data.v: अहं हि मतिसाचिव्यं करिष्यामि नरर्षभ । मित्रं चैवोपदेक्ष्यामि युवाभ्यां संस्कृतोऽग्निना ।।
data.es: O best among men I will help you with my wisdom and give you friendly advice when I am purified by you both through cremation on the funeral pyre.
data.anv: नरर्षभ O best of men, अहम् I, अग्निना by fire, संस्कृतः purified man, युवाभ्याम् by you both, मतिसाचिव्यम् help you with my wisdom, करिष्यामि I will do, मित्रं चैव as a friend also, उपदेक्ष्यामि I will advise you.
data.md: Being cremated by you, I shall counsel you best and tell you with whom you should contract friendship.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा दनुना तेन राघवः । इदं जगाद वचनं लक्ष्मणस्योपशृण्वतः ।।
data.es: Rigteous Rama spoke the following words in response to the story of Danu within Lakshmana's earshot:
data.anv: तेन by him, दनुना by Danu, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been told, धर्मात्मा righteous, राघवः Rama, लक्ष्मणस्य to Lakshmana, उपशृण्वतः listening, इदम् these, वचनम् words, जगाद spoke.
data.md: Being thus addressed by Danu, the virtuoussouled Rāghva spoke before listening Lakşmaņa.

data.v: रावणेन हृता सीता मम भार्या यशस्विनी । निष्क्रान्तस्य जनस्थानात्सह भ्रात्रा यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: My illlustrious wife Sita was carried away by Ravana comfortably when I was away from Janasthana along with my brother.
data.anv: जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, सह भ्रात्रा along with my brother, निष्क्रान्तस्य when I had gone out, मम my, भार्या wife, यशस्स्विनी famed lady, सीता Sita, रावणेन by Ravana, यथासुखम्  happily, हृता carried off.
data.md: My renowned spouse Sītā was easily ravished by Rāvaņa after I had gone out of Janasthana along with my brother. I know that Raksasa's name only—but do not know his whereabouts, his figure and his prowess.

data.v: नाममात्रं तु जानामि न रूपं तस्य रक्षसः । निवासं वा प्रभावं वा वयं तस्य न विद्महे ।।
data.es: I only know his name. We do not know how he looks, where he lives and what influence he has.
data.anv: तस्य his, नाममात्रम् only the name, जानामि I know, रूपम् form, न do not know, तस्य his, निवासं वा residence not known, प्रभावं वा or his power, वयम् we, न विद्महे we do not know.

data.v: शोकार्तानामनाथानामेवं विपरिधावताम् । कारुण्यं सदृशं कर्तुमुपकारे च वर्तताम् ।।
data.es: Creatures like you may help those who, like orphans, run here and there, stricken with sorrow.
data.anv: शोकार्तानाम् striken by sorrow, अनाथानाम् of orphans, एवम् that way, विपरिधावताम् of those running all over, उपकारे help, वर्ततां च do to others, कारुण्यम् kindness, कर्तुम् do show, सदृशम् worthy of your compasssion.
data.md: It behove you to show proper compassion for us, who have been stricken with grief, who are helpless, have been ranging this forest in this way and are, ever engaged in the well-being of others*. This sloka may be rendered in another way:Do you continue benefiting us by showing proper compassion for us, who are stricken with grief helpless and ranging the forest in this way. We have however adopted here the commentator Rāmāņaya's explanation.

data.v: काष्ठान्यानीय शुष्काणि काले भग्नानि कुञ्जरैः । भक्ष्यामस्त्वां वयं वीर श्वभ्रे महति कल्पिते ।।
data.es: O hero we will cremate you in a huge pit to be prepared for this occasion, collecting dry logs of wood broken by elephants.
data.anv: वीर hero, काले in the proper season, कुञ्जरैः by elephants, भग्नानि broken, शुष्काणि dried, काष्ठानि logs of wood, आदाय after getting, कल्पिते in a place set, महति in a large one, श्वभ्रे in a pit, त्वाम् you, धक्ष्यामः we will cremate you.
data.md: O, hero, we shall burn you after collecting all the branches that have been broken down by the elephants and dried up in time, and digging a big trench.

data.v: स त्वं सीतां समाचक्ष्व येन वा यत्र वा हृता । कुरु कल्याणमत्यर्थं यदि जानासि तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: If you really know where SIta has been kidnapped and by whom, tell me. You will be doing a great service.
data.anv: सः he, त्वम् you, तत्त्वतः truly, जानासि यदि if you know, सीताम् about Sita, येन वा by whom, यत्र वा of wherever, हृता carried, समाचक्ष्व tell me, अत्यर्थम् very much, कल्याणम् wellbeing, कुरु you may do.
data.md: Do you tell us who has carried away Sītā? And where? If do you know it truly do you perform us this good service.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण वाक्यं दनुरनुत्तमम् । प्रोवाच कुशलो वक्तुं वक्तारमपि राघवम् ।।
data.es: Danu who was proficient in speech spoke with chosen words to Rama who was a great speaker himself:
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः  having been asked, वक्तुम् telling, कुशलः one who can speak well, दनुः Danu, वक्तारम् addressing one who can speak, राघवम् to Rama, अनुत्तमम् best, वाक्यम् word, प्रोवाच spoke.
data.md: Thereat the Rākşasa, skilled in speech, spoke to Rāghava, addressing him thus.

data.v: दिव्यमस्ति न मे ज्ञानं नाभिजानामि मैथिलीम् । यस्तां ज्ञास्यति तं वक्ष्ये दग्धः स्वं रूपमास्थितः ।।
data.es: I do not have divine wisdom (now). Nor do I know Sita. When you cremate me, I shall assume my original form and will tell you the name of the person who knows it.
data.anv: मे to me, दिव्यम् divine, ज्ञानम् wisdom, नास्ति I do not have, मैथिलीम् Maithili, नाभिजानामि I do not know, दग्धः burnt one, स्वं रूम् my original form, आस्थितः getting, ताम् her, यः whoever, ज्ञास्यति know of her, तम् him, वक्ष्ये I will reveal.
data.md: I am not gifted with divine fore-sight and therefore do not know where Maithilī is. I shall let you know of him who shall be able to tell you all about her, after I resume my original shape, being burnt (by you). I shall furthermore tell you, O Rāma, who knows that Räksasa.

data.v: अदग्धस्य हि विज्ञातुं शक्तिरस्ति न मे प्रभो । राक्षसं तं महावीर्यं सीता येन हृता तव ।।
data.es: O lord before I am cremated, I do not have the ability to know about that powerful demon by whom Sita has been abducted.
data.anv: प्रभो O lord, येन by whom, तव your, सीता Sita, हृता is taken away, तम् him, महावीर्यम् very powerful, राक्षसम् rakshasa, विज्ञातुम् to know, अदग्धस्य without being burnt, मे to me, शक्तिः ability, नास्ति is not there.
data.md: Without being burnt I am incapable of being cognizant of that highly powerful Rākṣasa who has carried away your Sītā.

data.v: विज्ञानं हि महद्भ्रष्टं शापदोषेण राघव । स्वकृतेन मया प्राप्तं रूपं लोकविगर्हितम् ।।
data.es: O Rama due to the curse I have lost my wisdom. By my own deed, I have attained this form despicable to the world.
data.anv: राघव Rama, शापदोषेण due to the curse, मम my, विज्ञानम् wisdom, भ्रष्टं हि is indeed lost, मया by me, स्वकृतेन by my own deed, लोकविगर्हितम् a form despised by the world, रूपम् this form, प्राप्तम् is attained.
data.md: By the influence of curse, I have lost my foresight and by my own improper actions I have been transformed into this ugly figure.

data.v: किं तु यावन्न यात्यस्तं सविता श्रान्तवाहनः । तावन्मामवटे क्षिप्त्वा दह राम यथाविधि ।।
data.es: Before the Sun disappears with his tired horses drop me into a pit and cremate me in accordance with tradition, O Rama
data.anv: राम Rama, किं तु but, सविता Sun, श्रान्तवाहनः with his vehicle (horses) tired, अस्तम् (याति) setting, यावत् before, तावत् by then, माम् me, अवटे in a pit, क्षिप्त्वा dropping, यथाविधि in accordance with tradition, दह you may cremate.
data.md: Do you cremate me according to the prescribed rites after throwing me into the ditch before the sun, with his worn out carriers descends into the western horizon.

data.v: दग्धस्त्वयाहमवटे न्यायेन रघुनन्दन । वक्ष्यामि तमहं वीर यस्तं ज्ञास्यति राक्षसं ।।
data.es: O heroic Rama, delight of the Raghus, if you drop me in a pit and cremate me as per custom, I will tell you about him who knows the demon.
data.anv: वीर O hero, रघुनन्धन O delight of the Raghus, अहम् I, त्वया by you, न्यायेन as per custom, अवटे in a pit, दग्धः cremated, यः whoever, तं राक्षसम् to that demon, ज्ञास्यति knows, तम् about him, वक्ष्यामि I will let you know.
data.md: Being burnt by you in the ditch, with due ceremonials, O descendant of Raghu, I shall inention, to you, one who knows that Rāksasa.

data.v: तेन सख्यं च कर्तव्यं न्याय्यवृत्तेन राघव । कल्पयिष्यति ते प्रीतः साहाय्यं लघुविक्रमः ।।
data.es: O Rama you should establish friendship with him in a just manner. That hero of swift action will help you when he is pleased.
data.anv: राघव Rama, न्याय्यवृत्तेन rightfully conducting, तेन with him, सख्यं च friendship, कर्तव्यम् you should establish, लघुविक्रमः a warrior of swift action, प्रीतः a pleased one, ते to you, साहाय्यम् help, कल्पयिष्यति he will do.
data.md: O Raghava, O fleet-footed hero, do you contract friendship with him gifted with good qualities and he shall assist you.

data.v: न हि तस्यास्त्यविज्ञातं त्रिषु लोकेषु राघव । सर्वान्परिसृतो लोकान्पुरा वै कारणान्तरे ।।
data.es: O Rama, there is nothing that he does not know in the three worlds. In the past for a different reason he roamed all the (three) worlds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: राघव Rama, त्रिषु in the three, लोकेषु worlds, तस्य for him, अविज्ञातम् unknown to him, नास्ति is not there, हि do, असौ he, पुरा in the past, कारणान्तरे for a different cause, सर्वान् all, लोकान् worlds, परिसृतः has roamed about.
data.md: There is nothing unknown to him, O Rāghava is the three worlds. Formerly for some reasons he had travelled all over them.

data.v: एवमुक्तौ तु तौ वीरौ कबन्धेन नरेश्वरौ । गिरिप्रदरमासाद्य पावकं विससर्जतुः ।।
data.es: Thus said by Kabandha, the two lords of men, the heroes reached a cave in the mountain and lighted the fire.
data.anv: कबन्धेन by Kabandha, एवम् in that manner, उक्तौ having been advised, नरेश्वरौ two kings, तौ वीरौ the two heroes, गिरिप्रदरम्  mountain cave, आसाद्य reached, पावकम् fire, विससर्जतुः lighted.
data.md: After Kabandha had spoken thus, the two best of men, Rāma and Lakṣmaṇa took him to a mountain-cave and placed on fire.

data.v: लक्ष्मणस्तु महोल्काभिर्ज्वलिताभिः समन्ततः । चितामादीपयामास सा प्रजज्वाल सर्वतः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana lit the pyre with big meteorlike logs on all sides and it burned.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणस्तु Lakshmana himself, ज्वलिताभिः with burning, महोल्काभिः with big meteorlike logs, समन्ततः all round, चिताम् pyre, आदीपयामास set fire, सर्वतः on all sides, प्रजज्वाल lighted.
data.md: Laksmana kindled the funeral pile, which was ablaze on all sides. Thereupon the fire began to burn down slowly the huge and corpulent body of Kabandha like to a lump of clarified butter.

data.v: तच्छरीरं कबन्धस्य घृतपिण्डोपमं महत् । मेदसा पच्यमानस्य मन्दं दहति पावक ।।
data.es: As the flesh of Kabandha's body decomposed, if burnt slowly in the fire although it was like a huge mass of fat.
data.anv: मेदसा with flesh, पच्यमानस्य as the corpse was burning, कबन्धस्य Kabandha's, महत् great, घृतपिण्डोपमम् like a huge ball of ghee, तत् that, शरीरम्  body, पावकः the fire, मन्दम् slowly, दहति burnt.
data.md: Laksmana kindled the funeral pile, which was ablaze on all sides. Thereupon the fire began to burn down slowly the huge and corpulent body of Kabandha like to a lump of clarified butter.

data.v: स विधूय चितामाशु विधूमोऽग्निरिवोत्थितः । अरजे वाससी विभ्रन्मालां दिव्यां महाबलः ।।
data.es: Mighty Kabandha shook himself off the funeral pyre and rose like smokeless fire, wearing a pair of clean clothes and a divine garland.
data.anv: महाबलः very strong , सः he, अरजे clean, वाससी pair of clothes, दिव्याम् divine, मालाम् garland, बिभ्रत् wearing, चिताम् from the pyre, विधूय  shaking, आशु immediately, विधूमः smokeless, अग्निरिव like fire, उत्थितः he rose up.
data.md: Afterwards the highly powerful demon, shaking the funeral pile, rose up quickly like a smokeless flame of fire, wearing a clean cloth and a celestial garland.

data.v: ततश्चिताया वेगेन भास्वरो विरजाम्बरः । उत्पपाताशु संहृष्टः सर्वप्रत्यङ्गभूषणः ।।
data.es: Thereafter shining brightly in pure clothes and wearing ornaments all over the body, Kabandha hurtled out happily and instantaneously from the pyre.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, भास्वरः shining brightly, विमलाम्बरः wearing clean clothes, संहृष्टः happily, सर्वप्रत्यङ्गभूषणः limbs adorned with ornaments, आशु instantaneously, वेगेन speedily, चितायाः from the pyre, उत्पपात came out.

data.v: विमाने भास्वरे तिष्ठन्हंसयुक्ते यशस्करे । प्रभया च महातेजा दिशो दश विराजयन् ।।
data.es: The effulgent Kabandha rose into the sky on a famous aerial chariot harnessed to swans. Seated on it, he illuminated all ten directions and spoke from the sky,'O Raghava I will truly tell you how you will get Sita, listen to me'.
data.anv: सः कबन्धः he, Kabandha, अन्तरिक्षगतः reached the sky, हंसयुक्ते harnessed by swans, यशस्करे famous, भास्वरे shining, विमाने in an aerial chariot, तिष्ठन् seated, महातेजाः a brilliant one, प्रभया with glow, दश दिशः all the ten directions, विराजयन् illumining, रामम् Rama, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, राघव Raghava, सीताम् Sita, यथा as, अवाप्स्यसि you will be getting her, तत्त्वेन truly, शृणु listen.

data.v: सोऽन्तरिक्षगतो रामं कबन्धो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । शृणु राघव तत्त्वेन यथा सीमामवाप्स्यसि ।।
data.es: The effulgent Kabandha rose into the sky on a famous aerial chariot harnessed to swans. Seated on it, he illuminated all ten directions and spoke from the sky,'O Raghava I will truly tell you how you will get Sita, listen to me'.
data.anv: सः कबन्धः he, Kabandha, अन्तरिक्षगतः reached the sky, हंसयुक्ते harnessed by swans, यशस्करे famous, भास्वरे shining, विमाने in an aerial chariot, तिष्ठन् seated, महातेजाः a brilliant one, प्रभया with glow, दश दिशः all the ten directions, विराजयन् illumining, रामम् Rama, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, राघव Raghava, सीताम् Sita, यथा as, अवाप्स्यसि you will be getting her, तत्त्वेन truly, शृणु listen.

data.v: राम षड्युक्तयो लोके याभिः सर्वं विमृश्यते । परिमृष्टो दशान्तेन दशाभागेन सेव्यते ।।
data.es: O Rama there are six expedients (peace,war,marching,neutrality, alliance, making peace with one and waging war with another, for attaining your goal in the world. Only the unlucky can help the unfortunate.
data.anv: राम Rama, याभिः by those, सर्वम् all, विमृश्यते is tested, षट् युक्तयः six expedients, लोके in the world, दशान्तेन when one crosses that period, परिमृष्टः a man's test, दशाभागेन met with bad luck, सेव्यते he will be served.
data.md: Do you hear truly, O Rāghava, of the means by which you shall come by Sīta. There are six expedients. O Rāma, by virtue of which kings acquire all objects. He, in whom misfortune has culminated, should seek the company of one such+. The six expedients are as follow—(1) Sandhi, peace. (2) Vigraha war-fare. (3) Yāna, military expedition against an enemy. (4) Asana-halting. (5) Daidhibhava-sowing dissension. (6) Samaşraya seeking protection. This is a moral law referring to the sixth to or expedient, to be resorted by the kings-namely Samasrarya seeking protection.

data.v: दशाभागगतो हीनस्त्वं राम सहलक्ष्मणः । यत्कृते व्यसनं प्राप्तं त्वया दारप्रधर्षणम् ।।
data.es: Along with Lakshmna you are passing through a bad period on account of which your wife has been kidnapped and you, lying low, are experiencing great grief, O Rama
data.anv: राम Rama, सलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, त्वम् you, दशाभागगतः going through a part of such bad period, हीनः low ebb, यत्कृते by that , त्वया by you, दारप्रधर्षणम् abduction of wife, व्यसनम् sorrow, प्राप्तम् obtained.
data.md: You have, O Rāma along with Laksmana, met with the culmination of misfortune and for which you have been assailed with such a disaster as the ravishment of your spouse.

data.v: तदवश्यं त्वया कार्यः स सुहृत्सुहृदां वर । अकृत्वा न हि ते सिद्धिमहं पश्यामि चिन्तयन् ।।
data.es: O Rama, the best of friends you should certainly make friendship with him. As I think over the matter, I do not see any success if you do not adopt this method.
data.anv: सुहृदाम् of friends, वर best one, तत् so, सः that, त्वया by you, अवश्यम् certainly, सुहृत् friend, कार्यः should be done, अकृत्वा without doing so, ते to you, सिद्धिम् achievement, अहम् I, चिन्तयन् while I think over, न पश्यामि I do not see.
data.md: O you best of my friends, it behove you, therefore to make friends with such a person. Or else I do not find any means for your success.

data.v: श्रूयतां राम वक्ष्यामि सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः । भ्रात्रा निरस्तः क्रुद्धेन वालिना शक्रसूनुना ।।
data.es: O Rama, listen. I shall tell you. A monkey named Sugriva has been banished from the kingdom in a fit of anger by his brother Vali, the son of Indra.
data.anv: राम Rama, वक्ष्यामि l tell you, श्रूयताम् listen , शक्रसूनुना by Indra's son, भ्रात्रा by his brother, क्रुद्धेन in a fit of anger, वालिना by Vali, निरस्तः banished from the kingdom, सुग्रीवो नाम named Sugriva, वानरः monkey.
data.md: Do you hear, O Rāma, what I relate. There live with four monkeys a heroic, self-controlled monkey by name Sugrīva, on that best of mountains Rşyamūka, situated on the banks of the lake Pampā, being driven by his enraged brother Vāli, the son of Indra.

data.v: ऋष्यमूके गिरिवरे पम्पापर्यन्तशोभिते । निवसत्यात्मवान्वीरश्चतुर्भिः सह वानरैः ।।
data.es: A hero of great selfrespect, he lives with four monkeys on a beautiful mountain Rishyamuka extending up to lake Pampa.
data.anv: आत्मवान् he is a man of great selfrespect, वीरः a hero, पम्पापर्यन्तशोभिते extending up to lake Pampa, ऋश्यमूके on Rishyamuka, गिरिवरे the best of the mountain, चतुर्भिः with four, वानरैः सह along with monkeys, निवसति residing.
data.md: Do you hear, O Rāma, what I relate. There live with four monkeys a heroic, self-controlled monkey by name Sugrīva, on that best of mountains Rşyamūka, situated on the banks of the lake Pampā, being driven by his enraged brother Vāli, the son of Indra.

data.v: वयस्यं तं कुरु क्षिप्रमितो गत्वाद्य राघव । अद्रोहाय समागम्य दीप्यमाने विभावसौ ।।
data.es: O Rama, immediately proceed today from here to mighty Sugriva. Having reached him, make him your friend without malice in the presence of burning fire.
data.anv: राम Rama, इतः thus, श्रीघ्रम् swiftly, महाबलम् mighty, तं सुग्रीवम् to that Sugriva, गच्छ reach, राघव Rama, अद्य today, इतः from here, क्षिप्रम् quickly, गत्वा having gone, अद्रोहाय make alliance without any malice, विभावसौ  the fire, दीप्यमाने  is burning, तम् with him, वयस्यम् friend, कुरु you do.
data.md: Do you proceed soon, O hero, to Sugriva of mighty prowess, and repairing hence even to-day do you contract friendship with him, taking vow in the presence of flaming fire* that you shall not envy each other. This refers to the the oriental custom of performing every sacred rite in the presence of fire as witness. The Hindus regard the fire with sacred reverence and for this in all their social and religious ceremonials fire plays, a very prominent and sacred part.

data.v: न च ते सोऽवमन्तव्यः सुग्रीवो वानराधिपः । कृतज्ञः कामरूपी च सहायार्थी च वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Thinking that Sugriva is only a vanara king, he should not be disrespected. He has a sense of gratitude. He can take any form at will. He is in need of your help although he is very strong.
data.anv: वानराधिपः (अपि सन्) king of the monkeys, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, ते by you, नावमन्तव्यः not to be insulted, कृतज्ञः a grateful one, कामरूपी च he can take any form at will, सहायार्थी च he seeks your help, वीर्यवान् strong.

data.v: शक्तौ ह्यद्य युवां कर्तुं कार्यं तस्य चिकीर्षितम् । कृतार्थो वाकृतार्थो वा कृत्यं तव करिष्यति ।।
data.es: You are both young and able to do the work he wants. Whether his work is done or not, he will fulfil your task.
data.anv: युवाम् you both, अद्य now, तस्य his, चिकीर्षितम् desired, कार्यम् his work, कर्तुम् to do, शक्तौ हि you both have the ability, कृतार्थो वा whether his work is done, अकृतार्थो वा or not done, तव your, कृत्यम् work, करिष्यति he will do.

data.v: स ऋक्षरजसः पुत्रः पम्पामटति शङ्कितः । भास्करस्यौरसः पुत्रो वालिना कृतकिल्बिषः ।।
data.es: Born of Riksharaja, he is the offspring of the Sungod. He has developed enmity with Vali, and is roaming about the banks of Pampa, suspecting danger from Vali.
data.anv: ऋक्षरजसः Riksharaja's, पुत्रः son, भास्करस्य Sungod's, औरसःपुत्रः lawful son, सः he, वालिना Valin, कृतकिल्बिषः developing enmity, शङ्कितः apprehending danger, पम्पाम् on the banks of Pampa, अटति roaming.

data.v: संनिधायायुधं क्षिप्रमृष्यमूकालयं कपिम् । कुरु राघव सत्येन वयस्यं वनचारिणम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, with your weapons kept ready, go to Sugriva, king of the monkeys, a resident of Rishyamuka. He is wandering in the forest. Establish friendship with him.
data.anv: राघव Rama, आयुधम् weapon, सन्निधाय after keeping ready, वनचारिणम् a wanderer in the forest, ऋष्यमूकालयम् dwelling on Rishyamuka, कपिम् monkey, सत्येन truthfully, क्षिप्रम् at once, वयस्यम् friend, कुरु make.

data.v: स हि स्थानानि सर्वाणि कार्त्स्न्येन कपिकुञ्जरः । नरमांसाशिनां लोके नैपुण्यादधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: He is the foremost of the monkeys. He knows well by his wisdom all the dwellingplaces of the carnivorous demons in the world.
data.anv: कपिकुञ्जरः foremost of monkeys, सः he, लोके in the world, नरमांसाशिनाम् of cannibals, सर्वाणि all, स्थानानि dwellings, कार्त्स्न्येन entirely, नैपुण्यात् with tact, अधिगच्छति हि will find and reach.

data.v: न तस्याविदितं लोके किंचिदस्ति हि राघव । यावत्सूर्यः प्रतपति सहस्रांशुररिंदम ।।
data.es: There is nothing unknown to Sugriva in this world as far as the Sun shines, O subduer of enemies
data.anv: अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, राघव Rama, सहस्रांशुः the god of a thousand rays, सूर्यः Sun, यावत् so far, प्रतपति radiates, लोके in the world, तस्य his, अविदितम् unknown, किञ्चित् hardly anything, नास्ति हि is not.
data.md: There is no place under the sun of many rays, O Rāghava, O slayer of foes, unknown to him.

data.v: स नदीर्विपुलाञ्शैलान्गिरिदुर्गाणि कन्दरान् । अन्विष्य वानरैः सार्धं पत्नीं तेऽधिगमिष्यति ।।
data.es: Along with his monkeys, he will search all rivers, mountains and caves and will find out your consort.
data.anv: सः he, वानरैः सार्धम् along with monkeys, नदीः rivers, विपुलान् big, शैलान् mountains, गिरिदुर्गाणि mountain caves, कन्दरान् caverns, अन्वीक्ष्य searching, ते your, पत्नीम् consort, अधिगमिष्यति will find out.
data.md: Exploring, with all his monkeys, the rivers, huge mountains, strongholds and caves, he shall learn about your spouse.

data.v: वानरांश्च महाकायान्प्रेषयिष्यति राघव । दिशो विचेतुं तां सीतां त्वद्वियोगेन शोचतीम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva will find out the lady of purity and chastity brooding over you in separation in the abode of Ravana. He can send gigantic monkeys in different directions in order to search for her.
data.anv: राघव Rama, त्वद्वियोगेन by separation from you, शोचतीम् brooding, तां सीताम् that Sita, विचेतुम् to search, महाकायान् gigantic, वानरांश्च monkeys, दिशः in all directions, प्रेषयिष्यति he will send, सः he, रावणालये in Ravana's home, निर्मलाम् chaste, वरारोहाम् beautiful, ज्ञास्यति will find out.
data.md: He shall search that exquisitely fine damsel Maithili in Ravana's abode, bewailing on your separation, and to find her out he shall despatch, O Rāghava, many a monkey of huge proportions to various quarters.

data.v: स मेरुशृङ्गाग्रगतामनिन्दितां; प्रविश्य पातालतलेऽपि वाश्रिताम् । प्लवंगमानां प्रवरस्तव प्रियां; निहत्य रक्षांसि पुनः प्रदास्यति ।।
data.es: Sugriva, king of the monkeys, will reach the demons and restore you that blameless, beloved consort of yours, even if she is there on top of mount Meru or in the deep underworld. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्लवङ्गमानाम् of monkeys, प्रवरः the best one, सः he, अनिन्दिताम् a blameless, तव प्रियाम् your dear consort, मेरुशृङ्गाग्रगता even if on top of mount Meru, पातालतले or in the nether world, श्रितां वापि or gone there also, प्रविश्य after reaching, रक्षांसि demons, निहत्य  killing, पुनः again, प्रदास्यति he will restore to you.
data.md: Whether on the summit of the mount Meru or in the region under the earth, that lord of monkeys, shall give you back your blameless spouse, killing all the Raksasas.

data.v: निदर्शयित्वा रामाय सीतायाः प्रतिपादने । वाक्यमन्वर्थमर्थज्ञः कबन्धः पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having shown Rama the means to find Sita, Kabandha spoke again these significant words:
data.anv: अर्थज्ञः one who knows the meaning, कबन्धः Kabandha, सीतायाः Sita's, प्रतिपादने finding means to restore, (नि)दर्शयित्वा having shown, अन्वर्थम् meaningful, वाक्यम् words, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Having pointed out to Rāma the expedient for finding out Sītā the wise Kabandha began with the following significant words.

data.v: एष राम शिवः पन्था यत्रैते पुष्पिता द्रुमाः । प्रतीचीं दिशमाश्रित्य प्रकाशन्ते मनोरमाः ।।
जम्बूप्रियालपनसाः प्लक्षन्यग्रोधतिन्दुकाः । अश्वत्थाः कर्णिकाराश्च चूताश्चान्ये च पादपाः ।।
तानारुह्याथ वा भूमौ पातयित्वा च तान्बलात् । फलान्यमृतकल्पानि भक्षयन्तौ गमिष्यथः ।।
data.es: Climbing those trees or else pulling them down with your strength, both of you eat the nectarlike sweet fruits and proceed ahead.
data.anv: तान् those trees, आरुह्य climbing, अथवा or else, बलात् with your strength, तान् them, पातयित्वा pulling them down, अमृत कल्पानि nectarlike, फलानि fruits, भक्षयन्तौ while eating, गमिष्यथः go ahead.

data.v: चङ्क्रमन्तौ वरान्देशाञ्शैलाच्छैलं वनाद्वनम् । ततः पुष्करिणीं वीरौ पम्पां नाम गमिष्यथः ।।
data.es: O brave men, pass from hill to hill, forest to forest in great countries until you reach a lake named Pampa.
data.anv: वीरौ two brave men, वरान् great, देशान् places, शैलात् from one hill, शैलम् to another hill, वनात् from one forest, वनम् to another, चङ्क्रमन्तौ while going, ततः then, पम्पां नाम named Pampa, पुष्करिणीम् tank, गमिष्यथः you will both reach.
data.md: O heroes, ranging from forest to forest, from high mountains to hillocks, you shall get at the lake Pampā, void of gravels and acquatic plants and hence there is no danger of falling down to the people, having level watering-places, covered with sands and blooming with red and white lotuses.

data.v: अशर्करामविभ्रंशां समतीर्थमशैवलाम् । राम संजातवालूकां कमलोत्पलशोभिताम् ।।
data.es: The slopes of Pampa are without stones or pebbles, O Rama They are not slippery slopes. They are without moss. The water is neither deep nor shallow. It has smooth beds of sand on the banks and it is full of lotuses and lilies.
data.anv: राम Rama, अशर्कराम् without stones or pebbles, अविभ्रंशाम् or slipping, समतीर्थाम् level slopes, अशैवलाम् without moss, सञ्जातवालूकाम् smooth beds of sand on the banks, कमलोत्पलशालिनीम् full of lotuses lilies.

data.v: तत्र हंसाः प्लवाः क्रौञ्चाः कुरराश्चैव राघव । वल्गुस्वरा निकूजन्ति पम्पासलिलगोचराः ।।
data.es: Moving in the waters of Pampa you will see swans, ducks, krauncha birds and curlews cackling and cooing, O Son of the Raghus.
data.anv: राघव O son of the Raghus, तत्र there, पम्पासलिलगोचराः moving in the waters of Pampa, हंसाः swans, प्लवाः ducks, क्रौञ्चाः Krauncha birds, कुरराश्चैव and curlews, वल्गुस्वनाः cackling, विकूजन्ति cooing.
data.md: There emit forth musical notes, swans, frogs, cranes and ospreys sporting in the lake Pampā. They are not filled with terror in view of human beings, inexperienced as they are in the matter of destruction.

data.v: नोद्विजन्ते नरान्दृष्ट्वा वधस्याकोविदाः शुभाः । घृतपिण्डोपमान्स्थूलांस्तान्द्विजान्भक्षयिष्यथः ।।
data.es: Not knowing that they may be killed, the innocent creatures will not be scared of human beings. Both of you can kill and eat the fat birds comparable to balls of ghee.
data.anv: वधस्य to be killed, अकोविदाः not knowing, शुभाः auspicious, नरान् human beings, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, नोद्विजन्ते do not get scared, घृतपिण्डोपमान् like balls of ghee, स्थूलान् fat, तान् them, द्विजान् killing, भक्षयिष्यथः can eat.

data.v: रोहितान्वक्रतुण्डांश्च नलमीनांश्च राघव । पम्पायामिषुभिर्मत्स्यांस्तत्र राम वरान्हतान् ।।
data.es: O Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty there at Pampa, by shooting an arrow at the choicest fishes with a single bone, prawns and big fishes, crookedfaced fishes, fishes without scales and fins, baked on iron skewers and cooked will be offered to you by faithful Lakshmana.
data.anv: राघव scion of the Raghu dynasty, राम Rama, तत्र there, पम्पायाम् in Pampa, इषुभिः charging with arrows, हतान् killed, वरान् choicest, निस्त्वक्पक्षान् without scales and fins, अयस्तप्तान् baked on skewers made of iron, अकृशानेककण्टकान् fat ones with a single bone, मत्स्यान् fish, रोहितान् rohita fish, वक्रतुण्डांश्च crookedmouth fish, नडमीनांश्च huge fish, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, भक्त्या with devotion, समायुक्तः is endowed, तव you, सम्प्रदास्यति will be able to give.

data.v: निस्त्वक्पक्षानयस्तप्तानकृशानेककण्टकान् । तव भक्त्या समायुक्तो लक्ष्मणः संप्रदास्यति ।।
data.es: O Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty there at Pampa, by shooting an arrow at the choicest fishes with a single bone, prawns and big fishes, crookedfaced fishes, fishes without scales and fins, baked on iron skewers and cooked will be offered to you by faithful Lakshmana.
data.anv: राघव scion of the Raghu dynasty, राम Rama, तत्र there, पम्पायाम् in Pampa, इषुभिः charging with arrows, हतान् killed, वरान् choicest, निस्त्वक्पक्षान् without scales and fins, अयस्तप्तान् baked on skewers made of iron, अकृशानेककण्टकान् fat ones with a single bone, मत्स्यान् fish, रोहितान् rohita fish, वक्रतुण्डांश्च crookedmouth fish, नडमीनांश्च huge fish, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, भक्त्या with devotion, समायुक्तः is endowed, तव you, सम्प्रदास्यति will be able to give.

data.v: भृशं ते खादतो मत्स्यान्पम्पायाः पुष्पसंचये । पद्मगन्धि शिवं वारि सुखशीतमनामयम् ।।
data.es: While you delightedly eat the fishes, Lakshmana will fetch you water in a lotus leaf from the Pampa to drink. The waters of Pampa full of lotuses carry their scent, It is enjoyable, cool, healthy and clear, resembling silver and crystal.
data.anv: भृशम् very delightedly, मत्स्यान् fish, खादतः while eating, ते to you, पुष्पसञ्चये in a place full of flowers, पद्मगन्धि scent of lotuses, शिवम् beneficent, सुखशीतम् cool, अनामयम् healthy, सतताक्लिष्टम् always clear, रौप्यस्फाटिकसन्निभम् resembling silver and crystal, वारि water, असौ लक्ष्मणः this Lakshmana, पुष्करपर्णेन in lotus leaf, पाययिष्यति will offer you.

data.v: उद्धृत्य स तदाक्लिष्टं रूप्यस्फटिकसंनिभम् । अथ पुष्करपर्णेन लक्ष्मणः पाययिष्यति ।।
data.es: While you delightedly eat the fishes, Lakshmana will fetch you water in a lotus leaf from the Pampa to drink. The waters of Pampa full of lotuses carry their scent, It is enjoyable, cool, healthy and clear, resembling silver and crystal.
data.anv: भृशम् very delightedly, मत्स्यान् fish, खादतः while eating, ते to you, पुष्पसञ्चये in a place full of flowers, पद्मगन्धि scent of lotuses, शिवम् beneficent, सुखशीतम् cool, अनामयम् healthy, सतताक्लिष्टम् always clear, रौप्यस्फाटिकसन्निभम् resembling silver and crystal, वारि water, असौ लक्ष्मणः this Lakshmana, पुष्करपर्णेन in lotus leaf, पाययिष्यति will offer you.

data.v: स्थूलान्गिरिगुहाशय्यान्वराहान्वनचारिणः । अपां लोभादुपावृत्तान्वृषभानिव नर्दतः । रूपान्वितांश्च पम्पायां द्रक्ष्यसि त्वं नरोत्तम ।।
data.es: O best of men you will see huge boars of delightful appearance that roar like bulls resting in mountain caves, roaming in the forest and coming to Pampa for its water.
data.anv: नरोत्तम O best of men, स्थूलान् huge, गिरिगुहाशय्यान् resting in the mountain caves, वनचारिणः  forestrangers, अपाम् of waters, लोभात्  desire , उपावृत्तान् approaching, वृषभानिव like bulls, नर्दतः roaring, रूपावनितान् delightful appearance, वराहान् boars, पम्पायाम् at Pampa, त्वम् you, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
data.md: And you too, O best of men, shall behold those fat monkeys, who had drunk water, roaring like to oxen appearing on the banks of a river to drink water.

data.v: सायाह्ने विचरन्राम विटपी माल्यधारिणः । शीतोदकं च पम्पायां दृष्ट्वा शोकं विहास्यसि ।।
data.es: When you stroll in the evening, you will see the trees laden with blossoms and lake Pampa full of cool water. You will forget your grief.
data.anv: राम Rama, सायाह्ने in the evening, विचरन् while strolling, माल्यधारिणः laden with blossoms, विटपीन् trees, पम्पायाः at Pampa, शीतोदकं च cool waters also, दृष्ट्वा seeing, शोकम्  grief, विहास्यसि you will shake off.
data.md: And rambling in the evening, you shall assuage your grief beholding the pleasant water of Pampā and blossoming trees.

data.v: सुमनोभिश्चितांस्तत्र तिलकान्नक्तमालकान् । उत्पलानि च फुल्लानि पङ्कजानि च राघव ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghus there you will see tilaka trees, night jasmines full of flowers. You will also see blossoming water lilies and lotuses in Pampa.
data.anv: राघव Son of the Raghus, तत्र there, सुमनोभिः with flowers, चितान् full of, तिलकान् tilaka trees, नक्तमालकान् night jasmine, फुल्लानि blossoming, उत्पलानि च water lilies, पङ्कजानि च otuses.

data.v: न तानि कश्चिन्माल्यानि तत्रारोपयिता नरः । मतङ्गशिष्यास्तत्रासन्नृषयः सुसमाहितः ।।
data.es: There is no one to wear those flowers. Those garlands do not wilt or wither O Rama
data.anv: राघव Rama, तत्र there, तानि माल्यानि those garlands, आरोपयिता wearing, नरः man, कश्चित्  any one, न not, म्लानताम् whithering, न यान्ति not become, न च शीर्यन्ति they do not wilt,

data.v: तेषां भाराभितप्तानां वन्यमाहरतां गुरोः । ये प्रपेतुर्महीं तूर्णं शरीरात्स्वेदबिन्दवः ।।
data.es: While drops of sweat from the bodies of sage Matanga's disciples fell on earth under the heavy load of forest products they carried for their preceptor, they remained in a calm state. Those drops of sweat turned into flowers and those flowers do not wither due to the power of penance of the sages.
data.anv: तत्र there, सुसमाहिताः  in a calm state, मतङ्गशिष्याः seer Matanga's disciples, ऋषयः seers, आसन् they were, गुरोः of the preceptor, वन्यम् forest products, आहरताम् fetched, भाराभितप्तानाम् tired under the burden, तेषाम् from their, शरीरात् from the body, ये those, स्वेदबिन्दवः drops of sweat, तूर्णम् readily, महीम् on the earth, (प्र)पेतुः had fallen, तानि those, तदा then, मुनीनाम् of the sages, तपसा with penance, माल्यानि flowers, जातानि grown, राघव Rama, स्वेदबिन्दुसमुत्थानि sprung from the drops of sweat, न विनश्यन्ति not perish.

data.v: तानि माल्यानि जातानि मुनीनां तपसा तदा । स्वेदबिन्दुसमुत्थानि न विनश्यन्ति राघव ।।
data.es: There is no one to wear those flowers. Those garlands do not wilt or wither O Rama
data.anv: राघव Rama, तत्र there, तानि माल्यानि those garlands, आरोपयिता wearing, नरः man, कश्चित्  any one, न not, म्लानताम् whithering, न यान्ति not become, न च शीर्यन्ति they do not wilt,

data.v: तेषामद्यापि तत्रैव दृश्यते परिचारिणी । श्रमणी शबरी नाम काकुत्स्थ चिरजीविनी ।।
data.es: O Kakutstha even now their attendant, named Sabari, an old ascetic is there even though they have left long ago.
data.anv: काकुत्थ्स Kakutstha, तेषाम् for them, गतानाम् who had gone, परिचारिणी their attendant, चिरजीविनी living for long years, शबरीनाम named Sabari, श्रमणी ascetic, अद्यापि even now, दृश्यते is seen.

data.v: त्वां तु धर्मे स्थिता नित्यं सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् । दृष्ट्वा देवोपमं राम स्वर्गलोकं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: O Rama, she is established in righteousness, and you are godlike, and revered by all beings. When she sees you, she will attain heaven.
data.anv: राम Rama, नित्यम् always, धर्मे in rigteous ways, स्थिता remaining, सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् revered by all beings, देवोपमम् godlike, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा seeing, स्वर्गलोकम् heaven, गमिष्यति will go.
data.md: Even at the present day, O Kakutstha, there live an immortal mendicant woman, by name Savari, who had waited in attendance upon those departed ones. Beholding you, O Rāma, who are adored of all creatures like to the Deity Himself, that mendicant woman, ever engaged in pious observances, shall attain to the abode of celestials.

data.v: ततस्तद्राम पम्पायास्तीरमाश्रित्य पश्चिमम् । आश्रमस्थानमतुलं गुह्यं काकुत्स्थ पश्यसि ।।
data.es: O Rama of the Kakutstha family, you will see on reaching the western bank of Pampa an incomparable site of hermitage concealed in a remote place.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ Kakutstha, राम Rama, ततः thereafter, पम्पायाः Pampa's, तत् that, पश्चिमं तीरम् western bank, आसाद्य reaching, अतुलम् incomparable, गुह्यम् concealed, आश्रमस्थानम् site of hermitage, पश्यसि you will see.
data.md: O Rāma, turning to the western bank of Pampa, you shall, O Kakutstha, behold the incomparable and secret asylum of Matanga.

data.v: न तत्राक्रमितुं नागाः शक्नुवन्ति तमाश्रमम् । ऋषेस्तस्य मतङ्गस्य विधानात्तच्च काननम् ।।
data.es: The elephants of the forest and on the mountains do not attack the hermitage forbidden by sage Matanga.
data.anv: तत्र There, नागा: elephants, तम् that, आश्रमम् hermitage, आक्रमितुम् to attack, न शक्नुवन्ति not able, तस्मिन् in that, पर्वते in the mountain, वने forest, विविधाः many, नागाः elephants, तत् that, काननम् the forest, तस्य his, मतङ्गस्य ऋषेः seer Matanga's, विधानात् due to his command.
data.md: Fearing the divine authority of that great ascetic Matanga, the elephants, though there are many, dare not cross the threshold of his asylum.

data.v: तस्मिन्नन्दनसंकाशे देवारण्योपमे वने । नानाविहगसंकीर्णे रंस्यसे राम निर्वृतः ।।
data.es: O Rama, you will enjoy your stay in that forest which is like Nandana garden, the garden of the gods, full of various birds.
data.anv: राम Rama, नन्दनसङ्काशे like Nandana gardens, देवारण्योपमे comparable to the garden of the gods, नानाविहगसङ्कीर्णे full of several kinds of birds, तस्मिन् वने in that forest, निवृतः giving up your grief, रंस्यसे you will enjoy.
data.md: O Rāghava, this forest is widely known as Matanga wood. You shall sport, O Rāma, with a delighted heart in that forest resembling the celestial garden-Nandana and filled with various birds.

data.v: ऋष्यमूकस्तु पम्पायाः पुरस्तात्पुष्पितद्रुमः । सुदुःखारोहणो नाम शिशुनागाभिरक्षितः । उदारो ब्रह्मणा चैव पूर्वकाले विनिर्मितः ।।
data.es: Mount Rishyamuka situated on the bank of Pampa has trees filled with blossoms. It is difficult to climb and is protected by young elephants.This lofty mountain was created by Brahma in olden days.
data.anv: पम्पायाः Pampa's, पुरस्तात् before, पुष्पितद्रुमः trees with flowers in bloom, सुदुःखारोहणः quite difficult to climb, शिशुनागाभिरक्षितः protected by young elephants, उदारः exalted, ब्रह्मणा by Brahma, ऋष्यमूकश्च Rishyamuka, पूर्वकाले in the past, विनिर्मितः is created.
data.md: There stands in front of Pampă the highly inaccessible mount Rşyamūka, ornamented with many a blossoming tree and guarded on all sides by little serpents. That mount is highly munificent. It was created by Brahmā in the days of yore.

data.v: शयानः पुरुषो राम तस्य शैलस्य मूर्धनि । यत्स्वप्ने लभते वित्तं तत्प्रबुद्धोऽधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: Whatever wealth one dreams of in sleep on top of that mountain he will get on waking up, O Rama
data.anv: राम Rama, तस्य of that, शैलस्य mountain's, मूर्धनि on top, शयानः while sleeping there, पुरुषः any man, स्वप्ने in a dream, यत् whatever, वित्तम् wealth, लभते obtains, तत् that, प्रबुद्धः on waking up, अधिगच्छति will get.
data.md: A person, sleeping on the summit of that hill and dreaming of an accession of wealth, really gets at it after the dream is over. A perpetrator of iniquitous deeds and engaged in impious observances ascending that hill, the Rākṣasas seize upon him, asleep, and bruise him.

data.v: न त्वेनं विषमाचारः पापकर्माधिरोहति । तत्रैव प्रहरन्त्येनं सुप्तमादाय राक्षसाः ।।
data.es: If an evildoer or a sinner ascends the (Rishyamuka) mountain, he, in his sleep, will be thrown down with asleep by the demons from there itself. A sinner does not climb this mountain of uneven terrain.
data.anv: विषमाचारः a place of uneven terrain for movement, पापकर्मा sinner, एवम् so also, न अधिरोहति cannot ascend, विषमाचारः evil doer, पापकर्मा sinner, यः whoever, तम् him, अधिरोहति ascends, सुप्तम् when asleep, तम् him, आदाय taking, राक्षसाः demons, तत्रैव there itself, प्रहरन्ति strike at him.
data.md: A person, sleeping on the summit of that hill and dreaming of an accession of wealth, really gets at it after the dream is over. A perpetrator of iniquitous deeds and engaged in impious observances ascending that hill, the Rākṣasas seize upon him, asleep, and bruise him.

data.v: ततोऽपि शिशुनागानामाक्रन्दः श्रूयते महान् । क्रीडतां राम पम्पायां मतङ्गारण्यवासिनाम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, the trumpeting of the young playful elephants inhabiting sage Matanga's forest can be heard at Pampa.
data.anv: राम Rama, तत्रापि there also, पम्पायाम् at Pampa, क्रीडताम् sporting, मतङ्गारण्यवासिनाम् for those inhabiting sage Matanga's forest, शिशुनागानाम् for baby elphants, महान् great, आक्रन्द: roaring sound, श्रूयते will be heard.
data.md: You shall hear the terrible roar of the young elephants ranging in the asylum of Matanga, situated on the banks of Pampā.

data.v: सिक्ता रुधिरधाराभिः संहत्य परमद्विपाः । प्रचरन्ति पृथक्कीर्णा मेघवर्णास्तरस्विनः ।।
data.es: The great, nimble elphants, dark like clouds, drenched with the flow of ichor come together and then separate and scatter.
data.anv: मेघवर्णाः like dark rainclouds, तरस्विनः swift, परमद्विपाः great elephants, संहृत्य drawn together, रुधिरधाराभिः streams of ichor(red in colour) flowing from their body, सिक्ताः are drenched, पृथक् separated, कीर्णाः scattered, प्रचरन्ति they wander.

data.v: ते तत्र पीत्वा पानीयं विमलं शीतमव्ययम् । निवृत्ताः संविगाहन्ते वनानि वनगोचराः ।।
data.es: The wandering elephants of the forest drink plentiful water, pure and cool, from Pampa and contented, plunge into the forest.
data.anv: वनगोचराः wandering in the forest, ते they, विमलम् pure, शीतम् cool, अव्ययम् plenty, पानीयम् water, पीत्वा drinking, निर्वृताः contented, वनानि in the forest, (सं)विगाहन्ते plunge into.

data.v: राम तस्य तु शैलस्य महती शोभते गुहा । शिलापिधाना काकुत्स्थ दुःखं चास्याः प्रवेशनम् ।।
data.es: O son of the Kakutstha family, there is a beautiful cave in that mountain covered with a slab of stone. It is difficult to enter.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ राम Rama of the Kakutstha family, तस्य शैलस्य of that mountain, शिलापिधाना covered with a slab, महती huge, गुहा cave, शोभते looks beautiful, अस्याः that cave's, प्रवेशनम्  entry, दुःखम् difficult.
data.md: There is a huge cave, O Rāma, in that mountain, covered on all sides with rocks and where it is very hard to enter.

data.v: तस्या गुहायाः प्राग्द्वारे महाञ्शीतोदको ह्रदः । बहुमूलफलो रम्यो नानानगसमावृतः ।।
data.es: At the eastern entrance of the cave there is a cool watertank. On its bank teeming with various animals are delightful fruits and roots.
data.anv: तस्याः of that, गुहायाः cave's, प्राग्द्वारे at the eastern entrance, शीतोदकः one with cool water, फलमूलान्वीतः filled with fruits and roots, रम्यः delightful, नानामृगसमावृतः surrounded by different kinds of animals, महान् great, ह्रदः lake.
data.md: At the entrance of that cave lies a beautiful, wide lake of cool water, hedged on all sides with trees abounding in fruits.

data.v: तस्यां वसति सुग्रीवश्चतुर्भिः सह वानरैः । कदाचिच्छिखरे तस्य पर्वतस्यावतिष्ठते ।।
data.es: Sugriva dwells in that cave with four other monkeys. At times he sits on the top of the mountain.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, चतुर्भिः with four, वानरैः सह along with monkeys, तस्याम् in that cave, वसति  dwells, कदाचित् at times, तस्य पर्वतस्य the mountain's, शिखरे top, अवतिष्ठते stays.
data.md: There live with other monkeys the virtuoussouled Sugrīva, who sometimes reside on the summit of the hill.

data.v: कबन्धस्त्वनुशास्यैवं तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । स्रग्वी भास्करवर्णाभः खे व्यरोचत वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Having instructed both Rama and Lakshmana, courageous Kabandha, wearing a flowergarland, shone brightly like the Sun in the sky.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् courageous, स्रग्वी wearing a flower garland, कबन्धस्तु Kabandha, तौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, एवम् in that way, अनुशास्य telling them, खे भास्करवर्णाभः like the colour of the Sun, व्यरोचत shone brightly.
data.md: Having thus addressed Rāma and Lakşmaņa, Kabandha, highly powerful resembling the sun in effulgence and wearing garlands appeared beautiful on the sky.

data.v: तं तु खस्थं महाभागं कबन्धं रामलक्ष्मणौ । प्रस्थितौ त्वं व्रजस्वेति वाक्यमूचतुरन्तिकात् ।।
data.es: Both Rama and Lakshmana, ready to depart, went near the glorious Kabandha waiting in the sky and said, You may go now.
data.anv: प्रस्थितौ both set forth, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, अन्तिके gone near, खस्थम् he who stood in the sky, महाभागम् glorious, तं कबन्धम् that Kabandha, त्वम् you, व्रजस्व can go, इति thus, वाक्यम् words said, ऊचतुः both spoke.
data.md: Thereupon Rāma and Lakṣmaṇa, preparing to proceed spoke to that great one stationed in the sky, saying, Do you go'

data.v: गम्यतां कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थमिति तावब्रवीच्च सः । सुप्रीतौ तावनुज्ञाप्य कबन्धः प्रस्थितस्तदा ।।
data.es: Then Kabandha said to the brothers satisfied, You may go now to accomplish your task. Then he took leave.
data.anv: तदा then, प्रस्थितः set to go, सः कबन्धश्च that Kabandha, सुप्रीतौ both of them very pleased, तौ both, अनुज्ञाप्य took leave, कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थम् to accomplish the task, गम्यताम् you may depart, तौ both, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Whereto Kabandha replied, saying Do you proceed to make good your end and bidding them adieu, who were well pleased, departed.

data.v: स तत्कबन्धः प्रतिपद्य रूपं; वृतः श्रिया भास्करतुल्यदेहः । निदर्शयन्राममवेक्ष्य खस्थः; सख्यं कुरुष्वेति तदाभ्युवाच ।।
data.es: Kabandha assumed his true form, his body shining like the radiance of the Sun. He stood in the sky showing his form and looking at Rama, said, Make friendship with Sugriva.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सः कबन्धः that Kabandha, तत् then, रूपम् his true form, प्रतिपद्य after attaining, श्रिया with radiance, वृतः surrounded, भास्करतुल्य देहः his body shining like the Sun, खस्थः from the sky, रामम् Rama, अवेक्ष्य seeing, निदर्शयन् while showing at, सख्यम् friendship, कुरुष्व  make, इति this, तदा then, उवाच said.
data.md: Regaining his pristine beauty and shining in grace and effulgence that Kabandha, who was on the sky, fixing his looks upon Rāma, and pointing out to him his way, said Do you make friends with (Sugrīva).

data.v: तौ कबन्धेन तं मार्गं पम्पाया दर्शितं वने । आतस्थतुर्दिशं गृह्य प्रतीचीं नृवरात्मजौ ।।
data.es: The two princes set forth in the western direction towards Pampa shown by Kabandha.
data.anv: तौ both, नृवरात्मजौ the two princes, वने in the forest, प्रतीचीं दिशम् western direction showed by, गृह्य took, कबन्धेन by Kabandha, दर्शितं shown by, तम् him, पम्पायाः Pampa's, मार्गम् way, प्रतस्थतुः both set out.
data.md: Thereupon Rāma and Lakṣmaṇa, sons of a kingly father, passing along the way, pointed out by Kabandha, leading to the lake Pampā, proceeded towards the West.

data.v: तौ शैलेष्वाचितानेकान्क्षौद्रकल्पफलद्रुमान् । वीक्षन्तौ जग्मतुर्द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Observing the trees loaded with honeysweet fruits on the mountain, Rama and Lakshmana went to see Sugriva.
data.anv: तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, शैलेषु in the mountain, आचितान् loaded with, क्षौद्रकल्पफलान् honey like fruits, द्रुमान् trees, वीक्षन्तौ seeing, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, द्रष्टुम् to see, जग्मतुः both went.
data.md: They wending their way desirous of seeing Sugrīva, there came within the compass of their vision many trees, grown on the summits of the mountains, blossoming with flowers and abounding in fruits tasting sweet like to honey.

data.v: कृत्वा च शैलपृष्ठे तु तौ वासं रघुनन्दनौ । पम्पायाः पश्चिमं तीरं राघवावुपतस्थतुः ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana halted on the slope of the mountain and then departed for the western bank of Pampa.
data.anv: राघवौ Rama, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, शैलपृष्ठे on the slope of the mountain, वासम् stay, कृत्वा made, पम्पायाः Pampa's, पश्चिमं तीरम् western bank, उपतस्थतुः started on that path.
data.md: Passing the night on the summit of a hill those two descendants of Raghu arrived at the western bank of Pampā and espied the pleasant asylum of Savari.

data.v: तौ पुष्करिण्याः पम्पायास्तीरमासाद्य पश्चिमम् । अपश्यतां ततस्तत्र शबर्या रम्यमाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: Both reached the west bank of lake Pampa and saw the delightful hermitage of Sabari.
data.anv: ततः then, तौ both, पम्पायाः Pampa, पुष्करिण्याः of the tank, पश्चिमम् western, तीरम्  bank, आसाद्य reached, तत्र there, शबर्याः of Sabari, रम्यम् delightful, आश्रमम् hermitage, अपश्यताम् observed.
data.md: Passing the night on the summit of a hill those two descendants of Raghu arrived at the western bank of Pampā and espied the pleasant asylum of Savari.

data.v: तौ तमाश्रममासाद्य द्रुमैर्बहुभिरावृतम् । सुरम्यमभिवीक्षन्तौ शबरीमभ्युपेयतुः ।।
data.es: Both reached the beautiful hermitage full of many kinds of trees. There they saw Sabari, and went towards her.
data.anv: तौ they both, तम् that, आश्रमम् hermitge, आसाद्य after reaching, बहुभिः with many, द्रुमैः with many trees, आवृतम् surrounded, सुरम्यम् very beautiful, अभिवीक्षन्तौ both looking at, शबरीम् Sabari's, अभ्युपेयतुः went towards.
data.md: Getting at that charming hermitage covered on all sides with trees and casting their looks around they beheld that female mendicant-Savari.

data.v: तौ तु दृष्ट्वा तदा सिद्धा समुत्थाय कृताञ्जलिः । पादौ जग्राह रामस्य लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः ।।
data.es: On seeing them both, Sabari, an accomplished ascetic, got up with folded hands and touched the feet of the sagacious Rama and Lakshmana.
data.anv: तदा then, सिद्धा an accomplished ascetic, तौ both, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कृताञ्जलिः joined palms and offered obeisance, समुत्थाय having got up, रामस्य Rama's, धीमतः sagacious, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, पादौ feet, जग्राह held.
data.md: No sooner had that one of perfect asceticism beheld those highly intelligent Rāma and Laks maņa than she rose up with folded hands and touching their feet offered them duly water for washing their feet and mouth. Thereupon Rāma spoke to that female ascetic, engaged in religious services.

data.v: तामुवाच ततो रामः श्रमणीं संशितव्रताम् । कच्चित्ते निर्जिता विघ्नाः कच्चित्ते वर्धते तपः ।।
data.es: O ascetic hope you have overcome your obstacles to penance, you have controlled your anger and your desire for food. Is your austerity in progress.
data.anv: तपोधने  endowed with the wealth of penance(the ascetic), ते your, विघ्नाः obstacles, निर्जिताः कच्चित् hope you have overcome, ते your, तपः penance, वर्धते कच्चित्  progressing indeed, ते your, क्रोधः anger, आहारश्च desire for food, नियतः कच्चित् is controlled indeed?

data.v: कच्चित्ते नियतः कोप आहारश्च तपोधने । कच्चित्ते नियमाः प्राप्ताः कच्चित्ते मनसः सुखम् । कच्चित्ते गुरुशुश्रूषा सफला चारुभाषिणि ।।
data.es: O Sweettongued Sabari, have you achieved selfcontrol? Has your mind attained peace ? Have your services to the preceptor yielded results?
data.anv: चारुभाषिणि sweettongued, ते you, नियमाः selfcontrol, प्राप्ताः कच्चित् have you attained , ते your, मनसः mind, सुखं कच्चित् attained peace, ते your, गुरुशुश्रूषा serving the preceptor, सफला कच्चित् has yielded results?
data.md: O you of sweet accents, have you got all hindrances to asceticism removed? Is your asceticism growing stronger every day? O you having asceticism for your wealth, have you restricted your anger and fare? Have you observed the commandments and attained to mental felicity? Have your attendance upon your spiritual guide born fruits?

data.v: रामेण तापसी पृष्ठा सा सिद्धा सिद्धसंमता । शशंस शबरी वृद्धा रामाय प्रत्युपस्थिता ।।
data.es: When Rama asked Sabari who was an old, accomplished ascetic adored by siddhas, she stood in front and replied :
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, पृष्टा enquired, सिद्धा an accomplished ascetic, सिद्धसम्मता a lady adored and accepted by siddhas, तापसी ascetic, वृद्धा old woman, सा शबरी that Sabari, प्रत्युपस्थिता standing in front, रामाय to Rama, शशंस she spoke.
data.md: Being thus accosted by Rāma that old Savarī, of accomplished asceticism and recognised by the Siddhas, approaching Rāma spoke.

data.v: चित्रकूटं त्वयि प्राप्ते विमानैरतुलप्रभैः । इतस्ते दिवमारूढा यानहं पर्यचारिषम् ।।
data.es: The men I served have ascended heaven on aerial chariots of incomparable radiance the moment you touched Chitrakuta.
data.anv: अहम् I, यान् those men, पर्यचारिषम् I have served, ते they, त्वयि when you, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakutam, प्राप्ते arrived, अतुलप्रभैः with incomparable radiance, विमानैः with aerial chariots, इतः from here, दिवम् to heaven, आरूढाः I will reach.
data.md: On your setting foot on the mount Citrakūta, the ascetics whom I served, ascending celestial cars of incomparable lustre, departed to heaven.

data.v: तैश्चाहमुक्ता धर्मज्ञैर्महाभागैर्महर्षिभिः । आगमिष्यति ते रामः सुपुण्यमिममाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: Those great honourable sages who knew the ways of dharma said: 'Rama would visit this sacred hermitage along with Lakshmana. He would be your guest. Receive him with due honour. And you would attain the great, inexhaustible worlds when you see him.'
data.anv: धर्मज्ञैः by knowers of rigteousness, महाभागैः by the honourable, तैः महर्षिभिः by those great seers, अहम् I, उक्ता have been told, रामः Rama, ते your, सुपुण्यम् very sacred, इमम् आश्रमम् this hermitage, अगमिष्यति will come, सौमित्रिसहितः along with Saumitri, सः he, ते for you, अतिथिः guest, प्रतिग्रहीतव्यः receive with due reverence, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, त्वम् you, वरान् great, अक्षयान् inexhaustible, लोकान् worlds, गमिष्यसि you will go,
data.md: Those great ascetics, cognizant of virtue, said to me, Rāma shall come to your holy asylum. Do you receive with great reverence that guest together with Laksmana. On beholding him, you shall attain to that best land of the celestials whence none return.

data.v: स ते प्रतिग्रहीतव्यः सौमित्रिसहितोऽतिथिः । तं च दृष्ट्वा वराँल्लोकानक्षयांस्त्वं गमिष्यसि ।।
data.es: Those great honourable sages who knew the ways of dharma said: 'Rama would visit this sacred hermitage along with Lakshmana. He would be your guest. Receive him with due honour. And you would attain the great, inexhaustible worlds when you see him.'
data.anv: धर्मज्ञैः by knowers of rigteousness, महाभागैः by the honourable, तैः महर्षिभिः by those great seers, अहम् I, उक्ता have been told, रामः Rama, ते your, सुपुण्यम् very sacred, इमम् आश्रमम् this hermitage, अगमिष्यति will come, सौमित्रिसहितः along with Saumitri, सः he, ते for you, अतिथिः guest, प्रतिग्रहीतव्यः receive with due reverence, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, त्वम् you, वरान् great, अक्षयान् inexhaustible, लोकान् worlds, गमिष्यसि you will go,
data.md: Those great ascetics, cognizant of virtue, said to me, Rāma shall come to your holy asylum. Do you receive with great reverence that guest together with Laksmana. On beholding him, you shall attain to that best land of the celestials whence none return.

data.v: मया तु विविधं वन्यं संचितं पुरुषर्षभ । तवार्थे पुरुषव्याघ्र पम्पायास्तीरसंभवम् ।।
data.es: O best among men I have collected and kept for your sake different kinds of forestfood grown on the bank of Pampa.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्र O best among men, (रघुनन्दन delight of the Raghus), मया by me, तव अर्थे for your sake, पम्पायाः Pampa's, तीरसम्भवम् grown on the bank, विविधम् many kinds, वन्यम्   forestfood, सञ्चितम् collected.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स धर्मात्मा शबर्या शबरीमिदम् । राघवः प्राह विज्ञाने तां नित्यमबहिष्कृताम् ।।
data.es: Entreated by her in that manner, the righteous Rama spoke to Sabari who was established in true knowledge:
data.anv: शबर्या by Sabari, एवम् in that way, उक्तः addressed, धर्मात्मा righteous, सः राघवः that Rama, नित्यम् always, विज्ञाने in knowledge, अबहिष्क्रताम् not kept away, तां शबरीम् that Sabari, प्राह he said.
data.md: Being thus addressed by Savarī, the virtuoussouled Raghava spoke to her conversant with the knowledge of past and future.

data.v: दनोः सकाशात्तत्त्वेन प्रभावं ते महात्मनः । श्रुतं प्रत्यक्षमिच्छामि संद्रष्टुं यदि मन्यसे ।।
data.es: I have heard from great Danu about your power. If you agree, I would like to see this power in person.
data.anv: महात्मनः by the great self, दनोः सकाशात् from Danu, श्रुतम् heard, ते your, प्रभावम् power, मन्यसे यदि if you think so, प्रत्यक्षम् directly, (सं)द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि I desire.
data.md: I have heard from Danu, in truth, about your divine authority as well as that of your spiritual guides. If you purpose so I wish to witness it with my own eyes.

data.v: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा रामवक्त्राद्विनिःसृतम् । शबरी दर्शयामास तावुभौ तद्वनं महत् ।।
data.es: At these words from the mouth of Rama, Sabari took them both round the great garden.
data.anv: शबरी Sabari, रामवक्त्रात् from Rama's mouth, विनिस्सृतम् released, एतत् this, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, तौ उभौ both of them, महत् great, तत् that, वनम् garden, दर्शयामास started showing.
data.md: Hearing those accents dropping from Rāma's lips, Sabarī showing to them the vast forest said.

data.v: पश्य मेघघनप्रख्यं मृगपक्षिसमाकुलम् । मतङ्गवनमित्येव विश्रुतं रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O delight of the Raghus see this garden looking like the dense cloud. Full of animals and birds, it is popularly known as Matanga garden.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghus, मेघघनप्रख्यम् looking like the dense cloud, मृगपक्षिसमाकुलम् filled with animals and birds, मतङ्गवनमित्येव known as Matanga garden, विश्रुतम् popular, पश्य see.
data.md: Do you behold, O Rāghava, this forest, crowded with deer and birds resembling a dense cloud. This forest is known as Matanga's wood.

data.v: इह ते भावितात्मानो गुरवो मे महाद्युते । जुहवांश्चक्रिरे तीर्थं मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रपूजितम् ।।
data.es: My precepters, who had perceived the Supreme Spirit made sacrificial offerings in this great garden, invoked gods through the power of mantras. They brought water and offered oblations to the sacrificial fire.
data.anv: महावने in this great garden, भावितात्मानः who perceived the supreme spirit, ते they, मे गुरुवः my preceptors, इह here, मन्त्रवत् by the power of mantras, मन्त्रपूजितम् invoked by mantras, तीर्थम् waters, जुहवाञ्चक्रिरे  performed  sacrifice.
data.md: Here in this forest the pure-souled preceptors sacrificed to fire their persons consecrated by the Mantras as Mantra itself.

data.v: इयं प्रत्यक्स्थली वेदी यत्र ते मे सुसत्कृताः । पुष्पोपहारं कुर्वन्ति श्रमादुद्वेपिभिः करैः ।।
data.es: This is the altar named Pratyaksthali where the saints aged and exhausted( by performing chandrayana) whom I worshipped made offerings of flowers with trembling hands.
data.anv: मे my, सुसत्कृताः revered ones, ते they, यत्र where, श्रमात्  exhausted, उद्वेपिभिः करैः did with trembling hands, पुष्पोवहारम् offering flowers for worship, कुर्वन्ति make, प्रत्यक्थ्सली वेदिः altar knows as Pratyaksthali, इयम् this is.
data.md: This is that alter Pratyaksthalī, ascending which my worshipful preceptors used to offer flowers to the deities with hands trembling with toil,

data.v: तेषां तपः प्रभावेन पश्याद्यापि रघूत्तम । द्योतयन्ति दिशः सर्वाः श्रिया वेद्योऽतुलप्रभाः ।।
data.es: O Rama see, even now they illuminate the sacrificial altars with the power of their penance. They shed light in all directions with a matchless brilliance.
data.anv: रघूद्वह O Rama, तेषाम् their, तपःप्रभावेण by the power of their penance, अतुलप्रभाः matchless brilliance, वेद्यः altars, श्रिया with glow, अद्यापि even today, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, द्योतयन्ति filling with light, पश्य see.
data.md: Behold, O best of Raghus, this alter of incomparable beauty, by virtue of their asceticism, has been still shedding its lustre on all the sides.

data.v: अशक्नुवद्भिस्तैर्गन्तुमुपवासश्रमालसैः । चिन्तितेऽभ्यागतान्पश्य समेतान्सप्त सागरान् ।।
data.es: Look at the seven seas, which have reached here at their mere thought as they could not reach them due to fatigue from fasting.
data.anv: उपवासश्रमालसैः weariness due to fasting, गन्तुम् to move about, अशक्नुवद्भिः having no energy, तैः by them, चिन्तिते by mere thought, अभ्यागतान् came towards, सहितान् all together, सप्तसागरान् all the seven seas, पश्य see.
data.md: Behold, again, the seven seas have appeared here in conjunction, at their very thought, worn out with fast and therefore incapable of moving on.

data.v: कृताभिषेकैस्तैर्न्यस्ता वल्कलाः पादपेष्विह । अद्यापि न विशुष्यन्ति प्रदेशे रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O delight of the Raghus look at the bark robes spread on the trees to dry after their bathing which are still wet.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन delight of the Raghus, इह here, कृताभिषेकैः  after bathing, तै: by them, प्रदेशे place, पादपेषु on the trees, न्यस्ताः laid to dry, वल्कलाः bark clothes, अद्यापि even now, न अवशुष्यन्ति do not get dry still.
data.md: Even those barks, which they used to place on these trees after ablution have not yet been dried up.

data.v: कृत्स्नं वनमिदं दृष्टं श्रोतव्यं च श्रुतं त्वया । तदिच्छाम्यभ्यनुज्ञाता त्यक्तुमेतत्कलेवरम् ।।
data.es: You have seen the entire garden and have listened what is to be heard. With your permission I would like to give up this body.
data.anv: त्वया by you, कृत्स्नम् entirely, इदं वनम् this garden, दृष्टम् is seen, श्रोतव्यम् to be heard, श्रुतं च it is heard, तत् that, अभ्यनुज्ञाता with your permission, एतत् this, कलेबरम् body, त्यक्तुम् to give up, इच्छामि I desire to.
data.md: You have observed this entire forest and heard every thing worth hearing. I purpose now to renounce my body being commanded by you.

data.v: तेषामिच्छाम्यहं गन्तुं समीपं भावितात्मनाम् । मुनीनामाश्रंमो येषामहं च परिचारिणी ।।
data.es: I wish to reach those realisers of the Supreme Spirit whom I served and to whom this hermitage belonged.
data.anv: आश्रमः hermitage, येषां मुनीनाम् of  those seers (to whom this hermitage belongs), अहं च I, परिचारिणी I am a servant, भावितात्मनाम् realisers of supreme spirit, तेषाम् their, समीपम् near, गन्तुम् to go, इच्छामि I desire.
data.md: I wish to approach those pure-souled ascetics, whom I used to wait upon, and whom these asylums belong to.

data.v: धर्मिष्ठं तु वचः श्रुत्वा राघवः सहलक्ष्मणः । अनुजानामि गच्छेति प्रहृष्टवदनोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana on hearing the pious words of Savari joyfully exclaimed, This is really wonderful.
data.anv: सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, राघवः Rama, धर्मिष्ठम् dedicated to dharma, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, तत्त्वतः truly, आश्चर्यम् wonderful, इति thus, अतुलम् incomparable, प्रहर्षम् happiness, लेभे attained.
data.md: Hearing with Lakşmaņa the speech of the pious one, Rāma gained an excess of joy and exclaiming, Wonderful it is!

data.v: अनुज्ञाता तु रामेण हुत्वात्मानं हुताशने । ज्वलत्पावकसंकाशा स्वर्गमेव जगाम सा ।।
data.es: With matted locks, tattered bark clothes and deer skin, Sabari consigned her old and emaciated body to the fire at that moment, with the permission of Rama and ascended to heaven, her body glowing like fire.
data.anv: इति this, उक्ता was said, जटिला a woman of matted locks, वृद्धा old, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरा woman wearing tattered bark clothes and deer skin, शबरी Sabari, जीर्णम् emaciated, देहम् body, तस्मिन् मूहूर्ते at that moment, जिहासती desiring to give up, रामेण by Rama, अनुज्ञाता permitted, आत्मानम् herself, हुताशने in fire, हुत्वा after offering, ज्वलत्पावकसङ्काशा body glittering like fire, स्वर्गमेव to heaven, जगाम went.

data.v: यत्र ते सुकृतात्मानो विहरन्ति महर्षयः । तत्पुण्यं शबरीस्थानं जगामात्मसमाधिना ।।
data.es: By virtue of her selfmeditation, Sabari went to that sacred world where the holy sages lived because of their good deeds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुस्सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: शबरी Sabari, आत्मसमाधिना her meditation, सुकृतात्मानः who did good deeds, ते महर्षयः the great sages, यत्र where, विहरन्ति  moved, तत् that, पुण्यम् sacred, स्थानम् holy place, जगाम went.
data.md: By virtue of her devout meditation, Savarī repaired to that holy region where dwelt her spiritual preceptors-the pure-hearted ascetics.

data.v: दिवं तु तस्यां यातायां शबर्यां स्वेन कर्मणा । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा चिन्तयामास राघवः ।।
data.es: When Sabari departed for heaven with her brilliance, Rama contemplated (about the power of sages)with Lakshmana.
data.anv: तस्याम् when she, शबर्याम् Sabari, स्वेन तेजसा by her own brilliance, दिवम् heavens, यातायाम् on departing, राघवः Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह with Lakshmana, चिन्तयामास contemplated.

data.v: चिन्तयित्वा तु धर्मात्मा प्रभावं तं महात्मनाम् । हितकारिणमेकाग्रं लक्ष्मणं राघवोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thinking about the power of the great sages, righteous Rama said to Lakshmana, his wellwisher with singleminded devotion:
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः राघवः Rama, महात्मनाम् of great sages, प्रभावम् power, चिन्तयित्वा  on thinking over, हितकारिणम् his wellwisher, एकाग्रम् with singleminded devotion, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: After Savarī had repaired to heaven by virtue of her divine prowess, Rāma with his brother Lakşmaņa began to ponder over the pious influence of those great ascetics. Thinking within himself about the divine authority of those great ones, the virtuous-souled Rāma spoke to Lakşmaņa, devoted and ever engaged in his well-being.

data.v: दृष्टोऽयमाश्रमः सौम्य बह्वाश्चर्यः कृतात्मनाम् । विश्वस्तमृगशार्दूलो नानाविहगसेवितः ।।
data.es: O handsome one, we have seen this highly wonderful hermitage, where deer and tigers dwell together with mutual confidence, where birds of all kinds inhabit.
data.anv: सौम्य O handsome one  महात्मनाम् of the great sages, बह्वाश्चर्यः very wonderful, विश्वस्तमृगशार्दूलः deer and tigers live together with implicit faith, नानाविहगसेवितः where birds of all kinds dwell, अयम् आश्रमः this hermitage, दृष्टः seen.
data.md: Beheld have I, O gentle one, the wondrous asylum of the pure-souled ascetics filled with diverse birds and tigers rambling friendly with antelopes.

data.v: सप्तानां च समुद्राणामेषु तीर्थेषु लक्ष्मण । उपस्पृष्टं च विधिवत्पितरश्चापि तर्पिताः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, having bathed in the waters of the seven seas (by taking ritualistic bath in these waters) the manes are offered oblations in accordance with tradition.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सप्तानाम् of seven, समुद्राणाम् of seas, एषु तीर्थेषु in these waters, उपस्पृष्टम् having bathed, पितरश्चापि oblations to forefathers, विधिवत् in accordance with tradition, तर्पिताः have been invoked with offering.
data.md: O Laksmana, we have performed ablutions in the sacred waters of these seven seas and offered oblations to our manes. Our misfortunes have ended and prosperity has appeared and my mind is now filled with ecstasy of delight.

data.v: प्रनष्टमशुभं यत्तत्कल्याणं समुपस्थितम् । तेन त्वेतत्प्रहृष्टं मे मनो लक्ष्मण संप्रति ।।
data.es: We have got rid of inauspicious time and good days have come. Therefore, I feel truly happy. Good fortune will appear (now), O Lakshmana, O tiger among men
data.anv: अशुभम् inauspicious time, प्रणष्टम् is got rid of, तत्तत् respectively, कल्याणम् auspicious tidings, समुपस्थितम् have reached, लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, तेन therefore, तत्त्वेन truly, सम्प्रति presently, मनः mind, हृष्टम् happy, नरव्याघ्र O best among men, हृदये at heart, शुभम्  good fortune, आविर्भविष्यति हि will appear now.

data.v: हृदये हि नरव्याघ्र शुभमाविर्भविष्यति । तदागच्छ गमिष्यावः पम्पां तां प्रियदर्शनाम् ।।
data.md: Me-thinks, O best of men, auspiciousness shall soon appear to us; do you come, therefore, we shall proceed towards the picturesque lake Pampā.

data.v: ऋश्यमूको गिरिर्यत्र नातिदूरे प्रकाशते । यस्मिन्वसति धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवोंऽशुमतः सुतः । नित्यं वालिभयात्त्रस्तश्चतुर्भिः सह वानरैः ।।
data.es: Come, let us go to Pampa, which is pleasing to look at. Sugriva, the rigteous self, the son of the Sun has been staying for fear of Vali at the shining Rishyamuka, not far from here.
data.anv: तत् therefore, धर्मात्मा the righteous soul, अंशुमतः सुतः son of the Sun, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, नित्यम् ever, वालिभयात् by the fear of Vali, चतुर्भिः with four, वानरैः सह along with monkeys, यस्मिन् in which, वसति stay, ऋष्यमूक: Rishyamuka, यत्र there, नातिदूरे not very far away, प्रकाशते  shines, ताम् that, प्रियदर्शनाम् pleasing to look at, पम्पाम् Pampa, गमिष्यामि I will go, आगच्छ you may come along.
data.md: You appear in view, at no distance, the mount Rşyamūka. Here dwells with four monkeys, the virtuous-souled Sugrīva.

data.v: अभित्वरे च तं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं वानरर्षभम् । तदधीनं हि मे सौम्य सीतायाः परिमार्गणम् ।।
data.es: I am hastening to see that noble Sugriva the mighty monkey, as the search for Sita depends on him, O handsome one
data.anv: सौम्य O handsome one, वानरर्षभम् mighty among the monkeys, तं सुग्रीवम् that Sugriva, द्रष्टुम् to see, अभित्वरे च I am in haste, सीतायाः of Sita, परिमार्गणम् searching, तदधीनम् depends on him.
data.md: Surya's son, in constant fear of Vāli. I am in a hurry to behold Sugrīva the best of monkeys, for my business—Sītā's quest-is entirely at his hands.

data.v: इति ब्रुवाणं तं रामं सौमित्रिरिदमब्रवीत् । गच्छावस्त्वरितं तत्र ममापि त्वरते मनः ।।
data.es: To the words of Rama who was of stable mind, Lakshmana replied : My mind too is hastening me. Let us get there quickly.
data.anv: एवम् in that way, ब्रुवाणम् as he spoke, धीरम् stableminded one, तं रामम् to that Rama, सौमित्रिः Soumitri, अब्रवीत् said, मम my, मनः आपि mind also, त्वरते hurrying, त्वरितम् quickly, तत्र there, गच्छावः we both will go.
data.md: Unto the heroic Rāma, speaking thus Saumitrī said. Let us depart soon, I am in haste too.

data.v: आश्रमात्तु ततस्तस्मान्निष्क्रम्य स विशां पतिः । आजगाम ततः पम्पां लक्ष्मणेन सहाभिभूः ।।
data.es: Then Rama the lord of men along with Lakshmana departed from the hermitage and went to Pampa.
data.anv: ततः then, विशाम्पतिः lord of men, सः he, प्रभुः lord, तस्मात् from that, आश्रमात् from that hermitage, निष्क्रम्य on departing , ततः then, लक्ष्मणेन सह with Lakshmana, पम्पाम् to Pampa, आजगाम went.

data.v: समीक्षमाणः पुष्पाढ्यं सर्वतो विपुलद्रुमम् । कोयष्टिभिश्चार्जुनकैः शतपत्रैश्च कीचकैः । एतैश्चान्यैश्च विविधैर्नादितं तद्वनं महत् ।।
data.md: Issuing out of Matanga's asylum, the mighty Rāma, lord of men, repaired with Lakşmaņa to the lake Pampā. Exercised with grief, he arrived at the bank of that best lakes, beholding (as he passed along), various trees and pools, the mighty forest covered on all sides with huge trees and flowers and resounding with the noise of lapwings, peacocks, woodpeckers and various other birds and rattling of the bamboo's.

data.v: स रामो विधिवान्वृक्षान्सरांसि विविधानि च । पश्यन्कामाभिसंतप्तो जगाम परमं ह्रदम् ।।
data.es: On seeing different kinds of trees and tanks, the lovestriken Rama visited that great lake.
data.anv: सः that, रामः Rama, विविधान् several, वृक्षान् trees, विविधानि different, सरांसि tanks, पश्यन् seeing, कामाभिसन्तप्तः lovestriken, परमम् great, ह्रदम् lake, जगाम went.

data.v: स तामासाद्य वै रामो दूरादुदकवाहिनीम् । मतङ्गसरसं नाम ह्रदं समवगाहत ।।
data.es: Rama reached the Matanga lake which he could see from a distance and bathed in it.
data.anv: सः रामः Rama, उदकवाहिनीम् lake, ताम् that one, दूरात् from  a distance, आसाद्य reached, मतङ्गसरसं नाम a place called Matanga lake, ह्रदम् pond,समवगाहत bathed.

data.v: स तु शोकसमाविष्टो रामो दशरथात्मजः । विवेश नलिनीं पम्पां पङ्कजैश्च समावृताम् ।।
तिलकाशोकपुंनागबकुलोद्दाल काशिनीम् । रम्योपवनसंबाधां पद्मसंपीडितोदकाम् ।।
स्फटिकोपमतोयाढ्यां श्लक्ष्णवालुकसंतताम् । मत्स्यकच्छपसंबाधां तीरस्थद्रुमशोभिताम् ।।
सखीभिरिव युक्ताभिर्लताभिरनुवेष्टिताम् । किंनरोरगगन्धर्वयक्षराक्षससेविताम् । नानाद्रुमलताकीर्णां शीतवारिनिधिं शुभाम् ।।
पद्मैः सौगन्धिकैस्ताम्रां शुक्लां कुमुदमण्डलैः । नीलां कुवलयोद्धातैर्बहुवर्णां कुथामिव ।।
data.es: He saw the sacred lake Pampa whose sweet flow of water was used by great seers. It abounded in trees and creepers. Its surface was red with lotuses at one place, white with clusters of lilies at another and with blue lotuses at other places. As such, it looked like a carpet with variegated colours.
data.anv: ततः then, सः he, पुण्याम् that sacred, उदारजनसेविताम् the place where exalted seers lived, नानाद्रुमलताकीर्णाम्  abounding in different kinds of trees and creepers, पानीयवाहिनीम् with flow of waters, सौगन्धिकैः sweetscented, पद्मैः lotuses, ताम्राम् red, कुमुदमण्डलैः with clusters of lilies, शुक्लाम् white, कुवलयोद्घाटैः with blue waterlilies, नीलाम् blue lotuses, बहुवर्णाम् with variegated colours, कुथामिव like a carpet, पम्पाम् Pampa lake, ददर्श saw.

data.v: अरविन्दोत्पलवतीं पद्मसौगन्धिकायुताम् । पुष्पिताम्रवणोपेतां बर्हिणोद्घुष्टनादिताम् ।।
स तां दृष्ट्वा ततः पम्पां रामः सौमित्रिणा सह । विललाप च तेजस्वी कामाद्दशरथात्मजः ।।
तिलकैर्बीजपूरैश्च वटैः शुक्लद्रुमैस्तथा । पुष्पितैः करवीरैश्च पुंनागैश्च सुपुष्पितैः ।।
मालतीकुन्दगुल्मैश्च भण्डीरैर्निचुलैस्तथा । अशोकैः सप्तपर्णैश्च केतकैरतिमुक्तकैः । अन्यैश्च विविधैर्वृक्षैः प्रमदेवोपशोभिताम् ।।
अस्यास्तीरे तु पूर्वोक्तः पर्वतो धातुमण्डितः । ऋश्यमूक इति ख्यातश्चित्रपुष्पितकाननः ।।
data.es: The famous mount, sacred Rishyamuka is situated on the bank of Pampa full of blossoming trees.
data.anv: पूर्वोक्तः referred  earlier, धातुमण्डितः adorned with minerals, पुण्यः sacred, पुष्पितपादपः having trees with flowers in bloom, ऋष्यमूकः इति Rishyamuka by name, ख्यातः famous, पर्वतः mountain, अस्याः its, तीरे on the bank.

data.v: हरिरृक्षरजो नाम्नः पुत्रस्तस्य महात्मनः । अध्यास्ते तं महावीर्यः सुग्रीव इति विश्रुतः ।।
data.es: The mighty son of Riksharaja, the great soul, the Sun whose son was the wellknown Sugriva, resides on this mountain.
data.anv: ऋक्षरजोनाम्नः of Riksharaja by name, महात्मनः of the great soul, तस्य his, हरेः Sun's, पुत्रः son, महावीर्यः mighty, सुग्रीवः इति known as Sugriva, विश्रुतः very wellknown, तम् him, अध्यास्ते is residing.
data.md: There dwell the famous lord of monkeys, Sugrīva, the heroic son of the great Rkşarajā.

data.v: सुग्रीवमभिगच्छ त्वं वानरेन्द्रं नरर्षभ । इत्युवाच पुनर्वाक्यं लक्ष्मणं सत्यविक्रमम् ।।
data.es: Rama said to Lakshmana, the best of men, who had truth as his strength, Go to Sugriva, lord of the monkeys.
data.anv: नरर्षभ best among men, त्वम् you, वानरेन्द्रम् to the lord of monkeys, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अभिगच्छ approach, पुनः again, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, इति this, उवाच said.
data.md: O best of men, do you approach the chief of monkeys. Rāma, having truth for his prowess, again spoke to Laksmana, saying, O Laksmana, how shall I live without Sitā, who have been deprived of my kingdom, who am poorly and have Sītā for my life?

data.v: ततो महद्वर्त्म च दूरसंक्रमं; क्रमेण गत्वा प्रविलोकयन्वनम् । ददर्श पम्पां शुभदर्श कानना;मनेकनानाविधपक्षिसंकुलाम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, going slowly to a distance, Rama and Lakshmana saw Pampa surrounded by beautiful forests full of many varieties of birds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चसप्ततिमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, सुदूरसङ्क्रमम् extending to a distance, महत् great, वर्त्म path, क्रमेण gradually, गत्वा after going, वनम् forest, प्रविलोकयन् while observing, शुभदर्शकाननाम् surrounded by  beautiful forests, अनेकनानाविधपक्षिजालकाम् many varieties of birds, पम्पाम् Pampa, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Proceeding slowly, observing the forest, Rāma beheld and entered with Lakşmaņa Pampā, girt on all sides with beautiful woods and filled with a multitude of diverse birds.

data.v: स तां पुष्करिणीं गत्वा पद्मोत्पलझषाकुलाम् । रामः सौमित्रिसहितो विललापाकुलेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: Arriving with Laksmana at the lake filled with lotuses, lilies and fishes, Rama, his senses oppressed, burst into tears.
data.anv: सौमित्रिसहितः together with Saumitri, सः that, रामः Rama, पद्मोत्पलझषाकुलाम् filled with lotuses, lilies and fishes, पुष्करिणीम् to the lake, गत्वा arrived, आकुलेन्द्रियः one (Rama) who is with afflicted senses, विललाप lamented.
data.md: Repairing with Lakşmaņa to the lake Pampā filled with red and while lotuses and fish Rāma having his senses agitated began to lament.

data.v: तस्य दृष्ट्वैव तां हर्षादिन्द्रियाणि चकम्पिरे । स कामवशमापन्नः सौमित्रिमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: He was glad to see it but sad at the thought of Sita. His passion stirred, his senses shaken, he said this to Saumitri:
