data.md: And beholding there that lake, his senses were stirred with delight. Troubled with passion he spoke to Saumitri saying,

data.v: सौमित्रे पश्य पम्पायाः काननं शुभदर्शनम् । यत्र राजन्ति शैलाभा द्रुमाः सशिखरा इव ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri look at the pleasant forest around Pampa where trees stand splendid like mountainpeaks.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, पम्पायाः of Pampa, शुभदर्शनम् pleasant (view) to the eyes, काननम् forest, पश्य look see, यत्र where, द्रुमाः trees, सशिखराः with high branches, शैलाः mountains इव like, राजन्ति glitter (appear splendid)
data.md: Observe again, O son of Sumitra, the picturesque wood-land around the lake, where trees, crowned with large branches resembling the summits of a mountain, appear like so many hills.

data.v: मां तु शोकाभिसंतप्तमाधयः पीडयन्ति वै । भरतस्य च दुःखेन वैदेह्या हरणेन च ।।
data.es: Already saddened due to the abduction of Sita and plight of Bharata, I am tormented by Spring.
data.anv: भरतस्य दुःखेन Bharata's sorrow, वैदेह्या हरणेन Vaidehi's abduction, शोकाभिसन्तप्तम् tormented with sorrow, मां तु me  indeed, माधवः spring, पीडयन्ति is tormenting.
data.md: Mental agony arising from Sītā's ravishment and Bharata's grief, have been grinding me who am already stricken with sorrow.

data.v: अधिकं प्रविभात्येतन्नीलपीतं तु शाद्वलम् । द्रुमाणां विविधैः पुष्पैः परिस्तोमैरिवार्पितम् ।।
data.es: The bluishyellow grass, dotted with different kinds of flowers fallen from the trees shines like a carpet spread.
data.anv: द्रुमाणाम् of the trees, विविधैः पुष्पैः with variety of flowers, परिस्तोमैरिव like a carpet, अर्पितम् spread, एतत् this, नीलपीतम् bluishyellow, शाद्वलम् grass, अधिकम् very much, प्रविभाति shines brightly.
data.md: This green common, chequered with yellow and blue, appeared of enhanced beauty by the various flowers of the trees as if covered with a blanket of diverse hues.

data.v: सुखानिलोऽयं सौमित्रे कालः प्रचुरमन्मथः । गन्धवान्सुरभिर्मासो जातपुष्पफलद्रुमः ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri it is the season of spring. The trees are laden with fruits and fragrant flowers. Ecstatic blows the gentle freeze.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, सुखानिलः gentle breeze, अयं कालः at this time, प्रचुरमन्मथः ecstatic, जातपुष्पफलद्रुमः trees filled with flowers and fruits, सुरभिर्मासः Spring Season (Chaitra, the first Month of Indian calendar), गन्धवान् fragrant
data.md: The tops of the trees rich with flowery bunches are gnarled with creepers of blossoming tips. Now has appeared, O Saumitri, the fragrant spring of pleasant breezes, when greatly prevail the influence of Cupid and the trees are graced with fruits and flowers.

data.v: पश्य रूपाणि सौमित्रे वनानां पुष्पशालिनाम् । सृजतां पुष्पवर्षाणि वर्षं तोयमुचामिव ।।
data.es: 'Look at the flowering trees sending showers of flowers like water dropping from the clouds, O Saumitri
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, पुष्पवर्षाणि showers of flowers, सृजताम् sending forth, पुष्पशालिनाम् वनानाम् of flowering trees, तोयं water, तोयमुचामिव like waterbearing clouds, रूपाणि scenery (forms), पश्य look
data.md: Behold, O Saumitri, the beauty of the flowery woods, showering flowers like to clouds pouring forth rain.

data.v: प्रस्तरेषु च रम्येषु विविधाः काननद्रुमाः । वायुवेगप्रचलिताः पुष्पैरवकिरन्ति गाम् ।।
data.es: Various forest trees shaken by the force of the wind scatter flowers on the beautiful rocky surface of earth.
data.anv: रम्येषु on beautiful, प्रस्तरेषु on the rockyland, विविधाः different kinds of, काननद्रुमाः forest trees, वायुवेगप्रचलिताः shaken by the force of wind, पुष्पैः with flowers, गाम् the earth, अवकिरन्ति spreading all over
data.md: Various trees growing on rock surfaces, moved by the wind have been scattering flowers on the earth.

data.v: मारुतः सुखं संस्पर्शे वाति चन्दनशीतलः । षट्पदैरनुकूजद्भिर्वनेषु मधुगन्धिषु ।।
data.es: As if the trees are singing, swayed by the wind, while the bees in the forest, fragrant with honey, hum in tune.
data.md: Violently shaken by wind the trees in this nectar-smelling forest are sounding as it were with the hum of bees.

data.v: गिरिप्रस्थेषु रम्येषु पुष्पवद्भिर्मनोरमैः । संसक्तशिखरा शैला विराजन्ति महाद्रुमैः ।।
data.es: 'The huge trees in the scenic mountainranges look delightful with their blossoms touching the peaks.
data.anv: रम्येषु scenic, गिरिप्रस्थेषु mountain ranges, पुष्पवद्भिः flowers in bloom, मनोरमैः delightful, महाद्रुमैः huge trees, संसक्तशिखराः mountainpeaks touching each other, शैलाः mountains, विराजन्ते are splendid
data.md: Hillocks over-topped with picturesque and flowery trees stand beautifully on this mountainous expanse.

data.v: पुष्पिताग्रांश्च पश्येमान्कर्णिकारान्समन्ततः । हाटकप्रतिसंछन्नान्नरान्पीताम्बरानिव ।।
data.es: 'See these Karnikaras in full bloom all over, looking like people clad in yellow silk adorned with golden ornaments.
data.anv: समन्ततः everywhere, सुपुष्पितान् well blossomed, हाटकप्रतिसञ्छन्नान् adorned with golden ornaments, पीताम्बरान् clad in yellow silk, नरानिव like people, एतान् these, कर्णिकारान् Karnikara, पश्य see.
data.md: Behold, the Karņikāras covered with flowers appear on all sides like to human beings decorated with golden ornaments and wearing yellow cloths.

data.v: अयं वसन्तः सौमित्रे नानाविहगनादितः । सीतया विप्रहीणस्य शोकसंदीपनो मम ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri this spring season resonating with the sounds of several kinds of birds, kindles my anguish as I am separated from Sita.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, नानाविहगनादितः filled with sounds of several kinds of birds, अयं वसन्तः this spring season, सीतया with Sita, विप्रहीनस्य of a man separated, मम for me, शोकसन्दीपनः kindles anguish
data.md: This spring, O Saumitri, sounded by the musical notes of the birds of different spacies has been kindling my grief who am without Sītā.

data.v: मां हि शोकसमाक्रान्तं संतापयति मन्मथः । हृष्टः प्रवदमानश्च समाह्वयति कोकिलः ।।
data.es: 'Kandarpa (Cupid) torments me while I am already griefstricken. The Cuckoo with his challenging cheerfulness mocks me.
data.anv: शोकसमाक्रान्तम् to one (Rama) who is overcome with sorrow, माम् me, मन्मथः cupid (Manmatha, the god of love), सन्तापयति torments, हृष्ट: happy, प्रवदमानः making fun, कोकिलः cuckoo, ममाह्वयति inviting me
data.md: Cupid has been smiting me the more who am stricken with grief, and the cuckoos have been defying me, displaying their mirth, O Laksmana.

data.v: एष दात्यूहको हृष्टो रम्ये मां वननिर्झरे । प्रणदन्मन्मथाविष्टं शोचयिष्यति लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: 'Lakshmana, while I am already lovestricken, the swamphen (gallinule, a marshbird) troubles me with its joyous cackles in the beautiful foreststream.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, रम्ये in a beautiful, वननिर्झरे in waterfall, हृष्टः joyous, प्रणदन् while clucking, एषः this, दात्यूहकः a swamphen (a marshbird), gallinule (water crow),  मन्मथाविष्टम् tormented by love, माम् me, शोचयिष्यति is troubling
data.md: At the pleasant fountains the delighted Dátyūahas with their warblings have been afflicting me who am possessed by Cupid.

data.v: विमिश्रा विहगाः पुम्भिरात्मव्यूहाभिनन्दिताः । भृङ्गराजप्रमुदिताः सौमित्रे मधुरस्वराः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana the female birds praised by their flocks, are united with their male partners. Enjoying the sweet sounds of large black bees, they are singing melodiously.
data.anv: विहगाः female birds, पुम्भिः male birds, विमिश्राः united with, आत्मव्यूहाभिनन्दिताः praised by their flock, भृङ्गराजप्रमुदिताः enjoying the sounds of large black bees, मधुरस्वनाः singing sweetly.
data.md: O Saumitri, birds and bees of melodious notes accompanied by their co-mates and delighted with their mutual companionship are on the banks of this lake.

data.v: मां हि सा मृगशावाक्षी चिन्ताशोकबलात्कृतम् । संतापयति सौमित्रे क्रूरश्चैत्रवनानिलः ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri the cruel breeze of the spring forest torments me as I am now immersed in grief in the absence of my fawneyed beloved.
data.anv: सौमित्रे Saumitri, मृगशाबाक्षी a fawneyed lady, चिन्ताशोकबलात्कृतम्  sinking in sorrow, माम् me, क्रूरः cruel, चैत्रवनानिलः the breeze of spring forest, अद्य now, सन्तापयति torments, हि indeed
data.md: That one having the eyes of a fawn and ruthless vernal breeze, O Saumitri, have been oppressing me who am overpowered with anxiety and grief.

data.v: शिखिनीभिः परिवृता मयूरा गिरिसानुषु । मन्मथाभिपरीतस्य मम मन्मथवर्धनाः ।।
data.es: 'The peacocks intoxicated with passion for the peahens surround them intensifying my longing (for Vaidehi).
data.anv: शिखिनीभिः by peahens also, परिवृताः surrounded, मदमूर्छिताः intoxicated with passion, ते एते these peacocks, मन्मथाभिपरीतस्य fallen in love, मम to me, मन्मथवर्धनाः intensifying love
data.md: These maddened peacocks encircled by the pea-hens, have been aggravating my amorous desire who am already possessed by the Cupid.

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्णम नृत्यन्तं मयूरमुपनृत्यति । शिखिनी मन्मथार्तैषा भर्तारं गिरिसानुषु ।।
data.es: 'Look at the lovelorn peahen, excited by love, dancing on the moutain slope, O Lakshmana Engrossed in love, she dances for wooing the peacock.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, गिरिसानुनि on the mountain slope, मन्मथार्ता love lorn, एषा these, शिखिनी peahen, नृत्यन्तम् to dancing, भर्तारम् to the partner, मयूरम् peacock, उपनृत्यति  is dancing along with, पश्य look
data.md: Observe, O Laksmana, there dance with her dancing mate on the mountainous expanse, the pea-hen, troubled with amorous sentiments.

data.v: मयूरस्य वने नूनं रक्षसा न हृता प्रिया । मम त्वयं विना वासः पुष्पमासे सुदुःसहः ।।
data.es: 'The peacock's beloved, for sure, has not been abducted by the demon. Therefore, he is dancing in delight in the forest in the company of his beloved.
data.anv: मयूरस्य peacock's, प्रिया beloved, वने in the forest, रक्षसा by the demon, न हृता not abducted, नूनम् surely, तस्मात् therefore, कान्तया सह along with its beloved, रम्येषु in delight, वनेषु in the forests, नृत्यति is dancing

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण पुष्पाणि निष्फलानि भवन्ति मे । पुष्पभारसमृद्धानां वनानां शिशिरात्यये ।।
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, पश्य look, शिशिरात्यये at the end of winter, पुष्पभारसमृद्धानाम् loaded  with flowers, वनानाम् of the forest, पुष्पाणि flowers, मे my, निष्फलानि भवन्ति are no use
data.md: Behold, O Laksmana, In this season of spring flowers of this forest rich in their load of flowers are of no avail to me. These pleasant flowers of the trees have been uselessly falling on the earth along with the swarms of black bees.

data.v: वदन्ति रावं मुदिताः शकुनाः संघशः कलम् । आह्वयन्त इवान्योन्यं कामोन्मादकरा मम ।।
data.anv: मुदिताः happy, शकुनाः bird, मम to me, कामोन्मादकराः mad with love, अन्योन्यम् each other, आह्वयन्तः इव as though inviting, सङ्घशः in groups, कलम्  in a sweet Voice, कामम् indeed, नदन्ति they call out
data.md: The birds exciting my desire have been delightedly warbling in flocks as if welcoming each other.

data.v: नूनं परवशा सीता सापि शोचत्यहं यथा । श्यामा पद्मपलाशाक्षी मृदुभाषा च मे प्रिया ।।
एष पुष्पवहो वायुः सुखस्पर्शो हिमावहः । तां विचिन्तयतः कान्तां पावकप्रतिमो मम ।।
data.es: 'This cool breeze that carries the fragrance of flowers, that is gentle in its touch feels like fire when I think about my beautiful beloved.
data.anv: पुष्पवहः one which carries flowers, सुखस्पर्शः with gentle touch, हिमावहः one which is cool, एषः this one, वायुः wind, तां कान्ताम् that beautiful Sita, विचिन्तयतः while thinking, मम to me, पावकप्रतिमः appears like fire
data.md: This cool breeze of a pleasant touch, carrying the fragrance of flowers appears like a fire-brand to me who am thinking of my spouse.

data.v: तां विनाथ विहंगोऽसौ पक्षी प्रणदितस्तदा । वायसः पादपगतः प्रहृष्टमभिनर्दति ।।
data.es: 'The crow that cried unhappily flying in the sky as if to foretell my separation from Sita, is now on the tree, singing joyfully (suggesting my possible union with Sita).
data.anv: तदा then, विहङ्गः the birds flying in the sky, प्रणदितः cried out, पक्षी bird, यः वायसः that same crow, तां विना without her, पादपगतः sitting on the tree, प्रहृष्टम् happily, अभिनर्दति is singing joyfully
data.md: This bird set up a cry in the sky at that time* and now in the absence of Sītā, that crow, sitting on the tree is crying delightedly. This refers to the time when Rāma was united with Sītā i.e. at the time of his wedding, At that time the bird, flying up in the sky set up an inauspicious cry indicating that in no distant time he should be separated form her; and now his sitting on the tree and cawing delightedly indicated that he should soon be re-united with her.

data.v: एष वै तत्र वैदेह्या विहगः प्रतिहारकः । पक्षी मां तु विशालाक्ष्याः समीपमुपनेष्यति ।।
data.es: 'The same crow attendant on Vaidehi there will take me to my largeeyed beloved.
data.anv: तत्र there, विहगः the crow, वैदेह्या of Vaidehi, प्रतिहारकः attendant, एषः पक्षी that bird, माम् me, विशालाक्ष्याः  largeeyed (Sita), समीपम् near, उपनेष्यति will take me
data.md: This bird flying up in the sky brought about Sītā's ravishment and this bird shall take me to her having expansive eyes.

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण संनादं वने मदविवर्धनम् । पुष्पिताग्रेषु वृक्षेषु द्विजानामुपकूजताम् ।।
data.es: 'Losten, O Lakshmana to the sweet warblings of the birds on the blossoming treetops of the forest. My love for her (Sita) enhances with their sweet voices.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, वने in the forest, पुष्पिताग्रेषु वृक्षेषु on the blossoming tree tops, उपकूजताम् of warbling ones, द्विजानाम् of birds, मद्विवर्धनम् that which increases love,  शृणु listen
data.md: Hear, O Laksmana, the maddening notes of those birds sitting on the tops of the flowery trees and setting up their melody.

data.v: सौमित्रे पश्य पम्पायाश्चित्रासु वनराजिषु । नलिनानि प्रकाशन्ते जले तरुणसूर्यवत् ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri O' tiger among men look at the kinnaras wandering here and there, in the wonderful forest around the Pampa lake.
data.anv: नरशार्दूल O tiger among brave man, सौमित्रे O Saumitri, पम्पायाः of Pampa, चित्रासु in the  variegated, वनराजिषु forests, किन्नराः kinnaras, ततस्ततः here and there, विचरन्ति are wandering, पश्य see
data.md: Behold, O Saumitri, O foremost of men, the Kinnaras are ranging at large in this variegated forest land on the banks of Pampā. Behold, O Lakşmaņa, here the fragrant red lotuses are shedding forth their splendour like to the newly risen sun.

data.v: एषा प्रसन्नसलिला पद्मनीलोत्पलायता । हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा पम्पा सौगन्धिकायुता ।।
data.es: 'This Pampa with its water clear and fragrant with red and blue lotuses is filled with swans and geese.
data.anv: प्रसन्नसलिला clear water, पद्मनीलोत्पलायुता endowed with red and blue lotuses, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा filled with swans and geese, सौगन्धिकान्विता fragrant, एषा this, पम्पा Pampa

data.v: चक्रवाकयुता नित्यं चित्रप्रस्थवनान्तरा । मातङ्गमृगयूथैश्च शोभते सलिलार्थिभिः ।।
data.es: 'Frequented by the Chakravakas and surrounded by the wonderful forest with thirsty elephants and deer this Pampa looks beautiful.
data.anv: नित्यम् always, चक्रवाकयुता full of Chakravaka birds, चित्रप्रस्थवनान्तरा with wonderful forestland, सलिलार्थिभिः those wishing to have water, मातङ्गमृगयूथैश्च by herds of elephants and deer, शोभते looks very beautiful

data.v: पद्मकोशपलाशानि द्रष्टुं दृष्टिर्हि मन्यते । सीताया नेत्रकोशाभ्यां सदृशानीति लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: 'Seeing the delicate petals around the lotus buds that look like beautiful eyelids of Sita, my eyes crave for them O Lakshmana
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सीतायाः Sita's, नेत्रकोशाभ्याम् both eye lids, दृष्टिः sight, पद्मकोशपलाशानि delicate petals over the buds of lotus, द्रष्टुम् seeing, मन्यते  it appears, सदृशानि  they have similar beautiful appearance
data.md: My eyes pant for beholding those lotus-petals, O Lakṣmaṇa, because of their resemblance with Sītā's eyes.

data.v: पद्मकेसरसंसृष्टो वृक्षान्तरविनिःसृतः । निःश्वास इव सीताया वाति वायुर्मनोहरः ।।
data.es: 'The bleeze that blows through the trees carrying the fragrance of the filaments of lotuses feels pleasant like Sita's breath.
data.anv: पद्मकेसरसंसृष्टः touching the filaments of lotuses, वृक्षान्तरविनिःसृतः blowing through the  trees, मनोहरः pleasant, सीतायाः Sita's, निःश्वासः इव like the breath, वायुः wind, वाति blows.
data.md: Issuing out of the trees and touching the filaments, the pleasant wind is blowing like to Sita's breath.

data.v: सौमित्रे पश्य पम्पाया दक्षिणे गिरिसानुनि । पुष्पितां कर्णिकारस्य यष्टिं परमशोभनाम् ।।
data.es: 'Look at the very spectacular karnikara tree with its blossmed branches on the mountain slope towards the southern side of Pampa, O Saumitri
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, पम्पाया Pampa's, दक्षिणे southward, गिरिसानुनि on the slope of the mountains, कर्णिकारस्य Karnikara's, पुष्पिताम् blossomed, परमशोभनाम् very enchanting, यष्टिम् stem, पश्य see.
data.md: Behold O Lakşmaņa, the flowery branches of the Karņikāras on the summits of the mountain situated on the southern bank of Pampā.

data.v: अधिकं शैलराजोऽयं धातुभिस्तु विभूषितः । विचित्रं सृजते रेणुं वायुवेगविघट्टितम् ।।
data.es: 'This king of mountains is rich with plenty of minerals and, therefore, generates multicoloured dust particles splattered by the speed of the wind.
data.anv: धातुभिः with minerals, सुविभूषितः welldecked, अयम् this, शैलराजः king of mountains, वायुवेगविघट्टितम् splattered by the speed of the wind, विचित्रम् colourful, रेणुम् dust particles, अधिकम् plenty, सृजते generates.
data.md: This prince of mountains, beautified with various metals, has been throwing up dusts of diverse colours driven by the wind.

data.v: गिरिप्रस्थास्तु सौमित्रे सर्वतः संप्रपुष्पितैः । निष्पत्रैः सर्वतो रम्यैः प्रदीपा इव कुंशुकैः ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri With leafless kimsuka trees in full bloom all over the mountain ranges they appear beautiful like blazing mountains.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri गिरिप्रस्थाः mountain ranges, सर्वतः all over, सम्प्रपुष्पितैः with wellbloomed, निष्पत्रैः with leafless, रम्यैः by the enchanting ones, किंशुकैः with kimsuka  flowers, सर्वतः all over, प्रदीप्ताः are as if illuminated.
data.md: O Saumitri, these mountainous expanses are burning in beauty with blossoming and beautiful Kinsukas void of leaves.

data.v: पम्पातीररुहाश्चेमे संसक्ता मधुगन्धिनः । मालतीमल्लिकाषण्डाः करवीराश्च पुष्पिताः ।।
data.es: 'Very closely grown on the banks of Pampa, stand malati, mallika and karavira trees with their clusters of fragrant blossoms.
data.anv: पम्पातीररुहाः grown on the banks of Pampa, संसक्ताः all close to each other, मधुगन्धिनः having sweet fragrance, इमे these, मालतीमल्लिकाषण्डा: करवीराश्च clusters of malati, Mallika  and karaviras, पुष्पिताः in full bloom.

data.v: केतक्यः सिन्दुवाराश्च वासन्त्यश्च सुपुष्पिताः । माधव्यो गन्धपूर्णाश्च कुन्दगुल्माश्च सर्वशः ।।
data.es: 'Fully blossmed ketaka, sinduvara, madhavi and kunda bushes in spring scatter their fragrance everywhere.
data.anv: केतक्यः ketakas सिन्दुवाराश्च sinduvara, वासन्त्यश्च veneral flowers, गन्धपूर्णाः filled with fragrance, माधव्यः madhavi, कुन्दगुल्माश्च kunda bushes, सर्वशः everywhere, सुपुष्पिताः are in full bloom.

data.v: चिरिबिल्वा मधूकाश्च वञ्जुला बकुलास्तथा । चम्पकास्तिलकाश्चैव नागवृक्षाश्च पुष्पिताः ।।
data.anv: चिरिबिल्वाः chiribilvas, मधूकाश्च madhukas, वञ्जुलाः vanjulas, तथा so also, वकुलाः bakulas, चम्पकाः champaka, तिलकाश्चैव even tilaka, नागवृक्षाश्च nanga trees also, पुष्पिताः in bloom, नीपाश्च kadamba, वरणाश्चैव even varanas, खर्जूराश्च and kharjuras also, सुपुष्पिताः are in full bloom.

data.v: नीपाश्च वरणाश्चैव खर्जूराश्च सुपुष्पिताः । अङ्कोलाश्च कुरण्टाश्च चूर्णकाः पारिभद्रकाः ।।
चूताः पाटलयश्चैव कोविदाराश्च पुष्पिताः । मुचुकुन्दार्जुनाश्चैव दृश्यन्ते गिरिसानुषु ।।
data.es: 'There are trees like ankola, kuranta, churnaka, paribhadraka, mango, patali, kovidara, muchukunda, arjuna, ketaka, uddalaka, shirisha, shimshupa and shava, all in full bloom on the mountain peaks.
data.anv: अङ्कोलाः ankolas, कुरण्टाश्च kurantas, चूर्णकाः churnakas, पारिभद्रकाः paribhadrakas, चूताः mangoes, पाटलयः patalis, कोविदाराश्च kovidaras, मुचुकुन्दाः अर्जुनाः च एव muchukundas, and arjunas, केतकोद्दालकाश्चैव ketakas, uddalakas, शिरीषाः shirishas, शिंशुपाः shimshupas, धवाः dhavas, पुष्पिताः in bloom, गिरिसानुषु on the mountain peaks, दृश्यन्ते they are seen.
data.md: There appear on the summits of the hills flowers Asanas, Saptaparanas, Kavidaras, Bandhugivas, and Tamālās.

data.v: केतकोद्दालकाश्चैव शिरीषाः शिंशपा धवाः । शाल्मल्यः किंशुकाश्चैव रक्ताः कुरबकास्तथा । तिनिशा नक्त मालाश्च चन्दनाः स्यन्दनास्तथा ।।
data.anv: शाल्मल्यः shalmalis, किंशुकाः kimshukas, तथा similarly, रक्ताः red, कुरवकाः kuravakas, तिनिशाः tinisha, नक्तमालाश्च even naktamala, चन्दनाः chandana, तथा similarly, स्यन्दना: syandana.

data.v: विविधा विविधैः पुष्पैस्तैरेव नगसानुषु । विकीर्णैः पीतरक्ताभाः सौमित्रे प्रस्तराः कृताः ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri varieties of colourful flowers, some red and some yellow, are spread out on the mountain slopes.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, नगसानुषु on the slopes of mountains, विविधैः with many, (तैः) पुष्पैरेव flowers alone, विकीर्णाः spread, विविधाः several, प्रस्तराः slabs, पीतरक्ता हि yellow and red, कृताः formed
data.md: O Saumitri, the mountainous levels variegated with flowers of different species, are appearing like to beds.

data.v: हिमान्ते पश्य सौमित्रे वृक्षाणां पुष्पसंभवम् । पुष्पमासे हि तरवः संघर्षादिव पुष्पिताः ।।
data.es: 'Winter has ended and the season of flowers has set in, O Saumitri The trees are full of flowers as if competing with one another.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, हिमान्ते at the end of winter, पुष्पमासे in Spring, वृक्षाणाम् of the trees, पुष्पसम्भवम् abundance of flowers, पश्य see, तरवः trees, सङ्घर्षादिव competing with each other, पुष्पिताः  have blossomed .
data.md: Behold O Saumitri, the origination of flowers in the trees at the expiry of the winter. The trees as if viewing with each other, have blossomed in this season of flowers. The trees, O Lakşmaņa, with bees humming around and with flowery branches are as if welcoming each other.

data.v: पश्य शीतजलां चेमां सौमित्रे पुष्करायुताम् । चक्रवाकानुचरितां कारण्डवनिषेविताम् । प्लवैः क्रौञ्चैश्च संपूर्णां वराहमृगसेविताम् ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri look at this lake of cool water filled with, lotuses, chakravakas flying about and ducks floating.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, शीतजलाम् with cool water, पुष्करायुताम् filled with lotuses, चक्रवाकानुचरिताम् with chakravakas flying about, कारण्डवनिषेविताम् frequented by ducks, इमाम् this, पश्य see.
data.md: O Saumitri, behold this Pampā of cool water, enveloped on all sides with lotuses, and frequented by Cakravākas, Karandavas, Krauñcas, Plavas and high deer.

data.v: अधिकं शोभते पम्पाविकूजद्भिर्विहंगमैः ।।
दीपयन्तीव मे कामं विविधा मुदिता द्विजाः । श्यामां चन्द्रमुखीं स्मृत्वा प्रियां पद्मनिभेक्षणाम् ।।
data.es: Pampa, filled with swimming, kraunchas and frequented by big animals looks splendid. The joyous warbling of a variety of birds is highly exciting. They kindle my passion for my young, Moonfaced, lotus eyed beloved.
data.anv: प्लवैः swemming, क्रौञ्चैश्च krauncha, सम्पूर्णां filled, महामृगनिषेविताम् inhabited by big animals, पम्पा Pampa, विकूजद्भिः विहङ्गमैः by warbling birds, अधिकं very much, शोभते looks beautiful, मुदिताः joyous, विविधाः several, द्विजाः birds, श्यामाम् young lady, चन्द्रमुखीम् Moonfaced, पद्मनिभेक्षणाम् with eyes like lotus, प्रियाम् beloved, स्मृत्वा remembering, मे to me, कामम् passion, दीपयन्तीव burning.
data.md: The beauty of Pampā has been further enhanced by the birds carolling. Diverse delighted birds have been exciting my passion, reminding me of my dear spouse, of blameless countenance, having a moon like face and eyes resembling lotus-petals.

data.v: पय सानुषु चित्रेषु मृगीभिः सहितान्मृगान् । मां पुनर्मृगशावाक्ष्या वैदेह्या विरहीकृतम् ।।
data.anv: चित्रेषु colourful, सानुषु slopes of mountains, मृगीभिः with female deer, सहितान् accompanied, मृगान् deer, पश्य see, ततस्ततः here and there, सञ्चरन्तः while moving about, मृगशाबाक्ष्या fawneyed, वैदेह्या of Vaidehi, विरहीकृतम् separated from, माम् me, पुनः again, व्यथयन्तीव agonised, मे my, चित्तम् heart.
data.md: Behold on the yonder mountainous expanse of various colours, stags sporting with hinds and myself on the other hand forsaken by Vaidehi having eyes resembling those of an antelope.

data.v: एवं स विलपंस्तत्र शोकोपहतचेतनः । अवेक्षत शिवां पम्पां रम्यवारिवहां शुभाम् ।।
निरीक्षमाणः सहसा महात्मा; सर्वं वनं निर्झरकन्दरं च । उद्विग्नचेताः सह लक्ष्मणेन; विचार्य दुःखोपहतः प्रतस्थे ।।
data.es: The great Rama was overcome with grief while scanning the entire forest with its streams and caves. Engrossed in her thoughts, dejected at heart and inflicted with pain, he set both, accompanied by Lakshmana.
data.anv: महात्मा great soul, सर्वम् all, वनम् forest, निर्झरकन्दराः with streams and caves, निरीक्षमाणः observing, उद्विग्नचेताः dejected at heart, लक्ष्मणेन सह with Lakshmana, विचार्य thinking over, दुःखोपहतः inflicted with sorrow, सहसा quickly, प्रतस्थे started.
data.md: Thereupon the high-souled Rāma, stricken with grief passed along beholding the forestland, fountains, caves and revolving aside (the 'pregnant words of Laksmana).

data.v: तावृष्यमूकं सहितौ प्रयातौ; सुग्रीवशाखामृगसेवितं तम् । त्रस्तास्तु दृष्ट्वा हरयो बभूवु;र्महौजसौ राघवलक्ष्मणौ तौ ।।
data.es: Having seen the mighty Rama and Lakshmana, all other monkeys got frightened and ran into a sacred and safe hermitage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे प्रथमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the first sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महौजसौ of great strength, तौ both, राघवलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, त्रस्ताः frightened, हरयः monkeys, पुण्यसुखम् sacred and safe, शरण्यम् a refugees, सदैव always, शाखामृगसेवितान्तम् a restingplace for monkeys, तम् such, आश्रमम् hermitage, अभिजग्मुः went.

data.v: तौ तु दृष्ट्वा महात्मानौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । वरायुधधरौ वीरौ सुग्रीवः शङ्कितोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: On seeing the two great souls, heroic Rama and Lakshmana wielding the best of weapons, Sugriva was alarmed.
data.anv: वरायुधधरौ wielders of best of weapons, वीरौ  heroes, महात्मानौ great souls, भ्रातरौ the two brothers, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, शङ्कितः doubtful, अभूत् became
data.md: Beholding those two high-souled brothers Rāma and Lakşmaņa, heroic and with great scimitars in their hands, Sugrīva became terrified.

data.v: उद्विग्नहृदयः सर्वा दिशः समवलोकयन् । न व्यतिष्ठत कस्मिंश्चिद्देशे वानरपुंगवः ।।
data.es: Agitated at heart, the best of vanaras started in all directions and could not settle down at one spot.
data.anv: वानरपुङ्गवः best of vanaras, उद्विग्नहृदयः agitated at heart, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, समवलोकयन् looked at,  कस्मिंचशित् देशे at one place, न व्यतिष्ठत not able to stay
data.md: That best of monkeys, of a disturbed mind, cast his looks around and could not stand (patiently) at any place.

data.v: नैव चक्रे मनः स्थाने वीक्षमाणो महाबलौ । कपेः परमभीतस्य चित्तं व्यवससाद ह ।।
data.es: Beholding the two strong heroes, the monkey (Sugriva) was very much frightened. His heart sank.
data.anv: महाबलौ very strong persons, वीक्षमाणः beholding, स्थातुम् to be steady, मनः to his mind, नैव चक्रे did not, परमभीतस्य much frightened, कपेः monkey's, चित्तम् mind, व्यवससाद  ह sunk
data.md: Beholding those two of great prowess he could not make up his mind to remain there and the heart of that terrified monkey, sank.

data.v: चिन्तयित्वा स धर्मात्मा विमृश्य गुरुलाघवम् । सुग्रीवः परमोद्विग्नः सर्वैरनुचरैः सह ।।
data.es: Righteous Sugriva, became highly agitated, deliberated with all his followers on the pros and cons of the situation.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः सुग्रीवः Sugriva, चिन्तयित्वा reflecting, गुरुलाघवम् relative importance of consequences, विमृश्य analysed, सर्वैः with all, अनुचरैः सह with his followers, परमोद्विग्नः highly agitated
data.md: Pondering over what is more and what is less important the virtuous-souled Sugrīva became highly anxious along with that monkey-herd.

data.v: ततः स सचिवेभ्यस्तु सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः । शशंस परमोद्विग्नः पश्यंस्तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Sugriva, lord of monkeys, extremely agitated at the sight of both Rama and Lakshmana, spoke to his minister:
data.anv: ततः then, प्लवगाधिपः lord of monkeys, सः सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, पश्यन् seeing, परमोद्विग्नः extremely terrified, सचिवेभ्यः to his ministers, शशंस said
data.md: Beholding Rāma and Laksmana, Sugriva, the king of monkeys, greatly exercised with anxiety spoke to his counsellors, saying.

data.v: एतौ वनमिदं दुर्गं वालिप्रणिहितौ ध्रुवम् । छद्मना चीरवसनौ प्रचरन्ताविहागतौ ।।
data.anv: चीरवसनौ both wearing bark garments, छद्मना in cognito, दुर्गम् to a difficult place, इदं वनम् this forest, प्रचरन्तौ both wandering, एतौ these two, वालिप्रणिहितौ both sent by Vali, इह here, आगतौ have come, ध्रुवम् surely
data.md: Forsooth, these two heroes, in false guises and wearing bark, despatched by Vāli, have come here traversing the forest stronghold.

data.v: ततः सुग्रीवसचिवा दृष्ट्वा परमधन्विनौ । जग्मुर्गिरितटात्तस्मादन्यच्छिखरमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: On seeing these supreme bowmen, Sugriva's counsellers left for the peak of another mountain.
data.anv: ततः then, सुग्रीवसचिवाः Sugriva's counsellers, परमधन्विनौ supreme bowmen, दृष्ट्वा seeing, तस्मात् from that, गिरितटात् that mountain, उत्तमम् great, अन्यत् another, शिखरम् mountain peak, जग्मुः went
data.md: Beholding these two mighty archers the counsellors of Sugriva, quitting that mountainous expanse proceeded to another best of hills.

data.v: ते क्षिप्रमभिगम्याथ यूथपा यूथपर्षभम् । हरयो वानरश्रेष्ठं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे ।।
data.es: The leaders of the monkey troops reached Sugriva, the lord of monkeys, in no time and stood surrounding him.
data.anv: अथ then, यूथपाः leaders of troops, ते हरयः those monkeys, क्षिप्रम् quickly, अधिगम्य having reached, यूथपर्षभम् leaders of the group, वानरश्रेष्ठम् best of monkeys, परिवार्य having surrounded, उपतस्थिरे stood
data.md: Thereupon proceeding quickly the commanders of various monkey herds stood encircling the king of monkeys and the chief of · leaders.

data.v: एकमेकायनगताः प्लवमाना गिरेर्गिरिम् । प्रकम्पयन्तो वेगेन गिरीणां शिखराणि च ।।
data.es: Jumping from one mountain to another swiftly and shaking the mountain tops, the monkeys reached one spot.
data.anv: एवम् in that manner, गिरेः from one mountain, गिरिम् to another mountain, प्लवमानाः jumping, वेगेन swiftly, गिरीणाम् of the mountains, शिखराणि अपि tops also, प्रकम्पयन्तः shaking, एकायनगताः one place.

data.v: ततः शाखामृगाः सर्वे प्लवमाना महाबलाः । बभञ्जुश्च नगांस्तत्र पुष्पितान्दुर्गसंश्रितान् ।।
data.es: Then the mighty monkeys jumping on the trees in full bloom shook them.
data.anv: ततः then, प्लवमानाः jumping, महाबलाः  extremely strong, सर्वे all, शाखामृगाः monkeys, तत्र there, दुर्गम् संश्रितान् near hilly side, पुष्पितान् fully blossomed, नगान् trees, बभञ्जुः shattered
data.md: The monkeys thus sharing in the misery and happiness (of their chief) proceeded jumping from hill to hill shaking the summits thereof, with the velocity (of their persons). Thereupon those mighty monkeys, jumping, broke down the flowery trees of that stronghold.

data.v: आप्लवन्तो हरिवराः सर्वतस्तं महागिरिम् । मृगमार्जारशार्दूलांस्त्रासयन्तो ययुस्तदा ।।
data.es: The great monkeys went on leaping all over the great (Rishyamuka) mountain, scaring the deer, wildcats and tigers.
data.anv: हरिवराः the great monkeys, तम् them, महागिरिम् great mountain, सर्वतः all over, आप्लवन्तः jumping, तदा then, मृगमार्जारशार्दूलान् deer, wild cats and tigers, त्रासयन्तः scaring, ययुः went
data.md: Those best of monkeys, springing all around that mighty hill, proceeded terrifying the deer, the wild cats and the tigers.

data.v: ततः सुग्रीवसचिवाः पर्वतेन्द्रं समाश्रिताः । संगम्य कपिमुख्येन सर्वे प्राञ्जलयः स्थिताः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, all the ministers of Sugriva assembled together on the king of mountains and stood (in front of Sugriva), with folded hands.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सर्वे all, सुग्रीवसचिवाः Sugriva's ministers, पर्वतेन्द्रं king of mountains (Rishyamuka), समाहिताः collected together, कपिमुख्येन with the chief of monkeys, सङ्गम्य after assembling, प्राञ्जलयः with folded palms in reverence, स्थिताः stood.
data.md: Stationed on that best of mountains the ministers of Sugrīva, coming in the front of that monkey-chief, stood with clasped palms.

data.v: ततस्तं भयसंत्रस्तं वालिकिल्बिषशङ्कितम् । उवाच हनुमान्वाक्यं सुग्रीवं वाक्यकोविदः ।।
data.es: Suspecting that Vali might have sent them (Rama and Lakshmana), Hanuman, skilful in communication, said to Sugriva who was trembling in fear:
data.anv: ततः then, वाक्यकोविदः eloquent in speech, हनुमान् Hanuman, भयसंविग्नं shaken with fear, वालिकिल्बिषशङ्कितम् suspecting that Vali might have sent, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke
data.md: Thereupon Hanumān, skilled in speech, spoke to Sugrīva, terrified and afraid of Vāli's wicked wiles.

data.v: यस्मादुद्विग्नचेतास्त्वं प्रद्रुतो हरिपुंगव । तं क्रूरदर्शनं क्रूरं नेह पश्यामि वालिनम् ।।
data.es: 'O chief of monkeys I do not see here any sign of the cruel Vali, of whom you are afraid.
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गव O chief of monkeys, त्वम् yourself, यस्मात् due to whom, उद्विग्नचेताः frightened at heart, प्रद्रुतः running, तम् him, क्रूरदर्शनम् cruel figure, क्रूरम् cruel one, वालिनम् Vali, इह here, न पश्यामि, not see
data.md: I do not behold, O best of monkeys, that wicked Vāli of terrible looks, afraid of whom you had fled away and for whom you are anxious.

data.v: यस्मात्तव भयं सौम्य पूर्वजात्पापकर्मणः । स नेह वाली दुष्टात्मा न ते पश्याम्यहं भयम् ।।
data.es: 'O goodnatured Sugriva you are afraid of your elder brother Vali as he is evilminded and sinful. (But) I do not see any reason for you to be frightened as he is not found anywhere here.
data.anv: सौम्य O goodnatured, तव your, पापकर्मणः from the sinner, यस्मात् from whom, पूर्वजात् from elder brother, भयम् fear, सः he, दुष्टात्मा evilminded one, वाली Vali, इह here, न not, अहम् I, ते to you, भयम् fear, न पश्यामि  I do not see
data.md: I do not observe here, O gentle one, the wicked-souled Väli your elder brother of impious actions and whom you do fear and I do not perceive any terror proceeding from him.

data.v: अहो शाखामृगत्वं ते व्यक्तमेव प्लवंगम । लघुचित्ततयात्मानं न स्थापयसि यो मतौ ।।
data.es: 'Oh monkey, whoever is lilylivered cannot be steady. It is evident that your very nature as a monkey makes you restless.
data.anv: अहो Oh, प्लवङ्गम monkey, यः whoever, लघुचित्ततया  with low intellect, आत्मानम् oneself, मतौ in mind,न स्थापयसि  cannot be steady, ते to you, शाखामृगत्वम् monkeynature, व्यक्तमेव is very clear.
data.md: O monkey-chief, truly manifest is your monkey-hood and it is through your lightheartedness that you are incapable of fixing your soul.

data.v: बुद्धिविज्ञानसंपन्न इङ्गितैः सर्वमाचर । न ह्यबुद्धिं गतो राजा सर्वभूतानि शास्ति हि ।।
data.anv: बुद्धिविज्ञानसम्पन्नः one endowed with intelligence and knowledge, इङ्गितैः by gestures, सर्वम् everything, आचर you may do, अबुद्धिम् lack of intellect , गतः  reaches, राजा  king, सर्वभूतानि all beings, न शास्ति हि cannot control
data.md: Gifted with intellect and knowledge do you perforin all by means of gestures. A king void of sense cannot govern all creatures.

data.v: सुग्रीवस्तु शुभं वाक्यं श्रुत्वा सर्वं हनूमतः । ततः शुभतरं वाक्यं हनूमन्तमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Having heard the wise words of Hanuman, Sugriva addressed him with words more auspicious.
data.anv: सुग्रीवस्तु Sugriva also, हनूमतः Hanuman, शुभम् auspicious, सर्वं वाक्यम् all words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ततः then, हनूमन्तम् of Hanumanta, शुभतरम् even more auspicious, वाक्यम्  words,  उवाच ह he spoke
data.md: Hearing those pregnant words of Hanumār in its entirety, Sugrīva addressed to Hanumān in better accents.

data.v: दीर्घबाहू विशालाक्षौ शरचापासिधारिणौ । कस्य न स्याद्भयं दृष्ट्वा एतौ सुरसुतोपमौ ।।
data.es: 'Who would not be apprehensive of these two longarmed and largeeyed individuals comparable to sons of gods wielding arrows, bows and swords.
data.anv: दीर्घबाहू longarmed, विशालाक्षौ two largeeyed ones, शरचापासिधारिणौ two wielders of bow, arrows and sword, सुरसुतोपमौ both comparable to gods, एतौ they both, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कस्य  whose, भयम् fear, न स्यात् will not be created
data.md: Who is not terrified beholding those two mighty armed heroes, having expansive eyes, with bows, arrow, and daggers in their hands like to two sons of a celestial?

data.v: वालिप्रणिहितावेतौ शङ्केऽहं पुरुषोत्तमौ । राजानो बहुमित्राश्च विश्वासो नात्र हि क्षमः ।।
data.es: 'I support these two excellent men might have been sent by Vali. Kings have many friends and so it may not be appropriate to trust any king.
data.anv: पुरुषोत्तमौ two excellent men, वालिप्रणिहितौ एतौ have been sent by Vali,  अहम् I, शङ्के  doubt, राजानः kings, बहुमित्राः they have many friends, अत्र here, विश्वासः trust, न क्षमः not proper
data.md: Methinks these two best of men have been despatched by Vali. Kings have many friends. And it is not proper for me to place confidence in them.

data.v: अरयश्च मनुष्येण विज्ञेयाश्छन्नचारिणः । विश्वस्तानामविश्वस्ताश्छिद्रेषु प्रहरन्ति हि ।।
data.es: 'One has to identify these men roaming in disguise. These are not trustworthy and could even be our enemies, making us believe them so as to attack us when we are not vigilant.
data.anv: मनुष्येण by a man, छद्मचारिणः spies who move about in disguise, अरयः enemies, विज्ञेयाः    they should be identified, अविश्वस्ताः who do not trust, विश्वस्तानाम् of the trusting men, रन्ध्रेषु when we are not vigilant प्रहरन्ति, हि  will strike
data.md: People should know that enemies, always treacherous by nature, range under false guises. And those foes, availing of their credulity, bring about their destruction whenever opportunity presents itself.

data.v: कृत्येषु वाली मेधावी राजानो बहुदर्शनाः । भवन्ति परहन्तारस्ते ज्ञेयाः प्राकृतैर्नरैः ।।
data.es: 'Vali is wise in his actions. Kings employ many strategies to annihilate their enemies. Our gullible individuals should be able to detect them.
data.anv: वाली Vali, कृत्येषु in his actions, मेधावी wise, बहुदर्शिनः they have great vision, राजानः kings, परहन्तारः  they kill enemies, भवन्ति will be,  प्राकृतैः by ordinary ones, नरैः by men, ते to you, ज्ञेयाः they should be known
data.md: Vāli is eminently expert in despatching business. Monarchs, cognizant of many a wily expedient, bring about others' destruction. It is proper to discern them by means of disguised spies.

data.v: तौ त्वया प्राकृतेनैव गत्वा ज्ञेयौ प्लवंगम । शङ्कितानां प्रकारैश्च रूपव्याभाषणेन च ।।
data.es: 'O Hanuman assume an ordinary form and approach them. Try to read them through their gestures, traits, forms and conversations.
data.anv: प्लवङ्गम O Monkey, त्वया by you, प्राकृतेनैव by assuming an ordinary form, गत्वा going, तौ the two, इङ्गितानाम् their gestures, प्रकारैश्च by their traits, रूपव्याभाषणेन by  their form and conversation, ज्ञेयौ should be found out
data.md: O monkey, do you proceed under a false guise and come by their intentions, examining them aright by their countenances, gestures and words.

data.v: लक्षयस्व तयोर्भावं प्रहृष्टमनसौ यदि । विश्वासयन्प्रशंसाभिरिङ्गितैश्च पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys ascertain their purpose by praising them and studying their honest intentions. Gain the confidence of the wielders of bows and if you find them agreeable, enquire the purpose of their entering this forest.
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गव O best of monkeys, तयोः of both, भावम् intention, लक्षयस्व goal, प्रहृष्टमनसौ if they are pleasing in that ways, प्रशंसाभिः by praising them, इङ्गितैश्च by their signs, पुनः पुनः again and again, विश्वासयन् creating confidence, मम me, अभिमुखमेव favourable way only, स्थित्वा after making sure, धनुर्धरौ the two wielders of bows, अस्य वनस्य in this forest, प्रवेशस्य of entrance, प्रयोजनम् purpose, त्वम् you, पृच्छ  enquire
data.md: Do you ascertain their intention. If do you find them delighted, secure their confidence in my favour by eulogising me again and again and giving out to them my views.

data.v: ममैवाभिमुखं स्थित्वा पृच्छ त्वं हरिपुंगव । प्रयोजनं प्रवेशस्य वनस्यास्य धनुर्धरौ ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys ascertain their purpose by praising them and studying their honest intentions. Gain the confidence of the wielders of bows and if you find them agreeable, enquire the purpose of their entering this forest.
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गव O best of monkeys, तयोः of both, भावम् intention, लक्षयस्व goal, प्रहृष्टमनसौ if they are pleasing in that ways, प्रशंसाभिः by praising them, इङ्गितैश्च by their signs, पुनः पुनः again and again, विश्वासयन् creating confidence, मम me, अभिमुखमेव favourable way only, स्थित्वा after making sure, धनुर्धरौ the two wielders of bows, अस्य वनस्य in this forest, प्रवेशस्य of entrance, प्रयोजनम् purpose, त्वम् you, पृच्छ  enquire
data.md: O best of monkeys, do you ask them why they have entered this forest, if you do perceive that these two archers are pure souled.

data.v: शुद्धात्मानौ यदि त्वेतौ जानीहि त्वं प्लवंगम । व्याभाषितैर्वा रूपैर्वा विज्ञेया दुष्टतानयोः ।।
data.anv: प्लवङ्गम O best of monkey एतौ they both, शुद्धात्मानौ यदि if they are found trust worthy you, जानीहि you may know, तयोः with them, दुष्टाऽदुष्टता evil minded or otherwise, व्याभाषितैः with their talk, वा or, विजेया should be found out
data.md: O monkey, if you determine the fairness and unfairness of their purpose, their wickedness should be discovered by means of their gestures and conversation.

data.v: इत्येवं कपिराजेन संदिष्टो मारुतात्मजः । चकार गमने बुद्धिं यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Instructed thus by the king of the monkeys, Hanuman, son of the Windgod, decided to meet both Rama and Lakshmana.
data.anv: कपिराजेन by the king of monkeys, इत्येवम् in that manner, सन्दिष्टः having been instructed, मारुतात्मजः son of the windgod, तौ they both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, यत्र there, गमने to go, बुद्धिम् decision, चकार took
data.md: Being commanded by that chief of monkeys, the son of Maruta purposed to approach Rāma and Laksmana.

data.v: तथेति संपूज्य वचस्तु तस्य; कपेः सुभीतस्य दुरासदस्य । महानुभावो हनुमान्ययौ तदा; स यत्र रामोऽतिबलश्च लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the venerable, powerful and not easily conquerable monkey, honoured the words of the great Lord of the monkeys, offered salutations and said 'So be it'. And then proceeded towards the mighty Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वितीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the second sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महानुभावः highly respected, कपिः monkey, हनुमान् Hanuman, दुरासदस्य not easily conquerable, भीमस्य powerful, तस्य his, वचः words, तथेति so be it, सम्पूज्य offering salutation, अतिबल mighty, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सः राम that Rama, यत्र wherever, तदा then, ययौ went
data.md: Assenting to the words of the terrified and unconquerable Sugriva and saying 'Be it so, Hanumān, the high-souled monkey proceeded where the heroic Râma was with Lakşmaņa.

data.v: वचो विज्ञाय हनुमान्सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । पर्वतादृश्यमूकात्तु पुप्लुवे यत्र राघवौ ।।
data.es: Listening to great Sugriva, Hanuman leaped from mount Rishyamuka on to the location of the Raghavas.
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, महात्मनः great self, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, वचः words, विज्ञाय listening, ऋष्यमूकात् पर्वतात् from mountain Rishyamuka, राघवौ both (Rama and Lakshmana), यत्र where, पुप्लुवे leapt
data.md: Understanding the words of the high-souled Sugrīva, Hanumān, proceeded, springing, from the mount Rsyamūka, towards the descendants of Raghu.

data.v: स तत्र गत्वा हनुमान्बलवान्वानरोत्तमः । उपचक्राम तौ वाग्भिर्मृद्वीभिः सत्यविक्रमः ।।
स्वकं रूपं परित्यज्य भिक्षुरूपेण वानरः । आबभाषे च तौ वीरौ यथावत्प्रशशंस च ।।
राजर्षिदेवप्रतिमौ तापसौ संशितव्रतौ । देशं कथमिमं प्राप्तौ भवन्तौ वरवर्णिनौ ।।
data.es: 'You both fair in complexion, resemble royal sages or gods. You appear like ascetics and pursue vows in austerity. How come, you are present here, as if to frighten the animals and other creatures roaming this forest?
data.anv: राजर्षिदेवप्रतिमौ comparable to royal sages and gods, संशितव्रतौ strict followers of vows, तापसौ ascetics, वरवर्णिनौ of fair complexion, भवन्तौ you are, मृगान् animals, अन्यान् other, वनचारिणश्च creatures roaming the forest, त्रासयन्तौ frightening them, इमं देशम् this place, कथम् how, प्राप्तौ  come here?

data.v: त्रासयन्तौ मृगगणानन्यांश्च वनचारिणः । पम्पातीररुहान्वृक्षान्वीक्षमाणौ समन्ततः ।।
इमां नदीं शुभजलां शोभयन्तौ तरस्विनौ । धैर्यवन्तौ सुवर्णाभौ कौ युवां चीरवाससौ ।।
data.es: 'Gazing at the trees on the bank of Pampa, you both appear in brilliant complexion as if to enhance the beauty of the auspicious river water. Though young, courageous and with handsome shoulders, you seem to sigh in exhaustion. And though you look like ascetics robed in bark, you seem to terrify these creatures.
data.anv: पम्पातीररुहान् वृक्षान् trees on the bank of Pampa, समन्ततः all over, वीक्षमाणौ looking at, शुभजलाम् auspicious water, इमाम् this, नदीम् river, शोभयन्तौ enhancing the beauty, तपस्विनौ ascetics, धैर्यवन्तौ courageous, सुवर्णाभौ of golden complexion, चीरवाससौ robed in bark, निःश्वसन्तौ sighing, वरभुजौ with handsome shoulders, इमाः these, प्रजाः creatures, पीडयन्तौ terrifying, युवाम् youth

data.v: सिंहविप्रेक्षितौ वीरौ सिंहातिबलविक्रमौ । शक्रचापनिभे चापे प्रगृह्य विपुलैर्भुजैः ।।
data.es: 'Having the gaze of a lion, both of you are heroic in your stance. As each of you hold a bow resembling the rainbow, you seem to be mighty warriors eager to annihilate the enemies. With the valour of superior bulls and your shoulders resembling elephant's trunks, you look magnificent, handsome and brilliant. (No doubt,) you are the best among the humans.

data.v: प्रभया पर्वतेन्द्रोऽयं युवयोरवभासितः । राज्यार्हावमरप्रख्यौ कथं देशमिहागतौ ।।
data.es: 'You are young and radiant like the gods. This king of mountains (Rishyamuka) dazzles with your brilliance. Although you deserve to be sovereigns, how is it that you are here (into the forest)?
data.anv: अयम this, पर्वतेन्द्रः lord of mountains, युवयोः young, प्रभया  radiant, अवभासितः reflecting, राज्यार्हौ deserve to be sovereigns, अमरप्रख्यौ resembling gods, इह here, देशम् to this place, कथम् how, आगतौ  come

data.v: पद्मपत्रेक्षणौ वीरौ जटामण्डलधारिणौ । अन्योन्यसदृशौ वीरौ देवलोकादिवागतौ ।।
data.md: Having eyes resembling lotus-petals, heroic, wearing matted locks, resembling each other, have you come here from the celestial region?

data.v: यदृच्छयेव संप्राप्तौ चन्द्रसूर्यौ वसुंधराम् । विशालवक्षसौ वीरौ मानुषौ देवरूपिणौ ।।
data.es: 'Both of you appear alike, with eyes like lotus petals and locks of matted hair. You look like heroes descending from the world of the gods. You look like the Sun and the Moon dropped incidentally on this earth. With shoulders like those of a lion and the majesty of energetic bulls, you broadchested warriors appear like divine beings, though in fact humans.
data.anv: पद्मपत्रेक्षणौ having eyes like lotus petals, वीरौ  warriors, जटामण्डलधारिणौ with matted hair, अन्योन्यसदृशौ resembling each other, देवलोकात् from the world of gods, आगतौ have come here, वीरौ heroes, यदृच्छया incidentally, वसुन्धराम् to the earth, सम्प्राप्तौ come, चन्द्रसूर्याविव like Sun and Moon, विशालवक्षसौ broadchested, वीरौ warriors, देवरूपिणौ resembling gods, मानुषौ men, सिंहस्कन्धौ having shoulders like that of a lion, महोत्साहौ very energetic, समदौ majestic, गोवृषौ इव bullslike

data.v: सिंहस्कन्धौ महासत्त्वौ समदाविव गोवृषौ । आयताश्च सुवृत्ताश्च बाहवः परिघोत्तमाः । सर्वभूषणभूषार्हाः किमर्थं न विभूषितः ।।
data.es: 'Your long arms and spherelike shoulders appear as strong as iron clubs. Although they deserve to be decked with ornaments, how is it they are unadorned?
data.anv: आयताश्च long, सुवृत्ताश्च wellrounded, परिघोपमाः like the iron clubs, सर्वभूषणभूषार्हाः worthy of all ornaments, बाहवः shoulders, किमर्थम् why is it, न विभूषिताः not bedecked.

data.v: उभौ योग्यावहं मन्ये रक्षितुं पृथिवीमिमाम् । ससागरवनां कृत्स्नां विन्ध्यमेरुविभूषिताम् ।।
data.es: 'To me, you both deserve to rule the entire earth encompassed by seas and forests and adorned with mountains like Vindhya and Meru.
data.anv: उभौ both, अहम् I, इमाम् this, ससागरवनाम् with seas and forests, विन्ध्यमेरुविभूषिताम् adorned with mountains of Vindhya and Meru, कृत्स्नाम् entire, पृथिवीम् earth, रक्षितुम् to rule, योग्यौ fit, मन्ये I think

data.v: इमे च धनुषी चित्रे श्लक्ष्णे चित्रानुलेपने । प्रकाशेते यथेन्द्रस्य वज्रे हेमविभूषिते ।।
data.es: 'Smeared with wonderful unguents, (your) bows look very attractive. And they glow very much like Indra's golden thunderbolt.
data.anv: चित्रे wonderful, श्लक्ष्णे attractive ones, चित्रानुलेपने smeared with wonderful unguents, इमे धनुषी च both these bows too, इन्द्रस्य Indra's, हेमविभूषिते decorated with gold, वज्रे यथा like thunderbolt, प्रकाशेते glow
data.md: These your painted and smooth bows appear like to the thunder-bolts of Indra adorned with gold.

data.v: संपूर्णा निशितैर्बाणैर्तूणाश्च शुभदर्शनाः । जीवितान्तकरैर्घोरैर्ज्वलद्भिरिव पन्नगैः ।।
data.es: '(Your) quivers also appear beautiful, for they are fully filled with sharp and deadly arrows which look like the hissing of dreadful snakes
data.anv: शुभदर्सनाः beautiful to look at, तूणाश्च quivers also, जीवितान्तकरैः those which can put an end to life, घोरैः with terrible, श्श्वसद्भिरिव like hissing, पन्नगैरिव snakes, बाणैः with arrows, सम्पूर्णाश्च  totally filled with
data.md: And these beautiful quivers are filled to the brim with sharpened and deadly shafts like to flaming fire and serpents.

data.v: महाप्रमाणौ विपुलौ तप्तहाटकभूषितौ । खड्गावेतौ विराजेते निर्मुक्तभुजगाविव ।।
data.es: '(Your) long and broad swords appear very huge in size. Being encrusted with pure gold, they glitter brilliant like snakes in hyberation.
data.anv: महाप्रमाणौ of huge size, विस्तीर्णौ long and broad, तप्तहाटकभूषितौ encrusted with shining pure gold, एतौ these two, खडगौ swords, निर्मुक्ताविव पन्नगौ like the snakes that have shed their sloughs, विराजेते shine
data.md: And these two daggers, of mighty proportions, furnished with burning gold, appear like to serpents, let loose.

data.v: एवं मां परिभाषन्तं कस्माद्वै नाभिभाषथः ।।
सुग्रीवो नाम धर्मात्मा कश्चिद्वानरयूथपः । वीरो विनिकृतो भ्रात्रा जगद्भ्रमति दुःखितः ।।
data.es: 'Why are you silent while I am talking? (I am here to apprise ) about a great and righteous warrior Sugriva, the chief of the troop of monkeys, sadly wandering all over the land here, banished by his brother
data.anv: एवम् in that way, परिभाषन्तम् talking to you, माम् to me, कस्मात् why, नाभिभाषथः  not replying, सुग्रीवो नाम Sugriva by name, वीरः warrior, धर्मात्मा righteous, कश्चित् some one, वानरयूथपः chief of monkeys, भ्रात्रा by brother, विनिकृतः is aggrieved, दुःखितः grieved, जगत् world over, स भ्रमति roaming about
data.md: Why do you not answer me accosting you thus? A certain heroic and virtuous monkeychief, by name Sugrīva, has been journeying on this carth, distressed at heart, being driven away by his brother.

data.v: प्राप्तोऽहं प्रेषितस्तेन सुग्रीवेण महात्मना । राज्ञा वानरमुख्यानां हनुमान्नाम वानरः ।।
data.es: 'I am a monkey called Hanuman. I am here sent by great king Sugriva, the best of monkeys.
data.anv: महात्मना by the great, वानरमुख्यानाम् best of monkeys, राज्ञा by the king, तेन सुग्रीवेण by such Sugriva, प्रेषितः I am sent, प्राप्तः came here, अहम् I, हनुमान्नाम Hanuman, वानरः monkey
data.md: I have come here being despatched by that high-souled Sugriva-my name is Hanuman, the foremost of monkeys.

data.v: युवाभ्यां सह धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवः सख्यमिच्छति । तस्य मां सचिवं वित्तं वानरं पवनात्मजम् ।।
data.es: 'The righteous Sugriva wishes to make friendship with both of you. For his wellbeing I came here disguised as a mendicant from Rishyamuka mountain. I am a monkey, son of the Windgod and minister to Sugriva. I can assume any form at my free will and go anywhere I like'.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous , सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, युवाभ्याम् with you both, सख्यम friendship, इच्छति desires, माम् myself, सुग्रीवप्रियकाम्यया for the wellbeing of Sugriva, भिक्षुरूपप्रतिच्छन्नम् disguised like a mendicant, तस्य his, सचिवम् minister, ऋष्यमूकात् from  Rishyamuka, इह here, प्राप्तम् reached, कामगम् can go whereever I desire, कामरूपिणम् can assume whatever form I desire, पवनात्मजम् son of the windgod, वानरम् monkey, वित्तम् you  may know
data.md: That virtuous souled Sugrīva desires to make friends with you. And know me to be his counsellor-a monkey, the son of Pavana, ranging every where at my will, coming here, under the guise of a mendicant, from the mount Rsymuka, for the welfare of Sugriva.

data.v: भिक्षुरूपप्रतिच्छन्नं सुग्रीवप्रियकाम्यया । ऋश्यमूकादिह प्राप्तं कामगं कामरूपिणम् ।।
data.es: 'The righteous Sugriva wishes to make friendship with both of you. For his wellbeing I came here disguised as a mendicant from Rishyamuka mountain. I am a monkey, son of the Windgod and minister to Sugriva. I can assume any form at my free will and go anywhere I like'.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous , सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, युवाभ्याम् with you both, सख्यम friendship, इच्छति desires, माम् myself, सुग्रीवप्रियकाम्यया for the wellbeing of Sugriva, भिक्षुरूपप्रतिच्छन्नम् disguised like a mendicant, तस्य his, सचिवम् minister, ऋष्यमूकात् from  Rishyamuka, इह here, प्राप्तम् reached, कामगम् can go whereever I desire, कामरूपिणम् can assume whatever form I desire, पवनात्मजम् son of the windgod, वानरम् monkey, वित्तम् you  may know

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु हनुमांस्तौ वीरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । वाक्यज्ञौ वाक्यकुशलः पुनर्नोवाच किंचन ।।
data.es: The eloquent Hanuman, having spoken thus to both Rama and Lakshmana, good at speaking, said no more.
data.anv: वाक्यज्ञौ good at speaking, वाक्यकुशलः eloguent, हनुमान् Hanuman, वीरौ two heroes, तौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, पुनः again, किञ्चन anything more, नोवाच did not speak
data.md: Having addressed thus those two heroes-Rama and Laksmana, Hanuman, conversant with words and skilled in speech, did not speak again.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् । प्रहृष्टवदनः श्रीमान्भ्रातरं पार्श्वतः स्थितम् ।।
data.es: Having heard him, the Illustrious Rama cheerfully said to brother Lakshmana standing nearby:
data.anv: श्रीमान् Illustrious, रामः Rama, तस्य his, एतत् all that, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रहृष्टवदनः with cheerful face, पार्श्वतः nearby, स्थितम् stood, भ्रातरम् brother, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing those words, the effulgent Rāma, with a delighted countenance, spoke to his younger brother, Laksmana-~-sitting by him.

data.v: सचिवोऽयं कपीन्द्रस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । तमेव काङ्क्षमाणस्य ममान्तिकमुपागतः ।।
data.es: 'Here is minister to Sugriva, the great chief of monkeys whom I wish to see.
data.anv: कपीन्द्रस्य of the lord of monkeys, महात्मनः of great self, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, सचिवः minister, अयम् this, तमेव him only, काङ्क्षमाणस्य as I wish to see, मम to me, समीपम् near by, इह here, आगतः has come
data.md: He is the counsellor of the high-souled Sugriva, the lord of monkeys and has approached me, soliciting my friendship in his (Sugriva's) favour.

data.v: तमभ्यभाष सौमित्रे सुग्रीवसचिवं कपिम् । वाक्यज्ञं मधुरैर्वाक्यैः स्नेहयुक्तमरिंदमम् ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri, conqueror of enemies this monkey, Sugriva's minister, is skilled in friendly communication. Reply to him in words gentle and sweet.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, वाक्यज्ञम् knows how to talk, स्नेहयुक्तम् in a friendly way, अरिन्दमम् conqueror of enemies, सुग्रीवसचिवम् Sugriva's minister, तं कपिम् this monkey, मधुरैः pleasant, वाक्यैः words, अभिभाषस्व  reply well .
data.md: Do you welcome, with pleasant words, O Saumitri, this monkey-Sugrīva's minister, the subduer of foes, affectionate and skilled in speech.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टो हनुमान्कृत्यवानिति तद्वचः । श्रुत्वा मधुरसंभाषं सुग्रीवं मनसा गतः ।।
data.es: After listening to the sweet words of Lakshmana, Hanuman, having done what he had to do felt happy and thought of Sugriva.
data.anv: ततः then, कृत्यवान्  who has done his duty, हनुमान् Hanuman, इति thus, तद्वचः his words, श्रुत्वा having heard, मधुरसम्भाषं च and sweet talk, प्रहृष्टः glad, मनसा at heart, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, गतः about
data.md: Hearing those words (of Rāma) and learning his amicable feeling (in relation to Sugrīva) as also, seeing that Rāma was willing to assist Sugrīva, Hanuman, getting exceedingly delighted, remembered Sugrīva.

data.v: भव्यो राज्यागमस्तस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । यदयं कृत्यवान्प्राप्तः कृत्यं चैतदुपागतम् ।।
data.es: The great Sugriva, thinks Hanuman, who had done his duty is likely to acquire his kingdom, because great Rama who would help in the work of Sugriva has also come.'
data.anv: महात्मनः great self, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य that Sugriva's, राज्यागमः acquisition of kingdom, भव्यः is likely to happen, यत् since, कृत्यवान्  one who has done his duty, अयम् this, प्राप्तः got, एतत् this, कृतं च and has work, उपागतम् has come
data.md: Since this one of successful acts has been come by and also this business is in hand, the high-souled Sugrīva will most probably obtain the monarchy.

data.v: ततः परमसंहृष्टो हनूमान्प्लवगर्षभः । प्रत्युवाच ततो वाक्यं रामं वाक्यविशारदः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the best of the monkeys, learned in conversation, felt extremely happy and enquired from Rama:
data.anv: ततः then, परमसंहृष्टः extremely happy, प्लवगोत्तमः best of monkeys, हनुमान् Hanuman, ततः then,वाक्यविशारदम् learned in converasation, रामम् Rama's, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच  enquired
data.md: Then transported with joy, that foremost of monkeys, Hanumān, in these words, replied to Rāma, deft in speech, saying,

data.v: किमर्थं त्वं वनं घोरं पम्पाकाननमण्डितम् । आगतः सानुजो दुर्गं नानाव्यालमृगायुतम् ।।
data.es: 'Why have you come with your brother to this dreadful, inaccessible forest surrounding Pampa, full of different varieties of serpents and wild animals?'
data.anv: सानुजः accompanied by your brother, पम्पाकाननमण्डितम् woods surrounding Pampa, दुर्गम् inaccessible, नानाव्यालमृगायुतम् full of different kinds of serpents and wild animals, घोरम् dreadful, वनम् forest, किमर्थम् why, आगतः came here?
data.md: Why is it, thất accompanied with your younger brother, have you come to this dense and trackless forest, garnished with the woodlands of Pampā, and filled with various kinds of ferocious beasts?

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणो रामचोदितः । आचचक्षे महात्मानं रामं दशरथात्मजम् ।।
data.es: Having listened to Hanuman, and urged by Rama, Lakshmana told him about the great Rama, son of Dasaratha.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तस्य his, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, रामचोदितः urged by Rama, महात्मानम् great soul, दशरथात्मजम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् Rama, आचचक्षे narrated
data.md: Hearing those words of his, Laksmana, directed by Råma, informed (Hanumān) of all about Rama, the son of Dasaratha.

data.v: राजा दशरथो नाम द्युतिमान्धर्मवत्सलः । तस्यायं पूर्वजः पुत्रो रामो नाम जनैः श्रुतः ।।
data.es: 'Indeed in the Ikshvaku family there will be a king named Dasaratha. He will beget a brilliant son named Rama.
data.anv: द्युतिमान् brilliant, धर्मवत्सलः lover of dharma, चातुर्वर्ण्यम् four classes, नित्यमेव always, स्वधर्मेण  his duty, अभ्यपालयत् ruled, दशरथो नाम named Dasaratha, राजा king
data.md: There was a king named Dasaratha endued with the prowess of a celestial. I am his eldest son known among men by the name of Rāma.

data.v: शरण्यः सर्वभूतानां पितुर्निर्देशपारगः । वीरो दशरथस्यायं पुत्राणां गुणवत्तरः ।।
data.md: He is the refuge of all creatures, and competent to carry out the injunctions of his father. The eldest son of Dasaratha, he is foremost of all his sons in merit.

data.v: राज्याद्भ्रष्टो वने वस्तुं मया सार्धमिहागतः । भार्यया च महातेजाः सीतयानुगतो वशी । दिनक्षये महातेजाः प्रभयेव दिवाकरः ।।
data.es: 'This glorious Rama was followed by his wife, Sita, like the rays of the effulgent Sun follow him to the end of the day.
data.anv: महातेजाः glorious one, वशी selfcontrolled, दिनक्षये at the end of the day, दिवाकरः Sun, प्रभयेव with radiance, भार्यया  with wife, सीतया with Sita, अनुगतः followed
data.md: And, O highly exalted one, this one of subdued senses is followed by his wife Sītā even as the decline of day the exceedingly effulgent Sun is followed by (his spouse) Splendour.

data.v: अहमस्यावरो भ्राता गुणैर्दास्यमुपागतः । कृतज्ञस्य बहुज्ञस्य लक्ष्मणो नाम नामतः ।।
data.es: 'I am his younger brother, called Lakshmana. I have accepted the service of this learned, virtuous and grateful man.
data.anv: अहम् I am, कृतज्ञस्य of the grateful man, बहुज्ञस्य of a wellversed man, अस्य his, गुणैः by virtues, दास्यम् servitude, उपागतः has accepted, अवरः younger, भ्राता brother, नामतः  name, लक्ष्मणो नाम called Lakshmana
data.md: I am the younger brother of this one endued with gratitude and of various lore. Subdued by his virtues, I, Laksimana by name, have dedicated myself to his service.

data.v: सुखार्हस्य महार्हस्य सर्वभूतहितात्मनः । ऐश्वर्येण विहीनस्य वनवासाश्रितस्य च ।।
data.es: 'This man who should have lived in comfort and in reverence, one who was worthy of all the wellwishers lost his wealth and was banished into the forest. He is now deprived of his wife kidnapped by an unknown demon who could assume any form at will.

data.es: 'This man who should have lived in comfort and in reverence, one who was worthy of all the wellwishers lost his wealth and was banished into the forest. He is now deprived of his wife kidnapped by an unknown demon who could assume any form at will.
data.anv: सुखार्हस्य  deserved comforts, महार्हस्य worthy  of reverence, सर्वभूतहितात्मनः wellwisher of all beings, ऐश्वर्येण by wealth, विहीनस्य deprived, वनवासे dwelling in the forest, रतस्य of a man engaged, भार्या wife, रहिते when we were not present2 2सा she, कामरूपिणा who can assume any form at will, रक्षसा by a demon, अपहृता kidnapped, येन वा or by whomsoever,  अस्य his, भार्या wife, हृता has been stolen, तत् that, रक्षः rakshasa, न ज्ञायते is not known
data.md: Worthy of happiness, homage, and intent upon the welfare of all beings, deprived of wealth and living in the forest, he has his wife carried off by a Rākşasa, wearing shapes at will. Nor have we yet (been able) to ascertain who is that Rākşasa that has carried off his wife.

data.v: दनुर्नाम श्रियः पुत्रः शापाद्राक्षसतां गतः । आख्यातस्तेन सुग्रीवः समर्थो वानराधिपः ।।
data.es: 'Diti's son called Danu who had been cursed to live the life of a demon had said that Sugriva, the best among monkeys, would be able to locate her.
data.anv: दितेः Diti's, पुत्रः a son, शापात् by curse, राक्षसताम् as a demon, गतः became, दनुः नाम called Danu, तेन by him, वानरर्षभः the bull among monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, समर्थः capable, आख्यातः had said
data.md: A son of Diti named Danu, had, by virtue of an imprecation, undergone Raksasa-hood. He it is who had related to us all about the capable Sugrīva.—That exceedingly puissant one shall have a knowledge of the ravisher of your wife? Having said this, Danu beaming (with a halo) went to heaven.

data.v: स ज्ञास्यति महावीर्यस्तव भार्यापहारिणम् । एवमुक्त्वा दनुः स्वर्गं भ्राजमानो गतः सुखम् ।।
data.es: 'That Valiant Sugriva can spot the demon who has abducted your wife', said Danu and disappeared happily into heaven shining in brilliance.
data.anv: महावीर्यः valiant one, सः he, तव your, भार्यापहारिणम्  who has stolen your wife, ज्ञास्यति will know, दनुः Danu, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, भ्राजमानः glowing away, स्वर्गम् heaven, सुखम् happily, गतः went
data.md: A son of Diti named Danu, had, by virtue of an imprecation, undergone Raksasa-hood. He it is who had related to us all about the capable Sugrīva.—That exceedingly puissant one shall have a knowledge of the ravisher of your wife? Having said this, Danu beaming (with a halo) went to heaven.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं याथातथ्येन पृच्छतः । अहं चैव हि रामश्च सुग्रीवं शरणं गतौ ।।
data.es: 'I have given a factual account of everything, since you asked me. Now Rama and I have arrived seeking Sugriva's shelter.
data.anv: पृच्छतः since you asked, ते you, एतत् that, सर्वम् every event, यथा तथ्येन  in fact, आख्यातम् said, अहं चैव and I also, रामश्च Rama too, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva's, शरणम् refuge, गतौ both arrived
data.md: Thus have 1 related to you all as it fell out. Both Rāma and myself have saught the shelter of Sugriva.

data.v: एष दत्त्वा च वित्तानि प्राप्य चानुत्तमं यशः । लोकनाथः पुरा भूत्वा सुग्रीवं नाथमिच्छति ।।
data.es: 'Having earned supreme fame through his munificence in the past, this lord of the world now craves Sugriva's indulgence.
data.anv: एषः this person, वित्तानि wealth, दत्त्वा च and gifting , अनुत्तमम् excellence ,यशः fame, प्राप्य च having obtained, पुरा earlier, लोकनाथः lord of the world, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, नाथम् king, इच्छति wishes
data.md: Having given away profuse wealth and attained high fame, this one who formerly was the lord of the worlds, now wishes to make Sugrīva his master.

data.v: शोकाभिभूते रामे तु शोकार्ते शरणं गते । कर्तुमर्हति सुग्रीवः प्रसादं सह यूथपैः ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva, lord of monkeys, ought to help Rama who tormented by, and overwhelmed with, grief seeks his favour.'
data.anv: हरियूधप: lord of monkeys, शोकाभिभूते one who is overcome by grief, शोकार्ते one who is pained  by sorrow, शरणं गते when he sought refuge, रामे to Rama, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रसादम्  favour कर्तुम् to render, अर्हति deserves
data.md: On Rāma being overwhelmed with sorrow, tried by grief, and having come under his refuge,' it behoveth Sugrīva along with the leaders of bands to show favour to Rāma?

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणं सौमित्रिं करुणं साश्रुपातनम् । हनूमान्प्रत्युवाचेदं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः ।।
data.es: To Saumitri who was speaking thus in a piteous tone, his eyes filled with tears the eloquent Hanuman replied:
data.anv: करुणम् piteously, साश्रुलोचनम् eyes filled with tears, एवम् that way, ब्रुवाणम् while speaking, सौमित्रिम् to Saumithri, वाक्यविशारदः an erudite speaker, हनुमान् Hanuman, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied back
data.md: When Sumitrā's son shedding tears had spoken thus, that one skilled in speech, Hanumān, answered in these words, 'Persons of such a stamp, endued with understanding, of controlled anger and subdued senses, should be seen by the master of monkeys, and such come within one's ken through blessed luck.

data.v: ईदृशा बुद्धिसंपन्ना जितक्रोधा जितेन्द्रियाः । द्रष्टव्या वानरेन्द्रेण दिष्ट्या दर्शनमागताः ।।
data.es: 'It is a matter of great fortune that you who have intelligence, control over your senses and conquered anger have come to see the lord of monkeys who needs instead, to approach you.
data.anv: बुद्धिसम्पन्नाः highly intelligent, जितक्रोधाः who have conquered anger, जितेन्द्रियाः who have 2 2conquered senses, दिष्ट्या luckily, दर्शनम् to see, आगताः came here, ईदृशाः such men, वानरेन्द्रेण by king of vanaras, द्रष्टव्या deserve to be approached
data.md: When Sumitrā's son shedding tears had spoken thus, that one skilled in speech, Hanumān, answered in these words, 'Persons of such a stamp, endued with understanding, of controlled anger and subdued senses, should be seen by the master of monkeys, and such come within one's ken through blessed luck.

data.v: स हि राज्याच्च विभ्रष्टः कृतवैरश्च वालिना । हृतदारो वने त्रस्तो भ्रात्रा विनिकृतो भृशम् ।।
data.es: '(In fact) seriously offended by his brother Vali who treated him like his enemy and expelled him from the kingdom. He is now abandoned in the forest, his wife hijacked.
data.anv: वालिना by Vali, कृतवैरः developed enmity, भ्रात्रा by his brother, हृतदारः deprived of his wife, भृशम् strongly, विनिकृतः is offended, राज्यात् from the kingdom, विभ्रष्टः thrown out, सः he, त्यक्त: is abandoned, वने in the forest
data.md: He also has been driven out of his kingdom, and has incurred the hostility of Vali. And his wife torn away from him, he dwelleth in this wood, in fear, having been exceedingly harassed by his brother.

data.v: करिष्यति स साहाय्यं युवयोर्भास्करात्मजः । सुग्रीवः सह चास्माभिः सीतायाः परिमार्गणे ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva, son of the Sungod, along with us will extend all help to you, in your search for Sita.'
data.anv: भास्करात्मजः son of the Sungod, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अस्माभिः सह along with us, सीतायाः Sita's, परिमार्गणे in search of, युवयोः for both of you, साहाय्यम् help, करिष्यति he will do
data.md: That son of the Sun, Sugriva, along with us, will help you in seeking out Sītā.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा हनुमाञ्श्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा । बभाषे सोऽभिगच्छामः सुग्रीवमिति राघवम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, having spoken with sweet, gentle words said to the Raghavas, 'We will now go to Sugriva'.
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, मधुरया sweetly, गिरा with words, इत्येवम् like that, श्लक्ष्णम् gently, उक्त्वा having said, साधु well done, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अभिगच्छेम we will go, इति thus, राघवम् Raghava, बभाषे spoke
data.md: Having said these sweet and hurried words, Hanuman said to Rāghava, 'I will (now) repair to Sugriva.'

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणं धर्मात्मा हनूमन्तं स लक्ष्मणः । प्रतिपूज्य यथान्यायमिदं प्रोवाच राघवम् ।।
data.es: Having offered reverential salutations to Hanuman as per tradition, righteous Lakshmana now spoke to Rama:
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः लक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, ब्रुवाणम् as he spoke, हनुमन्तम् to Hanuman, यथान्यायम् as per tradition, प्रतिपूज्य  offered salutation, राघवम् Raghava, इदम् this, प्रोवाच spoke
data.md: When Hanumān had said this, the righteous Lakşmaņa duly paying homage to the former, addressed Rāghava, saying.

data.v: कपिः कथयते हृष्टो यथायं मारुतात्मजः । कृत्यवान्सोऽपि संप्राप्तः कृतकृत्योऽसि राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Raghava this monkey, son of the Windgod appears pleased as evident from his words. As he is a man of action, take your work as accomplished now.
data.anv: राघव Rama, मारुतात्मजः son of the windgod, अयं कपिः this monkey, हृष्टः a pleased one, यथा as, कथयते he is telling, सोऽपि he also, कृत्यवान् a person of action, सम्प्राप्तः has come, कृतकृत्यः  accomplished, असि you are
data.md: From the glad way in which this son of the god of the wind is speaking, it appears that he also seeks your service; and, arriving (at this region) you also, Rāghava, have reaped success.

data.v: प्रसन्नमुखवर्णश्च व्यक्तं हृष्टश्च भाषते । नानृतं वक्ष्यते वीरो हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: 'It is evident from his words and from his cheerful face that Hanuman is pleased. (I know that) this heroic son of the Windgod will never tell a lie'.
data.anv: व्यक्तम् it is evident, प्रसन्नमुखवर्णश्च he has a cheerful face, हृष्टश्च he is pleased, भाषते  words, मारुतात्मजः son of the windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, अनृतम् lie, न वक्ष्यते will not tell
data.md: He speaketh openly with a delightful light in his countenance; and cheerfulness. (It seems) that the heroic Hanuman, son to the God of wind does not speak anything that is false.

data.v: ततः स तु महाप्राज्ञो हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । जगामादाय तौ वीरौ हरिराजाय राघवौ ।।
data.es: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, endowed with great wisdom carried both the Raghava warriors to the king of monkeys.
data.anv: ततः then, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, मारुतात्मजः son of the windgod, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, वीरौ   warrior heroes, तौ राघवौ both Raghavas, हरिराजाय to the king of monkeys, आदाय led them, जगाम went
data.md: Then that vastly wise one Hanumān the son of the wind god departed, taking with him the heroic descendants of Raghu, for (presenting them) to the monarch of monkeys.

data.v: स तु विपुल यशाः कपिप्रवीरः; पवनसुतः कृतकृत्यवत्प्रहृष्टः । गिरिवरमुरुविक्रमः प्रयातः; स शुभमतिः सह रामलक्ष्मणाभ्याम् ।।
data.es: The son of the Windgod, the most valiant, the supremely heroic monkey and the one welladmired, having performed his task, felt immensely happy.And with an auspicious feeling, departed for the great mountain (Rishyamuka) along with Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किंधाकाण्डे चतुर्थस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: विपुलयशाः highly renowned, कपिप्रवीरः most heroic monkey, सः पवनसुतः son of the windgod, कृतकृत्यवत् having done his duty, प्रहृष्टः gladly, शुभमतिः with auspicious feeling, उरुविक्रमः renowned for his valiance, सः he, रामलक्ष्मणाभ्यां सह with Rama and Lakshmana, गिरिवरम् to the great mountain, प्रयातः departed.
data.md: Then the heroic monkey, the son of the windgod, of wide fame, and great prowess, with his mind perfectly pure, considering himself as crowned with success, and experiencing exceeding delight, arrived at that best of mountains in company with Rāma and Laks mana.

data.v: ऋश्यमूकात्तु हनुमान्गत्वा तं मलयं गिरम् । आचचक्षे तदा वीरौ कपिराजाय राघवौ ।।
data.es: Leaving Rishyamuka, Hanuman reached the Malaya mountain. Seeing the chief of monkeys there, he announced the arrival of the heroic Raghavas.
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, ऋष्यमूकात् from Rishyamuka, मलयं Malaya, गिरिम् mountain, गत्वा on going, कपिराजाय to the lord of the monkeys, तदा then, वीरौ the two heroes, राघवौ Raghavas, आचचक्षे  seeing announced (the arrival)
data.md: Having departed from Rşyamuka, and arrived at the Malaya hill, Hanumān informed the king of monkeys of (the arrival of) the descendants of Raghu.

data.v: अयं रामो महाप्राज्ञः संप्राप्तो दृढविक्रमः । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा रामोऽयं सत्यविक्रमः ।।
data.es: 'This Rama of greatwisdom and valour, endowed with the power of truth has arrived here along with his brother Lakshmana.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञः very wise, दृढविक्रम: unfailing in valour, अयं रामः this Rama, भ्रात्रा with brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, सम्प्राप्तः has arrived, अयं रामः this Rama, सत्यविक्रमः  endowed with the power of truth
data.md: O exceedingly wise one, this one that has come here is Rāma having truth for his prowess.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातो रामो दशरथात्मजः । धर्मे निगदितश्चैव पितुर्निर्देशपालकः ।।
data.es: 'Born in the Ikshvaku race Rama Dasaratha's son, distinguished for his righteousness is here to carry out the orders of his father.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvakus, कुले in the race, जातः he is born, दशरथात्मजः Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, धर्मे in righteousness, निगदितश्चैव is noteworthy, पितुः father's, निर्देशपारगः
data.md: This is Rāma having truth for his prowess, in company with his brother, Lakşmaņa. Rāma the son of Dasaratha, is born in the race of the Ikş wākus. Ever doing the will of his sire, he has been sent hither, in order that his father's verity may stand in tact.

data.v: तस्यास्य वसतोऽरण्ये नियतस्य महात्मनः । रक्षसापहृता भार्या स त्वां शरणमागतः ।।
data.es: 'While the great Rama armed with selfrestraint was living in the forest, his wife was abducted by Ravana. So he has come to you seeing refuge.

data.v: तान्यस्माभिर्गृहीतानि निहितानि च राघव । आनयिष्याम्यहं तानि प्रत्यभिज्ञातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'Rama, we have kept them safely. I will fetch them so that you should be able to identify them.'
data.anv: राघव Rama, तानि those, अस्माभिः by us, गृहीतानि collected, निहितानि च and kept safely, अहम् I, तानि them, आनयिष्यामि will get, प्रत्यभिज्ञातुम् recognise them, अर्हसि you ought to
data.md: All these, O Rāghava, I have taken and kept (with me). I will bring them. It behoveth you to recognise them.

data.v: तमब्रवीत्ततो रामः सुग्रीवं प्रियवादिनम् । आनयस्व सखे शीघ्रं किमर्थं प्रविलम्बसे ।।
data.es: Rama then said to Sugriva, one who used pleasing words, 'O my friend why delay? Get them here immediately'.
data.anv: ततः then, रामः Rama, प्रियवादिनम् a man of pleasant word, तं सुग्रीवम् that Sugriva, अब्रवीत् said, सखे O friend, शीघ्रम् quickly, आनयस्व you may get, किमर्थम् why do you, प्रविलम्बसे delay
data.md: There upon Rāma spoke to the sweetspeeched Sugrīva, 'Bring (them), at once, my friend. Why did you tarry?'

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवः शैलस्य गहनां गुहाम् । प्रविवेश ततः शीघ्रं राघवप्रियकाम्यया ।।
data.es: On hearing this, Sugriva at once entered into the deep cave of the mountain (to get the ornaments and veil) in order to please Rama.
data.anv: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having asked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, ततः then, राघवप्रियकाम्यया to make Rama happy, शैलस्य mountain's, गहनाम् deep, गुहाम् cave, शीघ्रम् at once, प्रविवेश entered
data.md: Having been thus addressed, Sugrīva swiftly entered a deep cavern in the mountain, with the view of doing what was dear to Rāghava. Then taking the scarf as well as the ornaments. Look at this, (Saying this) the monkey held them before Rāma.

data.v: उत्तरीयं गृहीत्वा तु शुभान्याभरणानि च । इदं पश्येति रामाय दर्शयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: That monkey brought out the veil and auspicios ornaments, showed them to Rama and said, 'Please, see.'
data.anv: (सः) वानरः that monkey, उत्तरीयम् veil, तानि those, आभरणानि च and ornaments, गृहीत्वा after taking, इदम् this, पश्य see, इति thus, रामाय to Rama, दर्शयामास showed

data.v: ततो गृहीत्वा तद्वासः शुभान्याभरणानि च । अभवद्बाष्पसंरुद्धो नीहारेणेव चन्द्रमाः ।।
data.es: Holding the raiment as well as the ornaments, Rama's eyes were filled with tears.He appeared like the Moon covered with dews.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, वासः raiment, शुभानि auspicious, आभरणानि च ornaments, गृहीत्वा holding, नीहारेण with dew, चन्द्रमाः इव like the Moon, बाष्पसंरुद्धः filled with tears, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Taking the sheet and the ornaments, (Rama) had his ayes filled with tears, like the moon covered by the dew.

data.v: सीतास्नेहप्रवृत्तेन स तु बाष्पेण दूषितः । हा प्रियेति रुदन्धैर्यमुत्सृज्य न्यपतत्क्षितौ ।।
data.es: On account of his deep attachment for Sita, he shed profuse tears. Unable to maintain his natural composure, he sank down to the ground, saying 'O my darling Sita' and cried inconsolably
data.anv: सः he, तु too, सीतास्नेहप्रवृत्तेन  on account of his deep love for Sita, बाष्पेण with tears, दूषितः affllicted, धैर्यम् patience, उत्सृज्य  failed to maintain, हा प्रियेति Oh darling, रुदन्  crying, क्षितौ on the ground, न्यपतत् fell
data.md: From affection for Sītā, (Rāma,) his eyes filled with tears, deprived of patience, fell down to the ground.

data.v: हृदि कृत्वा स बहुशस्तमलंकारमुत्तमम् । निशश्वास भृशं सर्पो बिलस्थ इव रोषितः ।।
data.es: Pressing the excellent ornaments to his bosom again and again Rama hissed like a cobra provoked in its anthill.
data.anv: सः he, उत्तमम् excellent, तम् अलङ्कारम् her ornaments, बहुशः again and again, हृदि on his chest, कृत्वा held, रोषितः in anger (sorrow), बिलस्थः in the hole, सर्पः इव like a snake, भृशम् intensely, निशश्वास sighed
data.md: And placing the elegant ornaments on his bosom, he sighed again and again, like an enraged serpent in a hole.

data.v: अविच्छिन्नाश्रुवेगस्तु सौमित्रिं वीक्ष्य पार्श्वतः । परिदेवयितुं दीनं रामः समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Rama began to wail piteously while tears streamed down his eyes incessantly. He looked at Saumitri standing by his side and said:
data.anv: रामः Rama, अविच्छिन्नाश्रुवेगः tears streamed incessantly, पार्श्वतः by his side, सौमित्रिम् at Saumitri, विक्ष्य  looking, दीनम् piteously, परिदेवयितुम् to wail, समुपचक्रमे started
data.md: Seeing Sumitrā's son at his side, Rāma shedding ceaseless tears, began to lament piteously,

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्या संत्यक्तं ह्रियमाणया । उत्तरीयमिदं भूमौ शरीराद्भूषणानि च ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana, behold the veil and the ornaments dropped on the ground by Vaidehi while she was being abducted.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, ह्रियमाणया while being abducted, वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, शरीरात् from her body, भूमौ on the ground, सन्त्यक्तम् thrown down, इदम् these, उत्तरीयम् veil, भूषणानि च and ornaments, पश्य see
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, behold this scarf and these ornaments which Vaidehī, while being carried away, let fall from her person to the earth.

data.v: शाद्वलिन्यां ध्रुवं भूम्यां सीतया ह्रियमाणया । उत्सृष्टं भूषणमिदं तथारूपं हि दृश्यते ।।
data.es: 'Sita, for sure, dropped these ornaments on the grassy ground. They are in good shape (without any damage).
data.anv: ह्रियमाणया while being carried away, सीतया by Sita, इदम् these, भूषणम् ornaments, शाद्वलिन्याम् on the grassy land, भूमौ on the ground, उत्सृष्टम् dropped down, ध्रुवम् surely, तथारूपम् as before, दृश्यते हि It appears like that
data.md: Surely Sītā, while being ravished, let these fall on a sward, for these remain as before.

data.v: ब्रूहि सुग्रीव कं देशं ह्रियन्ती लक्षिता त्वया । रक्षसा रौद्ररूपेण मम प्राणसमा प्रिया ।।
data.es: Then Rama said to Sugriva,.'Tell me, O Sugriva, to which region that fiercelooking demon has carried away my Sita, who is dearer than my life.
