data.anv: ततः then, राघवः Rama, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, सुग्रीव O Sugriva, मम my, प्राणैः life, प्रिया प्रिया dear one, रौद्ररूपेण by the fiercelooking one, रक्षसा by the demon, कम् which,देशम् place, ह्रियन्ती taken, त्वया by you, लक्षिता is seen, ब्रूहि tell me
data.md: Thereupon Rāghava said these words to Sugriva, Tell me, O Sugriva, at what place didst you see Sītā, while she, dear to me as life, was taken away by the fierce-looking Raksasas?

data.v: क्व वा वसति तद्रक्षो महद्व्यसनदं मम । यन्निमित्तमहं सर्वान्नाशयिष्यामि राक्षसान् ।।
data.es: 'Let me know where dwells that huge ogre who has caused this agony to me. I will exterminate all the demons
data.anv: अहम् I am, यन्निमित्तम् on whose account, सर्वान् all, राक्षसान् demons, नाशयिष्यामि I will exterminate, तत् that, मम my, व्यसनदम् brought agony to me, महत् रक्षः huge demon, क्व वा where does, वसति he lives?
data.md: Where does that Rākṣa, who has brought on this high peril, and for whom I will slay all the Rākşasas, live?

data.v: हरता मैथिलीं येन मां च रोषयता भृशम् । आत्मनो जीवितान्ताय मृत्युद्वारमपावृतम् ।।
data.es: 'By abducting Maithili he has stirred my fierce anger and has opened the door of his death.
data.anv: मैथिलीम् Maithili, हरता being kidnapped, माम् me, रोषयता च by causing anger, येन by whom, भृशम् profusly, आत्मनः to his self, जीवितान्ताय for his death, मृत्युद्वारम् door of death, अपावृतम् opened
data.md: He, that has carried off Mithila's daughter, and roused my wrath, has certainly for his own end, opened the door of death.

data.v: मम दयिततमा हृता वना;द्रजनिचरेण विमथ्य येन सा । कथय मम रिपुं तमद्य वै; प्रवगपते यमसंनिधिं नयामि ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys tell me the whereabouts of that nightranger who has carried off my darling from the heart of the forest and has harassed her. I will send him now to the abode of Death.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्गःThus ends the sixth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्लवगपते O lord of monkeys, येन by whom, रजनिचरेण by the mightrangers, मम my, दयिततरा most beloved, सा she, विमथ्य troubled her, वनान्तात् from the forest, हृता stolen, मम my, रिपुम् enemy, तम् him, कथय अद्य tell me now, यमसदनम् abode of lord of death, नयामि carry him
data.md: Tell me all about that ranger of the night, that deceitfully has carried away my dearest wife from the forest. My foe, O lord of monkey will I to-day send to the neighbourhood of Yāma.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो रामेणार्तेन वानरः । अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं सबाष्पं बाष्पगद्गदः ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Rama in deep distress, the monkey replied to him with folded hands, his throat choked with tears:
data.anv: आर्तेन  by the distressed, रामेण by Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः spoke, वानरः monkey, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, बाष्पगद्गदः voice choked, सबाष्पम् with sears, वाक्यम्  words, अब्रवीत् said
data.md: Thus addressed by the aggrieved Rāma, the monkey, Sugriva, his accents obstructed by vapour and his eyes filled with tears, said with joined hands,

data.v: न जाने निलयं तस्य सर्वथा पापरक्षसः । सामर्थ्यं विक्रमं वापि दौष्कुलेयस्य वा कुलम् ।।
data.es: 'I do not have any knowledge of this sinful demon's dwelling , his capability, his valour or his clan or his despicable lineage.
data.anv: दौष्कुलेयस्य born in despicable clan, तस्य his, पापरक्षसः of the sinful demon, निलयम् residence, सामर्थ्यम् capacity, विक्रमं वापि or his valour, कुलं वा or even the clan, सर्वथा all that, न जाने not known to me
data.md: I do not know the hidden abode of that exceedingly wicked Raksasa,-nor do l know his heroism and prowess, or the lineage of that one sprung from a vicious race.

data.v: सत्यं तु प्रतिजानामि त्यज शोकमरिंदम । करिष्यामि तथा यत्नं यथा प्राप्स्यसि मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'O subduer of enemies, give up sorrow. I promise I will make necessary effort so that you will obtain the princess from Mithila.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, सत्यम् truth, प्रतिजानामि I promise you, शोकम् sorrow, त्यज give up, मैथिलीम् Maithili, यथा as, प्राप्स्यसि will obtain, तथा that way, यत्नम् effort, करिष्यामि I will make
data.md: O vanquisher of foes, leave off sorrowing. I promise to you truly, I will exert so that you mayst obtain Maithilī.

data.v: रावणं सगणं हत्वा परितोष्यात्मपौरुषम् । तथास्मि कर्ता नचिराद्यथा प्रीतो भविष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'With all my capability I will kill Ravana and his clan. Thus I will be able to satisfy you soon with my efforts.
data.anv: सगणम् including clan, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, आत्मपौरुषम् my prowess, परितोष्य satisfy, यथा as, प्रीतः pleased, भविष्यसि you will be, तथा that way, न चिरात् very soon, कर्तास्मि I will do
data.md: Slaying Rāvaņa with his hosts, and putting forth my manliness capable of pleasing others, I will speedily act so that you mayst be pleased.

data.v: अलं वैक्लव्यमालम्ब्य धैर्यमात्मगतं स्मर । त्वद्विधानां न सदृशमीदृशं बुद्धिलाघवम् ।।
data.es: 'Give up despair. It is enough. Be patient. Maintain your natural disposition.It is unworthy of men like you to entertain such frivolus thoughts?
data.anv: वैक्लब्यम् despair, आलम्ब्य resorting to, अलम् it is enough, आत्मगतम् your natural disposition, धैर्यम् patience, स्मर pick up, त्वद्विधानाम् for men like you, ईदृशम् such, बुद्धिलाघवम् frivolous thought, न सदृशम् is not worthy
data.md: Do not be overwhelmed with grief: summon the fortitude that is in you. Such lightness of sense does not become persons like you.

data.v: मयापि व्यसनं प्राप्तं भार्या हरणजं महत् । न चाहमेवं शोचामि न च धैर्यं परित्यजे ।।
data.es: 'Separated from my wife, I, too, am afflicted with deep grief. But I do not brood, I do not lose patience.
data.anv: मयापि I am also, भार्याविरहजम् due to separation from my wife, महत् great, व्यसनम् sorrow, प्राप्तम् shared, अहम् I am, एवम् in that way, न not शोचामि I am not brooding, धैर्यं च patience also, न परित्यजे  not given up
data.md: I also have experienced mighty disaster arising out of separation from my wife; but I do not weep in this wise,-nor do I forsake my fortitude.

data.v: नाहं तामनुशोचामि प्राकृतो वानरोऽपि सन् । महात्मा च विनीतश्चा किं पुनर्धृतिमान्भवान् ।।
data.es: 'I am an ordinary monkey born. Even then, I do not brood over my wife. You are highsouled, humble and patient. Why do you grieve?
data.anv: अहम् I am, प्राकृतः ordinary, वानरोऽपि सन् although a monkey, ताम् her (wife), न अनुशोचामि I do not brood, महात्मा च you are highsouled, विनीतश्च  humble, धृतिमान् endowed with patience, भवान् you, किं पुनः why (grieve) again.
data.md: A despicable monkey as I am, I do not grieve for her,-and what again shall I say of one that is magnanimous, endued with meekness and firmness, and great?

data.v: बाष्पमापतितं धैर्यान्निग्रहीतुं त्वमर्हसि । मर्यादां सत्त्वयुक्तानां धृतिं नोत्स्रष्टुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'Restrain the flow of your tears. Be patient. Men (like you) endowed with equilibrium and dignity and patience ought not to leave their composure.
data.anv: त्वम् you, आपतितम् streaming down, बाष्पम् tears, धैर्यात् with patience, निग्रहीतुम् to  restrain,  अर्हसि you ought to, सत्त्वयुक्तानाम् men endowed with equilibrium, मर्यादाम् mark, धृतिम् steadfastness, उत्स्रष्टुम् to deviate from, नार्हसि ought  not
data.md: It behoveth you to restrain your falling tears by patience. It behoveth you not to resign that patience which is the dignity of persons possessed of the quality of goodness.

data.v: व्यसने वार्थ कृच्छ्रे वा भये वा जीवितान्तगे । विमृशन्वै स्वया बुद्ध्या धृतिमान्नावसीदति ।।
data.es: 'In times of grief or loss of wealth or at the hour of death, one who is patient does not abandon his wisdom, he does not despair.
data.anv: व्यसने वा in grief or, अर्थकृच्छ्रे वा or even over loss of wealth, जीवितान्तके at the hour of death, भये वा or in fear?, धृतिमान् one who is patient, स्वया बुद्ध्या by his own wisdom, विमृशन्  leaving, नावसीदति will not despair
data.md: Persons endued with firmness of understanding by help of their intellect, do not in calamity consequent on separation from dear ones, or on the occasion of loss of wealth, or of fear arising from thieves, wild beasts, etc., or of loss of life itself, lose their self-possession.

data.v: बालिशस्तु नरो नित्यं वैक्लव्यं योऽनुवर्तते । स मज्जत्यवशः शोके भाराक्रान्तेव नौर्जले ।।
data.anv: यः नरः which man, बालिशः foolish, नित्यम् always, वैक्लब्यम् despair, अनुवर्तते gives in for, सः he, अवशं he loses selfcontrol, भाराक्रान्ता burdened, नौः boat, जले इव as in the water, शोके in grief, मज्जति gets sunk
data.md: He that is senseless as well as he that suffers himself to be overwhelmed with grief, losing all control over self, drown themselves in sorrow like a boat bearing a heavy load in water.

data.v: एषोऽञ्जलिर्मया बद्धः प्रणयात्त्वां प्रसादये । पौरुषं श्रय शोकस्य नान्तरं दातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'I implore you with folded palms on account of our friendship to show manliness. You should not give in to grief.
data.anv: मया by me, एषः this, अञ्जलिः folded palms, बद्धः is held, प्रणयात् out of friendship, त्वाम् you, प्रसादये be pleased, पौरुषम् manliness, श्रय you may take resort to, शोकस्य sorrow's, अन्तरम् a chance, दातुम् to give in, नार्हसि you ought not.
data.md: I soothe you from the love I bear towards you. Do you have recourse to manliness. It does not behove you to let grief overcome you.

data.v: ये शोकमनुवर्तन्ते न तेषां विद्यते सुखम् । तेजश्च क्षीयते तेषां न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'There is no happiness for those who give way to sorrow. Their brilliance is dimmed. Therefore, you ought not grieve.
data.anv: ये those, शोकम् grief, अनुवर्तन्ते whoever give way, तेषाम् for them, सुखम् pleasure, न विद्यते is not there, तेषाम् for them, तेजश्च brilliance, क्षीयते is reduced, त्वम् you, शोचितुम् to grieve, नार्हसि ought not
data.md: Those that indulge in sorrow, know no happiness; and their virtue* goeth out of them. Therefore it behoveth you not to grieve. In the sense of energy.

data.v: हितं वयस्य भावेन ब्रूहि नोपदिशामि ते । वयस्यतां पूजयन्मे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'Out of friendly concern I offer my opinion in your interest. I am not competent to advise you. Respecting my friendship, you should never yield to grief.'
data.anv: वयस्यतां friendly concern, पूजयन्मे offering you, हितम् ब्रूमि I am speaking, ते to you, नोपदिशामि I do not advise, मे my, वयस्यताम् friendship, पूजयन् honouring, त्वम् you, शोचितुम् to grieve, न अर्हसि you ought not to
data.md: In the spirit of a friend I tell what is for your good: I do not instruct you. Honour the amity I bear towards you. It behoveth you not to weep.

data.v: मधुरं सान्त्वितस्तेन सुग्रीवेण स राघवः । मुखमश्रुपरिक्लिन्नं वस्त्रान्तेन प्रमार्जयत् ।।
data.es: Consoled by the sweet words of Sugriva, Rama wiped his face filled with tears by the hem of his upper cloth.
data.anv: तेन सुग्रीवेण by  Sugriva, मधुरम् sweet, सान्त्वितः comforted, सः राघवः that Rama, अश्रुपरिक्लिन्नम् wet with tears, मुखम् face, वस्त्रान्तेन with the hem of his upper cloth, प्रमार्जयत् wiped
data.md: Thus sweetly consoled by Sugrīva, Rāghava with the end of his cloth wiped his face tarnished with tears.

data.v: प्रकृतिष्ठस्तु काकुत्स्थः सुग्रीववचनात्प्रभुः । संपरिष्वज्य सुग्रीवमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When lord Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race was comforted by these words of Sugriva, he came to his senses, and clasping him said:
data.anv: प्रभुः Lord , काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, सुग्रीववचनात् by the words of Sugriva, प्रकृतिस्थः he became composed, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, सम्परिष्वज्य after embracing, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् he spoke
data.md: And after that lord, Kakutstha, had recovered his natural state through the words of Sugrīva he embraced Sugrīva and addressed him, saying,

data.v: कर्तव्यं यद्वयस्येन स्निग्धेन च हितेन च । अनुरूपं च युक्तं च कृतं सुग्रीव तत्त्वया ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva you have done what a friend should have done in a befitting manner with your sweet words and good wishes.
data.anv: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, स्निग्धेन by a loving, हितेन च and by a wellwisher, वयस्येन by a friend, यत् whatever, कर्तव्यं duty, अनुरूपं suitable, युक्तम् proper, तत् that, त्वया by you, कृतम् done
data.md: O Sugriva, that which, pleasing and profitable, proper and fit, ought to be done by a friend, has been done by you.

data.v: एष च प्रकृतिष्ठोऽहमनुनीतस्त्वया सखे । दुर्लभो हीदृशो बन्धुरस्मिन्काले विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O friend you have guided me back to my senses thus. It is difficult to find a friend like you specially at this time.
data.anv: सखे O friend, त्वया by you, अनुनीतः counselled by you, एषः अहम् that way I am, प्रकृतिस्थः come back to the senses, ईदृशः such, बन्धुः friend, दुर्लभः हि is difficult to find, अस्मिन् काले this time, विशेषतः specially
data.md: Solicited by you, I have, O friend, regained my natural tone of mind. Such a friend is rare, specially at such a time.

data.v: किं तु यत्नस्त्वया कार्यो मैथिल्याः परिमार्गणे । राक्षसस्य च रौद्रस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'Indeed, you must make effort to trace the princess from Mithila and the evilminded, fierce demon Ravana.
data.anv: किं तु but, त्वया by you, मैथिल्याः Maithili's, दुरात्मनः of the evilminded, राक्षसस्य demon's, रौद्रस्य of the fierce, रावणस्य Ravana's, परिमार्गणे in tracing, यत्नः effort, कार्यः do
data.md: But you should strive to trace Maithili as well as bring about the destruction of that fierce Räks asa, the impious Rāvana.

data.v: मया च यदनुष्ठेयं विस्रब्धेन तदुच्यताम् । वर्षास्विव च सुक्षेत्रे सर्वं संपद्यते तव ।।
data.es: 'Now tell me about my duty without any hesitation. I assure you that your desire will be fulfilled, just as seeds sown in a fertile land with timely rains bear fruit.
data.anv: मया by me, यत् that, अनुष्ठेयम् to be done, तत् that, विस्रब्धेन without any hesitation, उच्यताम् it may be, तव your, सर्वम् everything, वर्षासु in the rainy season, सुक्षेत्रे इव in a fertile land, सम्पद्यते it will produce good results.
data.md: Do you also without reserve say what I shall have to do for you. Like corn sown in a fertile field in the rainy season, every concern of thine shall attain success.

data.v: मया च यदिदं वाक्यमभिमानात्समीरितम् । तत्त्वया हरिशार्दूल तत्त्वमित्युपधार्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'O tiger amongst monkeys accept my words uttered out of injured honour in their true sense.
data.anv: हरिशार्दूल O tiger among monkeys, मया by me too, अभिमानात् out of injured honour, यत् those words, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, समीरितुम् have been uttered, तत् that, त्वया by you, तत्त्वम् इति appropriately, उपधार्यताम् it may be treated so
data.md: O best of monkeys, do you verily consider as true the words that I have uttered through affection.

data.v: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन । एतत्ते प्रतिजानामि सत्येनैव शपामि ते ।।
data.es: 'I have never uttered a false word earlier nor will I do it in future. This is my promise. I swear by truth alone.'
data.anv: मे by me, अनृतम् lies, न उक्तपूर्वम् never said earlier, कदाचन at any time, न वक्ष्ये च I will not tell also, एतत् this, ते to you, प्रतिजानामि I promise, अहम् I am, सत्येनैव by truth alone, च and, ते शपामि I swear
data.md: Falsehoods have I never spoken before, nor will I ever say one (in future). This I promise to you. I swear by truth itself.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टः सुग्रीवो वानरैः सचिवैः सह । राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा प्रतिज्ञातं विशेषतः ।।
data.es: Sugriva and his counsellors felt glad on hearing Rama's words, particularly the assurance given by him.
data.anv: ततः then, सचिवैः with his counsellers, वानरैः सह with monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राघवस्य Raghava's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, विशेषतः specially, प्रतिज्ञातम् his own promise, प्रहृष्टः felt glad
data.md: Hearing Rāghava's words, and in special his promise, Sugrīva felt exceedingly delighted along with this monkey ministers.

data.v: महानुभावस्य वचो निशम्य; हरिर्नराणामृषभस्य तस्य । कृतं स मेने हरिवीर मुख्य;स्तदा स्वकार्यं हृदयेन विद्वान् ।।
data.es: Wise Sugriva, chief of monkeys, heard the words of the magnanimous Rama, a bull among men. He felt glad at heart thinking that his task has been achieved.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventh sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.
data.anv: विद्वान् wise man, सः he, हरिवीरमुख्यः chief of monkeys, हरिः monkey, महानुभावस्य of the magnanimous, तस्य his, नृपाणाम् of kings, रुषभस्य of the bull among men, वचः words, निशम्य after listening, तदा then, कार्यम् task, कृतम् achieved, हृदयेन at heart, मेने he thought
data.md: Hearing the words of that illustrious monarch of kings, that hero-greatest of monkeys-considered and felt in his heart as if his work had already been accomplished.

data.v: परितुष्टस्तु सुग्रीवस्तेन वाक्येन वानरः । लक्ष्मणस्याग्रजं राममिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the monkey was very pleased with Rama's words and said to him in front of Lakshmana:
data.anv: वानरः monkey, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तेन वाक्येन by the words, परितुष्टः very pleased, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, अग्रतः in front, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् he spoke.
data.md: Sugrīva, rejoiced at the words of Rāma, said to that hero, the elder brother of Laksmana; who was well pleased.

data.v: सर्वथाहमनुग्राह्यो देवतानामसंशयः । उपपन्नगुणोपेतः सखा यस्य भवान्मम ।।
data.es: 'Since one like you endowed with all virtues has become my friend I am (now) worthy of grace of the gods in all respects. There is no doubt.
data.anv: उपपन्नः come, गुणोपेतः endowed with all virtues, भवान् yourself, यस्य मम you to me, सखा friend, अहम् I am, सर्वथा in all respects, देवतानाम्  of gods, अनुग्राह्यः worthy of favour, संशयः doubt, न no.
data.md: I am, without doubt, worthy of being favoured by the gods, since you accomplished and furnished with virtues are my friend.

data.v: शक्यं खलु भवेद्राम सहायेन त्वयानघ । सुरराज्यमपि प्राप्तुं स्वराज्यं किं पुनः प्रभो ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, my sinless Lord, it is possible to attain even the kingdom of the gods with your help, what to speak of my own kingdom?
data.anv: अनघ sinless, प्रभो O Lord, राम Rama, त्वया by you, सहायेन with help, सुरराज्यमपि even the kingdom of the gods, प्राप्तुम् to attain, शक्यम् possible, स्वराज्यम् my own kingdom, किं पुनः what to speak
data.md: By your help, O Rama, one can, O sinless one, obtain the kingdom of the celestials,-what is to be said of one's kingdom, O lord?

data.v: सोऽहं सभाज्यो बन्धूनां सुहृदां चैव राघव । यस्याग्निसाक्षिकं मित्रं लब्धं राघववंशजम् ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, since you, born in Raghava dynasty, have become my friend with fire as witness, I have become equally honourable among my relatives and friends.
data.anv: राघव Rama, यस्य whose, राघववंशजम् born in Raghava dynasty, मित्रम् friend, अग्निसाक्षिकम्  fire as witness, लब्धम् got, सः अहम् that I, बन्धूनाम्  among relatives, सुहृदां चैव also among friends, सभाज्यः became equally honourable.
data.md: I, who have, in the presence of Fire, gained for my friend (you) sprung from the Rāghava race, am, O Rāghava worthy of being honoured by my friends and relations.

data.v: अहमप्यनुरूपस्ते वयस्यो ज्ञास्यसे शनैः । न तु वक्तुं समर्थोऽहं स्वयमात्मगतान्गुणान् ।।
data.es: 'You will come to know slowly that I am also a friend worthy of you.It is not proper for me to speak of my qualities( flatter myself).
data.anv: अहमपि I am also, ते to you, अनुरूपः worthy, वयस्यः friend, शनैः slowly, ज्ञास्यसे you will know, अहम् I am, इमान् those, आत्मगुणान् my own qualities, स्वयम् myself, वक्तुम् to speak of, समर्थः proper, न not
data.md: You also shall by and by learn that I am a fit friend for you; but I can not speak to you of the qualities that abide in me.

data.v: महात्मनां तु भूयिष्ठं त्वद्विधानां कृतात्मनाम् । निश्चला भवति प्रीतिर्धैर्यमात्मवतामिव ।।
data.es: 'The affection of exalted souls is exceedingly stable like the patience of selfcontrolled and wellcomposed men like you.
data.anv: आत्मवताम् wellcomposed, कृतात्मनाम्  selfcontrolled, त्वद्विधानाम् of men like you, महात्मनाम् of the exalted souls, प्रीतिः affection, भूयिष्ठम् exceedingly, निश्चला stable, भवति will be, धैर्यम् patience.
data.md: O free one, the felicity of high-souled and self-governed friends like you abounds and is enduring.

data.v: रजतं वा सुवर्णं वा वस्त्राण्याभरणानि वा । अविभक्तानि साधूनामवगच्छन्ति साधवः ।।
data.es: 'Good friends consider(valuables such as) silver or gold, clothes or ornaments of worldly wealth indivisible.
data.anv: साधूनाम्  good friends, रजतं वा silver or, सुवर्णं वा gold, वस्त्राणि clothes, आभरणानि च and ornaments, अविभक्तानि not divisible, साधवः men who go in one's way, अवगच्छन्ति will consider.
data.md: Pious friends look upon the silver, and gold, and the elegant ornaments of pious friends as common property.

data.v: आढ्यो वापि दरिद्रो वा दुःखितः सुखितोऽपि वा । निर्दोषो वा सदोषो वा वयस्यः परमा गतिः ।।
data.es: 'Whether rich or poor, afflicted or happy, flawless or guilty, a friend is the ultimate refuge to a friend.
data.anv: आढ्यो वापि whether a rich man, दरिद्रो वा or poor, दुःखितः or sad one, सुखितोऽपि वा or a happy man, निर्दोषो flawless one, सदोषः guilty, वयस्यः a friend, परमा ultimate, गतिः refuge.
data.md: Whether rich or poor, happy or miserable, good or bad, a friend is the greatest refuge (of his friend).

data.v: धनत्यागः सुखत्यागो देहत्यागोऽपि वा पुनः । वयस्यार्थे प्रवर्तन्ते स्नेहं दृष्ट्वा तथाविधम् ।।
data.es: 'One will not hesitate to sacrifice wealth or happiness or even life for the sake of a friend like you.'
data.anv: स्नेहम् friendship, तथाविधम् that kind, दृष्ट्वा after finding, वयस्यार्थे for the sake of a friend, धनत्यागः to sacrifice wealth, सुखत्यागः to sacrifice happiness, देहत्यागोऽपि वा or sacrifice even life, प्रवर्तन्ते undertake
data.md: Witnessing such affection, people can, O sinless one, forsake wealth, comfort, and even their native land for the sake of their friends.

data.v: तत्तथेत्यब्रवीद्रामः सुग्रीवं प्रियवादिनम् । लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो लक्ष्म्या वासवस्येव धीमतः ।।
data.es: As wise Lakshmana, brilliant like Indra stood witness, Rama said, 'it is true as you say' to Sugriva who spoke pleasing words.
data.anv: रामः Rama, वासवस्य इव like Indra, धीमतः wise, लक्ष्म्या by signs, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, अग्रतः in the presence of, प्रियवादिनम् pleasant speaker, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, तत् that, तथा it is true, इति thus, अब्रवीत् he spoke.
data.md: There at the graceful Rāma, in front of the intelligent Lakşmaņa resembling Väsava, said to Sugriva of a pleasing presence,-It is even so.

data.v: ततो रामं स्थितं दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम् । सुग्रीवः सर्वतश्चक्षुर्वने लोलमपातयत् ।।
data.es: With mighty Rama and Lakshmana standing by, Sugriva cast his eyes eagerly all round the forest.
data.anv: ततः then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, स्थितम् standing, रामम् Rama, महाबलम् strong, लक्ष्मणं च Lakshmana also, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, लोलम् moving unsteadily, चक्षुः his eyes, वने in the forest, सर्वतः all sides, अपातयत् cast.
data.md: The next day seeing Rāma as well as the mighty Lakşmaņa seated on the ground, Sugrīva briskly cast his eyes about the forest.

data.v: स ददर्श ततः सालमविदूरे हरीश्वरः । सुपुष्पमीषत्पत्राढ्यं भ्रमरैरुपशोभितम् ।।
data.es: Then the chief of monkeys saw a sala tree looking lovely with tender leaves and flowers graced by bees.
data.anv: ततः then, सः हरीश्वरः chief of monkeys, अविदूरे not very far, सुपुष्पम् having flowers, ईषत्पत्राढ्यम् with a few leaves, भ्रमरैः by bees, उपशोभितम् looking graceful, सालम् sala tree, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And hard by that lord of monkeys discovered a Sāla tree, bearing a few beautiful blossoms, with its wealth of foliage, decked by black bees.

data.v: तस्यैकां पर्णबहुलां भङ्क्त्वा शाखां सुपुष्पिताम् । सालस्यास्तीर्य सुग्रीवो निषसाद सराघवः ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva cut the branch of a sala tree with luxuriant leaves and flowers, spread it on the ground and sat down along with Raghava.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तस्य its, पर्णबहुलाम्  with plenty of leaves, सुशोभिताम् beautifully  blossomed, एकां शाखाम् one branch, भङ्क्त्वा broke, रामस्य for Rama, आस्तीर्य spread, स राघवः with Rama, निषसाद sat.
data.md: Then spreading a beautifully blossoming spray of Sala, full of foliage, Sugriva made an awning and sat down with Rāghava.

data.v: तावासीनौ ततो दृष्ट्वा हनूमानपि लक्ष्मणम् । सालशाखां समुत्पाट्य विनीतमुपवेशयत् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Hanuman also broke a branch of the sala tree and seated Lakshmana on it.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, हनूमानपि Hanuman also, आसीनौ seated, तौ both Rama and Sugriva, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, सालशाखाम् a branch of sala tree, समुत्पाट्य  broke, विनीतम् obedient, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, उपवेशयत् made him sit.
data.md: Seeing them seated, Hanumān breaking off a branch of śāla, humbly made Lakşmaņa sit down.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टः सुग्रीवः श्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा । उवाच प्रणयाद्रामं हर्षव्याकुलिताक्षरम् ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva, eyes sparkling with joy, replied to Rama in a sweet, gentle voice.
data.anv: ततः then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, फलपुष्पमाकीर्णे in a place filled with flowers and fruits, तस्मिन् in that, गिरिवरोत्तमे on the best of mountains, सुखोपविष्टम् seated comfortably, प्रसन्नम् peaceful, उदधिं यथा like an ocean, रामम् Rama, श्लक्ष्णम् softly, मधुरया sweetly, गिरा words, हर्षव्याकुलिताक्षरम् mixing up words due to extreme joy and excitement, प्रणयात् out of love, उवाच said.
data.md: Next Sugriva, feeling high rapture, with his eyes expanded with joy, answered Rāma blandly in sweet words.

data.v: अहं विनिकृतो भ्रात्रा चराम्येष भयार्दितः । ऋश्यमूकं गिरिवरं हृतभार्यः सुदुःखितः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, I have been insulted deeply and my wife hijacked. Stricken with fear I have taken refuge in this inaccessible forest.
data.anv: भ्रात्रा  brother, विनिकृतः offended, एषः here I am, अहम् I, भयार्दितः frightened, हृतभार्यः wife stolen, सुदुःखितः very sad, गिरिवरम् great mountain, ऋश्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, चरामि I am roaming .
data.md: Wronged by my brother, I deprived of my wife and exceedingly distressed, and exercised with fear, live in this foremost of mountains, Rs yamuka.

data.v: सोऽहं त्रस्तो भये मग्नो वसाम्युद्भ्रान्तचेतनः । वालिना निकृतो भ्रात्रा कृतवैरश्च राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Rama humiliated by my brother Vali, I have developed enmity with him. Terribly distraught and disturbed I live in this forest in great fear.
data.anv: राघव Rama, भ्रात्रा brother, वालिना by Vali, निकृतः deceived, कृतवैरश्च developed enmity, सः अहम् that I am, त्रस्तः terrified, सम्भ्रान्तचेतनः utterly confused, वने in the forest, भये with fear, मग्नः stricken.
data.md: I am afflicted with fright, and worried by fear, with my senses bewildered in this wood. Wronged have I been by Vāli, my brother; and I have incurred his hostility, O Raghava.

data.v: वालिनो मे भयार्तस्य सर्वलोकाभयंकर । ममापि त्वमनाथस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O great warrior who can frighten all the worlds scared of Vali, I feel helpless like an orphan to whom you ought to extend your grace.'
data.anv: सर्वलोकाभयङ्कर O warrior who can threaten people of all worlds, मे to me, वालिनः from Vali, भयार्तस्य of one scared and helpless, अनाथस्य of an orphan, ममापि for me, त्वम् you, प्रसादम् grace, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि ought to.
data.md: O you, that remove the fear of all creatures, it behove you who am tormented by fear and am helpless, to extend your favour to me.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु तेजस्वी धर्मज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः । प्रत्युवाच स काकुत्स्थः सुग्रीवं प्रहसन्निव ।।
data.es: The righteous and glorious Rama to whom dharma is very dear said to Sugriva with a gentle smile on his face, when he was entreated thus:
data.anv: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having spoken, तेजस्वी glorious, धर्मज्ञः knower of duty , धर्मवत्सलः a lover of dharma, सः काकुत्स्थः that Kakustha, प्रहसन्निव gentle smile on his face, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, प्रत्युवाच replied
data.md: Thus addressed, the powerful Kākutstha, knowing righteousness, and devoted to virtue, answered Sugriva, smiling,

data.v: उपकारफलं मित्रमपकारोऽरिलक्षणम् । अद्यैव तं हनिष्यामि तव भार्यापहारिणम् ।।
data.es: 'O great monkey I know friendship is the fruit of a beneficial deed. I will kill that Vali who has usurped your wife.
data.anv: मित्रम्ज्ञ a friend, उपकारफलम् carries the fruit of help, अपकारः harm, अरिलक्षणम् an enemy's characteristic feature, तव your, भार्यापहारिणम् wrested your wife, तम् him, अद्यैव this very day, वधिष्यामि I will kill.
data.md: O mighty monkey, that the outcome of amity is good offices I am well aware of. I will slay that captor of your wife Vāli.

data.v: इमे हि मे महावेगाः पत्रिणस्तिग्मतेजसः । कार्तिकेयवनोद्भूताः शरा हेमविभूषिताः ।।
data.es: 'Here are my highspeed, winged arrows glowing like fierce fire, born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds.They are smooth and welljointed, decked with gold, comparable in strength to great Indra's thunderbolt, very sharp with pointed tips looking like angry serpents.
data.anv: महावेगाः of high speed, मे my, पत्रिणः winged ones, इमे these , शराःarrows, तिग्मतेजसः glowing like fierce fire, कार्तिकेयवनोद्भताः born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds, हेमविभूषिताः decked with gold, कङ्कपत्रपरिच्छन्नाः covered with kanka feathers, महेन्द्राशनिसन्निभाः  comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt, सुपर्वाणः those with smooth joints, सुतीक्ष्णाग्राः  with very sharp and pointed tips, सरोषाः angry, भुजगाः serpents, इव like.
data.md: O exalted one, these feathered shafts of exceeding energy, sprung from the Kārtikeya forest, decked with gold, furnished with the plumes of the Kanka, resembling the thunderbolt of the great Indra, having smooth knots, and sharp heads, are like enraged serpents.

data.v: कङ्कपत्रप्रतिच्छन्ना महेन्द्राशनिसंनिभाः । सुपर्वाणः सुतीक्ष्णाग्रा सरोषा भुजगा इव ।।
data.es: 'Here are my highspeed, winged arrows glowing like fierce fire, born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds.They are smooth and welljointed, decked with gold, comparable in strength to great Indra's thunderbolt, very sharp with pointed tips looking like angry serpents.
data.anv: महावेगाः of high speed, मे my, पत्रिणः winged ones, इमे these , शराःarrows, तिग्मतेजसः glowing like fierce fire, कार्तिकेयवनोद्भताः born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds, हेमविभूषिताः decked with gold, कङ्कपत्रपरिच्छन्नाः covered with kanka feathers, महेन्द्राशनिसन्निभाः  comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt, सुपर्वाणः those with smooth joints, सुतीक्ष्णाग्राः  with very sharp and pointed tips, सरोषाः angry, भुजगाः serpents, इव like.
data.md: O exalted one, these feathered shafts of exceeding energy, sprung from the Kārtikeya forest, decked with gold, furnished with the plumes of the Kanka, resembling the thunderbolt of the great Indra, having smooth knots, and sharp heads, are like enraged serpents.

data.v: भ्रातृसंज्ञममित्रं ते वालिनं कृतकिल्बिषम् । शरैर्विनिहतं पश्य विकीर्णमिव पर्वतम् ।।
data.es: 'With these sharp, serpentlike arrows Vali will be killed. He will fall down on the ground like a mountain shattered.You will see it now'.
data.anv: ते your, वालिनम् at Vali, कृतकिल्बिषम् doer of wrong deeds, वालिसंज्ञम् calls Vali's brother, अमित्रम् enemy, शरैः by arrows, विनिहतम् being killed, विकीर्णम् shattered, पर्वतम् इव crushed like a mountain, पश्य you may see.
data.md: You shall behold your brother and enemy, who is named Vāli slain by my shafts, and lying like a dislodged hill.

data.v: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो वाहिनीपतिः । प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे साधु साध्विति चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing Rama's words, Sugriva, chief of the army of monkeys experienced immeasurable happiness and exclaimed, 'you're great, you're great.'
data.anv: वाहिनीपतिः chief of the army (of monkeys), सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राघवस्य Rama's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अतुलम् immeasurable, प्रहर्षम् happiness, लेभे attained, साधु साधु इति good good thus, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing with Lakşmaņa the speech of the pious one, Rāma gained an excess of joy and exclaiming, Wonderful it is!

data.v: रामशोकाभिभूतोऽहं शोकार्तानां भवान्गतिः । वयस्य इति कृत्वा हि त्वय्यहं परिदेवये ।।
data.es: 'Rama I am overwhelmed with sorrow. You are the refuge of the distressed. As you are a friend I ventilate all my grief to you.
data.anv: राम  Rama, अहम् I am, शोकाभिभूतः overcome with sorrow, शोकार्तानाम् for those in sorrow, भवान् you are, गतिः refuge, वयस्यः friend, इति कृत्वा treating you like this, अहम् I am, त्वयि to you, परिदेवये express.
data.md: O Rāma, overwhelmed am I by grief. You are the succour of those afflicted with sorrow. Having made you my friend, I express to you my grief.

data.v: त्वं हि पाणिप्रदानेन वयस्यो सोऽग्निसाक्षिकः । कृतः प्राणैर्बहुमतः सत्येनापि शपाम्यहम् ।।
data.es: 'I value your hand of friendship extended to me, with fire as witness more than my very life. I, on my own, offer my pledge of friendship.
data.anv: त्वम् you, पाणिप्रदानेन by offering your hand in friendship, अग्निसाक्षिकम् with fire as witness, कृतः did, प्राणैः more than life, बहुमतः very great, मे वयस्यः हि being my friend, अहम् I am, सत्येन truly, शपामि  vow, ते to you.
data.md: I have, in the presence of Fire by giving you my hand, made you my friend. You are dearer to me than life itself. This I swear to you by Truth.

data.v: वयस्य इति कृत्वा च विस्रब्धं प्रवदाम्यहम् । दुःखमन्तर्गतं यन्मे मनो दहति नित्यशः ।।
data.anv: वयस्यः इति कृत्वा च also considering you as a friend, अहम् I am, विस्रब्धः  relaxed , प्रवदामि I am speaking, मे अन्तर्गतम् my feelings, दुःखम् sorrow, नित्यशः always, मनः mind, हरति is tormenting me.
data.md: Having made you my friend, I inspired with confidence am unbosoming myself to you. The sorrow, that is in my heart, is constantly enfeebling my mind.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं बाष्पदूषितलोचनः । बाष्पोपहतया वाचा नोच्चैः शक्नोति भाषितुम् ।।
data.es: His vision blurred, words choked with tears he was unable to speak further.
data.anv: एतावत् till that, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा spoken, बाष्पदूषितलोचनः vision blurred by tears, बाष्पदूषितया choked with tears, वाचा with words, उच्चैः loudly, भाषितुम् to speak further, न शक्नोति was not able to do.
data.md: Having proceeded thus far, he, his eyes filled with tears and his words faltering because of vapour, could not speak aloud.

data.v: बाष्पवेगं तु सहसा नदीवेगमिवागतम् । धारयामास धैर्येण सुग्रीवो रामसंनिधौ ।।
data.es: Quickly Sugriva controlled his tears streaming fast like the rushing river, with patience, Rama seated in front.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रामसन्निधौ in front of Rama, नदीवेगमिव like a rushing river, सहसा instantaneously, आगतम् flowing, बाष्पवेगम् fast flowing tears, धैर्येण with patience, धारयामास checked
data.md: Sugrīva suddenly restrained, before Rāma, the force of tears, like to the tide of a river.

data.v: संनिगृह्य तु तं बाष्पं प्रमृज्य नयने शुभे । विनिःश्वस्य च तेजस्वी राघवं पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Effulgent Sugriva controlled his tears, wiped his bright eyes, took deep breath and said to Rama:
data.anv: तेजस्वी  brilliant, सः he, तं बाष्पम् his tears, निगृह्य  controlled, शुभे auspicious, नयने eyes, प्रमृज्य wiped, विनिःश्वस्य took deep breath, राघवम् to Rama, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said
data.md: Having restrained his tears and wiped his fair eyes, that energetic one, sighing heavily, again went on,

data.v: पुराहं वलिना राम राज्यात्स्वादवरोपितः । परुषाणि च संश्राव्य निर्धूतोऽस्मि बलीयसा ।।
data.es: 'O Rama I was subjected to the harsh words of powerful Vali in the past when he uprooted me from the kingdom and threw me out.
data.anv: राम O Rama, पुरा in the past, अहम् I, बलीयसा powerful, वालिना by Vali, स्वात् from my  own, राज्यात् from the kingdom, अवरोपितः was uprooted, परुषाणि harsh (words), संश्राव्य making me listen, निर्धूतः thrown out, अस्मि I am.
data.md: Formerly, O Rāma, I was deprived of my kingdom and reproached in harsh language by the strong Vāli.

data.v: हृता भार्या च मे तेन प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसी । सुहृदश्च मदीया ये संयता बन्धनेषु ते ।।
data.es: 'I was robbed of my wife who is dearer than my own life. All my friends were rounded up and imprisoned.
data.anv: तेन by him, प्राणेभ्योऽपि than my own life, गरीयसी dearer, मे भार्या my wife, हृता robbed, मदीयाः my, ये whoever, सुहृदः friends, ते they, बन्धनेषु under arrest, संयताः imprisoned.
data.md: He also took away my wife dearer to me than life; and my friends have been imprisoned and been bound.

data.v: यत्नवांश्च सुदुष्टात्मा मद्विनाशाय राघव । बहुशस्तत्प्रयुक्ताश्च वानरा निहता मया ।।
data.es: 'O Rama this evilminded one made several attempts to kill me. The monkeys he sent to kill me were themselves killed.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, दुष्टात्मा evilminded, सः he was, मद्विनाशाय to kill me, यत्नवांश्च made effort, बहुशः in many ways, तत्प्रयुक्ताः  sent by him, वानराः monkeys, मया by myself, निहताः were killed.
data.md: That wicked wight, O Rāghava, seeks my life. Many monkeys commissioned by him have been slain by me.

data.v: शङ्कया त्वेतया चाहं दृष्ट्वा त्वामपि राघव । नोपसर्पाम्यहं भीतो भये सर्वे हि बिभ्यति ।।
data.es: 'It is because of suspicion that I did not approach you. Every one is scared when there is ample reason to fear.
data.anv: राघव Rama, अहं च I also, एतया by that, शङ्कया with doubt, त्वाम् अपि you also, इह here, दृष्ट्वा seeing, भीतः scared, नोपसर्पामि I did not come near, भये out of fear, सर्वे all, बिभ्यति हि one is scared.
data.md: It was, O Rāghava, in consequence of this fear that when I (first) saw you, I did not come out. This is all the fear that oppresses me.

data.v: केवलं हि सहाया मे हनुमत्प्रमुखास्त्विमे । अतोऽहं धारयाम्यद्य प्राणान्कृच्छ्र गतोऽपि सन् ।।
data.es: 'Only Hanuman and other chiefs are helping me. Therefore, I am surviving in spite of all difficulties.
data.anv: केवलम् only, इमे these, हनुमत्प्रमुखाः Hanuman and other chiefs, मे to me, सहायाः helpful ones, अतः therefore, अहम् I, कृच्छ्रगतोऽपि सन् in spite of all difficulties, अद्य now, प्राणान् life, धारयामि I am surviving.
data.md: My adherents are only these headed by Hanumān. It is for this that although reduced to the greatest straits I have been able to preserve my life.

data.v: एते हि कपयः स्निग्धा मां रक्षन्ति समन्ततः । सह गच्छन्ति गन्तव्ये नित्यं तिष्ठन्ति च स्थिते ।।
data.es: 'These monkeys out of love for me keep me protected from all sides. They go out with me when it is necessary and stay back whenever I stop (in order to guard me).
data.anv: स्निग्धाः affectionate, एते these, कपयः monkeys, माम् me, समन्ततः on all sides, रक्षन्ति protecting, गन्तव्ये  have to go, सह with any one, गच्छन्ति they go, स्थितौ stay when I stay, तिष्ठन्ति च stop.
data.md: These affectionate apes protect me on all sides. They go when I go, and stay when I stay.

data.v: संक्षेपस्त्वेष मे राम किमुक्त्वा विस्तरं हि ते । स मे ज्येष्ठो रिपुर्भ्राता वाली विश्रुतपौरुषः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama I tell you (my story) briefly. It is not necessary to go into details. My elder brother Vali, who is known for his prowess, is my enemy.
data.anv: राम O Rama, एषः this, मे my, सङ्क्षेपः in brief, ते to you, विस्तरम् in detail, उक्त्वा telling, किम् why, मे my, भ्राता brother, विश्रुतपौरुषः a man of wellknown prowess, सः वाली that Vali, रिपुः enemy.
data.md: Why should I expatiate? In brief, Vāli my elder brother, famed for his prowess, is my foe.

data.v: तद्विनाशाद्धि मे दुःखं प्रनष्टं स्यादनन्तरम् । सुखं मे जीवितं चैव तद्विनाशनिबन्धनम् ।।
data.es: 'My sorrow will go only with his death. My happiness and my life are also subject to his destruction.
data.anv: तद्विनाशाद्धि only after he is killed, अनन्तरम् thereafter, मे my, दुःखम् sorrow, प्रणष्टम् can vanish, स्यात् will be, मे my, सुखम् happiness, जीवितं चैव and life also, तद्विनाशनिबन्धनम् is subject to his destruction.
data.md: Even by his death my present pain would be removed. Both my life and my happiness are bound up with his death.

data.v: एष मे राम शोकान्तः शोकार्तेन निवेदितः । दुःखितोऽदुःखितो वापि सख्युर्नित्यं सखा गतिः ।।
data.es: 'This what I had to tell you out of sorrow. This is how my sorrow will end. In joy and in sorrow your friend is your refuge.
data.anv: राम Rama, शोकार्तेन out of sorrow, मे my, एषः this, शोकान्तः end the sorrow, निवेदितः  explained to you, सख्युः for a friend, दुःखितः unhappy, सुखितो वापि or happy, सखा a friend, गतिः is the only refuge.
data.md: I have, O Rāma, communicated to you, the way in which my grief might be removed. Whether in joy or in sorrow, a friend is the refuge of his friend.

data.v: श्रुत्वैतच्च वचो रामः सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत् । किंनिमित्तमभूद्वैरं श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: After hearing Sugriva, Rama said 'I wish to know the actual cause of this enmity.
data.anv: रामः Rama, एतत् these, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् he spoke, किं निमित्तम् for what reason, वैरम् enmity, अभूत् was caused, तत्त्वतः truly, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छामि I wish
data.md: Hearing these words, Rāma said to Sugrīva, What for arose hostility between yourself and Vāli? I wish to hear this (related) faithfully.

data.v: सुखं हि कारणं श्रुत्वा वैरस्य तव वानर । आनन्तर्यं विधास्यामि संप्रधार्य बलाबलम् ।।
data.es: 'On hearing the cause of your enmity and considering your strength and weakness, I will take steps to make you happy.
data.anv: वानर O monkey, तव your, वैरस्य enmity's, कारणम् cause, श्रुत्वा after hearing, बलाबलम् strength or weakness, सम्प्रधार्य after measuring, आनन्तर्यात् thereafter, सुखम् विधास्यामि I will take action to make you happy.
data.md: Having learnt the cause of your hostility, and ascertained your strength and weakness, I will, O monkey, understanding the irritation that has ensued, compass your happiness.

data.v: बलवान्हि ममामर्षः श्रुत्वा त्वामवमानितम् । वर्धते हृदयोत्कम्पी प्रावृड्वेग इवाम्भसः ।।
data.es: 'On hearing about your humiliation I feel highly agitated at heart. I feel very much angry and restless like the water in rainy season.
data.anv: त्वाम् your, अवमानितम् insulted, श्रुत्वा after hearing, मम my, हृदयोत्कम्पी heart is agitated, बलवान् strong, आमर्षः restless, अम्भसः rain water, प्रापृड्वेग इव  enraged , वर्तते feels
data.md: Great is my wrath, on hearing you disgraced; and like a down-pour in the rainy season my ire increases, shaking my very heart.

data.v: हृष्टः कथय विस्रब्धो यावदारोप्यते धनुः । सृष्टश्च हि मया बाणो निरस्तश्च रिपुस्तव ।।
data.es: 'Tell me freely and cheerfully before I string the bow. Your enemy will be destroyed as soon as I release my arrow.'
data.anv: मया by me, धनुः bow, यावत् until, आरोप्यते is strung, बाणः arrow, सृष्टश्च on the release, तव your, रिपुः enemy, निरस्तश्च will be destroyed, हृष्टः happily, विस्रब्धः freely, कथय speak.
data.md: Do you cheerfully and confidingly speak while I fix the string to my bow. As soon as my shaft is off, your foe is beaten.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवः काकुत्स्थेन महात्मना । प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे चतुर्भिः सह वानरैः ।।
data.es: When the great Rama said this, Sugriva with all the four monkeys felt immeasurably glad.
data.anv: महात्मना by the great, काकुत्स्थेन by Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः having been told, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, चतुर्भिः with all the four, वानरैः सह with monkeys, अतुलम् immeasurable, प्रहर्षम् joy, लेभे felt.
data.md: Thus addressed by the high-souled Käkutstha, Sugrīva, along with the four (other) monkeys, experienced exceeding delight.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टवदनः सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणाग्रजे । वैरस्य कारणं तत्त्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: With a smile on his face, Sugriva started narrating to Lakshmana's elder brother the facts about the cause of his enmity (with Vali).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टमस्सर्गःThus ends the eighth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, प्रहृष्टवदनः  smiling face, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, वैरस्य on account of enmity, कारणम् cause, तत्त्वम् facts, लक्ष्मणाग्रजे to the elder brother of Lakshmana, आख्यातुम् to tell, उपचक्रमे started.
data.md: Then with a cheerful countenance, Sugrīva began to unfold to Lakşmaņa's elder brother the cause of their hostility.

data.v: वाली नाम मम भ्राता ज्येष्ठः शत्रुनिषूदनः । पितुर्बहुमतो नित्यं मम चापि तथा पुरा ।।
data.es: 'My elder brother called Vali, capable of exterminating enemies was always highly regarded by my father and me.
data.anv: शत्रुनिषूदनः an exterminater of enemies, वाली नाम called Vali , मम my, ज्येष्ठः भ्राता elder brother, नित्यम् always, पितुः father, बहुमतः very highly regarded, पुरा earlier, मम चापि even me also, तथा that way.
data.md: My elder brother named Väli-destroyer of foes, was formerly highly, honoured both by my father and myself.

data.v: पितर्युपरतेऽस्माकं ज्येष्ठोऽयमिति मन्त्रिभिः । कपीनामीश्वरो राज्ये कृतः परमसंमतः ।।
data.anv: तस्मिन् he, पितरि my father, उपरते demise, अयम् this, ज्येष्ठः इति being  elder, राज्ये in the kingdom, परमसम्मतः with the acceptance of all, कपीनाम् ईश्वरः king of monkeys, मन्त्रिभिः including ministers, कृतः made.
data.md: At the death of our father, the counsellors, saying,-This is the eldest son', made him, who was well loved (of all), lord of the monkeys in the kingdom.

data.v: राज्यं प्रशासतस्तस्य पितृपैतामहं महत् । अहं सर्वेषु कालेषु प्रणतः प्रेष्यवत्स्थितः ।।
data.es: 'I served him obediently like a servant while he ruled over the great ancestral kingdom inherited by him.
data.anv: अहम् I, महत् great, पितृपैतामहम् inherited from ancestors, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रशासतः while he was ruling, तस्य his, सर्वेषु कालेषु at all times, प्रेष्यवत् like a servant, प्रणतः an obedient one, स्थितः remained.
data.md: While he was governing the kingdom which had belonged to his father and grand-father, I, at all times, in humiliation, remained like a servant.

data.v: मायावी नाम तेजस्वी पूर्वजो दुन्दुभेः सुतः । तेन तस्य महद्वैरं स्त्रीकृतं विश्रुतं पुरा ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi's eldest son Mayabi was a mighty demon. He developed bitter enmity with Vali for the sake of a woman.
data.anv: दुन्दभेः Dundubhi's, पूर्वजः elder, सुतः son, मायावी Mayavi, तेजस्वी a  mighty one, पुरा in the past, तस्य विश्श्रुतं wellknown about him, तेन by him, स्त्रीकृतम् for the sake of a woman, महत् bitter, वैरम् enmity.
data.md: There was one endued with energy, named Māyāvi. He was the eldest son of Dunduvī. Formerly there arose a mighty hostility between himself and Vali.

data.v: स तु सुप्ते जने रात्रौ किष्किन्धाद्वारमागतः । नर्दति स्म सुसंरब्धो वालिनं चाह्वयद्रणे ।।
data.es: 'One midnight when all were asleep, he (Mayabi) came to the entrance of Kishkinda screaming angrily and bellowing at Vali, challenging him to a duel.
data.anv: रात्रौ at night, जने people, सुप्ते were asleep, सः he, किष्किन्धाद्वारम् entrance of Kishkindha, आगतः came, सुसंरब्धः an agitated one, नर्दति स्म bellowing, वालिनम् Vali, रणे for war, आह्वयत् challenging.
data.md: It came to pass that one night when all had fallen asleep, (Māyāvi) coming to Kişkindhā, began to emit roars in great wrath, and challenged Väli to an encounter.

data.v: प्रसुप्तस्तु मम भ्राता नर्दितं भैरवस्वनम् । श्रुत्वा न ममृषे वाली निष्पपात जवात्तदा ।।
data.es: ' My brother Vali, who was asleep could not tolerate the frightful sound and jumped out of bed hastily.
data.anv: तदा  then, प्रसुप्त was sleeping, मम भ्राता my brother, वाली Vali, नर्दतः shouting, भैरवस्वनम् frightful sound, श्रुत्वा after hearing, न ममृषे  did not tolerate, जवात् hastily, निष्पपात jumped out.
data.md: My brother, who was fast asleep, hearing those dreadful yells, could not bear them; but at once rushed out vehemently.

data.v: स तु वै निःसृतः क्रोधात्तं हन्तुमसुरोत्तमम् । वार्यमाणस्ततः स्त्रीभिर्मया च प्रणतात्मना ।।
data.es: 'Enraged, he came out to kill the powerful demon even though I with the womenfolk (of the harem) tried to prevent him.
data.anv: ततः then, सः he, स्त्रीभिः by women, प्रणतात्मना by an obedient one, मया च and by me too, निवार्यमाणः  was prevented, तम् him, असुरोत्तमम् powerful demon, हन्तुम् to kill, क्रोधात् angrily, निःसृतः came out.
data.md: And as he rushed out in wrath, for the purpose of slaying that foremost of Asuras, he was opposed by his wives as well as myself, who humbled himself before him.

data.v: स तु निर्धूय सर्वान्नो निर्जगाम महाबलः । ततोऽहमपि सौहार्दान्निःसृतो वालिना सह ।।
data.es: 'That mighty warrior(Vali) came out, pushing aside all the womenfolk. I too followed him due to my affection towards him.
data.anv: महाबलः powerful, स तु he too, ताः सर्वाः all the women, निर्धूय pushing aside, निर्जगाम went, ततः then, अहमपि I too, सौहार्दात् out of love, वालिना सह accompanied Vali, निःसृतः came out (to support him).
data.md: But moving them aside, that exceedingly powerful one sallied out. Thereupon out of affection I also went out with Vāli.

data.v: स तु मे भ्रातरं दृष्ट्वा मां च दूरादवस्थितम् । असुरो जातसंत्रासः प्रदुद्राव तदा भृशम् ।।
data.es: 'On seeing my brother and me from a distance, the demon took to his heels scared.
data.anv: सः he, असुरः तु demon also, मे भ्रातरम् my brother, दूरात् from a distance, अवस्थितम् took my stand, मां च and us, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तदा then, भृशम् very much, जातसन्त्रासः felt scared, प्रदुद्राव ran
data.md: And seeing my brother and me present from a distance, the Asura, seized with a panic, fled with speed.

data.v: तस्मिन्द्रवति संत्रस्ते ह्यावां द्रुततरं गतौ । प्रकाशोऽपि कृतो मार्गश्चन्द्रेणोद्गच्छता तदा ।।
data.es: 'Frightened, he ran. We too chased him running faster. As the Moon was rising the path was welllit.
data.anv: सन्त्रस्ते when frightened, तस्मिन् him, द्रवति while running, आवाम् we also, द्रुततरम् faster, गतौ both went, तदा then, उद्गच्छता while rising, चन्द्रेण by the Moon, मार्गः the path, प्रकाशश्च was welllit, कृतः made.
data.md: And as he was rushing on in fear and when we had proceeded further, the moon arising, discovered the way.

data.v: स तृणैरावृतं दुर्गं धरण्या विवरं महत् । प्रविवेशासुरो वेगादावामासाद्य विष्ठितौ ।।
data.es: 'The demon entered into a hole (cave) covered with a heap of grass, difficult, therefore, of access. Both of us reached there and took position.
data.anv: सः असुरः that demon, धरण्याः on earth, दुर्गम् difficult passage, तृणैः by heaps of grass, आवृतम् covered, महत् great, विवरम् a hole, प्रविवेश entered, आवाम् both of us, आसाद्य reaching, विष्ठितौ we took position
data.md: And the Asura, coming by a capacious and impregnable hole covered with grass (on the surface), entered it amain; and we remained there.

data.v: तं प्रविष्टं रिपुं दृष्ट्वा बिलं रोषवशं गतः । मामुवाच तदा वाली वचनं क्षुभितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: 'Seeing the enemy entering the cave, Vali became wrathful and his senses were terribly disturbed.He said to me:
data.anv: तदा then, बिलम् hole, प्रविष्टम् entered, तं रिपुम् that enemy, दृष्ट्वा seeing, वाली Vali, रोषवशम् angry, गतः went, क्षुभितेन्द्रियः senses stirred, माम् to me, उवाच said.
data.md: Seeing his enemy enter the hole, Vāli, overcome by anger, and with his senses agitated, spoke to me, saying,

data.v: इह त्वं तिष्ठ सुग्रीव बिलद्वारि समाहितः । यावदत्र प्रविश्याहं निहन्मि समरे रिपुम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva wait here at the entrance of the cave and be on your alert until I enter this hole and kill the enemy'.
data.anv: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, अहम् I, तत्र there, प्रविश्य after entering, सहसा at once, रिपुम् the enemy, यावत् निहन्मि till I kill, समाहितः being alert, अद्य now, इह here, बिलद्वारि at the hole, तिष्ठ you wait, त्वम् yourself.
data.md: Do you, O Sugriva, carefully stay at the mouth of the hole, while I entering in, slay my foe in battle.

data.v: मया त्वेतद्वचः श्रुत्वा याचितः स परंतप । शापयित्वा च मां पद्भ्यां प्रविवेश बिलं तदा ।।
data.es: 'On hearing him, I begged the scorcher of enemies (Vali) that I would follow him, but he made me swear on his feet and entered the cave.
data.anv: एतत् this, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, मया me, याचितः begged, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, सः he, माम् me, पद्भ्याम् on his feet, शापयित्वा made me swear, महत् great, बिलम् cave, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: Hearing his speech, that subduer of foes was besought by me (for permission to enter the cave along with him). But making me swear by touching his feet he entered the cave.

data.v: तस्य प्रविष्टस्य बिलं साग्रः संवत्सरो गतः । स्थितस्य च मम द्वारि स कालो व्यत्यवर्तत ।।
data.anv: बिलम् cave, प्रविष्टस्य  him who entered, तस्य for him, साग्रः well over, संवत्सरज्ञ a year, गतः had passed, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of the cave, स्थितस्य was waiting, सः कालः all that year, व्यत्यवर्तत passed by.
data.md: After he had entered the cave, and as I remained at its mouth, a space of over a complete year rolled away.

data.v: अहं तु नष्टं तं ज्ञात्वा स्नेहादागतसंभ्रमः । भ्रातरं न हि पश्यामि पापशङ्कि च मे मनः ।।
data.es: 'Thinking him dead, I became agitated because of my love for him. My mind began to apprehend his death since I had not seen my brother for long.
data.anv: अहं तु I also, तम् him, नष्टम् dead, ज्ञात्वा after knowing, स्नेहात् due to love, आगत संभ्रमः became agitated, भ्रातरम् brother, न पश्यामि I have not seen, मे my, मनः mind, पापाशङ्कि च suspected.
data.md: And seized with sorrow (I reflected), 'As I do not see my brother, he must be lost—and my mind was alarmed, apprehending his death.

data.v: अथ दीर्घस्य कालस्य बिलात्तस्माद्विनिःसृतम् । सफेनं रुधिरं रक्तमहं दृष्ट्वा सुदुःखितः ।।
data.anv: अथ then, दीर्घस्य कालस्य after a long time, तस्मात् from that, बिलात् from the cave, विनिःसृतम् flowing down, सफेनम् along with foam, रुधिरम् blood, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, ततः then, अहम् I, भृशदुःखितः became very sad.
data.md: After a long time, I saw frothy blood issuing from the cave. There at I was greatly aggrieved.

data.v: नर्दतामसुराणां च ध्वनिर्मे श्रोत्रमागतः । निरस्तस्य च संग्रामे क्रोशतो निःस्वनो गुरोः ।।
data.es: 'I heard the roaring voices of the demons and not the yelling of my brother engaged in the duel.
data.anv: नर्दताम्  roaring voices, असुराणाम् of the demon, ध्वनिः sound, मे to me, श्रोत्रम् to the ear, आगतः came to, सङ्ग्रामे in war, रतस्त engaged, क्रोशतो वापि or not of a shouting, गुरोः of my brother, निस्स्वनः voice.
data.md: And roars of Asuras also reached my ears; but I could not hear the cries of my superior, engaged in conflict.

data.v: अहं त्ववगतो बुद्ध्या चिह्नैस्तैर्भ्रातरं हतम् । पिधाय च बिलद्वारं शिलया गिरिमात्रया । शोकार्तश्चोदकं कृत्वा किष्किन्धामागतः सखे ।।
data.es: 'O friend by those signs I understood that my brother was killed and concluding that way I blocked the entrance of the cave with a rock of the size of a mountain and offered oblations to my brother and came to Kishkinda. I intended to hide the fact of Vali's death. But the ministers came to know the truth with their efforts.
data.anv: सखे O friend, अहं तु I also, तैः by those, चिह्नैः by the signs, भ्रातरम् my brother, हतम्  killed, बुद्ध्या with my understanding, अवगतः  came to know, गिरिमात्रया of the size of a mountain, शिलया with a rock, बिलद्वारम् the entrance of the mountain, पिधाय blocking, च and, शोकार्तः immersed in sorrow, उदकं कृत्वा offering oblations, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkindha, आगतः came, मे  me, गूहमानस्य intending to hide the fact, मन्त्रिभिः by the ministers, तत्त्वम् truth, यत्नतः  efforts, श्रुतम् heard.
data.md: And from these signs concluding my brother to be slain, I, closing the mouth of the cavern with a crag, huge as a hill, and afflicted with grief, after performing his watery rites, came (back) to Kiskindha, O my friend. And although I carefully concealed (the matter), the counsellors heard it all.

data.v: गूहमानस्य मे तत्त्वं यत्नतो मन्त्रिभिः श्रुतम् । ततोऽहं तैः समागम्य समेतैरभिषेचितः ।।
राज्यं प्रशासतस्तस्य न्यायतो मम राघव । आजगाम रिपुं हत्वा वाली तमसुरोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'Then all the ministers assembled together and consecrated me. While I was ruling the kingdom lawfully, Vali, the monkey came back after killing the enemy demon.
data.anv: ततः then, समेतैः by those coming together, तैः by them, समागम्य having assembled, अहम् I, अभिषेचितः I was consecrated, राघव O Rama, तस्य मम to me (in such a condition), राज्यम् kingdom, न्यायतः lawfully, प्रशासतः while I was ruling, सः वानरः that monkey, रिपुम् enemy, दानवम् demon, हत्वा after killing, आजगाम came back.

data.v: अभिषिक्तं तु मां दृष्ट्वा क्रोधात्संरक्तलोचनः । मदीयान्मन्त्रिणो बद्ध्वा परुषं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: 'Seeing me on the throne, Vali became angry and his eyes turned red. He imprisoned my ministers and spoke to me harshly.
data.anv: अभिषिक्तम् consecrated, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, कोपात् angrily, संरक्तलोचनः with his eyes turned red, मदीयान् those belonging to me, मन्त्रिणः at the ministers, बद्ध्वा after imprisoning, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: निग्रहेऽपि समर्थस्य तं पापं प्रति राघव । न प्रावर्तत मे बुद्धिर्भ्रातृगौरवयन्त्रिता ।।
data.es: 'O Rama even though I was capable of restraining the sinner, my intellect did not let me do so out of respect for my brother.
data.anv: राघव Rama, निग्रहे in resistance, अपि also, समर्थस्य of a capable one, मे my, बुद्धि: intellect, भ्रातृगौरवयन्त्रिता controlled by my respect for my brother, तं पापं प्रति towards that sinner, न प्रावर्तत did not advance.

data.v: मानयंस्तं महात्मानं यथावच्चाभ्यवादयम् । उक्ताश्च नाशिषस्तेन संतुष्टेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: 'When my brother came back to the town after killing the enemy, I offered as usual my salutations to him. But he did not bless me wholeheartedly.
data.anv: मे भ्राता my brother, सः he, शत्रुम् enemy, हत्वा after killing, तदा then, पुरम् town, प्रविवेश he entered, महात्मानम् great man, तम् him, मानयन् while I respected, यथावत् as usual, अभ्यवादयम् I offered salutations, तेन by him, सन्तुष्टेन  gladly, अन्तरात्मना wholeheartedly, आशिषः blessings, नोक्ताः were not pronounced.
data.md: Having slain his foe, he then entered his city; and I, honouring that high-souled one, duly saluted him. He withal did not with a glad heart utter his benediction.

data.v: ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टं संरब्धं तमुपागतम् । अहं प्रसादयां चक्रे भ्रातरं प्रियकाम्यया ।।
data.es: 'I sought to appease my brother who arrived in an agitated state overpowered with anger.
data.anv: ततः then, अहम् I, क्रोधसमाविष्टम्  overpowered with anger, सम्रब्धम् agitated, उपागतम्  arrived, तं भ्रातरम् brother, प्रियकाम्यया to pacify, प्रसादयाञ्चक्रे I appeased.
data.md: Then wishing for my welfare I strove to propitiate my angry brother, wrought up with wrath, who was seated (there).

data.v: दिष्ट्यासि कुशली प्राप्तो निहतश्च त्वया रिपुः । अनाथस्य हि मे नाथस्त्वमेकोऽनाथनन्दनः ।।
data.es: 'By providence you have come back safe and the enemy has been killed. You are the only protector to an orphan which I am.
data.anv: अनाथनन्दन  compassionate to orphans, दिष्ट्या providence, त्वया by you, रिपुः enemy, निहतः is killed, कुशली safely, प्राप्तः असि have returned, अनाथस्य  to the orphan, मे  me, त्वम् you, एकः alone, नाथः are the saviour.
data.md: By good luck it is that you had come off safely; and that you had slain the foe. O you that rejoicest the forlorn, you are the only protector of me who am helpless.

data.v: इदं बहुशलाकं ते पूर्णचन्द्रमिवोदितम् । छत्रं सवालव्यजनं प्रतीच्छस्व मयोद्यतम् ।।
data.es: 'Here is the manyribbed parasol shining like the full Moon above the horizon and the yak's tailfan held by me.Pray accept it.
data.anv: ते to you, मया by me, धृतम् held, बहुशलाकम् having many ribs, उदितम् risen above, पूर्णचन्द्रमिव like the full Moon, सवालव्यजनम् Yak tailfans, इदम् this, छत्रम् parasol, प्रतीच्छस्व pray accept.
data.md: I hold this. umbrella furnished with many ribs, resembling the moon risen; as well as this chowrī containing hair,—do you accept my service.

data.v: त्वमेव राजा मानार्हः सदा चाहं यथापुरा । न्यासभूतमिदं राज्यं तव निर्यातयाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: You are the king, O worthy of honour; and I am, as before, ever (your servant). I was entrusted with regal power in consequence of your absence. This kingdom consisting of courtiers and citizens, remains now rid of its thorns. It was established in me as a trust. And I protected it as such.

data.v: मा च रोषं कृथाः सौम्य मयि शत्रुनिबर्हण । याचे त्वां शिरसा राजन्मया बद्धोऽयमञ्जलिः ।।
data.md: Do not get wroth, O miid one, O destroyer of foes, I beseech you with bent head, and, O king, with joined hands.

data.v: बलादस्मि समागम्य मन्त्रिभिः पुरवासिभिः । राजभावे नियुक्तोऽहं शून्यदेशजिगीषया ।।
data.es: 'O king I bow my head and beg you with folded hands. The ministers and citizens assembled and forced me to take charge, as the kingdom without a ruler was vulnerable to attack.'
data.anv: राजन् O king, शिरसा head bent, त्वाम् you, याचे I beg you, मया by myself, अयम् this, अञ्जलिः folded palms, बद्धः bound, मन्त्रिभिः by ministers, पुरवासिभिः by citizens, समागम्य having assembled, अहम् I, शून्यदेशजिगीषया kingdom without a king can be conquered, अस्मिन् in this, राजभावे as king, बलात् with pressure, नियुक्तः assigned.
data.md: With the view of preventing any one to wish to conquer this kingdom vacant (of its ruler the citizens and counsellors unanimously, by force, entrusted me with regal authority.

data.v: स्निग्धमेवं ब्रुवाणं मां स तु निर्भर्त्स्य वानरः । धिक्त्वामिति च मामुक्त्वा बहु तत्तदुवाच ह ।।
data.es: 'Even tnough I spoke to him with affection, Vali abused me in many words, saying, 'Fie on you'.
data.anv: सः वानरः that monkey, एवम् thus, स्निग्धम् affectionately, ब्रुवाणम् speaking, माम् me, निर्भर्त्स्य having abused, त्वाम् you are, धिक् reproached, इति च this way, उक्त्वा after saying, तत्तत् in various ways, बहु many (words), उवाच ह spoke
data.md: As I said this softly, the monkey reproaching me, said to me 'Fie on you,' and censured me greatly.

data.v: प्रकृतीश्च समानीय मन्त्रिणश्चैव संमतान् । मामाह सुहृदां मध्ये वाक्यं परमगर्हितम् ।।
data.es: 'Having invited ordinary people and favourite ministers he condemned me in the presence of friends.
data.anv: प्रकृतीश्चैव ordinary people, सम्मतान् whom he liked, मन्त्रिण श्चैव and ministers, समानीय having invited, सुहृदाम् of friends, मध्ये in the midst, माम् me, परमगर्हितम् contemptuous, वाक्यम् words, आह he spoke
data.md: And bringing together the subjects and favourite counsellors, spoke to me, before friends, highly improper words.

data.v: विदितं वो यथा रात्रौ मायावी स महासुरः । मां समाह्वयत क्रूरो युद्धाकाङ्क्षी सुदुर्मतिः ।।
data.es: 'You know very well how that wicked demon, Mayabi, that night challenged me angrily to a duel.
data.anv: सुदुर्मतिः wickedminded one, महासुरः great demon, मायावी Mayavi, क्रुद्धः angry one, युद्धाकाङ्क्षी wishing to tight, यथा as, रात्रौ In that night, माम् me, समाह्वयत challenged, वः to you, विदितं is known.
data.md: “You know that formerly one night the mighty Asura Mayavi, getting' enraged, challenged me (to a fight) desirous of an encounter with me.

data.v: तस्य तद्गर्जितं श्रुत्वा निःसृतोऽहं नृपालयात् । अनुयातश्च मां तूर्णमयं भ्राता सुदारुणः ।।
data.es: 'On hearing his words I came out of the royal abode quickly, followed by this wicked brother.
data.anv: तस्य his, तत् that, वचनम् words , श्रुत्वा after hearing, अहम् I, नृपालयात् from the royal abode, निःसृतः I came out, सुदारुणः terrific, अयम् this, भ्राता brother, तूर्णम् quickly, माम् me, अनुयातः followed.
data.md: Hearing his speech I sallied out of the palace, and was followed by this horrible brother of mine.

data.v: स तु दृष्ट्वैव मां रात्रौ सद्वितीयं महाबलः । प्राद्रवद्भयसंत्रस्तो वीक्ष्यावां तमनुद्रुतौ । अनुद्रुतस्तु वेगेन प्रविवेश महाबिलम् ।।
data.es: 'The powerful demon that night saw me followed by another advancing towards him and fled out of fear. When we chased him, he entered this huge cave in great speed.
data.anv: महाबलः powerful, सः he, रात्रौ that night, सद्वितीयम् followed by a second person, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा एव soon after seeing that, प्राद्रवत् he ran, समुपागतौ both advancing towards him, आवाम् both of us, वीक्ष्य after seeing, भयसन्त्रस्तः shaken with fear, वेगेन speedily, प्रविवेश entered, सः he, महाबिलम् huge cave, अनुद्रुत was chased.
data.md: Thereat seeing me with one to assist me, and finding that we had come upon him, that mighty Asura, fled, seized with fear. And fleeing on, he (at length) swiftly entered a huge hole.

data.v: तं प्रविष्टं विदित्वा तु सुघोरं सुमहद्बिलम् । अयमुक्तोऽथ मे भ्राता मया तु क्रूरदर्शनः ।।
data.es: 'When I saw the dreadful demon entering the great cave, I instructed this cruel brother of mine:
data.anv: सुघोरम् dreadful, तम् him, सुमहत् great, बिलम् hole, प्रविष्टम् entering, विदित्वा knowing, अथ thereafter, क्रूरदर्शनः with cruel looks, अयम् this, मम भ्राता my brother, मया by me, उक्तः has been told.
data.md: Knowing that he had entered that dreadful and large cave, I spoke to my brother of a crooked presence.

data.v: अहत्वा नास्ति मे शक्तिः प्रतिगन्तुमितः पुरीम् । बिलद्वारि प्रतीक्ष त्वं यावदेनं निहन्म्यहम् ।।
data.es: 'I cannot return from here without killing him. Wait at the entrance of the cave until I kill him. Look forward to my return.
data.anv: अहत्वा without killing him, इतः from this place, पुरीम् town, प्रतिगन्तुम् to return, मे to me, शक्तिः energy, नास्ति is not, अहम् I, एनम् him, यावत् till that time, हन्मि I kill and return, त्वम् you, बिलद्वारि at the entrance, प्रतीक्ष you may wait.
data.md: Without slaying (this Asura) I cannot return to the palace. Do you wait at the mouth of the cave while I slay him.

data.v: स्थितोऽयमिति मत्वा तु प्रविष्टोऽहं दुरासदम् । तं च मे मार्गमाणस्य गतः संवत्सरस्तदा ।।
data.es: 'Presuming that Sugriva was waiting there, I entered the formidable cave. While I was searching for the demon there, one year passed.
data.anv: अयम् this, स्थितः इति waiting there, मत्वा तु thinking like that, अहम् I, दुरासदम् formidable, प्रविष्टः entered, तदा then, तत्र there, तम् him, मार्गमाणस्य in the process of searching, मे for me, संवत्सरः गतः one year was over.
data.md: This one is stationed here-thinking thus, I entered that inaccessible cave. And as I searched (for the Asura), one entire year passed away.

data.v: स तु दृष्टो मया शत्रुरनिर्वेदाद्भयावहः । निहतश्च मया तत्र सोऽसुरो बन्धुभिः सह ।।
data.es: 'I could find that fearful enemy there and killed him along with his relatives without any difficulty.
data.anv: भयावहः fearful one, सः he, शत्रुः enemy, मया by me, अनिर्वेदात् without any difficulty, दृष्टः was seen, बन्धुभिः सह along with his relatives, तत्र there, मया by me, निहतः killed, च असुरः that demon.
data.md: That wicked wight who had roused my alarm in consequence of his disappearance, was (at length) slain by me in one day, along with his friends.

data.v: तस्यास्यात्तु प्रवृत्तेन रुधिरौघेण तद्बिलम् । पूर्णमासीद्दुराक्रामं स्तनतस्तस्य भूतले ।।
data.anv: भूतले on the ground, स्तनतः was roaring, तस्य his, आस्यात् from his mouth, प्रवृत्तेन due to emergence, रुधिरौघेण by the flow of blood, तत् बिलम् that cavern, पूर्णम् full, दुराक्रामम् आसीत् difficult to stay.
data.md: Then as he emitted yells in the subterranean region, the cave was filled with his blood and it became difficult to come out of it.

data.v: सूदयित्वा तु तं शत्रुं विक्रान्तं दुन्दुभेः सुतम् । निष्क्रामन्नेव पश्यामि बिलस्य पिहितं मुखम् ।।
data.anv: दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, सुतम् son, विक्रान्तम् valiant, तं शत्रुम् that enemy, सूदयित्वा after vanquishing, इह here, निष्क्रामम् as I returned, पश्यामि I could find, बिलस्य cavern, मुखम् entrance, पिहितम् was closed.
data.md: Having with ease slain my powerful foe, I could not find the outlet of the cavern, its mouth having been closed.

data.v: विक्रोशमानस्य तु मे सुग्रीवेति पुनः पुनः । यदा प्रतिवचो नास्ति ततोऽहं भृशदुःखितः ।।
data.es: 'When there was no response from Sugriva to my repeated call in distress I was very sad.
data.anv: सुग्रीवेति saying O Sugriva , पुनः पुनः again and again, विक्रोशमानस्य  shouting in distress, मे for me, यदा when, प्रतिवचः response, नास्ति was not heard, ततः then, अहम् I, भृशदुःखितः  very sad.
data.md: Then as I again and again cried Sugrīva, Sugrīva, I became exceedingly sorry for not receiving any reply.

data.v: पादप्रहारैस्तु मया बहुशस्तद्विदारितम् । ततोऽहं तेन निष्क्रम्य यथा पुनरुपागतः ।।
data.es: 'I kicked the boulder again and again till it yielded. I came out that way and arrived at the city.
data.anv: मया by me, बहुभिः by many, पादप्रहारैः kicks, विदारितम् broken, ततः then, अहम् I, तेन by that, यथा as, निष्क्रम्य after coming out, पुरः to city, उपागतः arrived.
data.md: Thereat I threw down the stone after striking it many times with my legs. Then coming out by its mouth, I have come to this city.

data.v: तत्रानेनास्मि संरुद्धो राज्यं मार्गयतात्मनः । सुग्रीवेण नृशंसेन विस्मृत्य भ्रातृसौहृदम् ।।
data.es: 'I was obstructed by wicked Sugriva who forgot his brotherly love and was desiring the kingdom, which belongs to me.'
data.anv: आत्मनः my own, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रार्थयता by desiring, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, नृशंसेन by the wicked one, अनेन by him, भ्रातृसौहृदम् brotherly love, विस्मृत्य forgetting, अहम् I, तत्र there, अस्मि I am, संरुध्दः I was obstructed
data.md: Seeking my kingdom, the crafty Sugrīva had shut me up there forgetting fraternal love.'

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु मां तत्र वस्त्रेणैकेन वानरः । तदा निर्वासयामास वाली विगतसाध्वसः ।।
data.es: 'When Vali, the monkey, spoke that way I remained unperturbed. He banished me with the only cloth I was wearing.
data.anv: वानरः monkey, वाली Vali, तत्र there, माम् me, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having spoken, विगतसाध्वसः unperturbed, तदा then, एकेन with a single, वस्त्रेण cloth, निर्वासयामास   banished me.
data.md: Saying this, that monkey, the shameless Vali, exiled me with a single cloth on.

data.v: तेनाहमपविद्धश्च हृतदारश्च राघव । तद्भयाच्च महीकृत्स्ना क्रान्तेयं सवनार्णवा ।।
data.es: 'O Rama my wife has been usurped. There is the fear of his attack. So I am roaming this entire earth, covered with forests and oceans.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, तेन on account of that, अपविद्धः attacked, हृतदारश्च stolen of my wife, अहम् I am, तद्भयात् by that fear, सवनार्णवा the entire forest and oceans, कृत्स्ना completely, इयं मही this earth, क्रान्ता is covered.

data.v: ऋश्यमूकं गिरिवरं भार्याहरणदुःखितः । प्रविष्टोऽस्मि दुराधर्षं वालिनः कारणान्तरे ।।
data.es: 'Tormented by the abduction of my wife by Vali, I came to the great Rishyamuka mountain inaccessible to Vali for some other reason.
data.anv: भार्याहरणदुःखितः tormented by the abduction of my wife, कारणान्तरे for some other reason, वालिनः for Vali, दुराधर्षम् inaccessible, गिरिवरम् great mountain, ऋष्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, प्रविष्टः अस्मि I have come.
data.md: O Rāghava, I have been discomfited by him, and been deprived of my wife. And from fear of him, I have wandered over the whole earth having forest and seas. And aggrieved in consequence of my having been deprived of my wife. I have (at length) entered this best of mountains, Rsyamuka, which for a certain reason* is incapable of being approached by Vali. *In consequence of Matanga's curse.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं वैरानुकथनं महत् । अनागसा मया प्राप्तं व्यसनं पश्य राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Rama I have given you this long, full account of the cause of our enmity. For no fault of mine I am suffering.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, एतत् this, महत् long, वैरानुकथनम् an account of the cause of our enmity, सर्वम् entirely, ते to you, आख्यातम् said, अनागसा for no fault, मया by me, प्रप्तम् befallen, व्यसनम् sorrow, पश्य see.
data.md: Thus have I mentioned to you the great cause of this hostility, O Rāghava, innocent as I am, I have come by this mighty misfortune.

data.v: वालिनस्तु भयार्तस्य सर्वलोकाभयंकर । कर्तुमर्हसि मे वीर प्रसादं तस्य निग्रहात् ।।
data.es: 'O reverend Kakutstha, I feel helpless with fear from Vali. Save me. You should release me free from fear.'
data.anv: सर्वलोकभयङ्कर वीर warrior, who can frighten the entire world, वीर hero, वालिनः Vali, भयार्तस्य of the frightened, मे for me, प्रसादम् grace, तस्य his, निग्रहात् by resisting, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि you may.
data.md: O you that inspirest the fear of all creatures, by chastising Vāli it behoveth you to grant your grace to me, who am tormented with fear in connection with Vali, O hero.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स तेजस्वी धर्मज्ञो धर्मसंहितम् । वचनं वक्तुमारेभे सुग्रीवं प्रहसन्निव ।।
data.es: The righteous and glorious Rama to whom dharma is very dear said to Sugriva with a gentle smile on his face, when he was entreated thus:
data.anv: एवम् that way, उक्तः spoken, धर्मज्ञः one who knows dharms, तेजस्वी glorious one, सः he, प्रहसन्निव as if joking with him, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, धर्मसंहितम् consistent with righteousness, वचनम् words, वक्तुम् to speak, आरेभे he started.
data.md: Thus addressed, the powerful Kākutstha, knowing righteousness, and devoted to virtue, answered Sugriva, smiling,

data.v: अमोघाः सूर्यसंकाशा ममेमे निशिताः शराः । तस्मिन्वालिनि दुर्वृत्ते पतिष्यन्ति रुषान्विताः ।।
data.es: 'These arrows covered with kanka feathers, sharp and straight at the tip, comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt are (burning bright) like the sun. Looking like angry serpents, they will unfailingly strike at the miscreant Vali soon.
data.anv: अमोघाः unfailing, सूर्यसङ्काशाः (bright) as the Sun, (रुषा अन्विता accompanied by anger), ममैते released by me, निशिताः sharp, मे शराः my arrows, दुर्वृत्ते on the evil doer, तस्मिन् वालिनि on that Vali, पतिष्यन्ति will descend.
data.md: These infallible sharpened shafts of inine, resembling the sun, feathered with the plumes of the Kanka, like to the thunderbolt of the great Indra, having sharp heads and even knots, like in infuriated serpents,-being let go with vehermence, shall alight upon the impious Vali.

data.v: यावत्तं न हि पश्येयं तव भार्यापहारिणम् । तावत्स जीवेत्पापात्मा वाली चारित्रदूषकः ।।
data.es: 'That sinful Vali who has abducted your wife and violated the moral code will live only as long I do not see him.
data.anv: तव your, भार्यापहारिणम् abducter of your wife, तम् him, यावत् until, न not, अभिपश्यामि I do not see, तावत् till that time, पापात्मा sinner, चारित्रदूषकः violater of the moral code, सः वाली that Vali, जीवेत्  live.
data.md: So long as you did not see that stealer of your wife, so long only shall the impious Väli of vile character, live.

data.v: आत्मानुमानात्पश्यामि मग्नं त्वां शोकसागरे । त्वामहं तारयिष्यामि कामं प्राप्स्यसि पुष्कलम् ।।
data.es: 'Inferring from my own experience, I see that you are immersed in an ocean of sorrow.I will help you cross over and fulfil your desire.'
data.anv: त्वाम् you, शोकसागरे in an ocean of sorrow, मग्नः immersed, आत्मानुमानात् due to my own sorrow, पश्यामि I see, त्वाम् you, अहम् I, तारयिष्यामि I will help you cross over, पुष्कलम् completely, कामम् desire, प्राप्स्यसि you will fulfil.
data.md: By what I myself feel, I see that you had sunk in a sea of sorrow. But I will deliver you; and you shall attain both your wife as well as this kingdom.

data.v: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा हर्षपौरुषवर्धनम् । सुग्रीवः पूजयां चक्रे राघवं प्रशशंस च ।।
data.es: On hearing his words that boosted his joy and vigour, Sugriva was immensely pleased and said these warm words.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गःThus ends the tenth sarga of Kishkindhakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तस्य his, हर्षपौरुषवर्धनम् boosting his joy and vigour, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, परमप्रीतः very pleased, सुमहत् great, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing that speech of his capable of enhancing joy and manliness, Sugrīva overjoyed, spoke those words informed with high sense.

data.v: असंशयं प्रज्वलितैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मर्मातिगैः शरैः । त्वं दहेः कुपितो लोकान्युगान्त इव भास्करः ।।
data.es: 'There is no doubt that your sharp, blazing arrows will pierce through the vital parts of the body once you are angry, just as the Sungod burns all worlds at the end of the Yuga.
data.anv: प्रज्वलितैः by blazing, तीक्ष्णैः by the sharp, मर्मातिगैः  go through vital parts, शरैः with arrows, कुपितः outraged one, त्वम् you, युगान्ते at the end of the Yuga, भास्करः इव like the Sun, लोकान् worlds, दहेः you many burn, असंशयम् no doubt.
data.md: Enraged, you, with your sharp and flaming shafts, capable of piercing into the vitals, canst burn up the worlds, like the sun at the universal dissolution.

data.v: वालिनः पौरुषं यत्तद्यच्च वीर्यं धृतिश्च या । तन्ममैकमनाः श्रुत्वा विधत्स्व यदनन्तरम् ।।
data.anv: वालिनः Vali's, यत् such, पौरुषम् manliness, तत् that, यत् वीर्यम् such valour, तत् that, या धृतिश्च courage, मम my, एकमनाः concentrate, श्रुत्वा on hearing, यत् which, अनन्तरम् after that, विधत्स्व  do what is to be done.
data.md: Heedfully hearing from me of Vali's strength, prowess and fortitude, do you afterwards, ascertain what is fit.

data.v: समुद्रात्पश्चिमात्पूर्वं दक्षिणादपि चोत्तरम् । क्रामत्यनुदिते सूर्ये वाली व्यपगतक्लमः ।।
data.es: 'In the early hours before Sunrise Vali crosses over the oceans from the west to the east and moving from south to north (performing sandhya) without getting fatigued.
data.anv: वाली Vali, व्यपगतक्लमः without getting tired, सूर्ये when the Sun, अनुदिते has not yet risen, पश्चिमात् from the west, समुद्रात् from the ocean, पूर्वम् east, दक्षिणात् from the south, उत्तरम् north, क्रामति crosses over.
data.md: Before the sun rises, Vāli can easily range the ocean from west to east and from south to north.

data.v: अग्राण्यारुह्य शैलानां शिखराणि महान्त्यपि । ऊर्ध्वमुत्क्षिप्य तरसा प्रतिगृह्णाति वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: 'Climbing up speedily, valiant Vali would catch the huge mountain peaks.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् valiant , शैलानाम् of the mountains, आग्राणि tops, आरुह्य ascending, महान्ति huge, शिखराणि peaks, तरसा speedily, ऊर्ध्वम् upward, उत्क्षिप्य climbing, प्रतिगृह्णाति catches.
data.md: Ascending the tops of mountains, Vāli possessed of prowess throws up their summits, and then again swiftly holds them.

data.v: बहवः सारवन्तश्च वनेषु विविधा द्रुमाः । वालिना तरसा भग्ना बलं प्रथयतात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'Vali would break several sturdy trees in the forest with his vigour and speed, exhibiting his strength.
data.anv: आत्मनः his, बलम् strength, प्रथयता exihibiting, वालिना by Vali, वनेषु in the forests, सारवन्तः sturdy, विविधाः several, बहवः many, द्रुमाः trees, तरसा with vigour, भग्नाः break
data.md: And displaying his strength, Vāli vehemently crushes in the woods various stout trees.

data.v: महिषो दुन्दुभिर्नाम कैलासशिखरप्रभः । बलं नागसहस्रस्य धारयामास वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: 'Massive like the shining peak of mount Kailas and valiant like the mightybuffalo in form, Dundubhi possessed the strength of a thousand elephants.
data.anv: कैलासशिखरप्रभः shining like the peak of mount Kailas, वीर्यवान् valiant one, महिषः mighty buffalo, दुन्दुभिः नाम by name Dundubhi, नागसहस्रस्य of a thousand elephants, बलम् strength, धारयामास possessed.
data.md: There was one assuming the shape of buffalo named Dundubhi, resembling in splendour the summit of Kailasa. That one possessed of prowess had the strength of an hundred elephants.

data.v: वीर्योत्सेकेन दुष्टात्मा वरदानाच्च मोहितः । जगाम स महाकायः समुद्रं सरितां पतिम् ।।
data.es: 'Wicked Dundubhi of huge body was proud of his valour and deluded by virtue of the boons, went to the ocean, the lord of rivers.
data.anv: वीर्योत्सेकेन proud of valour, वरदानात् by virtue of boons, मोहितः deluded, दुष्टात्मा wickedself, महाकायः of huge body, सः he (Dundubhi), सरितां पतिम् lord of rivers, समुद्रम् to ocean, जगाम went.
data.md: That wicked one of a gigantic body inflated by his prowess and blinded by the boon he had received once went to that lord of streams—the Sea.

data.v: ऊर्मिमन्तमतिक्रम्य सागरं रत्नसंचयम् । मम युद्धं प्रयच्छेति तमुवाच महार्णवम् ।।
data.es: 'Reaching the mighty ocean, he implored the sea with (high) waves and hoards of gems for a fight.
data.anv: ऊर्मिमन्तम् with waves, रत्नसञ्चयम् a hoarder of gems, सागरम् ocean, अभिक्रम्य after reaching, मह्यं to me, युद्धम् war, प्रयच्छ give, इति thus, तम् him, महार्णवम् mighty ocean, उवाच said.
data.md: Passing beyond the Sea, with waves upon him, and containing heaps of gemsji e said to the mighty deep-Grant me battle.

data.v: ततः समुद्रो धर्मात्मा समुत्थाय महाबलः । अब्रवीद्वचनं राजन्नसुरं कालचोदितम् ।।
data.es: 'O king, then the powerful and righteous king of the ocean came out and spoke to the demon (Dundubhi) who was driven to death by fate.'
data.anv: राजन् O king, ततः then, धर्मात्मा righteous self, महाबलः  powerful समुद्रः ocean, समुत्थाय  rising, कालचोदितम् driven to death by fate, असुरम् demon, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Thereat the righteous-souled and mighty Ocean arose and, O king, said these words to that Asura, who had been urged by Death.

data.v: समर्थो नास्मि ते दातुं युद्धं युद्धविशारद । श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि यस्ते युद्धं प्रदास्यति ।।
