data.es: 'You are proficient in warfare. I am not competent enough to challenge you to a duel. But I will name the one who can.
data.anv: युद्धविशारद O warrior proficient in war, ते to you, युद्धम् war, दातुम् to offer (challenge), समर्थः not capable, नास्मि I am not, यः he who, ते to you, युद्धम् war, प्रदास्यति will give, अभिधास्यामि I can name him, श्रूयताम् listen.
data.md: O you that are skilled in fight, I am not competent to offer you fight; but lister to me who will tell you who shall offer the fight.

data.v: शैलराजो महारण्ये तपस्विशरणं परम् । शंकरश्वशुरो नाम्ना हिमवानिति विश्रुतः ।।
data.es: 'Himavan, the supreme abode of ascetics is the fatherinlaw of Lord Siva. He is wellknown as king of mountains, who has, waterfalls, caves, caverns and great forests.He is competent to match your incomparable love for war.
data.anv: परम् supreme, तपस्विशरणम् abode of ascetics, शङ्करश्वशुरः fatherinlaw of lord Siva, हिमवानिति Himavan, नाम्ना by name, विश्रुतः wellknown, महाप्रस्रवणोपेतः great waterfalls, बहुकन्दरनिर्दरः many caves and caverns, शैलराजः king of mountains, महारण्ये in the great forest, सः he, समर्थः is competent, तव to you, अतुलाम् incomparable, प्रीतिम् love, कर्तुम् to do, आहवे in the war.
data.md: There is a monarch of mountains in a mighty forest,—the great refuge of asceticism, the worker of the weal (of all), an Asura, celebrated by the name of Himavān containing great cascades and furnished with many fountains and caves. He can compass your incomparable pleasure.

data.v: गुहा प्रस्रवणोपेतो बहुकन्दरनिर्झरः । स समर्थस्तव प्रीतिमतुलां कर्तुमाहवे ।।
data.es: 'Himavan, the supreme abode of ascetics is the fatherinlaw of Lord Siva. He is wellknown as king of mountains, who has, waterfalls, caves, caverns and great forests.He is competent to match your incomparable love for war.
data.anv: परम् supreme, तपस्विशरणम् abode of ascetics, शङ्करश्वशुरः fatherinlaw of lord Siva, हिमवानिति Himavan, नाम्ना by name, विश्रुतः wellknown, महाप्रस्रवणोपेतः great waterfalls, बहुकन्दरनिर्दरः many caves and caverns, शैलराजः king of mountains, महारण्ये in the great forest, सः he, समर्थः is competent, तव to you, अतुलाम् incomparable, प्रीतिम् love, कर्तुम् to do, आहवे in the war.

data.v: तं भीतमिति विज्ञाय समुद्रमसुरोत्तमः । हिमवद्वनमागच्छच्छरश्चापादिव च्युतः ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi, the most powerful of demons, aware that the ocean is frightened of him went swiftly to Himavan like an arrow released from a bow. He raised many huge white cliffs of the size of great elephants to the ground and roared.
data.anv: असुरोत्तमः best of demons, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, तम् him, समुद्रम् ocean, भीतः frightened, इति thus, विज्ञाय  knowing, चापात् from the bow, च्युतः released, शर इव arrowlike, हिमवद्वनम् forest of Himavan, आगम्य  reached, ततः then, तस्य गिरेः of that mountain, श्वेताः white, गजेन्द्र (like) elephants, विप्रला huge, शिलाः rocks, बहुधा several, भूमौ on the earth, चिक्षेप threw, विननाद roared, च also.

data.v: ततस्तस्य गिरेः श्वेता गजेन्द्रविपुलाः शिलाः । चिक्षेप बहुधा भूमौ दुन्दुभिर्विननाद च ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi, the most powerful of demons, aware that the ocean is frightened of him went swiftly to Himavan like an arrow released from a bow. He raised many huge white cliffs of the size of great elephants to the ground and roared.
data.anv: असुरोत्तमः best of demons, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, तम् him, समुद्रम् ocean, भीतः frightened, इति thus, विज्ञाय  knowing, चापात् from the bow, च्युतः released, शर इव arrowlike, हिमवद्वनम् forest of Himavan, आगम्य  reached, ततः then, तस्य गिरेः of that mountain, श्वेताः white, गजेन्द्र (like) elephants, विप्रला huge, शिलाः rocks, बहुधा several, भूमौ on the earth, चिक्षेप threw, विननाद roared, च also.
data.md: Concluding that the ocean was afraid, that foremost of Asuras, presented himself in the wood of Himavān, like a shaft shot from a bow. Thereupon Dundhubhi began to throw down many white crags resembling the foremost of elephants; and sent up shouts.

data.v: ततः श्वेताम्बुदाकारः सौम्यः प्रीतिकराकृतिः । हिमवानब्रवीद्वाक्यं स्व एव शिखरे स्थितः ।।
data.es: 'Then the gentle Himavan of pleasing appearance stood in the form of a white cloud on the peak and spoke:
data.anv: ततः then, श्वेताम्बुदाकारः in a white cloudlike form, सौम्यः a gentle one, प्रीतिकराकृतिः one who has a pleasing appearance, हिमवान् Himavan, स्वे on his own,  शिखरे एव on the peak, स्थितः he stood, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Then resembling white clouds, mild and possessed of a pleasing shape, Himavan, stationed on the summit, spoke,

data.v: क्लेष्टुमर्हसि मां न त्वं दुन्दुभे धर्मवत्सल । रणकर्मस्वकुशलस्तपस्विशरणं ह्यहम् ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi, it is not proper for you to trouble me, for I am devoted to righteousness. I am the resort of ascetics and not adept in warfare'.
data.anv: धर्मवत्सल devoted to dharma, दुन्दुभे Dundubhi, त्वम् you, माम् me, क्लेष्टुम् to trouble, नार्हसि it is not proper, तपस्विशरणम्  the resort of ascetics, अहम् I am, रणकर्मसु to wage war, अकुशलः हि not adept
data.md: O Dundhubhi, O you that are attached to righteousness, it behoveth you not to distress me. I am the refuge of all those ascetics who are not expert in military arts.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा गिरिराजस्य धीमतः । उवाच दुन्दुभिर्वाक्यं क्रोधात्संरक्तलोचनः ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi whose eyes turned red in anger when he heard the words of Vali ,the wise king of the monkeys, said:
data.anv: दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, धीमतः of the wise one, तस्य गिरिराजस्य of that king of mountains, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, क्रोधात् angrily, संरक्तलोचनः with eyes turned red, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.
data.md: Hearing those words of that intelligent lord of mountains Dundhubhi, with reddened eyes, said.

data.v: यदि युद्धेऽसमर्थस्त्वं मद्भयाद्वा निरुद्यमः । तमाचक्ष्व प्रदद्यान्मे योऽद्य युद्धं युयुत्सतः ।।
data.es: 'If you are unable or unwilling to fight me out of fear, tell me who wants to challenge me to a duel.
data.anv: त्वम् you, युद्धे in a duel, असमर्थः यदि if in capable, वा or else, मद्भयात् due to fear of me, निरुद्यमः unwilling, यः whosoever, युयुत्सतः wants to fight, मे with me, युद्धम् duel, प्रदद्यात् give me a challenge, समाचक्ष्व tell me.
data.md: Afraid of me and hence void of energy if you are incapable of fighting with me, do you name him who is ready to fight with me who am desirous of entering into conflict.

data.v: हिमवानब्रवीद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा वाक्यविशारदः । अनुक्तपूर्वं धर्मात्मा क्रोधात्तमसुरोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'On hearing such words, which no one had spoken earlier, righteous Himavan, skilful in conversation, flew into a rage and said to Dundubhi,the best of demons:
data.anv: वाक्यविशारदः skilful in conversation, धर्मात्मा righteous, हिमवान् Himavan, श्रुत्वा on hearing, तम् him, असुरोत्तमम् best of demon, क्रोधात् in anger, अनुक्तपूर्वम् had not spoken earlier, वाक्यम् such words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing these words the virtuous-souled Himavān, skilled in speech, spoke to that great Asura, exercised with ire.

data.v: वाली नाम महाप्राज्ञः शक्रतुल्यपराक्रमः । अध्यास्ते वानरः श्रीमान्किष्किन्धामतुलप्रभाम् ।।
data.es: 'Vali, son of Indra, is a wise, powerful and prosperous monkey. He resides at Kishkinda, a city of incomparable glory.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञः wise one, शक्रपुत्रः son of Indra, प्रतापवान् powerful, श्रीमान् prosperous one,   वाली नाम Vali by name, वानरः monkey, अतुलप्रभाम् of incomparable glory, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkindha, अध्यास्ते residing.
data.md: O greatly wise one, there lives in Kişkindhā, of incomparable beauty, the mighty and highly graceful monkey—the son of Sakra, by name Vali.

data.v: स समर्थो महाप्राज्ञस्तव युद्धविशारदः । द्वन्द्वयुद्धं महद्दातुं नमुचेरिव वासवः ।।
data.es: 'Vali is profoundly wise, an expert in warfare. He is capable of challenging you to a duel like Indra to Namuchi.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञः wise, युद्धविशारदः expert in warfare, सः he, वासवः Indra, नमुचेरिव like Namuchi, तव to you, महत् great, द्वन्द्वयुद्धम् duel, दातुम् to give (challenge), समर्थः competent.
data.md: That mighty wise one, skilled in warfare, is capable of fighting with you on equal terms like to Namuci with Vasava.

data.v: तं शीघ्रमभिगच्छ त्वं यदि युद्धमिहेच्छसि । स हि दुर्धर्षणो नित्यं शूरः समरकर्मणि ।।
data.es: 'If you wish to fight, go to him quickly.He is ever heroic and difficult to combat.
data.anv: इह now, युद्धम् fight, इच्छसि यदि if you want to fight, त्वम् you, शीघ्रम् quickly, तम् him, अभिगच्छ  go now, शूरः heroic, सः he, नित्यम् ever, समरकर्मणि in warfare, दुर्धर्षणः हि difficult to combat.
data.md: Do you speedily repair to him if did you wish for a conflict. He is always expert in military exploits and is hard to repress.

data.v: श्रुत्वा हिमवतो वाक्यं क्रोधाविष्टः स दुन्दुभिः । जगाम तां पुरीं तस्य किष्किन्धां वालिनस्तदा ।।
data.es: 'Having heard Himavan, Dundubhi, seized with anger, went to Kishkindha, the city of Vali.
data.anv: तदा then, सः दुन्दुभिः that Dundubhi, हिमवतः Himavan's, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, कोपाविष्टः seized with anger, तस्य his वालिनः Vali's, पुरीम् city, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, जगाम went.
data.md: Hearing Himavān's Himavān's words, Dundhubhi, inflamed with ire, went to Kişkindhā—Vāli's capital.

data.v: धारयन्माहिषं रूपं तीक्ष्णशृङ्गो भयावहः । प्रावृषीव महामेघस्तोयपूर्णो नभस्तले ।।
data.es: 'Mighty Dundubhi assuming the form of a frightening buffalo with pointed horns looking like a huge, dark raincloud in the sky in monsoon marched to the entrance of Kishkinda and roared like a wardrum as if shaking the earth.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, माहिषम् buffalo, रूपम् form, धारयन् assuming, तीक्ष्णशृङ्गः  pointed horns, भयावहः frightening, प्रावृषि in rainy season, नभस्तले in the sky, तोयपूर्णः laden with water, महामेघ इव like a huge cloud, किष्किन्धायाः Kishkinda's, द्वारम् entrance, आगम्य reached, भूमिम् earth, कम्पयन् shaking, दुन्दुभिर्यथा like Dundubhi a wardrum, ननर्द roared.
data.md: Assuming the figure of a terrible buffalo, with sharpened horns like to a cloud big with water, ranging on the sky in the rainy season, and approaching the gate of Kişkindhā that highly powerful one set up a terrible roar, shaking the earth like to the sound of a kettle-drum.

data.v: ततस्तु द्वारमागम्य किष्किन्धाया महाबलः । ननर्द कम्पयन्भूमिं दुन्दुभिर्दुन्दुभिर्यथा ।।
data.es: 'Mighty Dundubhi assuming the form of a frightening buffalo with pointed horns looking like a huge, dark raincloud in the sky in monsoon marched to the entrance of Kishkinda and roared like a wardrum as if shaking the earth.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, माहिषम् buffalo, रूपम् form, धारयन् assuming, तीक्ष्णशृङ्गः  pointed horns, भयावहः frightening, प्रावृषि in rainy season, नभस्तले in the sky, तोयपूर्णः laden with water, महामेघ इव like a huge cloud, किष्किन्धायाः Kishkinda's, द्वारम् entrance, आगम्य reached, भूमिम् earth, कम्पयन् shaking, दुन्दुभिर्यथा like Dundubhi a wardrum, ननर्द roared.
data.md: Assuming the figure of a terrible buffalo, with sharpened horns like to a cloud big with water, ranging on the sky in the rainy season, and approaching the gate of Kişkindhā that highly powerful one set up a terrible roar, shaking the earth like to the sound of a kettle-drum.

data.v: समीपजान्द्रुमान्भञ्जन्वसुधां दारयन्खुरैः । विषाणेनोल्लेखन्दर्पात्तद्द्वारं द्विरदो यथा ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi felled the trees nearby, rent the earth with its hoofs, scratched the entrance gate of the city as an elephant would do with its horns in arrogance.
data.anv: समीपस्थान् nearby, द्रुमान् trees, भञ्जन् felling, वसुधाम् earth, खुरैः with hoofs, दारयन् breaking, दर्पात् arrogantly, विषाणेन by the horn, तद्वारम् that entrance, द्विरदो यथा like an elephant, उल्लिखन् digging.
data.md: Like to an elephant he felled, out of haughtiness, the trees around, and rent the earth with his hoofs scraping it with his horns.

data.v: अन्तःपुरगतो वाली श्रुत्वा शब्दममर्षणः । निष्पपात सह स्त्रीभिस्ताराभिरिव चन्द्रमाः ।।
data.es: 'Unable to tolerate the sound, Vali jumped out of the harem along with the women like the Moon with stars.
data.anv: अन्तःपुरगतः in the harem, वाली Vali, शब्दम् sound, श्रुत्वा  hearing, अमर्षणः intolereable, ताराभिः stars also, चन्द्रमाः Moon, स्त्रीभिः with women, निष्पपात jumped out.
data.md: Vāli was in the female-apartment at that time, and unable to bear the sound came out with his wives like to the Moon with stars.

data.v: मितं व्यक्ताक्षरपदं तमुवाच स दुन्दुभिम् । हरीणामीश्वरो वाली सर्वेषां वनचारिणाम् ।।
data.es: 'Vali, king of the monkeys who roam the forest, saw Dundubhi and addressed, but briefly:
data.anv: वनचारिणाम् forestrangers, सर्वेषाम् for all, हरीणाम् of monkeys, ईश्वरः king, (सः वाली that Vali), दुन्दुभिम् to Dundubhi, व्यक्ताक्षरपदम् a brief statement, मितम् in limited words, उवाच said.
data.md: Thereupon thạt lord of monkeys and other wild anànals, spoke openly to Dundhubhi, saying,

data.v: किमर्थं नगरद्वारमिदं रुद्ध्वा विनर्दसि । दुन्दुभे विदितो मेऽसि रक्ष प्राणान्महाबल ।।
data.es: 'O Dundubhi why are you roaring, blocking the entrance of the city? I know you are powerful. Go and save your life.'
data.anv: दुन्दुभे O Dundubhi, इदम् this, नगरद्वारम् entrance of the city, रुध्द्वा  blocking, किमर्थम् for what reason, विनर्दसि are you roaring, मे to me, विदितः known, असि you are,महाबल O powerful one, प्राणान् life, रक्ष you may protect.
data.md: O Dundhubhi, obstructing this my city-gate, why did you set up a terrible roar? Did you know my mighty strength? Do you save your own life.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वानरेन्द्रस्य धीमतः । उवाच दुन्दुभिर्वाक्यं क्रोधात्संरक्तलोचनः ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi whose eyes turned red in anger when he heard the words of Vali ,the wise king of the monkeys, said:
data.anv: धीमतः wise, तस्य his, वानरेन्द्रस्य of the king of monkeys, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा  hearing, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, रोषात् angrily, संरक्तलोचनः eyes turned red, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said
data.md: Hearing those words of that intelligent lord of mountains Dundhubhi, with reddened eyes, said.

data.v: न त्वं स्त्रीसंनिधौ वीर वचनं वक्तुमर्हसि । मम युद्धं प्रयच्छ त्वं ततो ज्ञास्यामि ते बलम् ।।
data.es: 'O hero speaking such words in the presence of women is not proper. Come to me for a combat and I will let you know your strength.
data.anv: वीर hero, त्वम् you, स्त्रीसन्निधौ in the presence of women, वचनम् words, वक्तुम् to speak, नार्हसि not proper for you, अद्य to day, मम to me, युद्धम् war, प्रयच्छ you may give, ततः then, ते your, बलम् strength, ज्ञास्यामि I will let you know.
data.md: O hero, it becomes you not to speak thus before your wives. Do you enter into conflict with me and your prowess shall be ascertained thereafter.

data.v: अथ वा धारयिष्यामि क्रोधमद्य निशामिमाम् । गृह्यतामुदयः स्वैरं कामभोगेषु वानर ।।
data.es: 'O monkey I will restrain my anger tonight and give you time for your indulgence in sensual pleasures till morning.
data.anv: वानर O monkey, अथवा or else, अद्य now, इमाम् this, निशाम् night, क्रोधम् anger, धारयिष्यामि I will control,  स्वैरम् freedom, कामभोगेषु for your sensual pleasures, उदयः morning, गृह्यताम् I will give you time.
data.md: Or I shall suppress my wrath for this night and do you, O monkey, enjoy till the rise of the Sun.

data.v: यो हि मत्तं प्रमत्तं वा सुप्तं वा रहितं भृशम् । हन्यात्स भ्रूणहा लोके त्वद्विधं मदमोहितम् ।।
data.es: 'Whoever kills a person, who is drunk or is heedless or is asleep or without weapons or stupified by lust in this world, is equal to a killer of a foetus in the womb.'
data.anv: यः whoever, मत्तम् drunk, प्रमत्तं वा or heedless, सुप्तं वा or sleeping, रहितम् or without weapons, भृशम् greatly, मदमोहितम् stupified by lust, हन्यात् if killed, सः he, लोके in the world, भ्रूणहा हि is a killer of foetus in the womb.
data.md: He, who destroyeth a person who is given up to drinking, reckless, emaciated and deprived of weapons, and one like you, sunk in the abyss of voluptuousness, committeth the sin consequent upon the destruction of an embryo,

data.v: स प्रहस्याब्रवीन्मन्दं क्रोधात्तमसुरोत्तमम् । विसृज्य ताः स्त्रियः सर्वास्ताराप्रभृतिकास्तदा ।।
data.es: 'Then, Vali sent away Tara and all other women slowly and replied angrily to the foolish demon with a mischievous smile:
data.anv: तदा then, सः he, प्रहस्य laughing, ताराप्रभृतिकाः Tara and others, ताः those, सर्वाः all, स्त्रियः women, विसृज्य having sent away, मन्दम् slowly, तम् him, असुरोत्तमम् best of demons, क्रोधात् angrily, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Where to replied Vāli, laughing, to that wicked lord of Asuras, leaving aside all his wives, headed by Tārā.

data.v: मत्तोऽयमिति मा मंस्था यद्यभीतोऽसि संयुगे । मदोऽयं संप्रहारेऽस्मिन्वीरपानं समर्थ्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'Do not consider me drunken. This drink will serve as a warrior's drink in the combat. Be ready, if you are not afraid of a combat.'
data.anv: अयम् this, मत्तः a drunken person, इति thus, मा मंस्थाः do not think, संयुगे in the combat, अभीतः not afraid, असि यदि if you are, अयम् this, मदः drunkeness, अस्मिन्  सम्प्रहारे in striking you, वीरपानम् warrior's drink (sharpening a warrior's skill), समर्थ्यताम् consider.
data.md: If you are not afraid of fighting, do not consider me as one given up to drinking only. Do you regard this my attachment as a draught in this conflict, to be drunk by the heroes.

data.v: तमेवमुक्त्वा संक्रुद्धो मालामुत्क्षिप्य काञ्चनीम् । पित्रा दत्तां महेन्द्रेण युद्धाय व्यवतिष्ठत ।।
data.es: 'Having addressed thus in a rage, Vali removed the golden garland gifted by Indra, his father, and stood ready for the combat.
data.anv: तम् him, एवम् that way, उक्त्वा having spoken, सङ्कृद्धः angry, पित्रा by his father, महेन्द्रेण by Indra, दत्ताम् gifted, काञ्चनीम् golden, मालाम् garland, उत्क्षिप्य removed, युद्धाय for the combat, व्यवतिष्ठत stood ready
data.md: Saying this, Vāli, taking his golden garland, conferred on him by his father Mahendra, addressed himself for the conflict.

data.v: विषाणयोर्गृहीत्वा तं दुन्दुभिं गिरिसंनिभम् । वाली व्यापातयां चक्रे ननर्द च महास्वनम् ।।
data.es: 'Vali, the elephantlike monkey then held the mountainlike Dundubhi by the horns and struck him down, roaring loudly.
data.anv: तदा then, कपिकुञ्जरः elephantlike monkey, वाली Vali, गिरिसन्निभम् resembling a mountain, तम् him, दुन्दुभिम् Dundubhi, विषाणयोः by horns, गृहीत्वा  held, विनदन् roaring loudly, आविध्यत struck down.
data.md: Holding him by the horns, Vāli, that lord of monkeys, setting up a terrible roar, hurled Dundhubhi resembling a mountain.

data.v: युद्धे प्राणहरे तस्मिन्निष्पिष्टो दुन्दुभिस्तदा । श्रोत्राभ्यामथ रक्तं तु तस्य सुस्राव पात्यतः । पपात च महाकायः क्षितौ पञ्चत्वमागतः ।।
data.es: In the fight, Dundubhi fell down, with his strength, courage and prowess dwindled. Vali lifted his huge body and dashed it down on the ground. The body of Dundubhi dissolved into the five elements.
data.anv: व्यापारवीर्यधैर्यै in effort, strength and courage, पराक्रमैः in prowess as well, परिक्षीणं deterioration, तम् Vali, दुन्दुभिम् Dundubhi, उद्यम्य having lifted, धरण्याम् on the ground, अभ्यपातयत् hit down, तदा then, प्राणहरे in the deadly, तस्मिन् in that, युद्धे fight, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, निष्पिष्ट: crushed, पातयतः thrown down, तस्य his, महाकायः of huge body, पञ्चत्वम् resolved into the five elements (dead), आगतः go, क्षितौ on the ground, पपात fell down.
data.md: There was a profusion of blood falling from the ears of that one crushed down. Thereupon that one of mighty arms fell down to the earth and breathed his last.

data.v: तं तोलयित्वा बाहुभ्यां गतसत्त्वमचेतनम् । चिक्षेप वेगवान्वाली वेगेनैकेन योजनम् ।।
data.es: 'Mighty Vali lifted on both shoulders the insensate body drained of life and hurled it speedily to a distance of a yojana.
data.anv: बलवान् powerful, वाली Vali, गतसत्त्वम् life drained, अचेतनम् lost consciousness, तम् him, बाहुभ्याम् with both shoulders, तोलयित्वा after lifting, एकेन in one piece, वेगेन with speed, योजनम् distance of a yojana (eight miles), चिक्षेप hurled.
data.md: And taking up with his arms that lifeless one, the mighty Vāli hurled him with great force at distance of a Yojana.

data.v: तस्य वेगप्रविद्धस्य वक्त्रात्क्षतजबिन्दवः । प्रपेतुर्मारुतोत्क्षिप्ता मतङ्गस्याश्रमं प्रति ।।
data.es: 'Scattered by the wind, drops of blood fell at the hermitage of Matanga from the mouth of the deadbody flung.
data.anv: वेगप्रविद्धस्य flung, तस्य his, वक्त्रात् from the mouth, क्षतजबिन्दवः drops of blood, मारुतोत्क्षिप्ताः scattered by the wind, मतङ्गस्य Matanga's, आश्रमं प्रति at the hermitage of, प्रपेतुः fell.
data.md: While thus thrown down by force, drops of blood, falling from his mouth, driven by the wind, fell upon the asylum of the great Saint Matanga.

data.v: तान्दृष्ट्वा पतितांस्तत्र मुनिः शोणितविप्रुषः । उत्ससर्ज महाशापं क्षेप्तारं वालिनं प्रति । इह तेनाप्रवेष्टव्यं प्रविष्टस्य बधो भवेत् ।।
स महर्षिं समासाद्य याचते स्म कृताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: 'On hearing the monkeys, Vali went to the sage and begged forgiveness with folded hands.
data.anv: तदा then, सः वाली that Vali, वानरेरितम् spoken by monkeys, एतत् all that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, कृताञ्जलिः with folded hands, महर्षिम् to the sage, (सम्) आसाद्य having approached, याचते स्म begged.
data.md: Hearing those words, Vāli approached that great ascetic and solicited him with folded hands.

data.v: ततः शापभयाद्भीत ऋश्यमूकं महागिरिम् । प्रवेष्टुं नेच्छति हरिर्द्रष्टुं वापि नरेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O Lord Rama because of the fear of the curse, Vali will not enter the great Rishyamuka mountain nor will he like to see it.
data.anv: नरेश्वर O Lord Rama, ततः then onwards, हरिः monkeys, शापभयात् for fear of the curse, भीतः frightened, महागिरिम् great mountain, ऋष्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, प्रवेष्टुम् to enter, द्रष्टुं वापि even to see, नेच्छति does not like.
data.md: O Lord of men, afraid of the curse that monkey chief purposed to repair to the mount Rş yamuka. Knowing for certain, O Rāma, that he shall not enter this forest, I have been living here with my ministers, devoid of fear and grief.

data.v: तस्याप्रवेशं ज्ञात्वाहमिदं राम महावनम् । विचरामि सहामात्यो विषादेन विवर्जितः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama aware of the prohibition of Vali from entering the place, I roam about this great forest accompanied by my ministers without any apprehension.
data.anv: राम O Rama, अहम् I, तस्य his, अप्रवेशम् entry prohibited, ज्ञात्वा after knowing, विषादेन apprehension, विवर्जितः without, सहामात्यः accompanied by ministers, इदम् this, महावनम् great forest, विचरामि I am roaming about.
data.md: O Lord of men, afraid of the curse that monkey chief purposed to repair to the mount Rş yamuka. Knowing for certain, O Rāma, that he shall not enter this forest, I have been living here with my ministers, devoid of fear and grief.

data.v: एषोऽस्थिनिचयस्तस्य दुन्दुभेः संप्रकाशते । वीर्योत्सेकान्निरस्तस्य गिरिकूटनिभो महान् ।।
data.es: 'Hurled with the pride of his(Vali's) prowess is this heap of bones of Dundubhi here, which shines like a huge mountain peak.
data.anv: वीर्योत्सेकात् with pride of prowess, निरस्तस्य thrown away, तस्य दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, गिरिकूटोपमो as the mountain peak, महान् huge, एषः this, अस्थिनिचयः heap of bones, सम्प्रकाशते is shining
data.md: Here is the collection of Dundhuvi's bones, killed on account of his own haughtiness, resembling a huge mountain.

data.v: इमे च विपुलाः सालाः सप्त शाखावलम्बिनः । यत्रैकं घटते वाली निष्पत्रयितुमोजसा ।।
data.es: 'Look at these seven sturdy Sala trees with branches of one overlapping the other. Vali was able to remove all the leaves of one Sala tree with just one arrow.
data.anv: शाखावलम्बिनः  branches overlapping one another, इमे these, सप्त seven, विपुलाः sturdy, सालाः Sala trees, यत्र there, एकम् one, वाली Vali, ओजसा his own, निष्पत्रयितुम् to remove its leaves, घटते he is competent.
data.md: These are the seven huge Sāla trees, clothed in branches, which Vāli could simultaneously divest of leaves by virtue of his prowess.

data.v: एतदस्यासमं वीर्यं मया राम प्रकाशितम् । कथं तं वालिनं हन्तुं समरे शक्ष्यसे नृप ।।
data.es: 'O Rama Vali's strength and fame related by me is unequalled. O king how is it possible for you to kill him in a combat?'
data.anv: राम O Rama, अस्य his, असमम् unequalled, एतत् this, वीर्यम् strength, प्रकीर्तितम् is narrated, नृप king, समरे in a combat, तं वालिनम् that Vali's, हन्तुम् to kill, कथम् how is it, शक्ष्यसे it is possible for you?
data.md: I have related to you, O Rāma, the incomparable prowess of his. Do you tell me now, O hero, how canst you destroy him in the conflict?

data.v: यदि भिन्द्याद्भवान्सालानिमांस्त्वेकेषुणा ततः । जानीयां त्वां महाबाहो समर्थं वालिनो वधे ।।
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । राघवो दुन्दुभेः कायं पादाङ्गुष्ठेन लीलया । तोलयित्वा महाबाहुश्चिक्षेप दशयोजनम् ।।
data.es: Rama,the mighty elder brother of Lakshmana, having said so to Sugriva in a pleasing manner, lifted the dried body of Dundubhi easily with his toe, shook it and flung it with ease to a distance of ten yojanas.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणाग्रजः Lakshmana's elder brother, महाबाहुः longarmed one, वीर्यवान् mighty, राघवः Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, सान्त्वं In a pleasing way, दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, कायम् body, लीलया easily, पादाङ्गुष्ठेन with the toe, तोलयित्वा lifting, असुरस्य demon's, शुष्काम् dried, तनुम् body, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, चिक्षेप flung
data.md: Having thus addressed Sugrīva and consoling him, the highly powerful Raghava, of mighty arms-Laksmana's elder brother, lifting up easily with his thumb the dried frame of that Asura-Dundhubhi-hurled it at a distance of ten Yojanas.

data.v: क्षिप्तं दृष्ट्वा ततः कायं सुग्रीवः पुनरब्रवीत् । लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो राममिदं वचनमर्थवत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the monkey was very pleased with Rama's words and said to him in front of Lakshmana:
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, क्षिप्तम् the thrown, कायम् body, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, ततः then, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said, अर्थवत्  meaningful, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, अग्रतः In the presence.
data.md: Beholding that Asura's body thrown thus, Sugrīva, again addressed to the heroic Rāma, before Lakşmaņa and the monkey herd, the following pregnant words.

data.v: आर्द्रः समांसप्रत्यग्रः क्षिप्तः कायः पुरा सखे । लघुः संप्रति निर्मांसस्तृणभूतश्च राघव । नात्र शक्यं बलं ज्ञातुं तव वा तस्य वाधिकम् ।।
data.es: 'O friend, when Vali my brother flung the body, he was tired and intoxicated and the body was fresh with flesh (meaning heavy), but now, O Delight of the Raghu race, it is fleshless and light like a bunch of (dry) grass (for) which you could throw it playfully.
data.anv: सखे friend, तदा that time, परिश्रान्तेन by the tired, मत्तेन by the intoxicated, मे भ्रात्रा  by my brother, वालिना by Vali, पुरा earlier, आर्द्रः wet, समांसः with flesh, प्रत्यग्रः fresh, कायः body, क्षिप्तः flung, रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghu race, राघव Raghava, सम्प्रति now, लघुः light, निर्मांसः without flesh, तृणभूतश्च like a bunch of grass, प्रहर्षेण playfully, भवता by you, एवम् this, क्षिप्तम् flung.

data.v: एतच्च वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवेण सुभाषितम् । प्रत्ययार्थं महातेजा रामो जग्राह कार्मुकम् ।।
data.es: Having heard Sugriva's pleasing words, the brilliant Rama took up the bow in order to inspire confidence in Sugriva.
data.anv: महातेजाः effulgent, रामः Rama, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, सुभाषितम् good words, एतत् this, श्रुत्वा on hearing, प्रत्ययार्थम्  to create faith, कार्मुकम् bow, जग्राह took up.
data.md: Hearing those pleasant words of Sugrīva, the highly effulgent Rāma, to create his confidence, took up his bow.

data.v: स गृहीत्वा धनुर्घोरं शरमेकं च मानदः । सालानुद्दिश्य चिक्षेप ज्यास्वनैः पूरयन्दिशः ।।
data.es: Rama, subduer of the enemy's pride, strung his terrific bow, produced the twang that filled all directions, and discharged a single arrow aimed at the sala tree.
data.anv: मानदः subduer of enemy's pride, सः he, घोरम् terrific, धनुः bow, पूरयन् filled, दिशः directions, ज्यास्वनैः by the twang, सालम् sala tree, उद्दिश्य aiming, एकम् single, शरम् arrow, चिक्षेप discharged
data.md: That one, conferring honours upon others, holding his terrible bow and a shaft, darted it towards the Sāla, filling all the quarters with a sound,

data.v: स विसृष्टो बलवता बाणः स्वर्णपरिष्कृतः । भित्त्वा सालान्गिरिप्रस्थे सप्त भूमिं विवेश ह ।।
data.es: Released with great force, Rama's arrow embellished with gold pierced through the seven sala trees and splitting the mountain terrain entered the earth.
data.anv: बलवता forcefully, विसृष्टः released, स्वर्णपरिष्कृतः decorated with gold, सः बाणः that arrow, सप्त seven, सालान् sala trees, गिरिप्रस्थम् pierced through the mountain terrain, भित्त्वा on splitting, भूमिम् into the earth, विवेश ह entered.
data.md: The arrow, clear as the gold itself, hurled by that one of mighty strength, perforating the trees, entered into the mountainous expanse and the sevenfold regions of the earth.

data.v: प्रविष्टस्तु मुहूर्तेन रसां भित्त्वा महाजवः । निष्पत्य च पुनस्तूर्णं स्वतूणीं प्रविवेश ह ।।
data.es: In a moment the arrow emerged from the earth which it pierced and reentered the quiver with great speed.
data.anv: महाजवः of great speed, सायकस्तु the arrow, मुहूर्तेन in a moment, सालान् sala trees, भित्त्वा  split, निष्पत्य emerging forth, तम् its, स्वतूणीमेव from his quiver, पुनः again, प्रविवेश ह returned
data.md: And that shaft, gifted with wonderful velocity, piercing all the trees entered again into the quiver.

data.v: तान्दृष्ट्वा सप्त निर्भिन्नान्सालान्वानरपुंगवः । रामस्य शरवेगेन विस्मयं परमं गतः ।।
data.es: The chief of the monkeys was struck with wonder seeing Rama's arrow piercing through the seven sala trees so swiftly.
data.anv: वानरपुङ्गवः chief of monkeys, निर्भिन्नान् split through, तान् those, सप्त seven, सालान् sala trees, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, रामस्य Rama's, शरवेगेन by the speed of his arrow, परमम् highly, विस्मयम् wonderstruck, गतः became.
data.md: Having beheld those seven trees bored by Rāma's arrow, that monkey chief attained to an excess of surprise.

data.v: स मूर्ध्ना न्यपतद्भूमौ प्रलम्बीकृतभूषणः । सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतो राघवाय कृताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: Sugriva was immensely happy and offered obeisance to Rama with folded hands and bowed down and prostrated while his ornaments touched the ground.
data.anv: परमप्रीतः highly pleased, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, राघवाय to Rama, कृताञ्जलिः offered obeisance with folded hands, प्रलम्बीकृतभूषणः ornaments hanging down, मूर्ध्ना forehead, भूमौ on the ground, न्यपतत् prostrated.
data.md: Thereupon Sugrīva, exceedingly glad, and delighted with his actions, bowing down his head on the earth and stretching his ornamented person on the ground, addressed with clasped hands, that heroic descendant of Raghu.

data.v: इदं चोवाच धर्मज्ञं कर्मणा तेन हर्षितः । रामं सर्वास्त्रविदुषां श्रेष्ठं शूरमवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva who stood by, elated to watch the deed of Rama, best among the valiant, proficient in the use of arms of all kinds and knower of dharma, said:
data.anv: तेन by that, कर्मणा by the deed, हर्षितः he felt glad, धर्मज्ञम् the knower of dharma, सर्वास्त्रविदुषाम् among the proficient in the use of arms, श्रेष्ठं the best one, शूरम् valiant, अवस्थितम् who stood there, रामम् at Rama, इदम् this, उवाच च and spoke.
data.md: Rāma, the foremost of those conversant with religious lore, with the following pious words.

data.v: सेन्द्रानपि सुरान्सर्वांस्त्वं बाणैः पुरुषर्षभ । समर्थः समरे हन्तुं किं पुनर्वालिनं प्रभो ।।
data.es: 'O bull among men, O lord, you are capable of killing with your arrows even the gods including Indra in the battle, what to speak of Vali.
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभ O best among men, प्रभो O lord, त्वम् you, समरे in war, सेन्द्रान् including Indra, सर्वान् all, सुरान् अपि even gods, हन्तुम् to kill, समर्थः are capable, वालिनम् Vali, किं पुनः what to speak of again.
data.md: O best of men, O lord, what of Vali, you are capable of destroying with your arrows, in the conflict, even the celestials headed by Indra.

data.v: येन सप्त महासाला गिरिर्भूमिश्च दारिताः । बाणेनैकेन काकुत्स्थ स्थाता ते को रणाग्रतः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama who can in a battle confront you, capable of splitting seven huge sala trees, the mountain and the earth with a single arrow?
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, येन by such a person, एकेन बाणेन with a single arrow, सप्त seven, महासालाः great sala trees, गिरिः mountain, भूमिश्च even earth, दारिताः pierced, ते to  you, रणाग्रतः in the forefront of the battle, कः who, स्थाता can stand.
data.md: O Kākutstha, who can stand before you in a battle, who has pierced the seven trees, and the mountain, and the earth with one arrow?

data.v: अद्य मे विगतः शोकः प्रीतिरद्य परा मम । सुहृदं त्वां समासाद्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम् ।।
data.es: 'Having found a friend in you comparable to Indra and Varuna, my grief is gone and I am so happy now.
data.anv: अद्य now, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम् comparable to Indra and Varuna, त्वाम् you, सुहृदम् friend, समासाद्य after getting, मे to me, शोकः sorrow, विगतः is gone, अद्य now, मम my, परा supreme, प्रीतिः pleasure.
data.md: Obtaining you as my friend like to Mahendra and Varuņa, my grief has been removed and I have attained to an excess of delight.

data.v: तमद्यैव प्रियार्थं मे वैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम् । वालिनं जहि काकुत्स्थ मया बद्धोऽयमञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, for my pleasure kill Vali who is, to me, an enemy in the guise of a brother. I fold my hands to you.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, मे my, भ्रातृरूपिणम् in the form of a brother, वैरिणम् enemy, तं वालिनम्  that Vali, अद्यैव now itself, प्रियार्थम् for my pleasure, जहि you may kill, मया by me, अयम् this, अञ्जलि: reverential obeisance, बद्धः offered.
data.md: Do you, O Kākutstha, even to-day destroy, for my welfare, my brother Vāli. This I do pray to you with folded hands.

data.v: ततो रामः परिष्वज्य सुग्रीवं प्रियदर्शनम् । प्रत्युवाच महाप्राज्ञो लक्ष्मणानुमतं वचः ।।
data.es: Then wise Rama embraced handsome Sugriva and replied in these words which were agreeable to Lakshmana:
data.anv: ततः then, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, रामः Rama, प्रियदर्शनम् handsome, लक्ष्मणानुगतम् following Lakshmana, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, परिष्वज्य having embraced, वचः these words, प्रत्युवाच said in reply.
data.md: Thereupon embracing Sugrīva, of a pleasant countenance and like to Lakşmaņa, the highly wise Rāma spoke to him, saying,

data.v: अस्माद्गच्छाम किष्किन्धां क्षिप्रं गच्छ त्वमग्रतः । गत्वा चाह्वय सुग्रीव वालिनं भ्रातृगन्धिनम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva, get ready at once. We will promptly proceed to Kishkinda from here. Go ahead and challenge Vali, your brother only in name, to a combat.'
data.anv: सुग्रीव Sugriva, क्षिप्रम् at once, अस्मात् from here, किष्किन्थाम् to Kishkinda, गच्छेम will go, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् at once, अग्रतः forward, गच्छ go, गत्वा on going, भ्रातृगन्धिनम् a brother for name's sake, वालिनम् Vali, आह्वय invite.
data.md: Soon shall we repair to Kiskindha.-Do you go before, O Sugriva, and invite your false brother, Vali, to battle.

data.v: सर्वे ते त्वरितं गत्वा किष्किन्धां वालिनः पुरीम् । वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य व्यतिष्ठन्गहने वने ।।
data.es: Thay all rushed to Kishkinda, the capital of Vali and waited in the thick forest behind the trees.
data.anv: ते सर्वे they all, वालिनः Vali's, पुरीम् capital, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, त्वरितम् quickly, गत्वा went, गहने dense, वने forest, वृक्षैः with trees, आत्मानम् themselves, अवृ़त्य after covering, अतिष्ठन् stayed.
data.md: Thereupon proceeding quickly to Kişkindhā, Väli's capital—they all stood waiting in that dense forest, hiding themselves under the trees.

data.v: सुग्रीवो व्यनदद्घोरं वालिनो ह्वानकारणात् । गाढं परिहितो वेगान्नादैर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva tightened up his waist cloth hurriedly and roared terrifically as though piercing the sky. And screamed for Vali.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, गाढं tightly, परिहितः tightened the cloth around waist, वेगात् with speed, नादैः by roaring, अम्बरम् sky, भिन्दन्निव as if piercing the sky, वालिनः Vali's, ह्वानकारणात् to call out, घोरम् terrific, व्यनदत् screamed.
data.md: With a view to call Vāli, Sugrīva, tying fast his cloth (around the waist) set up a terrible roar, as if rending the sky (therewith).

data.v: तं श्रुत्वा निनदं भ्रातुः क्रुद्धो वाली महाबलः । निष्पपात सुसंरब्धो भास्करोऽस्ततटादिव ।।
data.es: On hearing his brother roaring, powerful Vali was enraged and rushed like the Sun from behind the western shore of the ocean (this simile suggests the downfall of Vali).
data.anv: महाबलः powerful, वाली Vali, भ्रातुः brother's, तं निनदम्  roaring, श्रुत्वा  hearing, क्रुद्धः enraged, सुसंरब्धः overwhelmed, अस्ततटात् from behind the western bank of the ocean, भास्करः Sun, यथा like, निष्पपात came out.
data.md: Hearing the terrible uproar of his brother, the mighty Vāli, highly angered, issued out of his city, like to the Sun from the western shores (where he sets).

data.v: ततः सुतुमुलं युद्धं वालिसुग्रीवयोरभूत् । गगने ग्रहयोर्घोरं बुधाङ्गारकयोरिव ।।
data.es: Then a tumultuous combat took place between Vali and Sugriva who looked like the planets Mercury and Mars.
data.anv: ततः then, वालिसुग्रीवयोः for Vali and Sugriva, बुधाङ्गारकयोः between Budha                (Mercury) and Angaraka (Mars), ग्रहयोरिव like the planets, सुतुमुलम् tumultous, युद्धम् war, अभूत् took place.
data.md: Thereupon there arose a mighty conflict between Vāli and Sugrīva like to the planets Mercury and Mars fighting with each other on the sky.

data.v: तलैरशनिकल्पैश्च वज्रकल्पैश्च मुष्टिभिः । जघ्नतुः समरेऽन्योन्यं भ्रातरौ क्रोधमूर्छितौ ।।
data.es: The brothers, insensate with fury, struck each other like thunder with their palms, soles and fists in the combat.
data.anv: क्रोधमूर्छितौ senseless with fury, भ्रातरौ brothers, अशनिकल्पैः like thunder, तलैः with palms soles, वज्रकल्पैः like thunderbolts, मुष्टिभिः with fists, समरे in the combat, अन्योन्यम् each other, जघ्नतुः struck.
data.md: The two brothers, exercised with ire, struck each other with palms like to Asani and with fists resembling adamant.

data.v: ततो रामो धनुष्पाणिस्तावुभौ समुदीक्ष्य तु । अन्योन्यसदृशौ वीरावुभौ देवाविवाश्विनौ ।।
data.es: Bow in hand, Rama watched both the heroes who resembled the twin Aswini Kumaras.
data.anv: ततः then, धनुष्पाणिः wielder of bow, रामः Rama, देवौ two deities, अश्विनौ इव like the twin Aswini Kumaras, अन्योन्यसदृशौ both of them similar in looks, तौ they, उभौ both, वीरौ the two heroes, समुदीक्ष्यतु  watched
data.md: Thereupon Rāma, with bow in hand, beheld those two heroes resembling each other, like to two Aświns.

data.v: यन्नावगच्छत्सुग्रीवं वालिनं वापि राघवः । ततो न कृतवान्बुद्धिं मोक्तुमन्तकरं शरम् ।।
data.es: Since Rama was not able to distinguish between Vali and Sugriva, he could not decide whether he should discharge his deadly arrow .
data.anv: राघवः Rama, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, वालिनं वापि or Vali, यत् such and such, नावगच्छत् not able to distinguish, ततः then, अन्तकरम् deadly, शरम् arrow, मोक्तुम् to discharge, बुद्धिम् intellect, न कृतवान्  not made.
data.md: And Rāghava did not discharge that mortal shaft until he could perfectly ascertain who was Vāli and who was Sugriva.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे भग्नः सुग्रीवस्तेन वालिना । अपश्यन्राघवं नाथमृश्यमूकं प्रदुद्रुवे ।।
data.es: Discomfited by Vali, and not seeing Rama around, Sugriva ran towards Rishyamuka mountain.
data.anv: एतस्मिन् अन्तरे in the mean while, तेन वालिना by Vali, भग्नः discomfited, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, नाथम्  lord, राघवम् Rama, अपश्यन् not finding, ऋश्यमूकम् to Rishyamuka, प्रदुद्रुवे ran.
data.md: In the mean time, being defeated by Vāli, Sugrīva fled away and not beholding Rāghava, proceeded towards Rșyamuka.

data.v: क्लान्तो रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गः प्रहारैर्जर्जरीकृतः । वालिनाभिद्रुतः क्रोधात्प्रविवेश महावनम् ।।
data.es: Exhausted, disfigured and body mauled and drenched in blood all over, Sugriva, chased by the infuriated Vali, entered the region of great sage Matanga.
data.anv: वालिना by Vali, क्रोधात् angry, अभिद्रुतः chased, क्लान्तः exhausted, रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गः body drenched in blood, प्रहारैः with strokes, जर्झरीकृतः mauled, महावनम् great grove (of Matanga), प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: And wearied, worn out with blows, and having his person bathed in blood, he, followed by Vāli, angered, entered that mighty forest.

data.v: तं प्रविष्टं वनं दृष्ट्वा वाली शापभयात्ततः । मुक्तो ह्यसि त्वमित्युक्त्वा स निवृत्तो महाबलः ।।
data.es: Effulgent Vali saw Sugriva entering the (prohibited) grove and turned back due to the fear of the curse (of sage Matanga) saying, 'You have escaped'.
data.anv: वनम् grove, प्रविष्टम् entered, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, महाद्युतिः effulgent, वाली Vali, त्वम् you, मुक्तः असि हि you have escaped, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, शापभयात् by the fear of the curse, ततः then, निवृत्तः returned.
data.md: Beholding him enter that forest, the highly powerful Vâli could not pursue him there for fear of the curse but said:-You are released today

data.v: राघवोऽपि सह भ्रात्रा सह चैव हनूमता । तदेव वनमागच्छत्सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः ।।
data.es: Rama together with Lakshmana and Hanuman also arrived at the same gave where Sugriva was.
data.anv: राघवोऽपि Rama too, भ्रात्रा सह along with brother, हनूमता च सह also with Hanuman, वानरः Vanara, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, यत्र where, तत् that, वनमेव to the grove, आगच्छत् arrived.
data.md: And Rāghava too, with his brother and Hanumān, entered that forest, where the monkey chief Sugrīva was.

data.v: तं समीक्ष्यागतं रामं सुग्रीवः सहलक्ष्मणम् । ह्रीमान्दीनमुवाचेदं वसुधामवलोकयन् ।।
data.es: At the sight of Rama accompanied by Lakshmana, Sugriva felt ashmed and aggrieved, and looking down on the ground, said:
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, आगतम् coming in, सहलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, तं रामम् that Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, ह्रीमान् ashamed, वसुधाम् ground, अवलोकयन् looking down , दीनम्  piteously, इदम् this, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Beholding Rāma approach with Lakşmaņa, Sugrīva, stricken with shame and casting his looks on the earth, addressed him poorly, with the following words.

data.v: आह्वयस्वेति मामुक्त्वा दर्शयित्वा च विक्रमम् । वैरिणा घातयित्वा च किमिदानीं त्वया कृतम् ।।
data.es: 'You demonstrated your prowess and directed me to challenge Vali and then why did you make the enemy hit me thus?
data.anv: आह्वयस्व asked me to declare, इति thus, माम् me, उक्त्वा after telling, विक्रमम् prowess, दर्शयित्वा having demonstrated, वैरिणा by the enemy, घातयित्वा  had hit me, त्वया  by you, इदानीम् this way, किं कृतम् why did you do?
data.md: Accosting me with 'do you call (Vāli),' displaying your valour and making me struck by the enemy, what improper, conduct have you shown by me? You should have spoken me then truly, O Rāghava,-I shall not destroy Vali and I would not have gone there.

data.v: तामेव वेलां वक्तव्यं त्वया राघव तत्त्वतः । वालिनं न निहन्मीति ततो नाहमितो व्रजे ।।
data.es: 'Had you, in fact, told me that you were not going to kill Vali, I would not have budged from this place.'
data.anv: राघव Rama, तां वेलामेव at that time, त्वया by you, वालिनम् Vali, न निहन्मि I will not kill, इति thus, तत्त्वतः truly, वक्तव्यम् should have been said, ततः then, अहम् I, इतः from this place, न व्रजे would not have gone.
data.md: Accosting me with 'do you call (Vāli),' displaying your valour and making me struck by the enemy, what improper, conduct have you shown by me? You should have spoken me then truly, O Rāghava,-I shall not destroy Vali and I would not have gone there.

data.v: तस्य चैवं ब्रुवाणस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । करुणं दीनया वाचा राघवः पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:
data.anv: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, दीनया a piteous, वाचा by word, करुणम् compasionately, एवम् in that manner, ब्रुवाणस्य while he spoke, राघवः Rama, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: The high-souled Sugrīva speaking thus poorly, Rāghava again spoke to him, saying:

data.v: सुग्रीव श्रूयतां तातः क्रोधश्च व्यपनीयताम् । कारणं येन बाणोऽयं न मया स विसर्जितः ।।
data.es: 'O dear Sugriva dispel your anger and listen to me why I had not released the arrow.
data.anv: तात O dear, सुग्रीव Sugriva, येन why, सः अयम् this, बाणः arrow, मया by me, न विसर्जितः not released, कारणम् reason, श्रूयताम् listen to me, क्रोधः anger, व्यपनीयतां च dispel.
data.md: Do you hear, O Sugriva, O worshipful one, why I did not discharge my arrow then.

data.v: अलंकारेण वेषेण प्रमाणेन गतेन च । त्वं च सुग्रीव वाली च सदृशौ स्थः परस्परम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva in form, ornaments and movements there is perfect resemblance between you and Vali.
data.anv: सुग्रीव Sugriva, अलङ्कारेण in personal embelishment, वेषेण in form, प्रमाणेन in appearance, गतेन च in your movements, त्वं च your, वाली च and Vali, परस्परम् to each other, सदृशौ both similar, स्थः are.
data.md: By ornaments, dress, stature and movements yourself and Vali are just the same, O Sugriva.

data.v: स्वरेण वर्चसा चैव प्रेक्षितेन च वानर । विक्रमेण च वाक्यैश्च व्यक्तिं वां नोपलक्षये ।।
data.es: 'O monkey in your voice, in brightness, in looks, in valour or in words I have marked no difference between you.
data.anv: वानर monkey, स्वरेण in voice, वर्चसा चैव or in splendour, प्रेक्षितेन in looks, विक्रमेण च in valour, वाक्यैश्च in talk, वाम् between the two, व्यक्तिम् difference, नोपलक्षये I have not seen.
data.md: By voice, by words, by looks or by valour, O monkey, I could not make out any distinction.

data.v: ततोऽहं रूपसादृश्यान्मोहितो वानरोत्तम । नोत्सृजामि महावेगं शरं शत्रुनिबर्हणम् ।।
data.es: 'O distinguished monkey you both are so similar in form that I was puzzled and did not release my swift arrow that could have destroyed the enemy.
data.anv: वानरोत्तम distinguished monkey, ततः then, रूपसादृश्यात् similar appearance, मोहितः bewildered, अहम् I was, महावेगम् swift, शत्रुनिबर्हणम् that which can destroy enemy, शरम् arrow, नोत्सृजामि I have not let loose.
data.md: O best of monkeys, being thus surprised by the similarity of your countenances I could not discharge that foe-destroying and quick-coursing shaft.

data.v: एतन्मुहूर्ते तु मया पश्य वालिनमाहवे । निरस्तमिषुणैकेन वेष्टमानं महीतले ।।
data.es: 'Therefore, O monkey, go and engage yourself in fight again. Do not suspect me. With this single arrow of mine, in one moment you will see Vali thrown down and rolling on the ground in this combat.
data.anv: वानर monkey, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, भूयः again go, युध्यस्व fight, मा मा do not do not, शङ्केश्च you may doubt me, एतन्मुहूर्ते  in one moment, मया by me, आहवे in war, एकेन by a single, बाणेन by arrow, निरस्तम् thrown down, महीतले on the ground, वेष्टमानम्  rolling, वालिनम् Vali, पश्य see.
data.md: And do you behold even, in this very moment, Vāli, moving restlessly on the breast of the earth, wounded by my shaft.

data.v: अभिज्ञानं कुरुष्व त्वमात्मनो वानरेश्वर । येन त्वामभिजानीयां द्वन्द्वयुद्धमुपागतम् ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys while you both are engaged in a duel wear some identification mark by which I can recognise you.
data.anv: वानरेश्वर lord of monkeys, द्वन्द्वयुद्धम् duel, उपागतम् has come, त्वाम् you, येन by which,  अभिजानीयाम् I may recognise you, अभिज्ञानम् an identification, आत्मनः you, कुरुष्व may put on.
data.md: Do you make some mark on your person, O lord of monkeys, by which I shall be able to recognize you when engaged in a duel (with your brother).

data.v: गजपुष्पीमिमां फुल्लामुत्पाट्य शुभलक्षणाम् । कुरु लक्ष्मण कण्ठेऽस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana this Gajapushpi in bloom is auspicious. Pluck and fasten it on great Sugriva's neck.'
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, इमाम् these, फुल्लाम् flowers blossomed, शुभलक्षणाम् auspicious, गजपुष्पीम् Gajapushpi, उत्पाट्य plucking, महात्मनः of the great, अस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, कण्ठे in the neck, कुरु put on.
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, plucking this auspicious Gaja flower, do you put it round the neck of the highsouled Sugriva.

data.v: ततो गिरितटे जातामुत्पाट्य कुसुमायुताम् । लक्ष्मणो गजपुष्पीं तां तस्य कण्ठे व्यसर्जयत् ।।
data.es: Then Lakshmana went to the mountain slope, plucked the (creeper with) gajapuspi blossoms and fastened it on the neck of Sugriva.
data.anv: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, गिरितटे on the slope of the mountain, जाताम् growing, कुसुमायुताम् flowering, तां गजपुष्पीम् those gajapushpi blossoms, उत्पाट्य  plucked, तस्य his, कण्ठे on the neck, व्यसर्जयत्  fastened on.
data.md: Thereat that highly graceful one with the garland around his neck appeared like to a cloud.

data.v: स तथा शुशुभे श्रीमाँल्लतया कण्ठसक्तया । मालयेव बलाकानां ससंध्य इव तोयदः ।।
data.es: With the creeper round the neck, Sugriva looked like the raincloud at twilight, adorned by a row of cranes like a garland.
data.anv: श्रीमान् lucky, सः Sugriva, कण्ठसक्तया by that on the neck, तया लतय by that creeper, ससन्ध्यः at twilight, तोयदः rain cloud, बलाकानाम् of cranes, मालयेव  like a garland, शुशुभे   glowed.

data.v: विभ्राजमानो वपुषा रामवाक्यसमाहितः । जगाम सह रामेण किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम् ।।
data.es: Radiant Sugriva intent on carrying out Rama's words again went to Kishkinda ruled by Vali.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वपुषा with his body, विभ्राजमानः radiant, सः he, रामवाक्यसमाहितः intent on carrying out Rama's instruction, रामेण सह with Rama, जगाम went, पुनः again, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda, वालि पालिताम् ruled by Vali.
data.md: And appearing in a graceful person and attentive to Rāma's words he again entered Kiş kindhā with him.

data.v: ऋश्यमूकात्स धर्मात्मा किष्किन्धां लक्ष्मणाग्रजः । जगाम सहसुग्रीवो वालिविक्रमपालिताम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva, get ready at once. We will promptly proceed to Kishkinda from here. Go ahead and challenge Vali, your brother only in name, to a combat.'
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः he, लक्ष्मणाग्रजः Lakshmana's elder brother, सहसुग्रीवः along with Sugriva, ऋष्यमूकात् Rishyamuka, वालिविक्रमपालिताम् ruled by Vali's valour, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, जगाम went.
data.md: Thereupon the high-souled Rāma, along with Sugrīva, proceeded from the mount Rșyamuka to Kiskindha, maintained by Vali's prowess, raising up his gold crested mighty bow and taking his battle arrows like to Aditya.

data.v: समुद्यम्य महच्चापं रामः काञ्चनभूषितम् । शरांश्चादित्य संकाशान्गृहीत्वा रणसाधकान् ।।
data.es: Getting ready to go, Rama took up his great bow and arrows adorned with gold and potent in war looking (dazzling) like the Sun.
data.anv: रामः Rama, काञ्चनभूषितम् adorned with gold, महत् great, चापम् bow, समुद्यम्य  getting ready, आदित्यसङ्कशान् radiant as the Sun, रणसाधकान् potent in war, शरान् arrows, गृहीत्वा taking up.
data.md: Thereupon the high-souled Rāma, along with Sugrīva, proceeded from the mount Rșyamuka to Kiskindha, maintained by Vali's prowess, raising up his gold crested mighty bow and taking his battle arrows like to Aditya.

data.v: अग्रतस्तु ययौ तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः । सुग्रीवः संहतग्रीवो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः ।।
data.es: The strongnecked Sugriva and mighty Lakshmana walked in front of the highsouled Rama.
data.anv: महात्मनः greatsoul, तस्य राघवस्य that Rama's, अग्रतः in front, संहतग्रीवः strongnecked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, महाबलः powerful, लक्ष्मणश्च and Lakshmana, ययौ went.
data.md: The mighty Sugrīva, bending low, proceeded before the high-souled Rama and Laksmana.

data.v: पृष्ठतो हनुमान्वीरो नलो नीलश्च वानरः । तारश्चैव महातेजा हरियूथप यूथपाः ।।
data.es: Brave and brilliant Hanuman, Nala, Nila, and Tara among the leaders of the monkeys walked behind.
data.anv: पृष्ठतः behind them, वीरः courageous, हनुमान् Hanuman, नलः Nala, वानरः monkey, नीलश्च and Nila, महातेजाः brilliant, हरियूथपयूथपः the head of monkey leaders, तारश्चैव and  Tara.
data.md: They were followed by the heroic Hanumān, the mighty Nala and Neela, and the highly powerful Tārā, the leader of the monkey herd.

data.v: ते वीक्षमाणा वृक्षांश्च पुष्पभारावलम्बिनः । प्रसन्नाम्बुवहाश्चैव सरितः सागरं गमाः ।।
data.es: They saw (on the way) trees bent down with the load of flowers, and rivers with pure water flowing into the sea.
data.anv: ते they, वीक्षमाणा enjoying the view, पुष्पभारावलम्बिनः bending down due to the weight of the flowers, वृक्षांश्च trees, प्रसन्नाम्बुवहाः carrying pure waters, सागरंगमाः flowing into the sea, सरितः rivers.
data.md: They beheld as they proceeded, trees, lowered down with the weight of flowers, rivers of clear water flowing to the ocean, mountain hollows, hills, caves, cavities, and principal peaks and charming rills.

data.v: कन्दराणि च शैलांश्च निर्झराणि गुहास्तथा । शिखराणि च मुख्यानि दरीश्च प्रियदर्शनाः ।।
data.es: (They saw) beautiful valleys, mountains, caves, prominent peaks with deep caverns.
data.anv: कन्दराणि valleys, शैलांश्च mountains, निर्दराणि caverns, तथा similarly, गुहाः caves, मुख्यानि prominent, शिखराणि peaks, प्रियदर्शनाः pleasing to look at, दरीश्च  deep caves.
data.md: They beheld as they proceeded, trees, lowered down with the weight of flowers, rivers of clear water flowing to the ocean, mountain hollows, hills, caves, cavities, and principal peaks and charming rills.

data.v: वैदूर्यविमलैः पर्णैः पद्मैश्चाकाशकुड्मलैः । शोभितान्सजलान्मार्गे तटाकांश्च व्यलोकयन् ।।
data.es: Observing on the way delightful lotus buds with leaves like Vaidurya, clear water and full tanks (They moved on).
data.anv: मार्गे on the way, पर्णै with leaves, वैदूर्यविमलैः clear like Vaidurya, अकोशकुडमलैः buds, पद्मैश्च and lotuses, शोभितान् beautiful, सजलान् with water, तटाकान् tanks, अवलोकयन् observing

data.v: कारण्डैः सारसैर्हंसैर्वञ्जूलैर्जलकुक्कुटैः । चक्रवाकैस्तथा चान्यैः शकुनैः प्रतिनादितान् ।।
data.es: Ducks, cranes, swans, vanjulas, waterfowls, chakravakas and other birds warbling melodiously.
data.anv: कारण्डैः with karandas (ducks), सारसैः with cranes, हंसैः with swans, वञ्जुलैः with vanjulas, जलकुक्कुटैः with water fowls, चक्रवाकैः with chakravakas, तथा similarly, अन्यैः with others, शकुनैः with birds, रुपनादितान् warbling melodiously
data.md: They. beheld on their way, pools filled with water clear as Baidurya and beautified with lotuses-full blown and buds, and resounded with the cries of Kārandhabas, swans, geese, Banculas, water-fowls, Cakravākas, and various other birds.

data.v: मृदुशष्पाङ्कुराहारान्निर्भयान्वनगोचरान् । चरतः सर्वतोऽपश्यन्स्थलीषु हरिणान्स्थितान् ।।
data.es: They observed deer feeding on tender grass on the ground around without fear, some standing and some roaming the forest
data.anv: मृदुशष्पाङ्कुराहारान् feeding on tender grass, निर्भयान् without fear, वनगोचरान् roaming the forest, स्थलीषु on the ground, सर्वतः all around, चरतः roaming, स्थितान् standing, हरिणान् deer, अपश्यन् saw.
data.md: They surveyed all around in the forest-land, deer ranging fearlessly at large and grazing on tender grass.

data.v: तटाकवैरिणश्चापि शुक्लदन्तविभूषितान् । घोरानेकचरान्वन्यान्द्विरदान्कूलघातिनः ।।
data.es: Observing terrific elephants adorned with white tusks wandering alone destroying the tanks, shattering the banks.
data.anv: तटाकवैरिणः destroyers of tanks, शुक्लदन्तविभूषितान् adorned with white tusks, घोरान् terrific, एकचरान् wandering alone, कूलघातिनः destroyers of the banks, द्विरदान् elephants (those that have two tusks).

data.v: वने वनचरांश्चान्यान्खेचरांश्च विहंगमान् । पश्यन्तस्त्वरिता जग्मुः सुग्रीववशवर्तिनः ।।
data.es: Following Sugriva faithfully, they proceeded swiftly, observing animals of the forest and birds flying in the sky.
data.anv: सुग्रीववशवर्तिनः faithful to Sugriva, वने in the forest, अन्यान् other, वनचरांश्च wild animals, खेचरान् those flying in the sky, विहङ्गमांश्च and birds, पश्यन्तः seeing, त्वरिताः fast, जग्मुः went.

data.v: तेषां तु गच्छतां तत्र त्वरितं रघुनन्दनः । द्रुमषण्डं वनं दृष्ट्वा रामः सुग्रीवमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: While walking fast, looking at the forest full of trees Rama, the delight of the Raghus said to Sugriva:
data.anv: तेषाम् while they, त्वरितम् swiftly, गच्छताम् were going, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghu family, रामः Rama, तत्र there, द्रुमषण्डवनम्  dense forest dense with trees, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: They proceeding quickly, Rama, the descendant of Raghu, beholding the forest filled with trees, spoke to Sugrīva, saying.

data.v: एष मेघ इवाकाशे वृक्षषण्डः प्रकाशते । मेघसंघातविपुलः पर्यन्तकदलीवृतः ।।
data.es: 'This cluster of trees surrounded by plantain groves look splendid like a vast collection of clouds in the sky.
data.anv: मेघसङ्घातविपुलः vast like a collection of clouds, पर्यन्तकदलीवृतः surrounded by banana plants all over, एषः that, वृक्षषण्डः cluster of trees, आकाशे in the sky, मेघः cloud, इव like, प्रकाशते splendid.
data.md: These trees skirted by plantain groves, dense as a collection of clouds, appear as clouds in the sky. Great is my curiosity, O friend, to learn what are these. 'And I wish to have my curiosity removed by you.

data.v: किमेतज्ज्ञातुमिच्छामि सखे कौतूहलं मम । कौतूहलापनयनं कर्तुमिच्छाम्यहं त्वया ।।
data.es: 'O friend I wish to know what this is? Could you answer my curiosity?'
data.anv: सखे O friend, एतत् this, किम् what, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामि wish, मम mine, कौतूहलम् curiosity, त्वया by you, कौतूहलापनयनम् clear to my curiosity, कर्तुम् do, इच्चामि I wish to.
data.md: These trees skirted by plantain groves, dense as a collection of clouds, appear as clouds in the sky. Great is my curiosity, O friend, to learn what are these. 'And I wish to have my curiosity removed by you.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्य महात्मनः । गच्छन्नेवाचचक्षेऽथ सुग्रीवस्तन्महद्वनम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, very much pleased with the words of Rama, spoke highly (of him).
data.anv: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य राघवस्य that Raghava's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा hearing, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अथ then, गच्छन्नेव walking, तत् that, महत्  extensive, वनम् forest, आचचक्षे started narrating.
data.md: Hearing the words of the high-souled Rāghava, Sugrīva began to describe that great forest.

data.v: एतद्राघव विस्तीर्णमाश्रमं श्रमनाशनम् । उद्यानवनसंपन्नं स्वादुमूलफलोदकम् ।।
data.es: 'O Raghava this is a hermitage, enchanting with vast gardens and trees bearing sweet fruits, full of tasty roots and water that relieves tiresomeness (of travellers).
data.anv: राघव Raghava, उद्यानवनसम्पन्नम् beautiful gardens, स्वादुमूलफलोदकम् tasty roots fruits and water, विस्तीर्णम् vast, एतत् all this, श्रमनाशनम् relieves tiresomeness of wearied people, आश्रमम् hermitage.

data.v: अत्र सप्तजना नाम मुनयः संशितव्रताः । सप्तैवासन्नधःशीर्षा नियतं जलशायिनः ।।
data.anv: अत्र here, संश्रितव्रताः strict followers of austere practices, नियतम्  highly disciplined, अधःशीर्षाः with head down, जलशायिनः immersed in water, सप्तजनाः नाम called seven ascetics (Saptajana), सप्तैव all the seven, मुनयः ascetics, आसन् were residing.

data.v: सप्तरात्रकृताहारा वायुना वनवासिनः । दिवं वर्षशतैर्याताः सप्तभिः सकलेवराः ।।
data.es: 'These seven sages used to live on air and that too once in seven nights. They lived for seven hundred years performing penance with motionlessness and attained heaven along with their bodies.
data.anv: सप्तरात्रे on the seventh night, वायुना with air, कृताहाराः as food, अचलवासिनः without motion, सप्तभिः  seven, वर्षशतैः hundred years, सकलेबराः with their bodies, दिवम् heaven, याताः attained.

data.v: तेषामेवं प्रभावेन द्रुमप्राकारसंवृतम् । आश्रमं सुदुराधर्षमपि सेन्द्रैः सुरासुरैः ।।
data.es: 'By virtue of the power of their penance, this hermitage surrounded by a row of trees is impenetrable even for demons and gods including Indra.
data.anv: द्रुमप्राकारसंवृतम् surrounded by a row of trees, एवं in this way, आश्रम् hermitage, तेषाम् their, प्रभावानां by virtue of their power of penance, सेन्द्रैः by those including Indra, सुरासुरैरपि gods and demons, सुदुराधर्षम् very difficult to enter.
data.md: By virtue of their asceticism, this asylum is walled by trees and incapable of being conquered even by Indra, the celestials and the Asuras.

data.v: पक्षिणो वर्जयन्त्येतत्तथान्ये वनचारिणः । विशन्ति मोहाद्येऽप्यत्र निवर्तन्ते न ते पुनः ।।
data.es: 'Birds and wild animals avoid the hermitage and whoever enters there out of ignorance never returns.
data.anv: पक्षिणः birds, तथा so also, अन्ये other, वनचारिणः wild animals, एतत् this place, वर्जयन्ति avoid, ये whoever, मोहात् by ignorance, अत्र there, विशन्ति enter, ते they, पुनः again, न निवर्तन्ति do not return.
data.md: Birds or other wild animals do not enter this asylum; whoever entereth this by mistake never returneth.

data.v: विभूषणरवाश्चात्र श्रूयन्ते सकलाक्षराः । तूर्यगीतस्वनाश्चापि गन्धो दिव्यश्च राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, one can hear pleasant sounds of jingling ornaments (of nymphs), of songs and windinstruments here. One can inhale divine fragrance, too.
data.anv: राघव Rama, अत्र here, सकलाक्षराः all words, विभूषणरवाश्च jingling of ornaments, तूर्यगीतस्वराश्चात्र sounds of songs and windinstruments (instruments that make a sound when wind passes through), श्रूयन्ते heard, दिव्यः divine, गन्धश्च fragrance also.
data.md: There is audible, O Rāghava, the sound of the dressing of Apsarās, their sweet-winged accents and that of their music and drums; and herçin pervadeth the celestial fragrance.

data.v: त्रेताग्नयोऽपि दीप्यन्ते धूमो ह्येष प्रदृश्यते । वेष्टयन्निव वृक्षाग्रान्कपोताङ्गारुणो घनः ।।
data.es: 'The three sacred fires keep burning and the thick smoke they emit resembles the red feet of pigeons. It shines forth as if enveloping the treetops.
data.anv: त्रेताग्नयोऽपि three sacred fires (Dakshinagni, Ahavaniya, Garhapatya fires), दीप्यन्ते shining, वृक्षाग्रान् treetops, वेष्टयन्निव as if enveloping, कपोताङ्गारुणः red like the pigeon's feet, घनः thick,दूमो smoke, एषः this, प्रकाशते हि glows.
data.md: Here burneth the fire Tretā; and the smoke and cloud sable like to the wings of a pigeon envelope the tops of the trees.

data.v: कुरु प्रणामं धर्मात्मंस्तान्समुद्दिश्य राघवः । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा प्रयतः संयताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: 'O rigteous Rama you and your brother Lakshmana humbly offer obeisance to them(sacred hermitage and sages Saptajana) with folded hands and meditate on them.
data.anv: धर्मात्मन् O righteous one, राघव Rama, तेषाम् उद्दिश्य contemplating about them, भ्रात्रा  brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, प्रयतः humbly, सयताञ्जलिः with folded hands, प्रणामम् offer obeisance, कुरु do, ताम् them.
data.md: Do you, O Rāghava, O virtuous-souled one, make obeisance to them along with your brother Lakṣmaṇa, with concentrated heart and folded palms.

data.v: प्रणमन्ति हि ये तेषामृषीणां भावितात्मनाम् । न तेषामशुभं किंचिच्छरीरे राम दृश्यते ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, nothing inauspicious happens to them who offer obeisance to those highly spiritual sacred sages.'
data.anv: राम Rama, भावितात्मनाम्  sacred souls, तेषाम् मुनीनाम् to those sages, ये whoever, प्रणमन्ति offer obeisance, तेषाम् to them, शरीरे in body, किञ्चित् not even a little, अशुभम् inauspicious, न दृश्यते will not be seen.
data.md: There resteth no sin in their persons, O Rāma, who bow to those self-controlled Saints.

data.v: ततो रामः सह भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणेन कृताञ्जलिः । समुद्दिश्य महात्मानस्तानृषीनभ्यवादयत् ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana offered salutations with folded hands in memory of those great sages, great souls.
data.anv: ततः then, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, कृताञ्जलिः with folded hands offered obeisance, महात्मानः great souls, तान् them, ऋषीन् समुद्दिश्य thinking of the seers, अभ्यवादयत् saluted.
data.md: Thereupon Rāma, along with his younger brother Lakşmaņa, made obeisance to those high-souled ones.

data.v: अभिवाद्य च धर्मात्मा रामो भ्राता च लक्ष्मणः । सुग्रीवो वानराश्चैव जग्मुः संहृष्टमानसाः ।।
data.es: Righteous Rama, Lakshmana, Sugriva and all the monkeys offered obeisance and proceeded delighted at heart.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, रामः Rama, भ्राता brother, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, वानराश्चैव and monkeys, अभिवाद्य  offered obeisance, संहृष्टमानसाः  delighted at heart, जग्मुः went.
data.md: Having paid homage (to the sacred memory of those great ones) the virtuous-souled Rāma his (younger) brother Laksmana, Sugriva and other monkeys, proceeded with delighted hearts.

data.v: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं तस्मात्सप्तजनाश्रमात् । ददृशुस्तां दुराधर्षां किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम् ।।
data.es: Walking a long distance from the hermitage of the seven seers, they beheld the unassailable Kishkinda ruled by Vali.
data.anv: ते they, तस्मात् from there, सप्तजनाश्रमात् the hermitage of seven seers, दूरम् long distance, अध्वानम् path, गत्वा on going, वालिपालिताम् ruled by Vali, दुराधर्षाम् unassailable, तां किष्किन्धाम् that Kishkinda, ददृशुः  beheld
data.md: And wending a distant way from that hermitage of the seven great ones, they beheld Kişkindhä, hard to conquer and occupied by Vali.

data.v: सर्वे ते त्वरितं गत्वा किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम् । वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य व्यतिष्ठन्गहने वने ।।
data.es: Thay all rushed to Kishkinda, the capital of Vali and waited in the thick forest behind the trees.
data.anv: सर्वे ते all of them, त्वरितं at once, गत्वा went वालि पालिताम् ruled by Vali, किष्किन्धां Kishkinda, वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य hiding behind the trees, गहने वने in the dense forest, व्यतिष्ठन् waited
data.md: Thereupon proceeding quickly to Kişkindhā, Väli's capital—they all stood waiting in that dense forest, hiding themselves under the trees.

data.v: विचार्य सर्वतो दृष्टिं कानने काननप्रियः । सुग्रीवो विपुलग्रीवः क्रोधमाहारयद्भृशम् ।।
data.es: Broadnecked Sugriva, a lover of the forest, looked around and flew into a rage.
data.anv: काननप्रियः a lover of forest, विपुलग्रीवः broadnecked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, कानने in the forest, सर्वतः all over, दृष्टिम् sight, विचार्य  extending, भृशम् very, क्रोधम् anger, आहारयत् became.
data.md: Casting his looks all around in the forest, Sugrīva, having a huge neck and fond of woods, became exceedingly enraged.

data.v: ततः स निनदं घोरं कृत्वा युद्धाय चाह्वयत् । परिवारैः परिवृतो नादैर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva tightened up his waist cloth hurriedly and roared terrifically as though piercing the sky. And screamed for Vali.
data.anv: परिवारैः with companions, परिवृतः surrounded, ततः then, नादैः with sounds, अम्बरम् sky, भिन्दन्निव as if piercing through, वायुवेगपुरःसरः moving with the speed of wind, गर्जन् while roaring, महामेघ इव like a huge cloud, घोरम् terrific, निनदम् sound, कृत्वा having produced, युद्धाय for the combat, अह्वयत् challenged.
data.md: Setting up a terrible uproar and rending the sky with his cry (Sugrīva) encircled by his kinsmen, invited (Vāli) to battle.

data.v: अथ बालार्कसदृशो दृप्तसिंहगतिस्तदा । दृष्ट्वा रामं क्रियादक्षं सुग्रीवो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, proficient in the performance of any task, one who appeared like the rising Sun and moved like a proud lion, said to Rama:
data.anv: अथ then, बालार्कसदृश looking like the rising Sun, दृप्तसिंहगतिः moving like a proud lion, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, क्रियादक्षम् proficient in any task, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तदा then, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: हरिवागुरया व्याप्तं तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणाम् । प्राप्ताः स्म ध्वजयन्त्राढ्यां किष्किन्धां वालिनः पुरीम् ।।
data.es: 'We have arrived at Kishkinda, the capital of Vali, decorated with flags and having a glittering golden archway that can be opened mechanically. Teeming with monkeys, it looks like a snare to catch the enemy.
data.anv: हरिवागुरया  like a net to catch animals, व्याप्ताम् filled, तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणाम् having a glittering golden archway, ध्वजयन्त्राढ्याम् decorated with the flagstaff operated mechanically, वालिनः Vali's, पुरीम् capital city, किष्किन्धाम् of Kishkinda, प्राप्ताः स्म reached
data.md: You have reached Kiskindhā, Vāli's capital, adorned with gold, filled with pennons and instruments and surrounded by monkeys. Do you make good your promise, O hero, you hadst made before to encompass the destruction of Vāli like to the season making the creepers filled with fruits.

data.v: प्रतिज्ञा या त्वया वीर कृता वालिवधे पुरा । सफलां तां कुरु क्षिप्रं लतां काल इवागतः ।।
data.es: 'O heroic Rama fulfil quickly the vow taken by you earlier to kill Vali in the same way a creeper bears fruit when the time comes.'
data.anv: वीर hero, त्वया by  you, वालिवधे to kill Vali, पुरा earlier, या such, प्रतिज्ञा vow, कृता has been taken, ताम् that one, आगतः came, कालः time, लताम् इव like creeper, क्षिप्रम् at once, सफलाम् successful, कुरु make it.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवेण स राघवः । तमथोवाच सुग्रीवं वचनं शत्रुसूदनः ।।
data.es: Requested thus by Sugriva, righteous Rama, the destroyer of enemies, replied:.
data.anv: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, एवम् that way, उक्तः spoken, धर्मात्मा righteous one, शत्रुसूदनः destroyer of enemies, सः राघवः that Rama, तम् to him, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, वचनम् these words, उवाच spoke.

data.v: कृताभिज्ञान चिह्नस्त्वमनया गजसाह्वया । विपरीत इवाकाशे सूर्यो नक्षत्र मालया ।।
data.es: 'Lakshmana has uprooted a creeper of gaja, and fastened it on your neck by which you can be easily identified.
data.anv: या that, एषा this, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, समुत्पाट्य having uprooted, तव your, कण्ठे in the neck, कृता done, अनया by that, गजसाह्वया with the help of Gaja creeper, त्वम् you, कृताभिज्ञानचिह्नः can be easily recognised.

data.v: अद्य वालिसमुत्थं ते भयं वैरं च वानर । एकेनाहं प्रमोक्ष्यामि बाणमोक्षेण संयुगे ।।
data.es: 'O monkey, with the release of a single arrow in the combat, I shall dispel your fear and enmity (hatred) for Vali.
data.anv: वानर O monkey, अद्य now, अहम् I, संयुगे in combat, एकेन by a single, बाणमोक्षेण by the release of an arrow, ते to you, वालिसमुत्थम् caused by Vali, भयम् fear, वैरं च and enmity, प्रमोक्ष्यामि I will dispel
data.md: I shall, O monkey, by the discharge of one shaft in the conflict, destroy your fear and enmity proceeding from Vāli.

data.v: मम दर्शय सुग्रीववैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम् । वाली विनिहतो यावद्वने पांसुषु वेष्टते ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva show me your enemy,who is in the guise of your brother.He will be killed. He will roll down in the dust of the forest.
data.anv: सुग्रीव  O Sugriva, भ्रातृरूपिणम् in the form of brother, वैरिणम् an enemy, मम to me, दर्शय वाली show Vali, विविहतः killed, वने in the forest, पांसुषु in the dust, यावत् चेष्टते before he rolls down.
data.md: Do you show me, O Sugriva, your enemy, in the guise of a brother. Wounded (by my shaft) Vāli shall roll in the dust in the forest.

data.v: यदि दृष्टिपथं प्राप्तो जीवन्स विनिवर्तते । ततो दोषेण मा गच्छेत्सद्यो गर्हेच्च मा भवान् ।।
data.es: 'If Vali appears before me I will not let him go with life.Then you will not blame me and find fault with me.
data.anv: दृष्टिपथम् sight, प्राप्तः comes, सः he, जीवन् with life, विनिवर्तते यदि if he will return, ततः then, भवान् you, सद्यः now, मा my, दोषेण blame, गच्छेत् may go, माम् me, गर्हेच्च will blame.
data.md: If regaining his life he comes in your view, do you leave this field, showering abuses upon me. more

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं सप्त ते साला मया बाणेन दारिताः । ततो वेत्सि बलेनाद्य बालिनं निहतं मया ।।
data.es: 'You have seen how I have pierced through seven sala trees with a single arrow. You will know how with the same strength I will kill Vali.'
data.anv: ते to you, प्रत्यक्षम् in your presence, मया by me, बाणेन by an arrow, सप्त seven, सालाः sala trees, दारिताः are torn, ततः then, अद्य now, मया by me, वालिनम् Vali, बलेन by strength, निहतम् killed, वेहि you may know.
data.md: You didst behold seven Talas riven by a single shaft of mine and do you therefore consider Vāli destroyed to-day by my prowess in the conflict.

data.v: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे वीर कृच्छ्रेऽपि तिष्ठता । धर्मलोभपरीतेन न च वक्ष्ये कथंचन ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva, I have uttered no falsehood before for fear of deviation from righteousness although I was in distress, nor shall I utter any falsehood in any circumstances hereafter.
data.anv: वीर hero, कृच्छ्रे in distress, तिष्ठतापि although subjected, धर्मलोभपरीतेन with the fear of deviating from righteousness, मे from me, अनृतम् a lie, उक्तपूर्वम् earlier, कथञ्चन in any way, न वक्ष्ये I will not speak.

data.v: सफलां च करिष्यामि प्रतिज्ञां जहि संभ्रमम् । प्रसूतं कलमं क्षेत्रे वर्षेणेव शतक्रतुः ।।
data.es: 'I shall fulfil my promise just as Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) helps production in the cornfield through timely rain. Give up your apprehension.
data.anv: शतक्रतुः Indra who performed a hundred sacrifices, वर्षेण by rain, प्रसूतम् production, कलमं क्षेत्रम् इव like the cornfield, प्रतिज्ञाम् my promise, सफलाम् will make it fruitful, करिष्यामि I will fulfil, सभ्रमम् apprehension, जहि give up.

data.v: तदाह्वाननिमित्तं त्वं वालिनो हेममालिनः । सुग्रीव कुरु तं शब्दं निष्पतेद्येन वानरः ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva give a warcry so that Vali adorned with a golden garland will come out.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तत् that, हेममालिनः adorned with a golden garland, वालिनः Vali, आह्वाननिमित्तं च to invite him, तम् such, शब्दम् sound, कुरु make, येन by which, वानरः monkey, निष्पतेत् will come out.

data.v: जितकाशी जयश्लाघी त्वया चाधर्षितः पुरात् । निष्पतिष्यत्यसंगेन वाली स प्रियसंयुगः ।।
data.es: 'Vali, who is proud of his valour, is strong, fearless and fond of combat, will rush out of the city in response to your challenge.
data.anv: जितकाशी proud of valour, बलश्लाघी one who praises strength, त्वया by you, अधर्षितः challenged, प्रियसंयुगः fond of battle, सः वाली that Vali, असङ्गेन without any fear, पुरात् from the city, निष्पतिष्यति will rush forward.
data.md: He has subdued his breath, is proud of victory and fond of warfare; you could not repress him before. Forsooth that Vāli shall come out, leaving the company (of his wives). Hearing the war cry of his enemy, he shall never put up with it, specially, as he boasteth of his prowess before his wives.

data.v: रिपूणां धर्षणं शूरा मर्षयन्ति न संयुगे । जानन्तस्तु स्वकं वीर्यं स्त्रीसमक्षं विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'Proud of their own prowess, heroes will not brook the challenge of foes in battle, specially in the presence of women.'
data.anv: स्वकम् their own, वीर्यम् prowess, जानन्तः proud, संयुगे in battle, रिपूणाम् foe's, धर्षितम् roar of challenge, श्रुत्वा on hearing, न मर्षयन्ति not brook, स्त्री समक्षम् in front of women, विशेषतः specially.
data.md: He has subdued his breath, is proud of victory and fond of warfare; you could not repress him before. Forsooth that Vāli shall come out, leaving the company (of his wives). Hearing the war cry of his enemy, he shall never put up with it, specially, as he boasteth of his prowess before his wives.

data.v: स तु रामवचः श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो हेमपिङ्गलः । ननर्द क्रूरनादेन विनिर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Rama's words, the goldenhued Sugriva roared in a fierce voice as if it would piece the sky.
data.anv: हेमपिङ्गलः goldenhued, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, रामवचः Rama's words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अम्बरम् sky, विनिर्भिन्दन्निव as if splitting, क्रूरनादेन in fierceful voice, ननर्द roared.
data.md: Hearing Rāma's words. Sugrīva, having a gold-yellow hue, set up a terrible roar, as if riving the sky.

data.v: तस्य शब्देन वित्रस्ता गावो यान्ति हतप्रभाः । राजदोषपरामृष्टाः कुलस्त्रिय इवाकुलाः ।।
data.es: Alarmed at the yelling of Sugriva, the cows began to run in all directions, like the women of noble pedigree who, with their brightness lost, run perplexed for failure of the king to protect their chastity.
data.anv: तत्र thereafter, गावः cows, शब्देन by the yelling, वित्रस्ताः were alarmed, हतप्रभाः lost their brightness, राजदोषपरामृष्टाः by the failure of the king, कुलस्त्रियः यथा like the chaste women, आकुलाः much perplexed, यान्ति become.
data.md: Terrified by that sound, the kine, losing their countenance do move hither and thither like to damsels, oppressed on account of their kings' neglecting (to protect them).

data.v: द्रवन्ति च मृगाः शीघ्रं भग्ना इव रणे हयाः । पतन्ति च खगा भूमौ क्षीणपुण्या इव ग्रहाः ।।
data.es: The deer were unable to run like wounded horses in a battle. Birds fell down on the ground like planets fall when their merit is exhausted.
data.anv: रणे in battle, भग्नाः wounded हयाः इव like the horses, मृगाः deer, शीघ्रम् speedily, द्रवन्ति च unable to run, खगाः birds, क्षीणपुण्याः their merit exhausted, ग्रहाः इव like planets, भूमौ on the ground, पतन्ति च fall.
data.md: And the deer fly away like to the horses defeated in a warfare. And the birds fall down on the earth, like to planets, losing their purity.

data.v: ततः स जीमूतगणप्रणादो; नादं व्यमुञ्चत्त्वरया प्रतीतः । सूर्यात्मजः शौर्यविवृद्धतेजाः; सरित्पतिर्वानिलचञ्चलोर्मिः ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva, son of the Sungod, with his lustre enhanced by his valour moved swiftly. His roar resembled the rumbling of a cluster of thundering clouds. He gave a warcry the tone of which resembled the sounds of waves lashed by high velocity winds in the sea.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, जीमूतगणप्रणादः thundering of a cluster of clouds, प्रतीतः quickly, सूर्यात्मजः son of Sungod, शौर्यविवृद्धतेजाः lustre enhanced by valour, अनिलचञ्चलोर्मि: waves lashed by the wind become restless, सरित्पतिर्वा (like the lord of rivers) ocean, त्वरया quick, नादम्  sound, अमुञ्चत् let loose.
data.md: Thereupon confiding in Rāma's words, that son, of Suryya (Sun) having his energy enhanced by means of his prowess resembling the ocean agitated by the wind, began to roar like to cloud.

data.v: अथ तस्य निनादं तं सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । शुश्रावान्तःपुरगतो वाली भ्रातुरमर्षणः ।।
data.es: The indignant Vali, who was in the harem, heard the roaring of his venerable brother, Sugriva.
data.anv: अथ then, महात्मनः venerable, भ्रातुः brother, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, तं निनादम् that sound, आन्तःपुरगतः into the inner chambers, अमर्षणः indignant, वाली Vali, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: While residing in the female apartment, Vāli heard the uproar of that high-souled Sugriva-his wrathful brother.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु तस्य निनदं सर्वभूतप्रकम्पनम् । मदश्चैकपदे नष्टः क्रोधश्चापतितो महान् ।।
data.es: The roar (of Sugriva) that frightened all beings gave Vali's vanity a jolt and at once aroused in him violent rage.
data.anv: तस्य his, सर्वभूतप्रकम्पनम् that shook all creatures, निनदम् roar, श्रुत्वा having heard, एकपदे at once, मदः च vanity नष्टः lost, महान्  violent, क्रोधः rage, आपादितश्च was aroused
data.md: And hearing that mighty roar, shaking the whole world of creation, his pride was in no time, crushed and he attained to an excess of ire.

data.v: स तु रोषपरीताङ्गो वाली संध्यातपप्रभः । उपरक्त इवादित्यः सद्यो निष्प्रभतां गतः ।।
data.es: Overcome with anger, Vali looked pale like the eclipsed Sun with the golden radiance faded from his face.
data.anv: ततः then, रोषपरीताङ्गःovercome with anger, कनकप्रभः radiant like gold, वालीVali, उपरक्तः eclipsed, आदित्यः इव like the Sun, सद्यःat once, निष्प्रभताम्  pale, गतः became
data.md: Thereupon, Vāli, having a golden hue, greatly exercised with wrath, instantly lost the effulgence of his person like to the sun possessed by Rāhu.

data.v: वाली दंष्ट्रा करालस्तु क्रोधाद्दीप्ताग्निसंनिभः । भात्युत्पतितपद्माभः समृणाल इव ह्रदः ।।
data.es: Vali, who looked fierce with his teeth and whose eyes shone like a flaming fire through anger looked like a pond with the lotuses and their stalks uprooted.
data.anv: दंष्ट्राकरालः of fierce teeth, क्रोधात्  in  anger, दीप्ताग्निसन्निभः like the flaming fire, वाली Vali, उत्पतितपद्मस्तु a pond with uprooted lotuses, समृणालः with the stalks, ह्रदः इव like a pond
data.md: And looking terrible by his teeth and having eyes resembling burning fire in consequence of ire he appeared like to a pond, having the lotuses thereof uprooted with their stalks and fibres.

data.v: शब्दं दुर्मर्षणं श्रुत्वा निष्पपात ततो हरिः । वेगेन चरणन्यासैर्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: Unable to tolerate Sugriva's roar, Vali stepped out hurriedly, taking long strides as if breaking the earth.
data.anv: ततः then, हरिः Sugriva, दुर्मर्षणम् intolerable, शब्दम् sound, श्रुत्वा on hearing, वेगेन hurriedly, पदन्यासैः  long strides, मेदिनीम् earth, दारयन्निव as if breaking, निष्पपात rushed out
data.md: And hearing that unbearable sound, the 'monkey, issued out speedily, as if riving the earth with his foot marks.

data.v: तं तु तारा परिष्वज्य स्नेहाद्दर्शितसौहृदा । उवाच त्रस्तसंभ्रान्ता हितोदर्कमिदं वचः ।।
data.es: Tara, perplexed out of fear, glanced at Vali lovingly, embraced him and gave him wise counsel:
data.anv: तारा Tara, तम् him, स्नेहात् with love, परिष्वज्य embraced, दर्शितसौहृदाः glanced lovingly, त्रस्तसम्भ्रान्ता perplexed out of fear, हितोदर्कम् a good counsel, इदं वचः these words, उवाच spoke
