data.md: Embracing him warmly and showing her affection, Tara, afraid and mortified, addressed him with the following words, presaging his future welfare.

data.v: साधु क्रोधमिमं वीर नदी वेगमिवागतम् । शयनादुत्थितः काल्यं त्यज भुक्तामिव स्रजम् ।।
data.es: 'O valiant Vali anger has overtaken you like the flood of a river. It is natural for you to be angry at this time, but shake off your anger just as the wise discard a flower garland already used up.
data.anv: वीर valiant Vali, नदीवेगमिव like the flood of river, आगतम् come, इमम् this, क्रोधम् with anger, काल्यम् entertained at this time, शयनात् from bed, उत्थितः got up, भुक्ताम् used up, स्रजमिव like a flower garland, साधु the wise, त्यज give up.
data.md: Do you renounce, O hero, this your ire, coming like the course of a river, like to one, leaving aside the garland, which he used in the night, after rising from bed.

data.v: सहसा तव निष्क्रामो मम तावन्न रोचते । श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि यन्निमित्तं निवार्यसे ।।
data.es: 'I do not like your rashness. I will explain the reason I am preventing you. Listen:
data.anv: सहसा rashly, तव you, निष्क्रामः exit, मम for me, न रोचते तावम् do not feel good, यन्निमित्तम् for what reason, निवार्यसे you are prevented, अभिधास्यामि I will explain, श्रूयताम् listen.
data.md: O monkey chief, do you engage with him in conflict, tomorrow. O hero, your enemy is very insignificant and hence there will be no deterioration on your part. Your hastily issuing out does not please me; do you hear, why I do prevent you.

data.v: पूर्वमापतितः क्रोधात्स त्वामाह्वयते युधि । निष्पत्य च निरस्तस्ते हन्यमानो दिशो गतः ।।
data.es: 'Earlier, he (Sugriva) came and challenged you to a duel. You struck him in anger, and defeated, he fled, running in all directions. Now his challenge rouses my suspicion.
data.anv: सः he, पूर्वम् earlier, क्रोधात् raged, आपतितः came, त्वाम् you, आह्वयते  challenging you, ते for you, निष्पत्य  attacked, निरस्तः thrown , हन्यमानः struck , दिशः directions, गतः went.
data.md: Formerly this Sugrīva invited you angrily to battle and being defeated and wounded by you fled away.

data.v: त्वया तस्य निरस्तस्य पीडितस्य विशेषतः । इहैत्य पुनराह्वानं शङ्कां जनयतीव मे ।।
data.es: 'One who is defeated and badly mauled by you is again coming and inviting you to a duel in this manner arouses suspicion in me.
data.anv: त्वया by you, निरस्तस्य defeated by you, विशेषतः specially, पीडितस्य hurt by you, तस्य his, इह here, पुनः again, एत्य after coming, आह्वानम् inviting you, मे to me, शङ्काम् suspicion, जनयतीव arouses.
data.md: That one, who had been defeated and harassed by you formerly, is now calling you. Indeed it has excited my fear.

data.v: दर्पश्च व्यवसायश्च यादृशस्तस्य नर्दतः । निनादस्य च संरम्भो नैतदल्पं हि कारणम् ।।
data.es: 'His determination, his insolence, his roaring, his arroganceall this cannot be for a small reason.
data.anv: नर्दतः roaring, तस्य his, दर्पश्च and his arrogance, व्यवसायश्च determination also, निनादस्य roaring, संरम्भः insolence, एतत् all this, अल्पम् small, कारणम् cause, न हि cannot be.
data.md: His pride, his energy, and his terrible uproar do indicate that there is nothing insignificant (at the bottom).

data.v: नासहायमहं मन्ये सुग्रीवं तमिहागतम् । अवष्टब्धसहायश्च यमाश्रित्यैष गर्जति ।।
data.es: 'Certainly Sugriva has not come here to give a warcry without any external help. The person whose refuge he has sought is not a small one.
data.anv: इह here, आगतम् came, तं सुग्रीवम् that Sugriva, असहायम् without any help, न मन्ये not think so, अवष्टब्धसहाय certainly sought refuge, यम् big, आश्रित्य having taken help, एषः he, गर्जति is roaring.
data.md: I do not think Sugrīva has come here without any to assist him. Forsooth he has taken shelter of some body, and securing which he has been setting up such a terrible uproar.

data.v: प्रकृत्या निपुणश्चैव बुद्धिमांश्चैव वानरः । अपरीक्षितवीर्येण सुग्रीवः सह नैष्यति ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva is clever by nature. He is wise. Without assessing the ability of the ally he will not enter into friendship.
data.anv: प्रकृत्या निपुणश्चैव naturally a clever, बुद्धिमांश्चैव wise person, वानरः monkey, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अपरीक्षितवीर्येण without testing the ability of the ally, सख्यम् friendship न एष्यति will not make
data.md: That monkey is clever by nature and gifted with intellect. And Sugrīva shall not desire friendship with any one without having a test of his prowess.

data.v: पूर्वमेव मया वीर श्रुतं कथयतो वचः । अङ्गदस्य कुमारस्य वक्ष्यामि त्वा हितं वचः ।।
data.es: 'O hero I have heard the news earlier from our son Angada. I will tell you what he had heard and what he has said to me:
data.anv: वीर O hero, पूर्वमेव earlier, कथयतः what he spoke, कुमारस्य from the son, अङ्गदस्य of Angada, वचः news, मय by me, श्रुतम् heard, हितम् good, वचः words, अद्य now, वक्ष्यामि त्वा will tell you.
data.md: Hearken, O hero, I shall relate to you today, the auspicious words, I heard ere this, from the prince Angada.

data.v: तव भ्रातुर्हि विख्यातः सहायो रणकर्कशः । रामः परबलामर्दी युगान्ताग्निरिवोत्थितः ।।
data.es: 'Rama, famous for crushing foes in war, like the fire that breaks out at the dissolution of the world, has slain strong enemies like Khara and will help your brother.
data.anv: रणकर्कशः  crushing the foes in war, विख्यातः famous man, उत्थितः sprung up, युगान्ताग्निरिव like fire at the end of creation, परबलामर्दी who slayed strong enemies like Khara, सः रामः that Rama, ते your, भ्रातुः brother's, सहायः हि will help.

data.v: निवासवृक्षः साधूनामापन्नानां परा गतिः । आर्तानां संश्रयश्चैव यशसश्चैकभाजनम् ।।
data.es: 'He is like a sheltering tree to the virtuous, an ultimate refuge for the destitutes and a protector of the distressed. He is the sole repository of fame.
data.anv: साधूनाम् to the virtuous people, निवासवृक्षः a sheltering tree, आपन्नानाम् to the destitutes, परा  supreme, गतिः refuge, आर्तानाम् to the distressed, संश्रयश्चैव protector, यशसः fame, एकभाजनम् sole repository.

data.v: ज्ञानविज्ञानसंपन्नो निदेशो निरतः पितुः । धातूनामिव शैलेन्द्रो गुणानामाकरो महान् ।।
data.es: 'He is endowed with the knowledge of science and scriptures. He stood by his father's command. He is like a mine of virtues just as the lord of the mountain is a mine of minerals.
data.anv: ज्ञानविज्ञानसम्पन्नः endowed with knowledge of scriptures science and, पितुः father's, निदेशे at the command, स्थितः stood by, शैलेन्द्रः lord of mountains, धातूनामिव like the mine of minerals, गुणानाम् for all virtues, महान् great, आकरः a mine.

data.v: तत्क्षमं न विरोधस्ते सह तेन महात्मना । दुर्जयेनाप्रमेयेन रामेण रणकर्मसु ।।
data.es: 'Rama is immeasurable in prowess and unconquerable in war. Therefore, enmity with him is not desirable for you.
data.anv: तत् therefore, महात्मना great, रणकर्मसु in war, दुर्जयेन unconquerable, अप्रमेयेन of immeasurable, तेन रामेण by that Rama, ते to you, विरोधः enmity, न क्षमम् not desirable.
data.md: Like to Himālaya, the king of mountains, containing diverse metals, he is the mine of various accomplishments. It does not behove you therefore to enter into conflict with that high-souled Răma, incomparable in prowess and hard to conquer in battle.

data.v: शूर वक्ष्यामि ते किंचिन्न चेच्छाम्यभ्यसूयितुम् । श्रूयतां क्रियतां चैव तव वक्ष्यामि यद्धितम् ।।
data.es: 'O hero, this I tell you not because I dislike you, but because I wish your welfare. Listen, and do as I say
data.anv: शूर valiant, ते to you, किञ्चित् a little, वक्ष्यामि I will tell, अभ्यसूयितुम् not to dislike you, न इच्छामि not intend to, तव your, हितम् welfare, यत् वक्ष्यामि telling for your sake, श्रूयताम् please listen, क्रियतां च do as I say.
data.md: Hearken, O hero, I desire to speak something more-I do not wish to excite your wrath. Do you instantly confer upon Sugrīva, the dignity of heir apparent (to your throne). O hero, O king, do not quarrel with your younger brother.

data.v: यौवराज्येन सुग्रीवं तूर्णं साध्वभिषेचय । विग्रहं मा कृथा वीर भ्रात्रा राजन्बलीयसा ।।
data.es: 'O king O hero consecrate your brother Sugriva as prince at once. Do not create enmity with him.
data.anv: वीर hero, राजन् king, त्वम् you, तूर्णम् swiftly, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, यौवराज्येन you may consecrate, अभिषेचय on consecration, यवीयसा with an younger one, भ्रात्रा brother, विग्रहम् enmity, मा कृथा do not have.

data.v: अहं हि ते क्षमं मन्ये तव रामेण सौहृदम् । सुग्रीवेण च संप्रीतिं वैरमुत्सृज्य दूरतः ।।
data.es: 'Leave enmity with Sugriva far behind. Make friendship with Rama. I think it is the right thing for you.
data.anv: वैरम् enmity, दूरतः to a distance, उत्सृज्य shed, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, सम्प्रीतिम् love, तेन रामेण with Rama, सौहृदम् friendship, ते to you, क्षमम् is the right, अहम् I, मन्ये I think.
data.md: I do consider it your welfare to contract friendship with Rāma and regain Sugrīva's affections, renouncing all your inimical feelings.

data.v: लालनीयो हि ते भ्राता यवीयानेष वानरः । तत्र वा सन्निहस्थो वा सर्वथा बन्धुरेव ते ।।
data.es: 'This monkey is your younger brother and, therefore, deserves your protection. Whether he is here or there, he is your brother.
data.anv: यवीयान् भ्राता he is your younger brother, एषः वानरः this monkey, ते to you, लालनीयः हि deserves your protection, तत्र there, सन् वा इहस्थो वा whether he is here(at kishkinda) or there (at Rishyamuka), सर्वथा all means, ते your, बन्धुरेव relation.
data.md: This your younger brother, even when remaining at a distance, should always be maintained by you. Whether by you, or at a distance, he is always your best friend—I do not find his equal on earth.

data.v: यदि ते मत्प्रियं कार्यं यदि चावैषि मां हिताम् । याच्यमानः प्रयत्नेन साधु वाक्यं कुरुष्व मे ।।
data.es: 'Pray, do me this favour. Treat me as your wellwisher. Heed my advice given with care.
data.anv: ते to you, मत्प्रियम् a favour to me, कार्यं यदि if it is going to be done, माम् me, हिताम् a good counsel, अवेषि यदि if you treat me so, प्रयत्नेन by the effort, याच्यमानः pray you, मे my, वाक्यम् words, साधु please, कुरुष्व heed.
data.md: If you does wish to go by my desire, if you does regard me as your well-wisher, do you perform what I do request you for your welfare. Be pleased and hear my beneficial words.

data.v: तामेवं ब्रुवतीं तारां ताराधिपनिभाननाम् । वाली निर्भर्त्सयामास वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: To these words of Tara with her Moonlike face, Vali replied reproachfully:
data.anv: एवम् thus, ब्रुवतीम्  speaking, ताराधिपनिभाननाम् Moonlike face, तां ताराम् to such a Tara, वाली Vali, निर्भर्त्सयामास reproached, इदम् these, वचनं च words, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: After Tārā, having a moon-like countenance, had spoken thus, Vāli, remonstrated with her and said.

data.v: गर्जतोऽस्य च संरम्भं भ्रातुः शत्रोर्विशेषतः । मर्षयिष्याम्यहं केन कारणेन वरानने ।।
data.es: 'O lady with a charming face why should I tolerate the enemy (Sugriva) who is none other than my own younger brother, especially when he roars excitedly?
data.anv: वरानने O lady with a charming face, भ्रातुः brother, विशेषतः especially, शत्रोः enemy, अस्य his, सुसम्रब्धम् excitement, गर्जतः as he roars, केन कारणेन for what reason, मर्षयिष्यामि should I tolerate?
data.md: O you of exquisite loveliness, my brother, and specially my enemy, is roaring lowly and haughtily-and how shall I put up with it?

data.v: अधर्षितानां शूराणां समरेष्वनिवर्तिनाम् । धर्षणामर्षणं भीरु मरणादतिरिच्यते ।।
data.es: O timid lady to swallow insult (without facing the opponent) is worse than death for indomitable heroes (like me) who know no retreat in a battle.
data.anv: भीरु O timid lady, समरेषु in combat, अनिवर्तिनाम् for those who do not turn back, अधर्षितानाम् for the invincible, शूराणाम् for heroes, धर्षणामर्षणम् to endure insult, मरणात् more than death, अतिरिच्यते is worse
data.md: O timid damsel, heroes, who have never been defeated and have never fled away from the battle field, had rather meet with death than put up with this ignominy.

data.v: सोढुं न च समर्थोऽहं युद्धकामस्य संयुगे । सुग्रीवस्य च संरम्भं हीनग्रीवस्य गर्जतः ।।
data.es: 'When the weaknecked Sugriva roars eager to join a duel it is not right on my part to tolerate his arrogance,much less his warcry.
data.anv: अहम् I am, संयुगे in battle, युद्धकामस्य desiring to fight, हीनग्रीवस्य of the weaknecked, गर्जतः  who roars, सुग्रीवस्य of Sugriva, सम्रम्भम् flurry, सोढुम् to tolerate, न समर्थः not right
data.md: I am incapable of bearing this proud uproar of Sugrīva, having a defective neck and desirous of entering into conflict with me.

data.v: न च कार्यो विषादस्ते राघवं प्रति मत्कृते । धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च कथं पापं करिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'You need not be concerned about me on account of Rama. How can one who knows dharma and who has a sense of gratitude commit sin?
data.anv: मत्कृते for me, राघवं प्रति with respect to Rama, ते to you, विषादः worry, न कार्यः no need, धर्मज्ञश्च for a knower of dharma, कृतज्ञश्च a grateful person, पापम् sin, कथम् how, करिष्यति will he do
data.md: Fearing danger from Rāghava, you needst not entertain any anxiety on my account. Why shall that virtuous-souled and grateful Rāma perpetrate iniquity?

data.v: निवर्तस्व सह स्त्रीभिः कथं भूयोऽनुगच्छसि । सौहृदं दर्शितं तारे मयि भक्तिः कृता त्वया ।।
data.es: 'Go back with all the women of the harem. Why do you follow me again? Your devotion towards me is evident from the sincere concern expressed by you.
data.anv: स्त्रीभिः सह along with women, निवर्तस्व you may return, भूयः again, कथम् how, अनुगच्छसि following, त्वया by you, सौहृदम् concern, दर्शितं (तावत्) shown by you, मयि to me, भक्तिः devotion, कृता is fixed

data.v: प्रतियोत्स्याम्यहं गत्वा सुग्रीवं जहि संभ्रमम् । दर्पं चास्य विनेष्यामि न च प्राणैर्विमोक्ष्यते ।।
data.es: 'I shall accept the challenge and fight with Sugriva. Give up your anxiety. I will destroy his pride, not his life.
data.anv: अहम् I am, गत्वा after going, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, प्रतियोत्स्यामि will fight accepting his challenge, सम्भ्रमम् anxiety, जहि give up, अस्य his, दर्पमात्रं pride, विनेष्यामि I will subdue, प्राणैः with life, न विमोक्ष्यते not be relieved
data.md: Do you therefore return with my other wives. Why do you follow me again? You have already shown your friendship and respect for me. I shall repairing thither, only fight with Sugrīva. I shall crush down his pride and not destroy him.

data.v: शापितासि मम प्राणैर्निवर्तस्व जयेन च । अहं जित्वा निवर्तिष्ये तमलं भ्रातरं रणे ।।
data.es: 'I make a vow even on my life and my victory. Pray return with the retinue. I will be back only after winning the encounter with my brother.
data.anv: मम my, प्राणैः with life, शापिता अपि even a vow on my life, जयेन  on victory, निवर्तस्व  I will return, अहम् I, रणे in encounter, तं भ्रातरम् that brother, जित्वा after winning, अहम् I, निवर्तिष्ये    will return
data.md: By my life, do you go back with the other members of my household, I shall only return after bringing about the discomfiture of my brother in the battle.

data.v: तं तु तारा परिष्वज्य वालिनं प्रियवादिनी । चकार रुदती मन्दं दक्षिणा सा प्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: Pleasing in her words, Tara then embraced Vali and sobbing, circumambulated Vali in compliance (to his advice).
data.anv: प्रियवादिनी a lady  pleasant in speech, दक्षिणा a compliant, सा तारा that Tara, तं वालिनम् that Vali, परिष्वज्य having embraced, मन्दम् faintly रुदती weeping, प्रदक्षिणम् circumambulated, चकार went
data.md: Thereupon, Tārā, dextrous and of sweet accents, embracing Väli, went round him, with tears trickling from her eyes.

data.v: ततः स्वस्त्ययनं कृत्वा मन्त्रवद्विजयैषिणी । अन्तःपुरं सह स्त्रीभिः प्रविष्टा शोकमोहिता ।।
data.es: The wise counsellor, Tara bade him farewell, wishing him victory and then, overwhelmed with sorrow, entered the inner apartment followed by the womenfolk.
data.anv: ततः then, मन्त्रवित् a lady wellversed in mantras, विजयैषिणी a lady who wished victory, स्वस्त्ययनम्  hailing, कृत्वा uttering, शोकमोहिता overwhelmed with sorrow, स्त्रीभिः सह along with women, अन्तःपुरम् inner apartments, प्रविष्टा entered
data.md: Having performed Sastayana or the ceremony of benediction, that one gifted with a knowledge of Mantras, and desirous of Vāli's success, went, overwhelmed with grief, to the inner-apartment in the company of other females.

data.v: प्रविष्टायां तु तारायां सह स्त्रीभिः स्वमालयम् । नगरान्निर्ययौ क्रुद्धो महासर्प इव श्वसन् ।।
data.es: After Tara and other women returned to their abode, Vali departed from the city, hissing like a huge angry cobra.
data.anv: तारायाम् when Tara, स्त्रीभिस्सह along with women, स्वम् her, आलयम् abode, प्रविष्टायाम् after she entered, कुद्दः angry , महासर्प इव like a huge serpent, श्वसन् breathing, नगरात् from the city, निर्ययौ came out.
data.md: After Tārā had departed to her own quarters with her female companions, he issued out of the city sighing like an enraged serpent.

data.v: स निःश्वस्य महावेगो वाली परमरोषणः । सर्वतश्चारयन्दृष्टिं शत्रुदर्शनकाङ्क्षया ।।
data.es: The mighty Vali, breathing heavily, looked around to find where his enemy was.

data.es: Sugriva, the noblest of all monkeys, spoke these polite words in a pleasing manner to Lakshmana of terrific strength:

data.v: तान्गुणान्संप्रधार्याहमग्र्यं चाभिजनं तव । तारया प्रतिषिद्धः सन्सुग्रीवेण समागतः ।।
data.es: 'Believing that you are a repository of all these virtues are in you, and respecting your noble lineage I engaged in a duel with Sugriva even though I was forewarned (by Tara).
data.anv: अहम् I am, तान् them, गुणान् virtues, तव your, अग्र्यम् foremost, अभिजनम् noble, सम्प्रधार्य considered, तारया by Tara, प्रतिषिद्धः अपि even though forewarned, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, समागतः came for a combat
data.md: And knowing your high pedigree, and all these your accomplishments I approached Sugrīva with a hostile intention, albeit prevented by Tārā.

data.v: न मामन्येन संरब्धं प्रमत्तं वेद्धुमर्हसि । इति मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना बभूवादर्शने तव ।।
data.anv: तव your, आदर्शने not seen, अन्येन with others, सम्रब्धम् engaged in combat, प्रमत्तम् engrossed, माम् me, योद्धुम् attacked, नार्हसि not proper on your part, इति thus, मे my, बुद्धि: mind, उत्पन्ना strike, बभूव become
data.md: Before I saw you I had thought within myself:-'Forsooth Rāma shall not destroy me, engaged as I am with another person and hence not prepared to fight with him.'

data.v: न त्वां विनिहतात्मानं धर्मध्वजमधार्मिकम् । जाने पापसमाचारं तृणैः कूपमिवावृतम् ।।
data.es: 'I did not know that you have killed your soul (by acting against your conscience), that you are sinful in conduct and unrighteous under the show of virtues like a well, its mouth covered with grass.
data.anv: त्वाम् to you, विनिहतात्मानम् who has killed his soul( one who acts against his conscience), धर्मध्वजम् functioning under the banner of (showing off) virtue, अधार्मिकम्  unrighteous, पापसमाचारम् sinful in conduct, तृणैः by grass, आवृतम् covered, कूपम् इव like a well, न जाने I did not know
data.md: I do now know you as one who has spoliated his soul through impious actions, feigning religion while in truth an irreligious person, resorting to all vicious deeds, like to a well crusted with grass, unrighteous while passing under the clock of honesty and religion like to a hidden fire.

data.v: सतां वेषधरं पापं प्रच्छन्नमिव पावकम् । नाहं त्वामभिजानानि धर्मच्छद्माभिसंवृतम् ।।
data.es: 'You are a sinful man covered with the mask of piety thus resembling a hidden fire. I failed to recognise that righteousness is a mere pretext for you.
data.anv: सताम् of piety, वेषधरम्  covered, पापम् a sinner, प्रच्छनम् a disguised person, पावकम् इव like fire, धर्मच्छद्माभिसंवृतम् with righteousness as a pretext, त्वाम् to you, अहम् I,  न अभिजानामि did not recognise
data.md: I do now know you as one who has spoliated his soul through impious actions, feigning religion while in truth an irreligious person, resorting to all vicious deeds, like to a well crusted with grass, unrighteous while passing under the clock of honesty and religion like to a hidden fire.

data.v: विषये वा पुरे वा ते यदा नापकरोम्यहम् । न च त्वां प्रतिजानेऽहं कस्मात्त्वं हंस्यकिल्बिषम् ।।
data.es: 'I did no harm to your affairs or to your city. I did not insult you. Why did you choose to kill me, a monkey roaming in the forest and living on fruits and roots? I was not fighting you. Why did you come and strike a person like me?
data.anv: अहम् I am, यदा when, ते your, विषये वा or in your affairs, पुरे वा or in your city, पापम् sin, न करोमि I did not, त्वाम् to you, न च and not, अवजाने I did  not insult you, अकिल्बिषम् not done any harm to you, नित्यम् always, फलमूलाशनम् living on fruits and roots, वनगोचरम् roaming in the forest, वानरम् monkey, इह here, अप्रतियुध्यन्तम् not come to battle with you, अन्येन others, समागतम् come, माम् me, कस्मात् why, हंसि do you kill

data.v: फलमूलाशनं नित्यं वानरं वनगोचरम् । मामिहाप्रतियुध्यन्तमन्येन च समागतम् ।।
data.es: 'I did no harm to your affairs or to your city. I did not insult you. Why did you choose to kill me, a monkey roaming in the forest and living on fruits and roots? I was not fighting you. Why did you come and strike a person like me?
data.anv: अहम् I am, यदा when, ते your, विषये वा or in your affairs, पुरे वा or in your city, पापम् sin, न करोमि I did not, त्वाम् to you, न च and not, अवजाने I did  not insult you, अकिल्बिषम् not done any harm to you, नित्यम् always, फलमूलाशनम् living on fruits and roots, वनगोचरम् roaming in the forest, वानरम् monkey, इह here, अप्रतियुध्यन्तम् not come to battle with you, अन्येन others, समागतम् come, माम् me, कस्मात् why, हंसि do you kill

data.v: त्वं नराधिपतेः पुत्रः प्रतीतः प्रियदर्शनः । लिङ्गमप्यस्ति ते राजन्दृश्यते धर्मसंहितम् ।।
data.es: 'O prince, you are son to a king, handsome and famous. Even signs of righteousness are discernible in you.
data.anv: त्वम् you, प्रियदर्शनः pleasing in appearance, नराधिपतेः पुत्रः son of a king, प्रतीतः famous, राजन् O king, ते to you, धर्मसंहितम् righteous one, लिङ्गमपि  even signs, अस्ति are, दृश्यते found

data.v: कः क्षत्रियकुले जातः श्रुतवान्नष्टसंशयः । धर्मलिङ्ग प्रतिच्छन्नः क्रूरं कर्म समाचरेत् ।।
data.es: 'Who, born in a kshatriya family, versed in the Vedas and free from doubt will commit such a cruel act under the guise of righteousness?
data.anv: क्षत्रियकुले in a kshatriya family, जातः born, श्रुतवान् one who has read the Vedas, नष्टसंशयः free from doubt, धर्मलिङ्गप्रतिच्छन्नः in the guise of a righteous person, कः who, क्रूरम् cruel, कर्म deed, समाचरेत् will do
data.md: Who, born in the race of Kșatriyas, versed in religious lore, having his doubts removed and marks of piety on his person, perpetrates such an iniquitous deed?

data.v: राम राजकुले जातो धर्मवानिति विश्रुतः । अभव्यो भव्यरूपेण किमर्थं परिधावसि ।।
data.es: 'You are born in a royal family. You are wellknown. You are proficient in dharma. Yet you are unworthy of your race and robe.
data.anv: राजकुले in royal family, जातः born, धर्मवानिति  proficient in dharma, विश्रुतः wellknown, राम Rama, अभव्यः unworthy, भव्यरूपेण attire, किमर्थम् for what reason, परिधावसे running
data.md: You are born in the family of Raghus and known all over the world as being pious. Being clothed in righteousness why did you commit such an unrighteous act?

data.v: साम दानं क्षमा धर्मः सत्यं धृतिपराक्रमौ । पार्थिवानां गुणा राजन्दण्डश्चाप्यपकारिषु ।।
data.es: 'O king selfcontrol (of organs of action and sense organs), righteousness, steadfastness, truthfulness, valiance and capacity to punish the offenders are virtues of a king.
data.anv: राजन् O king, साम conciliation, दानम् generosity, क्षमा forbearance, धर्मः righteousness, सत्यम् truth, धृतिपराक्रमौ steadfast in valour, अपराधिषु at the offenders, दण्डः punishment, पार्थिवानाम् of the rulers, गुणाः hallmarks
data.md: Punishment, control of passions, forgiveness, piety, firmness, truth, prowess and suppression of the wicked-these all are the royal virtues.

data.v: वयं वनचरा राम मृगा मूलफलाशनाः । एषा प्रकृतिरस्माकं पुरुषस्त्वं नरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama we are mere animals wandering in the forest and living on roots and fruits. This is our nature. (But) you are a lord of men.
data.anv: राम Rama, वयम् we, मूलफलाशना: live on roots and fruits, वनचराः wanderers in forest, मृगाः animals, एषा this, अस्माकम् our, प्रकृतिः nature, त्वम् you, नरेश्वरः lord of men, पुरुषः a man
data.md: We are, O Rama, wild beasts ranging in the forest and living on roots and fruits-our nature is such—but you are a man, O king.

data.v: भूमिर्हिरण्यं रूप्यं च निग्रहे कारणानि च । तत्र कस्ते वने लोभो मदीयेषु फलेषु वा ।।
data.es: 'We fight for land or gold or silver. What did you fight me for, for what I have or for the fruits of the forest?
data.anv: विग्रहे in battle, भूमिः land, हिरण्यम् gold, रूप्यं च and silver, कारणानि reasons, तत्र there, ते to you, वने in the forest, मदीयेषु in my belongings, फलेषु in fruits वा or, लोभः greediness, कः what for?
data.md: Land, gold and silver are the causes of dissension. But who is there who is avaricious enough to get by our forest habitations and fruits?

data.v: नयश्च विनयश्चोभौ निग्रहानुग्रहावपि । राजवृत्तिरसंकीर्णा न नृपाः कामवृत्तयः ।।
data.es: 'Submissiveness and modesty are the attributes of good rulers and should not be mixed up with benevolence and selfrestraint. Kings ought not to act (as they like) impulsively.
data.anv: नयश्च  submissiveness, विनयश्च  modesty, निग्रहानुग्रहौ  restraint and favour, उभावपि both are, असङ्कीर्णा not to be mixed up, राजवृत्तिः king's functions, नृपाः kings, कामवृत्तयः impulsive, न not excercise
data.md: The royal virtue consists in humbly and freely administering discipline, favour and punishment. Kings by no means, should follow their whims.

data.v: त्वं तु कामप्रधानश्च कोपनश्चानवस्थितः । राजवृत्तैश्च संकीर्णः शरासनपरायणः ।।
data.es: 'Fulfilling your own desire is important for you. You are wrathful and unstable with royal course of conduct. Your business is with your bow and arrows.
data.anv: त्वं तु you also, कामप्रधानश्च fulfilling your own desire is important, कोपनश्च wrathful, अनवस्थितः unstable, राजवृत्तेश्च royal course of conduct, सङ्कीर्णः intermingled, शरासनपरायणः you have  discharged arrows
data.md: But you are angry and unsteady by nature, capricious, perfectly narrow-minded in the discharge of your royal duties and did use your bow and shaft: (any where and every time).

data.v: न तेऽस्त्यपचितिर्धर्मे नार्थे बुद्धिरवस्थिता । इन्द्रियैः कामवृत्तः सन्कृष्यसे मनुजेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O lord of men you have no faith in righteousness, no steadfastness in the acquisition of wealth. You have no control over the senses. You are overcome by delusion.
data.anv: मनुजेश्वरः lord of men, ते to you, धर्मे in righteousness, उपचितिः not have faith, न not, बुद्धि: intellect, अर्थे material wealth, न अवस्थिता not steadfast, कामवृत्तः सन् overcome by delusion, इन्द्रियैः by the senses, कृष्यसे you are drawn
data.md: You have no attachment for virtue, no comprehension of right things and are always guided by your passions albeit you are a lord of men.

data.v: हत्वा बाणेन काकुत्स्थ मामिहानपराधिनम् । किं वक्ष्यसि सतां मध्ये कर्म कृत्वा जुगुप्सितम् ।।
data.es: 'O scion of the Kakutsthas Having killed me here with your arrow even though I have done you no harm, you have perpetrated an abominable act. How will you defend yourself in the midst of holy men after commiting such a sinful act?
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O scion of the Kakutstha race, अनपराधिनम् one who has not done any harm, मा to me, इह here, बाणेन by arrow, हत्वा having killed, जुगुप्सितम् abominable, कर्म deed, कृत्वा after commiting, सताम् to the holy people, मध्ये midst, किम् what, वक्ष्यसि will you answer?
data.md: O Kākutstha, destroying me sinless, with your shaft and perpetrating such a disgraceful act, how shall you relate it to the pious.

data.v: राजहा ब्रह्महा गोघ्नश्चोरः प्राणिवधे रतः । नास्तिकः परिवेत्ता च सर्वे निरयगामिनः ।।
data.es: 'One who kills a king, a brahmin or a cow, a thief or one who delights in destruction of life an atheist or one who marries before his elder they all go to hell.
data.anv: राजहा killer of a king, ब्रह्महा  killer of brahmin, गोघ्नः  killer of cows, चोर: a thief, प्राणिवधेरत: killer of living beings,नास्तिकः atheist, परिवेत्ता च and one who marries before his elder sibling, सर्वे all, निरयगामिनः will go to hell
data.md: Those, who commit treason, destroy Brahmins and kine, who are thieves and always engaged in the destruction of animals, and who are atheists and marry before their elder brothers are married, do all go to hell.

data.v: अधार्यं चर्म मे सद्भी रोमाण्यस्थि च वर्जितम् । अभक्ष्याणि च मांसानि त्वद्विधैर्धर्मचारिभिः ।।
data.es: 'My skin is not fit to be worn by the virtuous, my hair and bones are also prohibited from any use. My flesh is also not at all fit to be eaten by righteous people like you
data.anv: मे mine, चर्म skin, अधार्यम् is not fit to be worn, रोमाणि hair, सदभी: by the virtuous, अस्थि च bone also, वर्जितम् is prohibited, त्वद्विधैः by men like you also, धर्मचारिभिः by righteous people, मांसानि flesh, अभक्ष्याणि च is not fit for eating
data.md: And there is not the least doubt about it. My skin is not worthy of your touch and my bones and hairs should always be avoided by the virtuous. And my flesh is not worthy of being eaten by persons of your piety.

data.v: पञ्च पञ्चनखा भक्ष्या ब्रह्मक्षत्रेण राघव । शल्यकः श्वाविधो गोधा शशः कूर्मश्च पञ्चमः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama brahmins and kshatriyas are permitted to eat only the five nailed animals the porcupine, the hedgehog, the alligator, the rabbit and the tortoise.
data.anv: राघव Rama, ब्रह्मक्षत्रेण by brahmin and kshatriya, शल्यकः porcupine, श्वाविधः the hedgehog, गोधा the alligator, शशः the rabbit, कूर्मश्च the turtle, पञ्चमः the five, पञ्चनखाः fivenailed creatures, भक्ष्याः are permitted to be eaten
data.md: A hedge-hog a porcupine, an iguana, a hare and a tortoise these five animals only, having five toes, are worthy of being eaten by the Ks atryas and Brahmins, O Rāghava.

data.v: चर्म चास्थि च मे राजन्न स्पृशन्ति मनीषिणः । अभक्ष्याणि च मांसानि सोऽहं पञ्चनखो हतः ।।
data.es: 'O king the learned do not even touch my skin or bone. They do not eat my flesh. While it is so, you have unnecessarily killed me, a fivenailed animal.
data.anv: राजन O king, मनीषिणः learned people, मे mine, चर्म च even skin, अस्थीनि bone, न स्पृशन्ति do not touch, मांसानि च and the flesh, अभक्ष्याणि should not be eaten, पञ्चमः five nailed animal, सः अहम् such me, हतः killed
data.md: The wise, O Rāma, do not touch my skin and bones and my flesh is not worthy of being taken-I am that (monkey) having five toes who have been killed by you.

data.v: त्वया नाथेन काकुत्स्थ न सनाथा वसुंधरा । प्रमदा शीलसंपन्ना धूर्तेन पतिता यथा ।।
data.es: 'O Kakutstha just as a wife endowed with good character cannot be protected by a wicked husband, you cannot be a protector of this earth.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ Kakutstha, वसुन्धरा earth, नाथेन by lord, त्वया by you, शीलसम्पन्ना one endowed with good character, प्रमदा a lady, धूर्तेन by a wicked one, यथा similarly, पतिना by husband, सनाथा a protector, न no
data.md: O Kākutstha, the Earth has got you as her husband like to a good natured damsel being wedded to a husband who has forsaken his own religion.

data.v: शठो नैकृतिकः क्षुद्रो मिथ्या प्रश्रितमानसः । कथं दशरथेन त्वं जातः पापो महात्मना ।।
data.es: 'You are treacherous, dishonest, mean, guised with false humility and a sinner to the core. How were you born to that highsouled Dasaratha?
data.anv: शठः treacherous, नैकृतिकः dishonest, क्षुद्रः mean, मिथ्याप्रश्रितमानसः guised with false humility, पापः sinner, त्वम् you, महात्मना highsouled, दशरथेन to Dasaratha, कथम् how, जातः were you born?
data.md: How are you, who are wicked, narrowminded, a liar and ever intent upon bringing about others' misfortune, born of the loins of the high-souled Dasaratha?

data.v: छिन्नचारित्र्यकक्ष्येण सतां धर्मातिवर्तिना । त्यक्तधर्माङ्कुशेनाहं निहतो रामहस्तिना ।।
data.es: 'Breaking through the chains of good character, trespassing the moral code of conduct of the sages, discharging the sharp arrow of righteousness, the elephantine (arrogant) Rama killed me.
data.anv: छिन्नचारित्रकक्ष्येण breaking through the chains of good character, सताम् the sages, धर्मातिवर्तिना trespassing moral code of conduct, त्यक्तधर्माङ्कुशेन discharging sharp arrow of righteousness, रामहस्तिना the elephant called Rama, अहम् I, निहतः killed
data.md: I have been killed by an elephant-Rāma, disregarding the virtue of the pious, breaking the chord of character, and neglecting the goad of religion.

data.v: दृश्यमानस्तु युध्येथा मया युधि नृपात्मज । अद्य वैवस्वतं देवं पश्येस्त्वं निहतो मया ।।
data.es: 'O prince had you fought me face to face you would have seen Vaivasvata, the lord of death today (you would have been killed by me).
data.anv: नृपात्मज O prince, यदि if, दृश्यमानः openly, मया by me, युद्ध्येथाः you had fought, मया by me, निहतः killed, अद्य  today, त्वम् you, वैवस्वतं देवम् Vaivasvata, the lord of death, पश्येः you would have seen.
data.md: O son of a king, hadst you fought with me openly you wouldst have, forsooth, seen the abode of Death being killed by me.

data.v: त्वयादृश्येन तु रणे निहतोऽहं दुरासदः । प्रसुप्तः पन्नगेनेव नरः पानवशं गतः ।।
data.es: bitten to death by a snake while fast asleep.
data.anv: दुरासदः an unassailable warrior, अहम् I am, रणे in battle, अदृश्येन not seen, त्वया by you, पानवशं गतः in a drunken state, प्रसुप्तः  in deep sleep, नरः man, पन्नगेनेव like by the snake, निहतः killed
data.md: O Rāma, like to a serpent destroying persons asleep, you, that are under the control of vice, have killed me, who am hard to repress, keeping yourself out of my sight in the battle.

data.v: सुग्रीवप्रियकामेन यदहं निहतस्त्वया । कण्ठे बद्ध्वा प्रदद्यां तेऽनिहतं रावणं रणे ।।
data.es: 'Had you sought my help earlier(before you met Sugriva), I would have restored Sita to you within a single day. I have been killed by you to oblige Sugriva. I would have handed over Ravana by the neck after killing him in the battle.
data.anv: सुग्रीवप्रियकामेन to please Sugriva, त्वया by you, अहम् me, यत् since, निहतः killed, त्वम् you, एतदर्थम् on this account, पूर्वम् earlier, मामेव to me only, अचोदयः यदि if you had sought, रावणम् Ravana, रणे in battle, निहतम् killed, कण्ठे by the neck, बद्ध्वा tying, ते you, प्रदद्याम् I would have handed over

data.v: न्यस्तां सागरतोये वा पाताले वापि मैथिलीम् । जानयेयं तवादेशाच्छ्वेतामश्वतरीमिव ।।
data.es: 'Even if she were hidden in the waters of the ocean or in the underworld, I would have brought her by your order like Sweta to Aswatari or Hayagriva. (Hayagriva, an incarnation of Visnu brought Vedas stolen by demons, Madhu and Kaitabha from Patala or the netherworld)
data.anv: सागरतोये वा even from the water of the ocean, पातालेऽपि वा or even in the underworld, न्यस्ताम् hidden, मैथिलीम् Sita, तव your, आदेशात् by your order, श्वेताम्  like Sweta, अश्वतरीमिव like Aswatari, अनये यम् I could have brought
data.md: Whether in the deep ocean or in the region under the earth, I shall bring your Maithili like to an Asyatar* Here is an allusion. A prince of Daityas, named Hayagriva, stole the Vedas at the end of Kalpa; in the recovery of them he was slain by Vişnu after his descent as Matshya.

data.v: युक्तं यत्प्रप्नुयाद्राज्यं सुग्रीवः स्वर्गते मयि । अयुक्तं यदधर्मेण त्वयाहं निहतो रणे ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva inheriting the kingdom after my departure to heaven is proper. But your killing me this way in the combat by unjustifiable means is not.
data.anv: मयि in me, स्वर्गते on going to heaven, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्नुयात् इति getting as such, युक्तम् is right, अहम् I, रणे in war, त्वया by your, अधर्मेण by unjustifiable means, निहतः इति यत् this way been killed, अयुक्तम् not proper
data.md: It is perfectly proper that Sugrīva shall inherit my kingdom on my ascension to heaven. And it is equally improper that I have been viciously killed by you in the battle.

data.v: काममेवंविधं लोकः कालेन विनियुज्यते । क्षमं चेद्भवता प्राप्तमुत्तरं साधु चिन्त्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'Indeed, in the world people meet with death when the time comes. Hiding yourself (from me) you have achieved it. Is it proper for you? You may think over and give your reply.'
data.anv: लोकः the world, एवं विधः in this way, कामं indeed, कालेन  when time of death comes, विनियुज्यते hiding, क्षमं चेत् is it right, भवता for you, प्राप्तम् achieved, उत्तरम् reply, साधु properly, चिन्त्यताम् think over
data.md: Every one in time meets with death and hence there is nothing to be sorry for me. But do you think of a proper reply you shall give to the people (when asked about the cause of my destruction).

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा परिशुष्कवक्त्रः; शराभिघाताद्व्यथितो महात्मा । समीक्ष्य रामं रविसंनिकाशं; तूष्णीं बभूवामरराजसूनुः ।।
data.md: Having said this, that high-souled Son of monkey-chief, greatly distressed being wounded by (Rāma's) shaft and having his countenance dried up, became silent, fixing his look upon Rāma, resembling the sun.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रश्रितं वाक्यं धर्मार्थसहितं हितम् । परुषं वालिना रामो निहतेन विचेतसा ।।
data.es: To these harsh words though seemingly wellmeaning, courteous and righteous, Vali who had been mortally wounded and confused in mind, Rama replied:
data.anv: रामः Rama, निहतेन struck, विचेतसा confused in mind, वालिना Vali, धर्मार्थसहितम् righteous, हितम् wellmeaning, प्रश्रितम् courteous, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, इति these, उक्तः said.

data.v: तं निष्प्रभमिवादित्यं मुक्ततोयमिवाम्बुदम् । उक्तवाक्यं हरिश्रेष्ठमुपशान्तमिवानलम् ।।
data.es: To righteous Vali,the best of the monkeys, the lord of the monkeys, who looked like the Sun shorn of his brilliance or a raindrained cloud or a fire that had been extinguished. Rama, under the scanner, said in reply:
data.anv: तदा then, अधिक्षिप्तः having been criticised, रामः Rama, निष्प्रभम्  lost his glow, आदित्यम्  Sun, इव like, मुक्ततोयम् raindrained, अम्बुदमिव like the cloud, उपशान्तम् extinguished, अनलम् इव like the fire, हरिश्रेष्ठम् best of monkeys, हरीश्वरम् king of monkeys, अनुत्तमम् excellent, धर्मार्थगुणसम्पन्नम् righteous, उक्तवाक्यम् spoke out, वालिनम् to Vali, पश्चात् later, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: धर्मार्थगुणसंपन्नं हरीश्वरमनुत्तमम् । अधिक्षिप्तस्तदा रामः पश्चाद्वालिनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: To righteous Vali,the best of the monkeys, the lord of the monkeys, who looked like the Sun shorn of his brilliance or a raindrained cloud or a fire that had been extinguished. Rama, under the scanner, said in reply:
data.anv: तदा then, अधिक्षिप्तः having been criticised, रामः Rama, निष्प्रभम्  lost his glow, आदित्यम्  Sun, इव like, मुक्ततोयम् raindrained, अम्बुदमिव like the cloud, उपशान्तम् extinguished, अनलम् इव like the fire, हरिश्रेष्ठम् best of monkeys, हरीश्वरम् king of monkeys, अनुत्तमम् excellent, धर्मार्थगुणसम्पन्नम् righteous, उक्तवाक्यम् spoke out, वालिनम् to Vali, पश्चात् later, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च समयं चापि लौकिकम् । अविज्ञाय कथं बाल्यान्मामिहाद्य विगर्हसे ।।
data.es: 'Without correct knowledge of dharma, artha, kama and worldly ways, how do you reproach me bitterly now in total ignorance?
data.anv: धर्मम् righteousness, अर्थं च and wealth, कामं च pleasure also, लौकिकम् worldliness, समयं च at this time, अविज्ञाय not knowing, इह here, अद्य today, बाल्यात् from ignorance, माम् to me, कथम् how , विगर्हसे blame.
data.md: Not cognizant of virtue, knowledge, passion and custom, why did you blame me like a child?

data.v: अपृष्ट्वा बुद्धिसंपन्नान्वृद्धानाचार्यसंमतान् । सौम्य वानरचापल्यात्त्वं मां वक्तुमिहेच्छसि ।।
data.es: 'O gentle Vali why do you speak with monkeyish frivolousness, without consulting the elders and teachers endowed with intelligence?
data.anv: बुद्धिसम्पन्नान् endowed with intelligence, आचार्यसम्मतान् which carries the approval of teachers, वृद्धान् elderly, अपृष्ट्वा without consulting, त्वम् you,सौम्य gentle one, माम् me, वानरचापल्यात् from frivolousness of a monkey, इह here, वक्तुम् for talking this way, इच्छसि you wish.
data.md: Why did you purpose to address me thus out of fickleness, consequent upon your monkeyhood not asking your wise elders recognized by the preceptors?

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणामियं भूमिः सशैलवनकानना । मृगपक्षिमनुष्याणां निग्रहानुग्रहावपि ।।
data.es: 'This earth including mountains, groves and forests, animals, birds and humans belongs to the Ikshvaku kings.The right of purnishment and reward also vests with them.
data.anv: सशैलवनकानना including mountains, groves and forests, इयम् this, भूमिः earth, मृगपक्षिमनुष्याणाम् of animals, birds and humans, निग्रहप्रग्रहावपि punishing and rewarding also, इक्ष्वाकूणाम्  bequeathed to Ikshvaku race.
data.md: This land, abounding in hills and woods, belongs to the lkşwakus. Along with it was conferred on them the power of administering favour and chastisement to beasts, birds and human beings.

data.v: तां पालयति धर्मात्मा भरतः सत्यवागृजुः । धर्मकामार्थतत्त्वज्ञो निग्रहानुग्रहे रतः ।।
data.es: 'Bharata, righteous, truthful, upright, knower of dharma, artha and kama and dispenser of punishment and rewards, rules this earth.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, सत्यवाक् truthful , ऋजुः upright one, धर्मकामार्थत्त्वज्ञः knower of  dharma, kama and artha, निग्रहानुग्रहे in punishment and reward, रतः rests, भरतः Bharata, ताम् that earth, पालयति rules
data.md: The upright, virtuous and truthful king Bharata, cognizant of virtue, knowledge and passion and ever engaged in administering favour and punisl.ment, governs this kingdom.

data.v: नयश्च विनयश्चोभौ यस्मिन्सत्यं च सुस्थितम् । विक्रमश्च यथा दृष्टः स राजा देशकालवित् ।।
data.es: 'Bharata in whom justice and discipline, truth and courage along with the knowledge of time and place for action are firmly rooted is king (of this earth).
data.anv: यस्मिन् in whom, नयश्च justice, विनयश्च discipline, उभौ both, सत्यं च and truth, सुस्थितम् firmly established, विक्रमश्च and courage, यथा so, दृष्टः seen, सः he, देशकालवित् time and place for action, राजा king.
data.md: That king is said to be cognizant of time and place; in him dwelleth modesty, truthfulness, prowess and a love for discipline.

data.v: तस्य धर्मकृतादेशा वयमन्ये च पार्थिवः । चरामो वसुधां कृत्स्नां धर्मसंतानमिच्छवः ।।
data.es: 'Following his command, in confirmity with dharma we and the other kings also move all over the entire world desirous of promoting dharma.
data.anv: तस्य his, धर्मकृतादेशाः receiving instructions according to dharma, वयम् we, अन्ये others, पार्थिवाश्च and kings, धर्मसन्तानम् for the progress of dharma, इच्छवः desiring, कृत्स्नाम् this whole, वसुधाम् land, चरामः we are going about.
data.md: Ourselves and other kings, being commanded by him to practise piety, have been journeying in this wide world desirous of multiplying virtue.

data.v: तस्मिन्नृपतिशार्दूल भरते धर्मवत्सले । पालयत्यखिलां भूमिं कश्चरेद्धर्मनिग्रहम् ।।
data.es: 'Who can stray from the path of dharma when the whole world is ruled by Bharata, a tiger among kings, and a lover of dharma?
data.anv: नृपतिशार्दूले when the tiger among kings, धर्मवत्सले lover of dharma, तस्मिन् in him, भरते when Bharata, अखिलाम् entire, भूमिम् earth, पालयति while he is ruling, कः who, धर्मनिग्रहम् can stray from dharma, चरेत् and go?
data.md: That foremost of monarchs, Bharatalover of virtue, governing this entire earth, who dares perpetrate an iniquity.?

data.v: ते वयं मार्गविभ्रष्टं स्वधर्मे परमे स्थिताः । भरताज्ञां पुरस्कृत्य निगृह्णीमो यथाविधि ।।
data.es: 'By the command of Bharata ,all of us are devoted to our duty of upholding dharma and virtue and duly punish those who deviate from the path of dharma.
data.anv: परमे supreme, स्वधर्मे in one's own duty, स्थिताः established, ते वयम् all of us by him, भरताज्ञाम् command of Bharata, पुरस्कृत्य regarding, यथाविधि our duty, धर्मविभ्रष्टम् one who strays from the path of dharma,  निगृह्णीमो will punish.
data.md: Stationed in the excellent virtue of our own and placing Bharata's commandments on our heads, we shall consider how we shall punish them who go astray (from the path of virtue).

data.v: त्वं तु संक्लिष्टधर्मा च कर्मणा च विगर्हितः । कामतन्त्रप्रधानश्च न स्थितो राजवर्त्मनि ।।
data.es: 'You have violated dharma. You stand condemned for your actions. Passion is your priority. You have strayed from the right path of kings.
data.anv: त्वं तु you too, संक्लिष्टधर्मा च are violating dharma, कर्मणा by your actions, विगर्हितः despised, कामतन्त्रप्रधानश्च seeking pleasures as primary, राजवर्त्मनि on the right path of kings, न स्थितः did not stay.
data.md: You have oppressed virtue and perpetrated a gross iniquity. You have placed yourself under the control of your passions and deviated from the track of royal duties.

data.v: ज्येष्ठो भ्राता पिता चैव यश्च विद्यां प्रयच्छति । त्रयस्ते पितरो ज्ञेया धर्मे च पथि वर्तिनः ।।
data.anv: धर्म्ये in a righteous, पथि path, वर्तिनः those who conduct, ज्येष्ठो भ्राता elder brother, पिता चैव  even father, यश्च his, विद्याम् knowledge, प्रयच्छति gives, ते त्रयः all the three, पितरः are fathers, ज्ञेयाः should be known.
data.md: The elder brother, father, and the instructor—these three should always be regarded in the light of a father if they tread the paths of virtue and morality,

data.v: यवीयानात्मनः पुत्रः शिष्यश्चापि गुणोदितः । पुत्रवत्ते त्रयश्चिन्त्या धर्मश्चेदत्र कारणम् ।।
data.anv: यवीयान् younger brother, पुत्रः son, गुणोदितः virtuous, शिष्यश्च a pupil, ते त्रयः these three, आत्मनः one's own, पुत्रवत् like son, चिन्त्याः should be treated, अत्र there, धर्मः dharma (morality), कारणम् judged.
data.md: A younger brother, a son and an accomplished follower should always be regarded as sons. And virtue is always at the bottom of all such considerations.

data.v: सूक्ष्मः परमदुर्ज्ञेयः सतां धर्मः प्लवंगम । हृदिस्थः सर्वभूतानामात्मा वेद शुभाशुभम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkey dharma is very subtle. It is extremely difficult to understand. Installed in the hearts of all living beings the self knows good and evil (soul is the witness of good and evil).
data.anv: प्लवङ्गम O monkey, सताम् for the pious ones, धर्मः dharma, सूक्ष्मः is subtle, परमदुरजेयः  extremely difficult to understand, सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, हृदिस्थः in the heart, आत्मा self, शुभाशुभम् good and bad, वेद knows.
data.md: O monkey, the religion of the good is indeed very subtle and can comprehend great things the immortal soul can understand what is good or bad.

data.v: चपलश्चपलैः सार्धं वानरैरकृतात्मभिः । जात्यन्ध इव जात्यन्धैर्मन्त्रयन्द्रक्ष्यसे नु किम् ।।
data.es: 'You are fickle by nature. Your consultants are frivolous, pettyminded monkeys. It is like one born blind suppporting another blind by birth. What do you know (about dharma)?
data.anv: चपलः frivolous one, अकृतात्मभिः by the pettyminded, चपलैः by the fickle ones, वानरैः सार्धम् with the monkeys, जात्यन्धैः इव as if blind by birth, मन्त्रयन् while counselling, प्रेक्षसे नु किम् (why do you look at these issues) for what?
data.md: Fickle as you are, how canst you comprehend what is proper, consulting with your monkey companions who are equally stupid and lighthearted, like to one, born blind, leading with another such?

data.v: अहं तु व्यक्ततामस्य वचनस्य ब्रवीमि ते । न हि मां केवलं रोषात्त्वं विगर्हितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'I shall explain to you clearly (the reason for striking you down). It is not proper for you to despise me with mere anger and malice.
data.anv: अहम् I, अस्य his, वचनस्य of words, व्यक्तताम् clarify, ते to you, ब्रवीमि I will explain, त्वम् you, केवलम् only, रोषात् with anger, माम् me, विगर्हितुम् blame, नार्हसि हि not proper.
data.md: I do fairly speak to you that it is not anger only that has led me to bring about your destruction.

data.v: तदेतत्कारणं पश्य यदर्थं त्वं मया हतः । भ्रातुर्वर्तसि भार्यायां त्यक्त्वा धर्मं सनातनम् ।।
data.es: 'Now know the reason why I struck you down. Having abandoned the eternal law, you are living with your younger brother's wife.
data.anv: त्वम् you, यदर्थम् reason, मया by me, हतः struck, तत् एतत् all about that, कारणम् reason, पश्य see, सनातनम् having abandoned, धर्मम् law त्यक्त्वा casting, भ्रातुः brother's, भार्यायाम् with wife, वर्तसि live.
data.md: Do you consider why I have killed you-you had ravished your brother's wife renouncing that ever-existing virtue.

data.v: अस्य त्वं धरमाणस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । रुमायां वर्तसे कामात्स्नुषायां पापकर्मकृत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:
data.anv: महात्मनः great self, अस्य of this, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, धरमाणस्य when he is alive, पापकर्मकृत् a sinner, कामात् due to lust, स्नुषायाम् in your daughterinlaw, रुमायाम् with Ruma, वर्तसे live.
data.md: You, the perpetrator of many evil deeds, have got by Rumā, the wife of your brother-the high-souled Sugrīva.

data.v: तद्व्यतीतस्य ते धर्मात्कामवृत्तस्य वानर । भ्रातृभार्याभिमर्शेऽस्मिन्दण्डोऽयं प्रतिपादितः ।।
data.es: 'O monkey since you have violated morality by sinning against your brother's wife this punishment is justified.
data.anv: वानर monkey, तत् thus, धर्मात् from morality, व्यतीतस्य trespassing, कामवृत्तस्य for sensual pleasure, ते to you, अस्मिन् भ्रातृभार्यावमर्शे sinning against brother's wife, अयम् this, दण्डः punishment, प्रतिपादितः was justified.
data.md: O monkey, you had thus violated the path of virtue. And thus I have punished you who have ravished your elder brother's spouse.

data.v: न हि धर्मविरुद्धस्य लोकवृत्तादपेयुषः । दण्डादन्यत्र पश्यामि निग्रहं हरियूथप ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys I do not see any other way of controlling a person excepting punishing the one who has acted against dharma and swerved from the accepted code of conduct.
data.anv: हरियूथप O lord of monkeys, धर्मविरुद्धस्य for one who acts against dharma, लोकवृत्तात् from the accepted practice of the world, अपेयुषः for one who swerved, दण्डात् from punishing, अन्यत्र other than this, निग्रहम् preventing, न पश्यामि हि I have not seen.
data.md: o you, the leader of monkey-herds-I find no other alternative than to punish him who act against humanity and violates the sacred sanctions of custom.

data.v: औरसीं भगिनीं वापि भार्यां वाप्यनुजस्य यः । प्रचरेत नरः कामात्तस्य दण्डो वधः स्मृतः ।।
data.es: 'I am a kshatriya born of a good family. I will not pardon you for your sin. Whosoever transgresses dharma against his own daughter, sister or brother's wife out of lust should be killed according to smriti.
data.anv: कुलोद्भव: born in a good family, क्षत्रियः kshatriya, अहम् I am, ते your, पापम् sin, न मर्षये I will not pardon, यः नरः whoever, औरसीम् his own daughter, भगिनीं वापि even sister also, अनुजस्य brother's, भार्यां वापि wife also, कामात् out of lust, प्रचरेत meets, तस्य his, दण्डः punishment, वधः killing, स्मृतः ordained in scriptures.
data.md: I am a Ksatrya coming of a high pedigree. I cannot put up with your immoral conduct. Šāstras sanction the destruction of one who under the influence of passion ravishes his own daughter, sister and younger brother's wife.

data.v: भरतस्तु महीपालो वयं त्वादेशवर्तिनः । त्वं च धर्मादतिक्रान्तः कथं शक्यमुपेक्षितुम् ।।
data.es: 'Bharata is a king and we follow his command. How can you, who have strayed from dharma, go unpunished?
data.anv: भरतः तु Bharata too, महीपालः king, वयं तु we too, आदेशवर्तिनः follow his order, त्वं तु you too, धर्मात् from dharma, अतिक्रान्तः stayed, उपेक्षितुम् to overlook, कथम् how, शक्यम् possible?
data.md: This is Bharata's commandment-the lord of earth, and we have been satisfying his orders. You have disregarded virtue.

data.v: गुरुधर्मव्यतिक्रान्तं प्राज्ञो धर्मेण पालयन् । भरतः कामवृत्तानां निग्रहे पर्यवस्थितः ।।
data.es: 'Wise Bharata being a respectable king rules by dharma. By the command of Bharata, we are bent upon punishing those who have strayed from dharma by being addicted to sensual pleasures.
data.anv: प्राज्ञ: wise man, गुरुः a respectable man, धर्मव्यतिक्रान्तम् one who has trespassed dharma, धर्मेण by dharma, पालयन् while ruling, भरतः Bharata, कामवृत्तानाम्  addicted to sensual pleasures, निग्रहे to punish, पर्यवस्थितः is determined.
data.md: A wise man, living in virtue, cannot let go one who has passed by the sanctions of morality. Bharata has sanctioned the destruction of the amorous; and we, O lord of monkeys, following his orders, thought proper, to encompass the destruction of one like you who has spoliated virtue and morality.

data.v: वयं तु भरतादेशं विधिं कृत्वा हरीश्वर । त्वद्विधान्भिन्नमर्यादान्नियन्तुं पर्यवस्थिताः ।।
data.es: 'O Vali we have to follow Bharata's command and are bent upon punishing those wicked people who deviate from the bounds of dharma.
data.anv: हरीश्वर lord of monkeys, वयं तु we too, भरतादेशम् by Bharata's command, विधिम् following his command, कृत्वा do, भिन्नमर्यादान् deviated from the bounds of dharma, त्वद्विधान् this way, नियन्तुम् to punish, पर्यवस्थिताः determined.

data.v: सुग्रीवेण च मे सख्यं लक्ष्मणेन यथा तथा । दारराज्यनिमित्तं च निःश्रेयसि रतः स मे ।।
data.es: 'My friendship with Sugriva is as strong as that with Lakshmana. Its motive is the recovery of his wife and sovereignty. I have promised this to him in the presence of monkeys. How can a pledge remain unhonoured by a person like me? How is it possible?
data.anv: लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, यथा as such, सख्यं friendship, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, दारराज्यनिमित्तं for the sake of wife and kingdom, निःश्रेयसि welfare, रत: engaged, च and, तथा so, मे  mine, तदा then, मया by me, वानरसन्निधौ in the presence of monkeys, प्रतिज्ञा च a pledge, दत्ता made, मद्विधेन a person like me, प्रतिज्ञा promise, अनवेक्षितुम् to disregard, कथम् how,  शक्या possible?
data.md: Like to Laksmana, I have contracted friendship with Sugrīva. And with a view to regain his wife and kingdom, he resolved to engage in my well-being. I too also promised the same before the monkeys. And how can a man of my position neglect to make good his promise?

data.v: प्रतिज्ञा च मया दत्ता तदा वानरसंनिधौ । प्रतिज्ञा च कथं शक्या मद्विधेनानवेक्षितुम् ।।
data.es: 'My friendship with Sugriva is as strong as that with Lakshmana. Its motive is the recovery of his wife and sovereignty. I have promised this to him in the presence of monkeys. How can a pledge remain unhonoured by a person like me? How is it possible?
data.anv: लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, यथा as such, सख्यं friendship, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, दारराज्यनिमित्तं for the sake of wife and kingdom, निःश्रेयसि welfare, रत: engaged, च and, तथा so, मे  mine, तदा then, मया by me, वानरसन्निधौ in the presence of monkeys, प्रतिज्ञा च a pledge, दत्ता made, मद्विधेन a person like me, प्रतिज्ञा promise, अनवेक्षितुम् to disregard, कथम् how,  शक्या possible?
data.md: Like to Laksmana, I have contracted friendship with Sugrīva. And with a view to regain his wife and kingdom, he resolved to engage in my well-being. I too also promised the same before the monkeys. And how can a man of my position neglect to make good his promise?

data.v: तदेभिः कारणैः सर्वैर्महद्भिर्धर्मसंहितैः । शासनं तव यद्युक्तं तद्भवाननुमन्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'Knowing all these reasons(many violations of dharma), it is proper for you as a king to approve of the punishment accorded to you in consonance with dharma.
data.anv: तत् that, धर्मसंहितैः in consonance with dharma, सर्वैः all, महद्भिः  many big, एभिः by these, कारणैः for these reasons, तव your, यत् which, शासनम् is accorded, युक्तम् is proper, तत् that, भवान् you, अनुमन्यताम् to be accepted
data.md: For these causes of very great moment, favoured by virtue, I have adininistered to you this condign punishment. Do you now approve it.

data.v: सर्वथा धर्म इत्येव द्रष्टव्यस्तव निग्रहः । वयस्यस्योपकर्तव्यं धर्ममेवानुपश्यता ।।
data.es: 'Punishment given to you should be viewed as a right course of action in all respects. This is the duty of a trustworthy friend who follows dharma.
data.anv: तव your, निग्रहः overthrowing, सर्वथा in all respects, धर्मः इत्येव thus justifiable,द्रष्टव्यः it should be viewed, धर्मम् dharma, अनुपश्यत: who follows, वयस्यस्य a friend's, उपकर्तव्यम् एव  should be rendered.
data.md: Your discomfiture is quite of a piece with the sanctions of morality-and to assist friends in one of the codes of religion.

data.v: राजभिर्धृतदण्डास्तु कृत्वा पापानि मानवाः । निर्मलाः स्वर्गमायान्ति सन्तः सुकृतिनो यथा ।।
data.es: 'Men who have perpetrated sins should be subjected to punishment by kings so that they become stainless and attain heaven like pious men who have performed good deeds.
data.anv: मानवाः human beings, पापानि sins, कृत्वा having done, राजभिः by kings, धृतदण्डाः those punished, निर्मलाः purified, सुकृतिनः like those men performing good deeds, सन्तः यथा like pious men, स्वर्गम् heaven, आयान्ति will attain.

data.v: आर्येण मम मान्धात्रा व्यसनं घोरमीप्सितम् । श्रमणेन कृते पापे यथा पापं कृतं त्वया ।।
data.es: 'In the past a similar sin was perpetrated by Sramana, a revered soul (mendicant) and Mandhata, a noble king of my race inflicted terrible punishment on him.
data.anv: मम me, आर्येण by noble, मान्धात्रा by Mandhata, त्वया by you, यथा like that, पापम्  sin, कृतम् was perpetrated, श्रमणेन by Sramana, पापे sin, कृते done, ईप्सितम् inflicted, घोरम् terrible, व्यसनम् punishment.
data.md: Formerly an iniquity, like one perpetrated by you, was committed by a devotee who was punished severely by my forefather Māndhäta.

data.v: अन्यैरपि कृतं पापं प्रमत्तैर्वसुधाधिपैः । प्रायश्चित्तं च कुर्वन्ति तेन तच्छाम्यते रजः ।।
data.es: 'Vicious deeds have been committed by others when the kings were not watchful. Kings punish such sinners when they are vigilant. Otherwise they have to atone for their negligence.
data.anv: अन्यैरपि by others also, कृतम् committed, पापम् vicious deeds, प्रमत्तैः by those not watchful, वसुधाधिपैः by the kings of the earth, प्रायश्चित्तम् atonement, कुर्वन्ति was done, तेन by that, तत् that, रजः taint, शाम्यते is removed.
data.md: And other lords of earth punish in the same way the authors of misdeeds. What more, the perpetrators of crime, themselves undergo penances and are thus released from their sins.

data.v: तदलं परितापेन धर्मतः परिकल्पितः । वधो वानरशार्दूल न वयं स्ववशे स्थिताः ।।
data.es: 'O tiger among monkeys do not regret. Your death has the sanction of dharma. We are under the control of sastras. We are committed to them. We do not have the freedom to act independently.
data.anv: वानरशार्दूल O tiger among Monkeys, तत् therefore, परितापेन अलम् do not regret, वधः striking, धर्मतः righteously, परिकल्पितः committed, वयम् we are, स्ववशे under our control, न स्थिताः are not.
data.md: Therefore do not repent any more, O best of monkeys. The punishment, I have inflicted on you, is in consonance with the sanctions of morality. We are not our own masters.

data.v: वागुराभिश्च पाशैश्च कूटैश्च विविधैर्नराः । प्रतिच्छन्नाश्च दृश्याश्च गृह्णन्ति सुबहून्मृगान् । प्रधावितान्वा वित्रस्तान्विस्रब्धानतिविष्ठितान् ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys I have no mental agony nor do I regret in this case. Hidden from view or out in the open, people catch animals by means of snares or ropes or through other tricks.
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गव O best of monkeys, तत्र here, मे to me, मनस्तापः mental agony, मन्युः regret, न not, नराः people, वागुराभिश्च with meshnet, पाशैश्च with ropes, विविधैः different, कूटैश्च with tricks, प्रतिच्छन्नाश्च hiding, दृश्याश्च out in the open, सुबहून् many, मृगान् animals, गृह्णन्ति catch.
data.md: Many persons living on flesh, either lying in ambush, or openly catch and pierce by means of net, noose and trap, many a deer, terrified and trusted, taking to their heels or quarrelling with their companions, careful or careless. They are not to blame in this and I do not cherish, O best of monkeys, any mortification or ire for this.

data.v: प्रमत्तानप्रमत्तान्वा नरा मांसार्थिनो भृशम् । विध्यन्ति विमुखांश्चापि न च दोषोऽत्र विद्यते ।।
data.es: 'People seeking animal flesh for food kill animals alarmed or unalarmed, animals that run away or animals that stand still. They kill animals whether they are alert or not and no blemish is attached.
data.anv: मांसार्थिनः seeking flesh for food, नराः men, प्रधावितान् वा or running ones, वित्रस्तान् alarmed ones, विस्रब्धान् unalarmed, निष्ठितान् stable ones, प्रमत्तान् those that are not alert, अप्रमत्तान्वा even alert ones also, विमुखांश्च those which turn away, विध्यन्ति kill, अत्र here, दोषः blemish, न विद्यते not known.
data.md: And even many royal ascetics, versed in religious lore, go a-hunting; and hence you had been killed by me with a shaft, O monkey, in the conflict.

data.v: यान्ति राजर्षयश्चात्र मृगयां धर्मकोविदाः । तस्मात्त्वं निहतो युद्धे मया बाणेन वानर । अयुध्यन्प्रतियुध्यन्वा यस्माच्छाखामृगो ह्यसि ।।
data.es: 'O monkey even royal saints wellversed in dharma go for hunting. I struck you down with an arrow whether you were fighting with Sugriva or not, since you are a monkey. (You can be hit whether you are fighting face to face or not).
data.anv: अत्र here, धर्मकोविदाः those wellversed in dharma, राजर्षयः royal saints, मृगयाम् hunting, यान्ति go for, वानर monkey, त्वम् you, अयुध्यन् while not fighting, प्रतियुध्यन् वा or while fighting back, यस्मात् since, शाखामृगः monkey, असि you are, तस्मात् therefore, मया myself, युद्धे in battle, बाणेन by an arrow, निहतः struck down.

data.v: दुर्लभस्य च धर्मस्य जीवितस्य शुभस्य च । राजानो वानरश्रेष्ठ प्रदातारो न संशयः ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys kings are donors of dharma, life and auspiciousness to people which is difficult to acquire. There is no doubt about it.
data.anv: वानरश्रेष्ठ O best among monkeys राजानः kings, दुर्लभस्य difficult, धर्मस्य righteousness, शुभस्य auspicious, जीवितस्य life, प्रदातारः donors, संशयः doubt, न not.

data.v: तान्न हिंस्यान्न चाक्रोशेन्नाक्षिपेन्नाप्रियं वदेत् । देवा मानुषरूपेण चरन्त्येते महीतले ।।
data.es: 'One should not insult kings, nor shout at them, nor disregard them nor speak unpleasant words to them. They are gods in human form moving on this earth.
data.anv: तान् them, न हिंस्यात्  insult, न चाक्रोशेत् not to be shouted, न आक्षिपेत् not to be disregarded, अप्रियम् unpleasant, न वदेत् not speak, एते they, देवाः gods, मानुषरूपेण in the form of human beings, महीतले on this earth, चरन्ति move about.

data.v: त्वं तु धर्ममविज्ञाय केवलं रोषमास्थितः । प्रदूषयसि मां धर्मे पितृपैतामहे स्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'Seized with improper anger, you are reproaching one who is devoted to dharma, without knowing that I follow the code of conduct that has been passed on by my fathers and forefathers.'
data.anv: त्वं तु you on your part, धर्मम् dharma, अविज्ञाय not knowing, केवलम् only, रोषम् anger, आस्थितः have restored, पितृपैतामहे followed by fathers and grandfathers, धर्मे in dharma, स्थितम् devoted, माम्  me, प्रदूषयसि you are reproaching.
data.md: Not knowing virtue and growing angry why did you blame me who am following the religion of my forefathers?

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण वाली प्रव्यथितो भृशम् । प्रत्युवाच ततो रामं प्राञ्जलिर्वानरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Vali was very much pained to hear Rama. He became free from confusion regarding dharma and no longer found fault with Rama.
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः addressed, वाली Vali, भृशम् greatly, प्रव्यथितः was pained, धर्मे in dharma, अधिगतनिश्चयः had arrived at a conclusion, राघवे at Rama, दोषम्  fault, एवमुक्तस्तु having said this way, न दध्यौ did not find.
data.md: Thus addressed by Rāma, Khara enraged and beyond himself with passion, with eyes reddened, replied.

data.v: यत्त्वमात्थ नरश्रेष्ठ तदेवं नात्र संशयः । प्रतिवक्तुं प्रकृष्टे हि नापकृष्टस्तु शक्नुयात् ।।
यदयुक्तं मया पूर्वं प्रमादाद्वाक्यमप्रियम् । तत्रापि खलु मे दोषं कर्तुं नार्हसि राघव ।।
data.es: In Progress
data.anv: राघव Rama, प्रकृष्टे  a distinguished person, अपकृष्टः an ordinary person, प्रतिवक्तुम् to argue, न शक्नुयात् is not possible, मया by me, पूर्वम् earlier, प्रमादात् due to ignorance, यत् those, अयुक्तम् in appropriate, अप्रियम् unpleasant, वाक्यम् words, (उक्तम्  said), तत्रापि in that, मे my, दोषम् fault, कर्तुम्  hold, नार्हसि you need not be.

data.v: त्वं हि दृष्टार्थतत्त्वज्ञः प्रजानां च हिते रतः । कार्यकारणसिद्धौ ते प्रसन्ना बुद्धिरव्यया ।।
data.es: 'You are a wise man given to truth and righteousness.You remain devoted to people's wellbeing. As you know for certain about cause and effect your intellect is sound and words pleasant.
data.anv: त्वम् you, दृष्टार्थतत्त्वज्ञः wise man given to truth and righteousness, प्रजानाम्  people's, हिते   wellbeing, रतश्च remain devoted, अव्यया knowing, बुद्धि: sound intellect, कार्यकारणसिद्धौ know for certain about cause and effect, प्रसन्ना is pleasant.

data.v: मामप्यवगतं धर्माद्व्यतिक्रान्तपुरस्कृतम् । धर्मसंहितया वाचा धर्मज्ञ परिपालय ।।
data.es: 'O knower of dharma, I did not follow dharma in the past. I have trangressed the bounds of dharma. Say, you have pardoned me, protect me in a righteous manner.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञ knower of dharma, अगतधर्माणं did not follow dharma, अवगतम् in the past, व्यतिक्रान्तपुरस्कृतम्  violated the bounds of dharma in the past, मामपि and me too, धर्मसंहितया in a righteous manner, वाचा word, परिपालय  protect.
data.md: Do you know me as the foremost of sinners and one who has deviated from the track of imorality. Do you conduct me, with pious words, to a better land.

data.v: बाष्पसंरुद्धकण्ठस्तु वाली सार्तरवः शनैः । उवाच रामं संप्रेक्ष्य पङ्कलग्न इव द्विपः ।।
data.md: Vāli, having his throat choked with vapour, addressed again and again, Rāma, with piteous accents, saying.

data.v: न त्वात्मानमहं शोचे न तारां नापि बान्धवान् । यथा पुत्रं गुणश्रेष्ठमङ्गदं कनकाङ्गदम् ।।
data.es: 'I neither grieve for myself nor for Tara nor for my kinsmen. But I do for my son Angada adorned with golden armlets. He is embellished with all virtues.
data.anv: गुणज्येष्ठम्  all virtues, कनकाङ्गदम् adorned with golden armlets, पुत्रम् son, अङ्गदम् Angada, यथा as, अहम् I, आत्मानम् for me, न शोचे I do not grieve, ताराम् Tara too, न not, बान्धवानपि even kinsmen, न not.
data.md: I do not mourn so much for me, Tāră, or other friends as for my son Angada, eldest and wearing a golden Angada* *A bracelet worn on the upper arm.

data.v: स ममादर्शनाद्दीनो बाल्यात्प्रभृति लालितः । तटाक इव पीताम्बुरुपशोषं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'I loved him very much from his childhood. He will grow depressed in my absence. He will become like a pond whose waters have been dried up.
data.anv: बाल्यात् from childhood, प्रभृति from that time, लालितः loved, सः him, मम to me, आदर्शदानत्   by not seeing me, दीनः dejected, पीताम्बुः after the water is dried up, तटाकः इव like a tank, उपशोषम् left dried, गमिष्यति will become.
data.md: Brought up by me from his very infancy, he shall by my separation, wear away like to a pond having its liquid contents drunk up by an elephant.

data.v: सुग्रीवे चाङ्गदे चैव विधत्स्व मतिमुत्तमाम् । त्वं हि शास्ता च गोप्ता च कार्याकार्यविधौ स्थितः ।।
data.es: 'Shower equal affection from your heart on Sugriva and Angada. You are their protector and punisher also. You know what should and should not be done.
data.anv: सुग्रीवे at Sugriva, आङ्गदे चैव and at Angada, उत्तमाम् great, मतिम् in mind, विधत्स्व you may show, कार्याकार्यविधौ with regard to what should and should not be done, स्थितः sure, त्वम् you, गोप्ता च protector and, शास्ता च also punisher.
data.md: Do you regard favourable Sugrīva and Angada. You are their protector, and chastiser punishing them for their sins.

data.v: या ते नरपते वृत्तिर्भरते लक्ष्मणे च या । सुग्रीवे चाङ्गदे राजंस्तां चिन्तयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O lord of men may you have the same kind of affection for Sugriva and Angada as you have for Bharata and Lakshmana.
data.anv: नरपते O Lord of men, राजन् king, भरते Bharata, ते your, या वृत्ति: such affection, लक्ष्मणे च and towards Lakshmana, या whatever, ताम् same, सुग्रीवे च Sugriva and, अङ्गदे at  Angada, आधातुम् to hold, इह here, अर्हसि you may do.
data.md: O king, O lord of men, it behoveth you to regard Sugrīva and Angada in the same light in which you regardest Bharata and Laksmana.

data.v: मद्दोषकृतदोषां तां यथा तारां तपस्विनीम् । सुग्रीवो नावमन्येत तथावस्थातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'I hope Tara will not be made to suffer because of my offence. Make Sugriva not to run wretched Tara down.
data.anv: मद्दोषकृतदोषाम् suffered due to my offence, तपस्विनीम् wretch, तां ताराम् that Tara, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, नावमन्येत not think ill of her, तथा that, अवस्थातुम् to maintain, अर्हसि hope
data.md: It behoveth you to so arrange as Sugrīva may not disregard that chaste Tārā who is blameable for my folly only.

data.v: त्वया ह्यनुगृहीतेन शक्यं राज्यमुपासितुम् । त्वद्वशे वर्तमानेन तव चित्तानुवर्तिना ।।
data.es: 'It is possible for a person favoured by you to rule the kingdom.It is possible for one who is under your control and acts according to your will to rule the entire world and earn heaven.
data.anv: त्वया by you, अनुगृहीतेन by a person favoured, त्वद्वशे under your control, वर्तमानेन by one who moves, तव चित्तानुवर्तिना acts according to your will, राज्यम् kingdom, उपासितुम् to rule, शक्यम् it is possible, दिवम् heaven, आर्जयितुं च to attain, वसुधाम् earth, चापि also, शक्यम् posssible.
data.md: He, who is favoured by you, abideth by yourcommandments and acteth after your heart, can acquire kingdom, attain to heaven, and govern the earth.

data.v: स तमाश्वासयद्रामो वालिनं व्यक्तदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: Now Vali was able to see clearly. Rama consoled him with words of peace and tranquillity, truth and righteousness.
data.anv: सः रामः Rama, व्यक्तदर्शनम् him who saw clearly, तं वालिनम् that Vali, सामसम्पन्नया for peace and tranquillity, धर्मतत्त्वार्थयुक्तया reflecting truth and righteousness, वाचा with words, आश्वासयत् he consoled.

data.v: न वयं भवता चिन्त्या नाप्यात्मा हरिसत्तम । वयं भवद्विशेषेण धर्मतः कृतनिश्चयाः ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys, abandon all your anxiety on this score. Bother not about us or about yourself. Whatever has happened, has happened in consonance with dharma.
data.anv: प्लवङ्गम O monkey, एतदर्थम् on this account, त्वया by you, सन्तापः worry, न कार्यः not to be entertained, हरिसत्तम best of the monkeys, भवता by you, वयम् we, न चिन्त्याः not worry, आत्मापि you too, न not, वयम् we, भवद्विशेषेण for your sin, धर्मतः principles of righteousness, कृतनिश्चयाः came to firm decision.

data.v: दण्ड्ये यः पातयेद्दण्डं दण्ड्यो यश्चापि दण्ड्यते । कार्यकारणसिद्धार्थावुभौ तौ नावसीदतः ।।
data.es: 'The sinner and the punisher, whoever gives punishment and whoever receives it, are both regulated by the law of cause and effect. So do not despair.
data.anv: यः whoever, दण्ड्ये  deserves to be punished, दण्डम् punishment, पातयेत्  inflicts, यश्चापि and whosoever, दण्ड्यः sinner, दण्ड्यते punished, कार्यकारणसिद्धार्थौ with regard to cause and effect, तौ they, उभौ both, नावसीदतः do not become despondent.
data.md: They never lose their virtue being proficient in the mode of ascerting crime and punishing it one administering punishment to the criminal and the criminal receiving it. And therefore receiving punishment (from me) you had been released from your sins and acquired a knowledge of religion.

data.v: तद्भवान्दण्डसंयोगादस्माद्विगतकल्मषः । गतः स्वां प्रकृतिं धर्म्यां धर्मदृष्ट्तेन वर्त्मना ।।
data.es: 'You have been purged of your sin through punishment from the point of view of righteousness. You have regained your spiritual nature on the path of dharma.
data.anv: तत् such, भवान् you अस्मात् from this, दण्डसंयोगात् due to punishment, विगतकल्मषः got rid of sin, धर्मदृष्टेन from the point of righteousness, वर्त्मना by the path, धर्म्याम् righteous, स्वाम् your, प्रकृतिम् natura spiritual nature, गतः you regained.

data.v: स तस्य वाक्यं मधुरं महात्मनः; समाहितं धर्मपथानुवर्तिनः । निशम्य रामस्य रणावमर्दिनो; वचः सुयुक्तं निजगाद वानरः ।।
data.es: Having listened to the sweet, wellcomposed words of great Rama, a crusher of the enemy in war ,follower of righteous path, Vali replied in appropriate manner:
data.anv: सः वानरः that monkey, महात्मनः of the great, धर्मपथानुवर्तिनः of a man following a righteous path, रणावमर्दिनः  a crusher of enemy in war, तस्य रामस्य that Rama's, मधुरम् sweet, समाहितम् wellcomposed, वाक्यम् words, निशम्य after hearing, सुयुक्तम् very fitting, वचः words, निजगाद replied.
data.md: Hearing these sweet, collected and pious words of the high-souled Rāma,-the repressor of the enemies in a battle,-the monkey again addressed him with the following pregnant words.

data.v: शराभितप्तेन विचेतसा मया; प्रदूषितस्त्वं यदजानता प्रभो । इदं महेन्द्रोपमभीमविक्रम; प्रसादितस्त्वं क्षम मे महीश्वर ।।
data.es: 'Pray, O mighty prince, hero of immense valour, pardon me for the words of blame I unwittingly hurled at you. I said all that in excruciating pain caused by your mighty arrow and in confusion of what is right and what is wrong.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eighteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्रभो O lord, महेन्द्रोपम् like Indra, भीमविक्रम hero of immense valour, नरेश्वर lord of men, शराभितप्तेन excruciating pain caused by the arrow, विचेतसा loss of consciousness, अजानता without knowing, मया by me, त्वम् you, यत् since, प्रदूषितः blamed very much, मे I, इदम् thus, क्षमस्व  forgive, त्वम् you, प्रसादितः be pleased.
data.md: O lord, O you having Mahendra's prowess, I do propitiate you for my having insulted you with improper words, senseless as I was being wounded by shafts. Do you forgive me, O lord of monkeys.

data.v: स वानरमहाराजः शयानः शरविक्षतः । प्रत्युक्तो हेतुमद्वाक्यैर्नोत्तरं प्रत्यपद्यत ।।
data.es: The king of monkeys lying on the ground struck by the arrow did not offer to reply after listening to Rama's appropriate answers (to his objections).
data.anv: शरविक्षतः struck down by arrow, शयानः lying on the ground, सः he (Vali), वानरमहाराजः the  king of monkeys, हेतुमद्वाक्यैः by reasonable words, प्रत्युक्तः offered, उत्तरम् reply, न प्रत्यपद्यत not found.
data.md: Being thus accosted with reasonable words, that lord, of monkeys, lying on the ground and wounded with shafts, gave no reply.

data.v: अश्मभिः परिभिन्नाङ्गः पादपैराहतो भृशम् । रामबाणेन चाक्रान्तो जीवितान्ते मुमोह सः ।।
data.es: Severely battered by stones, hit by trees and pierced by Rama's arrow, Vali lost consciousness as the end of his life was nearing.
data.anv: अश्मभिः with stones, प्रविभिन्नाङ्गः limbs battreed, पादपैः with trees, भृशम् very much, आहतः   hit, रामबाणेन च by Rama's arrow, आक्रान्तः  attacked, सः he, जीवितान्ते end of life, मुमोह lost consciousness.
data.md: Having his limbs dissevered by stones, being struck with trees and wounded by Rama's shaft, he became senseless at the approach of death.

data.v: तं भार्याबाणमोक्षेण रामदत्तेन संयुगे । हतं प्लवगशार्दूलं तारा शुश्राव वालिनम् ।।
data.es: Tara, wife of Vali, heard that her husband, tiger among monkeys, was killed in the battle by the arrow discharged by Rama.
data.anv: प्लवगशार्दूलम् tiger among monkeys, तं वालिनम् by that Vali, संयुगे in the battle, रामदत्तेन hit by Rama, बाणमोक्षेण by the discharge of the arrow, हतम् killed, भार्या wife, तारा Tara, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: His spouse Tārā heard that Váli, the foremost of monkeys, had been killed in the conflict by Rāma's shaft.

data.v: सा सपुत्राप्रियं श्रुत्वा वधं भर्तुः सुदारुणम् । निष्पपात भृशं त्रस्ता विविधाद्गिरिगह्वरात् ।।
data.es: Hearing the terrible, unhappy news of her husband's death, Tara anxiously rushed along with her son out of the mountain cave.
data.anv: सपुत्रा along with her son, सा Tara, भर्तुः husband's, सुदारुणम् terrible, अप्रियम् sad, वधम् killing, श्रुत्वा on hearing, भृशम् much, उद्विग्ना anxious, तस्मात् from that, गिरि गह्वरात् from the mountain cave, विविधा many, निष्पपात rushed.
data.md: Hearing the heart-rending news of her husband's demise, she, big with a child, issued out of the mountain cave with a troubled heart.

data.v: ये त्वङ्गदपरीवारा वानरा हि महाबलाः । ते सकार्मुकमालोक्य रामं त्रस्ताः प्रदुद्रुवुः ।।
data.es: Alarmed at the sight of Rama holding the bow, the terribly courageous monkeys who followed Angada as his bodyguards ran in different directions.
data.anv: अङ्गदपरीवाराः Angada's bodyguards, ये those, भीमविक्रमा: terribly courageous warriors,  वानराः monkeys, ते to, सकार्मुकम् with bow, रामम् Rama, आलोक्य  seeing, त्रस्ताः   frightened, प्रदुद्रुवु: ran in different directions.
data.md: And beholding Rāma with a bow in his hand, the mighty monkeys, followers of Angada, fled away, terrified.

data.v: सा ददर्श ततस्त्रस्तान्हरीनापततो द्रुतम् । यूथादिव परिभ्रष्टान्मृगान्निहतयूथपान् ।।
data.es: Tara saw the terrorstricken monkeys running helterskelter, like the herd of deer whose leader who had strayed had been killed.
data.anv: ततः then, सा she, त्रस्तान् terrorstricken, भृशम् very much, आपततः running, निहतयूथपान् the leader killed, यूथात् from the troop, परिभ्रष्टान् strayed, मृगानिव like the deer, हरीन् monkeys, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Thereupon Tārā observed those monkeys flying away terrified like to deer alienated from their herd, having lost their king.

data.v: तानुवाच समासाद्य दुःखितान्दुःखिता सती । राम वित्रासितान्सर्वाननुबद्धानिवेषुभिः ।।
data.es: Sorrowful Tara, the wife of Vali, duly approaching the monkeys stricken with grief and running as if chased by the arrows of Rama at their back, said to them:
data.anv: दुःखितान्  sorrowing ones, इषुभिः by the arrows, अनुबद्धानिव as if stricken at the back, रामवित्रासितान् terrified by Rama's arrows, तान् them, समासाद्य after duly approaching them, दुःखिता सती she herself being sorrowful, उवाच said.
data.md: The chaste lady, racked with sorrow, spoke to those monkeys, afraid of Rāma, wounded with shafts and exercised with grief, saying,

data.v: वानरा राजसिंहस्य यस्य यूयं पुरःसराः । तं विहाय सुवित्रस्ताः कस्माद्द्रवत दुर्गताः ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys deserting the lion among kings,whose servants you are ? What should you be frightened for ? Why run away in distress?
data.anv: वानराः O monkeys, यूयम् all of you, यस्य whosoever, राजसिंहस्य of a lion among kings, पुरःसराः walked ahead, तम् him, विहाय left, सुसन्त्रस्ताः extremely frightened, दुर्गताः distressed, कस्मात् why, द्रवथ are you running?
data.md: O monkeys, why are you flying away, terrified and distressed, leaving behind that foremost of kings before whom you were used to fight?

data.v: राज्यहेतोः स चेद्भ्राता भ्राता रौद्रेण पातितः । रामेण प्रसृतैर्दूरान्मार्गणैर्दूर पातिभिः ।।
data.es: 'If the (elder) brother is struck down by his (younger) brother in anger for the sake of kingship using farreaching arrows discharged by Rama, why are you running?'
data.anv: रौद्रेण terrified, भ्रात्रा by the brother, सः he, Vali, राज्यहेतोः for the sake of kingship, रामेण by Rama, रौद्रात् in anger, प्रहितैः discharged, दूरपातिभिः farreaching, मार्गणैः with arrows, पातितः चेत् if he is struck down.
data.md: Hath Vāli been killed by Rāma, waiting at a distance with fleet and distant-coursing shafts, being requested by Sugrīva for kingdom?

data.v: कपिपत्न्या वचः श्रुत्वा कपयः कामरूपिणः । प्राप्तकालमविश्लिष्टमूचुर्वचनमङ्गनाम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Tara, the wife of Vali, the monkeys who could assume any form at their will replied with clear words appropriate to the occasion:
data.anv: कामरूपिणः who change form at their will, कपयः monkeys, कपिपत्न्या: of the wife of Vali, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, प्राप्तकालम् timely, अविक्लिष्टम् clear, वचनम् words, अङ्गनाम् to the lady, ऊचुः spoke.
data.md: Hearing the words of that wife of the monkey, they, wearing shapes at will, addressed that damsel with words, worthy of being said on that occasion,

data.v: जीव पुत्रे निवर्तस्य पुत्रं रक्षस्व चान्दगम् । अन्तको राम रूपेण हत्वा नयति वालिनम् ।।
data.es: 'O mother, your son is still alive. Go back and protect your son Angada. Lord of death in the form of Rama has come and killed Vali and is carrying him away.
data.anv: जीवपुत्रे O mother of a son who is alive, निवर्तस्व go back, पुत्रम् son, अङ्गदम् Angada, रक्षस्व you may protect, अन्तकः lord of death, रामरूपेण in the form of Rama, वालिनम् Vali, हत्वा having killed, नयति carrying away.
data.md: O you, having your son alive, do you go back and bring up your son Angada. Death himself, under Rāma's semblance, has snatched away Vāli.

data.v: क्षिप्तान्वृक्षान्समाविध्य विपुलाश्च शिलास्तथा । वाली वज्रसमैर्बाणैर्वज्रेणेव निपातितः ।।
data.es: 'Rama smashed the trees and stones Vali hurled at him and then struck him down with thunderboltlike arrows.
data.anv: क्षिप्तान् hurled, वृक्षान् trees, तथा so also, विपुलाः huge, शिलाः rocks, वज्रसमैः  like thunderbolt, बाणैः by arrows, समाविध्य after striking, वाली Vali, रामेण by Rama, निपातितः killed.
