data.md: He was killed by (Rāma's) shafts, resembling thunderbolts as if clapped by thunder itself, having bored trees and big stones (hurled by Vali).

data.v: अभिद्रुतमिदं सर्वं विद्रुतं प्रसृतं बलम् । अस्मिन्प्लवगशार्दूले हते शक्रसमप्रभे ।।
data.es: 'When Vali who was equal to Indra in strength, a tiger among monkeys, was killed, the army of monkeys got terrified and ran away here and there, scattered in different directions.
data.anv: शक्रसमप्रभे equal to Indra in splendour, अस्मिन् his, प्लवगशार्दूले tiger among monkeys, हते  is killed, इदम् this, सर्वम् all, बलम् army, अभिद्रुतम् terrified, विद्रुतम् scattered , प्रसृतम् spread all over.
data.md: That king of monkeys, having Sakra's prowess, being made away with this host of monkeys have been taking to their heels being overwhelmed with consternation.

data.v: रक्ष्यतां नगरं शूरैरङ्गदश्चाभिषिच्यताम् । पदस्थं वालिनः पुत्रं भजिष्यन्ति प्लवंगमाः ।।
data.es: 'Let the gate of the city be shut and Vali's son be consecrated as king. All the monkeys will serve him when he assumes power.
data.anv: नगरद्वारम् the gateway of the city, रक्ष्यताम् may be protected, अङ्गदश्च Angada also, अभिषिच्यताम् be consecrated, पदस्थम् assuming the position of a king, वालिनः पुत्रम् Vali's son, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, भजिष्यन्ति will serve him.
data.md: Let the heroes defend the city and install Angada on the throne. And on his being installed the monkeys shall serve Vāli's son.

data.v: अथ वा रुचिरं स्थानमिह ते रुचिरानने । आविशन्ति हि दुर्गाणि क्षिप्रमद्यैव वानराः ।।
data.es: 'O lovely Tara, this very day other monkeys will soon occupy our citadels.
data.anv: रुचिरानने a woman with a lovely face, अथवा or else, इह here, ते your, स्थानम् place, अरुचितम् not proper, वानराः monkeys, अद्यैव this very day, क्षिप्रम् at once, अन्यानि other, दुर्गाणि citadels, आविशन्ति हि will occupy.

data.v: अभार्याः सह भार्याश्च सन्त्यत्र वनचारिणः । लुब्धेभ्यो विप्रयुक्तेभ्यः स्वेभ्यो नस्तुमुलं भयम् ।।
data.es: 'There are monkeys wandering in the forest (sent away by Vali). Some of them have made others' wives their own and some have been separated from their wives. They are a great cause of fear.'
data.anv: अभार्याः those who do not have wives, सभार्याश्च those who have wives too, वनचारिणः wanderers of the forest, अत्र there, सन्ति are found, लुब्देभ्यः those who have made others wives their own, विप्रयुक्तेभ्यः separated from their wives, तेभ्यः from them, नः no, स्तुमुलम् great, भयम् fear.

data.v: अल्पान्तरगतानां तु श्रुत्वा वचनमङ्गना । आत्मनः प्रतिरूपं सा बभाषे चारुहासिनी ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of the pettyminded monkeys, Tara spoke to them in her own way with a gentle smile:
data.anv: अल्पान्तरगतानाम् of those lowminded monkeys, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, चारुहासिनी a lady with a gentle smile, सा अङ्गना that lady, आत्मनः of herself, प्रतिरूपम् in her own style, बभाषे spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words of the monkeys, lying at a little distance, that lady, smiling sweet, spoke to them, words worthy of herself.

data.v: पुत्रेण मम किं कार्यं किं राज्येन किमात्मना । कपिसिंहे महाभागे तस्मिन्भर्तरि नश्यति ।।
data.es: 'Now that the glorious Vali, a lion among monkeys, my husband is dying, of what purpose is the son, or the kingdom or my own life?
data.anv: कपिसिंहे  lion among monkeys, महाभागे  glorious, तस्मिन् him, नश्यति सति  he is dying, मम to me, पुत्रेण by my son, किं कार्यम् what use, राज्येन (अपि) च even with the kingdom, आत्मना with my own life, किम् what purpose?
data.md: That great lord of monkeys, my husband, being dead, what shall I do with my son, my kingdom and myself?

data.v: पादमूलं गमिष्यामि तस्यैवाहं महात्मनः । योऽसौ रामप्रयुक्तेन शरेण विनिपातितः ।।
data.es: 'I will seek the soles of the feet of the great soul who has been killed by the arrow discharged by Rama.'
data.anv: यः whosoever, असौ this person, रामप्रयुक्तेन discharged by Rama, शरेण by arrow, विनिपातितः is killed, महात्मनः of the great soul, तस्य his, पादमूलम् एव  soles of his feet, गमिष्यामि I will go.
data.md: I shall place myself at the feet of that highsouled one, who has been killed by Rama's shaft.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा प्रदुद्राव रुदती शोककर्शिता । शिरश्चोरश्च बाहुभ्यां दुःखेन समभिघ्नती ।।
data.es: So saying, the griefstricken, weeping Tara hastened, sadly beating with both hands her head and her chest.
data.anv: एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having spoken, रुदन्ती while crying, शोककर्शिता grief stricken, दुःखेन sadly, शिरश्च head, उरश्च chest, बाहुभ्याम् with both hands, समभिध्नती beating, प्रदुद्राव hastened.
data.md: Having said this, (Tara) proceeded, overwhelmed with grief, weeping and striking her head with her hands.

data.v: आव्रजन्ती ददर्शाथ पतिं निपतितं भुवि । हन्तारं दानवेन्द्राणां समरेष्वनिवर्तिनाम् ।।
data.es: As she was nearing (the spot) she saw her husband, a great conqueror of monkeys who never retreated from the battle, mortally hit and fallen on the ground.
data.anv: आव्रजन्ती as she approached, अथ then, दानवेन्द्राणाम् of warriors among demons, हन्तारम्  killed, समरेषु in wars, अनिवर्तिनम् who never retreated, भुवि on the ground, निपतितम् fallen, पतिम् husband, ददर्श saw.

data.v: क्षेप्तारं पर्वतेन्द्राणां वज्राणामिव वासवम् । महावातसमाविष्टं महामेघौघनिःस्वनम् ।।
data.es: Vali who used to hurl huge mountains like Indra discharges thunderbolts, who had the speed of wind of high velocity, who would roar like huge thundering clouds,
data.anv: वज्राणाम् the thunderbolts, वासवम् इव like Indra, पर्वतेन्द्राणाम् of huge mountains, क्षेप्तारम् the one who hurls, महावातसमाविष्टम् wind blowing at high velocity, महामेघौघनिस्स्वनम् thundering like huge clouds.

data.v: शक्रतुल्यपराक्रान्तं वृष्ट्वेवोपरतं घनम् । नर्दन्तं नर्दतां भीमं शूरं शूरेण पातितम् ।।
data.es: (Vali) who was equal to Indra in prowess looked like a huge monsoon cloud that had calmed down after pouring all water, a roaring warrior who could frighten others, struck down by another warrior, appeared like a lion killed by a tiger for the sake of meat
data.anv: शक्रतुल्यपराक्रान्तम् equal to Indra in prowess, वृष्टवा after raining, उपरतम् who stopped, घनम् इव heavy cloud like, नर्दन्तम् thundering, नर्दताम् among those who roared, भीमम् terrific, शूरम् heroic, शूरेण by a hero, पातितम् struck down, आमिषस्यार्थे for the sake of meat, शार्दूलेन by tiger, आहतम् killed, मृगराजं यथा like the lion.

data.v: शार्दूलेनामिषस्यार्थे मृगराजं यथा हतम् । अर्चितं सर्वलोकस्य सपताकं सवेदिकम् ।।
नागहेतोः सुपर्णेन चैत्यमुन्मथितं यथा । अवष्टभ्यावतिष्ठन्तं ददर्श धनुरूर्जितम् ।।
रामं रामानुजं चैव भर्तुश्चैवानुजं शुभा । तानतीत्य समासाद्य भर्तारं निहतं रणे ।।
समीक्ष्य व्यथिता भूमौ संभ्रान्ता निपपात ह । सुप्तेव पुनरुत्थाय आर्यपुत्रेति क्रोशती ।।
रुरोद सा पतिं दृष्ट्वा संदितं मृत्युदामभिः । तामवेक्ष्य तु सुग्रीवः क्रोशन्तीं कुररीमिव ।।
विषादमगमत्कष्टं दृष्ट्वा चाङ्गदमागतम् ।।
data.es: Seeing Tara crying like a female osprey and Angada following her in despair, Sugriva felt pain (at heart).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the nineteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, कुररीमिव like a female osprey, क्रोशन्तीम् while she was crying, ताम् her, अवेक्ष्य seeing, आगतम् came, आङ्गदं च and Angada also, दृष्ट्वा seeing, कष्टम् pain, विषादम् despair, अगमत् experienced.
data.md: And beholding Tārā like to a she-elephant and Angada, bewailing in this wise, Sugrīva attained to an excess of grief.

data.v: रामचापविसृष्टेन शरेणान्तकरेण तम् । दृष्ट्वा विनिहतं भूमौ तारा ताराधिपानना ।।
data.es: Beholding her husband lying on the ground pierced by a deathdealing arrow released by Rama, the lovely moonfaced Tara went and embraced him.
data.anv: ताराधिपानना moonfaced, भामिनी lovely woman, सा तारा that Tara, रामचापविसृष्टेन by the release of an arrow from Rama's bow, अन्तकरेण by a deathdealing one, शरेण arrow, (वि)निहतम् killed, तम् him, भूमौ on the ground, दृष्ट्वा beholding, समासाद्य went near, पर्यष्वजत embraced.

data.v: सा समासाद्य भर्तारं पर्यष्वजत भामिनी । इषुणाभिहतं दृष्ट्वा वालिनं कुञ्जरोपमम् ।।
वानरेन्द्रं महेन्द्राभं शोकसंतप्तमानसा । तारा तरुमिवोन्मूलं पर्यदेवयदातुरा ।।
data.es: Beholding Vali, the lord of monkeys, who was strong as an elephant, splendid as a mountain, fallen down like an uprooted tree, struck by the arrow, Tara became restless and wailed bitterly:
data.anv: इषुणा by the arrows, अभिहतम् killed, कुञ्जरोपमम् like an elephant, पर्वतेन्द्राभम् splendid as mountain, उन्मूलम् uprooted, तरुम् इव like a tree, वानरेन्द्रम् lord of monkeys, वालिनम् Vali, दृष्ट्वा seeing, तारा Tara, आतुरा restless, शोकसन्तप्तमानसा immersed in grief, पर्यदेवयत् wailed.

data.v: रणे दारुणविक्रान्त प्रवीर प्लवतां वर । किं दीनामपुरोभागामद्य त्वं नाभिभाषसे ।।
data.es: 'O valiant hero, lord of monkeys you were terrifying in war. Why don't you speak now to me so forlorn and helpless?
data.anv: रणे in war, दारुण dreadful, प्रवीर valiant, विक्रान्त a hero who advances, प्लवतां वर lord of monkeys, दीनाम् piteous lady, अपुरोभागाम् ignorant, त्वम् you, अद्य now, किम् why, नाभिभाषसे not replying.
data.md: O hero, O foremost of monkeys, O powerful one, O you terrible in warfare, why did you not welcome me to-day who am guilty of some iniquity by you?

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ हरिशार्दूल भजस्व शयनोत्तमम् । नैवंविधाः शेरते हि भूमौ नृपतिसत्तमाः ।।
data.es: 'O tiger among monkeys get up. Come and sleep on the best of beds. Best of kings, you should not lie on the ground.
data.anv: हरिशार्दूल O tiger among monkeys, उत्तिष्ठ get up, शयनोत्तमम् best of beds, भजस्व resort to, एवंविधाः such people, नृपतिसत्तमाः  best of kings, भूमौ on the ground, न शेरते हि do not lie down.
data.md: Rise, O best of monkeys, and lie down on a better bed; monarchs do not stretch themselves on earth.

data.v: अतीव खलु ते कान्ता वसुधा वसुधाधिप । गतासुरपि यां गात्रैर्मां विहाय निषेवसे ।।
data.es: 'O lord of the earth I know you loved the earth more than you loved me since you have forsaken me and enjoy her company by hugging her with your limbs, even after death.
data.anv: वसुधाधिप lord of the earth, ते to you, वसुधा earth, अतीव very much, कान्ता खलु indeed your loved one, गतासुरपि even after death, माम् me, विहाय abandon, गात्रै: by your limbs, याम् her, निषेवसे you are enjoying.
data.md: O lord of earth, indeed earth is your favourite wife; since renouncing me, you, though dead, are serving her with your body.

data.v: व्यक्तमन्या त्वया वीर धर्मतः संप्रवर्तता । किष्किन्धेव पुरी रम्या स्वर्गमार्गे विनिर्मिता ।।
data.es: 'O my heroic husband, you are the legitimate, righteous king of Kiskinda. You have evidently built another beautiful city Kiskinda on your way to heaven.
data.anv: वीर O hero, धर्मतः righteously, सम्प्रवर्तिता acknowledged, त्वया by you, अन्या another, किष्किन्धेव kishkindalike, रम्या delightful, पुरी city, स्वर्गमार्गे on your way to heaven, विनिर्मिता is built, स्पष्टम् it is evident.
data.md: Evident it is, O hero, that while engaged in a lawful conflict, you hadst created another city of Kiskindha, in the region of the celestials.

data.v: यान्यस्माभिस्त्वया सार्धं वनेषु मधुगन्धिषु । विहृतानि त्वया काले तेषामुपरमः कृतः ।।
data.es: 'Our pleasure trips to sweetscented forests have ended now. You have brought them to a close.
data.anv: त्वया with you, अस्माभि: by us, सार्धम् with us, मधुगन्धिषु sweetscented, वनेषु in the forests, यानि such, विहृतानि pleasure trips, काले at this time, तेषाम् their, उपरमः made to end, त्वया by you, कृतः is made.
data.md: All your enjoyments with me in nectarsmelling woods, have been brought to a close.

data.v: निरानन्दा निराशाहं निमग्ना शोकसागरे । त्वयि पञ्चत्वमापन्ने महायूथपयूथपे ।।
data.es: 'You are the leader of leaders. Now that you have attained heaven I am bereft of all joy, plunged in a sea of grief.
data.anv: महायूथपयूथपे the leader of the leaders, त्वयि you only, पञ्चत्वम् heaven, आपन्ने  are dead, अहम् I am, निरानन्दा without pleasure, निराशा with no hope, शोकसागरे in a sea of sorrow, निमग्ना immersed.
data.md: You, the lord of monkey-herds, being slain, I am deprived of joy and hope and am sunk in the abyss of grief.

data.v: हृदयं सुस्थिरं मह्यं दृष्ट्वा विनिहतं भुवि । यन्न शोकाभिसंतप्तं स्फुटतेऽद्य सहस्रधा ।।
data.es: 'I presume my heart is strong, for it has not broken into a thousand pieces, even though I am overwhelmed with grief to see my husband fallen on the ground.
data.anv: मह्यम् for me, हृदयम् heart, सुस्थिरम् is strong, यत् since, भुवि on the ground, (नि)पतितम् fallen, दृष्ट्वा even seeing, शोकाभिसन्तप्तम् tormented with sorrow, अद्य today, सहस्रधा thousandfold, न स्फुटते not broken into pieces.
data.md: Forsooth, my heart is uncommon hard, since beholding you on the ground it has not been sundered into thousand pieces being overwhelmed with grief.

data.v: सुग्रीवस्य त्वया भार्या हृता स च विवासितः । यत्तत्तस्य त्वया व्युष्टिः प्राप्तेयं प्लवगाधिप ।।
data.es: 'O king of monkeys you have banished Sugriva. You have usurped his wife. This is the fruit of your action.
data.anv: प्लवगाधिप O king of monkeys, त्वया by you, यत् that, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, भार्या wife, हृता seized, सः च and he is, विवासितः banished, तत् that, त्वया by you, तस्य its, इयम् this, व्युष्टिः as a result, प्राप्ता attained.
data.md: Sugrīva's wife was carried away and banished by you and this is the result of your action, O foremost of monkeys.

data.v: निःश्रेयसपरा मोहात्त्वया चाहं विगर्हिता । यैषाब्रुवं हितं वाक्यं वानरेन्द्रहितैषिणी ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys wishing your wellbeing I tendered salutary advice. But out of delusion you despised them.
data.anv: वानरेन्द्र O lord of monkeys, निःश्रेयसपरा wishing your wellfare, हितैषिणी as a wellwisher, या such, एषा such a lady, हितम् वाक्यम् salutary advice, अब्रुवम् I tendered, अहम् I, त्वया मोहात्  due to delusion, विगर्हिता despised.
data.md: O lord of monkeys, out of your ignorance you didst neglect all my well meaning words which I said, being intent on your welfare and benefit.

data.v: कालो निःसंशयो नूनं जीवितान्तकरस्तव । बलाद्येनावपन्नोऽसि सुग्रीवस्यावशो वशम् ।।
data.es: 'No doubt time is inexorable. The time of your death had surely arrived.Now you, whom nobody could control, have come under the sway of Sugriva.
data.anv: निस्संशयः no doubt, कालः inexorable time, तव to you, जीवितान्तकरः ends your life, नूनम् surely, येन since, अवशः an uncontrollable one, बलात् forcibly, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, वशम् under control, अवपन्नः  come into the fold.
data.md: Forsooth, you had been by force brought under the control of Kāla, since you had been discomfited by Sugrīva, albeit you are above the control of others.

data.v: वैधव्यं शोकसंतापं कृपणं कृपणा सती । अदुःखोपचिता पूर्वं वर्तयिष्याम्यनाथवत् ।।
data.es: 'I have not experienced poverty or suffering before. Immersed in grief, like an orphan, now I am reduced to the pitiable condition of a widow.
data.anv: पूर्वम् earlier, कृपणा सती reduced to pitiable condition, अदुःखोपचिता not experienced grief, अनाथवत् like an orphan, कृपणं in a wretched manner, वैधव्यम् widowhood, शोकसन्तापम् immersed in grief, वर्तयिष्यामि I will remain.
data.md: Unused to miseries before how shall I, being an object commiseration, put up like one helpless, with my widow-hood and grief.

data.v: लालितश्चाङ्गदो वीरः सुकुमारः सुखोचितः । वत्स्यते कामवस्थां मे पितृव्ये क्रोधमूर्छिते ।।
data.es: 'To what plight will the tender Angada, who has been tended affectionately and deserves comforts, be reduced when his uncle displays anger?
data.anv: पितृव्ये  father's brother, क्रोधमूर्छिते is deluded with anger, लालितः a fondled boy, सुकुमारः tender, सुखोचितः who deserves comforts, वीरः a hero, मे अङ्गदः my Angada, काम् what kind, अवस्थाम् state, वर्त्स्यते is going to experience?
data.md: How shall the heroic and youthful Angada, brought up in luxury and happiness, be regarded by his uncle, senseless with wrath?

data.v: कुरुष्व पितरं पुत्र सुदृष्टं धर्मवत्सलम् । दुर्लभं दर्शनं त्वस्य तव वत्स भविष्यति ।।
data.es: (Turning to Angada Tara said) 'O son, look at your father, a lover of dharma. See him, as it will be difficult to see him later, dear'.
data.anv: पुत्र O son, धर्मवत्सलम् a lover of dharma, पितरम् father, सुदृष्टम् well seen, कुरुष्व you may do, वत्स dear, तस्य his, दर्शनम् meeting, दुर्लभम् difficult, भविष्यति will become.
data.md: Do you cast for good, O my son, your looks towards your pious sire, for since now it will be hard for you to see him again.

data.v: समाश्वासय पुत्रं त्वं संदेशं संदिशस्व च । मूर्ध्नि चैनं समाघ्राय प्रवासं प्रस्थितो ह्यसि ।।
data.es: 'O lord you have set out on a long journey. Kiss your son on the forehead, enjoy its sweet smell, console him and give him your message.
data.anv: त्वम् you, पुत्रम् son, समाश्वासय console him, एनम् him, मूर्ध्नि touching his forehead, समाघ्राय enjoying the sweet smell of his body, च एनं him, सन्देशम्  instructon, सन्दिश्व  consoling him, प्रवासम् on a journey, प्रस्थितः going, असि हि you are.
data.md: Do you console your son, favour me with orders, smell his head, as you are going to journey in a foreign land.

data.v: रामेण हि महत्कर्म कृतं त्वामभिनिघ्नता । आनृण्यं तु गतं तस्य सुग्रीवस्य प्रतिश्रवे ।।
data.es: 'Indeed, Rama has achieved a great feat in fulfilling his promise to Sugriva. He is acquitted of the debt by killing you.
data.anv: त्वाम् you, अभिनिघ्नता by killing you, रामेण by Rama, महत् great, कर्म deed, कृतं हि accomplished, सुग्रीवस्य for Sugriva, प्रतिश्रवे in fulfilling promise, तस्य his, आनृण्यम् debt, गतं तु is acquitted.
data.md: By destroying you, Rāma, has performed a great action, since by this he has been released from his vow to Sugriva.

data.v: सकामो भव सुग्रीव रुमां त्वं प्रतिपत्स्यसे । भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यमनुद्विग्नः शस्तो भ्राता रिपुस्तव ।।
data.es: '(Now turning to Sugriva she said) O Sugriva your enemy brother has been killed and your desire has been fulfilled.You will get back Ruma and enjoy the kingdom without any obstacles.'
data.anv: सुग्रीव Sugriva, सकामः be happy, भव be, त्वम् you, रुमाम् Ruma, प्रतिपत्स्यसे returned to her, अनुद्विग्नः without any worry, राज्यम् kingdom, भुङ्क्षव  enjoy, तव your, रिपुः enemy, भ्राता brother, शस्तः is killed.
data.md: O Sugrīva, do you gain your ends and get back your Rumā, devoid of anxiety do you govern your kingdom-your enemy, the brother has been slain.

data.v: किं मामेवं विलपतीं प्रेंणा त्वं नाभिभाषसे । इमाः पश्य वरा बह्वीर्भार्यास्ते वानरेश्वर ।।
data.es: '(To Vali she said) O lord of monkeys Why don't you speak to me loving words when I am wailing this way? Here are your excellent wives'
data.anv: वानरेश्वर lord of monkeys, एवम् in that way, विलपतीम् while I am wailing, प्रेम्णा lovingly, माम् with me, त्वम् you, किम् why, नाभिभाषसे you are not speaking, ते your, बह्वीः many, वराः lovely, भार्याः wives, इमाः these, पश्य you may see.
data.md: O lord of monkeys, why did you not welcome me, your beloved spouse, who am bewailing thus? Behold, your other wives are also mourning in the same wise.

data.v: तस्या विलपितं श्रुत्वा वानर्यः सर्वतश्च ताः । परिगृह्याङ्गदं दीनं दुःखार्ताः परिचुक्रुशुः ।।
data.es: On hearing the wailing of Tara, all the other wives of Vali held the piteous (in their arms) Angada and wailed, overwhelmed with sorrow:
data.anv: सर्वतः all over, ताः those, वानर्यः female monkeys, तस्याः their, विलपितम् wailing, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अङ्गदम् Angada, परिगृह्य taking hold, दीनाः wretched women, दुःखार्ताः filled with sorrow, परिचुक्रुशुः cried bitterly.
data.md: Hearing the bewailings of that she-monkey, others, taking Angada, distressed and overwhelmed with grief, began to cry piteously.

data.v: किमङ्गदं साङ्गद वीर बाहो; विहाय यास्यद्य चिरप्रवासं । न युक्तमेवं गुणसंनिकृष्टं; विहाय पुत्रं प्रियपुत्र गन्तुम् ।।
data.es: 'O hero, adorned with armlets, why have you departed on a long journey, deserting your dear son Angada who possesses similar virtues like you? It is not proper.
data.anv: साङ्गदवीरबाहो O hero adorned with armlets, अङ्गदम् Angada, विहाय deserting, चिरप्रवासम् on a long journey, किम् why, प्रयातः असि going, गुणसन्निकृष्टम् with qualities like yours, प्रियपुत्र  your dear son, पुत्रम् son, एवम् this way, न युक्तम् not proper to go.
data.md: O hero, having Arigada on your arms, why are you proceeding on a journey for good in a foreign land leaving behind (your son) Angada. It does not behove you (to leave aside) your dear son, gifted with diverse accomplishments and wearing a charming and beautiful cloth.

data.v: किमप्रियं ते प्रियचारुवेष; कृतं मया नाथ सुतेन वा ते । सहायिनीमद्य विहाय वीर; यमक्षयं गच्छसि दुर्विनीतम् ।।
data.es: 'O darling, attractively dressed, you are leaving me and Angada and going too far. What unpleasant deeds we have done (to deserve this).
data.anv: प्रियचारुवेष  robed attractively, वीर esteemed one, नाथ lord, सहाङ्गदाम् with Angada, माम् me, विहाय leaving, इतः  this place, दीर्घम् long distance, प्रवासम् journey, यत् प्रस्थितः since you have begun, मया by me, ते to you, सुतेन वा or by your son, किम् what, अप्रियम् unpleasant, कृतम् done.

data.v: यद्यप्रियं किंचिदसंप्रधार्य; कृतं मया स्यात्तव दीर्घबाहो । क्षमस्व मे तद्धरिवंश नाथ; व्रजामि मूर्ध्ना तव वीर पादौ ।।
data.es: 'O longarmed chief of the monkey clan O warrior pardon me any wrong done unknowingly, inconsiderately. I touch your feet with my head.'
data.anv: दीर्घबाहो O longarmed one, हरिवंशनाथ chief of monkey clan, वीर warrior, असम्प्रधार्य unknowingly, मया by me, तव to you, अप्रियम् inconsiderately, किञ्चित् even a little, कृतं स्याद्यदि if done, मे mine, तत् that, क्षमस्व  may pardon, मूर्ध्ना by my head, तव your, पादो feet, व्रजामि I reach.
data.md: you of long arms, O lord of monkeys, if I have offended you in any way, do you forgive me, after ascertaining my crime.

data.v: तथा तु तारा करुणं रुदन्ती; भर्तुः समीपे सह वानरीभिः । व्यवस्यत प्रायमनिन्द्यवर्णा; उपोपवेष्टुं भुवि यत्र वाली ।।
data.md: O hero, I touch your feet with my head. Bewailing thus piteously with other sbemonkeys, Tārā, having a blameless countenance, stationing herself where Vāli was, resolved to put an end to her being by fastings.

data.v: ततो निपतितां तारां च्युतां तारामिवाम्बरात् । शनैराश्वासयामास हनूमान्हरियूथपः ।।
data.es: Thereafter Hanuman, leader of the monkey clan, slowly consoled Tara who was (standing before her husband) like a star fallen from the sky.
data.anv: ततः then, अम्बरात् from the sky, च्युताम् fallen down, तारामिव like a star, निपतिताम् fallen on the ground, ताराम् Tara, हरियूथपः leader of the monkey clan, हनुमान् Hanuman, शनैः slowly, आश्वासयामास consoled.
data.md: Thereupon beholding Tārā fallen (on the ground) like to a star dropt down from the sky, Hanumān, the lord of monkey-herds, consoled her again and again.

data.v: गुणदोषकृतं जन्तुः स्वकर्मफलहेतुकम् । अव्यग्रस्तदवाप्नोति सर्वं प्रेत्य शुभाशुभम् ।।
data.es: 'On departing from this mortal world an embodied soul reaps gradually the good and evil fruits of action performed under the notion of virtue or vice with an eye to their good or evil consequences.
data.anv: जन्तुः an embodied soul, गुणदोषकृतम् by virtue of their good and bad deeds, फलहेतुकम् the fruits of actions, सर्वम् all, तत् that, शुभाशुभम् whether good and bad, कर्म deed, प्रेत्य after death, अव्यग्रः gradually, आप्नोति attains.
data.md: Animals unagitated, attain to happiness or misery, as an outcome of their actions performed (in their previous existence) by merits or demerits.

data.v: शोच्या शोचसि कं शोच्यं दीनं दीनानुकम्पसे । कश्च कस्यानुशोच्योऽस्ति देहेऽस्मिन्बुद्बुदोपमे ।।
data.es: 'For whom do you grieve except for yourself? You are miserable. Who are you sympathising with? Who are you grieving for? When this body itself is like a bubble, who is worth grieving for?
data.anv: शोच्या worry, शोच्यम् a matter to grieve, कम् whom, शोचसि you are grieving, दीना in a  miserable manner, अनुकम्पसे you show sympathy, अस्मिन् in this, देहे body, बुद्बुदोपमे like a bubble, कः who, कस्य for whom, अनुशोच्यः worthy of worrying, अस्ति now.
data.md: Why did you mourn for others, yourself being an object of mourning? Why did you feel commiseration for the poor, yourself being poorly? In this body like to a bubble who is there who mourneth for another?

data.v: अङ्गदस्तु कुमारोऽयं द्रष्टव्यो जीवपुत्रया । आयत्या च विधेयानि समर्थान्यस्य चिन्तय ।।
data.es: 'You are mother of a surviving son, Angada. You have to look after him in times to come. Think of the duties to be performed now.
data.anv: जीवपुत्रया  who has a son surviving, कुमारः prince, अयम् this, अङ्गदः Angada, द्रष्टव्यः should be looked after, आयत्याम् in future, अस्य his, विधेयानि duties, समर्थानि properly, चिन्तय you may think of.
data.md: It behoveth you now, O you having your son alive, to look after prince Angada and think of those duties which remain to be executed by you (after the demise of Vāli).

data.v: जानास्यनियतामेवं भूतानामागतिं गतिम् । तस्माच्छुभं हि कर्तव्यं पण्डिते नैहलौकिकम् ।।
data.es: 'You are aware of the uncertain and transient happenings in the lives of living beings. Therefore, a wise lady should do auspicious work in this world.
data.anv: भूतानाम् for all beings, आगतिम् transient happenings, अनियताम् एव as it is unstable, जानासि you know, तस्मात् therefore, पण्डितेन by the wise, इह here, लौकिकम् worldly, शुभम् auspicious, कर्तव्यं हि is to be done.
data.md: Do you know that life and death of the animals is very unsettled. It is therefore proper to perform what tends to the welfare of after-life. It does not behove you, O learned damsel, to mourn like others.

data.v: यस्मिन्हरिसहस्राणि प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च । वर्तयन्ति कृतांशानि सोऽयं दिष्टान्तमागतः ।।
data.es: 'Tens of millions of monkeys depended on this hero with their hopes on him. He has reached his ultimate destiny now to enjoy the fruits of his good deeds.
data.anv: यस्मिन् in whom, कृतांशानि pinning their hopes, हरिसहस्राणि thousands of monkeys, प्रयुतानि in millions, अर्बुदानि च and tens of millions, वर्तयन्ति sustain, सः he, अयम् this, दिष्टान्तम् to enjoy the fruits of his good deeds, आगतः reached.
data.md: He even, who (while living) was surrounded by thousands of monkeys cherishing hopes, has met his destined end.

data.v: यदयं न्यायदृष्टार्थः सामदानक्षमापरः । गतो धर्मजितां भूमिं नैनं शोचितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'This hero with a right vision, adopted the means of conciliation, charity and forgiveness (in his administration) and has finally reached a position through righteousness in his death. It is not proper to mourn for him.
data.anv: न्यायदृष्टार्थः who has right vision, सामदानक्षमापरः adopts the sama(conciliation) dana (charity) and forgiveness (as means of administration), अयम् this hero, यत् such, धर्मजिताम् of those who win righteously, भूमिम् earth, गतः reached, एवम् in that way, शोचितुम् to mourn, नार्हसि not proper.
data.md: This hero discharged his royal duties in consonance with the sanctions of morality and was gifted with various kingly accomplishments such as conciliation, clarity and forgiveness. He has attained to the land of kings and it becomes you not to mourn for him.

data.v: सर्वे च हरिशार्दूल पुत्रश्चायं तवाङ्गदः । हर्यृष्कपतिराज्यं च त्वत्सनाथमनिन्दिते ।।
data.es: 'O blemishless lady these great monkeys including your son Angada and the entire kingdom of monkeys and bears are under your protection.
data.anv: अनिन्दिते O blemishless lady, सर्वे all, हरिशार्दूलाः tigers among monkeys, तव your, पुत्रः son, अयम् this, अङ्गदश्च Angada's, हर्यृक्षपतिराज्यं च and the kingdom of monkeys and bears, त्वत्सनाथम्  under your protection.
data.md: O blameless damsel, all these foremost of monkeys, this your son Angada, this kingdom of the monkey chief, do belong to you.

data.v: ताविमौ शोकसंतप्तौ शनैः प्रेरय भामिनि । त्वया परिगृहीतोऽयमङ्गदः शास्तु मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: 'O fair sex Encourage these two griefstricken heroes (Angada and Sugriva) gently. Let Angada rule this earth under your protection.
data.anv: भामिनि O fair sex, शोकसन्तप्तौ immersed in grief, तौ इमौ they both, शनैः slowly, प्रेरय you may encourage, त्वया by you, परिगृहीतः protected, अयम् this, अङ्गदः Angada, मेदिनीम् earth, शास्तु he may command.
data.md: Do you soon despatch, O passionate lady, these two (Angada and Sugrīva) exercised with grief as they are (for the performance of Vali's funeral rites). And abiding by your commandments let Angada govern the earth.

data.v: संततिश्च यथादृष्टा कृत्यं यच्चापि साम्प्रतम् । राज्ञस्तत्क्रियतां सर्वमेष कालस्य निश्चयः ।।
data.anv: सन्ततिः a son, यथा that way, दृष्टा after seeing, साम्प्रतम् presently, राज्ञः to king Vali, यत् all such thing, कृत्यं चापि and done, तत् that, सर्वम् all, क्रियताम् may be carried out, एषः this, कालस्य at this time, निश्चयः is the decision.
data.md: Let Angada perform all those ceremonies, which should be gone through by sons according to the Šāstras and which are for the well-being of the king; this is the time for the performance of those funeral rites.

data.v: संस्कार्यो हरिराजस्तु अङ्गदश्चाभिषिच्यताम् । सिंहासनगतं पुत्रं पश्यन्ती शान्तिमेष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'Let all the rituals of the king of vanaras be performed. Let Angada be consecrated. You will attain peace of mind to see your son seated on the throne.'
data.anv: हरिराजः king of monkeys, संस्कार्यः all rituals should be performed, अङ्गदश्च by Angada, अभिषिच्यताम् may be consecrated, सिंहासनगतम् seated on the throne, पुत्रम् son, पश्यन्ती while you are looking at him, शान्तिम् peace, एष्यसि you will attain.
data.md: Performing the funeral ceremonies of the lord of monkeys do you install Angada. And beholding your son thus established on the throne you shall be able to pacify your grief?

data.v: सा तस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा भर्तृव्यसनपीडिता । अब्रवीदुत्तरं तारा हनूमन्तमवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Hanuman's words, Tara, tormented by the death of her husband said to Hanuman who was waiting for her reply:
data.anv: भर्तृव्यसनपीडिता tormented by the husband's death, सा तारा that Tara, तस्य his, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अवस्थितम् waiting, हनूमन्तम् to Hanumanta, अवस्थितम् who was waiting, उत्तरम् reply, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing those words of Hanumān, Tārā, racked with grief consequent upon the loss of her lord, bespake him who was standing there:

data.v: अङ्गद प्रतिरूपाणां पुत्राणामेकतः शतम् । हतस्याप्यस्य वीरस्य गात्रसंश्लेषणं वरम् ।।
data.es: 'To embrace even the deadbody of this hero is better than (to embrace) a hundred prototypes of Angada.
data.anv: अङ्गदप्रतिरूपाणाम् of those who may be prototypes of Angada, पुत्राणाम् of sons, शतम् one hundred, एकतः on one side, हतस्यापि even if he is slayed, अस्य his, वीरस्य warrior's, गात्रसंश्लेषणम् embracing the body, वरम् is better.
data.md: I would rather die with this hero who has been slain than have hundred sons like Angada.

data.v: न चाहं हरिराजस्य प्रभवाम्यङ्गदस्य वा । पितृव्यस्तस्य सुग्रीवः सर्वकार्येष्वनन्तरः ।।
data.anv: अहम् I am, हरिराजस्य of the king of monkeys, अङ्गदस्य वा or about Angada, न प्रभवामि not the right, तस्य his, पितृव्यः father's brother, सर्वकार्येषु in all tasks, अनन्तरः herafter.
data.md: I cannot myself govern this kingdom nor can I confer it upon Angada. Such duty-devolves upon his (Angada's) uncle Sugrīva now.

data.v: न ह्येषा बुद्धिरास्थेया हनूमन्नङ्गदं प्रति । पिता हि बन्धुः पुत्रस्य न माता हरिसत्तम ।।
data.es: 'O Hanuman the best of monkeys, you need not think about (the future of) Angada. A father plans for a son and not (even) the mother.
data.anv: हनुमान् O Hanuman, अङ्गदं प्रति for Angada, एषा that way, बुद्धि: thought, न आस्थेयाः not to be entertained, हरिसत्तम best of monkeys, पुत्रस्य son's, पिता father, बन्धुः relation, माता mother, न none else.
data.md: O Hanumān, do you not consider that I shall confer this kingdom upon Angada-0 best of monkeys, father is son's friend (in this respect) not mother.

data.v: न हि मम हरिराजसंश्रया;त्क्षमतरमस्ति परत्र चेह वा । अभिमुखहतवीरसेवितं; शयनमिदं मम सेवितुं क्षमम् ।।
data.es: There is nothing more befitting for me than joining the king of monkeys either here or in the next world. It is proper for me to resort to this resting place (pyre) used by this slain hero in front of me.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfirst sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: मम my, इह वा in this world or, परत्र वा or in the next world, हरिराजसंश्रयात् other than joining king of monkeys, क्षमतरम् a safer course, न अस्ति हि is not found, अभिमुखहतवीरसेवितम् used by this slain warrior in front of me, इदं this, शयनम् resting place, सेवितुम् to rest, मम for me, क्षमम् is fitting.
data.md: There is no other resource for me tending to my welfare both in this world and the next than taking refuge to this lord of monkeys. It is becoming for me to serve this bed which has been resorted to by the hero, slain (and lying before me.)

data.v: वीक्षमाणस्तु मन्दासुः सर्वतो मन्दमुच्छ्वसन् । आदावेव तु सुग्रीवं ददर्श त्वात्मजाग्रतः ।।
data.es: Vali, gazing all around, breathing slowly and sighing feably beheld Sugriva at first instance, Sugriva who was standing in front of his own son.
data.anv: मन्दासुः slowly, मन्दं feebly, उच्छ्वसन्  sighing, सर्वतः all over, वीक्षमाणः तु gazing all round, आदावेव at first instance, अग्रतः front, आत्मजः his own son, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Vāli, ranging on the verge of death, casting his looks arounds and sighing faintly, espied his younger brother Sugrīva before him.

data.v: तं प्राप्तविजयं वाली सुग्रीवं प्लवगेश्वरम् । आभाष्य व्यक्तया वाचा सस्नेहमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Vali, the lord of monkeys, lovingly said to Sugriva, who had won a victory:
data.anv: प्लवगेश्वरः lord of monkeys, वाली Vali, प्राप्तविजयम् had won a victory, तं सुग्रीवम् to that Sugriva, आभाष्य spoke, व्यक्तया addressing, वाचा words, सस्नेहम् with love, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Welcoming that lord of monkeys with clear accents, Vāli addressed him affectionately saying.

data.v: सुग्रीवदोषेण न मां गन्तुमर्हसि किल्बिषात् । कृष्यमाणं भविष्येण बुद्धिमोहेन मां बलात् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva you ought not to accuse me of exiling you, and wresting your wife. My mind was deluded by the force of fate that controls one's future.
data.anv: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, माम् me, दोषेण by mistake, गन्तुम् exiling, न अर्हसि ought not to, किल्बिषात् due to mistake, भविष्येण in future, बुद्धिमोहेन by deluded, बलात् by force  माम् me, कृष्यमाणम् bound
data.md: O Sugrīva, do you not take to your heart the improper conduct I have shown towards you, being attracted by inevitable foolishness, subject as I was to sin.

data.v: युगपद्विहितं तात न मन्ये सुखमावयोः । सौहार्दं भ्रातृयुक्तं हि तदिदं जातमन्यथा ।।
data.es: 'O dear I believe that both of us are not destined to enjoy the love and happiness that come together to brothers.
data.anv: तात O dear, आवयोः for both of us, सुखम् happiness, युगपत् at the same time, न मन्ये I also do not believe, भ्रातृयुक्तम् not right for brothers, तत् so, इदम् this, सौहार्दम् friendship between us, न अन्यथा not otherwise, जातम् is created.
data.md: Methinks, O brother, it is not our fortune to enjoy at the same time the double bliss of fraternal affection and the enjoyment of kingdom, or else why has it happened otherwise?

data.v: प्रतिपद्य त्वमद्यैव राज्यमेषां वनौकसाम् । मामप्यद्यैव गच्छन्तं विद्धि वैवस्वतक्षयम् ।।
data.anv: त्वम् you, अद्यैव just now, एषाम् of these, वनौकसाम् forest dwellers, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रतिपद्य accept, मामपि me also, अद्यैव now, वैवस्वतक्षयम् the abode of Vivasvan, lord of the death, गच्छन्तम्  going, विद्धि know.
data.md: Do you acquire to-day this kingdom of the forest-ranges and know me as one who has departed to the abode of Death.

data.v: जीवितं च हि राज्यं च श्रियं च विपुलामिमाम् । प्रजहाम्येष वै तूर्णं महच्चागर्हितं यशः ।।
data.es: 'I am leaving this world soon, along with this vast kingdom, prosperity and untarnished fame.
data.anv: एषः अहम् thus I, जीवितं च life also, राज्यं च even kingdom, इमाम् this, विपुलाम् vast, श्रियं च and prosperity, अगर्हितम् untarnished, यशः च and fame, तूर्णम् soon, एषः here I am, प्रजहामि leaving.
data.md: Soon shall I renounce iny life, kingdom, my exquisite grace and my blameless fame.

data.v: अस्यां त्वहमवस्थायां वीर वक्ष्यामि यद्वचः । यद्यप्यसुकरं राजन्कर्तुमेव तदर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O warrior king you should do whatever I request you at this hour even though it may not be easy.
data.anv: वीर O warrior, राजन् O king, अस्यां अवस्थायाम् at this stage, अहम् I, यत् those, वचः words, वक्ष्यामि speaking, असुकरं not easy to do, यद्यपि even though, कर्तुमेव only to carry out, त्वम् you, अर्हसि ought to.
data.md: It behoveth you, O hero, O king, to perform what I shall speak to you in this plight, however difficult it might be.

data.v: सुखार्हं सुखसंवृद्धं बालमेनमबालिशम् । बाष्पपूर्णमुखं पश्य भूमौ पतितमङ्गदम् ।।
data.es: 'Look at this young Angada fallen on the ground, face flooded with tears. Raised with comfort, he deserves to be kept happy.
data.anv: सुखार्हम् who deserves happiness, सुखसंवृद्धम् raised with comfort, बालम् young boy, अबालिशम् youthful, बाष्पपूर्णमुखम् tearful face, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम्  fallen down, अङ्गदम् Angada, पश्य see.
data.md: Do you behold Angada fallen on the ground with tears in his eyes-a little boy, incapable, brought up in luxury and deserving happiness.

data.v: मम प्राणैः प्रियतरं पुत्रं पुत्रमिवौरसं । मया हीनमहीनार्थं सर्वतः परिपालय ।।
data.es: 'He is dearer to me than my life. Take care of him like your own son. He is separated from me. Take care of him in all respects, so that he is not deprived of anything.
data.anv: मम my, प्राणैः more than life, प्रियतरम् dearer to me, मया by me, हीनम् separated, पुत्रम् son, औरसं पुत्रं इव like your own son, सर्वतः in all respects, अहीनार्थम् without being deprived of anything, परिपालय take care of him.
data.md: Do you maintain this my son, dearer than my life, like to your own son, born of your loins, satisfying all his wants in my absence.

data.v: त्वमप्यस्य हि दाता च परित्राता च सर्वतः । भयेष्वभयदश्चैव यथाहं प्लवगेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys from now on, you alone will be his father, provider of everything, saviour and protector in danger.
data.anv: प्लवगेश्वर O lord of monkeys, अहम् I, यथा as I am, त्वमेव you alone, अस्य his, (पिता father), दाता provider, सर्वशः of everything, परित्राता च and saviour, भयेषु in danger, अभयदश्चैव protector.
data.md: O best of monkeys, like to me, you are his father, protector, conferrer of gifts and remover of fear.

data.v: एष तारात्मजः श्रीमांस्त्वया तुल्यपराक्रमः । रक्षसां तु वधे तेषामग्रतस्ते भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'This prosperous son of Tara, your equal in valour, will remain with you in the forefront to crush demons.
data.anv: श्रीमान् prosperous, त्वया to you, तुल्यपराक्रमः equal in valour, एषः this, तारात्मजः son of Tara, तेषाम् their, रक्षसाम् demons, वधे crush, ते to you, अग्रतः on the forefront, भविष्यति will remain.
data.md: This graceful son of Tārā equals you in prowess and shall precede you in the destruction of Raksasas.

data.v: अनुरूपाणि कर्माणि विक्रम्य बलवान्रणे । करिष्यत्येष तारेयस्तरस्वी तरुणोऽङ्गदः ।।
data.es: 'This mighty hero Angada, son of Tara, is young and dynamic. He will strike (the enemy) in a fitting manner in war.
data.anv: बलवान् strong, तारेयः of Tara's, तरस्वी fast, तरुणः young, एषः अङ्गदः this Angada, रणे in war, विक्रम्य strike, अनुरूपाणि fitting , कर्माणि deeds, करिष्यति will do.
data.md: This youthful Angada, Tārā's son, gifted with energy and strength, shall perform befitting exploits displaying his prowess in the battle.

data.v: सुषेणदुहिता चेयमर्थसूक्ष्मविनिश्चये । औत्पातिके च विविधे सर्वतः परिनिष्ठिता ।।
data.es: 'Tara, daughter of Sushena, is wise and efficient in discerning subtle matters and in foreseeing unexpected events.
data.anv: सुषेणदुहिता daughter of Sushena, इयं च and she also , अर्थसूक्ष्मविनिश्चये in disecerning subtle matters, विविधे various, औत्पातिके च and in foreseeing events that come up suddenly, सर्वतःall over, परिनिष्ठिता very efficient( in crisis management),
data.md: Surasen's daughter is wonderfully expert in ascertaining sabtle things and giving counsels in the time of danger.

data.v: यदेषा साध्विति ब्रूयात्कार्यं तन्मुक्तसंशयम् । न हि तारामतं किंचिदन्यथा परिवर्तते ।।
data.es: 'Tara's opinion is never wrong. It does not change. Whatever she speaks is right and should be carried out without any doubt.
data.anv: एषा she, यत् whatever, साधु इति treat it to be right, ब्रूयात् speak, तत् that, मुक्तसंशयम् without any doubt, कार्यम् work, तारामतम् her opinion, किञ्चत् even a little, अन्यथा otherwise, न परिवर्तते हि does not change.
data.md: Do you, without the least doubt perform what shall the chaste lady instruct you to do; for Tārā's advice never goes without effect.

data.v: राघवस्य च ते कार्यं कर्तव्यमविशङ्कया । स्यादधर्मो ह्यकरणे त्वां च हिंस्याद्विमानितः ।।
data.es: 'You ought to carry out Rama's work without hesitation. If you do not, it will be unrighteous and harmful.
data.anv: राघवस्य Rama's, कार्यं च work also, ते to you, अविशङ्कया without hesitation, कर्तव्यम्   duty, अकरणे not do, अधर्मः unrighteousness, स्यात् हि will be, अमानितः disobeyed, त्वाम् you, हिंस्यात् च will hurt.
data.md: It behoveth you to perform Rāghava's service fearlessly or else you shall be visited with sin: on his being insulted you shall be injured.

data.v: इमां च मालामाधत्स्व दिव्यां सुग्रीवकाञ्चनीम् । उदारा श्रीः स्थिता ह्यस्यां संप्रजह्यान्मृते मयि ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva put on this divine golden necklace. It has great brilliance. Its present lustre may be gone when I am dead.'
data.anv: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, दिव्यां divine, काञ्चनीम् golden, इमां मालाम् this necklace, अधत्स्व wear now, अस्याम् in it, स्थिता present, उदारा great, श्रीः brightness, मयि when me, मृते (when) dead, सम्प्रजह्यात् हि it will be gone.
data.md: O Sugrīva, do you put on this celestial golden garland-herein dwelleth the bounteous Sree who shall renounce me after my death.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्तः सुग्रीवो वालिना भ्रातृसौहृदात् । हर्षं त्यक्त्वा पुनर्दीनो ग्रहग्रस्त इवोडुराट् ।।
data.es: Thus spoken to by Vali with brotherly affection, Sugriva gave up joy (of victory) and appeared dull like the Moon eclipsed by planet Rahu.
data.anv: वालिना by Vali, भ्रातृसौहृदात् due to brotherly affection, इत्येवम् thus, उक्तः spoken, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, हर्षम् happiness, त्यक्त्वा having given up , पुनः again, दीनः dull, ग्रहग्रस्तः eclipsed by planet Rahu, उडुराट् इव like the Moon.
data.md: Having been accosted thus by Vāli, out of fraternal affection, Sugrīva renouncing joy again became pale like to the Moon possessed by Rahu.

data.v: तद्वालिवचनाच्छान्तः कुर्वन्युक्तमतन्द्रितः । जग्राह सोऽभ्यनुज्ञातो मालां तां चैव काञ्चनीम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Vali's words, Sugriva became composed with no illfeeling. Considering it to be proper, he received with his permission the golden necklace.
data.anv: सः he, तद्वालिवचनात् by the words of Vali, शान्तः became composed, अतन्द्रितः without any illfeeling, युक्तम् proper, कुर्वन् carrying out, अभ्यनुज्ञातः with the permission, काञ्चनीम् golden, तां मालाम् that necklace, जग्राह received.
data.md: Renouncing his inimical feelings, being thus addressed by Vāli and carrying out his words energetically Sugrīva accepted the golden garland as ordered (by him).

data.v: तां मालां काञ्चनीं दत्त्वा वाली दृष्ट्वात्मजं स्थितम् । संसिद्धः प्रेत्य भावाय स्नेहादङ्गदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having given the golden necklace to Sugriva,Vali, feeling ready to depart, looked at his son Angada who stood by and spoke affectionately:
data.anv: काञ्चनीम् golden, तां मालाम् that necklace, दत्त्वा having given, स्थितम् him who stood by, आत्मजं च and son, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, प्रेत्यभावाय with a feeling of preparedness for death, संसिद्धः ready to depart, स्नेहात् with affection, अङ्गदम् to Angada, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And conferring (upon Sugrīva) that golden garland and beholding his son before him, Vāli, resolved upon death, spoke to Angada, saying.

data.v: देशकालौ भजस्वाद्य क्षममाणः प्रियाप्रिये । सुखदुःखसहः काले सुग्रीववशगो भव ।।
data.es: 'Enduring pleasure or pain equally with due regard to time and place favourable to you or otherwise, you should submit to the will of Sugriva.
data.anv: अद्य now, प्रियाप्रिये dear or otherwise, क्षममाणः forgiving, देशकालौ regard  to time and place, भजस्व serve, काले in time, सुखदुःखसहः enduring pleasure and pain equally, सुग्रीववशगः भव submit to Sugriva's will.
data.md: Do you place yourself now under the control of Sugrīva, ascertaining time and place, putting up with misery for your welfare and injury.

data.v: यथा हि त्वं महाबाहो लालितः सततं मया । न तथा वर्तमानं त्वां सुग्रीवो बहु मंस्यते ।।
data.es: 'O longarmed one you have always been affectionately brought up by me. Sugriva may not rear you that way.
data.anv: महाबाहो O longarmed one, त्वम् you, सततम् always, मया by me, यथा as, लालितः affectionately, तथा in that way, वर्तमानम् as in the present, त्वाम् to you, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, न बहुमंस्यते not bring you up.
data.md: O you having long arms, Sugrīva shall not regard you much, if did you remain in the same wise in which you hadst been brought up by me before*. The significance of the passage is as follows:You wert a mere child while I brought you up. But now you are a grown up young man and this is the time for you to serve your elders. Do you therefore serve Sugriva.

data.v: मास्यामित्रैर्गतं गच्छेर्मा शत्रुभिररिंदम । भर्तुरर्थपरो दान्तः सुग्रीववशगो भव ।।
data.es: 'O conqueror of foes do not align with his enemies or with the friends of his enemies. Remain selfrestrained and loyal to Sugriva. Be subordinate to his will.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O conqueror of enemies, अस्य his, अमित्रैः friends his enemies, गतम् in the past , मा गच्छेः  after my exit, शत्रुभिः with his enemies too, मा do not, भर्तुः protector's, अर्थपरः devoted to his interests, दान्तः selfrestrained, सुग्रीववशगः stand by Sugriva, भव you.
data.md: O slayer of foes, do you never mix with Sugrīva's enemies, and place yourself always under Sugrīva's control, having subdued your senses and being intent upon your master's (Sugriva's) welfare.

data.v: न चातिप्रणयः कार्यः कर्तव्योऽप्रणयश्च ते । उभयं हि महादोषं तस्मादन्तरदृग्भव ।।
data.es: 'You are not to be excessively friendly or otherise as both are serious mistakes. Therefore, be insightful.'
data.anv: अतिप्रणयः excessively friendly, ते by you, न कार्यः should not be, अप्रणयश्च lack of love also, न कर्तव्यः not to be, उभयम् both, महान्दोषम् will amount to serious mistake, तस्मात्  therefore, अन्तरदृक् insightful, भव be.
data.md: Do you not cultivate too much of friendship nor be wanting in it-for both of these extremes are sources of disasters. Do you therefore follow the golden mean.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वाथ विवृत्ताक्षः शरसंपीडितो भृशम् । विवृतैर्दशनैर्भीमैर्बभूवोत्क्रान्तजीवितः ।।
data.es: Having spoken this, tormented by the arrow, eyes popping out and his dreadful teeth ejected, Vali remained drained of life.
data.anv: भृशम् intensely, शरसम्पीडितः formented by the arrow, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, अथ then, विवृत्ताक्षः popping out his eyes, विवृतैः with opened, भीमैः with dreadful, दशनैः with teeth, उत्क्रान्तजीवितः dead, बभूव remained.
data.md: After he had said this, his eyes became expanded, his teeth were opened and his appearance became ghastly. And greatly pained by shafts he breathed his last.

data.v: हते तु वीरे प्लवगाधिपे तदा; प्लवंगमास्तत्र न शर्म लेभिरे । वनेचराः सिंहयुते महावने; यथा हि गावो निहते गवां पतौ ।।
data.es: Just as the cattle get frightened when the leader of the herd gets killed in a huge forest full of lions, the young monkey became puzzled when the chief of monkeys got killed.
data.anv: सिंहयुते in a place full of lions, महावने in a huge forest, गवाम् of cattle, पतौ the lord, निहते when killed, वनेचराः wanderers of the forest, गावः cows, यथा as, तदा then, वीरे when the hero, प्लवगाधिपे chief of monkeys, हते when killed, तत्र there, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, शर्म peace of mind, न लेभिरे not get.
data.md: Like to kine, incapable of enjoying peace in a mighty forest filled with lions, their chief being dead, these forest-rangers could not attain to felicity on the demise of that lord of monkeys.

data.v: ततस्तु तारा व्यसनार्णव प्लुता; मृतस्या भर्तुर्वदनं समीक्ष्य सा । जगाम भूमिं परिरभ्य वालिनं; महाद्रुमं छिन्नमिवाश्रिता लता ।।
data.md: Thereupon, Tārā, sunk in the gulf of disaster, eyeing the countenance of her deceased lord, fell down to the ground embracing Vāli like to a creeper clinging for its support to a mighty but broken tree.

data.v: ततः समुपजिघ्रन्ती कपिराजस्य तन्मुखम् । पतिं लोकाच्च्युतं तारा मृतं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Tara kissed (smelt) the forehead of the king of monkeys who had departed and said:
data.anv: ततः then, लोकाच्च्युतं  departed from the world, तारा Tara, कपिराजस्य  king of monkeys', तत् मुखम् his forehead, समुपजिघ्रन्ती smelt (kissed), मृतम् dead, पतिम् husband, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereupon smelling the face of that lord of monkeys, Tārā again addressed her deceased lord, known all over the world, saying.

data.v: शेषे त्वं विषमे दुःखमकृत्वा वचनं मम । उपलोपचिते वीर सुदुःखे वसुधातले ।।
data.es: 'O hero, not caring for my words (of caution), you are now lying with great pain on hard stones on the ground.
data.anv: वीर hero, मम my,वचनम् words, अकृत्वा not cared, त्वम् you, विषमे on a hard, उपलोपचिते carpeted with stones, सुदुःखे very painful, वसुधातले on the ground, दुःखम् sadly, शेषे  lying
data.md: O hero, disregarding my words, you are lying on the uneven earth, hard and filled with gravels.

data.v: मत्तः प्रियतरा नूनं वानरेन्द्र मही तव । शेषे हि तां परिष्वज्य मां च न प्रतिभाषसे ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys you lie in the end, embracing the earth and not replying to me. Surely you deem this earth dearer than me.
data.anv: वानरेन्द्र O lord of monkeys, मही the earth, तव to you, मत्तः more than me, नूनम् surely, प्रियतरा dearer, हि indeed, ताम् to her, परिष्वज्य embracing, शेषे in the end, माम् me, न प्रतिभाषसे च  not replying me.
data.md: O lord of monkeys, the earth is dearer to you than I, since you are lying there embracing her and are not welcoming me.

data.v: सुग्रीव एव विक्रान्तो वीर साहसिक प्रिय । ऋक्षवानरमुख्यास्त्वां बलिनं पर्युपासते ।।
एषां विलपितं कृच्छ्रमङ्गदस्य च शोचतः । मम चेमां गिरं श्रुत्वा किं त्वं न प्रतिबुध्यसे ।।
data.es: 'Oh powerful Vali leaders of the bears and monkeys, the entire lot are standing near you, wailing. Angada has been crying in grief. How is it that you are not rising up even after hearing their wailing voices and my call? .
data.anv: ऋक्षवानरमुख्याः leader of bears and monkeys, बलिनः powerful, त्वाम् your, पर्युपासते are standing near,एषाम् of these, कृच्छ्रम् entire, विलपितम् wailing, शोचतः crying in grief, अङ्गदस्य च Angada's, मम my, इमाः these, गिरः words,  श्रुत्वा on hearing, त्वम् you, किम् why, न प्रतिबुध्यसे you are not getting up.
data.md: Why are you not awake, hearing the bewailings of bears and monkeys who used to wait upon you, powerful, as well as that of Angada and myself?

data.v: इदं तच्छूरशयनं यत्र शेषे हतो युधि । शायिता निहता यत्र त्वयैव रिपवः पुरा ।।
data.es: 'Earlier you have killed enemies in combats and made them lie down where now you lie.
data.anv: त्वयैव by yourself, पुरा earlier, निहताः killed, रिपवः enemies, यत्र there, शायिताः they are made to lie down, तत् that, शूरशयनम् the reclining place for heroes, इदम् this, युधि in war, हतः killed, यत्र where, (तत्र there), शेषे you are lying.
data.md: Alas! you are lying on this bed of the heroes, being slain in the battle, where formerly, your enemies destroyed by you, used to lie down,

data.v: विशुद्धसत्त्वाभिजन प्रिययुद्ध मम प्रिय । मामनाथां विहायैकां गतस्त्वमसि मानद ।।
data.es: 'O venerable hero, born in a pure and noble family, you are a lover of battles. Now you have left me an orphan.
data.anv: विशुद्धसत्त्वाभिजन born into pure and noble clan, प्रिययुद्ध O lover of battle, मानद O venerable one, मम प्रिय my dear, त्वम् you, अनाथाम् an orphan, माम् me, एकाम् विहाय leaving me alone, गतः went.
data.md: O you born of a pure family, O you that are fond of warfare, O my dear, O conferror of honours, whither have you departed making me husbandless?

data.v: शूराय न प्रदातव्या कन्या खलु विपश्चिता । शूरभार्यां हतां पश्य सद्यो मां विधवां कृताम् ।।
data.es: 'It is said by wise men that a girl should not be given in marriage to a warrior. See me, the wife of a warrior, now rendered a widow.
data.anv: विपश्चिता by wise men, कन्या a girl, शूराय for a warrior, न प्रदातव्या should not be given in marriage, सद्यः presently, विधवां कृताम्  rendered a widow, हताम् killed, शूरभार्याम् wife of a warrior, माम् me, पश्य you may see.
data.md: Let not the wise, henceforth, confer their daughters upon the heroes. Alas! behold me, the wife of a hero, made a widow in no time.

data.v: अवभग्नश्च मे मानो भग्ना मे शाश्वती गतिः । अगाधे च निमग्नास्मि विपुले शोकसागरे ।।
data.es: 'My pride is crushed. My husband, the ultimate resort for me is shattered.I am plunged in a vast, bottomless ocean of grief.
data.anv: मे my, मानः pride, अवभग्नश्च  is crushed, मे my, शाश्वती गतिः ultimate resort, भग्ना is shattered, अगाधे in a bottomless, विपुले in a vast, शोकसागरे in ocean of sorrow, निमग्ना plunged, अस्मि I am.
data.md: Shattered is my honour and destroyed is my happiness and I am sunk in the deep abyss of grief.

data.v: अश्मसारमयं नूनमिदं मे हृदयं दृढम् । भर्तारं निहतं दृष्ट्वा यन्नाद्य शतधा गतम् ।।
data.es: 'My heart is surely made of hard stone yet it has not split into a hundred pieces even on seeing my husband slain৷৷
data.anv: निहतम्  killed, भर्तारम् husband, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, यत् since, अद्य now, शतधा into a hundred, न कृतम् not broken, मे my, दृढम् hard, इदं हृदयम् this heart, अश्मसारमयम् made of stone, नूनम् surely.
data.md: Forsooth, this my firm heart is not sundered into hundred pieces, beholding my husband slain!

data.v: सुहृच्चैव हि भर्ता च प्रकृत्या च मम प्रियः । आहवे च पराक्रान्तः शूरः पञ्चत्वमागतः ।।
data.es: 'He was my husband, my friend and naturally my loving king. He was powerful in battle.Alas the hero has died.
data.anv: मम my, प्रकृत्या by nature, प्रियः dear, सुहृच्छैव a friend also, भर्ता च and husband, आहवे in  battle, पराक्रान्तः a powerful, शूरः hero, पञ्चत्वम् death, आगतः reached.
data.md: You are my friend, my dear husband and a great hero-and you had met with destruction, being struck by another man.

data.v: पतिहीना तु या नारी कामं भवतु पुत्रिणी । धनधान्यैः सुपूर्णापि विधवेत्युच्यते बुधैः ।।
data.es: 'Even if a woman without husband, is blessed with sons and abundant wealth and grain, still learned people call her a widow.
data.anv: या नारी any woman, पतिहीना without husband, पुत्रिणी mother of sons, भवतु कामम् even so, धनधान्यैस्सुपूर्णाऽपि a prosperous lady with wealth and grain in abundance, बुधैः by learned people, विधवेति only a widow, उच्यते is called so.
data.md: A husbandless woman is always styled by the wise as widow, although she might have a son and enough of riches.

data.v: स्वगात्रप्रभवे वीर शेषे रुधिरमण्डले । कृमिरागपरिस्तोमे त्वमेवं शयने यथा ।।
data.es: 'O hero how is it that you are lying in a crimson bed of the pool of blood flowing from your body?
data.anv: वीर O hero, स्वगात्रप्रभवे flowing from your body, रुधिरमण्डले in a pool of blood, क्रिमिरागपरिस्तोमे  crimson bed, त्वमात्मशयने in sleeping, यथा as such, शेषे you are lying.
data.md: O hero, you are lying down in a pool of blood issuing out of your own person, like to your own bed having a red-dyed bed-sheet.

data.v: रेणुशोणितसंवीतं गात्रं तव समन्ततः । परिरब्धुं न शक्नोमि भुजाभ्यां प्लवगर्षभ ।।
data.es: 'O bull among monkeys how can I embrace you with my arms as your body is covered with dust particles and blood?.
data.anv: प्लवगर्षभ O bull among monkeys, समन्ततः all over, रेणुशोणितसंवीतम् covered with dust particles and blood, तव गात्रम् your body, भुजाभ्याम् with my arms, परिरब्धुम् to embrace, न शक्नोमि not able to.
data.md: Your body is on all sides besmeared with blood and dust and I am incapable of embracing you with my arms, O best of monkeys.

data.v: कृतकृत्योऽद्य सुग्रीवो वैरेऽस्मिन्नतिदारुणे । यस्य रामविमुक्तेन हृतमेकेषुणा भयम् ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva has achieved his goal in his dreadful enmity (with you). His fear is dispelled by a single arrow released by Rama.
data.anv: अतिदारुणे very dreadful, अस्मिन् वैरे his enmity, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अद्य now, कृतकृत्यः has achieved his goal, यस्य at whose, भयम् fear, रामविमुक्तेन released by Rama, एकेषुणा one single arrow, हृतम् is dispelled.
data.md: Surely has Sugrīva satisfied his hostile intention to-day, whose fear has been removed by one shaft, discharged by Rāma.

data.v: शरेण हृदि लग्नेन गात्रसंस्पर्शने तव । वार्यामि त्वां निरीक्षन्ती त्वयि पञ्चत्वमागते ।।
data.es: 'The arrow which has pierced your body prevents me from embracing you. I am only looking at you lying (not removing the arrow lest you die).'
data.anv: त्वयि your, पञ्चत्वम् death, आगते reached, हृदि in the chest,  शरेण by the arrow,  लग्नेन by  arrow pierced, गात्रसंस्पर्शने touching limbs, वार्यामि refrain from, त्वां your, निरीक्षन्ती only looking at you.
data.md: Thyself departing to the land of the dead. I have been eyeing you simply, being prevented from touching your person by the shaft piercing your heart.* The meaning is:-Lest by my touching that shaft you feelest a greater pain.

data.v: उद्बबर्ह शरं नीलस्तस्य गात्रगतं तदा । गिरिगह्वरसंलीनं दीप्तमाशीविषं यथा ।।
data.es: Then Nila took out the arrow from Vali's heart with due effort as one would pull out a glowing serpent hidden in the mountain cave.
data.anv: तदा then, नीलः Nila, तस्य his, गात्रगतम् deadbody, शरम् arrow, गिरिगह्वरसंलीनम् hidden in the mountain cave(heart), दीप्तम् glowing, आशीविषं यथा like a serpent, उद्ववर्ह made effort.
data.md: Thereupon Neela took out that shaft from the person of (Vāli) like to a flaming serpent lurking in a mountain cave.

data.v: तस्य निष्कृष्यमाणस्य बाणस्य च बभौ द्युतिः । अस्तमस्तकसंरुद्धो रश्मिर्दिनकरादिव ।।
data.es: As the arrrow(drenched in blood) was being pulled out, its glow looked like the Sun's rays obstructed by the peak of the western mountain.
data.anv: निष्कृषमाणस्य as it was being pulled out, तस्य of that, बाणस्य arrow's, द्युतिः glow, दिनकरात् Sun's, अस्तमस्तकसंरुद्धः obstructed by the peak of the western mountain, रश्मिः इव like the rays, बभौ appeared.
data.md: There beamed the shaft extracted from his body like to the rays of the Sun, stationed on the summit of the setting hill.

data.v: पेतुः क्षतजधारास्तु व्रणेभ्यस्तस्य सर्वशः । ताम्रगैरिकसंपृक्ता धारा इव धराधरात् ।।
data.es: The streams of blood that flowed all over from the wounds of his body appeared like streams of water mixed with red and copper colour.
data.anv: तस्य from his, व्रणेभ्यः wound, क्षतजधाराः streams of blood, धराधरात् from a mountain, ताम्रगैरिकसम्पृक्ताः red mixed with copper, धाराः इव like the streams, सर्वशः all over, पेतुः flowed.
data.md: And there poured forth from all his wounds, streams of blood, like to showers of melted copper and other metals falling from a mountain.

data.v: अवकीर्णं विमार्जन्ती भर्तारं रणरेणुना । अस्रैर्नयनजैः शूरं सिषेचास्त्रसमाहतम् ।।
data.es: She (Tara) wiped the body wounded with the weapon and covered with wardust, sprinkling her tear drops from her eyes.
data.anv: रणरेणुना wardust, अवकीर्णम् covered, भर्तारम् husband, विमार्जन्ती wiped, अस्त्रसमाहतम्  wounded with the weapon, शूरम् warrior, नयनजैः water from the eyes, अप्रैः with tears, सिषेच sprinkled.
data.md: And (Tārā) washed, with tears, her heroic husband's body covered with dust and wounded with weapons.

data.v: रुधिरोक्षितसर्वाङ्गं दृष्ट्वा विनिहतं पतिम् । उवाच तारा पिङ्गाक्षं पुत्रमङ्गदमङ्गना ।।
data.es: Turning to the body of her husband fully drenched in blood, thus spoke Tara to her tawnyeyed son Angada:
data.anv: अङ्गना woman, तारा Tara, विनिहतम् killed, रुधिरोक्षितसर्वाङ्गम्  all parts of his body drenched in blood, पतिम् husband, दृष्ट्वा seeing, पुत्रम् son, पिङ्गाक्षम् tawnyeyed, अङ्गदम् Angada, उवाच said.
data.md: Beholding her husband thus slain and besmeared with blood, she spoke to her son, Angada, having coppery eyes, saying:

data.v: अवस्थां पश्चिमां पश्य पितुः पुत्र सुदारुणाम् । संप्रसक्तस्य वैरस्य गतोऽन्तः पापकर्मणा ।।
data.es: 'O son you see the most terrific end of your father on whom enmity forced sinful deeds.
data.anv: पुत्र Son, पितुः of father, सुदारुणाम् most terrific, पश्चिमां at the end, अवस्थाम् condition, पश्य  see, पापकर्मणा on account of the sinful deeds, सम्प्रसक्तस्य that which was forced on him, वैरस्य out of the enmity, अन्तः end, गतः reached.
data.md: Behold this terrible declining stage of your Sire. Here is the end of his hostilities collected by his impious action.

data.v: बालसूर्योदयतनुं प्रयान्तं यमसादनम् । अभिवादय राजानं पितरं पुत्र मानदम् ।।
data.es: 'O son offer salutations to your venerable father, the king, departing for the abode of Yama (lord of death) looking (red with blood) like the rising Sun.'
data.anv: पुत्र son, बालसूर्योदयतनुम्  body (red) like the rising Sun, यमसदनम् abode of Yama, प्रयान्तम् departing , राजानम् king, मानदम् venerable, पितरम् father, अभिवादय offer salutations.
data.md: O my son, do you how to your kingly father, the conferrer of honours, who has departed to the abode of Death, having a flaming person like to the rising Sun.

data.v: एवमुक्तः समुत्थाय जग्राह चरणौ पितुः । भुजाभ्यां पीनवृताभ्यामङ्गदोऽहमिति ब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Thus advised by Tara, Angada got up, clasped his father's feet with his stout arms, and saluted, saying, 'I am Angada.'
data.anv: एवम् that way, उक्तः  advised, समुत्थाय  got up, अहम् I am, अङ्गदः Angada, इति thus, ब्रुवन् speaking, पीनवृत्ताभ्याम् stout, भुजाभ्याम् both shoulders, पितुः of father, चरणौ feet, जग्राह clasped.
data.md: Thus accosted, Angada rose up and, saying, I (do touch my Sire's feet), embraced his father's feet with his plump arms.

data.v: अभिवादयमानं त्वामङ्गदं त्वं यथापुरा । दीर्घायुर्भव पुत्रेति किमर्थं नाभिभाषसे ।।
data.es: 'Why do you not, with the words 'May you live long'', bless, as before, your son Angada who is greeting you? (said Tara).
data.anv: त्वाम् to you, अभिवादयमानम् saluting, अङ्गदम् Angada, त्वम् you, पुत्र son, दीर्घायुः longlived, भव be, इति thus, किमर्थं why, यथा पुरा like earlier, नाभिभाषसे not speaking?
data.md: (Thereupon Tāră said)—Saying 'Do you live long' why did you not welcome Angada, to-day as before, who has bowed to you?

data.v: अहं पुत्रसहाया त्वामुपासे गतचेतनम् । सिंहेन निहतं सद्यो गौः सवत्सेव गोवृषम् ।।
data.es: 'Just like a cow followed by its calf would attend upon a mighty bull struck by a lion I will wait with my son upon you who have lost consciousness (died).
data.anv: सद्यः now, सिंहेन by a lion, निहतम् struck, गोवृषम् mighty bull, सवत्सा along with her calf, गौः इव like a calf, पुत्रसहाया wait upon with son, अहम् I am, गतचेतसम् lost consciousness (died), त्वाम् you, उपासे I serve you.
data.md: I am with my son, standing by you who are dead, like to a cow with her calf, having the bull slain by a lion.

data.v: इष्ट्वा संग्रामयज्ञेन नानाप्रहरणाम्भसा । अस्मिन्नवभृथे स्नातः कथं पत्न्या मया विना ।।
data.es: 'You have performed a warsacrifice. You have bathed in the waters of Rama's weapon signifying the end of the sacrifice. How did you take this customary bath without me, your wife?
data.anv: सङ्ग्रामयज्ञेन इष्ट्वा having performed a sacrificial war, पत्न्या with wife, मया विना without me, रामप्रह्ररणाम्भसि in the water of Rama's arrow, अस्मिन् in this, अवभृथे in this bath taken at the end of a sacrifice, कथम् how, स्नातः did you bathe?

data.v: या दत्ता देवराजेन तव तुष्टेन संयुगे । शातकुम्भमयीं मालां तां ते पश्यामि नेह किम् ।।
data.es: 'Why do I not see on your chest the golden necklace gifted by the king of the gods (Indra), pleased with you in the battle?
data.anv: संयुगे in the battle, तुष्टेन  pleased, देवराजेन by the king of gods (Indra), या such one, तव to your, दत्ता gifted, ताम् that one, शातकुम्भमयीं a golden one, मालाम् necklace, इह now, किम् why, न पश्यामि I do not see.

data.v: राजश्रीर्न जहाति त्वां गतासुमपि मानद । सूर्यस्यावर्तमानस्य शैलराजमिव प्रभा ।।
data.es: 'O venerable one, even though life has departed from you, kingly glory does not leave you any more than the light of the setting son leaves the king of mountains. (western mountain)
data.anv: मानद venerable, शैलराजम् king of mountains, आवर्तमानस्य as he returns, सूर्यस्य the Sun's, प्रभा इव like light, राज्यश्रीः kingly glory, गतासुम् अपि even though departed, त्वाम् you, न जहाति not left.
data.md: Royal grace has not renounced you, O conferrer of honours, albeit you are dead, like to the rays not quitting the king of mountains, even after the Sun is set.

data.v: न मे वचः पथ्यमिदं त्वया कृतं; न चास्मि शक्ता हि निवारणे तव । हता सपुत्रास्मि हतेन संयुगे; सह त्वया श्रीर्विजहाति मामिह ।।
data.es: 'You have not followed my advice. I did not have the capacity to prevent you from going to war. The result is, you are killed and I am ruined along with my son. The goddess of fortune also is deserting me as well as your son.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: त्वया by you, मे mine, पथ्यम् proper, इदं वचः these words, न कृतम् not followed, तव your, निवारणे in preventing, शक्ता capable, न अस्मि च हि I was not, संयुगे in war, हतेन one who is killed, सुपुत्रा along with my son, हतास्मि I am dead, श्रीः goddess of fortune, त्वया सह along with you, मामिह from me, विजहाति has deserted.
data.md: You didst not act by my wholesome words, nor could I prevent you. And I am now destroyed with my son, along with you in the battle. Truly has Sree (goddess of wealth) renounced me.

data.v: गतासुं वालिनं दृष्ट्वा राघवस्तदनन्तरम् । अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सुग्रीवं शत्रुतापनः ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the noblest of all monkeys, spoke these polite words in a pleasing manner to Lakshmana of terrific strength:
data.anv: सर्ववानरसत्तमः the noble of all the vanaras, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, भीमबलम् a man of great prowess, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, सम्प्रहर्षयन् pleasing manner, प्रश्रितम् वाक्यम् these polite words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: न शोकपरितापेन श्रेयसा युज्यते मृतः । यदत्रानन्तरं कार्यं तत्समाधातुमर्हथ ।।
data.es: 'No lamentation revives the dead. So you should take up whatever is required now.
data.anv: शोकपरितापेन by lamenting, मृतः the dead, श्रेयसा with wellbeing, न युज्यते will not gain, अत्र here, यत् whatever, अनन्तरम् later, कार्यम् should be done, तत् that, समाधातुम् to take up, अर्हथ you may do.
data.md: Grief and lamentations do not tend to the welfare of the deceased. It therefore behoveth you to perform the after ceremonies.

data.v: लोकवृत्तमनुष्ठेयं कृतं वो बाष्पमोक्षणम् । न कालादुत्तरं किंचित्कर्म शक्यमुपासितुम् ।।
data.es: 'You have to go the worldly way. You have shed tears enough. Time is passing. You cannot perform the funeral after the lapse of appropriate time.
data.anv: लोकवृत्तम् worldly way, अनुष्ठेयम् should be performed, वः by you, बाष्पमोक्षणम् shedding tears, कृतम् is done, कालात्  after lapse of time, उत्तरम् later, परम् supreme, किञ्चित् कर्म even a little task, उपासितुम् to be engaged in, न शक्यम् not possible.
data.md: You have satisfied the worldly practice with a profuse discharge of tears. It is not proper to delay the performance of appointed actions.

data.v: नियतः कारणं लोके नियतिः कर्मसाधनम् । नियतिः सर्वभूतानां नियोगेष्विह कारणम् ।।
data.es: 'Fate is the cause of the world. Fate is the means of accomplishment. Fate assigns duties to all beings.
data.anv: लोके  the worlds, नियतिः fate, कारणम् cause, नियतिः fate, कर्मसाधनम् to accomplish tasks, इह here, सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, नियोगेषु  to assign respective duties, नियतिः fate, कारणम् is the cause.
data.md: Time is the prime cause in this world, and the source of the accomplishment of actions. And Time it is that leads men to actions.

data.v: न कर्ता कस्यचित्कश्चिन्नियोगे चापि नेश्वरः । स्वभावे वर्तते लोकस्तस्य कालः परायणम् ।।
data.es: 'No one can control another's action. No one including God can be the agent of action. No one has the power to entrust duty to others. This entire world is governed by one's own nature. Nature in turn is governed by Time (fate).
data.anv: कस्यचित् for any one, नियोगे in controlling, कश्चित् any one, कर्ता agent of action, न not even, ईश्वरः अपि च Iswara also, न not, लोकः world, स्वभावे by nature, वर्तते follows, तस्य for that, कालः only time, परायणम् ultimate cause.
data.md: No one is the lord of another person, and no one leads him to actions. People are subject to their actions of previous existence and Time aids them.

data.v: न कालः कालमत्येति न कालः परिहीयते । स्वभावं वा समासाद्य न कश्चिदतिवर्तते ।।
data.es: 'God (though independent) does not deviate from Time. Time cannot be escaped or trangressed. It cannot be condoned or avoided. No one can transgress their own nature.
data.anv: कालः Iswara, कालम् time, न अत्येति not deviate, कालः fate, न परिहीयते is not subjected any concession, कश्चित् anybody, स्वभावम् one's own nature, समासाद्य after exercising, न अतिवर्तते cannot transgress.
data.md: Even the Eternal being cannot withstand the ways of Time. He never decayeth-and no one else can withstand the course of Time.

data.v: न कालस्यास्ति बन्धुत्वं न हेतुर्न पराक्रमः । न मित्रज्ञातिसंबन्धः कारणं नात्मनो वशः ।।
data.es: 'Time has no consideration for relationship, friendship, or kinship or valour. Time itself is the cause. It is never under one's control.
data.anv: कालस्य Time, बन्धुत्वम् relationship, नास्ति is not there, आत्मनो वशः self itself, हेतुः reason, न no, पराक्रमः valour, न not, मित्रज्ञातिसम्बन्धः relationship based on friendship, कारणम् cause, न no.
data.md: It has no friend, no cause and no one can overcome it. It has no kinsman, no relation; even it is not subject to itself.

data.v: किं तु काल परीणामो द्रष्टव्यः साधु पश्यता । धर्मश्चार्थश्च कामश्च कालक्रमसमाहिताः ।।
data.es: 'However a wise man should visualise the turn of events in course of time with the right vision. Dharma, artha and kama are controlled by an order laid down by Time.
data.anv: किं तु however, साधु properly, पश्यता by a person who can see, कालपरीणामः effect of fate, द्रष्टव्यः should be visualised, धर्मश्च and dharma, अर्थश्च even wealth, कामश्च and pleasures, कालक्रमसमाहिताः are ordained by an order which is controlled by fate.
data.md: The wise can perceive the work of Time. Piety, wealth and desire are all subject to it.

data.v: इतः स्वां प्रकृतिं वाली गतः प्राप्तः क्रियाफलम् । धर्मार्थकामसंयोगैः पवित्रं प्लवगेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'Vali, king of monkeys is dead and gone. He acted according to his own nature and attained the sacred fruit of his action comensurate with dharma, wealth and pleasures in this world.
data.anv: प्लवगेश्वरः king of monkeys, वाली vali, इतः dead, स्वाम् his own, प्रकृतिम् nature, गतः has reached, धर्मार्थकामसंयोगैः with the combination of dharma, wealth and pleasures, पवित्रम् sacred, क्रियाफलम् result of his action, प्राप्तः attained.
data.md: Vāli, the lord of monkeys, has attained to his own true state, reaping the fruits of his actions, acquired by virtue of his royal accomplishments namely forgiveness and charity.

data.v: स्वधर्मस्य च संयोगाज्जितस्तेन महात्मना । स्वर्गः परिगृहीतश्च प्राणानपरिरक्षता ।।
data.es: 'Great Vali has earned a place in heaven by virtue of his own dharma and not caring for his own life .He has got the heavenly position he earned.
data.anv: प्राणान् life, अपरिरक्षिता by not protecting, तेन महात्मना by that great soul, स्वधर्मस्य सम्योगात् by virtue of his own dharma, स्वर्गः heaven, जितः won, परिगृहीतश्च has been accepted.
data.md: The abode of the celestials, which was conquered by this high-souled one by his former piety, has now been occupied by him after resigning his body.

data.v: एषा वै नियतिः श्रेष्ठा यां गतो हरियूथपः । तदलं परितापेन प्राप्तकालमुपास्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'The state attained by the chief of monkeys is an excellent one.Therefore there is no need to regret. Attend to your duties (relating to rites)'
data.anv: हरियूथपः chief of monkeys, याम् whichever, गतः has gone, एषा this, नियतिः destiny, श्रेष्ठा वै is the very best, तत् therefore, परितापेन to regret, अलम् no need of, प्राप्तकालम् at this time, उपास्यताम् attend.
data.md: This is the best course of Time that has been attained to by the lord of monkey-herds. No more with lamentations therefore; do you perform the actions that are worthy of being performed on this occasion.

data.v: वचनान्ते तु रामस्य लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा । अवदत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सुग्रीवं गतचेतसं ।।
data.es: Seeing Sugriva had lost his senses, Lakshmana, the slayer of enemy warriors humbly said at the end of Rama's address:
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, वचनान्ते at the end of his address, परवीरहा slayer of enemy warriors, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, गतचेतसम् he who had lost his senses, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, प्रश्रितम् humbly, वाक्यम् these words, अवदत् said.
data.md: After Rāma had spoken thus, Laksmana, the slayer of foes, addressed Sugrīva, senseless with grief, with the following sound words.

data.v: कुरु त्वमस्य सुग्रीव प्रेतकार्यमनन्तरम् । ताराङ्गदाभ्यां सहितो वालिनो दहनं प्रति ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva perform with Tara and Angada the funeral obsequies relating to the cremation of Vali.
data.anv: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, त्वम् you, ताराङ्गदाभ्याम् with Tara and Angada, सहितः along with, अस्य his, अनन्तरम् later, प्रेतकार्यम् funeral rites, कुरु you may do, वालिनः for Vali, दहनं प्रति for the cremation.
data.md: Sugrīva, do you perform the funeral ceremonies of Vali along with Tārā and Angada.

data.v: समाज्ञापय काष्ठानि शुष्काणि च बहूनि च । चन्दनानि च दिव्यानि वालिसंस्कारकारणात् ।।
data.es: 'Let the best of dry logs and sandalwood be ordered for the funeral rites of Vali.
data.anv: शुष्कानि dried, बहूनि many, काष्ठानि logs of wood, दिव्यानि best one, चन्दनादीनि च sandalwood and such things, वालिसंस्कार कारणात् for the funeral rites of Vali, समाज्ञापय  order.
data.md: Do you collect for cremation many a dry fuel and celestial sandal.

data.v: समाश्वासय चैनं त्वमङ्गदं दीनचेतसं । मा भूर्बालिशबुद्धिस्त्वं त्वदधीनमिदं पुरम् ।।
data.es: 'Pacify the despondent Angada so that he does not entertain childish thoughts any more. This city is under your control (now).
data.anv: त्वम् you, दीनचेतसम् despondent, एनम् him, अङ्गदम् Angada, समाश्वासय you may pacify, त्वम् you, बालिशबुद्धिः मा भूः you may not be childish, इदं पुरम् this city, त्वदधीनम् is under you.
data.md: Do you console the unfortunate Angada, who is beside himself with grief. Do not conduct yourself like an ignorant person, for this city is now under you.

data.v: अङ्गदस्त्वानयेन्माल्यं वस्त्राणि विविधानि च । घृतं तैलमथो गन्धान्यच्चात्र समनन्तरम् ।।
data.es: 'Let Angada for his part collect garlands of many kinds, clothes, clarified butter, oil, fragrants and all that is required to be procured.
data.anv: अङ्गदस्तु Angada for his part, माल्यम् garlands, विविधानि of many kinds, वस्त्राणि च clothes, घृतम् clarified butter, तैलम् oil, अथो now, गन्धानि fragrants, अत्र here, यत् whatever, समनन्तरम् is required to be collected, आनयेत् let him get.
data.md: Let Angada bring clothes, garlands, scents, clarified butter, oil and other necessary articles.

data.v: त्वं तार शिबिकां शीघ्रमादायागच्छ संभ्रमात् । त्वरा गुणवती युक्ता ह्यस्मिन्काले विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O Tara quickly get a swiftmoving litter fastened with ropes specially suitable for this occasion.
data.anv: तार Tara (a monkey), त्वम् you, सम्भ्रमात् hasten, शीघ्रम् quickly, शिबिकाम् litter, आदाय after getting, आगच्छ may come, त्वरा swiftly, गुणवती tied with ropes, विशेषतः specially, अस्मिन्काले at this time, युक्ता हि will be proper.
data.md: O Tārā, do you go and bring soon a conveyance; for speediness is a special virtue on an occasion like this.

data.v: सज्जीभवन्तु प्लवगाः शिबिकावाहनोचिताः । समर्था बलिनश्चैव निर्हरिष्यन्ति वालिनम् ।।
data.es: 'Let those who are strong and capable among the monkeys be ready to carry the dead body of Vali on a litter'.
data.anv: शिबिकावाहनोचिताः those monkeys who can carry the litter, समर्थाः capable ones, बलिनश्चैव and strong also, प्लवगाः monkeys, सज्जीभवन्तु let them get ready, वालिनम् Vali's, निर्हरिष्यन्ति they will carry him.
data.md: Let the monkeys dress themselves who can convey this hearse. The powerful and the capable only shall carry Vali.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु सुग्रीवं सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः । तस्थौ भ्रातृसमीपस्थो लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा ।।
data.es: Having thus spoken to Sugriva, Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, slayer of enemies, stood by his brother
data.anv: सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः the delight of Sumitra, परवीरहा slayer of enemies, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, भ्रातृसमीपस्थः near his brother, स्थौ stood.
data.md: Having thus addressed Sugriva, Laksmana, the enhancer of Sumitrā's joy and the destroyer of foes, stood before his elder brother.

data.v: लक्ष्मणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा तारः संभ्रान्तमानसः । प्रविवेश गुहां शीघ्रं शिबिकासक्तमानसः ।।
data.es: On hearing Lakshmana, Tara in an excited state quickly entered the cave city to get the litter.
data.anv: तारः Tara, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सम्भ्रान्तमानसः with exited mind, शिबिकासक्तमानसः entrusted to get a latter, शीघ्रम्  quickly, गुहाम् cave, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: And hearing the words of Laksmana, the counsellor respectfully entered the cave with a view to bring the conveyance.

data.v: आदाय शिबिकां तारः स तु पर्यापयत्पुनः । वानरैरुह्यमानां तां शूरैरुद्वहनोचितैः ।।
data.es: Tara jumped in on to the litter carried by strong monkeys.
data.anv: सः तारः that Tara, उद्वहनोचितैः by those who can carry, शूरैः by heroes, वानरैः by monkeys, उह्यमानाम् being carried, ताम् that, शिबिकाम् litter, आदाय after getting, पुनःagain, पर्यापतत् jumped in.
data.md: And taking that conveyance carried by the monkeys and worthy of being carried by the heroes, he issued out again of the cave.

data.v: ततो वालिनमुद्यम्य सुग्रीवः शिबिकां तदा । आरोपयत विक्रोशन्नङ्गदेन सहैव तु ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva along with Angada, crying aloud bitterly, lifted the body (of Vali) and placed it on the palanquin.
data.anv: ततः then, अङ्गदेन सहैव तु along with Angada , सुग्रीवःSugriva, विक्रोशन् while crying aloud, वालिनम् Vali, उद्यम्य after lifting, तदा then, शिबिकाम् palanquin, आरोपयत  placed him on it
data.md: Thereupon Sugrīva, long with Angada, placing Väli on the conveyance, began to bewail.

data.v: आरोप्य शिबिकां चैव वालिनं गतजीवितम् । अलंकारैश्च विविधैर्माल्यैर्वस्त्रैश्च भूषितम् ।।
data.es: Vali's deadbody was placed on the palanquin, decorated with many ornaments, garlands and clothes
data.anv: विविधैः with different, अलङ्कारैश्च with ornaments, माल्यैः with garlands, वस्त्रैश्च clothes, भूषितम्  adorned, गतजीवितम् dead, वालिनम् Vali, शिबिकाम् palanquin, आरोप्य on placing.
data.md: And placing the lifeless body of Vāli on it, he covered it with various ornaments, garlands, and clothes.

data.v: आज्ञापयत्तदा राजा सुग्रीवः प्लवगेश्वरः । और्ध्वदेहिकमार्यस्य क्रियतामनुरूपतः ।।
data.es: King Sugriva, lord of the monkeys, said, 'Let the funeral rites of my noble sire be performed in a fitting manner'.
data.anv: तदा then, राजा the king, प्लवगेश्वरः king of monkeys, सुग्रीव Sugriva, आज्ञापयत् instructed,  अनुरूपतः in a fitting manner, और्ध्वदैहिक funeral rites, आर्यस्य for the noble sire, क्रियतां may be conducted
data.md: Thereat Sugrīva, the king of monkeys, ordered for the performance of Vāli's funeral rites.

data.v: विश्राणयन्तो रत्नानि विविधानि बहूनि च । अग्रतः प्लवगा यान्तु शिबिका तदनन्तरम् ।।
data.es: 'Let the monkeys march in front, showering many different gems in large quantities and let the palanquin follow.
data.anv: प्लवगाः monkeys, विविधानि different, बहूनि many, रत्नानि gems, विश्राणयन्तः showering, अग्रतः   in front, यान्तु let them go, शिबिका palanquin, समनन्तरम् be followed.
data.md: Let the monkeys go before, scattering many a precious jewel and let the conveyance follow them.

data.v: राज्ञामृद्धिविशेषा हि दृश्यन्ते भुवि यादृशाः । तादृशं वालिनः क्षिप्रं प्राकुर्वन्नौर्ध्वदेहिकम् ।।
data.es: 'Let the monkeys perform the funeral rites of our lord in an honourable way as expensively as has been done with regard to the obsequies of kings who ruled over this land.
