data.es: 'To remove your fear and to please you, the great hero Rama has killed Vali, an equal to Indra in valour.
data.anv: वीरेण by the distinguished hero, राघवेण by Rama, भयम् fear, दूरतः driving away, उत्सृज्य putting aside, त्वत्प्रियार्थम् for your happiness, शक्रतुल्यपराक्रमः valour equal to that of Indra, वाली Vali, हतः killed.

data.v: सर्वथा प्रणयात्क्रुद्धो राघवो नात्र संशयः । भ्रातरं स प्रहितवाँल्लक्ष्मणं लक्ष्मिवर्धनम् ।।
data.es: 'Rama's anger is purely out of love for you. He has sent Lakshmana, a bestower of prosperity to you. There is no doubt about it.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, सर्वथा ever, प्रणयात् due to love, क्रुद्धः enraged, अत्र here, संशयः doubt, न no, भ्रातरम् his brother, लक्ष्मिवर्धनम् a bestower of prosperity, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, (सं) प्रहितवान्  sent.
data.md: To encompass your well-being, Vali, powerful as the Lord of celestials, was fearlessly destroyed by the heroic Rāghava. There is not the least doubt, that Rāghava, out of love, is enraged with you, and has despatched his younger brother Lakşmaņa, the enhancer of prosperity.

data.v: त्वं प्रमत्तो न जानीषे कालं कलविदां वर । फुल्लसप्तच्छदश्यामा प्रवृत्ता तु शरच्छिवा ।।
data.es: 'You knows best the passage of time (changing seasons). But you are not aware out of inattention that the auspicious autumn has set in, making the garden lush green with blossoms of Saptachada flowers.
data.anv: कालविदाम् among the knowers of time, वर best, त्वम् you are, प्रमत्तः not alert, कालम् time, न जानीषे you are not aware, फुल्लसप्तच्छदश्यामा a lush green season with blossoming saptachada flowers, शिवा (शुभा) auspicious, शरत् autumn, प्रवृत्ता has set in.
data.md: O you foremost of those conversant with time, the auspicious autumn, green with Saptchada flowers, has set in and you, given up to enjoyments, does not perceive it.

data.v: निर्मल ग्रहनक्षत्रा द्यौः प्रनष्टबलाहका । प्रसन्नाश्च दिशः सर्वाः सरितश्च सरांसि च ।।
data.es: 'The sky from which the dark clouds have completely disappeared is illumined with planets and stars. The rivers and tanks as well as all directions are pleasant.
data.anv: प्रनष्टवलाहका with disappearance of clouds, द्यौः sky, निर्मलग्रहनक्षत्रा with clear appearance of planets and constellations, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, सरितश्च rivers, सरांसि च and tanks, प्रसन्नाः pleasant.
data.md: The sky, having the clouds removed, is full of clear stars and planets. The quarters, the ponds and rivers are all clear.

data.v: प्राप्तमुद्योगकालं तु नावैषि हरिपुंगव । त्वं प्रमत्त इति व्यक्तं लक्ष्मणोऽयमिहागतः ।।
data.es: 'O chief of monkeys it is time for military expeditions. Since you are intoxicated you are not aware of this, Lakshmana has come here evidently for this.
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गव chief of monkeys, प्राप्तम् having set in, उद्योगकालम् time for making millitary endeavour, नावैषि not aware, त्वम् you, प्रमत्तः इति inattentive, अयं लक्ष्मणः this Lakshmana, इह here, आगतः has come, व्यक्तम् it is evident.
data.md: O best of monkeys, finding you forgetful, Lakṣmaṇa has come here to inform you that the proper time has arrived.

data.v: आर्तस्य हृतदारस्य परुषं पुरुषान्तरात् । वचनं मर्षणीयं ते राघवस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'The message sent by a man who is in distress, and is deprived of his wife should be accepted even if they are harsh since he is a great self (who has rendered you help).
data.anv: आर्तस्य of a man in distress, हृतदारस्य of a man who is deprived of his wife, महात्मनः of a great self, राघवस्य Rama's, पुरुषान्तरात् from another man, परुषम् harsh, वचनम् words, ते for you, मर्षणीयम् should be tolerated.
data.md: Do you patiently hear all these harsh words of the high-souled Rāma, racked with sorrow and separated from his spouse, which Laksmana, shall relate to you.

data.v: कृतापराधस्य हि ते नान्यत्पश्याम्यहं क्षमम् । अन्तरेणाञ्जलिं बद्ध्वा लक्ष्मणस्य प्रसादनात् ।।
data.es: 'In these circumstances the best way is seeking apology from Lakshmana with folded hands. I do not see any way other than this.
data.anv: अञ्जलिम् folded hands, बद्ध्वा by holding, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, प्रसादनात् अन्तरेण make him to excuse, क्षमम् to excuse, अन्यत् other than this, कृतापराधस्य for one who has missed his duty, ते you, अहम् I, न पश्यामि I do not see.
data.md: You have acted improperly towards him, and I do not find any thing tending to your welfare but your satisfying Lakşmana with folded hands.

data.v: नियुक्तैर्मन्त्रिभिर्वाच्यो अवश्यं पार्थिवो हितम् । अत एव भयं त्यक्त्वा ब्रवीम्यवधृतं वचः ।।
data.es: 'The counsellors and ministers appointed by a king should certainly give good advice, without fear. This I tell you since I have faith in my words.
data.anv: नियुक्तै: appointed, मन्त्रिभिः by ministers, पार्थिवः king, अवश्यम् certainly, हितम् good, वाच्यः should advise, अतः एव therefore, भयम् fear, त्यक्त्वा giving up, अवधृतम् what I felt decidedly, वचः ब्रवीमि I am telling these words.
data.md: The kings should be addressed with auspicious words by their counsellors always ministering to them proper counsels. And it is for this reason, I am addressing you with these sound words.

data.v: अभिक्रुद्धः समर्थो हि चापमुद्यम्य राघवः । सदेवासुरगन्धर्वं वशे स्थापयितुं जगत् ।।
data.anv: अभिक्रुद्धः if angry, राघवः Rama, चापम् bow, उद्यम्य by lifting, सदेवासुरगन्धर्वम् including gods, demons and ghandarvas, जगत् world, वशे under control, स्थापयितुम् to keep, समर्थो हि able.
data.md: Rāghava, taking up his bow, while enraged, can bring under subjection the entire world, inhabited by by the celestials, Asuras and Gandharvas.

data.v: न स क्षमः कोपयितुं यः प्रसाद्य पुनर्भवेत् । पूर्वोपकारं स्मरता कृतज्ञेन विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'He who deserves propitiation, should not be offended, more so by a grateful man, remembering the help received by him earlier.
data.anv: पूर्वोपकारम् having received help earlier, स्मरता remembering, विशेषतः more so, कृतज्ञेन by a grateful man, यः whoever, पुनः again, प्रसाद्यः deserves to be propitiated, सः he, कोपयितुम् to show anger, न क्षमः not proper.
data.md: Remembering his former service, it does not behove you, grateful as you are, to excite his wrath, who should be pleased again.

data.v: तस्य मूर्ध्ना प्रणम्य त्वं सपुत्रः ससुहृज्जनः । राजंस्तिष्ठ स्वसमये भर्तुर्भार्येव तद्वशे ।।
data.es: 'O great king Go at once with your son and relations, salute him now and avert his anger'.
data.anv: महाराज O great king, त्वम् you, सपुत्रः with your son, सहबान्धवः with your relations, शीघ्रम् quickly, गच्छ go, मूर्ध्ना face, तस्य his, प्रणम्य after saluting, अद्य now, रोषः anger, निवर्त्यताम् may be averted.
data.md: Bowing to him, with your children and friends, do you, O king, satisfying your promise, seek his shelter like to a wife placing herself under the control of her husband.

data.v: न रामरामानुजशासनं त्वया; कपीन्द्रयुक्तं मनसाप्यपोहितुम् । मनो हि ते ज्ञास्यति मानुषं बलं; सराघवस्यास्य सुरेन्द्रवर्चसः ।।
data.es: 'O king of monkeys It is not right for you to overlook the commands of Rama or Lakshmana even in mind. You know the superhuman virtues of Rama, particularly his valour. The two brothers are like Indra (and Upendra) in valour and might.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: कपीन्द्र O king of monkeys, रामरामानुजशासनम् Rama's word or Lakshmana's command, त्वया by you, मनसापि even in heart, अपोहितुम् to overlook, न युक्तम् not proper, अस्य his, सराघवस्य along with Rama, सुरेन्द्रवर्चसः countenace having the lustre of Indra, मानुषम् human, बलम् strength, ते मनः your mind, ज्ञास्यति हि  knows.
data.md: O lord of monkeys, it does not behove you, to neglect even in thought, the behests of Rāma and his younger brother; for you are fully aware of the prowess of Rāghava like to the lord of celestials, and passing human power.

data.v: अथ प्रतिसमादिष्टो लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा । प्रविवेश गुहां घोरां किष्किन्धां रामशासनात् ।।
data.es: Instructed by Rama, and having been permitted, Lakshmana, the slayer of enemies entered the frightful cave of Kishkinda.
data.anv: अथ and then, प्रतिसमादिष्टः having been called in, परवीरहा slayer of enemies, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, रामशासनात् as per Rama's command, घोराम् frightful in appearance, गुहाम् cave, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: Thereupon, Laksmana, the slayer of foes, commanded, entered, at the behest of Rāma, the pleasant city of Kişkindhā situated in the centre of caves.

data.v: द्वारस्था हरयस्तत्र महाकाया महाबलाः । बभूवुर्लक्ष्मणं दृष्ट्वा सर्वे प्राञ्जलयः स्थिताः ।।
data.es: Seeing Lakshmana, the huge and mighty monkey gatekeepers stood at the entrance and greeted him with folded hands.
data.anv: तत्र there, द्वारस्थाः  gatekeepers, महाकायाः of huge body, महाबलाः mighty, हरयः monkeys, सर्वे all, लक्ष्मणम् at Lakshmana, दृष्ट्वा seeing, प्राञ्जलयः greeted with folded palms, स्थिताः stood, बभूवुः became.
data.md: Beholding Lakşınaņa, the highly powerful monkeys, having huge persons and waiting at the gate, stood all with folded hands.

data.v: निःश्वसन्तं तु तं दृष्ट्वा क्रुद्धं दशरथात्मजम् । बभूवुर्हरयस्त्रस्ता न चैनं पर्यवारयन् ।।
data.es: The monkeys kept away out of fear to see the son of Dasaratha, who was angry and sighing deeply.
data.anv: हरयः monkeys, निश्श्वसन्तम् sighing deeply, क्रुद्धम् angry, दशरथात्मजम् son of Dasaratha, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, त्रस्ताः feared, बभूवुः became, एनम् him, पर्यवारयन् not surround him.
data.md: And seeing Dasaratha's son highly enraged and sighing again and again, the monkeys stood silent and did not interrupt him.

data.v: स तं रत्नमयीं श्रीमान्दिव्यां पुष्पितकाननाम् । रम्यां रत्नसमाकीर्णां ददर्श महतीं गुहाम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, the bestower of fortune, saw the mammoth cave inlaid with gems and precious stones and forests full of delightful flowers.
data.anv: श्रीमान् a bestower of fortune, सः he, रत्नमयीम् inlaid with gems, दिव्याम् wonderful, पुष्पितकाननाम् with forest full of flowers, रम्याम् delighting, रत्नसमाकीर्णाम् full of precious stones and gems, ताम् such, महतीम् mammoth, गुहाम् cave, ददर्श saw.

data.v: हर्म्यप्रासादसंबाधां नानापण्योपशोभिताम् । सर्वकामफलैर्वृक्षैः पुष्पितैरुपशोभिताम् ।।
data.es: The palace was thronged with elevated mansions and illumined with jewels of all kinds. The trees were in bloom and the fruits satisfied every one's wish.It was splendid.
data.anv: हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधाम् thronged with elevated mansions and palaces, नानापण्योपशोभिताम् illumined with jewels, सर्वकामफलैः which satisfied every one's wish, पुष्पितैः flowers in bloom, वृक्षैः by trees, उपशोभिताम् splendid.

data.v: देवगन्धर्वपुत्रैश्च वानरैः कामरूपिभिः । दिव्य माल्याम्बरधारैः शोभितां प्रियदर्शनैः ।।
data.es: The inhabitants of Kishkinda being sons of gods and gandharvas, were of beautiful appearance wearing wonderful garlands. They could change their form at their free will. They were delightful.
data.anv: देवगन्धर्वपुत्रैः sons born of gods and gandharvas, कामरूपिभिः by those who could change their form as they wished, दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरैः wearing beautiful garlands, प्रियदर्शनैः  pleasing in appearance, वानरैः by monkeys, उपशोभिताम् very delightful.

data.v: चन्दनागरुपद्मानां गन्धैः सुरभिगन्धिनाम् । मैरेयाणां मधूनां च संमोदितमहापथाम् ।।
data.es: The royal roads were filled with fragrant unguents, like sandal, agaru and lotus incenses, finesmelling honey of several kinds and happy inhabitants.
data.anv: सुरभिगन्धिनाम् of fragrant unguents, चन्दनागरुपद्मानाम् of sandal, agaru and lotus  incenses, मधूनाम् of various kinds of honey, गन्धैः of fine smell, सम्मोदितमहापथाम् royal roads filled with happy people.
data.md: It was fragrant with the sweet smell of sandal wood, Aguru and lotuses and its highway were equally fragrant with the smell of honey.

data.v: विन्ध्यमेरुगिरिप्रस्थैः प्रासादैर्नैकभूमिभिः । ददर्श गिरिनद्यश्च विमलास्तत्र राघवः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana saw tall buildings comparable to Vindhya and Meru mountains and pure water flowing from the mountain streams.
data.anv: राघवः Lakshmana, तत्र there, नैकभूमिभि: tall buildings, विन्ध्यमेरूगिरिप्रख्यै: like the Vindhya and Meru mountains, प्रासादै: buildings, विमलाः pure, गिरिनद्यश्च mountain streams, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And Lakşmaņa beheld there many spacious buildings like to the hills Vindhya and Meru and rivers of clear water.

data.v: अङ्गदस्य गृहं रम्यं मैन्दस्य द्विविदस्य च । गवयस्य गवाक्षस्य गजस्य शरभस्य च ।।
विद्युन्मालेश्च संपातेः सूर्याक्षस्य हनूमतः । वीरबाहोः सुबाहोश्च नलस्य च महात्मनः ।।
कुमुदस्य सुषेणस्य तारजाम्बवतोस्तथा । दधिवक्त्रस्य नीलस्य सुपाटलसुनेत्रयोः ।।
एतेषां कपिमुख्यानां राजमार्गे महात्मनाम् । ददर्श गृहमुख्यानि महासाराणि लक्ष्मणः ।।
पाण्डुराभ्रप्रकाशानि दिव्यमाल्ययुतानि च । प्रभूतधनधान्यानि स्त्रीरत्नैः शोभितानि च ।।
data.es: These homes were shining like white clouds, with wonderful garlands hung on, filled with abundance of wealth, grains and best of females.
data.anv: पाण्डुराभ्रप्रकाशानि shining like white clouds, दिव्यमाल्ययुतानि च with wonderful garlands hanging, प्रभूतधनधान्यानि filled with abundant wealth and grain, स्त्रीरत्नैः with best of women, शोभितानि च shining bright.

data.v: पाण्डुरेण तु शैलेन परिक्षिप्तं दुरासदम् । वानरेन्द्रगृहं रम्यं महेन्द्रसदनोपमम् ।।
शुल्कैः प्रासादशिखरैः कैलासशिखरोपमैः । सर्वकामफलैर्वृक्षैः पुष्टितैरुपशोभितम् ।।
data.es: The palace was thronged with elevated mansions and illumined with jewels of all kinds. The trees were in bloom and the fruits satisfied every one's wish.It was splendid.
data.anv: हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधाम् thronged with elevated mansions and palaces, नानापण्योपशोभिताम् illumined with jewels, सर्वकामफलैः which satisfied every one's wish, पुष्पितैः flowers in bloom, वृक्षैः by trees, उपशोभिताम् splendid.

data.v: महेन्द्रदत्तैः श्रीमद्भिर्नीलजीमूतसंनिभैः । दिव्यपुष्पफलैर्वृक्षैः शीतच्छायैर्मनोरमैः ।।
हरिभिः संवृतद्वारं बलिभिः शस्त्रपाणिभिः । दिव्यमाल्यावृतं शुभ्रं तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणम् ।।
सुग्रीवस्य गृहं रम्यं प्रविवेश महाबलः । अवार्यमाणः सौमित्रिर्महाभ्रमिव भास्करः ।।
स सप्त कक्ष्या धर्मात्मा यानासनसमावृताः । प्रविश्य सुमहद्गुप्तं ददर्शान्तःपुरं महत् ।।
data.es: Righteous Lakshmana crossed the seven enclosures filled with different kinds of people and saw a great harem full of several bright gold and silver cots, excellent seats here and there with best of cushions spread.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous man, सः Lakshmana, नानाजनसमाकुला: with all kinds of people assembled, सप्त seven, कक्ष्याः enclosures, प्रविश्य having entered through, सुमहत् huge, गुप्तम् protected, महत् great, हैमराजतपर्यङ्कै: with cots made of bright gold and silver, महार्हास्तरणोपेतैः with best of cushions, बहुभि: with costly, वरासनैश्च best of seats, तत्र तत्र here and there, समावृतम् covered, अन्तःपुरम्  harem, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And that virtuous-souled one, crossing the seven rooms filled with conveyances and seats beheld the secret apartment (of that monkeychief), having many a gold and silver bed-steads with excellent coverlets and fine seats.

data.v: हैमराजतपर्यङ्कैर्बहुभिश्च वरासनैः । महार्हास्तरणोपेतैस्तत्र तत्रोपशोभितम् ।।
data.es: Righteous Lakshmana crossed the seven enclosures filled with different kinds of people and saw a great harem full of several bright gold and silver cots, excellent seats here and there with best of cushions spread.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous man, सः Lakshmana, नानाजनसमाकुला: with all kinds of people assembled, सप्त seven, कक्ष्याः enclosures, प्रविश्य having entered through, सुमहत् huge, गुप्तम् protected, महत् great, हैमराजतपर्यङ्कै: with cots made of bright gold and silver, महार्हास्तरणोपेतैः with best of cushions, बहुभि: with costly, वरासनैश्च best of seats, तत्र तत्र here and there, समावृतम् covered, अन्तःपुरम्  harem, ददर्श saw.

data.v: प्रविशन्नेव सततं शुश्राव मधुरस्वरम् । तन्त्रीगीतसमाकीर्णं समगीतपदाक्षरम् ।।
data.es: As he entered, he heard melodious sounds of string instruments and music worded to metre with different kinds of tunes.
data.anv: प्रविशन्नेव as he entered, तन्त्रीगीतसमाकीर्णम् sounds of melodiously tuned string instruments, समगीतपदाक्षरम् with songs worded to metre in different kinds of tune, सततम् always, मधुरस्वरम् sweet voices, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: No sooner had he entered the inner apartment than he heard a musical sound, well-measured and accompanied by the music of the stringed instrument.

data.v: बह्वीश्च विविधाकारा रूपयौवनगर्विताः । स्त्रियः सुग्रीवभवने ददर्श स महाबलः ।।
data.es: Powerful Lakshmana saw many females of different forms proud of their youth and charm at the palace of Sugriva.
data.anv: महाबलः powerful man, सः he, सुग्रीवभवने in Sugriva's palace, विविधाकाराः of different forms, रूपयौवनगर्विताः proud of their youth and beauty, बह्वीः many, स्त्रियः women, ददर्श saw, च and.
data.md: And that highly powerful one beheld in the abode of Sugrīva many a beautiful damsel proud of their youth and beauty sprung from respectable families, adorned with splendid ornaments, engaged in stringing excellent garlands.

data.v: दृष्ट्वाभिजनसंपन्नाश्चित्रमाल्यकृतस्रजः । वरमाल्यकृतव्यग्रा भूषणोत्तमभूषिताः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana saw women with a good lineage adorned with colourful flower garlands and choicest ornaments engaged in making garlands and arranging fruits. He also saw at Sugriva's palace attendants, gentle, welldressed, contented and not too busy.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana,  अभिजनसम्पन्नाः  born of a good race, चित्रमाल्यकृतस्रजः decorated with colourful garlands, फलमाल्यकृतव्यग्राः engaged in making garlands and arranging fruits, भूषणोत्तमभूषिताः wearing choice ornaments, दृष्ट्वा seeing, नातृप्तान् not contented, नापि चा व्यग्रान् who were not busy, नानुदात्तपरिच्छदान् who were not gentle, सुग्रीवानुचरांश्चापि attendants of Sugriva, लक्षयामास he saw.

data.v: नातृप्तान्नाति च व्यग्रान्नानुदात्तपरिच्छदान् । सुग्रीवानुचरांश्चापि लक्षयामास लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana saw women with a good lineage adorned with colourful flower garlands and choicest ornaments engaged in making garlands and arranging fruits. He also saw at Sugriva's palace attendants, gentle, welldressed, contented and not too busy.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana,  अभिजनसम्पन्नाः  born of a good race, चित्रमाल्यकृतस्रजः decorated with colourful garlands, फलमाल्यकृतव्यग्राः engaged in making garlands and arranging fruits, भूषणोत्तमभूषिताः wearing choice ornaments, दृष्ट्वा seeing, नातृप्तान् not contented, नापि चा व्यग्रान् who were not busy, नानुदात्तपरिच्छदान् who were not gentle, सुग्रीवानुचरांश्चापि attendants of Sugriva, लक्षयामास he saw.
data.md: And he observed Sugrīva's servants, well fed, contented, not hurry in offering their services and without splendid ornaments.

data.v: ततः सुग्रीवमासीनं काञ्चने परमासने । महार्हास्तरणोपेते ददर्शादित्यसंनिभम् ।।
data.md: There seated on a superb seat spread with a costly carpet, he found Sugrīva resembling the sun himself, his person decked with noble ornaments, of a dignified presence, famous, wearing gay garlands and attire, invincible like to the great Indra.

data.v: दिव्याभरणचित्राङ्गं दिव्यरूपं यशस्विनम् । दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं महेन्द्रमिव दुर्जयम् । दिव्याभरणमाल्याभिः प्रमदाभिः समावृतम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana saw famous Sugriva, difficult to be conquered, seated on a golden throne strewn around with cushions, decorated with ornaments of different colours, endearing in appearance, decked with beautiful garlands and clothes. He was surrounded by women adorned with most fascinating ornaments and garlands. Bewildered at the sight, Lakshmana's eyes turned red in anger. He appeared like Yama, lord of death.
data.anv: ततः then, महार्हास्तरणोपेते strewn with fine cushions, काञ्चने on a golden, परमासने on a grand throne, आसीनम् seated, आदित्यसन्निभम् like the Sun god, दिव्याभरणचित्राङ्गम् decorated with excellent ornaments, दिव्यरूपम् heavenly in appearance, यशस्विनम् famous, दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरम् adorned with beautiful garlands, महेन्द्रमिव like the lord of gods, दुर्जयम् like one who is difficult to be conquered, दिव्याभरणमाल्याभिः adorned with excellent ornaments, garlands and clothes, प्रमदाभिः by women decked with, समावृतम् surrounded, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, ददर्श saw, संरब्धतररक्ताक्षः bewildered with eyes turned red, निभः resembling, बभूव appeared, अन्तकसन्निभः like Yama the god of death.

data.v: रुमां तु वीरः परिरभ्य गाढं; वरासनस्थो वरहेमवर्णः । ददर्श सौमित्रिमदीनसत्त्वं; विशालनेत्रः सुविशालनेत्रम् ।।
data.md: Then deeply embracing Umā, the large-eyed hero of the hue of fine gold, seated on an excellent seat, saw the powerful Saumitri having expansive eyes.

data.v: तमप्रतिहतं क्रुद्धं प्रविष्टं पुरुषर्षभम् । सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणं दृष्ट्वा बभूव व्यथितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: On seeing the angry Lakshmana, a bull among men, who could not be obstructed, enter in, Sugriva was disturbed.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अप्रतिहतम् who could not be obstructed, प्रविष्टम्  entered, क्रुद्धम् angry one, पुरुषर्षभम् a bull among men, तं him, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, व्यथितेन्द्रियः  senses depressed, बभूव became.
data.md: Seeing that foremost of men, Laksmana, exercised with wrath, as he entered in without let, Sugrīva was seized with sadness.

data.v: क्रुद्धं निःश्वसमानं तं प्रदीप्तमिव तेजसा । भ्रातुर्व्यसनसंतप्तं दृष्ट्वा दशरथात्मजम् ।।
data.es: Seeing enraged Lakshmana, son of Dasaratha, sighing heavily, glowing like bright fire burning with the sorrow of Rama, Sugriva jumped out of his seat quitting the decorated golden throne just as Indra's decorated banner is raised up suddenly.
data.anv: क्रुद्धम् enraged, निश्श्वसमानम्  sighing heavily, तेजसा lustrous, प्रदीप्तमिव as if glowing, भ्रातुः brother's, व्यसनसन्तप्तम् burning with sorrow, तम् him, दशरथात्मजम् son of Dasaratha, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, हरिश्रेष्ठ: best of vanaras, सौवर्णम् golden, आसनम् seat, हित्वा quitting, महेन्द्रस्य Mahendra's, ध्वजः  banner, स्वलङ्कृतः decorated, महान् great, इव like,  उत्पपात jumped up.
data.md: And seeing Dasaratha's son, wroth, and breathing hard, and flaming up in energy, and burning in consequence of the calamity that had overtaken his brother, that chief of monkeys started up, leaving his golden seat, like to the mighty ornamented standard of the great Indra.

data.v: उत्पपात हरिश्रेष्ठो हित्वा सौवर्णमासनम् । महान्महेन्द्रस्य यथा स्वलंकृत इव ध्वजः ।।
data.es: Seeing enraged Lakshmana, son of Dasaratha, sighing heavily, glowing like bright fire burning with the sorrow of Rama, Sugriva jumped out of his seat quitting the decorated golden throne just as Indra's decorated banner is raised up suddenly.
data.anv: क्रुद्धम् enraged, निश्श्वसमानम्  sighing heavily, तेजसा lustrous, प्रदीप्तमिव as if glowing, भ्रातुः brother's, व्यसनसन्तप्तम् burning with sorrow, तम् him, दशरथात्मजम् son of Dasaratha, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, हरिश्रेष्ठ: best of vanaras, सौवर्णम् golden, आसनम् seat, हित्वा quitting, महेन्द्रस्य Mahendra's, ध्वजः  banner, स्वलङ्कृतः decorated, महान् great, इव like,  उत्पपात jumped up.
data.md: And seeing Dasaratha's son, wroth, and breathing hard, and flaming up in energy, and burning in consequence of the calamity that had overtaken his brother, that chief of monkeys started up, leaving his golden seat, like to the mighty ornamented standard of the great Indra.

data.v: उत्पतन्तमनूत्पेतू रुमाप्रभृतयः स्त्रियः । सुग्रीवं गगने पूर्णं चन्द्रं तारागणा इव ।।
data.es: As soon as Sugriva jumped up ,Ruma and other womenfolk rose to their feet like the clusters of stars around the fullMoon in the sky.
data.anv: रुमाप्रभृतयः Ruma and others, स्त्रियः women, उत्पतन्तम्  jumped up, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, गगने in the sky, पूर्णम् full, चन्द्रम् Moon, तारागणा cluster of stars, इव like, अनूत्पेतु: jumped up.
data.md: And as Sugrīva rose up, Umā and the other females rose up, like to stars appearing in the sky when the full moon has risen.

data.v: संरक्तनयनः श्रीमान्विचचाल कृताञ्जलिः । बभूवावस्थितस्तत्र कल्पवृक्षो महानिव ।।
data.es: With eyes red as blood through drunkenness,prosperous Sugriva was shaken like the Kalpa tree.He stood there and offered salutations(to Lakshmana) with folded hands.
data.anv: संरक्तनयनः redeyed, श्रीमान् prosperous, कृताञ्जलिः offered salutations with folded palms, विचचाल was shaken, महान् great, कल्पवृक्षः इव like the Kalpa tree, तत्र there, अवस्थितः stood, बभूव became.
data.md: And with eyes reddened, and his hands folded, the graceful Sugrīva came (before Laks maņa) and stood there like a mighty Kalpa tree.

data.v: रुमा द्वितीयं सुग्रीवं नारीमध्यगतं स्थितम् । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणः क्रुद्धः सतारं शशिनं यथा ।।
data.es: Looking at Sugriva surrounded by Ruma and other women like the Moon among stars, infuriated Lakshmana said
data.anv: सतारम् surrounded by stars, शशिनं यथा like the Moon, रुमाद्वितीयम् along with Ruma, नारीमध्यगतम् surrounded by women, स्थितम् who stood, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, क्रुद्धः infuriated, लक्ष्मणः to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And the wrathful Lakşmaņa spoke to Sugrīva stationed among women, having Umā for his second, and resembling the moon with the stars, saying.

data.v: सत्त्वाभिजनसंपन्नः सानुक्रोशो जितेन्द्रियः । कृतज्ञः सत्यवादी च राजा लोके महीयते ।।
data.es: 'Only a king who is an heir to a noble family, compassionate, and selfcontrolled, grateful and truthful excels in the world.
data.anv: सत्त्वाभिजनसम्पन्नः heir of a noble clan, सानुक्रोशः compassionate, जितेन्द्रियः one who has controlled his senses, कृतज्ञः grateful person, सत्यवादी च one who is truthful, राजा king, लोके in the world, महीयते will excel.
data.md: The king that is nobly endowed by heredily, and is kind, that has subdued his senses, and is grateful and truth telling, obtains renown in this world.

data.v: यस्तु राजा स्थितोऽधर्मे मित्राणामुपकारिणाम् । मिथ्याप्रतिज्ञां कुरुते को नृशंसतरस्ततः ।।
data.es: 'Which king can be more malicious than the one who makes false promises and adopts an unrighteous path towards those who helped him?
data.anv: यः whoever, राजा a king, अधर्मे in unrighteous path, स्थितः adopts, उपकारिणाम् to his benefactors, मिथ्या false, प्रतिज्ञाम् promise, कुरुते makes, ततः then, नृशंसतरः more malicious, कः what
data.md: And who is more wicked than that king who, rooted in unrighteousness, makes false promises to friends intent upon his welfare?

data.v: शतमश्वानृते हन्ति सहस्रं तु गवानृते । आत्मानं स्वजनं हन्ति पुरुषः पुरुषानृते ।।
data.es: 'If a man tells a lie about a horse, he commits the sin of killing a hundred horses. If one tells a lie about a cow, he shares the sin of killing a thousand cows. If one tells a lie about a man, it is equal to the sin of killing oneself and his own people.
data.anv: पुरुषः  man, अश्वानृते tells a lie about a horse, शतम् hundred, हन्ति kills, गवानृते tells a lie about a cow, सहस्रम् thousand, पुरुषानृते a lie about a man, आत्मानम् himself, स्वजनम् his own people, हन्ति kills.
data.md: He that speaks a falsehood with reference to a horse, becomes guilty of the deaths of an hundred horses: he committing himself to a falsehood relative to a cow, reapeth the demerit of slaying a thousand kine; while he that uttereth an untruth touching a person, destroys self as well as his kindred.

data.v: पूर्वं कृतार्थो मित्राणां न तत्प्रतिकरोति यः । कृतघ्नः सर्वभूतानां स वध्यः प्लवगेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys he who, having accomplished his task first with the help of his friend, does not return the help is ungrateful. Such a person deserves to be killed.It applies to all beings.
data.anv: प्लगेश्वर O lord of monkeys, पूर्वम् first, कृतार्थः is fulfilled, यः whoever, मित्राणाम् to the friends, तत् that, प्रतिकरोति does not help in turn, कृतघ्नः an ungrateful one, सः he, सर्वभूतानाम् to all beings, वध्यः deserves to be killed.
data.md: That ungrateful might that having at first attained benefit at the hands of his friends, does not requite it, is, O lord of monkeys, worthy of being slain by all creatures.

data.v: गीतोऽयं ब्रह्मणा श्लोकः सर्वलोकनमस्कृतः । दृष्ट्वा कृतघ्नं क्रुद्धेन तं निबोध प्लवंगम ।।
data.es: 'O lord of the monkeys here is a verse worthy of appreciation by all the worlds, sung by a brahmin, when he saw an ungrateful person. Listen:
data.anv: प्लवङ्गम O lord of the monkeys, कृतघ्नम्  an ungrateful one, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, क्रुद्धेन by an outraged, ब्रह्मणा by a brahmin, सर्वलोकनमस्कृतः revered by all the worlds, अयम् this, श्लोकः verse, गीतः is sung, तत् that, निबोध listen.
data.md: Seeing an ingrate wretch, the wrathful Brahmā sang the (previous) śloka, bowed down to by all the worlds.

data.v: ब्रह्मघ्ने च सुरापे च चोरे भग्नव्रते तथा । निष्कृतिर्विहिता सद्भिः कृतघ्ने नास्ति निष्कृतिः ।।
data.es: 'There is expiation for one who kills a brahmin, a drunkard, a thief and a violator of sacred vows. But there is no atonement for an ungrateful man.'
data.anv: ब्रह्मघ्ने one who kills a brahmin, सुरापे च and a drunkard, चोरे by thieves, तथा similarly, भग्नव्रते one who violates sacred vows, सद्भि: pious men, निष्कृतिः expiation, विहिता is provided, कृतघ्ने for an ungrateful one, निष्कृतिः such an atonement, नास्ति not there.
data.md: Do you understand that, O monkey. The pious provide deliverance for the cow-killer, the winebiber, the thief, and the violator of vows; but for the ungrateful person there is no deliverance whatever.

data.v: अनार्यस्त्वं कृतघ्नश्च मिथ्यावादी च वानर । पूर्वं कृतार्थो रामस्य न तत्प्रतिकरोषि यत् ।।
data.es: 'O monkey you have already achieved your objective (with the help of Rama) but have not helped Rama in return. You are surely an ignoble and ungrateful liar.
data.anv: वानर O monkey, पूर्वम् in the past, कृतार्थः one whose object is achieved, त्वम् you, यत् since, रामस्य Rama's, न प्रतिकरोषि not helped in return, तत् that, अनार्यः ignoble one, कृतघ्नश्च ungrateful, मिथ्यावादी च one who is a liar, ननु you are surely.
data.md: You are ignoble and ungrateful and lying, O monkey, since, having been formerly benefited by Rāma, you did not requite his services.

data.v: ननु नाम कृतार्थेन त्वया रामस्य वानर । सीताया मार्गणे यत्नः कर्तव्यः कृतमिच्छता ।।
data.es: 'O monkey, if you are grateful to Rama you should wish to search for Sita. Indeed, you should make efforts to take it up.
data.anv: वानर monkey, कृतार्थेन by a grateful one, रामस्य Rama's, कृतम् task, इच्छता intending, त्वया by you, सीतायाः Sita's, मार्ग in search, यत्नः attempt, ननु नाम कर्तव्यः it should be taken up indeed.
data.md: Having been benefited by Rāma, you, anxious to repay his kindness, should exert yourself in search of Sita.

data.v: स त्वं ग्राम्येषु भोगेषु सक्तो मिथ्या प्रतिश्रवः । न त्वां रामो विजानीते सर्पं मण्डूकराविणम् ।।
data.es: 'You have failed to keep your word. You are engaged in worldly pleasures. Rama did not know that you are a serpent croaking like a frog.
data.anv: मिथ्याप्रतिश्रवः who has made false promises, सः he, त्वम् you, ग्राम्येषु भोगेषु worldy pleasures, सक्तः engaged in, रामः Rama, त्वाम् you, मण्डूकराविणम् croaking like a frog, सर्पम् serpent, न विजानीते did not identify.
data.md: But, of false promises, you had been indulging in gross enjoyments,-nor does Rāma know you for a serpent, croaking like a frog*. *Crying through the voice of the frog in its mouth. Another meaning is, croaking like a frog, to allure frog to it.

data.v: महाभागेन रामेण पापः करुणवेदिना । हरीणां प्रापितो राज्यं त्वं दुरात्मा महात्मना ।।
data.es: 'Rama is illustrious, compassionate and great. He has granted the kingdom to you, to one who is a sinner and an evilminded person.
data.anv: महाभागेन by the illustrious, महात्मना by the great self, करुणवेदिना by the compassionate, रामेण by Rama, पापः sinner, दुरात्मा evilminded, त्वम् you, हरीणाम् monkeys', राज्यम् kingdom, प्रापितः granted.
data.md: A sinful wretch and of wicked soul, you had obtained the kingdom of the monkeys through the agency of the eminently virtuous, kind and high-souled Rāma.

data.v: कृतं चेन्नाभिजानीषे रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । सद्यस्त्वं निशितैर्बाणैर्हतो द्रक्ष्यसि वालिनम् ।।
data.es: 'If you do not recognise the help of Rama who can accomplish any deed with ease, you will be killed with my sharp arrows and meet Vali (in heaven).
data.anv: त्वम् you, अक्लिष्टकर्मणः of a man who accomplishes a task with ease, रामस्य of Rama, कृतम् help, नाभिजानीषे यदि if you did not recognise, सद्यः presently, निशितैः by sharp ones, बाणैः with arrows, हतः kill, वालिनम् to Vali, द्रक्ष्यसे you may see.
data.md: You did not acknowledge the good offices rendered to you by the high-souled Rāghava; and therefore, slain by means of sharpened shafts, you shall soon see Vali.

data.v: न च संकुचितः पन्था येन वाली हतो गतः । समये तिष्ठ सुग्रीव मा वालिपथमन्वगाः ।।
data.es: 'The route by which Vali departed, killed by me has not been closed. O Sugriva you ought to abide by the pledge given. Do not follow the path of Vali.
data.anv: सुग्रीव Sugriva, समये as per pledge, तिष्ठ  abide, हतः killed, वाली Vali, येन by the root, गतः had gone, पन्थाः path, न च सङ्कुचितः is not a narrow one, वालिपथम् Vali's path, मा अन्वगाः you do not follow.
data.md: The way that has been wended by the slain Vali, is not yet narrowed. Do you, O Sugriva, desist in time: do not walk in the wake of Vāli.

data.v: न नूनमिक्ष्वाकुवरस्य कार्मुका;च्च्युताञ्शरान्पश्यसि वज्रसंनिभान् । ततः सुखं नाम निषेवसे सुखी; न रामकार्यं मनसाप्यवेक्षसे ।।
data.es: 'You have not seen the thunderboltlike arrows released from the bow of Rama, the renowned prince of the Ikshvaku race. Therefore you are resorting to enjoyment without any fear and have not given thought to Rama's work.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: नूनम् surely, इक्ष्वाकुवरस्य of the renowned among the Ikshvaku race, कार्मुक bow, वज्रसन्निभान् comparable to a thunderbolt, च्युतान् released, शरान् arrows, न पश्यसि you do not see, ततः then, सुखी without fear, सुखम् a happy, निषेवसे नाम you are resorting to, मनसापि even in your mind, रामकार्यम् Rama's work, न अवेक्षसे  not thinking.
data.md: Do not behold the shafts resembling thunderbolts shot from the bow of that best of the Ikş wakus. Then, attaining happiness, you shall pass your days in peace. Nor do you mentally neglect Rāma's business.

data.v: तथा ब्रुवाणं सौमित्रिं प्रदीप्तमिव तेजसा । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणं तारा ताराधिपनिभानना ।।
data.es: While Lakshmana, the son of Sumitra, was glowing like fire with his brilliance, thus spoke the moonfaced Tara:
data.anv: तथा that way, ब्रुवाणम् when he spoke, तेजसा with brilliance, प्रदीप्तमिव as if glowing, सौमित्रिम् to Saumitri, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, ताराधिपनिभानना a lady with a Moonlike face, तारा Tara, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: When Sumitra's son, Laksmana, had spoken thus, flaming in energy, Tārā of face fair as the moon, said to him,

data.v: नैवं लक्ष्मण वक्तव्यो नायं परुषमर्हति । हरीणामीश्वरः श्रोतुं तव वक्त्राद्विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana you, in particular, should not speak to the king of vanaras in that manner. He does not deserve to hear from your mouth words which are harsh.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अयम् this, हरीणामीश्वरः king of vanaras, एवम् in that way, न वक्तव्यः not speak, विशेषतः specially, तव your, वक्त्रात् your words, परुषम् harsh, श्रोतुम् to listen, नार्हति not deserve.
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, you ought not to speak thus: and this lord of monkeys does not deserve to hear this harsh speech from your lips, in especial.

data.v: नैवाकृतज्ञः सुग्रीवो न शठो नापि दारुणः । नैवानृतकथो वीर न जिह्मश्च कपीश्वरः ।।
data.es: 'O hero Sugriva, king of monkeys, is not ungrateful or deceitful, He is neither crooked nor false.
data.anv: वीर O hero, कपीश्वरः king of monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अकृतज्ञः ungrateful, न not, शठः deceitful, न not, अपि even, न not, अनृतकथः one who tells a lie, नैव nor, जिह्मः च and crooked, न not.
data.md: Sugrīva is not ungrateful, or cunning, or heartless; nor does he, O hero, deal in falsehood; nor is he deceitful.

data.v: उपकारं कृतं वीरो नाप्ययं विस्मृतः कपिः । रामेण वीर सुग्रीवो यदन्यैर्दुष्करं रणे ।।
data.es: 'O hero this warrior Sugriva has not forgotten the help rendered by Rama in combat which was difficult (to win).
data.anv: वीर hero, कपिः monkey, अयं सुग्रीवः this Sugriva, रणे in war, यत् such, अन्यै: by others, दुष्करम् difficult, रामेण by Rama, कृतम् has been done, उपकारम् help, न विस्मृतः अपि and not forget.
data.md: Nor has the heroic monkey, O hero, forgotten the good, incapable of being done by others in battle, that the hero; Rāma, has done in his behalf.

data.v: रामप्रसादात्कीर्तिं च कपिराज्यं च शाश्वतम् । प्राप्तवानिह सुग्रीवो रुमां मां च परंतप ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies it is by Rama's grace that Sugriva has attained fame, the kingdom of monkeys and Ruma and me.
data.anv: परन्तप O scorcher of enemies, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, इह now, रामप्रसादात् by Rama's grace, कीर्तिं च fame and, शाश्वतम् permanent, कपिराज्यं च kingdom of monkeys, रुमाम् Ruma, मां च and me, प्राप्तवान् attained.
data.md: O afflictor of foes, through Rāma's grace, Sugriva has here attained fame and the enduring empire of the monkeys, as well as Umā and myself.

data.v: सुदुःखं शायितः पूर्वं प्राप्येदं सुखमुत्तमम् । प्राप्तकालं न जानीते विश्वामित्रो यथा मुनिः ।।
data.es: 'Sleep did not come to him in deep distress in the past, and now that great happiness has come, he does not realize that it is time to act (search for Sita). He behaves like sage Viswamitra.
data.anv: पूर्वम् earlier, सुदुःखं शयितः sleeping unhappily, उत्तमम् best, इदम् this, सुखम् happiness, प्राप्य having obtained, विश्वामित्रः Visvamitra, मुनिः यथा like the sage, प्राप्तकालम् time to attend to his duty, न जानीते I did not know.
data.md: Having lain down miserable before, Sugrīva, now that he has attained this supreme happiness, does not heed his urgent duties, like the ascetic Visvamitra.

data.v: घृताच्यां किल संसक्तो दशवर्षाणि लक्ष्मण । अहोऽमन्यत धर्मात्मा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana great sage Visvamitra was in union with an apsara Gritachi for ten years and felt it was just one day indeed
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, धर्मात्मा great self, महामुनिः great sage, विश्वामित्रः Visvamitra, दश ten, वर्षाणि years, घृताच्याम् with an apsara Gritachi, संसक्तः in union, अह one day, अमन्यत thought, किल indeed.
data.md: Attached to Ghrtāci, O Laksmana, the pious and mighty ascetic, Viśvāmitra looked upon ten years as one day; and that best of those conversant with time, Viśvāmitra of mighty energy, did not perceive that the time (for doing a certain act) had arrived. What is to be said of other people?

data.v: स हि प्राप्तं न जानीते कालं कालविदां वरः । विश्वामित्रो महातेजाः किं पुनर्यः पृथग्जनः ।।
data.es: 'If the brilliant and the most distinguished of those who knew the value of time did not realise the passing of time, what can be said of an ordinary person?
data.anv: कालविदाम् वरः a distinguished person among those who know the value of time, महातेजाः brilliant, सः that, विश्वामित्रः Visvamitra, प्राप्त कालम् right time, न जानीते did not know, यः he who, पृथग्जनः ordinary man, किं पुनः what else.

data.v: देहधर्मं गतस्यास्य परिश्रान्तस्य लक्ष्मण । अवितृप्तस्य कामेषु रामः क्षन्तुमिहार्हति ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana you should pardon him since he is not yet satisfied, though tired, with the struggle for the fulfilment of his sensual pleasures.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, देहधर्मं गतस्य  attending to physical needs, परिश्रान्तस्य tired person, कामेषु in lust, अवितृप्तस्य finding no satisfaction, अस्य his, कामम् love, इह now, क्षन्तुम् to pardon, अर्हसि should.
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, it behoveth Rāma to forgive one who has all the bodily exigencies, who is fatigued, and who is not satisfied with the pleasures of Kama. Nor, O Laksmana, does it behove you, without ascertaining the exact import of things, to become suddenly subject to wrath, like any inferior person.

data.v: न च रोषवशं तात गन्तुमर्हसि लक्ष्मण । निश्चयार्थमविज्ञाय सहसा प्राकृतो यथा ।।
data.es: 'O dear Lakshmana not knowing the true intention of Sugriva, it is not proper for you to be rashly angry like an ordinary man.
data.anv: तात O dear, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, निश्चयार्थम् true meaning, अविज्ञाय not knowing, प्राकृतो यथा like an ordinary man, सहसा rashly, रोषवशम् being angry, गन्तुम् to be, न अर्हसि is not proper.
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, it behoveth Rāma to forgive one who has all the bodily exigencies, who is fatigued, and who is not satisfied with the pleasures of Kama. Nor, O Laksmana, does it behove you, without ascertaining the exact import of things, to become suddenly subject to wrath, like any inferior person.

data.v: सत्त्वयुक्ता हि पुरुषास्त्वद्विधाः पुरुषर्षभ । अविमृश्य न रोषस्य सहसा यान्ति वश्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'O bull among men men with right vision like you do not become angry instantly without right thinking.
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभ O bull among men, सत्त्वयुक्ताः people with right vision, त्वद्विधाः people like you, पुरुषाः men, अविमृश्य not thinking rightly, सहसा rashly, रोषस्य of anger, वश्यताम् to become, न यान्ति do not get.
data.md: O chief of men, persons endowed with the quality of goodness, like to you, do not suffer themselves to come under the sway of passion, without (at first) heedfully revolving matters.

data.v: प्रसादये त्वां धर्मज्ञ सुग्रीवार्थे समाहिता । महान्रोषसमुत्पन्नः संरम्भस्त्यज्यतामयम् ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana, knower of dharma, give up your agitation arising out of great anger. Be composed for the sake of Sugriva.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञ knower of righteousness, समाहिता a wellcomposed woman, सुग्रीवार्थे for the sake of Sugriva, त्वाम् you, प्रसादये I appease you, रोषसमुत्पन्नः arising out of this anger, महान् great, अयम् this, संरम्भः agitation, त्यज्यताम् give up.
data.md: I crave your favour with concentrated mind, O you that know morality. Renounce the mighty grief that springs from your ire.

data.v: रुमां मां कपिराज्यं च धनधान्यवसूनि च । रामप्रियार्थं सुग्रीवस्त्यजेदिति मतिर्मम ।।
data.es: 'I feel Sugriva should (is prepared to) renounce the monkeykingdom, wealth, grains and other treasures and even Ruma and me for the pleasure of Rama.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रामप्रियार्थम् for Rama's pleasure, रुमाम् Ruma, मां me, कपिराज्यम् monkey kingdom, धनधान्यवसूनि च wealth, grain and other treasures, त्यजेत् will renounce, इति this is, मम my, मतिः feeling in mind.
data.md: This is my conviction that for compassing Rāma's welfare, Sugrīva can resign Umã and myself, and Angada, and the kingdom and wealth and corn and animals.

data.v: समानेष्व्यति सुग्रीवः सीतया सह राघवम् । शशाङ्कमिव रोहिष्या निहत्वा रावणं रणे ।।
data.es: 'Killing Ravana in war, Sugriva will restore Sita soon to Rama.Rama will join Sita like Moon joins Rohini.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रणे in war, हत्वा having killed, रावणं Ravana, शशाङ्कम् the Moon, रोहिण्या इव like with Rohini, राघवम् Rama, सीतया सह with Sita, समानेष्यति will make them meet.
data.md: Slaying that worst of Rākṣasas, Sugrīva will bring Rāghava with Sītā, like to the moon accompanied by Rohiņi.

data.v: शतकोटिसहस्राणि लङ्कायां किल रक्षसाम् । अयुतानि च षट्त्रिंशत्सहस्राणि शतानि च ।।
data.es: 'The number of demons in Lanka is reported to be a hundred thousand crore, three lakh, ninetynine thousand and six hundred. (Note: Indian tradition has numbers up to eighteen digits. One hundred thousand crores is equal to a 'mahapadma' which has thirteen digits. The number described here is 1000000399600.)
data.anv: लङ्कायाम् at Lanka, राक्षसाः demons, शतकोटिसहस्राणि a hundred thousand crores,   षट्त्रिंशत् thirtysix times, आयुतानि च ten thousandmyriads, सहस्राणि thousands, शतानि च  and hundreds.
data.md: Without slaying hundreds of thousands of Kotis, and thirty-six Ayutas, thousands and hundreds of irrepressible Rākṣasas wearing shapes at will, (Rāma) can not slay Rāvana, by whom Maithili has been carried away.

data.v: अहत्वा तांश्च दुर्धर्षान्राक्षसान्कामरूपिणः । न शक्यो रावणो हन्तुं येन सा मैथिली हृता ।।
data.es: 'It is not possible to kill Ravana who has stolen Sita without killing those unassailable demons who can assume any form at their will.
data.anv: दुर्धर्षान् unassailable, कामरूपिणः who can assume any form at will, तान् them, राक्षसान् demons, अहत्वा without killing, येन by whomsoever, सा she, मैथिली Maithili, हृता stolen, रावण: Ravana, हन्तुम् to kill, न शक्यः not possible.
data.md: Without slaying hundreds of thousands of Kotis, and thirty-six Ayutas, thousands and hundreds of irrepressible Rākṣasas wearing shapes at will, (Rāma) can not slay Rāvana, by whom Maithili has been carried away.

data.v: ते न शक्या रणे हन्तुमसहायेन लक्ष्मण । रावणः क्रूरकर्मा च सुग्रीवेण विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana moreover it is not possible for Sugriva alone to kill the wicked Ravana without the help of the monkeys.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, ते those, क्रूरकर्मा evildoer, रावणः Ravana, असहायेन without any help, रणे in war, हन्तुम् to kill, न शक्याः not possible, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, विशेषतः specially.
data.md: They are incapable, O Laksmana, of being slain (by Rāma) in battle, unless he is supported (by others).

data.v: एवमाख्यातवान्वाली स ह्यभिज्ञो हरीश्वरः । आगमस्तु न मे व्यक्तः श्रवात्तस्य ब्रवीम्यहम् ।।
data.es: Vali, the wellinformed lord of the monkeys, has given an account of the demons. The source of the account is not known to me.Therefore I am speaking from what I have heard.
data.anv: वाली Vali, एवम् in that way, आख्यातवान् gave an account, सः that, हरीश्वरः lord of monkeys, अभिज्ञः हि a well informed person, आगमः source, मे to myself, न व्यक्तः not known, तस्मात् therefore, श्रवात् from what is heard, अहम् I, ब्रवीमि I am speaking.
data.md: Rāvana is a wily warrior, and hence is the special need of Sugrīva. That knowing lord of monkeys, Väli, had told me all this. I do not know how Rāvana had secured this host: I say what I had heard from Vāli.

data.v: त्वत्सहायनिमित्तं वै प्रेषिता हरिपुंगवाः । आनेतुं वानरान्युद्धे सुबहून्हरियूथपान् ।।
data.es: 'Monkey chiefs have been sent to bring multitudes of monkey leaders to help you in the battle.
data.anv: तत् then, युद्धे in war, त्वत् सहायनिमित्तम् for helping you, हरियूधपान् troops of monkeys, सुबहून् in multitudes, वानरान् monkeys, आनेतुम् to bring, हरिपुङ्गवाः leaders of monkeys, प्रेषिताः sent.
data.md: For rendering you assistance, the foremost monkeys have been despatched in order to summon to the conflict numerous principal monkeys.

data.v: तांश्च प्रतीक्षमाणोऽयं विक्रान्तान्सुमहाबलान् । राघवस्यार्थसिद्ध्यर्थं न निर्याति हरीश्वरः ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva is awaiting the arrival of the powerful and strong vanaras without whose help he cannot accomplish Rama's task.Therefore he has not yet started (the search).
data.anv: विक्रान्तां powerful, अयम् this, हरीश्वरः Sugriva, महाबलान् strong, तान् them, राघवस्य for Rama's, अर्थसिध्यर्थम् to accomplish his task, प्रतीक्षमाणः awaiting, न निर्याति not yet started.
data.md: Expecting these powerful and exceedingly strong ones, for attaining Rāghava's end, this lord of monkeys does not (yet) sally out.

data.v: कृता तु संस्था सौमित्रे सुग्रीवेण यथापुरा । अद्य तैर्वानरैर्सर्वैरागन्तव्यं महाबलैः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana since Sugriva has already promulgated an ordinance to all the mighty vanaras, they should be all arriving by now.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Suamitri, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, पुरा earlier, संस्था promulgated an ordinance, यथा like that, कृता is ordered by, महाबलैः mighty, सर्वैः by all, तैः them, वानरैः by vanaras, अद्य now, आगन्तव्यम् should be reaching.
data.md: Things, O Saumitri, have beforehand been so satisfactorily arranged by Sugrīva, that this very day the mighty one will be joined with all those monkeys.

data.v: ऋक्षकोटिसहस्राणि गोलाङ्गूलशतानि च । अद्य त्वामुपयास्यन्ति जहि कोपमरिंदम । कोट्योऽनेकास्तु काकुत्स्थ कपीनां दीप्ततेजसाम् ।।
data.anv: अरिन्दम subduer of enemies, काकुत्स्थ Lakshmana, अद्य now, ऋक्षकोटिसहस्राणि thousands of crores of bears, गोलाङ्गूलशतानि hundreds of golangulas (monkeys with long tails like those of cows), दीप्ततेजसाम्  of fiery spirit, कपीनाम् of monkeys, अनेकाः many, कोट्यः crores, त्वाम् your, उपयास्यन्ति will attend on you, कोपम् anger, जहि give up.
data.md: This very day billions of bears and thousands of golangulas as well as innumerable Koțis of monkeys flaming in energy shall join you. Therefore, O subduer of enemies, banish your anger.

data.v: तव हि मुखमिदं निरीक्ष्य कोपा;त्क्षतजनिभे नयने निरीक्षमाणाः । हरिवरवनिता न यान्ति शान्तिं; प्रथमभयस्य हि शङ्किताः स्म सर्वाः ।।
data.es: 'Looking at your angry countenance with bloodred eyes, the wives of the foremost of monkeys are frightened by the possibility of similar danger of the past (of Vali's death) and do not find peace of mind.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: हरिवरवनिताः wives of foremost of monkeys, तव your, इदम् this, मुखम् face, निरीक्ष्य on seeing, कोपात् from anger, क्षतजनिभे resembling blood, नयने eyes, निरीक्षमाणाः looking at the eyes, शान्तिम् peace, न यान्ति not able to, सर्वाः all, प्रथमभयस्य of the earlier fear, शङ्कितास्तु suspecting.
data.md: Seeing this your face wrought up with wrath, and your eyes appearing like red sores, the wives of the best of monkeys experience no peace, and they are agitated by the fear that exercised them of late.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्तारया वाक्यं प्रश्रितं धर्मसंहितम् । मृदुस्वभावः सौमित्रिः प्रतिजग्राह तद्वचः ।।
data.es: Thus the gentlenatured Saumitri accepted Tara's courteous words sanctioned by dharma.
data.anv: हनुमतः Hanuman's, प्रश्रितम् humble, धर्मसंहितम् consistent with righteousness, स्वामिसत्कारसंयुक्तम् full of devotion to his master, the king, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अङ्गदः Angada, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Humbly addressed in these words informed with morality, Sumitra's son, resuming his native mildness, accepted them.

data.v: तस्मिन्प्रतिगृहीते तु वाक्ये हरिगणेश्वरः । लक्ष्मणात्सुमहत्त्रासं वस्त्रं क्लिन्नमिवात्यजत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, king of the vanara clan, cast aside his great fear when Lakshmana accepted the words of Tara just as one discards a wet garment from the body.
data.anv: तस्मिन् when such, वाक्ये words, प्रतिगृहीते were accepted, हरिगणेश्वरः leader of the vanara clan, लक्ष्मणात् from Lakshmana, सुमहत् great, त्रासम् fear, क्लिन्नम् wet, वस्त्रमिव like a garment, अत्यजत् cast aside.
data.md: On his accepting the speech, the lord of monkeys like a wet cloth cast off from him the fear he had conceived on account of Lakşmaņa.

data.v: ततः कण्ठगतं माल्यं चित्रं बहुगुणं महत् । चिच्छेद विमदश्चासीत्सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Thereupon Sugriva, relieved from his drunken state tore off the great, colourful valuable garland worn on his neck.
data.anv: ततः then, वानरेश्वरः lord of vanaras, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, कण्ठगतम् worn on the neck, चित्रम् colourful, बहुगुणम् valuable, महत् great, माल्यम् garland, चिच्छेद tore off, विमदश्च relieved (from drunkenness), आसीत् got free.
data.md: Then Sugriva-lord of monkeys-tore away the gaudy and variegated garland on his neck-potent with many a virtue, and become deprived of energy.

data.v: स लक्ष्मणं भीमबलं सर्ववानरसत्तमः । अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सुग्रीवः संप्रहर्षयन् ।।
data.es: Seeing Sugriva had lost his senses, Lakshmana, the slayer of enemy warriors humbly said at the end of Rama's address:
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, वचनान्ते at the end of his address, परवीरहा slayer of enemy warriors, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, गतचेतसम् he who had lost his senses, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, प्रश्रितम् humbly, वाक्यम् these words, अवदत् said.
data.md: And that master of all the monkeys, Sugrīva, gladdening Lakşmaņa of dreadful prowess, humbly observed to him,

data.v: प्रनष्टा श्रीश्च कीर्तिश्च कपिराज्यं च शाश्वतम् । रामप्रसादात्सौमित्रे पुनः प्राप्तमिदं मया ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri my prosperity, fame and the permanent sovereignty of vanaras had been lost. It was regained by the grace of Rama.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, प्रणष्टा lost from me, श्री:च prosperity also, कीर्ति: च and fame, शाश्वतम् permanent, कपिराज्यं च and the kingdom of monkeys, इदम् this, रामप्रसादात् by the grace of Rama, मया by me, पुनः again, प्राप्तम् has been regained.
data.md: You son to Sumitrā, by the favour of Rāma have I received back my lost luck, my fame, and this eternal monarchy of the monkeys.

data.v: कः शक्तस्तस्य देवस्य ख्यातस्य स्वेन कर्मणा । तादृशं विक्रमं वीर प्रतिकर्तुमरिंदम ।।
data.es: 'O crusher of enemies how is it possible to repay the famous lord Rama's valour (in killing Vali)?
data.anv: अरिन्दम crusher of enemies, स्वेन his own, कर्मणा by deeds, ख्यातस्य of a famed, देवस्य lord's, तस्य his, शक्तः is possible, कः who, प्रतिकर्तुम् ever to repay, तादृशम् such, विक्रमं वीर heroic valour.
data.md: O king's son, who is capable of repaying even in part an action like that of the divine (Rāma) renowned by means of his own acts?

data.v: सीतां प्राप्स्यति धर्मात्मा वधिष्यति च रावणम् । सहायमात्रेण मया राघवः स्वेन तेजसा ।।
data.es: 'Righteous Rama can merely restore Sita with my assistance. By his own fiery energy he will kill Ravana.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा राघवः righteous Rama, सहायमात्रेण only be an assistant, मया by me, स्वेन तेजसा by his own fiery energy, सीताम् Sita, प्राप्स्यति he will get back, रावणम् Ravana,वधिष्यति च he will  kill.
data.md: By virtue of native energy, and merely with my help, the righteous Rāghava shall recover Sītā and slay Rāvana to boot.

data.v: सहायकृत्यं हि तस्य येन सप्त महाद्रुमाः । शैलश्च वसुधा चैव बाणेनैकेन दारिताः ।।
data.es: 'Rama shattered seven huge trees, a mountain and earth with a single arrow. What assistance does he need?
data.anv: येन by whomsoever, सप्त seven, महाद्रुमाः huge trees, शैलश्च mountain too, वसुधा चैव and earth also, एकेन by only one, बाणेन with an arrow, दारिताः shattered, तस्य to him, सहायकृत्यम् assistance to be done, किम् what.
data.md: What need of assistance to him who with a single shaft rived seven giant trees, a mountain, and the Earth.

data.v: धनुर्विस्फारमाणस्य यस्य शब्देन लक्ष्मण । सशैला कम्पिता भूमिः सहायैस्तस्य किं नु वै ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana the twang of his bow shook even the mountains and the earth. What assistance does he need?
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, धनुः bow, विष्फारयानस्य  with the twang of his bow, यस्य its, शब्देन by the sound, सशैला: even the mountains, भूमिः earth, कम्पिता was shaken तस्य his, सहायैः assistance, किं why?
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, what is the use of help to him the sounds of whose stretching bow made the Earth tremble with her mountains?

data.v: अनुयात्रां नरेन्द्रस्य करिष्येऽहं नरर्षभ । गच्छतो रावणं हन्तुं वैरिणं सपुरःसरम् ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana, bull among men I shall only join him along with others when he leads the army to kill Ravana.
data.anv: नरर्षभ O bull among men, सपुरस्सरम् along with his followers, वैरिणम् the enemy, रावणम् Ravana, हन्तुम् to kill, गच्छतः while going, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, अहम् I, अनुयात्राम् following, करिष्ये I shall.
data.md: O best of men, when that foremost of men shall set out for slaying his enemy, Rāvaņa along with those going before him, I will follow him.

data.v: यदि किंचिदतिक्रान्तं विश्वासात्प्रणयेन वा । प्रेष्यस्य क्षमितव्यं मे न कश्चिन्नापराध्यति ।।
data.es: 'If I have committed even a little transgression in my faith in Rama or affection for him and exceeded the time limit, my mistakes are to be excused as one would pardons a servant. No one is flawless in the world.'
data.anv: विश्वासात् due to faith, प्रणयेन वा or with love, किञ्चित् even a little, अतिक्रान्तं यदि have exceeded time, प्रेष्यस्य of a servant, मे my, क्षमितव्यम् one should pardon, कश्चित् any one, नापराध्यति इति न is not flawless in the world.
data.md: I through my confidence, or presuming upon our amity. I have transgressed in any way, (Rāma) ought to excuse his servant,—for there is no servant that does not transgress.

data.v: इति तस्य ब्रुवाणस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । अभवल्लक्ष्मणः प्रीतः प्रेंणा चेदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:
data.anv: रामः Rama, महात्मनः great soul, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य that Sugriva's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अथ then, हरिं प्रति seeing Sugriva, स्मितपूर्वम् smiling gently, प्रत्युवाच  replied.
data.md: When the high-souled Sugrīva had said this, Lakşmaņa became well pleased and he spoke from love,

data.v: सर्वथा हि मम भ्राता सनाथो वानरेश्वर । त्वया नाथेन सुग्रीव प्रश्रितेन विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva, king of monkeys when you are extending due courtesy to my brother,he has a guardian in you by all means.
data.anv: वानरेश्वर O king of monkeys, सुग्रीव Sugriva, नाथेन by a king, विशेषतः specially, प्रश्रितेन by a courteous one, त्वया you, मम my, भ्राता brother, सर्वथा in all ways, सनाथः हि has a guardian.
data.md: Having in especial, you endued with humility, my brother, O monarch of monkeys, is every way strong, O Sugriva.

data.v: यस्ते प्रभावः सुग्रीव यच्च ते शौचमुत्तमम् । अर्हस्तं कपिराज्यस्य श्रियं भोक्तुमनुत्तमाम् ।।
data.es: 'You are powerful and straightforward by nature.You are humble and noble. Therefore, you deserve the high prosperity of the kingdom of the monkeys.
data.anv: सुग्रीव Sugriva, ते your, यः whatever, प्रभावः power, आर्जवम् straightforward nature, यत्  such, शौचं च purity, त्वम् your, कपिराज्यस्य of vanara kingdom, अनुत्तमाम् excellent, श्रियम् prosperity, भोक्तुम् to enjoy, अर्हः you deserve.
data.md: Such is your strength, O Sugriva, and such your self-denial, that you are fully worthy to enjoy the good fortune of the king of monkeys.

data.v: सहायेन च सुग्रीव त्वया रामः प्रतापवान् । वधिष्यति रणे शत्रूनचिरान्नात्र संशयः ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva with you as associate, valiant hero Rama will kill his enemies in war very soon. There is no doubt about it.
data.anv: सुग्रीव Sugriva, सहायेन with you as associate, त्वया by your, प्रतापवान् valiant hero, रामः Rama, शत्रून्  enemies, रणे in war, अचिरात् shortly, वधिष्यति he will kill, संशयः is doubt, न not, अत्र in this case
data.md: O Sugrīva, by your help, the puissant Rāma shall speedily slay his foe. Of this there is not the least doubt.

data.v: धर्मज्ञस्य कृतज्ञस्य संग्रामेष्वनिवर्तिनः । उपपन्नं च युक्तं च सुग्रीव तव भाषितम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva you know dharma.You are grateful and will not turn back from the battle. So your words are true and befitting.
data.anv: सुग्रीव Sugriva, धर्मज्ञस्य  who is aware of dhrama, कृतज्ञस्य of a grateful one, सङ्ग्रामेषु in battles, अनिवर्तिनः of one who does not retreat, तव your, भाषितम् word, उपपन्नम्  true, युक्तं च is fitting also.
data.md: O Sugrīva, what you virtuous, grateful and never turning away from fight, have said is fit and proper.

data.v: दोषज्ञः सति सामर्थ्ये कोऽन्यो भाषितुमर्हति । वर्जयित्वा मम ज्येष्ठं त्वां च वानरसत्तम ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys barring you and my elder brother, who else would be capable of speaking this way about themselves even when you are aware of other's faults?
data.anv: वानरसत्तम best of monkeys, मम my, ज्येष्ठम् elder brother, त्वां च and you, वर्जयित्वा with the exception of, अन्यः others, कः who, सामर्थ्ये सति capability, दोषज्ञः knows the faults of others, भाषितुम् to speak, अर्हति will be capable.
data.md: What knowing person, excepting, O foremost of monkeys, yourself and my elder brother, can speak so.

data.v: सदृशश्चासि रामस्य विक्रमेण बलेन च । सहायो दैवतैर्दत्तश्चिराय हरिपुंगव ।।
data.es: 'You who are equal to Rama in valour and strength, will continue to be the gift of gods to us for long.
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गव Sugriva, दैवतैः by deities, चिराय for a long time, दत्तः given, सहायः as helper, विक्रमेण बलेन च in power and valour, रामस्य with Rama, सदृशः equal, असि you are.
data.md: Resembling Rāma himself in strength and prowess, you, O chief of monkeys, have been ordained his help by the gods.

data.v: किं तु शीघ्रमितो वीर निष्क्राम त्वं मया सह । सान्त्वयस्व वयस्यं च भार्याहरणदुःखितम् ।।
data.es: 'Nevertheless I want you to proceed from here with me at once and reassure your friend who is agrieved due to the abduction of his wife.
data.anv: किं तु nevertheless, त्वम् you, मया सह with me, इतः from this place, शीघ्रम् at once, निष्क्रम start, भार्याहरणकर्शितम् a man grieved by the abduction of his wife, वयस्य your friend, सान्त्वयस्व reassure.
data.md: But, O hero, do you speedily go out with me and soothe your friend aggrieved for the ravishment of his wife.

data.v: यच्च शोकाभिभूतस्य श्रुत्वा रामस्य भाषितम् । मया त्वं परुषाण्युक्तस्तच्च त्वं क्षन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामयणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysix sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: त्वम् You, शोकाभिभूतस्य of a griefstricken man, रामस्य भाषितम् Rama's words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, मया by me, त्वम् you, परुषाणि harshly, उक्तः इति यत् thus spoken, अर्हसि you will, तच्च that, क्षन्तुम् to forgive.
data.md: And do you, my frie forgive what rough speech, on hearing the utterances of Rāma sunk in grief, I have given you.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना । हनुमन्तं स्थितं पार्श्वे सचिवं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When the great Rama said this, Sugriva with all the four monkeys felt immeasurably glad.
data.anv: महात्मना by the great, काकुत्स्थेन by Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः having been told, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, चतुर्भिः with all the four, वानरैः सह with monkeys, अतुलम् immeasurable, प्रहर्षम् joy, लेभे felt.
data.md: Thus addressed by the magnanimous Lakşmana Sugrīva said to Hanumān, staying beside him,

data.v: महेन्द्रहिमवद्विन्ध्यकैलासशिखरेषु च । मन्दरे पाण्डुशिखरे पञ्चशैलेषु ये स्थिताः ।।
तरुणादित्यवर्णेषु भ्राजमानेषु सर्वशः । पर्वतेषु समुद्रान्ते पश्चिमस्यां तु ये दिशि ।।
आदित्यभवने चैव गिरौ संध्याभ्रसंनिभे । पद्मतालवनं भीमं संश्रिता हरिपुंगवाः ।।
अञ्जनाम्बुदसंकाशाः कुञ्जरप्रतिमौजसः । अञ्जने परते चैव ये वसन्ति प्लवंगमाः ।।
मनःशिला गुहावासा वानराः कनकप्रभाः । मेरुपार्श्वगताश्चैव ये च धूम्रगिरिं श्रिताः ।।
तरुणादित्यवर्णाश्च पर्वते ये महारुणे । पिबन्तो मधुमैरेयं भीमवेगाः प्लवंगमाः ।।
वनेषु च सुरम्येषु सुगन्धिषु महत्सु च । तापसानां च रम्येषु वनान्तेषु समन्ततः ।।
तांस्तांस्त्वमानय क्षिप्रं पृथिव्यां सर्ववानरान् । सामदानादिभिः कल्पैराशु प्रेषय वानरान् ।।
प्रेषिताः प्रथमं ये च मया दूता महाजवाः । त्वरणार्थं तु भूयस्त्वं हरीन्संप्रेषयापरान् ।।
data.es: 'This is in addition to the monkeys for whom swiftfooted messengers have already been sent.
data.anv: मया by me, दूताः messengers, महाजवाः swift, ये those, प्रथमम् earlier, प्रेषिताः are sent forth, त्वरणार्थम् to hasten, त्वम् you, भूयः again, आपरान् others, हरीन् monkeys, सम्प्रेषय send.
data.md: I know those monkeys that I have first despatched, to be gifted with great velocity*, yet, for urging speed upon them, do you send other foremost of monkeys. *The commentator slips the sense here. According to him, the meaning is, Those monkeys whom I have first sent, are known to me.

data.v: ये प्रसक्ताश्च कामेषु दीर्घसूत्राश्च वानराः । इहानयस्व तान्सर्वाञ्शीघ्रं तु मम शासनात् ।।
data.es: 'Get all the monkeys including those engaged in carnal pleasures and those slow in movement all at once on my command.
data.anv: ये those, वानराः monkeys, कामेषु in carnal pleasures, प्रसक्ताश्च engaged in, दीर्घसूत्राश्च slow workers, सर्वान् all, तां them, मम शासनात् on my command, शीघ्रम् at once, इह here, आनयस्व  bring.
data.md: Do you directly bring up here those monkeychiefs that are given up to lust or are dilatory.

data.v: अहोभिर्दशभिर्ये च नागच्छन्ति ममाज्ञया । हन्तव्यास्ते दुरात्मानो राजशासनदूषकाः ।।
data.es: 'Kill those evilminded ones within ten days for disobeying the royal orders.
data.anv: ये those, मम my, आज्ञया by my orders, दशभिः in ten days, अहोभिः by days, नागच्छन्ति are not coming, राजशासनदूषकाः  disobeying king's order, ते they, दुरात्मानः evilminded ones, हन्तव्याः to be killed.
data.md: Those wicked ones, that finding fault with the royal mandate, do not (come in) at my command within ten days, must be slain.

data.v: शतान्यथ सहस्राणि कोट्यश्च मम शासनात् । प्रयान्तु कपिसिंहानां दिशो मम मते स्थिताः ।।
data.es: 'The hundreds of thousands of crores of obedient lionlike monkeys should proceed in all directions at my command.
data.anv: मम my, दिशः all directions, मम my, मते स्थिताः obedient to me, कपिसिंहानाम् of lion like monkeys, शतानि hundred, सहस्राणां thousand, कोट्यश्च crores, मम my, शासनात् by command, प्रयान्तु let them go.
data.md: Let those hundreds and thousands and kotis of leonine monkeys that abide by my mandate, hie (hence) at my behest.

data.v: मेघपर्वतसंकाशाश्छादयन्त इवाम्बरम् । घोररूपाः कपिश्रेष्ठा यान्तु मच्छासनादितः ।।
data.es: 'Fierce monkeys, comparable to clouds and mountains in appearance shall go as though covering the sky from here at my command.
data.anv: मेघपर्वतसङ्काशाः those comparable to clouds and mountains, घोररूपाः fierce in appearance, कपिश्रेष्ठाः best of monkeys, अम्बरम् sky, छाहोदयन्त इव as if covering, मच्छासनात् by my command, इतः from here, यान्तु will go.
data.md: Let (monkey) resembling clouds or mountains, cover up the sky; and let the foremost monkeys of dreadful forms march hence at my command.

data.v: ते गतिज्ञा गतिं गत्वा पृथिव्यां सर्ववानराः । आनयन्तु हरीन्सर्वांस्त्वरिताः शासनान्मम ।।
data.es: The monkey leaders from all over the earth arrived quickly, leading the hordes of them.
data.anv: गतिज्ञाः those who know the locations, ते they, सर्ववानराः all vanaras, त्वरिताः quickly, गतिं ज्ञात्वा knowing their movements, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, सर्वान् all, हरीन् monkeys, मम my, शासनात् command, आनयन्तु bring.
data.md: Let all the monkeys on earth, acquainted with motion lying themselves and summoning speed at my command, bring all the monkeys.

data.v: तस्य वानरराजस्य श्रुत्वा वायुसुतो वचः । दिक्षु सर्वासु विक्रान्तान्प्रेषयामास वानरान् ।।
data.es: Having heard Sugriva's command, Hanuman, son of the Windgod, sent powerful monkeys in all directions.
data.anv: वायुसुतः son of Windgod, तस्य वानरराजस्य that monkey king's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सर्वासु in all, दिक्षु in directions, विक्रान्तान् advancing, वानरान् monkeys, प्रेषयामास sent for.
data.md: Hearing the words of the monkey-king, the son of the Wind-god despatched powerful monkeys in all directions.

data.v: ते पदं विष्णुविक्रान्तं पतत्रिज्योतिरध्वगाः । प्रयाताः प्रहिता राज्ञा हरयस्तत्क्षणेन वै ।।
data.es: The monkeys ordered by the king, traversed the pathway of birds and heavenly bodies, the path Lord Visnu had trod. [Note: the sky is called Vishnupada since Lord Visnu set his foot on the sky in his incarnation as Vamana.]
data.anv: राज्ञा by the king, प्रहिताः sent, ते they, पतत्रिज्योतिरध्वगाः those moving in the path of birds and heavenly bodies, क्षणेन in that moment, विष्णुविक्रान्तम् where Visnu moved about, पदम् path, प्रयाताः travelled, हरयः monkeys, वै indeed.
data.md: Despatched by the king, the monkeys, ranging the sphere of birds and stars, immediately went through the welkin.

data.v: ते समुद्रेषु गिरिषु वनेषु च सरित्सु च । वानरा वानरान्सर्वान्रामहेतोरचोदयन् ।।
data.es: The messenger monkeys drove in all those living on the sea shore, mountains, forests as well as banks of lakes in order to serve the cause of Rama.
data.anv: ते वानराः set his foot those monkeys, समुद्रेषु on the sea shore, गिरिषु on the mountains, वनेषु च in the forests, सरस्सु च  on the banks of lakes, सर्वान् all over, वानरान् monkeys, रामहेतोः  to serve Rama's cause, अचोदयन् driven.
data.md: And on oceans and mountains, in forests and tanks, the monkeys began to send away all the apes on behalf of Rāma.

data.v: मृत्युकालोपमस्याज्ञां राजराजस्य वानराः । सुग्रीवस्याययुः श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवभयदर्शिनः ।।
data.es: In response to the command of the king, who was like death to them, the monkeys came at once, driven by fear from Sugriva.
data.anv: वानराः monkeys, मृत्युकालोपमस्य  like god of death , राजराजस्य of king's, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, आज्ञाम् command, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सुग्रीवभयदर्शिनः foreseeing fear from Sugriva, आययुः came.
data.md: Hearing the mandate of that king of kings, Sugriva, resembling the Hour of death, the monkeys, conceiving fear for Sugrīva, set out.

data.v: ततस्तेऽञ्जनसंकाशा गिरेस्तस्मान्महाजवाः । तिस्रः कोट्यः प्लवंगानां निर्ययुर्यत्र राघवः ।।
data.es: Then three crores of swiftfooted monkeys, dark like collyrium, rushed forth to the mountain to meet Rama.
data.anv: ततः then, तस्मात् गिरेः from that mountain, प्लवङ्गनाम् of monkeys, महाजवाः swift moving, अञ्जनसङ्काशाः who were like collyrium, तिस्रः three, कोट्यः crores, राघवः Rama, यत्र wherever, निर्ययुः rushed forth.
data.md: And monkeys resembling collyrium (in hue), numbering three kotis, endued with huge might, set out from the Añjana hill for the place where Rāghava was.

data.v: अस्तं गच्छति यत्रार्कस्तस्मिन्गिरिवरे रताः । तप्तहेमसमाभासास्तस्मात्कोट्यो दशच्युताः ।।
data.es: Ten crores of monkeys shining like pure molten gold, staying on the best of mountains where the Sun sets moved towards Kishkinda.
data.anv: यत्र wherever, अर्कः Sun, अस्तं गच्छति sets, तस्मिन् in that, गिरिवरे in the best of mountains, स्थिताः staying at, सन्तप्तहेममहाभास shining like pure molten gold, दश कोट्यः ten crores, तस्मात् from there, च्युताः moved out.
data.md: And ten koțis having the splendour of molten gold inhabiting the mountain where the sun sets, set out.

data.v: कैलास शिखरेभ्यश्च सिंहकेसरवर्चसाम् । ततः कोटिसहस्राणि वानराणामुपागमन् ।।
data.es: From the peaks of Kailasa mountain moved out one thousand crores of monkeys who were of bright colour like the lion's mane.
data.anv: ततः then, सिंहकेसरवर्चसाम् of those having the colour of the lion's mane, वानराणाम् monkeys, कोटि सहस्राणि a thousand crores, कैलासशिखरेभ्यश्च from the peaks of Kailasa mountain, उपागमन् started.
data.md: And a thousand kotis, hued like the lion's mane, came from the peaks of Kailāsa.

data.v: फलमूलेन जीवन्तो हिमवन्तमुपाश्रिताः । तेषां कोटिसहस्राणां सहस्रं समवर्तत ।।
data.es: Then monkeys residing at mount Himavan feeding on fruits and roots came in thousands of crores. (This number is called Shankha 1000,000,000,000,0, it is one digit higher than Mahapadma.)
data.anv: फलमूलेन with fruits and roots, जीवन्तः those feeding on, हिमवन्तम् Himavan, उपाश्रिताः resorted to, तेषाम् them, कोटिसहस्राणाम् thousands of crores, सहस्रम् a thousand, समवर्तत was ready.
data.md: And of those dwelling in Himālaya, subsisting on fruits and roots, numbering a thousand and kotis, a thousand appeared.

data.v: अङ्गारक समानानां भीमानां भीमकर्मणाम् । विन्ध्याद्वानरकोटीनां सहस्राण्यपतन्द्रुतम् ।।
data.es: From the Vindhya mountain came down thousands of crores of swiftfooted monkeys of terrific deeds. They were fierce like fire (Angaraka).
data.anv: विन्ध्यात् from the Vindhya, अङ्गारकसमानानाम् like the Angaraka (fire), भीमानाम् fierceful, भीमकर्मणाम् of fierce deeds, वानरकोटीनाम् of crores of monkeys, सहस्राणि thousands, द्रुतम् swiftly, अपतन् came down.
data.md: And thousands of dreadful monkeys of terrible deeds, hued like charcoal, numbering kot is, rushed suddenly from Vindhya.

data.v: क्षीरोदवेलानिलयास्तमालवनवासिनः । नारिकेलाशनाश्चैव तेषां संख्या न विद्यते ।।
data.es: The monkeys residents of Tamala forest on the shores of the ocean of milk feeding on coconuts arrived from the groves in countless number.
data.anv: क्षीरोदवेलानिलयाः those dwelling on the banks of the milky ocean, तमालवनवासिनः residents of Tamala forest, नारिकेलाशनाश्चैव those feeding on coconuts in the palm grove, तेषाम् of all of them, सङ्ख्या number, न विद्यते not exist.
data.md: And there exists no record of the number of those inhabiting the shores of the ocean of milk, and the dwellers in the Tamāla forests, as well as those subsisting on coconuts.

data.v: वनेभ्यो गह्वरेभ्यश्च सरिद्भ्यश्च महाजवाः । आगच्छद्वानरी सेना पिबन्तीव दिवाकरम् ।।
data.es: An army of swiftmoving monkeys came from the caves, from the banks of rivers and forests as though it was swallowing up the Sungod.
data.anv: महाजवा: swift movers, वानरी सेना army of monkeys, दिवाकरम् Sun, पिबन्तीव as if it was swallowing, वनेभ्यः from the forests, गह्वरेभ्यश्च from the caves, सरिद्भ्यश्च from the river banks, आगच्छत् came.
data.md: And, as if drinking up the sun, the mighty monkey host came from forests and caves and rivers.

data.v: ये तु त्वरयितुं याता वानराः सर्ववानरान् । ते वीरा हिमवच्छैलं ददृशुस्तं महाद्रुमम् ।।
data.es: The monkeys sent earlier to hasten all their counterparts saw mount Himavat from the great tree.
data.anv: ये those, वानराः monkeys, सर्ववानरान् all the rest of monkeys, त्वरयितुम् to hasten, याताः they had gone, ते वीराः those heroes, हिमवच्छैलं the mountain Himavat, तम् that, महाद्रुमम्  great tree, ददृशुः saw.
data.md: And it came to pass that those heroic monkeys that had gone away to spur others on, found a mighty tree on Himayat.

data.v: तस्मिन्गिरिवरे रम्ये यज्ञो महेश्वरः पुरा । सर्वदेवमनस्तोषो बभौ दिव्यो मनोहरः ।।
data.es: A divine, wonderful, delightful Yagna dedicated to Lord Siva used to be performed on the beautiful (Himalayan) mountain in the past so that the minds of all deities were satisfied.
data.anv: रम्ये on the enchanting, तस्मिन् on that, गिरिवरे on the best of mountains, पुरा earlier, सर्वदेवमनस्तोषः made the minds of all deities happy, दिव्य: मनोहर: divine and wonderful, माहेश्वरः Lord Mahesvara, यज्ञः Yajna, बभौ was performed.
data.md: On that sacred mount in days of yore there took place a pleasing Maheswara* sacrifice. *The celestial horse-sacrifice.

data.v: अन्नविष्यन्दजातानि मूलानि च फलानि च । अमृतस्वादुकल्पानि ददृशुस्तत्र वानराः ।।
data.es: There the monkeys saw the Yajna, and partook the fruits and roots produced out of the havis which tasted sweet like nectar.
data.anv: तत्र there, वानराः monkeys, अन्ननिष्यन्दजातानि produced out of the havis of the Yajna, अमृतास्वादकल्पानि sweet like nectar, मूलानि and roots, च and, फलानि च fruits also, ददृशुः they saw.
data.md: There the monkeys found grateful fruits and roots sprung from the streams of sacrificial oblations, and resembling ambrosia.

data.v: तदन्न संभवं दिव्यं फलं मूलं मनोहरम् । यः कश्चित्सकृदश्नाति मासं भवति तर्पितः ।।
data.es: Any one who shares even a little of the divine, delicious fruits and roots grown out of that havis will have no hunger or thirst for a month.
data.anv: तदन्नसम्भवम् born out of that havis, दिव्यम् wonderful, मनोहरम् delicious, फलमूलम् fruits and roots, यः कश्चित् any one, सकृत् one, अश्नाति eats, मासम् for one month, तर्पितः contented, भवति he will be.
data.md: He that partakes of those excellent fruits and roots sprung from the sacrificial ingredients, does not experience hunger for a month.

data.v: तानि मूलानि दिव्यानि फलानि च फलाशनाः । औषधानि च दिव्यानि जगृहुर्हरियूथपाः ।।
data.es: The monkey leaders who lived on fruits collected the divine fruits, roots as well as medicinal herbs.
data.anv: फलाशनाः those who live on fruits, हरियूथपाः monkey leaders, दिव्यानि divine, तानि them, मूलानि roots, फलानि च and fruits, दिव्यानि heavenly, औषधानि च and medicinal herbs, जगृहुः took.
data.md: Those prime monkeys, feeding on fruits, gathered those sapid fruits and roots and medicinal herbs.

data.v: तस्माच्च यज्ञायतनात्पुष्पाणि सुरभीणि च । आनिन्युर्वानरा गत्वा सुग्रीवप्रियकारणात् ।।
data.es: The monkeys also collected finesmelling flowers from the sacrificial altar to please Sugriva with.
data.anv: वानराः monkeys, गत्वा having gone, तस्मात् from that, यज्ञायतनात् from that sacrificial altar, सुरभीणि finesmelling, पुष्पाणि च flowers also, सुग्रीवप्रियकारणात् for pleasing Sugriva, आनिन्युः collected them.
data.md: And for compassing the good of Sugrīva, repairing thither, the monkeys brought ordorous blossoms from the sacrificial ground.

data.v: ते तु सर्वे हरिवराः पृथिव्यां सर्ववानरान् । संचोदयित्वा त्वरितं यूथानां जग्मुरग्रतः ।।
data.es: The monkey leaders from all over the earth arrived quickly, leading the hordes of them.
data.anv: गतिज्ञाः those who know the locations, ते they, सर्ववानराः all vanaras, त्वरिताः quickly, गतिं ज्ञात्वा knowing their movements, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, सर्वान् all, हरीन् monkeys, मम my, शासनात् command, आनयन्तु bring.
data.md: And all those foremost of monkeys, taking all the monkeys of the earth, hastily set off in the van of the herds.

data.v: ते तु तेन मुहूर्तेन यूथपाः शीघ्रकारिणः । किष्किन्धां त्वरया प्राप्ताः सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः ।।
data.es: In a short while the swiftmoving leaders of the monkeys groups reached Kishkinda quickly.
data.anv: शीघ्रगामिनः swiftwalkers, ते यूथपाः leaders of the groups, तेन मुहूर्तेन in that short time, वानरः monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, यत्र there, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda, त्वरया quickly, प्राप्ताः reached.
data.md: And in a short while, those fast-fleeting apes speedily reached Kişkindhā, where the monkey Sugriva was.

data.v: ते गृहीत्वौषधीः सर्वाः फलं मूलं च वानराः । तं प्रतिग्राहयामासुर्वचनं चेदमब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Offering all kinds of medicinal herbs, fruits and roots collected, to Sugriva the monkeys said:
data.anv: ते वानराः those monkeys, सर्वाः all kinds of, ओषधीः medicinal herbs, फलमूलं च fruits and roots, गृहीत्वा having collected, तम् by them, प्रतिग्राहयामासुः in turn gifted to him (Sugriva), इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रुवन् च said.
data.md: And taking the healing herbs and the fruits and roots, the monkeys made them over to Sugrīva, and said,

data.v: सर्वे परिगताः शैलाः समुद्राश्च वनानि च । पृथिव्यां वानराः सर्वे शासनादुपयान्ति ते ।।
data.anv: सर्वे all, शैलाः mountains, समुद्रा: oceans, वनानि च and forests, परिगताः have been covered, ते your, शासनात् with command, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, वानराः vanaras, उपयान्ति they are coming.
data.md: Having traversed mountains, rivers and forests, all the monkeys of the earth bend their steps towards you in obedience to your command.

data.v: एवं श्रुत्वा ततो हृष्टः सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः । प्रतिजग्राह च प्रीतस्तेषां सर्वमुपायनम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the report from the monkeys, Sugriva the king of vanaras, accepted all the gifts they had brought him, with great pleasure.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, of the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, प्लवगाधिपः king of monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, एवम् in that way, श्रुत्वा on hearing, हृष्टः happy, तेषाम् their, सर्वम् entire, उपायनम् gift, तत् प्रीतः he was pleased with it, प्रतिजग्राह च and accepted them.
data.md: Hearing this, Sugriva-lord of monkeys-was well pleased, and with a glad heart accepted all those present.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तत्सर्वमुपानयमुपाहृतम् । वानरान्सान्त्वयित्वा च सर्वानेव व्यसर्जयत् ।।
data.es: On receiving all the gifts presented by the monkeys, Sugriva permitted them to go happy.
data.anv: उपाहृतम् presented, तत् that, सर्वम् all that, उपायनम् gifts, प्रतिगृह्य after taking, सान्त्वयित्वा च pleasing them, सर्वान् एव all of them, वानरान् monkeys, व्यसर्जयत् permitted to go.
data.md: Having accepted all those presents, (Sugrīva), after soothing the monkeys, dismissed them.

data.v: विसर्जयित्वा स हरीञ्शूरांस्तान्कृतकर्मणः । मेने कृतार्थमात्मानं राघवं च महाबलम् ।।
data.es: The monkey heroes sent by Sugriva performed the task assigned to them and felt powerful Rama's task has been achieved (a successful beginning has been made).
data.anv: सः he, कृतकर्मणः those who have done the task asigned, शूरान् तान् those heroes, हरीन् the monkeys, विसर्जयित्वा after sending away, आत्मानम् himself, महाबलम् powerful, राघवं च and Rama, कृतार्थम् achieved, मेने felt.
data.md: Having dismissed the thousands of apes, who had performed their task, he deemed himself as well as the mighty Rāghava as having secured success.

data.v: स लक्ष्मणो भीमबलं सर्ववानरसत्तमम् । अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सुग्रीवं संप्रहर्षयन् । किष्किन्धाया विनिष्क्राम यदि ते सौम्य रोचते ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the noblest of all monkeys, spoke these polite words in a pleasing manner to Lakshmana of terrific strength:
data.anv: सर्ववानरसत्तमः the noble of all the vanaras, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, भीमबलम् a man of great prowess, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, सम्प्रहर्षयन् pleasing manner, प्रश्रितम् वाक्यम् these polite words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And that master of all the monkeys, Sugrīva, gladdening Lakşmaņa of dreadful prowess, humbly observed to him,

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणस्य सुभाषितम् । सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतो वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Sugriva, very much pleased with the words of Rama, spoke highly (of him).
