data.anv: भक्ष्यलुब्धस्य of the greedy for food, तस्य पक्षिणः of the vulture, तत् वचनम् that words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अथ then, अङ्गदः Angada, परमायस्तः highly dejected, हनूमन्तम् to Hanumanta, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing those words of Răghava fraught with his welfare, Sugrīva supremely rejoiced, said these words, informed with rapture, You hero!

data.v: एवं भवतु गच्छामः स्थेयं त्वच्छासने मया । तमेवमुक्त्वा सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्ष्मणम् ।।
data.md: Be it so. Let us go. I abide by your behest. Having said this to Lakşmaņa of auspicious marks, Sugrīva dismissed the women with Tārā at their head.

data.v: विसर्जयामास तदा तारामन्याश्च योषितः । एतेत्युच्चैर्हरिवरान्सुग्रीवः समुदाहरत् ।।
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हरयः शीघ्रमाययुः । बद्धाञ्जलिपुटाः सर्वे ये स्युः स्त्रीदर्शनक्षमाः ।।
data.es: Sugriva called in the monkeys who deserved audience of the female folk of the royal family. They came forward quickly with folded hands welcoming the heroes.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, एते you come, इति thus, उच्चैः loudly, हरिवरान् foremost of the monkeys, समुदाहरत् as he collected them, तस्य his, तत् that, वचनं श्रुत्वा on hearing the word, ये who, स्त्रीदर्शनक्षमाः female monkeys fit to see, स्युः they be, सर्वे all, हरयः monkeys, बद्धाञ्जलिपुटाः those with folded hands, शीघ्रम् quickly, आययुः came.
data.md: Then Sugrīva in a loud voice summoned the foremost monkey, saying, Come (hither). hearing his words, those monkeys that could present themselves before the females, did so with joined hands.

data.v: तानुवाच ततः प्राप्तान्राजार्कसदृशप्रभः । उपस्थापयत क्षिप्रं शिबिकां मम वानराः ।।
data.es: Then seeing the monkeys who had come there, king Sugriva who was shining like the Sungod asked them to get a palanquin ready at once.
data.anv: ततः then, अर्कसदृशप्रभः shining like the Sun, राजा king, प्राप्तान् those who came there, तान् them, उवाच said, वानराः monkeys, मम my, शिबिकाम् palanquin, क्षिप्रम् at once, उपस्थापयत get it here.
data.md: To them, who had presented themselves, said the king, of splendour resembling that of the Sun, Do, you monkeys, bring hither a car.8

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तस्य हरयः शीघ्रविक्रमाः । समुपस्थापयामासुः शिबिकां प्रियदर्शनाम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the king, the monkeys who were quick to act placed a beautiful palanquin in front of him.
data.anv: शीघ्रविक्रमाः those who were quick to act, हरयः monkeys, तस्य his, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, प्रियदर्शनाम् pleasing to see, शिबिकाम् palanquin, समुपस्थापयामासुः placed in front of him.
data.md: Hearing his words, monkeys uniting vigour with celerity, brought a car lovely to behold.

data.v: तामुपस्थापितां दृष्ट्वा शिबिकां वानराधिपः । लक्ष्मणारुह्यतां शीघ्रमिति सौमित्रिमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Seeing the palanquin placed in front of Sugriva, the chief of the monkeys requested Lakshmana to get in quickly.
data.anv: वानराधिपः chief of monkeys, उपस्थापिताम् was brought in, तां शिबिकाम् palanquin, दृष्ट्वा seeing, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, शीघ्रम् quickly, आरुह्यताम् get on, इति thus, सौमित्रिम् to Saumithri, अब्रवत् said.
data.md: Seeing the car brought up, the lord of monkeys said to Sumitra's son, O Laksmana, ascend speedily.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा काञ्चनं यानं सुग्रीवः सूर्यसंनिभम् । बृहद्भिर्हरिभिर्युक्तमारुरोह सलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: With this Sugriva, shining like the Sungod, entered along with Lakshmana the golden palanquin carried by ablebodied monkeys.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, सूर्यसन्निभम् shining like the Sun, बृहद्भि: by the strong, हरिभिः by the monkeys, युक्तम् fit to be yoked, काञ्चनम् golden, यानम् that vehicle, सलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, आरुरोह got in.
data.md: Having said this, Sugrīva in company with Lakşınana swiftly ascended the golden car resembling the sun, yoked with numerous steeds.

data.v: पाण्डुरेणातपत्रेण ध्रियमाणेन मूर्धनि । शुक्लैश्च बालव्यजनैर्धूयमानैः समन्ततः ।।
data.es: With a pale white umbrella over his head, white yaktail fans and sounds of conches and drums, Sugriva set out receiving greetings from monkeys, rejoicing in his royal glory.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अनुत्तमाम् utmost, राज्यश्रियम् royal prosperity, प्राप्य having attained, हरिभिः by monkeys, अभिनन्दितः greeted, मूर्धनि over his head, ध्रियमाणेन holding, शुक्लेश्च पाण्डुरेण with  pale white, आतपत्रेण by an umbrella, समन्ततः all over, धूयमानैः fanning, वालव्यजनैः  made of yaktail, शङ्खभेरीनिनादैश्च by the sounds of conches and drums निर्ययौ set out.
data.md: With a pale umbrella held over his head, and white chowris waving around, with conchs and trumpets blowing, eulogized by bards, Sugrīva marched out, having obtained supreme regal auspiciousness.

data.v: शङ्खभेरीनिनादैश्च बन्दिभिश्चाभिवन्दितः । निर्ययौ प्राप्य सुग्रीवो राज्यश्रियमनुत्तमाम् ।।
data.es: With a pale white umbrella over his head, white yaktail fans and sounds of conches and drums, Sugriva set out receiving greetings from monkeys, rejoicing in his royal glory.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अनुत्तमाम् utmost, राज्यश्रियम् royal prosperity, प्राप्य having attained, हरिभिः by monkeys, अभिनन्दितः greeted, मूर्धनि over his head, ध्रियमाणेन holding, शुक्लेश्च पाण्डुरेण with  pale white, आतपत्रेण by an umbrella, समन्ततः all over, धूयमानैः fanning, वालव्यजनैः  made of yaktail, शङ्खभेरीनिनादैश्च by the sounds of conches and drums निर्ययौ set out.

data.v: स वानरशतैस्तीष्क्णैर्बहुभिः शस्त्रपाणिभिः । परिकीर्णो ययौ तत्र यत्र रामो व्यवस्थितः ।।
data.es: Surrounded by hundreds of monkeys wielding various sharp weapons, Sugriva went forth to the region where Rama resided৷৷
data.anv: सः he, शस्त्रपाणिभिः wielding weapons in hand, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, बहुभिः varied, वानरशतैः by hundreds of monkeys, परिकीर्णः surrounded by, रामः Rama, यत्र where, व्यवस्थितः resided, तत्र there, ययौ went forth.

data.v: स तं देशमनुप्राप्य श्रेष्ठं रामनिषेवितम् । अवातरन्महातेजाः शिबिकायाः सलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Having reached the place where Rama lived, brilliant Sugriva along with Lakshmana descended from the palanquin.
data.anv: महातेजाः brilliant, सलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, सः he, रामनिषेवितम् where Rama was resided, श्रेष्ठम् best, तं देशम् that location, अनुप्राप्य having reached, शिबिकायाः from the palanquin, अवातरत् descended.
data.md: And having arrived at the excellent spot which was the home of Rāma, that highly energetic one alighted from the car along with Lakşmaņa. And having come to Rāma, Sugrīva (stood) folding his hands.

data.v: आसाद्य च ततो रामं कृताञ्जलिपुटोऽभवत् । कृताञ्जलौ स्थिते तस्मिन्वानराश्चभवंस्तथा ।।
data.es: Thereafter Sugriva followed by the monkeys approached Rama, and stood with folded hands.
data.anv: ततः then, रामम् to Rama, आसाद्य approached, कृताञ्जलिपुटः with folded hands, अभवत् remained, तस्मिन् when he, कृताञ्जलौ with folded hands, स्थिते stood, वानराश्च  monkeys also, तथा similarly, अभवन् did so.

data.v: तटाकमिव तद्दृष्ट्वा रामः कुड्मलपङ्कजम् । वानराणां महत्सैन्यं सुग्रीवे प्रीतिमानभूत् ।।
data.es: Rama was pleased on beholding the great army of monkeys standing, resembling a pond full of lotus buds.
data.anv: रामः Rama, कुड्मलपङ्कजम् filled with lotus buds, तटाकमिव resembling a pond, वानराणाम् of the vanaras, महत् great, सैन्यम् army, दृष्ट्वा after witnessing, सुग्रीवे at Sugriva, प्रीतिमान् pleased one, अभूत् appeared.
data.md: And when Sugrīva has folded his hands, the monkeys also did so. And beholding the mighty host of the monkeys resembling a tank filled with lotus buds, Rāma was well-pleased with Sugriva.

data.v: पादयोः पतितं मूर्ध्ना तमुत्थाप्य हरीश्वरम् । प्रेंणा च बहुमानाच्च राघवः परिषस्वजे ।।
data.es: Sugriva touched Rama's feet, bending his head down, and Rama lifted him up and embraced him with love and great regard.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, मूर्ध्ना bending the head, पादयोः at both his feet, पतितम् touching in prostration, तम् him, हरीश्वरम् Sugriva, उत्थाप्य lifted him up, प्रेम्णा च with love, बहुमानाच्च with great regard, परिषस्वजे he embraced.
data.md: And raising up the monkey-king who had bent his head at Rāma's feet, Rāghava embraced him from love and regard.

data.v: परिष्वज्य च धर्मात्मा निषीदेति ततोऽब्रवीत् । तं निषण्णं ततो दृष्ट्वा क्षितौ रामोऽब्रवीद्वचः ।।
data.es: Embracing him, Rama offered him a seat on the ground and said:
data.anv: ततः thereafter, धर्मात्मा righteous, रामः Rama, परिष्वज्य embracing, ततः then, निषीद sit, इति thus, अब्रवीत् said, वचः words, क्षितौ on the ground, निषण्णाम् sat down, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having embraced Sugrīva, that righteous one said to him, Be seated. And seeing Sugrīva seated on the ground, Rāma said,

data.v: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च काले यस्तु निषेवते । विभज्य सततं वीर स राजा हरिसत्तम ।।
data.es: 'O best among the heroic monkeys, a king who apportions his time properly towards pursuit of dharma, artha and kama is a hero and deserves to be a king.
data.anv: वीर: a hero, हरिसत्तम O best among monkeys, यः whoever, धर्मम् duty, अर्थं च wealth also, कामं च desire too, काले in time, विभज्य after dividing due time, निषेवते attends, सः such a man, राजा is king.

data.v: हित्वा धर्मं तथार्थं च कामं यस्तु निषेवते । स वृक्षाग्रे यथा सुप्तः पतितः प्रतिबुध्यते ।।
data.es: 'One who neglects dharma and artha and pursues only kama (sensuous enjoyment) is like a man asleep on top of the tree, waking up only to realize that he has fallen down.
data.anv: यः whoever, धर्मम् one's duty, तथा so also, अर्थं च pursuit of wealth also, हित्वा after giving up, कामम् desire, निषेवत् attends, सः he, वृक्षाग्रे on the tree top, सुप्तः इव as one lying, पतितः fallen down, प्रतिबुध्यते gets awakened.

data.v: अमित्राणां वधे युक्तो मित्राणां संग्रहे रतः । त्रिवर्गफलभोक्ता तु राजा धर्मेण युज्यते ।।
data.anv: अमित्राणाम् of enemies, वधे in slaying, युक्तः  right, मित्राणाम् of friends, सङ्ग्रहे in the acqusition of, रतः is engaged, राजा that king, धर्मेण with righteousness, युज्यते is associated, त्रिवर्गफलभोक्ता च enjoys the fruits of all the three (dharma, artha and kama) goals of life.
data.md: That king is verily virtuous that, engaged in uprooting foes and advancing friends, attends to all the three ends.

data.v: उद्योगसमयस्त्वेष प्राप्तः शत्रुविनाशन । संचिन्त्यतां हि पिङ्गेश हरिभिः सह मन्त्रिभिः ।।
data.es: 'O king of monkeys, slayer of enemies the time to act has arrived. Think of the strategies with your ministers and other monkeys.
data.anv: शत्रुविनाशन O slayer of enemies, पिङ्गेश O king of monkeys, एषः this, उद्योगसमयः time for enterprise, प्राप्तः set in, मन्त्रिभिः ministers, हरिभिः सह and with monkeys, सञ्चिन्त्यताम् think over.
data.md: O destroyer of foes, the time is come for exertion: do you, O lord of monkeys, bethink yourself along with your monkey ministers.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो रामं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Rama in deep distress, the monkey replied to him with folded hands, his throat choked with tears:
data.anv: आर्तेन  by the distressed, रामेण by Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः spoke, वानरः monkey, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, बाष्पगद्गदः voice choked, सबाष्पम् with sears, वाक्यम्  words, अब्रवीत् said

data.v: प्रनष्टा श्रीश्च कीर्तिश्च कपिराज्यं च शाश्वतम् । त्वत्प्रसादान्महाबाहो पुनः प्राप्तमिदं मया ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri my prosperity, fame and the permanent sovereignty of vanaras had been lost. It was regained by the grace of Rama.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, प्रणष्टा lost from me, श्री:च prosperity also, कीर्ति: च and fame, शाश्वतम् permanent, कपिराज्यं च and the kingdom of monkeys, इदम् this, रामप्रसादात् by the grace of Rama, मया by me, पुनः again, प्राप्तम् has been regained.
data.md: You son to Sumitrā, by the favour of Rāma have I received back my lost luck, my fame, and this eternal monarchy of the monkeys.

data.v: तव देवप्रसदाच्च भ्रातुश्च जयतां वर । कृतं न प्रतिकुर्याद्यः पुरुषाणां स दूषकः ।।
data.es: 'O victorious lord he who does not repay the help got through your grace and your brother's is despicable among men.
data.anv: देव O lord, जयतां वर best of the victorious men, तव your, भ्रातुश्च your brother's, प्रसादात् by the grace, च also, कृतम् accomplished, यः whoever, न प्रतिकुर्यात् not help in return, पुरुषाणाम् among men, स दूषकः the lowest.
data.md: He that, having received a good office, does not requite it, reapeth obloquy among persons.

data.v: एते वानरमुख्याश्च शतशः शत्रुसूदन । प्राप्ताश्चादाय बलिनः पृथिव्यां सर्ववानरान् ।।
data.es: 'O destroyer of enemies hundreds of strong vanara chiefs gathered from all over the earth have reached here.
data.anv: शत्रुसूदन destroyer of enemies, शतशः in hundreds, एते these, वानरमुख्याः chiefs of monkeys, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, बलिनः strong ones, सर्ववानरान् all the vanaras, आदाय gathering, प्राप्ताः have reached.
data.md: These hundreds of prime monkeys, O destroyer of enemies, have come here, bringing with them all the monkeys of the world.

data.v: ऋक्षाश्चावहिताः शूरा गोलाङ्गूलाश्च राघव । कान्तार वनदुर्गाणामभिज्ञा घोरदर्शनाः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama valiant bears of fierce appearance, also golangulas (a variety of monkeys with tails like cows') familiar with the inaccessible fortresses of forest have come. These monkeys are sons of divine beings and gandharvas who can assume any form at will. They are on their way along with their armies.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, कान्तार वनदुर्गाणाम् inaccessible fortresses of forests, घोरदर्शनाः of fierce  appearance, ऋक्षाश्च bears, अवाहिताः familiar with every place, शूराः valiant, गोलाङ्गूलाश्च golangulas also, देवगन्धर्वपुत्राश्च loins of divine beings, and gandharvas, कामरूपिणः  who can assume any form at their will, वानराश्च vanaras, स्वैः स्वैः with their, सैन्यैः armies, परिवृताः gathered, पथि on the way, वर्तन्ते are coming.

data.v: देवगन्धर्वपुत्राश्च वानराः कामरूपिणः । स्वैः स्वैः परिवृताः सैन्यैर्वर्तन्ते पथि राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Rama valiant bears of fierce appearance, also golangulas (a variety of monkeys with tails like cows') familiar with the inaccessible fortresses of forest have come. These monkeys are sons of divine beings and gandharvas who can assume any form at will. They are on their way along with their armies.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, कान्तार वनदुर्गाणाम् inaccessible fortresses of forests, घोरदर्शनाः of fierce  appearance, ऋक्षाश्च bears, अवाहिताः familiar with every place, शूराः valiant, गोलाङ्गूलाश्च golangulas also, देवगन्धर्वपुत्राश्च loins of divine beings, and gandharvas, कामरूपिणः  who can assume any form at their will, वानराश्च vanaras, स्वैः स्वैः with their, सैन्यैः armies, परिवृताः gathered, पथि on the way, वर्तन्ते are coming.

data.v: शतैः शतसहस्रैश्च कोटिभिश्च प्लवंगमाः । अयुतैश्चावृता वीरा शङ्कुभिश्च परंतप ।।
अर्बुदैरर्बुदशतैर्मध्यैश्चान्तैश्च वानराः । समुद्रैश्च परार्धैश्च हरयो हरियूथपाः ।।
आगमिष्यन्ति ते राजन्महेन्द्रसमविक्रमाः । मेरुमन्दरसंकाशा विन्ध्यमेरुकृतालयाः ।।
ते त्वामभिगमिष्यन्ति राक्षसं ये सबान्धवम् । निहत्य रावणं संख्ये ह्यानयिष्यन्ति मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'The monkeys who can kill ogre Ravana and his relatives in battle and bring back Maithili will be arriving shortly.
data.anv: ये those, संख्ये in war, सबान्धवम् with relatives, राक्षसम् ogre, रावणम् Ravana, निहत्य after killing, मैथिलीम् Maithili, आनयिष्यन्ति will bring her, ते they, त्वाम् you, अभिगमिष्यन्ति they will reach you.
data.md: They will join you for battling the fiend in the field; and, slaying Ravana in fight, shall bring Mithilā's daughter.

data.v: ततस्तमुद्योगमवेक्ष्य बुद्धिमा;न्हरिप्रवीरस्य निदेशवर्तिनः । बभूव हर्षाद्वसुधाधिपात्मजः; प्रबुद्धनीलोत्पलतुल्यदर्शनः ।।
data.es: The wise statesman, Rama observing the efforts of Sugriva and his attendants looked like a blooming blue lotus through delight.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of thirtyeighth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana, composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, बुद्धिमान् wise, वसुधाधिपात्मजः son to king of the earth (Rama), निदेशवर्तिनः those who take orders, हरिप्रवीरस्य of the monkey lord, तमुद्योगम् that effort, अवेक्ष्य observing, हर्षात् with delight, प्रबुद्धनीलोत्पलतुल्यदर्शनः appeared like a blooming blue lotus, बभूव remained.
data.md: Thereat the puissant son of the Earth's lord, witnessing the preparations made by the heroic monkey, remaining under his his command, appeared like a blown blue lotus.

data.v: इति ब्रुवाणं सुग्रीवं रामो धर्मभृतां वरः । बाहुभ्यां संपरिष्वज्य प्रत्युवाच कृताञ्जलिम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Sugriva who stood with folded hands, Rama, the foremost among the upholders of righteousness, hugged him and said:
data.anv: धर्मभृताम् among the upholders of righteousness, वरः foremost, रामः Rama, इति thus, ब्रुवाणम् spoke, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded hands, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, बाहुभ्याम् shoulders, सम्परिष्वज्य having hugged, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: As Sugrīva was speaking thus with joined hands, that best of the righteous, Rāma, embraced him with his arms, and then replied,

data.v: यदिन्द्रो वर्षते वर्षं न तच्चित्रं भवेद्भुवि । आदित्यो वा सहस्रांशुः कुर्याद्वितिमिरं नभः ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies, gentle Sugriva it will not be strange if Indra showers rain, if the Sun in the sky dispels darkness with his thousand rays, and if the Moon cools down the earth with his light, and a person like you helps his friend.
data.anv: परन्तप O scorcher of enemies, सौम्य O gentle one, इन्द्रः Indra, वर्षम् यत् वर्षते when he rains, सहस्रांशुः god with a thousand rays, वा or else, आदित्यः Sun, नभः sky, वितिमिरम् bright, कुर्यात् make, चन्द्रमाः Moon, पृथिवीं on the earth, रश्मिभिः with his rays, निर्मलाम् cool, कुर्यात् does, त्वद्विधः a person like you, मित्राणाम् for friends, प्रतिकुर्यात् help in turn, तत् that, चित्रम् strange, न भविष्यति will not be.

data.v: चन्द्रमा रश्मिभिः कुर्यात्पृथिवीं सौम्य निर्मलाम् । त्वद्विधो वापि मित्राणां प्रतिकुर्यात्परंतप ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies, gentle Sugriva it will not be strange if Indra showers rain, if the Sun in the sky dispels darkness with his thousand rays, and if the Moon cools down the earth with his light, and a person like you helps his friend.
data.anv: परन्तप O scorcher of enemies, सौम्य O gentle one, इन्द्रः Indra, वर्षम् यत् वर्षते when he rains, सहस्रांशुः god with a thousand rays, वा or else, आदित्यः Sun, नभः sky, वितिमिरम् bright, कुर्यात् make, चन्द्रमाः Moon, पृथिवीं on the earth, रश्मिभिः with his rays, निर्मलाम् cool, कुर्यात् does, त्वद्विधः a person like you, मित्राणाम् for friends, प्रतिकुर्यात् help in turn, तत् that, चित्रम् strange, न भविष्यति will not be.

data.v: एवं त्वयि न तच्चित्रं भवेद्यत्सौम्य शोभनम् । जानाम्यहं त्वां सुग्रीव सततं प्रियवादिनम् ।।
data.es: 'O gentle Sugriva this your help to me is not surprising. You always help your friends and speak in a pleasing manner.
data.anv: सौम्य gentle one, सुग्रीव Sugriva, एवम् that way, त्वयि you, शोभनम् well done, तत् that, चित्रम् surprising, न भवेत् will not be, त्वाम् you, सततम् always, प्रियवादिनम्  pleasing in talk, अहम् I, जानामि know.
data.md: I know, O Sugrīva, that you always speakst what is for my good.

data.v: त्वत्सनाथः सखे संख्ये जेतास्मि सकलानरीन् । त्वमेव मे सुहृन्मित्रं साहाय्यं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O friend I will win over all enemies in war supported by you.You are a goodhearted friend and you alone should help me.
data.anv: सखे O friend, त्वत्सनाथः one supported by you, सङ्ख्ये in war, सकलान् all, अरीन् enemies, जेताऽस्मि I will win over, सुहृत् goodhearted, मित्रम् friend, त्वमेव you alone, मे to me, साहाय्यम् help, कर्तुम् to render, अर्हसि it is proper on your part.
data.md: Assisted by you, my friend, I shall in battle vanquish all my foes. You being my friend and my ally, should assist me.

data.v: जहारात्मविनाशाय वैदेहीं राक्षसाधमः । वञ्चयित्वा तु पौलोमीमनुह्लादो यथा शचीम् ।।
data.es: Just as Anuhlada (son of Hiranyakasipu and brother of Prahlada) took away, Poulomi (Sachi, daughter of Puloma) deceiving Indra, this lowly demon took away Sita, daughter of the king of Videha.
data.anv: राक्षसाधमः lowly demon, वञ्चयित्वा after deceiving, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अनुह्लादः Anuhlada, पौलोमीम् Poulomi ( Indra's wife), शचीं यथा like Sachi, आत्मविनाशाय for his own destruction, जहार took away.
data.md: That worst of Rākșasas has carried away Maithilī, to bring down destruction upon himself, even as Anuhlāda ravished Puloma's daughter, Sachi, deceiving her sire.

data.v: नचिरात्तं हनिष्यामि रावणं निशितैः शरैः । पौलोम्याः पितरं दृप्तं शतक्रतुरिवारिहा ।।
data.es: 'I will kill Ravana with my sharp arrows just as Indra, (who had done a hundred sacrifices) killed the proud father of Poulomi.
data.anv: तं रावणम् that Ravana, न चिरात् very soon, अहवे in a battle, शतक्रतुः one who has done a hundred sacrifices, Indra, पौलोम्याः Pouloma's, दृप्तम् proud, पितरम् father, निशितैः with sharp ones, शरैः arrows, हनिष्यामि will kill.
data.md: That Rāvana I will at no distant date slay with my sharpened shafts, even as that slayer of enemies, he of an hundred sacrifices-slew the haughty father of Paulomi.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे चैव रजः समभिवर्तत । उष्णां तीव्रां सहस्रांशोश्छादयद्गगने प्रभाम् ।।
data.es: In the mean while the dust raised (by army of monkeys) all over obscured the intense heat from the sky and the radiance of the thousandrayed Sun.
data.anv: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे in the mean while, गगने in the sky, सहस्रांशोः thousandrayed Sun's, उष्णां तीव्राम् intense heat, प्रभाम् radiance, छादयत् covering, रजः dust, समभिवर्तत was raised.
data.md: Presently appeared volumes of dust, and the hot and fierce rays of the sun were hid in the sky.

data.v: दिशः पर्याकुलाश्चासन्रजसा तेन मूर्छिताः । चचाल च मही सर्वा सशैलवनकानना ।।
data.es: By the spreading of dust, the quarters were not visible.The earth including the mountains gardens and forests was shaken up.
data.anv: तेन by that, रजसा by the dust, मूर्छता by the spread, दिशः sides, पर्याकुलाश्च became mixed up,  सशैलवनकानना including mountains, gardens and forests, सर्वा all, मही च and earth, चचाल was shaken.
data.md: And darkened by the gloom, all sides became bewildered. And the entire earth with her mountains, forests, and wocds, trembled.

data.v: ततो नगेन्द्रसंकाशैस्तीक्ष्ण दंष्ट्रैर्महाबलैः । कृत्स्ना संछादिता भूमिरसंख्येयैः प्लवंगमैः ।।
data.md: Then the whole ground was covered with innumerable monkeys gifted with great strength, and having sharp teeth, and resembling kings of men.

data.v: निमेषान्तरमात्रेण ततस्तैर्हरियूथपैः । कोटीशतपरीवारैः कामरूपिभिरावृता ।।
नादेयैः पार्वतीयैश्च सामुद्रैश्च महाबलैः । हरिभिर्मेघनिर्ह्रादैरन्यैश्च वनचारिभिः ।।
तरुणादित्यवर्णैश्च शशिगौरैश्च वानरैः । पद्मकेसरवर्णैश्च श्वेतैर्मेरुकृतालयैः ।।
कोटीसहस्रैर्दशभिः श्रीमान्परिवृतस्तदा । वीरः शतबलिर्नाम वानरः प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Then appeared the glorious warrior named Satavali, followed by ten thousand crore of monkeys.
data.anv: तदा then, दशभिः by ten, कोटीसहस्रैः thousand crores, परिवृतः accompanied by, श्रीमान् glorious, वीरः warrior, शतवलिर्नाम named Satavali, वानरः monkey, प्रत्यदृश्यत appeared on the site.

data.v: ततः काञ्चनशैलाभस्ताराया वीर्यवान्पिता । अनेकैर्दशसाहस्रैः कोटिभिः प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: (Next came) the valiant father of Tara of golden complexion like mount Meru followed by ten thousand crore of vanaras.
data.anv: ततः then, काञ्चनशैलाभः appearing like the golden mountain (Meru), वीर्यवान् valiant, पिता father, दशसाहस्रैः by ten thousand, कोटिभिः by crores, अनेकैः and many, प्रत्यदृश्यत appeared with, ताराया Tara's.
data.md: Then, having the splendour of the Golden hill, the puissant sire of Tārā was seen at the head of many thousand kotis.

data.v: पद्मकेसरसंकाशस्तरुणार्कनिभाननः । बुद्धिमान्वानरश्रेष्ठः सर्ववानरसत्तमः ।।
data.es: Then arrived Kesari, the wise and illustrious monkey, foremost and the best among vanaras, father of Hanuman. He was of the colour of lotus filaments and his countenance was red like the early morning Sun. He was accompanied by many thousands of monkeys.
data.anv: पद्मकेसरसङ्काशः like lotus filaments in colour, तरुणार्कनिभाननः with the countenance red like the early morning Sun, बुद्धिमान् wise, वानरश्रेष्ठः foremost of vanaras, सर्ववानरसत्तमः the best among vanaras, हनुमतः Hanuman's, पिता father, श्रीमान् prosperous, केसरी Kesari, वानराणाम् of vanaras, अनेकैः many, बहुसाहस्रैः by many thousands, समन्वितः accompanied by, प्रत्यदृश्यत appeared.
data.md: And Hanuman's father, the graceful Kasarī, appeared in company with many thousands of monkeys.

data.v: अनीकैर्बहुसाहस्रैर्वानराणां समन्वितः । पिता हनुमतः श्रीमान्केसरी प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Then arrived Kesari, the wise and illustrious monkey, foremost and the best among vanaras, father of Hanuman. He was of the colour of lotus filaments and his countenance was red like the early morning Sun. He was accompanied by many thousands of monkeys.
data.anv: पद्मकेसरसङ्काशः like lotus filaments in colour, तरुणार्कनिभाननः with the countenance red like the early morning Sun, बुद्धिमान् wise, वानरश्रेष्ठः foremost of vanaras, सर्ववानरसत्तमः the best among vanaras, हनुमतः Hanuman's, पिता father, श्रीमान् prosperous, केसरी Kesari, वानराणाम् of vanaras, अनेकैः many, बहुसाहस्रैः by many thousands, समन्वितः accompanied by, प्रत्यदृश्यत appeared.
data.md: And Hanuman's father, the graceful Kasarī, appeared in company with many thousands of monkeys.

data.v: गोलाङ्गूलमहाराजो गवाक्षो भीमविक्रमः । वृतः कोटिसहस्रेण वानराणामदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Next arrived Gavaksha, king of Langurs (whose tail resembled the cow's), of fierceful courage surrounded by a thousand crore of vanaras.
data.anv: वानराणाम् of vanaras, कोटिसहस्रेण by a thousand crores, वृतः surrounded, गोलाङ्गूलमहाराजः king of Langur, भीमविक्रमः a warrior of fierce valour, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, अदृश्यत was seen
data.md: And Gavaksa-sovereign of Golangulas-endowed with dreadful might, appeared, surrounded by thousand koțis of monkeys.

data.v: ऋक्षाणां भीमवेगानां धूम्रः शत्रुनिबर्हणः । वृतः कोटिसहस्राभ्यां द्वाभ्यां समभिवर्तत ।।
data.es: Dhumra, destroyer of enemies, came next followed by two thousand crore of bears of terrible speed.
data.anv: शत्रुनिबर्हणः destroyer of enemies, धूम्रः Dhumra, भीमवेगानाम् of those of frightening speed, ऋक्षाणाम् of bears, द्वाभ्याम् with two, कोटिसहस्राभ्याम् thousand crores, समभिवर्तत arrived there.
data.md: And Dhūmra of bears endowed with terrific speed—destroyer of foes—appeared, surrounded by two thousand kotis.

data.v: महाचलनिभैर्घोरैः पनसो नाम यूथपः । आजगाम महावीर्यस्तिसृभिः कोटिभिर्वृतः ।।
data.es: Similarly, the great warrior named Panasa, leader of the troop, reported with three crore dreadful vanaras of the size of huge mountains.
data.anv: पनसो नाम Panasa by name, महावीर्यः a great warrior, यूथपः troop leader, तिसृभिः कोटिभिः by three crores, महाचलनिभैः by those resembling huge mountains, घोरैः by a dreadful one, वृतः surrounded by, आजगाम came.
data.md: And the leader of herds, named Panasa, of exceeding prowess, came, accompanied with three kotis, mighty and dreadful.

data.v: नीलाञ्जनचयाकारो नीलो नामाथ यूथपः । अदृश्यत महाकायः कोटिभिर्दशभिर्वृतः ।।
data.es: Then appeared Nila of huge body, dark like a mountain of collyrium accompanied by ten crore vanaras.
data.anv: अथ then, दशभिः कोटिभिः by ten crore, वृतः surrounded, नीलाञ्जनचयाकारः dark like a mountain of collyrium, महाकायः of huge body, नीलो नाम by name Nila, यूथपः leader, अदृश्यत appeared.
data.md: And the leader of herds, named Nīla, of huge body, resembling a mass of blue collyrium. appeared with ten kotis.

data.v: दरीमुखश्च बलवान्यूथपोऽभ्याययौ तदा । वृतः कोटिसहस्रेण सुग्रीवं समुपस्थितः ।।
data.es: Then the strong Darimukha, leader of a thousand crore monkeys approached Sugriva.
data.anv: तदा then, बलवान् strong, दरीमुखः Darimukha, यूथपः leader, कोटिसहस्रेण with one thousand crores, वृतः surrounded, अभ्याययौ came near, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, समुपस्थितः approached.
data.md: And that powerful leader of herdsDarimukha, came, sutrounded by thousands of kotis, and took up his post by Sugriva.

data.v: मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चोभावश्विपुत्रौ महावलौ । कोटिकोटिसहस्रेण वानराणामदृश्यताम् ।।
data.es: Two very powerful sons of Asvini, Mainda and Dvivida, appeared with a thousand crore vanaras.
data.anv: महाबलौ two very powerful, अश्विपुत्रौ two sons of Asvi, मैन्दश्च Mainda, द्विविदश्च Dvivida, उभौ both, वानराणाम् vanaras, कोटिकोटिसहस्रेण by a thousand crores, अदृश्यताम् appeared.
data.md: And Mainda and Dvivida-sons of Asvi both-of mighty strength, appeared with kotis upon thousands of koțis of monkeys.

data.v: ततः कोटिसहस्राणां सहस्रेण शतेन च । पृष्ठतोऽनुगतः प्राप्तो हरिभिर्गन्धमादनः ।।
data.es: Then came Gandhamadana with a hundred thousand crore of vanaras following him.
data.anv: ततः then, कोटिसहस्राणाम् of a thousand crore, सहस्रेण by a thousand, शतेन च by a hundred also, वानरैः with vanara, पृष्ठतः behind him, अनुगतः followed, गन्धमादन: Gandhamadana, प्राप्तः came.
data.md: Then, followed at his back by hundreds and thousands of koțis, came the monkey, Gandhamādana.

data.v: ततः पद्मसहस्रेण वृतः शङ्कुशतेन च । युवराजोऽङ्गदः प्राप्तः पितृतुल्यपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: Then arrived the heir apparent, Angada, whose prowess is comparable to that of his father with him came a thousand padmas and a hundred sankus of followers.
data.anv: ततः then, पितुः तुल्यपराक्रमः comparable in prowess to his father, युवराजः heir apparent, अङ्गदः Angada, पद्मसहस्रेण with a thousand Padmas (trillion), शङ्कुशतेन च one hundred times Sanku (ten trillion), वृतः surrounded, प्राप्तः arrived.
data.md: Then came the young prince Angada, in prowess resembling his sire, accompanied by a thousand padmas and an hundred sankhas.

data.v: ततस्ताराद्युतिस्तारो हरिर्भीमपराक्रमः । पञ्चभिर्हरिकोटीभिर्दूरतः प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: And Tara (brother of Ruma's father) of terrific valour shining like a star showed up at a distance with five crore vanaras.
data.anv: ततः then, ताराद्युतिः shining like a star, भीमपराक्रमः a warrior of terrific valour, तारः Tara, हरिः vanara, पञ्चभिः with five, हरिकोटीभिः with crores of vanaras, दूरतः at a distance, प्रत्यदृश्यत was seen.
data.md: Then appeared at a distance, accompanied by five koțis of monkeys endowed with dreadful prowess,-Tārā, having the splendour of a star.

data.v: इन्द्रजानुः कपिर्वीरो यूथपः प्रत्यदृश्यत । एकादशानां कोटीनामीश्वरस्तैश्च संवृतः ।।
data.es: Then Indrajanu the troop leader and chief of vanaras appeared along with eleven crore monkeys.
data.anv: एकादशानां कोटीनाम् of eleven crores of vanaras, ईश्वरः chief, वीरःhero, यूथपः leader of troop, इन्द्रजानुः Indrajanu, कपिः vanara, तैः with them, समावृतः surrounded, प्रत्यदृश्यत appeared.
data.md: And then appeared Indrajāni, the heroic monkey and leader of herds-lord of eleven kotis-surrounded by them.

data.v: ततो रम्भस्त्वनुप्राप्तस्तरुणादित्यसंनिभः । अयुतेन वृतश्चैव सहस्रेण शतेन च ।।
data.es: Thereafter Rambha of the colour of the rising Sun brought together an army of one thousand and one hundred ayuta troops.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, तरुणादित्यसन्निभः of the colour of the rising Sun, रम्भः Rambha, अयुतेना by one ayuta (10,000), सहस्रेण by a thousand, शतेन च by a hundred, वृतः surrounded, अनुप्राप्तः arrived
data.md: Then followed Rambha, resembling the infant sun, accompanied by an ayuta, a thousand, and an hundred.

data.v: ततो यूथपतिर्वीरो दुर्मुखो नाम वानरः । प्रत्यदृश्यत कोटिभ्यां द्वाभ्यां परिवृतो बली ।।
data.es: Thereafter the mighty hero, leader of the troop, by name Durmukha appeared with two crore vanaras.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, यूथपतिः leader of the troop, वीरः hero, बली strong one, दुर्मुखो नाम Durmukha by name, वानरः vanara, द्वाभ्याम् with two, कोटीभ्याम् with crores, परिवृतः surrounded, प्रत्यदृश्यत appeared.
data.md: Then appeared to the view the stout monkey, named Durmukha, heroic lord of herds, surrounded by two koțis.

data.v: कैलासशिखराकारैर्वानरैर्भीमविक्रमैः । वृतः कोटिसहस्रेण हनुमान्प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Next arrived Gavaksha, king of Langurs (whose tail resembled the cow's), of fierceful courage surrounded by a thousand crore of vanaras.
data.anv: वानराणाम् of vanaras, कोटिसहस्रेण by a thousand crores, वृतः surrounded, गोलाङ्गूलमहाराजः king of Langur, भीमविक्रमः a warrior of fierce valour, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, अदृश्यत was seen
data.md: And Gavaksa-sovereign of Golangulas-endowed with dreadful might, appeared, surrounded by thousand koțis of monkeys.

data.v: नलश्चापि महावीर्यः संवृतो द्रुमवासिभिः । कोटीशतेन संप्राप्तः सहस्रेण शतेन च ।।
data.es: Valiant Nala also arrived surrounded by a hundred crore and a hundred thousand treedwellers (monkeys).
data.anv: महावीर्यः valiant, नलश्चापि Nala also, कोटीशतेन by a hundred crores, सहस्रेण by a thousand, शतेन च and by hundreds, द्रुमवासिभिः by the tree dwellers(monkeys), संवृतः surrounded by, सम्प्राप्तः arrived.
data.md: And the exceedingly energetic Nala came, attended with an hundred kotis, a thousand, and an hundred monkeys, living in trees.

data.v: शरभः कुमुदो वह्निर्वानरो रम्भ एव च । एते चान्ये च बहवो वानराः कामरूपिणः ।।
आवृत्य पृथिवीं सर्वां पर्वतांश्च वनानि च । आप्लवन्तः प्लवन्तश्च गर्जन्तश्च प्लवंगमाः । अभ्यवर्तन्त सुग्रीवं सूर्यमभ्रगणा इव ।।
data.es: The monkeys came leaping, jumping and roaring in enthusiasm and surrounded Sugriva just as clouds surround the Sun.
data.anv: प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, आप्लवन्तः leaping in enthusiasm, प्लवन्तश्च and jumping, गर्जन्तश्च and roaring, सूर्यम् Sun, अभ्रगणा इव like the clouds, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, अभ्यवर्तन्त approached.
data.md: And all the monkeys of the world were some of them coming and others putting up. And monkeys-some of them dripping, and some leaping, and some roaring-gathered round Sugriva, like clouds gathering round the sun.

data.v: कुर्वाणा बहुशब्दांश्च प्रहृष्टा बलशालिनः । शिरोभिर्वानरेन्द्राय सुग्रीवाय न्यवेदयन् ।।
data.es: The leaders of monkeys possesing sturdy shoulders made many kinds of noises and reported to Sugriva, bending their heads in reverence.
data.anv: प्रहृष्टाः happy ones, बाहुशालिनः of sturdy shoulders, बहुशब्दान् many kinds of noises, कुर्वाणाः while they made, शिरोभिः with their heads, वानरेन्द्राय to the lord of monkeys, सुग्रीवाय to Sugriva, न्यवेदयन् reported.
data.md: And, crying in various tones, prime monkeys furnished with arms, with bent heads spoke humbly to that lord of monkeys—Sugrīva.

data.v: अपरे वानरश्रेष्ठाः संगम्य च यथोचितम् । सुग्रीवेण समागम्य स्थिताः प्राञ्जलयस्तदा ।।
data.es: Thereafter the vanaras came close to Sugriva freely and on reaching him stood, offering salutations with folded hands.
data.anv: अपरे others, वानरश्रेष्ठाः foremost of vanaras, यथोचितम् in a suitable manner, सङ्गम्य after coming together, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, समागम्य after reaching, तदा then, प्राञ्जलयः with folded hands in salutation, स्थिताः stood.
data.md: And other foremost of monkeys, gathering together duly, came before Sugrīva with joined hands.

data.v: सुग्रीवस्त्वरितो रामे सर्वांस्तान्वानरर्षभान् । निवेदयित्वा धर्मज्ञः स्थितः प्राञ्जलिरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, knower of dharma, at once presented all the prominent vanaras to Rama, and standing with folded hands said.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of dharma, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, त्वरितः at once, प्राञ्जलिः with folded hands, स्थितः stood, वानरर्षभान् prominent vanaras, तान् them, सर्वान् all, रामे to Rama, निवेदयित्वा having presented, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Sugrīva standing with joined hands, expeditiously informed Rāma of the arrival of the monkey-leaders in hot haste; and then spoke (to them, saying, O chiefs of monkeys, stationing the forces duly near mountain-rills and all the woods, let him that is conversant with the army, ascertain who have come and who have not.

data.v: यथा सुखं पर्वतनिर्झरेषु; वनेषु सर्वेषु च वानरेन्द्राः । निवेशयित्वा विधिवद्बलानि; बलं बलज्ञः प्रतिपत्तुमीष्टे ।।
data.es: Sugriva told the chiefs to station the forces by the side of swift mountain streams, in forests, and hills and ascertain their exact number.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वानरेन्द्राः best of vanaras, पर्वतनिझरेषु by the side of swift mountain streams, सर्वेषु in all, वनेषु च in forests, यथासुखम् comfortably settled, विधिवत् as per tradition, बलानि army, निवेशयित्वा after lodging, बलज्ञः know the strength, बलम् of army, प्रतिपत्तुम् to know, ईष्टे decided.

data.v: अथ राजा समृद्धार्थः सुग्रीवः प्लवगेश्वरः । उवाच नरशार्दूलं रामं परबलार्दनम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, lord of monkeys, who was supported by a massive army informed Rama, the tiger among men and a crusher of the enemy army
data.anv: प्लवगेश्वरः lord of monkeys, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, समृद्धार्थः supported by massive army, अथ then, नरशार्दूलम्  tiger among men, परबलार्दनम् who could crush enemy army, रामम् to Rama, उवाच said.
data.md: Then that lord of monkeys, the successful Sugrīva, spoke to Rāma-lion among men and destroyer of hostile hosts-saying,

data.v: आगता विनिविष्टाश्च बलिनः कामरूपिणः । वानरेन्द्रा महेन्द्राभा ये मद्विषयवासिनः ।।
data.es: 'The vanaras living in my kingdom have come and have settled down. They are strong and huge like elephants and they can assume any form at will.
data.anv: ये those, मद्विषयवासिनः residing in my kingdom, बलिनः strong, कामरूपिण: who can assume any form at will, वारणेन्द्रभा: huge like elephants, वानरेन्द्राः vanara heroes, आगताः have come, विनिविष्टाश्च have settled down here.
data.md: Those foremost monkeys endued strength and capable of wearing any shape at will, and possessed of the splendour of the mishty Indra,-that inhabit my territories, have come and stationed themselves.

data.v: त इमे बहुसाहस्रैर्हरिभिर्भीमविक्रमैः । आगता वानरा घोरा दैत्यदानवसंनिभाः ।।
data.es: 'Dreadful monkeys, powerful monkeys of fierce valour who resemble demons in form, have arrived.
data.anv: घोराः dreadful, दैत्यदानवसन्निभाः resemble daityas and demons in form, ते those, इमे वानराः vanaras,  बहुविक्रान्तैः very powerful, हरिभिः monkeys, भीमविक्रमैः of frightening valour, आगताः have arrived.
data.md: And in company with many thousands and innumerable ones that have shewn their ability in many a field, have come monkeys dreadful, and resembling Daityas and Dänavas.

data.v: ख्यातकर्मापदानाश्च बलवन्तो जितक्लमाः । पराक्रमेषु विख्याता व्यवसायेषु चोत्तमाः ।।
data.es: Powerful vanaras who have earned fame for their valiant deeds in the past, those who are indefatigable and wellknown for their valour having gained preeminence through their efforts and living on several mountains, those who can move on the earth as well as water, crores of them have arrived.
data.anv: राम O Rama, ख्यातकर्मापदानाश्च earned fame for their valiant deeds in the past, बलवन्तः powerful ones, जितक्लमाः indefatigable, पराक्रमेषु in might, विख्याताः famous, व्यवसायेषु in making efforts, उत्तमाः best, पृथिव्यम्बुचराः who can move on earth as well as water, नानानगनिवासिनः living on several mountains, इमे they, वानराः vanaras, कोट्यग्रश: crores of them, तव your, किङ्कराः vanaras, प्राप्ताः have come.
data.md: And these monkeys-dreadful, and resembling Daityas and Dānvas are accompanied by powerful monkeys of terrific prowess, who have displayed their virtue in many a field, and are of famed renown in battle and, powerful, and who have mastered languor and are celebrated in prowess and sterling in their profession.

data.v: पृथिव्यम्बुचरा राम नानानगनिवासिनः । कोट्यग्रश इमे प्राप्ता वानरास्तव किंकराः ।।
data.es: Powerful vanaras who have earned fame for their valiant deeds in the past, those who are indefatigable and wellknown for their valour having gained preeminence through their efforts and living on several mountains, those who can move on the earth as well as water, crores of them have arrived.
data.anv: राम O Rama, ख्यातकर्मापदानाश्च earned fame for their valiant deeds in the past, बलवन्तः powerful ones, जितक्लमाः indefatigable, पराक्रमेषु in might, विख्याताः famous, व्यवसायेषु in making efforts, उत्तमाः best, पृथिव्यम्बुचराः who can move on earth as well as water, नानानगनिवासिनः living on several mountains, इमे they, वानराः vanaras, कोट्यग्रश: crores of them, तव your, किङ्कराः vanaras, प्राप्ताः have come.
data.md: O Rāma, these koțis of apes that have arrived, inhabiting earth and water and various mountainous tracts, are at your service.

data.v: निदेशवर्तिनः सर्वे सर्वे गुरुहिते रताः । अभिप्रेतमनुष्ठातुं तव शक्ष्यन्त्यरिंदम ।।
data.es: 'O Rama,the subduer of foes all of them will follow your command.They are engaged in seeking the wellbeing of elders and can fulfil your wish.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O subduer of foes, सर्वे all, निदेशवर्तिनः follow your orders, सर्वे all, गुरुहिते in the wellbeing of the elders, रताः engaged, तव your, अभिप्रेतम् your wish, अनुष्ठातुम् to fulfil, शक्ष्यन्ति are capable.
data.md: All abide by your command all are intent upon the welfare of their master, and, O subduer of foes, they are competent to bring about your end.

data.v: यन्मन्यसे नरव्याघ्र प्राप्तकालं तदुच्यताम् । तत्सैन्यं त्वद्वशे युक्तमाज्ञापयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O tiger among men announce the proper time for action. This army is at your command. Command them.
data.anv: नरव्याघ्र O tiger among men, यत् such that, प्राप्तकालम् proper time, मन्यसे if you think, तत् that, उच्यताम् may be made known, त्वद्वशे at your command, युक्तम् proper, तत्सैन्यम् this army, आज्ञापयितुम्  you may order, अर्हसि you may.
data.md: If, O lion among men, you conceive that the time is ripe, tell it (to me). It behoves you to command those forces, remaining under your sway.

data.v: काममेषामिदं कार्यं विदितं मम तत्त्वतः । तथापि तु यथा तत्त्वमाज्ञापयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.anv: इदम् this, कार्यम् task, मम to me, तत्त्वतः  in principle, एवम् that way, विदितं कामम् is known to me, तथापि even then, यथातत्त्वम् properly, आज्ञापयितुम् to order, अर्हसि you may.
data.md: Although I am full well acquainted with the work in which they are to be employed, yet you ought to order them as to what they are to accomplish.

data.v: तथा ब्रुवाणं सुग्रीवं रामो दशरथात्मजः । बाहुभ्यां संपरिष्वज्य इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing Sugriva who stood with folded hands, Rama, the foremost among the upholders of righteousness, hugged him and said:
data.anv: धर्मभृताम् among the upholders of righteousness, वरः foremost, रामः Rama, इति thus, ब्रुवाणम् spoke, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded hands, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, बाहुभ्याम् shoulders, सम्परिष्वज्य having hugged, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: As Sugrīva was speaking thus with joined hands, that best of the righteous, Rāma, embraced him with his arms, and then replied,

data.v: ज्ञायतां सौम्य वैदेही यदि जीवति वा न वा । स च देशो महाप्राज्ञ यस्मिन्वसति रावणः ।।
data.es: 'O wise warrior I wish to know whether Vaidehi is alive or not. Let the kingdom of Ravana be found out.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञ O very wise one, मम my, वैदेही Vaidehi, जीवति वा alive or, न वा not or, रावणः Ravana, यस्मिन् in whichever, वसति resides, सः he, देशः in a place, च and, ज्ञायताम् it may be found out.
data.md: O placid one, do you learn whether Videha's daughter is alive or not; as well as ascertain the country, where, O you endowed with eminent wisdom,.liveth Ravana.

data.v: अधिगम्य च वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च । प्राप्तकालं विधास्यामि तस्मिन्काले सह त्वया ।।
data.es: 'On locating Vaidehi in the kingdom of Ravana I shall take up proper course of action in conjunction with you.
data.anv: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi,रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं home, च and, अधिगम्य going there, तस्मिन्काले at that time, त्वयासह in conjunction with you, प्राप्तकालम् at the right time, विधास्यामि I will take action.
data.md: Having come at Vaidehi and Ravana's abode, shall I then appoint the time along with you.

data.v: नाहमस्मिन्प्रभुः कार्ये वानरेश न लक्ष्मणः । त्वमस्य हेतुः कार्यस्य प्रभुश्च प्लवगेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys neither I nor my brother Lakshmana should command the monkeys. You are the right person to do it.
data.anv: प्लवगेश्वर O lord of monkeys, वानरेश king of vanaras, अहम् I, अस्मिन् in this, कार्ये in the task, प्रभुः  commanders, न not, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, न  not, त्वम् you, अस्य of this, कार्यस्य of the task, हेतुः means, प्रभुश्च lord.
data.md: O lord of monkeys, I am not the master in this matter, nor Lakşmaņa: you are the cause of this undertaking, as well as, O monarch of monkeys, the lord.

data.v: त्वमेवाज्ञापय विभो मम कार्यविनिश्चयम् । त्वं हि जानासि यत्कार्यं मम वीर न संशयः ।।
data.es: 'O king you have understood the task to be performed and, therefore, issue orders without the least hesitation.
data.anv: विभो O king, मम to me, कार्यविनिश्चयम् understood the task to be performed, त्वमेव you only, आज्ञापय you order, वीर hero, मम my, यत् कार्यम् that task, त्वम् you, जानासि हि you are aware, संशयः  doubt न no.
data.md: Do you therefore, O lord, command these as to what is to be done by them in my behalf. O hero, you certainly know my business.

data.v: सुहृद्द्वितीयो विक्रान्तः प्राज्ञः कालविशेषवित् । भवानस्मद्धिते युक्तः सुकृतार्थोऽर्थवित्तमः ।।
data.es: 'You are my second friend (Lakshmana being the first). You are valiant as well as wise. You are aware of timely action. You are interested in my wellbeing. You are capable. You know my purpose. You are a startegic planner'. (The present purpose is to plan the course of action. That is artha. Sugriva knows this artha very well).
data.anv: भवान् yourself, सुहृत् friend, द्वितीयो second friend, विक्रान्तः valiant, प्राज्ञः wise, कालविशेषवित् knower of timely action, अस्मध्दिते in our wellbeing, युक्तः capable, सुकृतार्थः strategic planner,  अर्थवित्तमः  knower of present purpose.
data.md: My second friend (Laksmana being first), you potent, wise, conversant with seasonableness, cognisant of profit, and engaged in our welfare.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो विनतं नाम यूथपम् । अब्रवीद्राम साम्निध्ये लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः । शैलाभं मेघनिर्घोषमूर्जितं प्लवगेश्वरम् ।।
data.es: 'In response to Rama's desire, Sugriva beckoned a troopleader called Vinata who was wellbuilt and lofty like a mountain. And thundering like a cloud, said to him in the presence of Rama and wise Lakshmana:
data.anv: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been asked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रामसान्निध्ये in the presence of Rama, धीमतः  learned, लक्ष्मणस्य च Lakshmana's, यूथपम् a troop leader, शैलाभम् lofty like a mountain, मेघनिर्घोषम्  who roared like a thunderous cloud, ऊर्जितम् wellbuilt body, विनतं नाम called Vinata, प्लवगेश्वरम् lord of monkeys, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: सोमसूर्यात्मजैः सार्धं वानरैर्वानरोत्तम । देशकालनयैर्युक्तः कार्याकार्यविनिश्चये ।।
data.es: 'O foremost of the vanaras march forward with the sons of Moon and Sun, followed by one lakh swift monkeys towards the eastern direction full of mountains, gardens, and forests. Endowed with political wisdom, you are capable of taking right decision in accordance with time and place.
data.anv: वानरोत्तम O foremost of vanaras, देशकालनयैः with political wisdom in accordance with time and place, युक्तः endowed with, कार्यविनिश्चये in taking right decision, सोमसूर्यात्मजै along with sons of Sun and Moon, वानरैः सार्धम् followed by the vanaras, तरस्विनाम् of swift ones, वानराणाम् of vanaras, शतसहस्रेण with one hundred thousand, वृतः surrounded, सशैलवनकाननाम्  with mountains, gardens and forests, अधिगच्छ march forward, पूर्वाम्  to the eastern, दिशं direction.

data.v: वृतः शतसहस्रेण वानराणां तरस्विनाम् । अधिगच्छ दिशं पूर्वां सशैलवनकाननाम् ।।
data.es: 'O foremost of the vanaras march forward with the sons of Moon and Sun, followed by one lakh swift monkeys towards the eastern direction full of mountains, gardens, and forests. Endowed with political wisdom, you are capable of taking right decision in accordance with time and place.
data.anv: वानरोत्तम O foremost of vanaras, देशकालनयैः with political wisdom in accordance with time and place, युक्तः endowed with, कार्यविनिश्चये in taking right decision, सोमसूर्यात्मजै along with sons of Sun and Moon, वानरैः सार्धम् followed by the vanaras, तरस्विनाम् of swift ones, वानराणाम् of vanaras, शतसहस्रेण with one hundred thousand, वृतः surrounded, सशैलवनकाननाम्  with mountains, gardens and forests, अधिगच्छ march forward, पूर्वाम्  to the eastern, दिशं direction.

data.v: तत्र सीतां च वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च । मार्गध्वं गिरिदुर्गेषु वनेषु च नदीषु च ।।
data.es: 'Search for Sita in the abode of Ravana, on mountain peaks and river banks and in forests.
data.anv: तत्र there, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, सीतां च Sita also, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च in the abode, गिरिशृङ्गेषु on the mountain peaks, वनेषु च and in the forests, नदीषु च and river banks, मार्गध्वम् you may search for.

data.v: नदीं भागीरथीं रम्यां सरयूं कौशिकीं तथा । कालिन्दीं यमुनां रम्यां यामुनं च महागिरिम् ।।
सरस्वतीं च सिन्धुं च शोणं मणिनिभोदकम् । महीं कालमहीं चैव शैलकाननशोभिताम् ।।
ब्रह्ममालान्विदेहांश्च मालवान्काशिकोसलान् । मागधांश्च महाग्रामान्पुण्ड्रान्वङ्गांस्तथैव च ।।
पत्तनं कोशकाराणां भूमिं च रजताकराम् । सर्वमेतद्विचेतव्यं मृगयद्भिर्ततस्ततः ।।
रामस्य दयितां भार्यां सीतां दशरतः स्नुषाम् । समुद्रमवगाढांश्च पर्वतान्पत्तनानि च ।।
मन्दरस्य च ये कोटिं संश्रिताः केचिदायताम् । कर्णप्रावरणाश्चैव तथा चाप्योष्ठकर्णकाः ।।
घोरा लोहमुखाश्चैव जवनाश्चैकपादकाः । अक्षया बलवन्तश्च पुरुषाः पुरुषादकाः ।।
किराताः कर्णचूडाश्च हेमाङ्गाः प्रियदर्शनाः । आममीनाशनास्तत्र किराता द्वीपवासिनः ।।
अन्तर्जलचरा घोरा नरव्याघ्रा इति श्रुताः । एतेषामालयाः सर्वे विचेयाः काननौकसः ।।
गिरिभिर्ये च गम्यन्ते प्लवनेन प्लवेन च । रत्नवन्तं यवद्वीपं सप्तराज्योपशोभितम् ।।
सुवर्णरूप्यकं चैव सुवर्णाकरमण्डितम् । यवद्वीपमतिक्रम्य शिशिरो नाम पर्वतः ।।
दिवं स्पृशति शृङ्गेण देवदानवसेवितः । एतेषां गिरिदुर्गेषु प्रतापेषु वनेषु च ।।
रावणः सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः । ततः समुद्रद्वीपांश्च सुभीमान्द्रष्टुमर्हथ ।।
तत्रासुरा महाकायाश्छायां गृह्णन्ति नित्यशः । ब्रह्मणा समनुज्ञाता दीर्घकालं बुभुक्षिताः ।।
data.es: 'Demons of huge bodies catch the shadows of passersby in that place as they have been hungry for long and have the permission of Brahma to do so.
data.anv: तत्र there, दीर्घकालम् for a long time, बुभुक्षिताः very hungry people, महाकायाः those of huge body, असुराः demons, ब्रह्मणा by Brahma, समनुज्ञाताः have been permitted, नित्यम् ever, छायाम् shadow, गृह्णन्ति will be catching.
data.md: There, huge-bodied Asuras, hungering for a long period, permitted by Brahmā, capture creatures, resorting to shades.

data.v: तं कालमेघप्रतिमं महोरगनिषेवितम् । अभिगम्य महानादं तीर्थेनैव महोदधिम् ।।
data.es: 'Reach out to the great roaring ocean which looks like a black cloud at the time of dissolution, inhabited by great serpents.Go through the bank of the river, and touch the frightening sea named Lohita of red coloured water.You will see a huge silkcotton tree in that place.
data.anv: कालमेघप्रतिमम् looking like black clouds at the time of dissolution, महोरगनिषेवितम् inhabited by great serpents, महानादम् roaring, महोदधिम् great ocean, रक्तजलं with red colured water, तीर्थेनैव through the river bank, अभिगम्य after reaching there, लोहितं नाम called Lohita, सागरम् sea, गत्वा going there, बृहतीम् a huge one, ताम् that one, कूटशाल्मलीम् Salmali tree (silkcotton tree), प्रेक्ष्यथ seeing, चैव also.
data.md: And adroitly arriving at that great sea, like to clouds at the universal dissolution, inhabited by mighty snakes, sending loud sounds.

data.v: ततो रक्तजलं भीमं लोहितं नाम सागरम् । गता द्रक्ष्यथ तां चैव बृहतीं कूटशाल्मलीम् ।।
data.es: 'Reach out to the great roaring ocean which looks like a black cloud at the time of dissolution, inhabited by great serpents.Go through the bank of the river, and touch the frightening sea named Lohita of red coloured water.You will see a huge silkcotton tree in that place.
data.anv: कालमेघप्रतिमम् looking like black clouds at the time of dissolution, महोरगनिषेवितम् inhabited by great serpents, महानादम् roaring, महोदधिम् great ocean, रक्तजलं with red colured water, तीर्थेनैव through the river bank, अभिगम्य after reaching there, लोहितं नाम called Lohita, सागरम् sea, गत्वा going there, बृहतीम् a huge one, ताम् that one, कूटशाल्मलीम् Salmali tree (silkcotton tree), प्रेक्ष्यथ seeing, चैव also.

data.v: गृहं च वैनतेयस्य नानारत्नविभूषितम् । तत्र कैलाससंकाशं विहितं विश्वकर्मणा ।।
data.es: 'You would see there a house of Garuda constructed by Visvakarma. It looks like the Kailasa mountain and is adorned with different kinds of gems.
data.anv: तत्र there, नानारत्नविभूषितम् adorned with diffrent kinds of gems, कैलाससङ्काशम् looking like the Kailasa mountain, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, विहितम् constructed, वैनतेयस्य Garuda's, गृहम् house, च also.

data.v: तत्र शैलनिभा भीमा मन्देहा नाम राक्षसाः । शैलशृङ्गेषु लम्बन्ते नानारूपा भयावहाः ।।
data.es: 'There are frightening demons called Mandehas of different forms, fearsome as huge mountains hanging down the mountain peaks.
data.anv: तत्र there, शैलशृङ्गेषु on the mountain cliffs, शैलनिभा: huge as mountain, भीमाः frightening, नानारूपाः of different forms, भयावहाः fearsome, मन्देहाः नाम called Mandehas, राक्षसाः demons, लम्बन्ते will be hanging down.

data.v: ते पतन्ति जले नित्यं सूर्यस्योदयनं प्रति । अभितप्ताश्च सूर्येण लम्बन्ते स्म पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: 'Those demons keep dropping down in water at the time of Sunrise every day, by the power of Gayatri mantras recited by brahmins scorched by the heat of the Sun. Again and again they keep hanging on to the cliffs.
data.anv: ते those, राक्षसाः demons, अहन्यहनि every day, सूर्योदयनं प्रति at the time of Sunrise, नित्यम् always, सूर्येण by the Sun's heat, अभितप्ताः scorched, ब्रह्मतेजोभिः by the power of mantras recited by brahmins, निहताः dead, जले in water, पतन्ति drop down, पुनः पुनः again and again, लम्बन्ते स्म keep hanging on.
data.md: Day after day at sunrise, these Rākşasas heated (by solar rays) and struck dead by Brahmā energy,* again and again (hang on the crags). *The commentator explains: energy darted from the three orders.

data.v: ततः पाण्डुरमेघाभं क्षीरौदं नाम सागरम् । गता द्रक्ष्यथ दुर्धर्षा मुखा हारमिवोर्मिभिः ।।
data.es: 'You who are unassailable by the enemies, will see the milky ocean appearing like clouds, resembling a pearl necklace with its rows of waves.
data.anv: दुर्धर्षाः one who is unassailable by the enemies, ततः then, गत्वा after going, पाण्डुरमेघाभम् appearing like white clouds, ऊर्मिभिः white waves, मुक्ताहारमिव like pearl chain, क्षीरोदं नाम  milky ocean by name, सागरम् ocean, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

data.v: तस्य मध्ये महाश्वेत ऋषभो नाम पर्वतः । दिव्यगन्धैः कुसुमितै रजतैश्च नगैर्वृतः ।।
data.es: 'In the midst of that ocean stands a majestic white mountain named Rishaba surrounded by trees filled with silver flowers emitting wonderful fragrance.There is also a lake named Sudarsana with glittering silver lotuses having gleaming golden filaments. Royal swans inhabit these surroundings.
data.anv: तस्य मध्ये in the middle, दिव्यगन्धैः with wonderful fragrances, कुसुमितैः flowering, राजितैः  glowing, नगैः with mountains, वृतः surrounded, ऋषभो नाम called Rishaba, श्वेतः white, पर्वतः mountain, ज्वलितैः with glittering, हेमकेसरैः with golden filaments, राजतैः with silver, पद्मैः with lotuses, राजहंसैः with royal swans, समाकुलम् surrounded, नाम्ना known as, सुदर्शनं नाम called Sudarsana, सरश्च lake.

data.v: सरश्च राजतैः पद्मैर्ज्वलितैर्हेमकेसरैः । नाम्ना सुदर्शनं नाम राजहंसैः समाकुलम् ।।
data.es: 'In the midst of that ocean stands a majestic white mountain named Rishaba surrounded by trees filled with silver flowers emitting wonderful fragrance.There is also a lake named Sudarsana with glittering silver lotuses having gleaming golden filaments. Royal swans inhabit these surroundings.
data.anv: तस्य मध्ये in the middle, दिव्यगन्धैः with wonderful fragrances, कुसुमितैः flowering, राजितैः  glowing, नगैः with mountains, वृतः surrounded, ऋषभो नाम called Rishaba, श्वेतः white, पर्वतः mountain, ज्वलितैः with glittering, हेमकेसरैः with golden filaments, राजतैः with silver, पद्मैः with lotuses, राजहंसैः with royal swans, समाकुलम् surrounded, नाम्ना known as, सुदर्शनं नाम called Sudarsana, सरश्च lake.

data.v: विबुधाश्चारणा यक्षाः किंनराः साप्सरोगणाः । हृष्टाः समभिगच्छन्ति नलिनीं तां रिरंसवः ।।
data.es: 'The deities, called charanas, yakshas and kinneras, also apsarasas keep coming there to stoll by that lotus pond.
data.anv: विबुधाः deities, चारणाः charanas, यक्षाः yakshas, किन्नराश्च even kinneras, अप्सरोगणाः groups of apasaras, हृष्टाः joyfully, रिरंसवः those desirous of strolling, तां that, नलिनीम् lotus pond, समभिगच्छन्ति keep coming.
data.md: Desirous of sport, resort to this tank delighted troops of Vivudhas and Charanas, Yaksas, Kinnaras and Apsarās.

data.v: क्षीरोदं समतिक्रम्य ततो द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः । जलोदं सागरश्रेष्ठं सर्वभूतभयावहम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys going beyond the milky ocean you will see the seas most dreadful to all creatures.
data.anv: वानराः O monkeys, क्षीरोदम् milky ocean, समतिक्रम्य going beyond, सर्वभूतभयावहम् most dreadful to all creatures, जलोदम् ocean, सागरम् sea, शीघ्रं swiftly, तदा then, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

data.v: तत्र तत्कोपजं तेजः कृतं हयमुखं महत् । अस्याहुस्तन्महावेगमोदनं सचराचरम् ।।
data.es: 'Here is born Hayamukha, out of the fastspreading fire of anger of the ocean. Its movable and immovable creatures constitute his food.
data.anv: तत्र there, तत्कोपजम् born out of his anger, महत् great, हयमुखम् face of horse, तेजः bright, कृतम् is created, सचराचरम् both movable and immovable creatures, महावेगम् very fast, तत् that, अस्य its, ओदनम् food, आहुः they said.

data.v: तत्र विक्रोशतां नादो भूतानां सागरौकसाम् । श्रूयते चासमर्थानां दृष्ट्वा तद्वडवामुखम् ।।
data.es: 'You can hear the sounds of helpless oceanic creatures crying loudly on seeing the burning face of Vadava.
data.anv: तत्र there, तत् that, बडबामुखम् burning face of Vadava, दृष्ट्वा seeing, असमर्थानाम् of the weak, विक्रोशताम् crying loudly, सागरौकसाम् dwelling in the sea, भूतानाम् of creatures, नादः sound, श्रूयते is heard.

data.v: स्वादूदस्योत्तरे देशे योजनानि त्रयोदश । जातरूपशिलो नाम महान्कनकपर्वतः ।।
data.es: 'Thirteen yojanas to the north of this ocean of pure waters is a huge golden mountain called Jatarupasila.
data.anv: स्वादूदस्य of the ocean of tasty water, उत्तरे देशे  the north direction, त्रयोदश thirteen, योजनानि yojanas, महान् huge, कनकपर्वतः golden mountain, जातरूपशिलो नाम called Jatarupasila.
data.md: On the north of the Swādu sea, lie thirteen Yojanas (of land), named Jātarūpasila, * exceeding spacious, and of the splendour of gold. Lit. of gold and stone.

data.v: आसीनं पर्वतस्याग्रे सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् । सहस्रशिरसं देवमनन्तं नीलवाससं ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys on top of the mountain you will see Ananta, a thousandhooded serpent seated, as bright as the Moon, robed in blue, with large eyes like lotus petals bearing the load of the earth, and revered by all beings.
data.anv: वानराः O monkeys, ततः then, तत्र there, पर्वतस्य mountain's, अग्रे on the top, आसीनम् seated, चन्द्रप्रतीकाशम् resembling the Moon in brightness, पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षम् of large eyes like lotus petals, सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् revered by all beings, सहस्रशिरसम् thousandheaded, नीलवाससम् robed in blue cloth, देवम् worshipped, धरणीधरम् bearing the load of the earth, अनन्तम् Ananta, पन्नगम् serpent, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

data.v: त्रिशिराः काञ्चनः केतुस्तालस्तस्य महात्मनः । स्थापितः पर्वतस्याग्रे विराजति सवेदिकः ।।
data.es: 'Highsouled Ananta's flag is a threeheaded golden palm tree shining on an altar on top of the mountain.
data.anv: महात्मनः  highsouled, तस्य पर्वतस्य of that mountain, अग्रे on top, स्थापितः is fixed, केतुः flag of Ananta, त्रिशिराः triplecrowned, काञ्चनः golden, सवेदिकः with an altar, तालः Tala, विराजति shining.
data.md: And by the dais (there) at the top of the mount is the golden palm, planted by that high souled one,—which is like a banner.

data.v: पूर्वस्यां दिशि निर्माणं कृतं तत्त्रिदशेश्वरैः । ततः परं हेममयः श्रीमानुदयपर्वतः ।।
data.es: 'The flag of Ananta is fixed by the gods in the eastern direction. Beyond that stands the famous golden mountain behind which the sun rises. Its golden peak with a divine altar spread over a hundred yojanas touches heaven.
data.anv: तत् that, निर्माणम् arrangement , पूर्वस्यां दिशि in the eastern quarter, त्रिदशेश्वरैः by the gods, कृतम् done, ततः परम् beyond that, हेममयः full of gold, श्रीमान् famous, उदयपर्वतः mountain behind which the sun rises, तस्य its, जातरूपमयी golden, दिव्या divine, सवेदिका that altar, शतयोजनम् a hundred yojanas, आयता long, कोटिः the edge, दिवम् sky, स्पृष्ट्वा touching, विराजति shining.
data.md: The chief of the celestials reared it in the Eastern region. After that is the fair Rising mountain.

data.v: तस्य कोटिर्दिवं स्पृष्ट्वा शतयोजनमायता । जातरूपमयी दिव्या विराजति सवेदिका ।।
data.es: 'The flag of Ananta is fixed by the gods in the eastern direction. Beyond that stands the famous golden mountain behind which the sun rises. Its golden peak with a divine altar spread over a hundred yojanas touches heaven.
data.anv: तत् that, निर्माणम् arrangement , पूर्वस्यां दिशि in the eastern quarter, त्रिदशेश्वरैः by the gods, कृतम् done, ततः परम् beyond that, हेममयः full of gold, श्रीमान् famous, उदयपर्वतः mountain behind which the sun rises, तस्य its, जातरूपमयी golden, दिव्या divine, सवेदिका that altar, शतयोजनम् a hundred yojanas, आयता long, कोटिः the edge, दिवम् sky, स्पृष्ट्वा touching, विराजति shining.
data.md: Its golden peak measuring a hundred Yojanas, reaching to the heavens, rises nobly, with mountains at its base; and looks beautiful with Sālas, palms, Tamālas, and flowering Karnikāras,-golden, splendid and resembling the sun.

data.v: सालैस्तालैस्तमालैश्च कर्णिकारैश्च पुष्पितैः । जातरूपमयैर्दिव्यैः शोभते सूर्यसंनिभैः ।।
data.es: 'The place looks beautiful with salas, palmyras, tamalas and karnikara trees in full bloom. These golden, divine flowers shine like the Sungod.
data.anv: जातरूपमयैः golden form, दिव्यैः divine, सूर्यसन्निभैः resembling the Sun, पुष्पितैः flowering, सालैः with  salas, तालैः with palmyras, तमालैश्च with tamalas, कर्णिकारैश्च with karnikaras also, शोभते enchanting.
data.md: Its golden peak measuring a hundred Yojanas, reaching to the heavens, rises nobly, with mountains at its base; and looks beautiful with Sālas, palms, Tamālas, and flowering Karnikāras,-golden, splendid and resembling the sun.

data.v: तत्र योजनविस्तारमुच्छ्रितं दशयोजनम् । शृङ्गं सौमनसं नाम जातरूपमयं ध्रुवम् ।।
data.es: 'There is a huge golden peak called Saumanas of ten yojanas in height spread over a breadth of one yojana.
data.anv: तत्र there, योजनविस्तारम् spread over a yojana, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, उच्छ्रितम् tall, जातरूपमयम् golden, ध्रुवम् certainly, सौमनसं नाम called Saumanasa, शृङ्गम् peak.
data.md: There, spreading a Yojana around, towering up ten, is the peak named Saumanasa-all certainly of gold.

data.v: तत्र पूर्वं पदं कृत्वा पुरा विष्णुस्त्रिविक्रमे । द्वितीयं शिखरं मेरोश्चकार पुरुषोत्तमः ।।
data.es: 'When the supreme being, Visnu took his three strides as Lord Vamana, he placed his first foot on this peak and the second on the peak of mount Meru.
data.anv: पुरुषोत्तमः supreme being, विष्णुः Visnu, पुरा formerly, त्रिविक्रमे taking three strides, पूर्वम् first, तत्र there, पदम् foot, कृत्वा after that, द्वितीयम् second, मेरोः Meru's, शिखरे on the peak, चकार placed.
data.md: There, formerly on the occasion of invading the earth with three paces, that foremost of persons, Vişņu, planting his first foot planted the other on the summit of Meru.

data.v: उत्तरेण परिक्रम्य जम्बूद्वीपं दिवाकरः । दृश्यो भवति भूयिष्ठं शिखरं तन्महोच्छ्रयम् ।।
data.es: 'The Sun circumabulates Jambu island and when he arrives at this lofty cliff of the mountain, it takes the northern direction and becomes visible to the world.
data.anv: दिवाकरः Sun, जम्बूद्वीपं उत्तरेण north of Jambu island, परिक्रम्य circumambulating, महोच्छ्रयम् very tall, तत् that, शिखरम् peak, भूयिष्ठम् greatly, दृश्यः is seen, भवति will be.
data.md: The sun, having passed by Jambūdwipa on the north, and, arriving at that mighty and eminent summit, (Saumanasa), again becomes visible to the dwellers of Jambūdwipa.

data.v: तत्र वैखानसा नाम वालखिल्या महर्षयः । प्रकाशमाना दृश्यन्ते सूर्यवर्णास्तपस्विनः ।।
data.es: 'Over there the great ascetics Vaikhanasas and Valakhilyas appear like the radiating Sun.
data.anv: तत्र there, सूर्यवर्णाः those with the lustre of the Sungod, तपस्वीनः great ascetics, वैखानसा नाम named Vaikhanasas, वालखिल्याः महर्षयः Valakhilya sages, प्रकाशमानाः radiating, दृश्यन्ते appear.

data.v: अयं सुदर्शनो द्वीपः पुरो यस्य प्रकाशते । यस्मिंस्तेजश्च चक्षुश्च सर्वप्रानभृतामपि ।।
data.es: 'The region in front of this mountain is called Sudarsana Island. This island is where the Sun who gives all beings the ability to see rises.
data.anv: यस्य its, पुरः in front of, सर्वप्राणभृतामपि  for all beings, चक्षुश्च the (ability to see with) eye, प्रकाशते shines, तत् that, तेजः glow, यस्मिन् therefore, अयम् this, सुदर्शनः द्वीपः island of Sudarsana.
data.md: This is the island of Sudarsana, before which all creatures inspire energy and have their sight granted to them.

data.v: शैलस्य तस्य कुञ्जेषु कन्दरेषु वनेषु च । रावणः सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः ।।
data.es: 'Therefrom reach out to the swiftflowing river Sona which has redcoloured waters. Then crossing the sea which is the abode of Siddhas and Charanas search the different rivers reaching the sea, and the picturesque and wonderful forests to trace the abode of Ravana who has stolen Sita.
data.anv: तस्य शैलस्य of that mountain, शृङ्गेषु on the peak, कन्दरेषु in the caves, वनेषु च in the forests, ततस्ततः here and there, रावणः Ravana, वैदेह्यासह with Vaidehi, मार्गितव्यः may be looked for.
data.md: You should search for Rāvana with Vaidehi all round the top of that mountain as well as in its forests and woods.

data.v: काञ्चनस्य च शैलस्य सूर्यस्य च महात्मनः । आविष्टा तेजसा संध्या पूर्वा रक्ता प्रकाशते ।।
data.es: 'The early morning twilight appears bright red because of the glow of the golden mountain as well as of the great Sungod.
data.anv: काञ्चनस्य of the golden, शैलस्य mountain's, महात्मनः of the great, सूर्यस्य च and Sun's, तेजसा with brightness, आविष्टा filled, पूर्वा सन्ध्या early morning twilight, रक्ता red in colour, प्रकाशते will be glowing.
data.md: (Here) the first twilight enfolded in the glory of the golden hill and that of the high-souled Sun, appeareth roseate.

data.v: ततः परमगम्या स्याद्दिक्पूर्वा त्रिदशावृता । रहिता चन्द्रसूर्याभ्यामदृश्या तिमिरावृता ।।
data.es: 'Beyond, there is no Sun or Moon. Darkness pervades. It is neither accessible nor visible. It is guarded by the gods.
data.anv: ततः परम् beyond that, त्रिदशावृता guarded by gods, चन्द्रसूर्याभ्याम् by Moon and Sun, रहिता not present, तिमिर darkness, आवृता pervaded by, पूर्वादिक् eastern direction, अगम्या स्यात् not possible to reach, अदृश्या invisible.
data.md: Beyond that, is the exceedingly impassable Eastern quarter, thronged by the celestials, covered with darkness and devoid of the sun and the moon.

data.v: शैलेषु तेषु सर्वेषु कन्दरेषु वनेषु च । ये च नोक्ता मया देशा विचेया तेषु जानकी ।।
data.es: 'You should look for Janaki everywhere -- on the mountains, in the lakes and in the places not indicated by me.
data.anv: तेषु among those, शैलेषु on the mountains, सर्वेषु everywhere, कन्दरेषु in the caves, वनेषु च in the forests, मया my, ये those, देशाः spots, नोक्ताः not mentioned, तेषु in those places, जानकी Janaki, विचेया should be searched.
data.md: Do you search for Jānaki in all those rocks, woods and streams as well as in such spots as I have not mentioned.

data.v: एतावद्वानरैः शक्यं गन्तुं वानरपुंगवाः । अभास्करममर्यादं न जानीमस्ततः परम् ।।
data.es: 'O chieftains monkeys can go that far. We know not what lies beyond those boundaries where no Sun shines.
data.anv: वानरपुङ्गवाः O chieftains of monkeys, एतावत् till there, वानरैः by monkeys, गन्तुम् to go, शक्यम् is possible, अभास्करम् where there is no Sunlight, अमर्यादं च devoid of boundaries, ततः परम् beyond that, न जानीमः is not known to us.
data.md: You foremost of monkey, the monkeys are competent to proceed thus far. Beyond that, of regions sunless and limitless I know nothing.

data.v: अधिगम्य तु वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च । मासे पूर्णे निवर्तध्वमुदयं प्राप्य पर्वतम् ।।
data.es: 'On locating Vaidehi in the kingdom of Ravana I shall take up proper course of action in conjunction with you.
data.anv: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi,रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं home, च and, अधिगम्य going there, तस्मिन्काले at that time, त्वयासह in conjunction with you, प्राप्तकालम् at the right time, विधास्यामि I will take action.
data.md: Meeting with Vaidehi and arriving at) Rāvana's mansion, do you, having reached the Rising hill, turn back, when it shall be a full month.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न वस्तव्यं वसन्वध्यो भवेन्मम । सिद्धार्थाः संनिवर्तध्वमधिगम्य च मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'If you do not report within one month, you will be killed. May you see Maithili and come back after reaching the goal.
data.anv: मासात् ऊर्ध्वम् beyond one month, न वस्तव्यम् you should not stay away, वसन् while one stays, मम to me, वध्यः will be killed, सिद्धार्थाः accomplishing the goal, मैथिलीम् Maithili, अधिगम्य reaching, सन्निवर्तध्वम् return.
data.md: Do not stay longer than a month. If you do, you shall be slain by me. Having attained your end, do you turn back, having met with Maithili.

data.v: महेन्द्रकान्तां वनषण्ड मण्डितां; दिशं चरित्वा निपुणेन वानराः । अवाप्य सीतां रघुवंशजप्रियां; ततो निवृत्ताः सुखितो भविष्यथ ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys go about the beloved quarter (east) of Indra bestowed with differnt kinds of forests and groves. Look out carefully for Rama's beloved Sita, spot her and return, you will live happily.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकांडे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वानराः O monkeys, महेन्द्रकान्ताम् Indra's beloved, वनषण्डमण्डिताम् bestowed with different kinds of forests and groves, दिशम् quarter, निपुणेन carefully, चरित्वा after going about, रघुवंशजप्रियाम् Rama's beloved, सीताम् Sita, अवाप्य after finding, ततः then, निवृत्ताः returning, सुखिनः happy ones, भविष्यथ you will be.
data.md: Having adroitly explored (the tract) loved of Mahendra, plated with woods, do you, you monkeys, having come at Sītā—the beloved wife of that descendant of Raghu-desist, attaining happiness.

data.v: ततः प्रस्थाप्य सुग्रीवस्तन्महद्वानरं बलम् । दक्षिणां प्रेषयामास वानरानभिलक्षितान् ।।
data.es: Sugriva then sends in the southern direction another vanara army known for their excellence.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, महत् great, तत् that, वानरं बलम् monkey army, प्रस्थाप्य after despatching, ततः then, अभिलक्षितान् those recognised for excellence, वानरान् monkeys, दक्षिणाम् southern direction, प्रेषयामास sent forth.
data.md: Then having sent away that mighty host of monkeys, Sugriva despatched to the South others competent to perform the several tasks entrusted to them.

data.v: नीलमग्निसुतं चैव हनुमन्तं च वानरम् । पितामहसुतं चैव जाम्बवन्तं महाकपिम् ।।
सुहोत्रं च शरीरं च शरगुल्मं तथैव च । गजं गवाक्षं गवयं सुषेणमृषभं तथा ।।
मैन्दं च द्विविदं चैव विजयं गन्धमादनम् । उल्कामुखमसङ्गं च हुताशन सुतावुभौ ।।
अङ्गदप्रमुखान्वीरान्वीरः कपिगणेश्वरः । वेगविक्रमसंपन्नान्संदिदेश विशेषवित् ।।
तेषामग्रेसरं चैव महद्बलमसंगगम् । विधाय हरिवीराणामादिशद्दक्षिणां दिशम् ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva ordered mighty Angada to lead the group of the heroic monkeys in the southern direction.
data.anv: अथ then, तेषाम् of them, हरिवीराणाम् of those monkeys, महाबलम् one of formidable strength, अङ्गदम् Angada, अग्रेसरम् leader, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern direction, आदिशत् ordered.

data.v: ये केचन समुद्देशास्तस्यां दिशि सुदुर्गमाः । कपीशः कपिमुख्यानां स तेषां तानुदाहरत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the monkey king, explained to the monkey chiefs about the inaccessible places in the southern direction.
data.anv: तस्यां दिशि in that quarter, दुर्गमाः inaccessible, ये केचन those, समुद्देशाः spots, सः कपीशः the monkey king, कपिमुख्यानाम् to the chieftains of monkeys, तानुदाहरत् he gave an account.

data.v: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतावृतम् । नर्मदां च नदीं दुर्गां महोरगनिषेविताम् ।।
ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णावेणीं महानदीम् । वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम् ।।
मेखलानुत्कलांश्चैव दशार्णनगराण्यपि । अवन्तीमभ्रवन्तीं च सर्वमेवानुपश्यत ।।
विदर्भानृषिकांश्चैव रम्यान्माहिषकानपि । तथा बङ्गान्कलिङ्गांश्च कौशिकांश्च समन्ततः ।।
अन्वीक्ष्य दण्डकारण्यं सपर्वतनदीगुहम् । नदीं गोदावरीं चैव सर्वमेवानुपश्यत ।।
तथैवान्ध्रांश्च पुण्ड्रांश्च चोलान्पाण्ड्यान्सकेरलान् । अयोमुखश्च गन्तव्यः पर्वतो धातुमण्डितः ।।
विचित्रशिखरः श्रीमांश्चित्रपुष्पितकाननः । सचन्दनवनोद्देशो मार्गितव्यो महागिरिः ।।
data.es: 'Look for Sita all over mount Ayomukha (known as Malaya), rich in ores. It has wonderful peaks. It looks colourful with the forest in bloom. This great mountain is full of sandalwood forest.
data.anv: धातुमण्डितः with ores, विचित्रशिखर wonderful peaks, श्रीमान् rich, चित्र पुष्पितकाननः a forest full of colourful flowers, अयोमुखः पर्वतः mount Ayomukha, गन्तव्यः should visit, सचन्दनवनोद्देशः of sandalwood forest, महागिरिः great mountain, मार्गितव्यः search.
data.md: Then shall you repair to the mountain Ayomukha,* plated with ore, having taking summits, graceful, furnished with picturesque flowering woods,-the mighty mountain having groves of excellent sandal. *Another name of this hill is Malaya.

data.v: ततस्तामापगां दिव्यां प्रसन्नसलिलां शिवाम् । तत्र द्रक्ष्यथ कावेरीं विहृतामप्सरोगणैः ।।
data.es: 'Then you will see the sacred river Cauvery with pure and auspicious water, where celestial nymphs sport.
data.anv: ततः then, दिव्याम् wonderful, प्रसन्नसलिलां शिवाम् river with pure and sacred waters, अप्सरोगणैः  celestial nymphs, विहिताम sport, ताम् that, कावेरीम् Cauvery, आपगाम् river, तत्र there, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.
data.md: At the foot of the Malaya mountain endued with exceeding energy, you will behold the noble stream Kāveri, of pleasant waters, where sport troops of Apsarās.

data.v: तस्यासीनं नगस्याग्रे मलयस्य महौजसं । द्रक्ष्यथादित्यसंकाशमगस्त्यमृषिसत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'Dwelling on the top of that Malaya mountain you will find celebrated sage Agastya, resplendent like the Sun.
data.anv: महौजसम् a person shining brightly, तस्य its, नगस्य mountain's, अग्रे on the top, आसीनम्  seated, आदित्यसङ्काशम् like the Sun, ऋषिसत्तमम् a celebtated sage, अगस्त्यम् Agastya, द्रक्ष्यथ you find.
data.md: (There) you will see that foremost of saints, Agastya, resembling the sun.

data.v: ततस्तेनाभ्यनुज्ञाताः प्रसन्नेन महात्मना । ताम्रपर्णीं ग्राहजुष्टां तरिष्यथ महानदीम् ।।
data.es: 'You will then come cross the great river Tamraparni infested with alligators. Cross it with the permission of the sage pleased (with you).
data.anv: ततः then, प्रसन्नेन by the pleasing one, महात्मना by the great soul, तेन by him, अनुज्ञाताः permitted, अथ then, ग्राहजुष्टाम् inhabited by alligators, ताम्रपर्णीम् Tamraparni, महानदीम् great river, तरिष्यथ cross.
data.md: Permitted by that gratified high-souled one, you will cross over the great river, Tăniraparni, abounding in alligators.

data.v: सा चन्दनवनैर्दिव्यैः प्रच्छन्ना द्वीप शालिनी । कान्तेव युवतिः कान्तं समुद्रमवगाहते ।।
data.es: 'With its wonderful islands covered with lovely sandalwood forests, the river mingles with the ocean just as a young beloved meets her lover.
data.anv: दिव्यै: lovely, चन्दनवनैः with sandalwood forests, प्रच्छन्ना covered, द्वीपशालिनी with wonderful islands, सा that, युवति: young lady, कान्तां beloved, इव like, समुद्रम् ocean, अवगाहते reaches.
data.md: Like a youthful female in relation to her lover, she (Tāmraparni), with both her waters as well as islets concealed under beautiful sandal woods, bathes in the sea.

data.v: ततो हेममयं दिव्यं मुक्तामणिविभूषितम् । युक्तं कवाटं पाण्ड्यानां गता द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys leaving that river, you will find encrusted with pearls the wonderful golden gate of the city of Pandyas (modern Madurai).
data.anv: वानरा: O monkeys, ततः then, युक्तम् fitted, हेममयम् full of gold, दिव्यम् endearing, मुक्तामणिविभूषितम् encrusted with pearls, पाण्ड्यानाम् Pandyas', कवाटम् gate, गताः you reach,  द्रक्ष्यथ you will find.
data.md: Proceeding (therefrom), the monkeys shall see the grand golden gates belonging to the walls of the capital of the Pāndyas.

data.v: ततः समुद्रमासाद्य संप्रधार्यार्थनिश्चयम् । अगस्त्येनान्तरे तत्र सागरे विनिवेशितः ।।
data.es: 'Then on reaching the sea shore, decide the course of action. Sage Agastya has set up (between the moat of the city and and the sea) a glorious golden mountain Mahendra. Filled with colourful trees, it stretches into the sea.
data.anv: ततः then, समुद्रम् ocean, आसाद्य after reaching, अर्थनिश्चयम् decision, सम्प्रधार्य after arriving at, अगस्त्येन by Agastya, तत्र there, सागरे in the sea, अन्तरे inside, विनिवेशितः set up, चित्रनानानगः filled with colourful trees, श्रीमान् rich, महेन्द्रः Mahendra, पर्वतोत्तमः best of mountains, जातरूपमयः full of gold, श्रीमान् rich, महार्णवम् great sea, अवगाढः immersed into.
data.md: Then arriving at the main, you shall ascertain your ability or otherwise of crossing the same. In the bosom of the deep there, Agastya has placed that foremost of mountains-the charming Mahendra, having picturesque plateaus; golden, and beautiful,-with a portion of it sunk in the great ocean.

data.v: चित्रनानानगः श्रीमान्महेन्द्रः पर्वतोत्तमः । जातरूपमयः श्रीमानवगाढो महार्णवम् ।।
data.es: 'Then on reaching the sea shore, decide the course of action. Sage Agastya has set up (between the moat of the city and and the sea) a glorious golden mountain Mahendra. Filled with colourful trees, it stretches into the sea.
data.anv: ततः then, समुद्रम् ocean, आसाद्य after reaching, अर्थनिश्चयम् decision, सम्प्रधार्य after arriving at, अगस्त्येन by Agastya, तत्र there, सागरे in the sea, अन्तरे inside, विनिवेशितः set up, चित्रनानानगः filled with colourful trees, श्रीमान् rich, महेन्द्रः Mahendra, पर्वतोत्तमः best of mountains, जातरूपमयः full of gold, श्रीमान् rich, महार्णवम् great sea, अवगाढः immersed into.

data.v: नानाविधैर्नगैः फुल्लैर्लताभिश्चोपशोभितम् । देवर्षियक्षप्रवरैरप्सरोभिश्च सेवितम् ।।
data.es: 'That mountain with several kinds of colourful trees and vines is frequented by gods, sages and prominent yakshas like siddhas and charanas. It is exceedingly delightful and even the thousandeyed Indra keeps visiting this place on full and new Moon days.
data.anv: नानाविधैः with different kinds of, सर्वैः by all, नगैः with trees, लताभिश्च even with vines, उपशोभितम् delightful, देवर्षियक्षप्रवरैः with gods, sages, yakshas, अप्सरोभिश्च and also with celestial nymphs, सेवितम् inhabited by, सिद्धचारणसङ्घैश्च with siddhas, charanas, प्रकीर्णम् scattered about, सुमनोरमम् very enchanting, तम् him, सहस्राक्षः thousandeyed Mahendra, पर्वसु पर्वसु on all full and new Moon days, सदा always, उपैति keeps coming.

data.v: सिद्धचारणसंघैश्च प्रकीर्णं सुमनोहरम् । तमुपैति सहस्राक्षः सदा पर्वसु पर्वसु ।।
data.es: 'That mountain with several kinds of colourful trees and vines is frequented by gods, sages and prominent yakshas like siddhas and charanas. It is exceedingly delightful and even the thousandeyed Indra keeps visiting this place on full and new Moon days.
data.anv: नानाविधैः with different kinds of, सर्वैः by all, नगैः with trees, लताभिश्च even with vines, उपशोभितम् delightful, देवर्षियक्षप्रवरैः with gods, sages, yakshas, अप्सरोभिश्च and also with celestial nymphs, सेवितम् inhabited by, सिद्धचारणसङ्घैश्च with siddhas, charanas, प्रकीर्णम् scattered about, सुमनोरमम् very enchanting, तम् him, सहस्राक्षः thousandeyed Mahendra, पर्वसु पर्वसु on all full and new Moon days, सदा always, उपैति keeps coming.

data.v: द्वीपस्तस्यापरे पारे शतयोजनमायतः । अगम्यो मानुषैर्दीप्तस्तं मार्गध्वं समन्ततः । तत्र सर्वात्मना सीता मार्गितव्या विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'Beyond this, on the other side of the sea stretching over an area of a hundred yojanas is an island difficult to reach for humans. Which you may explore.
data.anv: तस्य its, अपरे पारे on the other side, शतयोजनमायतः stretched over a distance of a hundred yojanas, मानुषैः for human beings, अगम्यः inaccessible, दीप्तः glittering, द्वीपः island, तम् that place, समन्ततः all over there, मार्गध्वम् explore.
data.md: On its other shore is an island extending over an hundred Yojanas, inaccessible to men*, and of splendid aspect. Do you explore it all round. There, in particular, you must every way search for Sita. *Because, says the commentator,. of the profusion of gold in it.

data.es: 'In the midst of the southern sea is a famous ogress, Angaraka (also Simhika) by name who swallows humans by capturing them even by their shadows.
