data.es: 'I remembed Matanga's curse to Vali, king of monkeys. Vali would not enter the site of Matanga's hermitage as his head would break into a hundred pieces if he did'. Therefore we thought it would be safe for us to reside in that place.
data.anv: राजन् O king, हरीश्वरः king of monkeys, वाली Vali, तदा then, मतङ्गेन by Mathanga, यथा as, शप्तः cursed, मे to me, इदानीम् now, स्मृतम् I remembered, वाली Vali, अस्मिन् in this, आश्रममण्डले hermitage site, प्रविशेद्यदि if he enters, अस्य his, मूर्धा head, शतधा hundred pieces, भवेत् will become, तत्र there, अस्माकम् to us, वासः residence, सुखः happy, निरुद्विग्नः peaceful, भविष्यति will be.
data.md: 'O king, now, I remember me how that lord of monkeys, Vāli, was cursed by Matanga in this very hermitage. If Vāli enters (into this asylum), his head becomes cleft in hundred.

data.v: प्रविशेद्यदि वा वाली मूर्धास्य शतधा भवेत् । तत्र वासः सुखोऽस्माकं निरुद्विग्नो भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'I remembed Matanga's curse to Vali, king of monkeys. Vali would not enter the site of Matanga's hermitage as his head would break into a hundred pieces if he did'. Therefore we thought it would be safe for us to reside in that place.
data.anv: राजन् O king, हरीश्वरः king of monkeys, वाली Vali, तदा then, मतङ्गेन by Mathanga, यथा as, शप्तः cursed, मे to me, इदानीम् now, स्मृतम् I remembered, वाली Vali, अस्मिन् in this, आश्रममण्डले hermitage site, प्रविशेद्यदि if he enters, अस्य his, मूर्धा head, शतधा hundred pieces, भवेत् will become, तत्र there, अस्माकम् to us, वासः residence, सुखः happy, निरुद्विग्नः peaceful, भविष्यति will be.

data.v: ततः पर्वतमासाद्य ऋश्यमूकं नृपात्मज । न विवेश तदा वाली मतङ्गस्य भयात्तदा ।।
data.es: 'O prince Rama then I reached mount Rishyamuka which Vali did not enter out of fear of the curse of Matanga.
data.anv: नृपात्मज  O prince Rama, ततः from that place, ऋष्यमूकं पर्वतम् mountain Rishyamuka, तदा then, आसाद्य having reached, वाली Vali, मतङ्गस्य Matanga's, भयात् out of fear of, तदा then, न विवेश did not enter.
data.md: There shall dwell happily without anxiety.' O king's son, thereupon, we went to the Rișyamuka mountain, nor did then Vāli enter we there from fear of Matanga.

data.v: एवं मया तदा राजन्प्रत्यक्षमुपलक्षितम् । पृथिवीमण्डलं कृत्स्नं गुहामस्म्यागतस्ततः ।।
data.es: 'O king that way I surveyed the entire earth directly and returned to this cave and lived here.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षटचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysixth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: राजन् king, एवम् in that manner, तदा then, कत्स्नम् पृथिवीमण्डलम् entire earth, प्रत्यक्षम् saw directly, मया by me, उपलक्षितम् is surveyed, गुहाम् this cave, ततः thereafter, आगतः reached, अस्मि I am.
data.md: Thus, O king, did I actually see all the world. And from that place I came to this cave.

data.v: दर्शनार्थं तु वैदेह्याः सर्वतः कपियूथपाः । व्यादिष्टाः कपिराजेन यथोक्तं जग्मुरञ्जसा ।।
data.es: The leaders of vanara troops went fast in all directions to look for Vaidehi following the instructions of the king of vanaras.
data.anv: कपिराजेन by the king of monkeys, व्यादिष्टाः commanded, कपियूधपाः leaders of vanara troops, यथोक्तम् as instructed, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, दर्शनार्थम् to look for, अञ्जसा swiftly, सर्वतः all directions, जग्मुः went.
data.md: The principal monkeys, having been ordered by the monkey-king, speedily went in all directions to their destinations for the purpose of seeing Vaidehi.

data.v: सरांसि सरितः कक्षानाकाशं नगराणि च । नदीदुर्गांस्तथा शैलान्विचिन्वन्ति समन्ततः ।।
data.es: They went looking everywhere in the tanks, in the bottom of rivers, in towns, in the sky and similarly in inaccessible rivers, mountains, and forts surrounded by rivers.
data.anv: ते they, सरांसि tanks, सरित: कक्षान् bottom of rivers, आकाशम् sky, नगराणि च and towns, तथा similarly, नदीदुर्गान् forts surrounded by rivers, शैलान् mountains, समन्ततः every where, विचिन्वन्ति looking for.
data.md: And on all sides they explore watery expanses, and streams, and lawns, and commons, and cities, and tracts rendered impassable by torrents.

data.v: सुग्रीवेण समाख्यातान्सर्वे वानरयूथपाः । प्रदेशान्प्रविचिन्वन्ति सशैलवनकाननान् ।।
data.es: The troop leaders of the monkeys instructed by Sugriva searched in all places including mountains and forests.
data.anv: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, समाख्याताः instructed, सर्वे all, वानरयूथपाः vanara troop leaders, सशैलवनकाननान् including forests and mountains, प्रदेशान्  places, विचिन्वन्ति searched.
data.md: And the leaders of monkey-herds search all those countries, countries, described described by Sugrīva,-containing mountains, woods and forests.

data.v: विचिन्त्य दिवसं सर्वे सीताधिगमने धृताः । समायान्ति स्म मेदिन्यां निशाकालेशु वानराः ।।
data.es: The monkeys used to search for Sita all day determinedly and at night assemble at one place.
data.anv: सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys, सीताधिगमने in search of Sita, धृताः determined, दिवसम् all day, विचित्य after searching, निशाकालेषु during nights also, मेदिन्याम् on the ground, समायान्ति स्म used to meet one another.
data.md: Engaged during the day in search of Sītā, at night the monkeys seek the ground (for sleep).

data.v: सर्वर्तुकांश्च देशेषु वानराः सफलान्द्रुमान् । आसाद्य रजनीं शय्यां चक्रुः सर्वेष्वहःसु ते ।।
data.es: The monkeys would search all day and by night reach for rest the branches of the trees that bear fruits in all seasons.
data.anv: ते वानराः those monkeys, सर्वेषु अहस्सु all day, सर्वर्तुकामान् in all seasons, सफलद्रुमान् fruitbearing trees, देशेषु in countries, आसाद्य having reached, रजनीम् in the night, शय्याम् resting place, चक्रुः they made.
data.md: In every place, by day coming to trees aye enjoying every season, and crowned with fruits, the monkeys prepared their beds at night.* *The sense is rather obscure, it being difficult to understand the relation their beds bore to the neighbouring trees.

data.v: तदहः प्रथमं कृत्वा मासे प्रस्रवणं गताः । कपिराजेन संगम्य निराशाः कपियूथपाः ।।
data.es: The monkey leaders thus spent a month doing what they did daily and returning disappointed, met the monkey king on mount Prasravana.
data.anv: तत् अहः that day, प्रथमम् first, कृत्वा having passed off, मासे in the month, कपियूधपाः monkey leaders, निराशाः disappointed, प्रस्रवणम् mountain Prasravana, गताः gone, कपिराजेन by the king of vanaras, सङ्गम्य after meeting.
data.md: Counting that day* as the first, the principal monkeys, after the month had run out, resigning all hope, came to the Fountain and met with the monkey-king. *i.e. the day of their departure.

data.v: विचित्य तु दिशं पूर्वां यथोक्तां सचिवैः सह । अदृष्ट्वा विनतः सीतामाजगाम महाबलः ।।
data.es: Having searched for Sita as instructed by Sugriva, powerful Vinita returned along with the ministers unable to find Sita.
data.anv: महाबलः powerful, विनतः Vinata, सचिवैः सह along with the ministers, यथोक्ताम् as instructed, पूर्वां दिशम् eastern side, विचित्य having searched, सीताम् Sita, अदृष्ट्वा not able to see, आजगाम returned.
data.md: And having explored the Eastern regions, as directed, the exceedingly strong Vinata not having been able to see Sītā, came back, in company with his counsellors.

data.v: उत्तरां तु दिशं सर्वां विचित्य स महाकपिः । आगतः सह सैन्येन वीरः शतबलिस्तदा ।।
data.es: Then the monkey warrior Satavali departed for the north, surrounded by kings of mountains.
data.anv: तदा then, शतवालिः Satavali, वीरः warrior, हरिः monkey, गिरिराजसमावृताम् surrounded by kings of mountains, रम्याम् lovely, उत्तरां दिशम् northern direction, सहसा at once, प्रतस्थे started their journey.
data.md: And then that mighty ape, Satavali, daunted in spirits, arrived with his forces, after having searched all through the North.

data.v: सुषेणः पश्चिमामाशां विचित्य सह वानरैः । समेत्य मासे संपूर्णे सुग्रीवमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Sushena searched for a full month in the western quarter along with the monkeys and returned to report to Sugriva.
data.anv: सुषेणः Sushena, वानरैस्सह along with the monkeys, पश्चिमाम् आशाम् western side, विचित्य having searched, मासे in a month, सम्पूर्णे when completed, समेत्य after coming back, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, उपचक्रमे reported.
data.md: And having searched the West in company with his monkeys, Sușeņa, on the month being complete, presented himself before Sugrīva.

data.v: तं प्रस्रवणपृष्ठस्थं समासाद्याभिवाद्य च । आसीनं सह रामेण सुग्रीवमिदमब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Sushena came to Sugriva, seated with Rama at Prasravana mountain, offered salutations and spoke:
data.anv: रामेण सह along with Rama, आसीनम् seated, प्रस्रवणपृष्ठस्थम् on the Prasravana mountain, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, आसाद्य came near, अभिवाद्य च and offered salutations, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And coming to Sugrīva seated along with Rāma behind the Fountain, and saluting the former, Susena said to Sugriva.

data.v: विचिताः पर्वताः सर्वे वनानि नगराणि च । निम्नगाः सागरान्ताश्च सर्वे जनपदास्तथा ।।
data.es: 'We searched for her in the mountains, in inaccessible forests, in rivers and seas and also the countryside.
data.anv: सर्वे all, पर्वताः mountains, विचिताः are searched, गहनानि inacccessible, वनानि च forests also, निम्नगाः rivers, सागरान्ताश्च in the seas, ये those, जनपदाश्च country side, सर्वे every where.

data.v: गुहाश्च विचिताः सर्वा यास्त्वया परिकीर्तिताः । विचिताश्च महागुल्मा लताविततसंतताः ।।
data.es: 'We searched for her in the caves, in places filled with extensive vines and huge bushes and in all places mentioned by you.
data.anv: सर्वाः all, त्वया by your, परिकीर्तिताः mentioned, याः those, गुहाः caves, विचिताः searched, लताविततसन्तताः filled with extensive vines, महागुल्माः and huge bushes, विचिताः are searched.

data.v: गहनेषु च देशेषु दुर्गेषु विषमेषु च । सत्त्वान्यतिप्रमाणानि विचितानि हतानि च । ये चैव गहना देशा विचितास्ते पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: 'We searched again and again the interior, inaccessible and uneven locations,and killed huge animals. We searched in regions difficult to penetrate.
data.anv: गहनेषु in the interiors, दुर्गेषु inaccessible, विषमेषु च and unevenplaces, देशेषु locations, अतिप्रमाणानि very huge, सत्त्वानि beings, विचितानि searched, हतानि च killed, गहनाः difficult interiors, ये those, देशाः places, ते those, पुनः पुनः again and again, विचिताः searched.

data.v: उदारसत्त्वाभिजनो महात्मा; स मैथिलीं द्रक्ष्यति वानरेन्द्रः । दिशं तु यामेव गता तु सीता; तामास्थितो वायुसुतो हनूमान् ।।
data.es: 'O king of monkeys we hope, his exhalted highness, the mighty vanara, son of the Windgod, Hanuman has gone in the direction in which Maithili has been carried off. He alone will find Sita and come back.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वानरेन्द्र O king of monkeys, उदारसत्त्वाभिजनः exhalted by strength and birth, सः that, महात्मा  great person, मैथिलीम् Maithili, द्रक्ष्यति will see, सीता sita, याम् एव whichever, दिशम्  direction, गता is taken, ताम् that, वायुसुतः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, आस्थितः he has set out.
data.md: O lord of monkeys, possessed of great strength and nobly born, it is Hanumān who will be able to ascertain the whereabouts of Mithila's daughter. And the Wind's son, Hanumān, has followed even the has by which Sītā has gone.

data.v: सहताराङ्गदाभ्यां तु गत्वा स हनुमान्कपिः । सुग्रीवेण यथोद्दिष्टं तं देशमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the monkey accompanied by Tara and Angada proceeded as instructed by Sugriva in the (South) direction.
data.anv: कपिः monkey, हनुमान् Hanuman, ताराङ्गदाभ्यां सह along with Tara and Angada, गत्वा सा  going, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, यथोद्दिष्टम् as instructed, तम् them, देशम् place, उपप्रचक्रमे started.
data.md: The monkey Hanumān in company with Tārā and Angada swiftly set out for the quarter assigned by Sugrīva.

data.v: स तु दूरमुपागम्य सर्वैस्तैः कपिसत्तमैः । विचिनोति स्म विन्ध्यस्य गुहाश्च गहनानि च ।।
data.es: He went a long distance with other heroic monkeys, searching in the impenetrable caves of Vindhya mountain. They combed interior places, mountain peaks, fortresses surrounded by rivers, lakes, extensive groves of trees, bushes and thickets.
data.anv: सः that, सर्वैः तैः they all, कपिसत्तमैः with heroic monkeys, दूरम् a distant place, उपागम्य having gone, ततः then, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya's, गुहाश्च caves, गहनानि च impenetrable, विचिनोति searched, पर्वताग्रान् on the peaks of mountains, नदीदुर्गान् inaccessible fortress surrounded by rivers, सरांसि tanks, विपुलान्द्रुमान् huge trees, वृक्षषण्डांश्च collection of trees, विविधान् many, पर्वतान् mountains, घनपादपान् dense trees.

data.v: पर्वताग्रान्नदीदुर्गान्सरांसि विपुलान्द्रुमान् । वृक्षषण्डांश्च विविधान्पर्वतान्घनपादपान् ।।
data.es: He went a long distance with other heroic monkeys, searching in the impenetrable caves of Vindhya mountain. They combed interior places, mountain peaks, fortresses surrounded by rivers, lakes, extensive groves of trees, bushes and thickets.
data.anv: सः that, सर्वैः तैः they all, कपिसत्तमैः with heroic monkeys, दूरम् a distant place, उपागम्य having gone, ततः then, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya's, गुहाश्च caves, गहनानि च impenetrable, विचिनोति searched, पर्वताग्रान् on the peaks of mountains, नदीदुर्गान् inaccessible fortress surrounded by rivers, सरांसि tanks, विपुलान्द्रुमान् huge trees, वृक्षषण्डांश्च collection of trees, विविधान् many, पर्वतान् mountains, घनपादपान् dense trees.

data.v: अन्वेषमाणास्ते सर्वे वानराः सर्वतो दिशम् । न सीतां ददृशुर्वीरा मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: The heroic monkeys went searching all over the direction for the daughter of Janaka, but in vain.
data.anv: वीराः heroes, ते वानराः the vanaras, सर्वे all, सर्वतो दिशम् all over in that direction, अन्वेषमाणाः  went searching, मैथिलीम् for Maithili, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, सीताम् Sita, न ददृशुः they did not see.

data.v: ते भक्षयन्तो मूलानि फलानि विविधानि च । अन्वेषमाणा दुर्धर्षा न्यवसंस्तत्र तत्र ह । स तु देशो दुरन्वेषो गुहागहनवान्महान् ।।
data.es: The unassailable monkeys ate roots and fruits and halted here and there at different places searching for Sita.
data.anv: दुर्धर्षाः unassailable, ते those, विविधानि many, मूलानि roots, फलान्यपि and also fruits, भक्षयन्तः  eating, अन्वेषमाणाः searching, तत्र तत्र here and there, न्यवसन् dwelt.

data.v: त्यक्त्वा तु तं तदा देशं सर्वे वै हरियूथपाः । देशमन्यं दुराधर्षं विविशुश्चाकुतोभयाः ।।
data.es: Having searched all over in the forests and very difficult areas, the fearless, invincible vanaras moved forward, leaving that place and entered another areasearching.
data.anv: तादृशानि such of those, अरण्यान्यपि even in the forests, विचित्य having searched, भृशपीडिताः very difficult, सर्वे all, हरियूथपाः vanara leaders, ततः then, तं देशम् that place, त्यक्त्वा after leaving, अकुतोभयाः fearless warriors, दुराधर्षम् unassailable, अन्यं देशम् other places, विविशुः entered.

data.v: यत्र वन्ध्यफला वृक्षा विपुष्पाः पर्णवर्जिताः । निस्तोयाः सरितो यत्र मूलं यत्र सुदुर्लभम् ।।
data.es: As they marched forward, they entered a location where there were trees devoid of leaves, flowers and fruits and rivers without water and a place where it was difficult to get roots (for food).
data.anv: यत्र where, वृक्षाः trees, वन्ध्यफलाः without fruits, विपुष्पाः without flowers, पर्णवर्जिताः without leaves, यत्र where, सरितः rivers, निस्तोयाः without water, यत्र there, मूलम् root, सुदुर्लभम् very difficult to get.

data.v: न सन्ति महिषा यत्र न मृगा न च हस्तिनः । शार्दूलाः पक्षिणो वापि ये चान्ये वनगोचराः ।।
data.es: There were no buffaloes, no deer, no elephants, tigers or even birds and other wild animals.
data.anv: यत्र where, महिषाः buffaloes, न सन्ति not found, मृगाः deer, न not, हस्तिनः elephants, शार्दूलाः tigers, पक्षिणो वापि  and even birds, वनगोचराः forest beasts, ये those, अन्ये च and other, न not,

data.v: स्निग्धपत्राः स्थले यत्र पद्मिन्यः फुल्लपङ्कजाः । प्रेक्षणीयाः सुगन्धाश्च भ्रमरैश्चापि वर्जिताः ।।
data.es: There were no medicinal plants, no vines or creepers spreading on the ground.The lotus creepers on the dry ground had shining leaves,beautiful and fragrant blooms devoid of bees.
data.anv: यत्र where, वृक्षाः trees, न not, ओषध्यः medicinal plants, न not, वल्ल्यः vines, न not, वीरुधः creepers spreading on ground, न not, यत्र where, स्निग्धपत्राः shining leaves, स्थले on the dry ground, पद्मिन्यः lotus creepers, फुल्लपङ्कजाः in full bloom, प्रेक्षणीयाः beautiful to look, सुगन्धाश्च fragrant ones, भ्रमरैश्चापिवर्जिताः devoid of bees.
data.md: And there are there neither trees, nor annual plants, nor creepers, nor herbs,-and in that place there are no pleasant pools, with cool leaves, and filled with blown lotuses, and it has been renounced by the black-bees.

data.v: कण्डुर्नाम महाभागः सत्यवादी तपोधनः । महर्षिः परमामर्षी नियमैर्दुष्प्रधर्षणः ।।
data.es: There was a sage called Kandu who was truthful, outrageous and shorttempered. He observed strict austerities and was rich in penance.
data.anv: सत्यवादी truthful, महाभागः an eminent acsetic, तपोधनः rich in penance, परमामर्षी choleric tempered, नियमैः strict follower of austerities, दुष्प्रधर्षणः outrageous, कण्डुर्नाम called Kandu, महर्षिः sage.
data.md: There dwelleth a Maharași, Kandu by name, an eminently pious, and truthful ascetic, irascible, and irrepressible because of his practice of self-discipline.

data.v: तस्य तस्मिन्वने पुत्रो बालको दशवार्षिकः । प्रनष्टो जीवितान्ताय क्रुद्धस्तत्र महामुनिः ।।
data.es: The great sage was enraged because he had lost his sixteenyearold son in the forest.
data.anv: तस्मिन् वने in that forest, तस्य his, षोडशवार्षिकः sixteen years old, पुत्रः son, बाल: young boy, तत्र there, जीवितान्ताय  died, प्रणष्टः was lost, महामुनिः great sage, क्रुद्धः enraged.
data.md: In that wood his son, a boy of ten years, his sands having run out, breathed his last; and it is for this that the mighty ascetic has come under the influence of passion.

data.v: तेन धर्मात्मना शप्तं कृत्स्नं तत्र महद्वनम् । अशरण्यं दुराधर्षं मृगपक्षिविवर्जितम् ।।
data.es: Cursed by the great righteous sage the entire forest turned barren, unfit to harbour living beings and became devoid of even beasts and birds.
data.anv: तत्र there, महत् great, कृत्स्नम् entire, वनम् forest, अशरण्यम् barren, दुराधर्षम् unfit to harbour, मृगपक्षिविवर्जितम् without beasts and birds, तेन by him, धर्मात्मना by the righteous sage, शप्तम् cursed.
data.md: And cursed by that high-souled one, the entire mighty forest has become unfit to harbour (any creatures); difficult of entrance; and devoid of birds and beasts.

data.v: तस्य ते काननान्तांस्तु गिरीणां कन्दराणि च । प्रभवानि नदीनांच विचिन्वन्ति समाहिताः ।।
data.es: The monkeys searched in the forest regions, in the mountains, rivers and sources of rivers with concentrated attention.
data.anv: ते those, समाहिताः those with concentrated attention, तस्य his, काननान्ताश्च forest regions, गिरीणाम्  in the mountains, कन्दराणि च caves also, नदीनाम् प्रभवानि च sources of rivers also, विचिन्वन्ति searched.
data.md: They carefully search the skirts of its woods, mountain-caves, and the sources of its streams. And those high-souled ones, devoted to the good of Sugrīva, did not find Janaka's daughter, or her ravisher, Rāvaņa.

data.v: तत्र चापि महात्मानो नापश्यञ्जनकात्मजाम् । हर्तारं रावणं वापि सुग्रीवप्रियकारिणः ।।
data.es: Eager to please Sugriva, the great souls searched in the forest region. Even there they could not find Janaka's daughter and also Ravana who had abducted Sita.
data.anv: महात्मानः great souls, सुग्रीवप्रियकारिणः eager to please Sugriva, तत्र चापि and there also, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, हर्तारम् one who has abducted, रावणं वापि Ravana also, नापश्यन् could not see.
data.md: They carefully search the skirts of its woods, mountain-caves, and the sources of its streams. And those high-souled ones, devoted to the good of Sugrīva, did not find Janaka's daughter, or her ravisher, Rāvaņa.

data.v: ते प्रविश्य तु तं भीमं लतागुल्मसमावृतम् । ददृशुः क्रूरकर्माणमसुरं सुरनिर्भयम् ।।
data.es: (Then) they noticed a place covered with creepers and bushes. As soon as they entered the dreadful forest, they saw a demon of wicked deeds, unafraid even of gods.
data.anv: ते they, लतागुल्मसमावृतम् covered with creepers and bushes, क्रूरम् dreadful, तम् that, प्रविश्य entering, आशु immediately, क्रूरकर्माणम् one of wicked deeds, सुरनिर्भयम् not even afraid of gods, असुरम् demon, दद्दृशुः they saw.
data.md: And entering (into a wood), they saw a terrible Asura, concealed by the shrubs and plants-of dreadful deeds, and cherishing no fear even of the gods.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा वनरा घोरं स्थितं शैलमिवापरम् । गाढं परिहिताः सर्वे दृष्ट्वा तं पर्वतोपमम् ।।
data.es: The monkeys beheld the dreadful demon standing firmly like a huge, incomparable mountain in front of them.
data.anv: सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys, शैलम् इव like a mountain, स्थितम् stood, घोरम् dreadful, तम् they, अपरम् another, दृष्ट्वा saw, पर्वतोपमम् like a huge mountain, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा saw, गाढम् firmly, परिहिताः stood in attention.
data.md: And seeing that dreadful Asura, seated like a hill, and resembling a mountain, they all tightened their cloths,

data.v: सोऽपि तान्वानरान्सर्वान्नष्टाः स्थेत्यब्रवीद्बली । अभ्यधावत संक्रुद्धो मुष्टिमुद्यम्य संहितम् ।।
data.es: Seeing the monkeys, the infuriated demon ran towards them, raising his fist firmly, saying, 'You are all as good as dead, now that I have caught you.'
data.anv: सोऽपि he also, नष्टाः killed, स्थ you are, इति thus, तान् them, सर्वान् all, वानरान् monkeys, अब्रवीत् said, सङ्कृद्धः enraged, संहितम् held, मुष्टिम् the fist, उद्यम्य raising, अभ्यधावत ran towards them.
data.md: And that strong one also, saying to the monkeys, Destroyed are you, and uplifting his clenched fist, rushed after them in rage.

data.v: तमापतन्तं सहसा वालिपुत्रोऽङ्गदस्तदा । रावणोऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा तलेनाभिजघान ह ।।
data.es: Mistaking him for Ravana, Angada, Vali's son at once pounced on him and slapped him with his palm.
data.anv: तदा then, वालिपुत्रः Vali's son, अङ्गदः Angada, आपतन्तम् pouncing, तम् them, अयम् this person, रावणः is Ravana, इति thus, ज्ञात्वा on thinking, सहसा at once, तलेन  with his palm, अभिजघान ह slapped him.
data.md: And as he darted suddenly, Angada, the son of Vali, knowing, This is Ravana, administered to him a slap.

data.v: स वालिपुत्राभिहतो वक्त्राच्छोणितमुद्वमन् । असुरो न्यपतद्भूमौ पर्यस्त इव पर्वतः ।।
data.es: Struck by Vali's son, the demon vomitting blood from the mouth, fell down on the ground like a mountain, uprooted.
data.anv: वालिपुत्राभिहतः struck by the son of Vali, सः असुरः that demon, वक्त्रात् from the mouth, शोणितम् blood, उद्वमन्  vomitting, पर्यस्तः uprooted, पर्वतः इव like a mountain, भूमौ on the ground, अभ्यपतत् overturned.
data.md: Struck by Vāli's son, that Asura, his mouth vomiting blood, fell down to the earth like a hill toppled down. And on his having breathed his last, the monkeys, elated with victory, thoroughly searched that mountain cavern.

data.v: ते तु तस्मिन्निरुच्छ्वासे वानरा जितकाशिनः । व्यचिन्वन्प्रायशस्तत्र सर्वं तद्गिरिगह्वरम् ।।
data.es: He breathed his last, and the monkeys who won went searching almost all over the mountain caves.
data.anv: तस्मिन् his, निरुच्छवासे  he breathed his last, जितकाशिनः  vanaras who won him, ते they, तत्र there, प्रायशः probably, सर्वम् all over, तत् that, गिरिगह्वरम् mountain cave, व्यचिन्वन्  searched, अपि also.
data.md: Struck by Vāli's son, that Asura, his mouth vomiting blood, fell down to the earth like a hill toppled down. And on his having breathed his last, the monkeys, elated with victory, thoroughly searched that mountain cavern.

data.v: विचितं तु ततः कृत्वा सर्वे ते काननं पुनः । अन्यदेवापरं घोरं विविशुर्गिरिगह्वरम् ।।
data.es: Again they searched the forest and entered another dreadful mountain cave.
data.anv: सर्वे all, ते they, काननं पुनः again in the forest, विचितम् searched, कृत्वा having done, ततः then, अन्यदेव a different, घोरम् dreadful, अपरम् another, गिरिगह्वरम् mountain cave, विविशुः entered.
data.md: And when they had satisfied themselves that the cave had been searched all through, the dwellers of the woods entered another fearful mountain cavern.

data.v: ते विचिन्त्य पुनः खिन्ना विनिष्पत्य समागताः । एकान्ते वृक्षमूले तु निषेदुर्दीनमानसाः ।।
data.md: And after having searched (that place) also, they came out fatigued; and with desponding hearts sat them down at a distance under the shade of a tree. they came out fatigued; and with desponding hearts sat them down at a distance under the shade of a tree.

data.v: अथाङ्गदस्तदा सर्वान्वानरानिदमब्रवीत् । परिश्रान्तो महाप्राज्ञः समाश्वास्य शनैर्वचः ।।
data.es: Wise Angada, exhausted after the search, collected the monkeys, and consoling them, said slowly:
data.anv: अथ then, परिश्रान्तः an exhausted person, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, अङ्गदः Angada, तदा then, सर्वान् all, वानरान् the vanaras, समाश्वास्य consoled, शनैः slowly, इदम् these, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then the eminently wise Angada, fatigued, spoke to all the monkeys, cheering them.

data.v: वनानि गिरयो नद्यो दुर्गाणि गहनानि च । दर्यो गिरिगुहाश्चैव विचिता नः समन्ततः ।।
data.es: 'We have searched here, there, everywhere, in dense forests, hills, forts, impenetrable caverns and mountain ranges. But we could find neither Janaki who is like a goddess nor the demon who abducted her.
data.anv: अस्माभिः by all of us, सह along with, वनानि forests, गिरयः the mountains, नद्यः the rivers, दुर्गाणि inaccessible forts, गहनानि च dense, दर्यः caves, गिरिगुहाश्चैव and the mountain ranges also, समन्ततः all over, तत्र तत्र everywhere, विचितानि searched, जानकी Janaki, न दृश्यते is not seen, तदा then, सीता Sita, हृता येन by one who has stolen, सुरसुतोपमा one who is like a goddess, रक्षः च raksha, वा or.

data.v: तत्र तत्र सहास्माभिर्जानकी न च दृश्यते । तद्वा रक्षो हृता येन सीता सुरसुतोपमा ।।
data.es: 'We have searched here, there, everywhere, in dense forests, hills, forts, impenetrable caverns and mountain ranges. But we could find neither Janaki who is like a goddess nor the demon who abducted her.
data.anv: अस्माभिः by all of us, सह along with, वनानि forests, गिरयः the mountains, नद्यः the rivers, दुर्गाणि inaccessible forts, गहनानि च dense, दर्यः caves, गिरिगुहाश्चैव and the mountain ranges also, समन्ततः all over, तत्र तत्र everywhere, विचितानि searched, जानकी Janaki, न दृश्यते is not seen, तदा then, सीता Sita, हृता येन by one who has stolen, सुरसुतोपमा one who is like a goddess, रक्षः च raksha, वा or.

data.v: कालश्च नो महान्यातः सुग्रीवश्चोग्रशासनः । तस्माद्भवन्तः सहिता विचिन्वन्तु समन्ततः ।।
data.anv: नः for us, महान् long, कालः time, यातः over, सुग्रीवश्च Sugriva also, उग्रशासनः  strict in administration, तस्मात् therefore, भवन्तः all of you, सहिताः together, समन्ततः all over, विचिन्वन्तु you may search for.
data.md: We have spent a great part of the term that had been assigned by Sugrīva of stern commands. Therefore, banishing languor, sadness, and invading drowsiness, do you together search all round.

data.v: विहाय तन्द्रीं शोकं च निद्रां चैव समुत्थिताम् । विचिनुध्वं यथा सीतां पश्यामो जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: 'You should keep searching on till we see Sita, Janaka's daughter, giving up laziness and sorrow and sleep that is overpowering us.
data.anv: समुत्थिताम् overpowering us, तन्द्रीं laziness, शोकं च and sorrow, निद्रां चैव even sleep, विहाय after giving up, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, सीताम् Sita, पश्यामः we will see, यथा so also, विचिनुध्वम् you may search.
data.md: Do you so search Sītā, that she may be found out (by us). High spirits, ability and forwardness in action, are said to conduce to success. Therefore it is that I speak thus to you.

data.v: अनिर्वेदं च दाक्ष्यं च मनसश्चापराजयम् । कार्यसिद्धिकराण्याहुस्तस्मादेतद्ब्रवीम्यहम् ।।
data.es: 'It is said, zeal, capability, and fortitude can overcome defeat and lead to success. Therefore I am saying this.
data.anv: अनिर्वेदम् zeal, दाक्ष्यं च capability and, मनसः mind's, अपराजयं च robust optimism, कार्यसिद्धिकराणि conducive  to success, आहुः is said, तस्मात् therefore, अहम् I am, एतत् all this, ब्रवीमि I am telling you.
data.md: Do you so search Sītā, that she may be found out (by us). High spirits, ability and forwardness in action, are said to conduce to success. Therefore it is that I speak thus to you.

data.v: अद्यापीदं वनं दुर्गं विचिन्वन्तु वनौकसः । खेदं त्यक्त्वा पुनः सर्वं वनमेतद्विचीयताम् ।।
data.es: 'Search this impenetrable forest even now, O you denizens of this forest Give up grief, let us all once again ransack this forest.
data.anv: अद्यापि even now, वनौकसः you forestdwellers, दुर्गम् difficult to enter, तत् वनम् that forest, विचिन्वन्तु search, सर्वैः by all, खेदम् grief, त्यक्ता giving up, पुनः again, वनमेव forest itself, विचीयताम् search.
data.md: You dwellers of the wood, do you to day rummage this impenetrable wood; renouncing grief, do you again search through this forest.

data.v: अवश्यं क्रियमाणस्य दृश्यते कर्मणः फलम् । अलं निर्वेदमागम्य न हि नो मलिनं क्षमम् ।।
data.anv: क्रियमाणस्य being carried on, कर्मणः of the deed, फलम् result, अवश्यम् certainly, दृश्यते will be seen, अलम् enough, निर्वेदम् despair, आगम्य experiencing, नः for us, मीलनम् closing eyes, न क्षमम् हि not proper.
data.md: Those who act, for certain behold the fruit of their endeavours; but if people once give way to grief, they cannot again attain vigour.

data.v: सुग्रीवः क्रोधनो राजा तीक्ष्णदण्डश्च वानराः । भेतव्यं तस्य सततं रामस्य च महात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva, the monkey king, is wrathful and awards severe punishment. We should ever bear in mind the (purpose of the) great self, Rama.
data.anv: वानरः monkey, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, कोपनः an angry one, तीक्ष्णदण्डश्च severe punishment, तस्य his, महात्मनः of the great self, रामस्य च of Rama also, सततम् ever, भेतव्यम् we have to fear.
data.md: You monkeys, king Sugrīva is irascible; and inflicteth sharp punishments. He should be always feared, as also the magnanimous Rāma.

data.v: हितार्थमेतदुक्तं वः क्रियतां यदि रोचते । उच्यतां वा क्षमं यन्नः सर्वेषामेव वानराः ।।
data.es: 'I have said all this for your good. You may carry it out, if it pleases you. Speak freely if there is any other course left for all of us, O monkeys'
data.anv: वानराः O monkeys, वः हितार्थम् for your benefit, एतत् all this, उक्तम् said, रोचते यदि if it pleases you, क्रियताम् it may be done, यत् whatever, सर्वेषामेव for all of you, क्षमम् right, नः for us, उच्यताम् you may tell.
data.md: I tell you this for your good. Act accordingly, if you list. And do you also express what else you are capable of.

data.v: अङ्गदस्य वचः श्रुत्वा वचनं गन्धमादनः । उवाचाव्यक्तया वाचा पिपासा श्रमखिन्नया ।।
data.es: Having heard Angada, Gandhamadana worn out by thirst and exhaustion, replied in a feeble tone:
data.anv: अङ्गदस्य Angada's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, पिपासाश्रमखिन्नया worn out by thirst and exhaustion, अव्यक्तया feebly, वाचा with language, वचनम् these words, उवाच expressed.
data.md: Hearing Angada's words Gandhamādana said in candid words faint from thirst and fatigue,

data.v: सदृशं खलु वो वाक्यमङ्गदो यदुवाच ह । हितं चैवानुकूलं च क्रियतामस्य भाषितम् ।।
data.es: 'What Angada says is appropriate, beneficial and also favourable. Carry out his command.
data.anv: अङ्गदः Angada, यत् वाक्यम् those words, उवाच ह expressed, वः for us, सदृशं खलु appropriate too, हितं चैव good also, अनुकूलं च even favourable, अस्य his, भाषितम्  utterance, क्रियताम् carry out.
data.md: What Angada has said to us is worthy of him, and is beneficial and good. Do you follow his speech.

data.v: पुनर्मार्गामहे शैलान्कन्दरांश्च दरीस्तथा । काननानि च शून्यानि गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च ।।
data.es: 'Once again let us explore the mountains, caverns, forests, desolate places and mountain streams.
data.anv: पुनः once again, शैलान् mountains, कन्दरांश्च valleys also, तथा similarly, दरीः caverns, शून्यानि desolate places, काननानि च and forests, गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च mountain streams, मार्गामहै we will explore again.
data.md: Let us afresh search hills, caves and rocks, vacant forests and mountain cascades,-in accordance with what the high-souled Sugrīva has laid down. Let all in a body rummage the wood, and the mountain caverns.

data.v: यथोद्दिष्ठानि सर्वाणि सुग्रीवेण महात्मना । विचिन्वन्तु वनं सर्वे गिरिदुर्गाणि सर्वशः ।।
data.anv: सर्वे all of you, सर्वशः everywhere, महात्मना by great self, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, यथोद्दिष्टानि as pointed out, सर्वाणि all places, गिरिदुर्गाणि mountains, विचिन्वन्तु search, वनम् forest.
data.md: Let us afresh search hills, caves and rocks, vacant forests and mountain cascades,-in accordance with what the high-souled Sugrīva has laid down. Let all in a body rummage the wood, and the mountain caverns.

data.v: ततः समुत्थाय पुनर्वानरास्ते महाबलाः । विन्ध्यकाननसंकीर्णां विचेरुर्दक्षिणां दिशम् ।।
data.es: Once again the monkeys rose up and started exploring the mountain ranges of Vindhya and the forests surrounding the southern side.
data.anv: ततः then, महाबलाः mighty, ते वानराः those monkeys, पुनः again, समुत्थाय after getting up, विन्ध्यकाननसङ्कीर्णाम् filled with forests surrounding the ranges of Vindhya, दक्षिणां दिशम् in the southern side, विचेरुः started exploring.
data.md: There rising up, the mighty monkeys again began to range the South close with forests belonging to Vindhya.

data.v: ते शारदाभ्रप्रतिमं श्रीमद्रजतपर्वतम् । शृङ्गवन्तं दरीवन्तमधिरुह्य च वानराः ।।
data.es: Eager to find Sita, the best of monkeys climbed the silver mountain rich with peaks and caverns resembling the autumnal clouds. And looked out into the Lodhra grove and the garden of seven leaves (banara plantations).
data.anv: सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिण: eager to see Sita, हरिवराः best of monkeys, ते वानराः those monkeys, शारदाभ्रप्रतिमम् resembling the autumn clouds, श्रीमत् rich, शृङ्गवन्तम् endowed with peaks, दरीमन्तम् with caverns, रजतपर्वतम् silver mountain, अधिरुह्य having ascended, तत्र there, रम्यम् enchanting, लोध्रवनम् Lodhra grove, सप्तपर्णवनानि च and gardens of seven leaves, व्यचिन्वंस्ते they looked out.
data.md: And the monkeys ascended the Silvern Hill resembling the autumnal welkin, graceful, and furnished with summits and valleys.

data.v: तत्र लोध्रवनं रम्यं सप्तपर्णवनानि च । विचिन्वन्तो हरिवराः सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ।।
data.es: Eager to find Sita, the best of monkeys climbed the silver mountain rich with peaks and caverns resembling the autumnal clouds. And looked out into the Lodhra grove and the garden of seven leaves (banara plantations).
data.anv: सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिण: eager to see Sita, हरिवराः best of monkeys, ते वानराः those monkeys, शारदाभ्रप्रतिमम् resembling the autumn clouds, श्रीमत् rich, शृङ्गवन्तम् endowed with peaks, दरीमन्तम् with caverns, रजतपर्वतम् silver mountain, अधिरुह्य having ascended, तत्र there, रम्यम् enchanting, लोध्रवनम् Lodhra grove, सप्तपर्णवनानि च and gardens of seven leaves, व्यचिन्वंस्ते they looked out.
data.md: And eager to behold Sītā, those excellent monkeys began to search the Lodhra wood, and the Saptaparņa forests.

data.v: तस्याग्रमधिरूढास्ते श्रान्ता विपुलविक्रमाः । न पश्यन्ति स्म वैदेहीं रामस्य महिषीं प्रियाम् ।।
data.es: Even after scaling up the peak, the exhausted, heroic monkeys could not find Vaidehi, the dear queen of Rama.
data.anv: तस्य its, अग्रम् peak, अधिरूढाः they climbed, विपुलविक्रमाः very brave ones, ते they, श्रान्ताः   exhausted, रामस्य Rama's, प्रियां महिषीम् dear queen, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, न पश्यन्ति स्म  did not find.
data.md: And ascending its top*, those ones endued with immense prowess, experiencing fatigue, could not find Vaidehi, the beloved spouse of Rama. *i.e. the top of the Silvern Hill.

data.v: ते तु दृष्टिगतं कृत्वा तं शैलं बहुकन्दरम् । अवारोहन्त हरयो वीक्षमाणाः समन्ततः ।।
data.es: Having looked all over the mountain and many caverns, those monkeys got down from the mountain.
data.anv: ते हरयः those monkeys, दृष्टिगतम् having seen all over, बहुकन्दरम् having many caves, तं शैलम् that mountain, कृत्वा after doing so, समन्ततः everywhere, वीक्षमाणाः while looking at, अवारोहन्त descended.
data.md: And having surveyed that hill having many a grot, so far as the eye could range, the monkeys looking all round, descended (the eminence).

data.v: अवरुह्य ततो भूमिं श्रान्ता विगतचेतसः । स्थित्वा मुहूर्तं तत्राथ वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रिताः ।।
data.es: Descending to the foothills, the exhausted monkeys became quiet. Fatigued and disheartened, they assembled under a tree, stood for a moment and then lay down.
data.anv: ततः then, भूमिम् ground, अवरुह्य descending down, श्रान्ताः tired, विगतचेतसः dejected at heart, तत्र there, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, स्थित्वा having stood, अथ and then, वृक्षमूलम् under a tree, उपाश्रिताः lay down.
data.md: And having descended to the earth, the monkeys, bewildered, and losing their consciousness, rested for a while at the foot of a tree.

data.v: ते मुहूर्तं समाश्वस्ताः किंचिद्भग्नपरिश्रमाः । पुनरेवोद्यताः कृत्स्नां मार्गितुं दक्षिणां दिशम् ।।
data.es: Resting for a while, the frustrated monkeys resumed their search throughout the southern direction.
data.anv: ते they, मुहूर्तम् for a while, समाश्वस्ताः took rest, किञ्चित् a little, भग्नपरिश्रमाः frustrated, पुनरेव once again, कृत्स्नाम् entire, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern side, मार्गितुम् to search, उद्यताः decided.
data.md: And their fatigue having gone off a little, the monkeys, having been refreshed for a while, again prepared to explore the whole South.

data.v: हनुमत्प्रमुखास्ते तु प्रस्थिताः प्लवगर्षभाः । विन्ध्यमेवादितस्तावद्विचेरुस्ते समन्ततः ।।
data.es: The bulls among vanaras and Hanuman, the chief of the group again started exploring everywhere in the Vindhya range starting from the beginning.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyninth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: हनुमत्प्रमुखाः Hanuman being the prominent one of the group, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among the vanaras, प्रस्थिताः started search, आदितः from the beginning, तावत् all over, विन्ध्यमेव  Vindhya range itself, समन्ततः everywhere, विचेरुः roamed.
data.md: And the monkey chiefs, headed by Hanumān, having set out (on the search), began to range all through Vindhya.

data.v: सह ताराङ्गदाभ्यां तु संगम्य हनुमान्कपिः । विचिनोति स्म विन्ध्यस्य गुहाश्च गहनानि च ।।
data.es: Hanuman, together with the monkeys, Tara and Angada, searched in the impenetrable places and caves of Vindhya.
data.anv: कपिः Monkey, हनुमान् Hanuman, ताराङ्गदाभ्यां सह along with Tara and Angada, सङ्गम्य together with, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya, गुहाश्च caves, गहनानि च and impenetrable places, विचिनोति स्म searched for.
data.md: The monkey, Hanumān, in company with Tārā and Angada searcheth the caves and woods of Vindhya, caverns all around haunted by lions and tigers, and in vast inaccessible cascades in that foremost of mountains.

data.v: सिंहशार्दूलजुष्टाश्च गुहाश्च परितस्तथा । विषमेषु नगेन्द्रस्य महाप्रस्रवणेषु च ।।
data.es: They also searched near rivers, mountain streams, hill ranges, caves of lions and tigers, in the rock shelters and difficult spots of vast mountains.
data.anv: तदा then, सरितः rivers, सिंहशार्दूलजुष्टेषु inhabited by lions and tigers, शिलाश्च rocks, नगेन्द्रस्य vast mountain, विषमेषु in difficult spots, महाप्रस्रवणेषु च near mountain streams also.
data.md: The monkey, Hanumān, in company with Tārā and Angada searcheth the caves and woods of Vindhya, caverns all around haunted by lions and tigers, and in vast inaccessible cascades in that foremost of mountains.

data.v: तेषां तत्रैव वसतां स कालो व्यत्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: They reached the end of the southwest side of the mountain(Vindhya). While they were still there, the time stipulated for them (to find Sita) had slipped.
data.anv: तस्य शैलस्य that mountain's, दक्ष्णिपश्चिमाम् southwest side, कोटिम् end of, आसेदुः reached, तेषाम् for them, तत्रैव while being there, वसताम् while they stayed, सः कालः that time, व्यत्यवर्तत slipped.
data.md: And they came to the south-western summit of the inountain. And when they sojourned there, their (appointed) term had not expired.

data.v: स हि देशो दुरन्वेषो गुहा गहनवान्महान् । तत्र वायुसुतः सर्वं विचिनोति स्म पर्वतम् ।।
data.es: They searched in dense forests, interior locations impassable, desolate and terrific, without water, and people.
data.anv: गुहागहनवान् a location with impenetrable caves, महान् great, सः देशः that place, दुरन्वेषः is difficult to search, निर्जलम्  with no water, निर्जनम् no people, शून्यम् desolate, गहनम्  impassable, रोमहर्षणम् terrific.
data.md: And that spacious country, consisting as it did, of caves and grots and woods, was difficult to search. And there the wind-god's offspring searched all over the mountain.

data.v: परस्परेण रहिता अन्योन्यस्याविदूरतः । गजो गवाक्षो गवयः शरभो गन्धमादनः ।।
मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चैव हनुमाञ्जाम्बवानपि । अङ्गदो युवराजश्च तारश्च वनगोचरः ।।
गिरिजालावृतान्देशान्मार्गित्वा दक्षिणां दिशम् । क्षुत्पिपासा परीताश्च श्रान्ताश्च सलिलार्थिनः । अवकीर्णं लतावृक्षैर्ददृशुस्ते महाबिलम् ।।
data.es: Overcome with hunger and thirst, the exhausted monkeys noticed a huge cave covered with creepers and bushes, while they were looking around for water.
data.anv: क्षुत्पिपासापरीताः overcome by hunger and thirst, श्रान्ताः tired out, सलिलार्थिनः (desperately) looking for water, ते they, लतावृक्षैः with creepers and bushes, अवकीर्णम् spread with creepers and trees, महाबिलम् huge cave, ददृशुः saw.

data.v: ततः क्रौञ्चाश्च हंसाश्च सारसाश्चापि निष्क्रमन् । जलार्द्राश्चक्रवाकाश्च रक्ताङ्गाः पद्मरेणुभिः ।।
data.es: Just then, the kraunchas, swans, geese and chakravaka drenched in water with their limbs reddened with the pollen of lotuses were fluttering out (of the cave).
data.anv: तत्र there, क्रौञ्चाश्च kraunchas, हंसाश्च swans, सारसाश्च geese, जलार्द्राः drenched in water, पद्मरेणुभिः covered by the pollen of lotuses, रक्ताङ्गाः wings red in colour, चक्रवाकाश्च chakravakas, विनिष्क्रमन् flying out of it.

data.v: ततस्तद्बिलमासाद्य सुगन्धि दुरतिक्रमम् । विस्मयव्यग्रमनसो बभूवुर्वानरर्षभाः ।।
data.es: The bulls among the monkeys were bewildered when they reached the cave which was difficult to access.
data.anv: ततः then, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, सुगन्धि fragrant, दुरतिक्रमम् difficult to enter, तत्  that, बिलम् cave, आसाद्य  reached, विस्मयव्यग्रमनसः bewildered, बभूवुः became.
data.md: And drawing nigh to that fragrant and inaccessible cave, those superior monkeys were struck with amaze, and became eager (to enter into it).

data.v: संजातपरिशङ्कास्ते तद्बिलं प्लवगोत्तमाः । अभ्यपद्यन्त संहृष्टास्तेजोवन्तो महाबलाः ।।
data.es: The brilliant host of monkeys experienced both fear and joy to see the cave difficult to enter.
data.anv: तेजोवन्तः brilliant, महाबलाः forces, ते those, प्लवगोत्तमाः best of the monkeys, सञ्जातपरिशङ्काः afraid, संहृष्टाः they felt happy, तत् बिलम् that cave, अभ्यपद्यन्त that was difficult to enter.

data.v: ततः पर्वतकूटाभो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः । अब्रवीद्वानरान्सर्वान्कान्तार वनकोविदः ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod who appeared like a huge mountain and knew about forests spoke to the fellowmonkeys:
data.anv: ततः then, पर्वतकूटाभः a being as huge as a mountain, कान्तारवनकोविदः knowledgeable of dense forests, पवनात्मजः son of the windgod, हनूमान् Hanuman, सर्वान् all, वानरान् monkeys, अब्रवीत् said:

data.v: गिरिजालावृतान्देशान्मार्गित्वा दक्षिणां दिशम् । वयं सर्वे परिश्रान्ता न च पश्यामि मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'Going round the places covering all mountain ranges in the southern direction, we are spent. But we could not see Maithili.
data.anv: वयम् we, सर्वे all, गिरिजालावृतान् having covered all the mountain ranges, देशान् places, मार्गित्वा having searched, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern side, परिश्रान्ताः exhausted, मैथिलीम् Maithili, न च पश्याम not see.
data.md: Having explored the South, (containing) countries enveloped with mountain chains, we have all got fatigued, but we have failed to find Mithila's daughter.

data.v: अस्माच्चापि बिलाद्धंसाः क्रौञ्चाश्च सह सारसैः । जलार्द्राश्चक्रवाकाश्च निष्पतन्ति स्म सर्वशः ।।
data.es: Just then, the kraunchas, swans, geese and chakravaka drenched in water with their limbs reddened with the pollen of lotuses were fluttering out (of the cave).
data.anv: तत्र there, क्रौञ्चाश्च kraunchas, हंसाश्च swans, सारसाश्च geese, जलार्द्राः drenched in water, पद्मरेणुभिः covered by the pollen of lotuses, रक्ताङ्गाः wings red in colour, चक्रवाकाश्च chakravakas, विनिष्क्रमन् flying out of it.
data.md: And from yonder cave come out swarms of and and kraunchas and chakravākas, drenched with water. For certain here is a well or a watery expanse. And at the mouth of the cave there are these cool trees.'

data.v: नूनं सलिलवानत्र कूपो वा यदि वा ह्रदः । तथा चेमे बिलद्वारे स्निग्धास्तिष्ठन्ति पादपाः ।।
data.es: 'From this cave have emerged several birds like sarasas, swans, kraunchas and chakravakas drenched in water. Surely there must be a source of plenty of water or well or a pond. Moreover there are shining( green) trees at the entrance of the cave (suggesting subsoil water).'
data.anv: अस्मात् from this, बिलात् cave, हंसाः swans, सारसैः सह with sarasas, क्रौञ्चाश्च and kraunchas, जलार्द्राः drenched in water, चक्रवाकाश्च chakravakas also, सर्वशः all over, निष्पतन्ति स्म emerging, अत्र here, सलिलवान्  abundant water, कूपो वा well or, यदि वा so also, ह्रदः a pond, नूनम् surely, तथा like that, इमे these, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of the cave, पादपाः trees, स्निग्धाः shining, तिष्ठन्ति are present.
data.md: And from yonder cave come out swarms of and and kraunchas and chakravākas, drenched with water. For certain here is a well or a watery expanse. And at the mouth of the cave there are these cool trees.'

data.v: इत्युक्तास्तद्बिलं सर्वे विविशुस्तिमिरावृतम् । अचन्द्रसूर्यं हरयो ददृशू रोमहर्षणम् ।।
data.es: On hearing him, the monkeys entered the cave full of darkness. There was no light of the Moon or the Sun. It was a horripilating experience.
data.anv: इति thus, उक्त्वा having been told, सर्वे all, तिमिरावृतम् filled with darkness, तत् बिलम् that cave, विविशुः  entered, हरयः monkeys, अचन्द्रसूर्यम् where there is no Moon or Sun light, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, ददृशुः saw.

data.v: ततस्तस्मिन्बिले दुर्गे नानापादपसंकुले । अन्योन्यं संपरिष्वज्य जग्मुर्योजनमन्तरम् ।।
data.es: Holding one another's hands, they went in for a distance of one yojana inside the cave that was densely covered with several kinds of trees.
data.anv: ततः then, अन्योन्यम् one another, सम्परिष्वज्य after holding on, दुर्गे in the dense, नानापादपसङ्कुले in a place filled with several kinds of trees, तस्मिन् बिले in that cave, योजनम् yojana, अन्तरम् inside, जग्मुः went.

data.v: ते नष्टसंज्ञास्तृषिताः संभ्रान्ताः सलिलार्थिनः । परिपेतुर्बिले तस्मिन्कंचित्कालमतन्द्रिताः ।।
data.es: Having nearly lost their senses (without water to drink), the thirsty and bewildered monkeys were desperate for water.They wandered in the cave without feeling lazy for some time.
data.anv: नष्टसंज्ञाः they nearly lost consciousness, तृषिताः thirsty ones, सम्भ्रान्ताः bewildered ones, सलिलार्थिनः they were desperate for water, ते they, अतन्द्रिताः without feeling lazy, तस्मिन् in that, बिले in the cave, कञ्चित्कालम् for a while, परिपेतुः wandered.
data.md: And deprived of their sense, and tried with thirst, and bewildered, and thirsting for water, they for a time vigilantly descended in darkness down the cave. And emaciated, with woebegone faces, and spent, those monkeys despairing of their lives, (at last) saw light.

data.v: ते कृशा दीनवदनाः परिश्रान्ताः प्लवंगमाः । आलोकं ददृशुर्वीरा निराशा जीविते तदा ।।
data.es: Exhausted and enfeebled, they saw with dejected faces a gleam of light at a time when they were desparate.
data.anv: कृशाः weakened, दीनवदनाः having dejected faces, परिश्रान्ताः exhausted ones, ते they, वीराः heroes, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, यदा when, जीविते in life, निराशाः desperate, आलोकम् light, ददृशुः beheld.

data.v: ततस्तं देशमागम्य सौम्यं वितिमिरं वनम् । ददृशुः काञ्चनान्वृक्षान्दीप्तवैश्वानरप्रभान् ।।
data.md: Those mild ones, coming to a spot free from darkness, saw golden trees, possessed of the brightness of flaming fire.

data.v: सालांस्तालांश्च पुंनागान्ककुभान्वञ्जुलान्धवान् । चम्पकान्नागवृक्षांश्च कर्णिकारांश्च पुष्पितान् ।।
तरुणादित्यसंकाशान्वैदूर्यमयवेदिकान् । नीलवैदूर्यवर्णाश्च पद्मिनीः पतगावृताः ।।
महद्भिः काञ्चनैर्वृक्षैर्वृतं बालार्क संनिभैः । जातरूपमयैर्मत्स्यैर्महद्भिश्च सकच्छपैः ।।
नलिनीस्तत्र ददृशुः प्रसन्नसलिलायुताः । काञ्चनानि विमानानि राजतानि तथैव च ।।
तपनीयगवाक्षाणि मुक्ताजालावृतानि च । हैमराजतभौमानि वैदूर्यमणिमन्ति च ।।
data.es: The vanaras beheld highrise palaces built with gold and silver. The windows fixed on the roof were golden, shaped like cow's eye with lattices of pearls. They also saw best of houses built in gold, silver and clay, decorated with precious gems including vaidurya.
data.anv: हरयः monkeys, तत्र there, काञ्चनानि golden, तथैव similarly, राजतानि silver, विमानानि highrise palaces, तपनीयगवाक्षाणि golden windows (shaped like cow's eye fixed on the roofs and walls), मुक्ताजालावृतानि च covered with lattices of pearls, हैमराजतभौमानि made of gold, silver and mud (earth), वैदुर्यमणिमन्ति च decorated with precious gems of vaidurya, गृहमुख्यानि beautiful houses, सर्वशः all over, ददृशुः they saw.

data.v: ददृशुस्तत्र हरयो गृहमुख्यानि सर्वशः । पुष्पितान्फलिनो वृक्षान्प्रवालमणिसंनिभान् ।।
काञ्चनभ्रमरांश्चैव मधूनि च समन्ततः । मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि शयनान्यासनानि च ।।
महार्हाणि च यानानि ददृशुस्ते समन्ततः । हैमराजतकांस्यानां भाजनानां च संचयान् ।।
data.es: They saw all over rich collections of beds, couches and highly valuable vehicles, decorated beautifully with gems and gold.They also saw a large collection of shining utensils made of gold, silver and bronze.
data.anv: ते they, मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि wonderfully shining with gems and gold, महार्हाणि highly valuable ones, च also, यानानि vehicles, शयनानि beds, आसनानि च and couches, हैमराजतकांस्यानाम् made of gold, silver and bronze, भाजनानाम् of utensils, संञ्चयान् च collections, समन्ततः all over, ददृशुः they saw.

data.v: अगरूणां च दिव्यानां चन्दनानां च संचयान् । शुचीन्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च ।।
data.es: There they noticed a wonderful collection of incense and sandal, tasty and pure eatables, roots and fruits
data.anv: दिव्यानाम् of wonderful, अगरूणाम् of incense, चन्दनानाम् of sandal, सञ्चयान् collections, शुचीनि pure, अभ्यवहार्याणि eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits.

data.v: महार्हाणि च पानानि मधूनि रसवन्ति च । दिव्यानामम्बराणां च महार्हाणां च संचयान् । कम्बलानां च चित्राणामजिनानां च संचयान् ।।
data.es: (They found) excellent drinks and many kinds of honey, wonderful collections of clothes, colourful blankets and heaps of animal skin.
data.anv: महार्हाणि very rich, पानानि drinks, रसवन्ति tasty, मधूनि many kinds of honey,  दिव्यानाम्    wonderful, महार्हाणाम् of valuable ones, अम्बराणाम् of clothes, सञ्चयान् च and collections, चित्राणाम् of colourful, कम्बलानां च of blankets, अजिनानां च of animal skins, सञ्चयान् collection.

data.v: तत्र तत्र विचिन्वन्तो बिले तत्र महाप्रभाः । ददृशुर्वानराः शूराः स्त्रियं कांचिददूरतः ।।
data.es: While searching here and there in the cave, the strong and powerful monkeys discovered a woman not far from there.
data.anv: महाबलाः strong, शूराः powerful, वानराः monkeys, तस्मिन्बिले in that cave, तत्र तत्र here and there, विचिन्वन्तः while they searched, अदूरतः not far from there, काञ्चित् some, स्त्रियम् woman, ददृशुः saw.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा भृशसंत्रस्ताश्चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बराम् । तापसीं नियताहारां ज्वलन्तीमिव तेजसा ।।
data.es: She was an ascetic in bark robes and deer skin blazing with lustre, restrained in her food. The monkeys got very frightened.
data.anv: दृष्ट्वा on seeing, तां her, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बराम् wearing deer skin and bark robes, नियताहाराम् restricted food, तेजसा with lustre, ज्वलन्तीमिव as if glowing, तापसीम् a female ascetic, भृशसन्त्रस्ता very much frightened.

data.v: ततो हनूमान्गिरिसंनिकाशः; कृताञ्जलिस्तामभिवाद्य वृद्धाम् । पप्रच्छ का त्वं भवनं बिलं च; रत्नानि चेमानि वदस्व कस्य ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman who was of the size of a mountain greeted the old lady with folded hands and enquired her 'Who are you? To whom does this mansion, this cave and these gems belong?'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of fiftieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic of the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, गिरिसन्निकाशः resembling a mountain in size, हनूमान् Hanuman, कृताञ्जलिः offered salutations with folded palms, तां वृद्धाम् to that old lady, अभिवाद्य having greeted, पप्रच्छ enquired, त्वम् you, का who, भवनम् this mansion, बिलं च and cave, इमानि these, रत्नानि च  gems, कस्य whose, वदस्व  tell.
data.md: And-Hanumān like to a hill, bowing down to the old women with joined hands, asked her, saying,-Who are you? And tell me, to whom belong this edifice and the cave as well as all these jewels.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा हनुमांस्तत्र पुनः कृष्णाजिनाम्बराम् । अब्रवीत्तां महाभागां तापसीं धर्मचारिणीम् ।।
data.es: On meeting the distinguished, righteous ascetic woman robed in deer skin, Hanuman said:
data.anv: तत्र there, हनुमान् Hanuman, इति thus, उक्त्वा having addressed, पुनः again, कृष्णाजिनाम्बराम् robed in deer skin, महाभागाम् a distinguished lady, धर्मचारिणीम् a righteous woman, तां तापसीम् ascetic woman, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having said this to that female clad in a piece of black deer-skin, Hanumān asked that highly religious ascetic practising pious offices,

data.v: इदं प्रविष्टाः सहसा बिलं तिमिरसंवृतम् । क्षुत्पिपासा परिश्रान्ताः परिखिन्नाश्च सर्वशः ।।
data.es: 'We are exhausted with thirst and hunger. We are fatigued. (Hence) we entered this dark cave all at once(without waiting for permission).
data.anv: क्षुत्पिपासापरिश्रान्ताः exhausted with hunger and thirst, सर्वशः by all means, परिखिन्नाश्च fatigued, तिमिरसंवृतम् filled with darkness, इदम् this, बिलम् cave, सहसा all at once, प्रविष्टाः entered.

data.v: महद्धिरण्या विवरं प्रविष्टाः स्म पिपासिताः । इमांस्त्वेवं विधान्भावान्विविधानद्भुतोपमान् । दृष्ट्वा वयं प्रव्यथिताः संभ्रान्ता नष्टचेतसः ।।
data.es: 'Thirst drove us into this cave on earth. We are amazed at the kind of many wonderful objects here and have nearly lost our senses. We are tormented with pain.
data.anv: पिपासिताः thirsty, धरण्याः of the earth, महत् huge, विवरम् hole, प्रविष्टाः स्म we entered, एवं विधान् this kind, विविधान् many, अद्भुतोपमान् wonderful ones, इमान् these, भावान् feelings, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, वयम् we, नष्टचेतसः having lost conciousness nearly, सम्भ्रान्ताः amazed, प्रव्यथिताः we are pained.

data.v: कस्येमे काञ्चना वृक्षास्तरुणादित्यसंनिभाः । शुचीन्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च ।।
data.es: There they noticed a wonderful collection of incense and sandal, tasty and pure eatables, roots and fruits
data.anv: दिव्यानाम् of wonderful, अगरूणाम् of incense, चन्दनानाम् of sandal, सञ्चयान् collections, शुचीनि pure, अभ्यवहार्याणि eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits.

data.v: काञ्चनानि विमानानि राजतानि गृहाणि च । तपनीय गवाक्षाणि मणिजालावृतानि च ।।
data.es: The vanaras beheld highrise palaces built with gold and silver. The windows fixed on the roof were golden, shaped like cow's eye with lattices of pearls. They also saw best of houses built in gold, silver and clay, decorated with precious gems including vaidurya.
data.anv: हरयः monkeys, तत्र there, काञ्चनानि golden, तथैव similarly, राजतानि silver, विमानानि highrise palaces, तपनीयगवाक्षाणि golden windows (shaped like cow's eye fixed on the roofs and walls), मुक्ताजालावृतानि च covered with lattices of pearls, हैमराजतभौमानि made of gold, silver and mud (earth), वैदुर्यमणिमन्ति च decorated with precious gems of vaidurya, गृहमुख्यानि beautiful houses, सर्वशः all over, ददृशुः they saw.

data.v: पुष्पिताः फालवन्तश्च पुण्याः सुरभिगन्धिनः । इमे जाम्बूनदमयाः पादपाः कस्य तेजसा ।।
काञ्चनानि च पद्मानि जातानि विमले जले । कथं मत्स्याश्च सौवर्णा चरन्ति सह कच्छपैः ।।
data.md: And golden lotuses spring in in lucent water,-how golden fishes are discovered in it along with tortoises! Have these sprung from your power; or do they owe their existence to the ascetic energy of any other? It behoves you to relate all this to us who are ignorant of everything.

data.v: आत्मानमनुभावं च कस्य चैतत्तपोबलम् । अजानतां नः सर्वेषां सर्वमाख्यातुमर्हसि ।।
एवमुक्ता हनुमता तापसी धर्मचारिणी । प्रत्युवाच हनूमन्तं सर्वभूतहिते रता ।।
data.es: Requested by Hanuman who was skilful in conversation, wise Rama, slayer of enemies, replied:
data.anv: हनुमता by Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्तः said, परवीरहा slayer of enemies, वाक्यकोविदः skilful in talk, बुद्धिमान् wise, राघवः Rama, हनूमन्तम् to Hanuman, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Thus addressed by Hanumān, the female ascetic practising righteousness, and engaged in the welfare of all beings, replied to Hanumān,

data.v: मयो नाम महातेजा मायावी दानवर्षभः । तेनेदं निर्मितं सर्वं मायया काञ्चनं वनम् ।।
data.es: 'O bull among monkeys this golden forest was created by the magical power of a deceitful demon called Maya.
data.anv: वानरर्षभः O bull among monkeys, महातेजाः brilliant, मायावी a deceitful, मयो नाम called Maya, इदम् this, सर्वम् all, काञ्चनं वनम् golden forest, तेन by his, मायया magical power, निर्मितम् created.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys, there is one, named Maya, spreader of illusions. By him has this entire golden grove been constructed through his wonderful power of construction.

data.v: पुरा दानवमुख्यानां विश्वकर्मा बभूव ह । येनेदं काञ्चनं दिव्यं निर्मितं भवनोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: This best of wonderful mansions has been constructed earlier by Visvakarma, the chief (architect) of the demons.
data.anv: येन by whomsoever, काञ्चनम् golden, दिव्यम् wonderful, इदम् this, भवनोत्तमम् best of mansions, निर्मितम् constructed, पुरा earlier, दानवमुख्यानाम्  chiefs of demons, विश्वकर्मा Visvakarma, बभूव existed.
data.md: He that as reared this excellent golden grove, and this charming mansion, was formerly the Viśvakarmā* of the principal Dänavas. *The name of the celestial architect.

data.v: स तु वर्षसहस्राणि तपस्तप्त्वा महावने । पितामहाद्वरं लेभे सर्वमौशसनं धनम् ।।
data.es: 'He (Maya) performed rigorous penance in the dense forest for thousands of years seeking the favour of Brahma, the creator and obtained a boon that he should inherit all the wealth of Usanas (Shukra).
data.anv: सः that, वने in the forest, वर्षसहस्राणि for thousands of years, महावने dense forest, तपः penance, तप्त्वा having performed, पितामहात् from the creator Brahma, वरम् boon, औशनसम् of Usanas, सर्वम् all, धनम् wealth, लेभे inherited.
data.md: Having for a thousand years thousand years practised austerities in this vast forest, he obtained a boon from the Great-father,-in virtue of which he had attained consummate mastery in his art, as well as absolute control over the materials required therein.

data.v: विधाय सर्वं बलवान्सर्वकामेश्वरस्तदा । उवास सुखितः कालं कंचिदस्मिन्महावने ।।
data.es: Then the mighty Maya who received the power of (executing) desires created this mansion and lived here happily for some time in this dense forest.
data.anv: तदा then, बलवान् powerful one, सर्वकामेश्वरः master of all desires, सुखितः happily, अस्मिन् in this, महावने in this dense forest, कञ्चित्कालम् for some time, उवास lived, वनं the forest, विधाय after creating.
data.md: Having accomplished everything, that powerful one, commanding every enjoyment, for a time happily dwelt in this mighty forest.

data.v: तमप्सरसि हेमायां सक्तं दानवपुंगवम् । विक्रम्यैवाशनिं गृह्य जघानेशः पुरंदरः ।।
data.es: 'Seeing this great demon in love with a heavenly apsara (nymph) called Hema, Lord Indra with all his might attacked him with his thunderbolt.
data.anv: हेमायाम् Hema, अप्सरसि an apsarasa or angel, सक्तम् infatuated, तम् him, दानवपुङ्गवम् great demon, ईशः lord, पुरन्दरः Indra, अशनिम् thunderbolt, गृह्य after taking, विक्रम्यैव with all his might, जघान attacked.
data.md: Then he, happening to conceive a passion for an Apsara, Hema (by name), Purandara, vigorously wielding his thunder-bolt, struck him dead.

data.v: इदं च ब्रह्मणा दत्तं हेमायै वनमुत्तमम् । शाश्वतः कामभोगश्च गृहं चेदं हिरण्मयम् ।।
data.es: 'Thus this wonderful forest and the golden house with all luxury were given away permanently to Hema by the creator Brahma.
data.anv: इदम् thus, उत्तमम् wonderful, वनम् forest, शाश्वता: permanently, कामभोगश्च luxurious life, हिरण्मयम् golden, इदम् this, गृहम् house, ब्रह्मणा creator Brahma, हेमायै to Hema, दत्तम् was given.
data.md: Then Brahmä conferred on Hemā this fine forest and this golden mansion, with the perpetual privilege of enjoying every pleasure herein.

data.v: दुहिता मेरुसावर्णेरहं तस्याः स्वयं प्रभा । इदं रक्षामि भवनं हेमाया वानरोत्तम ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys daughter of Meru Sauvarni, I am Svayamprabha (selfilluminator), caretaker of this house of Hema. (Meru Sauvarni is the eleventh Manu).
data.anv: वानरोत्तम best of monkeys, मेरुसावर्णेः of Meru Sauvarni, दुहिता daughter, स्वयंप्रभा Svayamprabha, अहम् me, तस्याः her, हेमायाः Hema's, इदम् this, भवनम् house, रक्षामिI protect.
data.md: I, Svayamprabhā by name,-the daughter of Merusāvarņi, guard this house of Hemā, O foremost of monkeys.

data.v: मम प्रियसखी हेमा नृत्तगीतविशारदा । तया दत्तवरा चास्मि रक्षामि भवनोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'Hema, wellversed in dance and music is a fast friend to me. She granted a boon (that none can resist me) and gave this house of which I am the caretaker.
data.anv: नृत्तगीतविशारदा wellversed in dance and music, हेमा Hema, मम to me, प्रियसखी dear friend, तया as such, दत्तवरा granted a boon, अस्मि I am, उत्तमम् supreme, भवनम् house, रक्षामि I watch this house.
data.md: Hemā, skilled in dance and song, is my dear friend. having received her blessing, I guard this vast forest.

data.v: किं कार्यं कस्य वा हेतोः कान्ताराणि प्रपद्यथ । कथं चेदं वनं दुर्गं युष्माभिरुपलक्षितम् ।।
data.es: 'What is your mission? For what purpose have you come to this inaccessible forest? What are you looking for?How did you find this?
data.anv: कार्यम् mission, किम् what, कस्य वा for what, हेतोः for purpose, कान्ताराणि these forests, प्रपश्यथ you are looking for, दुर्गम् inaccessible, इदम् वनम् this forest, युष्माभिः by all of you, कथम् how, उपलक्षितम् was found?
data.md: What is your errand? And why is it that you have arrived at these lone woods? And how have you managed to see this inaccessible forest?

data.v: इमान्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च । भुक्त्वा पीत्वा च पानीयं सर्वं मे वक्तुमर्हथ ।।
data.es: 'Eat these wonderful roots and fruits and have these drinks and then tell me all about you.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकपञ्चशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of the fiftyfirst sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: इमान् these, अभ्यवहार्याणि wonderful eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits, भुक्त्वा after eating, पानीयम् drink, पीत्वा च taking, मे to me, सर्वम् every thing, वक्तुम् you may tell, अर्हथ you may do so.
data.md: Having partaken of these fruits and roots intended for use, and drunk, do you detail all this to me.

data.v: अथ तानब्रवीत्सर्वान्विश्रान्तान्हरियूथपान् । इदं वचनमेकाग्रा तापसी धर्मचारिणी ।।
data.es: After the monkey leaders had taken rest, the noble ascetic with undiverted attention said these words:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, धर्मचारिणी righteous woman, एकाग्रा with concentration, तापसी ascetic woman, विश्रान्तान्  had rested, तान् those, सर्वान् all, हरियूथपान् monkey leaders, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then to all the monkey-chiefs, after they had rested, the female ascetic, engaged in righteous practices, eagerly said these words,

data.v: वानरा यदि वः खेदः प्रनष्टः फलभक्षणात् । यदि चैतन्मया श्राव्यं श्रोतुमिच्छामि कथ्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys if you have been relieved of your fatigue after eating fruits, now tell me about yourself, if you think it can be told. I want to hear.
data.anv: वानराः O monkey, फलभक्षणात् by eating fruits, वः your, खेदः sorrow, प्रनष्टः यदि is relieved, एतत् thus, मया by me, श्राव्यं च यदि if it can be heard, कथ्यताम् it may be narrated, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छामि I wish.
data.md: You monkeys, if your pain has gone off in consequence of the fare of fruits which you have partaken, and also if it be fit to be heard by me, I would listen to your narration.

data.v: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः । आर्जवेन यथातत्त्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: When Hanuman, son of the Windgod, heard her, he started narrating frankly and truthfully.
data.anv: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनूमान् Hanuman, तस्याः her, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, आर्जवेन frankly, यथातत्त्वम् faithfully, आख्यातुम् to narrate, उपचक्रमे started.
data.md: Hearing her words, Hanumān, the son of the wind-god, in all candour began to relate everything faithfully.

data.v: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः । रामो दाशरथिः श्रीमान्प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम् ।।
data.es: 'Rama, son of Dasaratha, a prosperous king of all the worlds, comparable to Indra and Varuna came to the Dandaka forest along with his brother Laksmana and wife Vaidehi. Ravana abducted his wife from Janasthana.
data.anv: सर्वस्य for the entire, लोकस्य world's, राजा king, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः comparable to Indra and Varuna, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, श्रीमान् prosperous, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered, तस्य his, भार्या wife, रावणेन by Ravana, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, बलात् forcibly, हृता she was abducted.
data.md: The Sovereign of all this world, resembling Mahendra or Varuna, Rāma, the graceful son of Dasaratha, entered the woods of Dandaka, in company with his brother, Laksmana, as well as his spouse, Vaidehi. His wife has been forcibly carried of by Rāvana.

data.v: लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या चापि भार्यया । तस्य भार्या जनस्थानाद्रावणेन हृता बलात् ।।
data.es: 'Rama, son of Dasaratha, a prosperous king of all the worlds, comparable to Indra and Varuna came to the Dandaka forest along with his brother Laksmana and wife Vaidehi. Ravana abducted his wife from Janasthana.
data.anv: सर्वस्य for the entire, लोकस्य world's, राजा king, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः comparable to Indra and Varuna, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, श्रीमान् prosperous, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered, तस्य his, भार्या wife, रावणेन by Ravana, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, बलात् forcibly, हृता she was abducted.
data.md: The Sovereign of all this world, resembling Mahendra or Varuna, Rāma, the graceful son of Dasaratha, entered the woods of Dandaka, in company with his brother, Laksmana, as well as his spouse, Vaidehi. His wife has been forcibly carried of by Rāvana.

data.v: वीरस्तस्य सखा राज्ञः सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः । राजा वानरमुख्यानां येन प्रस्थापिता वयम् ।।
data.anv: वीरः hero, वानरमुख्यानाम् lord of monkeys, राजा king, सुग्रीवो नाम called Sugriva, वानरः monkey, तस्य his, राज्ञः the king's, सखा friend, येन by whom, वयम् we, प्रस्थापिताः are sent.
data.md: His friend is that heroic king, the monkey named Sugrīva. By that monarch of the foremnost monkeys have we been despatched (hither). And we have, joining company with these prime monkeys headed by Angada, come to the South, protected by Yama, and inhabited by Agastya.

data.v: अगस्त्यचरितामाशां दक्षिणां यमरक्षिताम् । सहैभिर्वानरैर्मुख्यैरङ्गदप्रमुखैर्वयम् ।।
data.es: 'We along with the dreadful monkeys are sent with Angada as our chief to the southern direction, guarded by Yama and inhabited by sage Agasti. We are commanded to search Sita, princess of Videha and also the abode of the demon Ravana who assumes any form at his free will.
data.anv: सर्वे all, सहिताः together, वैदेह्या Videha, सीतया सह with Sita, कामरूपिणम् he who changes his form at his will, राक्षसम् demon, रावणम् Ravana, मार्गध्वम् direction, इति thus, वयम् we, अङ्गदप्रमुखैः with Angada as chief, एभिः these also, मुख्यैः with leaders, वानरैः सह along with the monkeys, अगस्त्यचरिताम् where sage Agasthya lived, यमरक्षिताम् protected by Yama, दक्षिणाम् southern direction, आशाम् intent on, चोदिताः to search.
data.md: His friend is that heroic king, the monkey named Sugrīva. By that monarch of the foremnost monkeys have we been despatched (hither). And we have, joining company with these prime monkeys headed by Angada, come to the South, protected by Yama, and inhabited by Agastya.

data.v: रावणं सहिताः सर्वे राक्षसं कामरूपिणम् । सीतया सह वैदेह्या मार्गध्वमिति चोदिताः ।।
data.es: 'We along with the dreadful monkeys are sent with Angada as our chief to the southern direction, guarded by Yama and inhabited by sage Agasti. We are commanded to search Sita, princess of Videha and also the abode of the demon Ravana who assumes any form at his free will.
data.anv: सर्वे all, सहिताः together, वैदेह्या Videha, सीतया सह with Sita, कामरूपिणम् he who changes his form at his will, राक्षसम् demon, रावणम् Ravana, मार्गध्वम् direction, इति thus, वयम् we, अङ्गदप्रमुखैः with Angada as chief, एभिः these also, मुख्यैः with leaders, वानरैः सह along with the monkeys, अगस्त्यचरिताम् where sage Agasthya lived, यमरक्षिताम् protected by Yama, दक्षिणाम् southern direction, आशाम् intent on, चोदिताः to search.
data.md: And we have been commissioned, 'Do you all search for the Rākşasa Rāvana, wearing forms at will, along with Videha's daughter, Sītā.'

data.v: विचित्य तु वयं सर्वे समग्रां दक्षिणां दिशम् । बुभुक्षिताः परिश्रान्ता वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रिताः ।।
data.anv: वयम् we, सर्वे all, सर्वम् all over, समग्रां entirely, वयं we, परिश्रान्ता exhausted, दक्षिणां दिशम् on the southern direction, विचित्य after searching, बुभुक्षिताः feeling hungry, वृक्षमूलम् under a tree, उपाश्रिताः  sheltered.
data.md: Having searched through the forest as well as the ocean on the South, we becoming hungry, sat down at the foot of a tree.

data.v: विवर्णवदनाः सर्वे सर्वे ध्यानपरायणाः । नाधिगच्छामहे पारं मग्नाश्चिन्तामहार्णवे ।।
data.es: 'We were all exhausted, lost in thought and worried, unable to cross this deep ocean of sorrow. We did not know how to proceed.
data.anv: सर्वे all of us, विवर्णवदनाः palefaced, सर्वे all, ध्यानपरायणाः lost in thought, चिन्तामहार्णवे in the deep ocean of worry, मग्नाः immersed, पारम् the shore, नाधिगच्छामहे we were unable to find.
data.md: And with pallid countenance, we all, absorbed in thought, sank in a wide sea of anxiety, which we could not cross.

data.v: चारयन्तस्ततश्चक्षुर्दृष्टवन्तो महद्बिलम् । लतापादपसंछन्नं तिमिरेण समावृतम् ।।
data.es: 'Then while we were looking around we saw this cave concealed by trees and vines, with darkness spread all over.
data.anv: ततः then, चक्षुः eyes, चारयन्तः while we were looking around, लतापादपसञ्च्छन्नम् concealed by vines and trees, तिमिरेण with darkness, समावृतम् spread all over, वयम् we, बिलम् cave, दृष्टवन्तः we saw.
data.md: And casting our eyes around, we spyed a huge cave covered with trees and plants and enveloped in gloom.

data.v: अस्माद्धंसा जलक्लिन्नाः पक्षैः सलिलरेणुभिः । कुरराः सारसाश्चैव निष्पतन्ति पतत्रिणः । साध्वत्र प्रविशामेति मया तूक्ताः प्लवंगमाः ।।
data.es: 'Drenched in water the swans, kuraras, and sarasas were seen emerging with water dripping from thier wings.
data.anv: अस्मात् this, सलिलविस्रवैः by those with water dripping, पक्षैः with wings, जलक्लिन्नाः drenched in water, हंसाः swans, कुरराः kuraras, सारसाश्चैव sarasas also, पतत्रिणः birds, निष्पतन्ति flying out.
data.md: And (it came to pass that) from this (cave) came out swans, drenched with water, with drops of water on their wings,-and plumed kuravas and cranes.

data.v: तेषामपि हि सर्वेषामनुमानमुपागतम् । गच्छामः प्रविशामेति भर्तृकार्यत्वरान्विताः ।।
ततो गाढं निपतिता गृह्य हस्तौ परस्परम् । इदं प्रविष्टाः सहसा बिलं तिमिरसंवृतम् ।।
एतन्नः कायमेतेन कृत्येन वयमागताः । त्वां चैवोपगताः सर्वे परिद्यूना बुभुक्षिताः ।।
data.es: 'Vexed and starved, we entered this grotto shrouded in darkness.This is our task and we reached here (in the process).
data.anv: तिमिरसंवृतम् shrouded in darkness, इदं बिलम् this grotto, सहसा at once, प्रविष्टाः we entered, एतत् this, नः our, कार्यम् task, एतेन by this, कृत्येन by the task, वयम् we, आगताः we came, बुभुक्षिताः hungry ones, परिद्यूनाः vexed, सर्वे all of us, त्वाम् your, उपगताश्चैव we reached.

data.v: आतिथ्यधर्मदत्तानि मूलानि च फलानि च । अस्माभिरुपभुक्तानि बुभुक्षापरिपीडितैः ।।
data.es: There the monkeys saw the Yajna, and partook the fruits and roots produced out of the havis which tasted sweet like nectar.
data.anv: तत्र there, वानराः monkeys, अन्ननिष्यन्दजातानि produced out of the havis of the Yajna, अमृतास्वादकल्पानि sweet like nectar, मूलानि and roots, च and, फलानि च fruits also, ददृशुः they saw.
data.md: Having come to you, hungry, and exhausted, we, who had been sore tried by hunger, have been entertained with fruits and roots, agreeably to the code regulating hospitality.

data.v: यत्त्वया रक्षिताः सर्वे म्रियमाणा बुभुक्षया । ब्रूहि प्रत्युपकारार्थं किं ते कुर्वन्तु वानराः ।।
data.es: 'We were dying from hunger when you saved us. Tell us what the monkeys can do to repay your debt?'.
data.anv: बुभुक्षया by starvation, म्रियमाणाः dying, सर्वे all, यत् as such, त्वया by you, रक्षिताः saved, वानराः monkeys, ते to you, प्रत्युपकारार्थम् to repay you in turn, किं कुर्वन्तु what can they do, ब्रूहि  tell.
data.md: And as you had saved the monkeys, who were weary and suffering from hunger, tell (me),-what benefit shall the monkeys do you in return?

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु सर्वज्ञा वानरैस्तैः स्वयंप्रभा । प्रत्युवाच ततः सर्वानिदं वानरयूथपम् ।।
data.es: To the leaders among the monkeys, knowers of dharma, who said this Svayamprabha replied:
data.anv: तैः वानरैः by the monkeys, एवम् thus, उक्ताः addressed, धर्मज्ञौः by the knowers of dharma, स्वयंप्रभा Svayamprapbha, ततः then, सर्वान् all, वानरपुङ्गवान् leaders among the monkeys, इदम्  this, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Thus addressed by the apes, the all-knowing Svayamprabhā replied to the monkey-chiefs, saying,

data.v: सर्वेषां परितुष्टास्मि वानराणां तरस्विनाम् । चरन्त्या मम धर्मेण न कार्यमिह केनचित् ।।
data.es: 'I am very much pleased with all of you, smart monkeys. As I am engaged in the practice of righteousness, I do not need your services.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तरस्विनाम् of those quick and energetic ones, सर्वेषाम् about all of you, वानराणाम् of  monkeys, परितुष्टा pleased, अस्मि I am, धर्मेण in rghteousness, चरन्त्याः while practising, मम to me, इह now, केनचित् any, कार्यम् service,  न no need.
data.md: Well pleased am I with the fast-footing monkeys. But by one engaged in your duties, there is no work that is desiderated.

data.v: एवमुक्तः शुभं वाक्यं तापस्या धर्मसंहितम् । उवाच हनुमान्वाक्यं तामनिन्दितचेष्टिताम् ।।
data.es: To the auspicious words of the righteous, blameless hermitess Hanuman replied:
data.anv: तापस्या by the hermitess, एवम् that way, धर्मसंहितम् coupled with righteousness, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, उक्तः expressed, हनुमान् Hanuman, अनिन्दितचेष्टिताम् blameless in actions, ताम् her, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
data.md: Thus accosted in excellent words fraught with asceticism and righteousness Hanumān spoke to that one of faultless eyes, saying.

data.v: शरणं त्वां प्रपन्नाः स्मः सर्वे वै धर्मचारिणि । यः कृतः समयोऽस्माकं सुग्रीवेण महात्मना । स तु कालो व्यतिक्रान्तो बिले च परिवर्तताम् ।।
data.es: 'You are a righteous lady. You have given us refuge. Now in moving about the cave we have exceeded the time limit given by Sugriva.'
data.anv: धर्मचारिणीम् to the righteous lady, त्वाम् you, सर्वे all, शरणं प्रसन्नाः स्मः have taken refuge, महात्मना by the great self, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, अस्माकं to us, यः such, समयः condition, कृतः having given, सः that, बिले in the cave, परिवर्तताम् while we were moving about, ह्यतिक्रान्तः exceeded.
data.md: We all take refuge in you, practising piety. the term that had been fixed by the high-souled Sugrīva in respect of us, shall all be spent in this cave. Therefore it behoveth you to deliver us from this place.

data.v: सा त्वमस्माद्बिलाद्घोरादुत्तारयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.anv: सा such lady, त्वम् you, तस्मात् therefore, सुग्रीववचनात् Sugriva's words, अतिक्रान्तान् those who exceeded, गतायुषः lost our lives, घोरात् from the dreadful, अस्मात् from this, बिलात्  from this cave, उत्तारयितुम् to help us go out, अर्हसि should.

data.v: तस्मात्सुग्रीववचनादतिक्रान्तान्गतायुषः । त्रातुमर्हसि नः सर्वान्सुग्रीवभयशङ्कितान् ।।
data.md: It behove you to save us, exercised with fear for Sugriva,-who, happening to override Sugriva's command, shall lose our lives. And, further, O you that practisest righteousness, great is the task that is to be performed by us.

data.v: महच्च कार्यमस्माभिः कर्तव्यं धर्मचारिणि । तच्चापि न कृतं कार्यमस्माभिरिह वासिभिः ।।
data.es: 'O righteous lady we have a great task waiting. We are afraid of Sugriva as we could not accomplish our objective by staying here. Save us.'
data.anv: धर्मचारिणि a woman of righteous practices, सुग्रीवभयकर्शितान् who are afraid of Sugriva, नः us, सर्वान् all, त्रातुम् to save, अर्हसि should, अस्माभिः by us, महत् great, कार्यं च task also, कर्तव्यम् should be done, इह now, वासिभिः staying here, अस्माभिः by us, तत् that, कार्यं चापि the objective, न कृतम् not accomplished.
data.md: But if we stay here, that work of ours shall remain unaccomplished.

data.v: एवमुक्ता हनुमता तापसी वाक्यमब्रवीत् । जीवता दुष्करं मन्ये प्रविष्टेन निवर्तितुम् ।।
data.es: To the words of Hanuman the ascetic replied, 'I consider it difficult for any one who enters here to go back alive.'
data.anv: हनुमता by Hanuman, एवम् in that manner, उक्ता being told, तापसी ascetic, वाक्यम्  these words, अब्रवीत् said, प्रविष्टेन by one who entered, जीवता with life, निवर्तितुम् to go back, दुष्करम् it is difficult, मन्ये I think.
data.md: Thus addressed by Hanumān, the ascetic said, Once entering, hard it is for any one to return (hence) alive. But by the potency of my asceticism acquired through self-discipline, I shall deliver all the monkeys from this den.

data.v: तपसस्तु प्रभावेन नियमोपार्जितेन च । सर्वानेव बिलादस्मादुद्धरिष्यामि वानरान् ।।
data.es: 'I will help all monkeys out of this cave by virtue of my power of asceticism duly practised.
data.anv: नियमोपार्जितेन earned by practising, तपसः by asceticism, तु प्रभावेन by virtue of it, सर्वानेव all of you, वानरान् monkeys, अस्मात् बिलात् from this cave, उद्धरियिष्यामि I will help you out.

data.v: निमीलयत चक्षूंषि सर्वे वानरपुंगवाः । न हि निष्क्रमितुं शक्यमनिमीलितलोचनैः ।।
data.anv: सर्वे all, वानरपुङ्गवाः great monkeys, चक्षूंषि eyes, निमीलयतः keep them closed, अनिमीलितलोचनैः if you do not close your eyes, निष्क्रमितुम् to get out, नशक्यं हि is not possible.
data.md: You foremost of monkeys, do you close your eyes. No one is able to issue out of this place without closing one's eyes.

data.v: ततः संमीलिताः सर्वे सुकुमाराङ्गुलैः करैः । सहसा पिदधुर्दृष्टिं हृष्टा गमनकाङ्क्षिणः ।।
data.es: Happy at the prospect of getting out (of the cave) they all not only closed their eyes but also covered them with their delicate fingers.
data.anv: ततः then, गमनकाङ्क्षया with a desire to get out, हृष्टाः joyful ones, सर्वे all, सम्मीलिताः closed their eye lids, सहसा at once, सुकुमाराङ्गुलैः with delicate fingers, करैः with hands, दृष्टिम् eyes, पिदधुः closed.
data.md: Then they, eagerly desirous of going out, closed their sight* with their hands furnished with tender fingers. *The text has nimilitah—and thus they closed their eyes. This redundant epithet has been left out in the translation, as it would render the version extremely awkward.

data.v: वानरास्तु महात्मानो हस्तरुद्धमुखास्तदा । निमेषान्तरमात्रेण बिलादुत्तारितास्तया ।।
data.es: Then the great monkeys, faces covered with their hands, emerged from the cave in a moment.
data.anv: तदा then, हस्तरुद्धमुखाः faces covered with hands, महात्मानः great souls, वानराः monkeys, तया with her help, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in a moment, बिलात् from the cave, उत्तारिताः came out.
data.md: The magnanimous monkeys, with their faces covered with their palms, were in the twinkling of an eye, liberated from the den by her.

data.v: ततस्तान्वानरान्सर्वांस्तापसी धर्मचारिणी । निःसृतान्विषमात्तस्मात्समाश्वास्येदमब्रवीत् ।।
