data.es: The righteous hermitess released all the monkeys out of that difficult situation and said these words of consolation:
data.anv: धर्मचारिणी righteous, तापसी ascetic, तत्र there, तान् सर्वान् all of them, विषमात् from the difficult situation, तस्मात् from that, निस्सृतान् those who were released, समाश्वास्य after consoling them all, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And then the pious anchoret spoke to them there. And when they had come out of the fearful den, cheering them up, she said,

data.v: एष विन्ध्यो गिरिः श्रीमान्नानाद्रुमलतायुतः । एष प्रसवणः शैलः सागरोऽयं महोदधिः ।।
data.es: 'This Vindhya mountain has a rich collection of trees and bushes. This is Prasravana hill and this is the great ocean.O monkeys. Good luck to you. (Now) I am going back home'. Having said so, Svayamprabha entered the splendid cave.
data.anv: एषः this, श्रीमान् rich, नानाद्रुमलताकुलः filled with different kinds of trees and vines, विन्ध्यः Vindhya, गिरिः mountain, एषः this, प्रस्रवणः Prasravana, शैलः hill, अयम् this, सागरः sea, महोदधिः great ocean, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys वः you, स्वस्ति be happy, अस्तु so be it, भवनम् to my house, गमिष्यामि I will go, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, स्वयम्प्रभा Svayamprabha, श्रीमत् splendid, तत् बिलम् that cave, प्रविवेश entered.

data.v: स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु गमिष्यामि भवनं वानरर्षभाः । इत्युक्त्वा तद्बिलं श्रीमत्प्रविवेश स्वयंप्रभा ।।
data.es: 'This Vindhya mountain has a rich collection of trees and bushes. This is Prasravana hill and this is the great ocean.O monkeys. Good luck to you. (Now) I am going back home'. Having said so, Svayamprabha entered the splendid cave.
data.anv: एषः this, श्रीमान् rich, नानाद्रुमलताकुलः filled with different kinds of trees and vines, विन्ध्यः Vindhya, गिरिः mountain, एषः this, प्रस्रवणः Prasravana, शैलः hill, अयम् this, सागरः sea, महोदधिः great ocean, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys वः you, स्वस्ति be happy, अस्तु so be it, भवनम् to my house, गमिष्यामि I will go, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, स्वयम्प्रभा Svayamprabha, श्रीमत् splendid, तत् बिलम् that cave, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: This is the fair Vindhya mountain filled with various trees and herbs. This is the Praśravaņa hill; and this is the great deep. Fair Fortune! I go to my abode, you foremost of monkeys. Having spokea thus, Svayamprabhā entered that captivating cave.

data.v: ततस्ते ददृशुर्घोरं सागरं वरुणालयम् । अपारमभिगर्जन्तं घोरैरूर्मिभिराकुलम् ।।
data.es: Then the monkeys saw the boundless, dreary ocean roaring wild with its terrific waves spread all over.
data.anv: ततः then, ते they, घोरम् dreadful, वरुणालयम् abode of Varuna, अपारम् endless, अभिगर्जन्तम्  roaring wildly, घोरै: with terrific, ऊर्मिभिः with waves, आवृतम् spread over, सागरम् ocean, ददृशुः saw.
data.md: Then they saw the ocean—abode of Varuņashoreless, resounding, rife with dreadful billows.

data.v: मयस्य माया विहितं गिरिदुर्गं विचिन्वताम् । तेषां मासो व्यतिक्रान्तो यो राज्ञा समयः कृतः ।।
data.es: While they were ransacking the impassable mountain created with the magical powers of Maya, the time limit of one month set by the king was over.
data.anv: तेषाम् for them, मयस्य Maya's, मायाविहितम् created by his Maya, गिरिदुर्गम् impassable mountain, विचिन्वताम् while searching, यः such, राज्ञा by the king, समयः time set, कृतः was fixed, मासः month, व्यतिक्रान्तः exceeded.
data.md: Exploring the mountain fateness of Maya*, they spent the month that had been set by the king. *Named Rhiksavila.

data.v: विन्ध्यस्य तु गिरेः पादे संप्रपुष्पितपादपे । उपविश्य महाभागाश्चिन्तामापेदिरे तदा ।।
data.es: Then the highsoul monkeys reached the hill adjacent to Vindhya mountain on which trees were in full bloom.They sat there, lost in thought.
data.anv: तदा then, महाभागा: great souls, सम्प्रपुष्पितपादपे in a location where trees are in full bloom, विन्ध्यस्य तु of Vindhya, गिरेः of that mountain, पादे adjacent, उपविश्य sat, चिन्ताम् thinking, आपेदिरे did.
data.md: Then sitting down at the foot of the Vindhya mountain, containing blossoming trees, at that time* those high-souled ones indulged-in reflections. *i.e. at the beginning of winter.

data.v: ततः पुष्पातिभाराग्राँल्लताशतसमावृतान् । द्रुमान्वासन्तिकान्दृष्ट्वा बभूवुर्भयशङ्किताः ।।
data.es: Alarmed at the thought (of transgression of time limit), the monkeys kept looking at the tree tops entwined with a hundred oreepers heavily loaded with the flowers of spring.
data.anv: ततः then, पुष्पातिभाराग्रान्  heavily loaded with flowers on top, लताशतसमावृतान् entwined by hundreds of creepers, वासन्तिकान् spring, द्रुमान् trees, दृष्ट्वा saw, भयशङ्किताः frightened, बभूवुः became.
data.md: Beholding vernal trees bending beneath the load of flowers, and environed by hundreds of plants, they were inspired with apprehension.

data.v: ते वसन्तमनुप्राप्तं प्रतिवेद्य परस्परम् । नष्टसंदेशकालार्था निपेतुर्धरणीतले ।।
data.es: Having realised (looking at the flowers) that spring has set in and they have exceeded the time limit, they all fell down on the ground.
data.anv: ते they, वसन्तम् spring, अनुप्राप्तम् set in, परस्परम् with one onather, प्रतिबुद्ध्वा after realising, नष्टसन्देशकालार्थाः having exceeded the time set, धरणीतले on the ground, निपेतुः fell down.
data.md: And each knowing that spring had appeared, they, the term appointed for their task having run out, dropped down on the ground.

data.v: स तु सिंहर्षभ स्कन्धः पीनायतभुजः कपिः । युवराजो महाप्राज्ञ अङ्गदो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Coming to a conclusion after due deliberation Angada, heir apparent, profoundly wise, endowed with sturdy and broad shoulders like those of a lion or a bull, spoke in a sweet voice to the elderly, respectable monkeys, dwellers of the forest:
data.anv: ततः then, सिंहवृषस्कन्धः one who has shoulders like a lion or bull, पीनायतभुजः of sturdy and long arms, युवराजः heir apparent, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, कपिः monkey, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् them, कपिवृद्धांस्तु to the elderly monkeys, शिष्टान् respectable, वनैकसश्चैव forestdwellers (monkeys), मधुरया with a sweet, वाचा tone, आभाष्य spoke, यथावत् properly, अनुमान्य च after coming to a decision, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereat, with bland words properly honouring the aged apes and the rest dwelling in the woods, that monkey having the shoulders of a lion or a bull, and plump and broad arms-the youthful prince Angada, endowed with high wisdom, spoke,

data.v: शासनात्कपिराजस्य वयं सर्वे विनिर्गताः । मासः पूर्णो बिलस्थानां हरयः किं न बुध्यते ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys don't you realize that all of us have come here at the command of the monkey king, and while we were in the cave a whole month has gone by?
data.anv: हरयः O monkeys, वयं सर्वे all of us, कपिराजस्य monkey king's, शासनात् by his command,  विनिर्गताः came here, बिलस्थानाम् for us staying in the cave, मासः a month, पूर्णः is completed, किम् what, न बुद्ध्यते do you not know?
data.md: We have come out at the mandate of the monarch of monkeys. While we sojourned in the cave, a full month had passed away, you monkeys. Why do you not understand this? We set out, engaging that our term of search should reach no further than the end of Kärtika;* but that has expired. Now, what next is to be done? *October.

data.v: तस्मिन्नतीते काले तु सुग्रीवेण कृते स्वयम् । प्रायोपवेशनं युक्तं सर्वेषां च वनौकसाम् ।।
data.es: 'Now that the time limit fixed by Sugriva has expired, the right thing to do for the monkeys is to fast unto death.
data.anv: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, कृते fixed, तस्मिन् काले at this time, अतीते when exceeded, सर्वेषाम् for all of us,वनौकसाम् for the forest dwellers (monkeys) स्वयम् personally, प्रायोपवेशनम् fasting unto death, युक्तम् is right.

data.v: तीक्ष्णः प्रकृत्या सुग्रीवः स्वामिभावे व्यवस्थितः । न क्षमिष्यति नः सर्वानपराधकृतो गतान् ।।
data.es: 'By nature Sugriva is harsh, and being a king now, he will not forgive us who are real offenders and have not done the task assigned.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रकृत्या by nature, तीक्ष्णः harsh, स्वामिभावे as a king, व्यवस्थितः consecrated, गतान् when we reach, अपराधकृतः  us who are real offenders, नः not, सर्वान् to all, न क्षमिष्यति will not forgive us.
data.md: Naturally stern, Sugrīva, established as our master, shall not forgive us, when we repair there, after having transgressed thus.

data.v: अप्रवृत्तौ च सीतायाः पापमेव करिष्यति । तस्मात्क्षममिहाद्यैव प्रायोपविशनं हि नः ।।
data.anv: सीतायाः Sita, अप्रवृत्तौ for not bringing any clue, पापमेव sin, करिष्यति he will do, तस्मात् therefore, पुत्रांश्च sons, दारांश्च wives, धनानि च and wealth, गृहाणि च and houses, त्यक्त्या  bid farewell to, इह here, अद्यैव today itself, प्रायोपवेशनम् death, गन्तुम् take recourse, क्षमम् proper.
data.md: Sītā not having been found out, Sugrīva, for certain, shall commit this sin.* Therefore it is fit that, forsaking our sons, and wives, and wealth, and homes, we this very day sit down to starve ourselves to death. *i.e. slay us.

data.v: त्यक्त्वा पुत्रांश्च दारांश्च धनानि च गृहाणि च । यावन्न घातयेद्राजा सर्वान्प्रतिगतानितः । वधेनाप्रतिरूपेण श्रेयान्मृत्युरिहैव नः ।।
data.es: 'Surely the king will torture us by awarding death sentence in a singular manner when we go back. It is better for us to meet death here itself.
data.anv: राजा king, इतः here, प्रतिगतान् when we return, नः us, सर्वान् all, अप्रतिरूपेण in an incomparable manner, वधेन with death sentence, ध्रुवम् surely, हिंसिता will torture us, नः us, इहैव here itself, मृत्यु: death, श्रेयान् it is better.
data.md: Death at this place is preferable to the unequal punishment (we must meet with at the hands of Sugriva).

data.v: न चाहं यौवराज्येन सुग्रीवेणाभिषेचितः । नरेन्द्रेणाभिषिक्तोऽस्मि रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा ।।
data.es: 'I was not installed as heir apparent by Sugriva. I was made crowned prince by king Rama, the king of the people who never hurts others.
data.anv: अहम् I, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, यौवराज्येन as heir apparent, न अभिषेचितः not installed, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा who never harms others, नरेन्द्रेण by the king of the people, रामेण by Rama, अभिषिक्तः crowned prince, अस्मि I was.
data.md: And, further, I have not been installed heirapparent by Sugrīva: I have been sprinkled by that foremost of kings, Rāma of untiring energy.

data.v: स पूर्वं बद्धवैरो मां राजा दृष्ट्वा व्यतिक्रमम् । घातयिष्यति दण्डेन तीक्ष्णेन कृतनिश्चयः ।।
data.es: 'The Monkeyking nursed bitter enmity against me even earlier. Now seeing my lapse, he will decidedly inflict severe punishment on me.
data.anv: पूर्वम् earlier, बद्धवैरः nursed bitter enmity, सः राजा that king, व्यतिक्रमम् lapse, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कृतनिश्चयः decidedly, माम् me, तीक्ष्णेन with a severe, दण्डेन with punishment, घातयिष्यति he will inflict.
data.md: Entertaining enmity against me of old, the king, seeing this lapse, must be firmly determined to take my life by means of a severe sentence.

data.v: किं मे सुहृद्भिर्व्यसनं पश्यद्भिर्जीवितान्तरे । इहैव प्रायमासिष्ये पुण्ये सागररोधसि ।।
data.es: 'I do not want my friends to see my calamity, my death. I shall sit here on the sacred shores of this ocean and await my death'.
data.anv: जीवितान्तरे at the end of life, मे व्यसनम् my calamity, पश्यद्भिः by seeing, सुहृदभि: by my friends, किम् what, इहैव here itself, पुण्ये in a sacred, सागररोधसि on the shores of the ocean, प्रायमासिष्ये I shall sit down and await my death.
data.md: What is the use of suffering my friends to look on my disaster at the last moment of my existence? Therefore even on this sacred shore of the sea shall I sit down to starve myself.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा कुमारेण युवराजेन भाषितम् । सर्वे ते वानरश्रेष्ठाः करुणं वाक्यमब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Hearing the young heir apparent thus speaking, the best of the monkeys kindly responded:
data.anv: युवराजेन by heir apparent, कुमारेण by the young prince, भाषितम् talk, एतत् this, श्रुत्वा heard, सर्वे all, ते they, वानरश्रेष्ठाः  best of the monkeys करुणम् kindly, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रुवन् said.
data.md: Hearing the tender prince speak thus, all those principal monkeys pathetically observed,

data.v: तीक्ष्णः प्रकृत्या सुग्रीवः प्रियासक्तश्च राघवः । अदृष्टायां च वैदेह्यां दृष्ट्वास्मांश्च समागतान् ।।
data.es: 'By nature Sugriva is harsh. Rama is devoted to his wife. Therefore, if Sugriva sees that we have not found Vaidehi and have returned (without fulfilling the mission) he will award death sentence to us in order to please Rama.There is no doubt.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रकृत्या by nature, तीक्ष्णः harsh, राघव: Rama, प्रियासक्तः devoted to his wife, वैदेह्याम् princess of Videha, अदृष्टायाम् when she is not found, अस्मान् us, तु indeed, समागतान् reaching, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, राघवप्रियकामार्थम् in order to please Rama, असंशयम् without any doubt, घातयिष्यति he will punish us to death.
data.md: Sugrīva is harsh by nature, and Rāghava loveth his wife dearly. The time appointed having passed by, seeing us (come) without attaining success in the task, and seeing us arrive without obtaining a sight of Vaidehi, (Sugrīva) shall certainly slay us from the desire of doing what is agreeable to Rāghava.

data.v: राघवप्रियकामार्थं घातयिष्यत्यसंशयम् । न क्षमं चापराद्धानां गमनं स्वामिपार्श्वतः ।।
प्लवंगमानां तु भयार्दितानां; श्रुत्वा वचस्तार इदं बभाषे । अलं विषादेन बिलं प्रविश्य; वसाम सर्वे यदि रोचते वः ।।
data.es: 'On hearing the words of the frightened monkeys, Tara said, 'Enough of this sorrow. If it pleases you, we will all go to the cave and reside there' ''
data.anv: तारः Tara, भयार्दितानाम् those shaken with fear, प्लवङ्गमानाम् of the monkeys, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, इदम् this, बभाषे he spoke, विषादेन with sorrow, अलम् enough, वः to you, रोचते यदि if it pleases you, सर्वे all of us, बिलम् cave, प्रविश्य after entering, वसाम let us reside.
data.md: Hearing the speeches of the monkeys afflicted with fear, Tārā said,-No use of indulging in grief. If you relish it, let us all entering the cave, dwell there.

data.v: इदं हि माया विहितं सुदुर्गमं; प्रभूतवृक्षोदकभोज्यपेयम् । इहास्ति नो नैव भयं पुरंदरा;न्न राघवाद्वानरराजतोऽपि वा ।।
data.es: 'This cave built by magic is inaccessible. It has a number of trees, water, eatables and drinks. (If we live here) we need not be afraid of even Indra, the breaker of enemy citadels or even of Rama or also of the king of monkeys'.
data.anv: मायाविहितम् built by magic, प्रभूतवृक्षोदकभोज्यपेयकम् with many trees, water, food and drinks, इदम् this, सुदुर्गमं हि inaccessible, इह here, नः for us, पुरन्दरात् from Indra, the breaker of enemy citadel, भयम् fear, नैव not there, राघवात् of Rama even, वानरराजतोऽपि वा also of king of monkeys, न not.
data.md: This place abounding in flowers and waters, meats and drinks,—which has been brought forth by the power of ilusion, is incapable of being approached. Here we have no fear from Purandara, or Rāghava, or the king of monkeys.

data.v: श्रुत्वाङ्गदस्यापि वचोऽनुकूल;मूचुश्च सर्वे हरयः प्रतीताः । यथा न हन्येम तथाविधान;मसक्तमद्यैव विधीयतां नः ।।
data.es: All the monkeys agreed to the favourable suggestion of Tara which was acceptable to Angada. 'A plan may be made in such a way by which we will not be killed by the king. Our strategy should be delinked from the conditions laid down by the king. Let us not face punishment' said the monkeys.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अङ्गदस्य Angada's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सर्वे all, हरयः monkeys, प्रतीताः became agreeable, अनुकूलम् favourable, ऊचुः spoke, यथा as, न हिंस्येम we will not be punished, तथा that way, नः for us, अद्यैव now itself, विधानम् strategy, असक्तम् not conditional, विदीयताम्  be planned.
data.md: Hearing the welcome words of Angada, the monkeys,-being convinced, said,-Do you this very day so order that we may not be slain.

data.v: तथा ब्रुवति तारे तु ताराधिपतिवर्चसि । अथ मेने हृतं राज्यं हनुमानङ्गदेन तत् ।।
data.es: Hanuman listened to the proposal of Tara, whose face was like the Moon, lord of the stars. (After listening to Tara) he thought Angada might take over the kingdom from Sugriva.
data.anv: ताराधिपतिवर्चसि face like the moon, lord of stars, तारे when Tara, तथा thus, ब्रुवति spoke, अथ then, हनूमान् Hanuman, अङ्गदेन by Angada, तत् that, राज्यम् kingdom, हृतम् taken over, मेने thought.
data.md: When Tārā, bright as the moon, had spoken thus, Hanumān felt as if Angada had already deprived (Sugrīva) of his kingdom.* The sense is very obscure. One meaning is: Hanumān thought that Argada acquiescing in what Tārā had said, must remain there,-and ultimately endeavour to wrest the kingdom from Sugriva. Another meaning is: Hanumān conceived that remaining there in peace, Angada would consider his position as enviable as if he had extorted the kingdom from Sugrīva.

data.v: बुद्ध्या ह्यष्टाङ्गया युक्तं चतुर्बलसमन्वितम् । चतुर्दशगुणं मेने हनुमान्वालिनः सुतम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman thought Vali's son possessed in addition to his intellect, eight kinds of limbs, four kinds of strength and fourteen qualities (required of a king):
data.anv: हनूमान् Hanuman, वालिनः Vali's, सुतम् son, अष्टाङ्गया with eight limbs, बुद्ध्या with intellect, युक्तम् endowed, चतुर्बलसमन्वितम् possessed of four kinds of strength, चतुर्दशगुणम् having fourteen qualities, मेने thought.

data.v: आपूर्यमाणं शश्वच्च तेजोबलपराक्रमैः । शशिनं शुक्लपक्षादौ वर्धमानमिव श्रिया ।।
बृहस्पतिसमं बुद्ध्या विक्रमे सदृशं पितुः । शुश्रूषमाणं तारस्य शुक्रस्येव पुरंदरम् ।।
भर्तुरर्थे परिश्रान्तं सर्वशास्त्रविशारदम् । अभिसंधातुमारेभे हनुमानङ्गदं ततः ।।
data.md: And Hanumān versed in all branches of learning, finding Angada backward in the affair of his master, began inspire him with fear.* *Touching Tārā.

data.v: स चतुर्णामुपायानां तृतीयमुपवर्णयन् । भेदयामास तान्सर्वान्वानरान्वाक्यसंपदा ।।
data.es: Resorting to the third strategy out of the four ways of achieving an objective Hanuman created differences among the monkeys with skilful arguments. (Sama, Dana, Bheda and Danda are the four means. Hanuman adopted Bheda as a means of winning over an enemy).
data.anv: सः that, चतुर्णाम् of the four, उपायानाम् of means, तृतीयम् third one, उपवर्णयन् while describing, तान्सर्वान् all of them, वानरान् monkeys, वाक्यसम्पदा with wealth of arguments, भेदयामास created differences.
data.md: He, wealthy in words, laying under contribution the second of the four means,* had created division among those monkeys. *Referred to above.

data.v: तेषु सर्वेषु भिन्नेषु ततोऽभीषयदङ्गदम् । भीषणैर्बहुभिर्वाक्यैः कोपोपायसमन्वितैः ।।
data.es: When there were differences among the monkeys over the issue, Hanuman intimidated Angada with frightening words expressing his anger, using skilful arguments:
data.anv: तेषु of them, सर्वेषु  all, भिन्नेषु of the differences, ततः then, कोपोपायसमन्वितैः strategy to cause both anger and expediency, भीषणैः with frightening, बहुभि: by many, वाक्यैः with arguments, अङ्गदम् to Angada, अभीषयत् frightened.
data.md: On their being divided, he (Hanuman) set about raising Angada's apprehension by various fear-fraught speech, referring to punishments.

data.v: त्वं समर्थतरः पित्रा युद्धे तारेय वै धुरम् । दृढं धारयितुं शक्तः कपिराज्यं यथा पिता ।।
data.es: 'O Son of Tara you are, indeed, very efficient like your father in combat. You can hold firmly the responsibilty of the vanara kingdom like your father.
data.anv: तारेय O son of Tara, त्वम् you, युद्धे in combat, पित्रा compared to your father, समर्थतरः you are very efficient, वै indeed, धुरम् yoke (responsibility of running the kingdom), पिता यथा like your father, कपिराज्यम् kingdom of the monkeys, दृढम् firmly, धारयितुम् to hold, शक्तः capable.
data.md: O Tārā's son, you are for certain more capable of fight than even your sire; and you are also able to hold the monkey-kingdom as firmly as he.

data.v: नित्यमस्थिरचित्ता हि कपयो हरिपुंगव । नाज्ञाप्यं विषहिष्यन्ति पुत्रदारान्विना त्वया ।।
data.es: 'O leader among monkeys Vanaras are always fickleminded. Being away from their sons and wives they will not always carry out your command and stay here forever.
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गव O leader of monkeys, कपयः vanaras, नित्यम् always, अस्थिरचित्ताः हि they are fickle minded, पुत्रदारान् sons and wives, विना without, त्वया with you, आज्ञाप्यम् command, न विषहिष्यन्ति will never tolerate.
data.md: But, O foremost of monkeys, the monkeys are always inconstant in character. Bereft of their wives and sons, they shall not bear your behest.

data.v: त्वां नैते ह्यनुयुञ्जेयुः प्रत्यक्षं प्रवदामि ते । यथायं जाम्बवान्नीलः सुहोत्रश्च महाकपिः ।।
data.es: 'This I am telling you openly and frankly. These monkeys are not going to be obedient to you. Neither Jambavan, nor Nila nor the great monkey Suhotra nor even myself would subscribe to this opinion (of staying in the cave) and follow you. It is not possible for you to keep us or these monkeys from Sugriva through the policy of appeasement like Sama, Dana, Bheda or even Danda (persuasion, giving gifts, creating differences or imposing punishment).
data.anv: प्रत्यक्षम् directly, ते to you, यथा as, प्रवदामि I am speaking, अयम् this, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, नीलः Nila, महाकपिः great monkey, सुहोत्रश्च Suhotra also, एते  them, त्वाम् you, नानुयुञ्जेयुः हि will not following you, अहम् I am, न हि not, ते you, इमे these, सर्वे all, सामदानादिभिः through the policy of appeasement, गुणैः by merit, दण्डेन by punishment, त्वया by you, सुग्रीवात् from Sugriva, अपकर्षितुम् to avert, न शक्याः not possible.
data.md: They shall never take to you. This I tell you in presence of all. And I will tell you what. You neither by the virtues of conciliation, charity and the rest, nor by chastisement, shall succeed in drawing to your side this Jāmbavān, or Nīla, or the mighty ape Suhotra, or myself.

data.v: न ह्यहं त इमे सर्वे सामदानादिभिर्गुणैः । दण्डेन न त्वया शक्याः सुग्रीवादपकर्षितुम् ।।
data.es: 'This I am telling you openly and frankly. These monkeys are not going to be obedient to you. Neither Jambavan, nor Nila nor the great monkey Suhotra nor even myself would subscribe to this opinion (of staying in the cave) and follow you. It is not possible for you to keep us or these monkeys from Sugriva through the policy of appeasement like Sama, Dana, Bheda or even Danda (persuasion, giving gifts, creating differences or imposing punishment).
data.anv: प्रत्यक्षम् directly, ते to you, यथा as, प्रवदामि I am speaking, अयम् this, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, नीलः Nila, महाकपिः great monkey, सुहोत्रश्च Suhotra also, एते  them, त्वाम् you, नानुयुञ्जेयुः हि will not following you, अहम् I am, न हि not, ते you, इमे these, सर्वे all, सामदानादिभिः through the policy of appeasement, गुणैः by merit, दण्डेन by punishment, त्वया by you, सुग्रीवात् from Sugriva, अपकर्षितुम् to avert, न शक्याः not possible.

data.v: विगृह्यासनमप्याहुर्दुर्बलेन बलीयसः । आत्मरक्षाकरस्तस्मान्न विगृह्णीत दुर्बलः ।।
data.es: 'It is said that when a strong man fights a weak one, the weak opponent should adopt the strategy of asana (watching) for selfprotection. The weak should not enter into combat with the strong.
data.anv: बलीयस: with a strong man, दुर्बलेन by a weak one, विगृह्य waging war, आसनम् अपि remaining quiet, watching (a kind of war strategy), आहुः it is said, तस्मात् therefore, आत्मरक्षाकरः for selfprotection, दुर्बलः a weak one, न विगृह्णीत should not wage.
data.md: A strong one wronging another that is weak, can live; therefore a weak person anxious for self-preservation, should never wrong (a strong individual).

data.v: यां चेमां मन्यसे धात्रीमेतद्बिलमिति श्रुतम् । एतल्लक्ष्मणबाणानामीषत्कार्यं विदारणे ।।
data.es: 'You may think it safe to stay here in this opening of the earth. It is a petty task for the arrows of Lakshmana to break open this socalled cave.
data.anv: याम् whichever, इमाम् this, धात्रीम् earth, मन्यसे you may be thinking, एतत् this, बिलम् cave, इति in this way, श्रुतम् is known, लक्ष्मणबाणानाम् for the arrows of Lakshmana, एतत् this, विदारणम् breaking, ईषत्कार्यम् is a very small task.
data.md: You considerest that this cave may serve for your protectress,* having heard of it (said by Tārā); but to rive the same is but light work for the shafts of Laksmana. *The word meaning cave is feminine in Sanskrit.

data.v: स्वल्पं हि कृतमिन्द्रेण क्षिपता ह्यशनिं पुरा । लक्ष्मणो निशितैर्बाणैर्भिन्द्यात्पत्रपुटं यथा । लक्ष्मणस्य च नाराचा बहवः सन्ति तद्विधाः ।।
data.es: 'In the past Indra had done a small damage (to the cave) with his thunderbolt. But with his sharp arrows Lakshmana will shatter the cave easily as though it is a leaf cup.
data.anv: पुरा earlier, अशनिम् a thunderbolt, क्षिपता by throwing, इन्द्रेण by Indra, स्वल्पम् a little, कृतं हि has done, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, निशितै: with sharp ones, बाणैः with arrows, पत्रपुटम् यथा like tearing a leaf cup, भिन्द्यात् he can shatter.
data.md: Formerly this was cleft a little by Indra, with his thunderbolt hurled (against it);* but now Lakṣmaṇa would pierce it like a leaf-stalk, by means of his keen arrows. *The commentator interprets the passage differently: Formerly Indra did a little damage herein-i.e. merely slew Maya, the architect of the mansion. This is ingenuity. I give the plain sense.

data.v: अवस्थाने यदैव त्वमासिष्यसि परंतप । तदैव हरयः सर्वे त्यक्ष्यन्ति कृतनिश्चयाः ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies the moment you decide to establish yourself here, all these monkeys will surely desert you.
data.anv: परन्तप O scorcher of enemies, त्वम् you, यदैव whenever, अवस्थाने to stay here, आसिष्यसि  decide, तदैव at that moment, सर्वे all these, हरयः monkeys, कृतनिश्चयाः decidedly,  त्यक्ष्यन्ति desert
data.md: O subduer of enemies, soon as you shall set up here, the monkeys, making up their minds, shall forsake you.

data.v: स्मरन्तः पुत्रदाराणां नित्योद्विग्ना बुभुक्षिताः । खेदिता दुःखशय्याभिस्त्वां करिष्यन्ति पृष्ठतः ।।
data.es: 'The memory of their sons and wives will haunt these hungry monkeys. The inconvenient bed will make them so depressed that they will leave you behind.
data.anv: पुत्रदाराणाम् about their sons and wives, स्मरन्तः while they are remembering, नित्योद्विग्नाः always anxious, बुभुक्षिताः hungry ones, दुःखशय्याभिः with inconvenient beds, खेदिताः  depressed, त्वाम् you, पृष्ठतः करिष्यन्ति will leave you behind.
data.md: Remembering their wives and sons, ever anxious (on account of Sugrīva, pining for domestic happiness, ad aggrieved (at their pitiable plight), they shall turn their backs upon you.

data.v: स त्वं हीनः सुहृद्भिश्च हितकामैश्च बन्धुभिः । तृणादपि भृशोद्विग्नः स्पन्दमानाद्भविष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'Left out of your friends and relatives,who are your wellwishers, you will be very frightened even by the trembling of a blade of grass.
data.anv: सुहृद्भिश्च even with friends also, हितकामैः by the wellwishers, बन्धुभिश्च even with your relatives, हीनः left out, सः त्वम् such a person, स्पन्दमानात् trembling, तृणादपि from a blade of grass, भृशोद्विग्नः you will be very much frightened, भविष्यसि you will be.
data.md: Then forsaken by the kindred as well as friends seeking your welfare, you shall be struck with affright even at a quaking blade of grass. If you make head (against Sugriva), the sharpened shafts of Laksmana, terrible, of exceeding impetuosity and mighty vehemence, and incapable of being baffled, shall be eager to slay you.

data.v: न च जातु न हिंस्युस्त्वां घोरा लक्ष्मणसायकाः । अपवृत्तं जिघांसन्तो महावेगा दुरासदाः ।।
data.es: In Progress
data.anv: In Progress

data.v: अस्माभिस्तु गतं सार्धं विनीतवदुपस्थितम् । आनुपूर्व्यात्तु सुग्रीवो राज्ये त्वां स्थापयिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'If along with us you approach Sugriva in a humble manner he will make you his successor to the kingdom.
data.anv: अस्माभिः सार्धम् along with us, गतम् when you go, विनीतवत् humbly, उपस्थितम् approached, त्वाम् you, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राज्ये in the kingdom, आनुपूर्व्यात् following the law of succession, स्थापयिष्यति he will make you king, तु indeed.
data.md: On the contrary, if you in humble guise present yourself (before him) along with us, he shall-establish you in the kingdom, in consideration of your being the next heir.

data.v: धर्मकामः पितृव्यस्ते प्रीतिकामो दृढव्रतः । शुचिः सत्यप्रतिज्ञश्च ना त्वां जातु जिघांसति ।।
data.es: 'Your father's brother is virtuous, wellintentioned, loving, steadfast in action, and true to his promise. He will not kill you.
data.anv: ते your, पितृव्यः father's brother, धर्मकामः a goodintentioned, प्रीतिकामः  pleasureloving, दृढव्रतः steadfast, शुचिः virtuous one, सत्यप्रतिज्ञश्च one who is true to his promise, त्वाम् you also, जातु go with, न जिघांसति will not punish you.
data.md: A righteous sovereign, steady in vow, clean, and truthful in promise, your uncle, who cherishes affection for you shall not by any mears chastise. Ju.

data.v: प्रियकामश्च ते मातुस्तदर्थं चास्य जीवितम् । तस्यापत्यं च नास्त्यन्यत्तस्मादङ्गद गम्यताम् ।।
data.md: He loves your mother, and his life is for her; and she has no other son. Therefore, O Angada, go along with us.

data.v: श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं प्रश्रितं धर्मसंहितम् । स्वामिसत्कारसंयुक्तमङ्गदो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing Hanuman's humble words (of advice) consistent with righteousness and full of devotion to his master, the king, Angada said:
data.anv: हनुमतः Hanuman's, प्रश्रितम् humble, धर्मसंहितम् consistent with righteousness, स्वामिसत्कारसंयुक्तम् full of devotion to his master, the king, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अङ्गदः Angada, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing Hanuman's speech, uttered meekly, fraught with morality, and reflecting honour upon Sugriva, Angada said,

data.v: स्थैर्यं सर्वात्मना शौचमानृशंस्यमथार्जवम् । विक्रमैश्चैव धैर्यं च सुग्रीवे नोपपद्यते ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva has no steadfastness, purity of body and mind, compassion, rectitude, valour and patience.
data.anv: स्थैर्यम् steadfastness, आत्ममनश्शौचम् purity of body and mind, आनृशंस्यम् compassion, अथ and, आर्जवम् rectitude, विक्रमश्चैव valour, धैर्यं च as well as patience, सुग्रीवे in Sugriva, नोपपद्यते not found.
data.md: Firmness, and mental sanctity, mercy, candour, prowess, and patience, are not in Sugriva.

data.v: भ्रातुर्ज्येष्ठस्य यो भार्यां जीवितो महिषीं प्रियाम् । धर्मेण मातरं यस्तु स्वीकरोति जुगुप्सितः ।।
data.es: 'He usurped his elder brother's queen, while he was still alive. It is morally abominable since an elder brother's wife is like a mother. How can a person who blocks the entrance of a cave while his noble brother is engaged in fighting inside be treated as righteous?
data.anv: जुगुप्सितः despicable person, यः who, ज्येष्ठस्य of elder's, भ्रातुः brother's, जीवतः while he was alive, धर्मेण from the point of view of morality, मातरं motherlike, भार्याम् wife, प्रियाम् loved, महिषीम् queen, स्वीकरोति he took over (used her as his wife), महात्मना by the great, भ्रात्रा by the brother, युद्धाय for combat, अभिनियुक्तेन engaged, येन by whom, बिलस्य cave's, मुखम् entrance, पिहितम् blocked, सः he, धर्मम् morals, कथम् how, जानीते will he know?
data.md: He that, while her son is living, appropriateth the beloved queen of his elder brother, mother to him by morality, is hated (of all beings). How can he that could cover up the mouth of the cave, when he had been desired by his brother gone on martial mission, to guard the same,—(how can he) know morality?

data.v: कथं स धर्मं जानीते येन भ्रात्रा दुरात्मना । युद्धायाभिनियुक्तेन बिलस्य पिहितं मुखम् ।।
data.es: 'He usurped his elder brother's queen, while he was still alive. It is morally abominable since an elder brother's wife is like a mother. How can a person who blocks the entrance of a cave while his noble brother is engaged in fighting inside be treated as righteous?
data.anv: जुगुप्सितः despicable person, यः who, ज्येष्ठस्य of elder's, भ्रातुः brother's, जीवतः while he was alive, धर्मेण from the point of view of morality, मातरं motherlike, भार्याम् wife, प्रियाम् loved, महिषीम् queen, स्वीकरोति he took over (used her as his wife), महात्मना by the great, भ्रात्रा by the brother, युद्धाय for combat, अभिनियुक्तेन engaged, येन by whom, बिलस्य cave's, मुखम् entrance, पिहितम् blocked, सः he, धर्मम् morals, कथम् how, जानीते will he know?
data.md: He that, while her son is living, appropriateth the beloved queen of his elder brother, mother to him by morality, is hated (of all beings). How can he that could cover up the mouth of the cave, when he had been desired by his brother gone on martial mission, to guard the same,—(how can he) know morality?

data.v: सत्यात्पाणिगृहीतश्च कृतकर्मा महायशाः । विस्मृतो राघवो येन स कस्य सुकृतं स्मरेत् ।।
data.es: 'Illustrious Rama, who faithfully held his hand was forgotten after he received his help. Indeed whose help would he remember?
data.anv: सत्यात् truly, पाणिगृहीतश्च held his hand, कृतकर्मा accepted, महायशाः an illustrious man, राघवः Rama, येन whom, विस्मृतः forgotten, सः he, कस्य whose, तु indeed, कृतम् help, स्मरेत् will he remember?
data.md: Whose good office remembereth he who could forget the renowned Räghava himself of mighty deeds, after having, in the name of truth, taken his hand? How can he reap religious merit that directed us to search Sītā here, from fear of Laksmana, and not from fear of unrighteousness?

data.v: लक्ष्मणस्य भयाद्येन नाधर्मभयभीरुणा । आदिष्टा मार्गितुं सीतां धर्ममस्मिन्कथं भवेत् ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva ordered search for Sita out of fear of Lakshmana and not out of fear of unrighteousness. How can such a man be pious?
data.anv: येन by whom, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, भयात् out of fear, सीताम् Sita, मार्गितुम् to search, आदिष्टाः ordered, अधर्मभयभीरुणा out of fear of unrighteousness, न not, अस्मिन् in this, धर्मम् righteousness, कथम् how, भवेत् will be?
data.md: Whose good office remembereth he who could forget the renowned Räghava himself of mighty deeds, after having, in the name of truth, taken his hand? How can he reap religious merit that directed us to search Sītā here, from fear of Laksmana, and not from fear of unrighteousness?

data.v: तस्मिन्पापे कृतघ्ने तु स्मृतिहीने चलात्मनि । आर्यः को विश्वसेज्जातु तत्कुलीनो जिजीविषुः ।।
data.es: 'He is a sinner and an ungrateful person as he does not remember others' help. He is fickleminded. Which respectable person will believe him? Which member of his family will wish to live?
data.anv: पापे in a sinner, कृतघ्ने in an ungrateful one, स्मृतिहीने in one devoid of memory, चलात्मनि in a fickleminded self, तस्मिन् in him, जातु indeed, आर्यः a respectable one, कः who, विश्वसेत् have confidence, जिजीविषुः who wishes to live, तत् कुलीनः born in that family.
data.md: What noble person, in especial, sprung in his race, shall any longer repose confidence in that impious one of unstable soul who has run amuck of morality?

data.v: राज्ये पुत्रं प्रतिष्ठाप्य सगुणो निर्गुणोऽपि वा । कथं शत्रुकुलीनं मां सुग्रीवो जीवयिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'If I am the king's son, virtuous or otherwise, I will be installed in the kingdom (as successor). How can Sugriva suffer me to live when I am his enemy's descendant?
data.anv: सुगुणः virtuous, विगुणोऽपि or not virtuous also, पुत्रः a son, राज्ये in the kingdom, प्रतिष्ठाप्यः should be installed, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, शत्रुकुलीनम् enemy's descendant, माम् me, कथम् how, जीवयिष्यति will allow me to live.
data.md: Meritorious or otherwise, how can Sugriva, having installed in the kingdom me, son (of his enemy) and the enemy sprung in his race, suffer me to live?

data.v: भिन्नमन्त्रोऽपराद्धश्च हीनशक्तिः कथं ह्यहम् । किष्किन्धां प्राप्य जीवेयमनाथ इव दुर्बलः ।।
data.es: 'My alternate strategy has failed. I have already made a mistake (by announcing my plan). My advisors are holding different views. I am powerless. How can a weakling, an orphan like me live in Kishkinda?
data.anv: भिन्नमन्त्रः my effort failed (my counsels are divided), अपराद्धश्च a crime too, हीनशक्तिः powerless, अहम् I am, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, प्राप्य after reaching, दुर्बलः a weak person, अनाथ इव like an orphan, कथम् how, जीवेयम् will I live.
data.md: How can I, whose counsels have been revealed, who have transgressed, and who have been deprived of my power, repairing to Kiş kindhā like one forlorn and feeble, live?

data.v: उपांशुदण्डेन हि मां बन्धनेनोपपादयेत् । शठः क्रूरो नृशंसश्च सुग्रीवो राज्यकारणात् ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva is deceitful, cruel and treacherous. He will inflict secret punishment on me by way of imprisonment for the sake of the kingdom.
data.anv: शठः deceitful person, क्रूरः cruel one, नृशंसः treacherous person, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राज्यकारणात् for the sake of kingdom, माम् me, उपांशुदण्डेन with secret punishment, बन्धनेन imprisonment, उपपादयेत् inflict.
data.md: For the sake of his kingdom, Sugrīva, wily, cunning and cruel, shall put me in solitary confinement.

data.v: बन्धनाच्चावसादान्मे श्रेयः प्रायोपवेशनम् । अनुजानीत मां सर्वे गृहान्गच्छन्तु वानराः ।।
data.es: 'It is better for me to fast unto death rather than suffer imprisonment. Permit me to do so. You may all go back.
data.anv: बन्धनाद्वा with imprisonment or, अवसादात् with pain, मे me, प्रायोपवेशनम् by fasting unto death, श्रेयः is better, सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys माम् me, अनुजानीत you may permit, गृहम् home, गच्छन्तु may go.
data.md: For me fasting to death is better than being confined-and suffering the consequent misery. Do you grant me your permission; and go to your homes, you monkeys.

data.v: अहं वः प्रतिजानामि न गमिष्याम्यहं पुरीम् । इहैव प्रायमासिष्ये श्रेयो मरणमेव मे ।।
data.es: 'I swear I will not return to the city. I will fast unto death here only. Death for me is desirable.
data.anv: अहम् I am, वः to you, प्रतिजानामि I pledge, अहम् I am, पुरीम् to city, न आगमिष्यामि I will not come, इहैव here only, प्रायम् आसिष्ये I seek death by fasting, मे to me, मरणमेव death alone, श्रेयः better.
data.md: I vow before you, to the palace I will never repair. At this very spot will I fast for death; as death is good for me.

data.v: अभिवादनपूर्वं तु राजा कुशलमेव च । वाच्यस्ततो यवीयान्मे सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: 'Convey my greetings with due courtesy to Rama and Lakshmana on my behalf and my respects to my father's younger brother, king of monkeys, Sugriva and wish him well.
data.anv: बलशालिनौ two powerful ones, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, अभिवादनपूर्वम् greet them with due courtesy on my behalf, वानरेश्वरः king of monkeys, मे to me, यवीयान् तातः father's younger brother, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अभिवादनपूर्वम् by conveying my respects, कुशलम् wellbeing, वाच्यः greet.
data.md: Bowing to the king as well as to the powerful Rāghava, you should communicate my wellbeing to Sugriva— lord of my health and peace to my mother Umā.

data.v: आरोग्यपूर्वं कुशलं वाच्या माता रुमा च मे । मातरं चैव मे तारामाश्वासयितुमर्हथ ।।
data.es: 'You should convey my mother as well as Ruma my good wishes for their health and wellbeing. You should console my mother Tara also.
data.anv: मे my, माता mother, रुमा च also Ruma, आरोग्यपूर्वम् enquire about their health, कुशलम् wellbeing, वाच्या by words, मे my, मातरम् mother, ताराम् Tara, आश्वासयितुं चैव to console, अर्हथ you should.

data.v: प्रकृत्या प्रियपुत्रा सा सानुक्रोशा तपस्विनी । विनष्टं मामिह श्रुत्वा व्यक्तं हास्यति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: 'By nature my mother, is compassionate. She is fond of me. (But) she is helpless. On hearing about my death, she will certainly give up her life'.
data.anv: प्रकृत्या by nature, सानुक्रोशा a compassionate woman, प्रियपुत्रा fond of her son, तपस्विनी a helpless lady, सा she, इह here, माम् me, विनष्टम् dead, श्रुत्वा on hearing, व्यक्तम् certainly, जीवितम् life, हास्यति she will give up.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं वृद्धानप्यभिवाद्य च । संविवेशाङ्गदो भूमौ रुदन्दर्भेषु दुर्मनाः ।।
data.es: Having expresed so much of his feelings, disheartened Angada saluted the elderly monkeys and started crying. Then he spread the darbha grass and lay down on the ground.
data.anv: एतावत् so much, वचनम् word, उक्त्वा having expressed, तान् them, वृद्धान् old, अभिवाद्य saluted, च and, अङ्गदः Angada, रुदन् started crying, दुर्मना: a disheartened one, भूमौ on the ground, दर्भेषु on darbha (Kusa) grass, विवेश lay down.

data.v: तस्य संविशतस्तत्र रुदन्तो वानरर्षभाः । नयनेभ्यः प्रमुमुचुरुष्णं वै वारिदुःखिताः ।।
data.es: Seeing him lie down the bulls among the monkeys became sad and shed hot tears from their eyes.
data.anv: तस्य his, तत्र there, संविशतः when he sat down, वानरर्षभाः bulls among the monkeys, दुःखिताः said, रुदन्तः cried, नयनेभ्यः from the eyes, उष्णम् hot, वारि tears, प्रमुमुचुः shed.
data.md: When he had entered, those foremost monkeys, stricken with sorrow, weeping shed warm tears from their eyes. And censuring Sugrīva and praising Vāli, they, surrounding Angada, determined to starve themselves to death.

data.v: सुग्रीवं चैव निन्दन्तः प्रशंसन्तश्च वालिनम् । परिवार्याङ्गदो सर्वे व्यवस्यन्प्रायमासितुम् ।।
data.es: Blaming Sugriva and praising Vali, all the companions of Angada sat there surrounding him after having decided to fast unto death .
data.anv: सर्वे all , सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, निन्दन्तः while they were blaming, वालिनम् Vali, प्रशंसन्तश्च while praising, अङ्गदम् Angada, परिवार्य after surrounding, प्रायम् आसितुम् to seek fast unto death, व्यवसन् while he decided
data.md: When he had entered, those foremost monkeys, stricken with sorrow, weeping shed warm tears from their eyes. And censuring Sugrīva and praising Vāli, they, surrounding Angada, determined to starve themselves to death.

data.v: मतं तद्वालिपुत्रस्य विज्ञाय प्लवगर्षभाः । उपस्पृश्योदकं सर्वे प्राङ्मुखाः समुपाविशन् । दक्षिणाग्रेषु दर्भेषु उदक्तीरं समाश्रिताः ।।
data.es: With the opinion of Vali's son ascertained, all the great monkeys thought it proper to die. They sipped water and assembled on the northern shore of the sea facing the east with the darbha grass spread on the ground, their edges pointing southward.
data.anv: वालिपुत्रस्य of Vali's son, तत् मतम्  his opinion, विज्ञाय after knowing, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, तत्र there, हरिश्रेष्ठाः best of monkeys, एतत् this, क्षमम् is fitting, इति in this way, मुमूर्षवः they were willing to die, उदकम् water, उपश्पृश्य having sipped, उदक्तीरम् on the (northern) shore of the sea, समाश्रिताः assembled, प्राङ्मुखाः facing the east, दक्षिणाग्रेषु pointing to the south, दर्भेषु darbha grass, समुपाविशन् sat down together.
data.md: Taking to heart the speech of Väli's son, those prime monkeys, sipping water, sat down facing the East. And sitting on the edge of the water on grass pointing to the south, the foremost monkeys, wishing for surcease, thought within themselves,-Even this is fit for us.

data.v: स संविशद्भिर्बहुभिर्महीधरो; महाद्रिकूटप्रमितैः प्लवंगमैः ।।
data.es: While the numerous monkeys, resembling peaks of high mountains were roaring, it resounded through the mountain caves. It was like the sound of the stormy thunderclouds.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: संविशद्भि: preparing to lay down, महाद्रिकूटप्रतिमैः  as huge as mountain peaks, बहुभिः by many, प्लवङ्गमैः by monkeys, भृशम् greatly, सन्नादितनिर्दरान्तरः the sound that came from inside the cave, सः that, महीधरः mountain, नदद्भि: by the thundering, जलदैः with clouds,  इव like, उल्बणैः stormy clouds, बभूव appeared.
data.md: When those monkeys resembling mountainsummits had entered in, they set up cries, which, like to the rumbling of clouds, making the sky resound, made that mountain with its rills reverberate.

data.v: बभूव संनादितनिर्झरान्तरो; भृशं नदद्भिर्जलदैरिवोल्बणैः ।।
data.es: While the numerous monkeys, resembling peaks of high mountains were roaring, it resounded through the mountain caves. It was like the sound of the stormy thunderclouds.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: संविशद्भि: preparing to lay down, महाद्रिकूटप्रतिमैः  as huge as mountain peaks, बहुभिः by many, प्लवङ्गमैः by monkeys, भृशम् greatly, सन्नादितनिर्दरान्तरः the sound that came from inside the cave, सः that, महीधरः mountain, नदद्भि: by the thundering, जलदैः with clouds,  इव like, उल्बणैः stormy clouds, बभूव appeared.

data.v: उपविष्टास्तु ते सर्वे यस्मिन्प्रायं गिरिस्थले । हरयो गृध्रराजश्च तं देशमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: While the monkeys were preparing to fast unto death on the plateau of the mountain, Sampati, the prosperous king of vultures, the longlived elder brother of Jatayu widely known for his strength, appeared there.
data.anv: ते they, सर्वे all, हरयः monkeys, यस्मिन् that, गिरिस्थले on the plateau of the mountain, प्रायम् उपविष्टाः seated preparing to die by fasting unto death, तं देशम् that location, गृध्रराजः king of vultures, नाम्ना by name, सम्पातिर्नाम as Sampati, चिरञ्जीवी longlived, जटायुष: Jatayu, भ्राता brother, श्रीमान् prosperous, विख्यातबलपौरुषः widely known for his strength, विहङ्गमः a vulture, उपचक्रमे came there.
data.md: When the monkeys had been seated in that mountain, with the intention of putting a period to their existence through fasting a king of vultures happened to come to that quarter. And that long-lived bird was named Sampāti, the beautiful brother of Jaţāyu, famous for his strength and prowess.

data.v: साम्पातिर्नाम नाम्ना तु चिरजीवी विहंगमः । भ्राता जटायुषः श्रीमान्प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः ।।
data.es: While the monkeys were preparing to fast unto death on the plateau of the mountain, Sampati, the prosperous king of vultures, the longlived elder brother of Jatayu widely known for his strength, appeared there.
data.anv: ते they, सर्वे all, हरयः monkeys, यस्मिन् that, गिरिस्थले on the plateau of the mountain, प्रायम् उपविष्टाः seated preparing to die by fasting unto death, तं देशम् that location, गृध्रराजः king of vultures, नाम्ना by name, सम्पातिर्नाम as Sampati, चिरञ्जीवी longlived, जटायुष: Jatayu, भ्राता brother, श्रीमान् prosperous, विख्यातबलपौरुषः widely known for his strength, विहङ्गमः a vulture, उपचक्रमे came there.
data.md: When the monkeys had been seated in that mountain, with the intention of putting a period to their existence through fasting a king of vultures happened to come to that quarter. And that long-lived bird was named Sampāti, the beautiful brother of Jaţāyu, famous for his strength and prowess.

data.v: कन्दरादभिनिष्क्रम्य स विन्ध्यस्य महागिरेः । उपविष्टान्हरीन्दृष्ट्वा हृष्टात्मा गिरमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Coming out of the cave of the great mount Vindhya, Sampati was glad to see the monkeys seated there and said to himself:
data.anv: सः he, महागिरेः of the great mountain, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya's, कन्दरात् from the cave, अभिनिष्क्रम्य emerging, उपविष्टान् seated, हरीन् monkeys, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, हृष्टात्मा delighted, गिरम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Issuing from a cavern of the mighty mountain Vindhya, he, seeing the monkeys seated, well pleased, said.

data.v: विधिः किल नरं लोके विधानेनानुवर्तते । यथायं विहितो भक्ष्यश्चिरान्मह्यमुपागतः ।।
data.es: 'Destiny rules the world of men in accordance with a divine arrangement. Or else, it would not have brought me food after a long time (of fasting)'. (The monkeys are food for Sampati)'
data.anv: लोके in this world, विधिः destiny, विधानेन in accordance with, नरम् अनुवर्तते किल said to follow, यथा as, चिरात् for long, मह्यम् for me, विहितः fixed, अयम् this, भक्ष्यः eatable, उपागतः has come.
data.md: Verily man reapeth the fruit of his former acts; and therefore it is that this food ordained to that end, comes to me after a long time. I shall feed on these monkeys, one by one, slaying them one after another. Eyeing those apes, the bird expressed himself thus.

data.v: परम्पराणां भक्षिष्ये वानराणां मृतं मृतम् । उवाचैवं वचः पक्षी तान्निरीक्ष्य प्लवंगमान् ।।
data.es: Looking at them, the vulture continued, 'I will eat these monkeys one after the other as and when they die'.
data.anv: वानराणाम् of monkeys, परम्पराणाम् one after the other, मृतं मृतम् as and when they die, भक्षिष्ये I will eat, तान् them, प्लवङ्गमान् monkeys, निरीक्ष्य looking at them, पक्षी the vulture, इदं these, वचः words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Verily man reapeth the fruit of his former acts; and therefore it is that this food ordained to that end, comes to me after a long time. I shall feed on these monkeys, one by one, slaying them one after another. Eyeing those apes, the bird expressed himself thus.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा भक्षलुब्धस्य पक्षिणः । अङ्गदः परमायस्तो हनूमन्तमथाब्रवीत् ।।

data.v: पश्य सीतापदेशेन साक्षाद्वैवस्वतो यमः । इमं देशमनुप्राप्तो वानराणां विपत्तये ।।
data.es: 'See, Yama, son of Vaivasvata, has arrived here in person to destroy the monkeys in the name of Sita. (Sita became the direct agent for causing the destruction of monkeys).
data.anv: सीतापदेशेन in the name of Sita, वैवस्वतः Vaivasvata, यमः Yama, साक्षात् himself in person, वानराणाम् to monkeys, विपत्तये to kill, इमं देशम् this place, अनुप्राप्तः has come, पश्य see.
data.md: Behold! through Sita's simplicity* this onethe very son of the Sun, Yama-has come to this place, to exterminate the monkeys. *Another reading is Gridhra padesana— through the vultur's cunning. This the commentator consider as preferrable.

data.v: रामस्य न कृतं कार्यं राज्ञो न च वचः कृतम् । हरीणामियमज्ञाता विपत्तिः सहसागता ।।
data.es: 'Rama's task has not been performed. Sugriva's order has not been excuted. And (now) suddenly this calamity has overtaken the monkeys unawares.

data.md: Rāma's work has not been done; nor the royal mandate. And this disaster has arrived unthought of by the monkeys.

data.v: वैदेह्याः प्रियकामेन कृतं कर्म जटायुषा । गृध्रराजेन यत्तत्र श्रुतं वस्तदशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'We have heard in detail about the task accomplished by Jatayu, the king of vultures, in order to please Sita, the princess of Videha.

data.md: You have in detail heard all that, inspired with the desire of doing what is good to Vaidehi, that king of vultures, Jatayu, did here.

data.v: तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि तिर्यग्योनिगतान्यपि । प्रियं कुर्वन्ति रामस्य त्यक्त्वा प्राणान्यथा वयम् ।।
data.anv: तथा that way, तिर्यग्योनिगतान्यपि those born as animals even, सर्वाणि all, भूतानि creatures, प्राणान् life, त्यक्त्वा risking, वयं यथा like us, रामस्य for Rama, प्रियम् please, कुर्वन्ति you will.
data.md: In this way, all creatures, even the brute species, compass the welfare of Rāma, renouncing their lives, as we do.

data.v: राघवार्थे परिश्रान्ता वयं संत्यक्तजीविताः । कान्ताराणि प्रपन्नाः स्म न च पश्याम मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'Jatayu, the knower of dharma, has laid down his life for the wellbeing of Rama. We are exhausted in the process of helping Rama. We have lost hope of our lives after entering these forests. Yet we have failed to find the princess from Mithila.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञेन by the righteous, जटायुषा by Jatayu, रामस्य Rama's, प्रियम् wellbeing, कृतं हि is done, वयम् we, राघवार्थे for Rama's sake, परिश्रान्ताः exhausted, सन्त्यक्तजीविताः all of us are giving up life, कान्ताराणि forests, प्रपन्नाः ventured, स्म we, मैथिलीम् Maithili, न च पश्याम we have not seen.
data.md: Therefore the righteous Jațãyu, of his own accord laying down his life, has done the pleasure of Rāma. We also, overcome with fatigue and (almost) dying, have come to this forest; but Mithila's daughter we find not.

data.v: स सुखी गृध्रराजस्तु रावणेन हतो रणे । मुक्तश्च सुग्रीवभयाद्गतश्च परमां गतिम् ।।
data.es: 'The king of vultures was slain by Ravana in a combat. He attained supreme status. He had no fear for Sugriva (as we have).
data.anv: रणे in combat, रावणेन by Ravana, हतः was slain, सः he, गृध्रराजस्तु king of vultures, सुखी is happy, सुग्रीवभयात् fear of Sugriva, मुक्तश्च relieved, परमाम् supreme, गतिम् status, गतश्च attained.
data.md: Happy is that king of vultures, having been slain by Rāvaņa in battle. He has got quit of the fear of Sugrīva, and has also attained supreme state.

data.md: In consequence of the death of Jațāyu and that of king Dasaratha, as well as owing to the ravishment of Vaidehi, (the lives of) the monkeys have come into jeopardy.

data.v: कथमासीज्जनस्थाने युद्धं राक्षसगृध्रयोः । नामधेयमिदं भ्रातुश्चिरस्याद्य मया श्रुतम् ।।
data.es: 'I heard my brother's name today after a long time.I wish to know how the demon and the vulture fought at Janasthana.

data.md: How happened in Janasthāna the fight between the Rākṣasa and the vulture? It is after a long time that to-day I hear the name of my brother.

भ्रातुर्जटायुषस्तस्य जनस्थाननिवासिनः । तस्यैव च मम भ्रातुः सखा दशरथः कथम् । यस्य रामः प्रियः पुत्रो ज्येष्ठो गुरुजनप्रियः ।।

data.v: सूर्यांशुदग्धपक्षत्वान्न शक्नोमि विसर्पितुम् । इच्छेयं पर्वतादस्मादवतर्तुमरिंदमाः ।।
data.es: 'O tamers of foes as my wings are burnt down by the Sun's rays it is not possible for me to move forward. I wish you help me to get down from this mountain'.
data.anv: अरिन्दमाः O tamers of enemies, सूर्यांशुदग्धपक्षत्वात् due to the burning of my wings by the Sun's rays, उपसर्पितुम् to move forward, न शक्नोमि it is not possible for me, अस्मात् from this, पर्वतात् from the mountain, अवतर्तुम् to get down, इच्छेयम् I want.
data.md: I can not move in consequence of my wings having been burnt by the solar rays. But I wish that you may take me down from this mountain.

data.v: ते प्रायमुपविष्टास्तु दृष्ट्वा गृध्रं प्लवंगमाः । चक्रुर्बुद्धिं तदा रौद्रां सर्वान्नो भक्षयिष्यति ।।
data.es: On seeing the vulture, the monkeys fasting unto death got a terrible thought in their minds that the vulture might eat them.
data.anv: प्रायम् fasting unto death, उपविष्टाः seated, ते प्लवङ्गमाः those monkeys, गृध्रम् vulture, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तदा then, नः us, सर्वान् all, भक्षयिष्यति he will eat away, रौद्रम् terribly, बुद्धिम् in their minds, चक्रुः  thought .
data.md: Seated for the purpose of fasting to death, the monkeys, seeing the vulture, with terror thought within themselves, he shall eat us all up.

data.v: सर्वथा प्रायमासीनान्यदि नो भक्षयिष्यति । कृतकृत्या भविष्यामः क्षिप्रं सिद्धिमितो गताः ।।
data.es: 'Since we wish to die, we will be accomplishing our objective successfully if he eats us soon'.
data.anv: प्रायम् आसीनान् welcoming death, नः us, भक्षयिष्यति यदि if he eats us away, इतः from here, क्षिप्रम् soon, सिद्धिम् accomplishment, गताः attained, सर्वथा by all means, कृतकृत्याः we succeed in our objective, भविष्यामः we will be.
data.md: If he eat us up, who have sat down to fast to death, we shall secure success, and speedily attain our end.

data.v: बभूवुर्क्षरजो नाम वानरेन्द्रः प्रतापवान् । ममार्यः पार्थिवः पक्षिन्धार्मिकौ तस्य चात्मजौ ।।
data.es: 'O powerful bird my revered grandfather Riksharaja was a glorious king of monkeys. He had two sons called Sugriva and Vali.Both were strong like floodwaters. My father Vali was wellknown in this world for his remarkable deeds.

data.md: There was a lord of monkeys named Riksaraja, endowed with prowess. That king, O bird, was my grandsire. He had two virtuous sons, exceedingly powerful both-Vāli and Sugriva. My father, Vali, was famed in the world for his deeds.

data.v: राजा कृत्स्नस्य जगत इक्ष्वाकूणां महारथः । रामो दाशरथिः श्रीमान्प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम् ।।
data.es: 'The great warrior Rama is the son of Dasaratha, the scion of the Ikshvaku race and the king of the entire world. He entered Dandaka forest along with his brother Lakshmana and consort Vaidehi obeying his father's command following a righteous path.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvaku race, महारथः great warrior, कृत्स्नस्य of the entire, जगतः world, राजा king, श्रीमान् illustrious, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama's, पितुः father's, निदेशनिरतः obeying his command, धर्म्यम् righteous, पन्थानम् path, आश्रितः seeking, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, वैदेह्या चापि and with Vaidehi, दण्डकावनम् forest of Dandaka, प्रविष्टः he entered.
data.md: It came to pass that mighty monarch of all this earth, descendant of the Ikṣwākus, the great and graceful car warrior, Rāma, son to Dasaratha, intent upon the injunction of his sire, resorting to the path of righteousness, entered the woods of Dandaka in company with his brother, Lakşmaņa and his wife Vaidehī.

data.v: लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या चापि भार्यया । पितुर्निदेशनिरतो धर्म्यं पन्थानमाश्रितः । तस्य भार्या जनस्थानाद्रावणेन हृता बलात् ।।
data.es: 'Rama, son of Dasaratha, a prosperous king of all the worlds, comparable to Indra and Varuna came to the Dandaka forest along with his brother Laksmana and wife Vaidehi. Ravana abducted his wife from Janasthana.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvaku race, महारथः great warrior, कृत्स्नस्य of the entire, जगतः world, राजा king, श्रीमान् illustrious, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama's, पितुः father's, निदेशनिरतः obeying his command, धर्म्यम् righteous, पन्थानम् path, आश्रितः seeking, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, वैदेह्या चापि and with Vaidehi, दण्डकावनम् forest of Dandaka, प्रविष्टः he entered.

data.v: रामस्य च पितुर्मित्रं जटायुर्नाम गृध्रराट् । ददर्श सीतां वैदेहीं ह्रियमाणां विहायसा ।।
data.es: 'His wife was abducted from Janasthana by Ravana. The king of vultures Jatayu, a friend of Rama's father observed princess of Videha, being forcibly carried away through the aerial region.
data.anv: तस्य his, भार्या wife, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, रावणेन by Ravana, बलात् with force, हृता is abducted, रामस्य Rama's, पितुः father's, मित्रम् friend, जटायुर्नाम called Jatayu, गृध्रराट् king of vultures, विहायसा flying through aerial region, ह्रियमाणाम्  forcibly taken away, वैदेहीम् princess of Videha, सीताम् Sita, ददर्श he saw.

data.v: रावणं विरथं कृत्वा स्थापयित्वा च मैथिलीम् । परिश्रान्तश्च वृद्धश्च रावणेन हतो रणे ।।
data.es: 'Jatayu destroyed Ravana's aerial chariot and put Maithili in a (safe) place. But being old and exhausted, he was killed in a combat by Ravana.
data.anv: रावणम् Ravana, विरथम् deprived of the chariot, कृत्वा after defeating, मैथिलीं च and Maithili, स्थापयित्वा putting her at a place, परिश्रान्तश्च exhausted one, वृद्धश्च and old one also, रणे in combat, रावणेन by Ravana, हतः was killed.

data.v: एवं गृध्रो हतस्तेन रावणेन बहीयसा । संस्कृतश्चापि रामेण गतश्च गतिमुत्तमाम् ।।
data.es: 'Thus the vulture was slain by Ravana who was stronger. Cremated by Rama and his last rites performed, he reached the supreme heavenly abode. (It was the luck of Jatayu, unlike Dasaratha, to be cremated by Rama.)
data.anv: गृध्रः vulture, एवम् that way, बलीयसा by a stronger one, तेन रावणेन by that Ravana, हतः slain, रामेण by Rama, संस्कृतश्चासि cremated according to rites, उत्तमां गतिम् supreme abode, गतश्च reached.
data.md: Thus slain by the powerful Rāvana, the vulture, having had his funereal obsequies performed by Rama. (himself), has attained excellent state.

data.v: ततो मम पितृव्येण सुग्रीवेण महात्मना । चकार राघवः सख्यं सोऽवधीत्पितरं मम ।।
data.es: 'Then Rama made friendship with my father's brother, great self Sugriva and killed my father.
data.anv: ततः then, राघवः Rama, मम my, पितृव्येण with my father's brother, महात्मना by the great self, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, सख्यम् friendship, चकार made, सः he, Rama, पितरम् my father, अवधीत् killed.
data.md: Then Rāghava made friends with my uncle, the high-souled Sugrīva; and he also slew my sire.

data.v: माम पित्रा विरुद्धो हि सुग्रीवः सचिवैः सह । निहत्य वालिनं रामस्ततस्तमभिषेचयत् ।।
data.md: My father had debarred Sugrīva from the kingdom along with his counsellors; but Rāma, having slain Vāli, installed him (Sugrīva).

data.v: स राज्ये स्थापितस्तेन सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः । राजा वानरमुख्यानां येन प्रस्थापिता वयम् ।।
data.es: 'I am a monkey called Hanuman. I am here sent by great king Sugriva, the best of monkeys.
data.anv: महात्मना by the great, वानरमुख्यानाम् best of monkeys, राज्ञा by the king, तेन सुग्रीवेण by such Sugriva, प्रेषितः I am sent, प्राप्तः came here, अहम् I, हनुमान्नाम Hanuman, वानरः monkey
data.md: And established in the monarchy by him (Rāma), Sugriva is (now) the master of the monkeys and king of all the foremost monkeys. By him have we been sent.

data.v: एवं रामप्रयुक्तास्तु मार्गमाणास्ततस्ततः । वैदेहीं नाधिगच्छामो रात्रौ सूर्यप्रभामिव ।।
data.md: Despatched hither by Rāma, we have searched for Sītā all round, but Vaidehī we have not found, as one does not find the solar splendour at night.

data.v: ते वयं दण्दकारण्यं विचित्य सुसमाहिताः । अज्ञानात्तु प्रविष्टाः स्म धरण्या विवृतं बिलम् ।।
data.md: It came to pass that, having heedfully explored the Dandaka forest, we through ignorance entered a cave lying open before.

data.v: मयस्य माया विहितं तद्बिलं च विचिन्वताम् । व्यतीतस्तत्र नो मासो यो राज्ञा सामयः कृतः ।।
data.es: While they were ransacking the impassable mountain created with the magical powers of Maya, the time limit of one month set by the king was over.
data.anv: तेषाम् for them, मयस्य Maya's, मायाविहितम् created by his Maya, गिरिदुर्गम् impassable mountain, विचिन्वताम् while searching, यः such, राज्ञा by the king, समयः time set, कृतः was fixed, मासः month, व्यतिक्रान्तः exceeded.
data.md: Exploring the mountain fateness of Maya*, they spent the month that had been set by the king. *Named Rhiksavila.

data.v: ते वयं कपिराजस्य सर्वे वचनकारिणः । कृतां संस्थामतिक्रान्ता भयात्प्रायमुपास्महे ।।
data.md: Doing the behests of the king of monkeys, we, having overstayed the terms which had been appointed, have from fear sat here down for the purpose of fasting to death.

data.v: क्रुद्धे तस्मिंस्तु काकुत्स्थे सुग्रीवे च सलक्ष्मणे । गतानामपि सर्वेषां तत्र नो नास्ति जीवितम् ।।
data.md: On that Kākutstha being wrought up with wrath, as well as Sugrīva together with Lakş maņa, we, repairing thither, shall lose our lives.

data.v: इत्युक्तः करुणं वाक्यं वानरैस्त्यक्तजीवितैः । सबाष्पो वानरान्गृध्रः प्रत्युवाच महास्वनः ।।
data.es: On hearing the pathetic words from the monkeys who had given up hope of life, the loudvoiced vulture wailing replied:
data.anv: त्यक्तजीवितैः who had given up hope of life, वानरैः by monkeys, इति thus, करुणम् pathetic, वाक्यम् words, उक्तः spoken, महास्वनः loudvoiced, गृध्रः vulture, सबाष्पः with tears, वानरान्   the monkeys, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: When the monkeys, whose lives had well nigh departed out of them, had spoken these piteous words, the vulture, in solemn accents, with tears in his eyes, said to the monkeys,

data.v: यवीयान्मम स भ्राता जटायुर्नाम वानराः । यमाख्यात हतं युद्धे रावणेन बलीयसा ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys, the one you said to have been killed by mighty Ravana in a combat was my younger brother, Jatayu.
data.anv: वानराः O monkeys, यम् whom, बलीयसा by a strong, रावणेन by Ravana, युद्धे in the combat, हतम् killed, आख्यात you told, जटायुः नाम called Jatayu, सः he is, मम my, यवीयान् younger, भ्राता brother.
data.md: You monkeys, you have said that my younger brother, named Jaţāyu, has been slain in battle by the powerful Rāvaņa.

data.v: वृद्धभावादपक्षत्वाच्छृण्वंस्तदपि मर्षये । न हि मे शक्तिरद्यास्ति भ्रातुर्वैरविमोक्षणे ।।
data.es: 'Even after I have heard this, I cannot avenge my brother's death as I am old, I have no wings, and I have no energy enough (to fight).
data.anv: तत् that, श्रुण्वन् अपि even after hearing , वृद्धभावात् due to old age, अपक्षत्वात् since I have no wings, मे to me, अद्य now, भ्रातुः brother's, वैरविमोक्षणे to avenge the death, शक्तिः energy, नास्ति हि I do not have.
data.md: On account of my age and want of wings, I, although hearing this, bear it. Nor have I strength to-day to clear scores touching my brother's enmity.

data.v: पुरा वृत्रवधे वृत्ते स चाहं च जयैषिणौ । आदित्यमुपयातौ स्वो ज्वलन्तं रश्मिमालिनम् ।।
data.es: 'In olden days, when Indra killed Vrutra we (Jatayu and I) seeking to challenge him reached the Sun blazing with a garland of beams.
data.anv: पुरा in olden days, वृत्रवधे at the time of the death of Vrutra, वृत्ते परस्पर when Vrutra and Indra, जयैषिणौ wishing to win, ज्वलन्तम् blazing, रश्मिमालिनम् with a garland of beams, आदित्यम् to Sun, उपयातौ both went, स्वः we both.
data.md: Formerly, while engaged in the destruction of Vrtra, he and I, burning for victory, soared in the sky near the flaming sun, garlanded by glory. Thence impetuously wheeling round, we went to the celestial regions along the etherial way. And it came to pass that, coming midway of the sun, Jațāyu was faint.

data.v: आवृत्याकाशमार्गेण जवेन स्म गतौ भृशम् । मध्यं प्राप्ते च सूर्ये च जटायुरवसीदति ।।
data.es: 'Flying in the sky at a violently high speed, we reached the meridian of the Sun when, unable to bear the heat, Jatayu became weak.
data.anv: आकाशमार्गे in the sky, आवृत्य surrounding, भृशम् violently, जवेन at high speed, गतौ स्म both of us reached, मध्यम् in the midst, प्राप्ते when reached, दिनकरे when the Sun, जटायुः Jatayu's, अवसीदति became weak.
data.md: Formerly, while engaged in the destruction of Vrtra, he and I, burning for victory, soared in the sky near the flaming sun, garlanded by glory. Thence impetuously wheeling round, we went to the celestial regions along the etherial way. And it came to pass that, coming midway of the sun, Jațāyu was faint.

data.v: तमहं भ्रातरं दृष्ट्वा सूर्यरश्मिभिरर्दितम् । पक्षाभ्यं छादयामास स्नेहात्परमविह्वलम् ।।
data.es: 'Seeing my brother tormented due to the Sun's radiance I was overwhelmed with grief. Out of love I covered him with both my wings.
data.anv: भ्रातरम् my brother, तम् him, सूर्यरश्मिभिः with Sun's radiance, अर्दितम् tormented, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, परमविह्वल: overwhelmed, अहम् I, स्नेहात् lovingly, पक्षाभ्याम् with both my wings, छादयामास I covered.
data.md: Witnessing my brother severely struck by the solar rays and exceedingly stupefied, I from affection shadowed him with my wings.

data.v: निर्दग्धपक्षः पतितो विन्ध्येऽहं वानरोत्तमाः । अहमस्मिन्वसन्भ्रातुः प्रवृत्तिं नोपलक्षये ।।
data.es: 'O bulls among monkeys, consequently my wings were burnt and I dropped down on Vindhya. Here I have been living, knowing not my brother's whereabouts.'
data.anv: वानरर्षभाः O bulls among monkeys, अहम् I am, निर्दग्धपत्रः with burnt wings, विन्ध्ये on Vindhya, पतितः dropped down, अस्मिन् in this place, वसन् while I lived, अहम् I, भ्रातुः brother's, प्रवृत्तिम् news, नोपलक्षये not known to me.
data.md: Thereat, my pinions scathed, I dropped down on Vindhya, you foremost of monkeys; and staying here, I could not know the circumstances that have befallen my brother.

data.v: जटायुषस्त्वेवमुक्तो भ्रात्रा संपातिना तदा । युवराजो महाप्राज्ञः प्रत्युवाचाङ्गदस्तदा ।।
data.es: To these words of Jatayu's brother, Sampati, Angada, the learned heir apparent replied:
data.anv: तदा then, जटायुषः Jatayu's, भ्रात्रा by brother, सम्पातिना by Sampathi, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been told, महाप्राज्ञः highly learned one, युवराजः heir apparent, अङ्गदः Angada, ततः then, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Thus addressed by Jatāyu's brother, Sampāti, the eminently wise prince Angada answered,

data.v: जटायुषो यदि भ्राता श्रुतं ते गदितं मया । आख्याहि यदि जानासि निलयं तस्य रक्षसः ।।
data.es: 'I have heard you. If you are the brother of Jatayu, tell us about the abode of that demon if you know.
data.anv: ते your, गदितम् word, मया by me, श्रुतम् is heard, जटायुषः Jatayu's, भ्राता यदि if you are brother, जानासि यदि if you know, तस्य his, रक्षसः demon's निलयम् residence, आख्याहि tell.
data.md: 'If you are indeed the brother of Jațāyu, having heard what I have related, tell (us) if you know touching the abode of that Rākşasa. Tell us if you know anent that short-sighted worst of Raksasas, Ravana, whether staying far or near.

data.v: अदीर्घदर्शिनं तं वा रावणं राक्षसाधिपम् । अन्तिके यदि वा दूरे यदि जानासि शंस नः ।।
data.es: 'Tell us about Ravana, king of the demons who is unaware of the consequences. If you know his residence, tell us if it is near or far.'
data.anv: अदीर्घदर्शिनम् one who is not farsighted, राक्षसाधिपम् king of demons, तं रावणम् that Ravana, अन्तिके near, दूरे यदि वा far away, जानासि यदि if you know, नः us, शंस tell.
data.md: 'If you are indeed the brother of Jațāyu, having heard what I have related, tell (us) if you know touching the abode of that Rākşasa. Tell us if you know anent that short-sighted worst of Raksasas, Ravana, whether staying far or near.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजा ज्येष्ठो भ्राता जटायुषः । आत्मानुरूपं वचनं वानरान्संप्रहर्षयन् ।।
data.es: Then Jatayu's elder brother, the glorious Sampati, said these pleasing, befitting words:
data.anv: ततः then, जटायुषः Jatayu's, ज्येष्ठः भ्राता elder brother, महातेजाः very  glorious, वानरान् monkeys, अत्मानुरूपम् in a befitting manner, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, सम्प्रहर्षयन् while pleasing them.
data.md: Thereat, rejoicing the monkeys, the exceedingly energetic elder brother of Jațāyu spoke words worthy of him.

data.v: निर्दग्धपक्षो गृध्रोऽहं गतवीर्यः प्लवंगमाः । वाङ्मात्रेण तु रामस्य करिष्ये साह्यमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys I am a vulture. My wings are burnt and my strength is depleted. The only substantial help I can render Rama is through my words.
data.anv: प्लवङ्गमाः O monkeys, निर्दग्धपक्षः my wings are totally burnt, हीनवीर्यः my strength is reduced, गृध्रः vulture, अहम् I, वाङ्मात्रेणा only by my words, रामस्य to Rama, उत्तमम् substantial, साह्यम् help, करिष्ये I will do.
data.md: You monkeys, my pinions have been burnt; and I am a vulture shorn of strength. Therefore I will help Rāma well by my words.

data.v: जानामि वारुणाल्लोकान्विष्णोस्त्रैविक्रमानपि । देवासुरविमर्दांश्च अमृतस्य च मन्थनम् ।।
data.es: 'I know Varuna's worlds(seas and oceans) and all the three worlds measured by three strides by Vamana. Indeed I also know about the friction between the great gods and demons and the churning of the ocean for nectar.
data.anv: वारुणान् Varuna's, लोकान् world, त्रैविक्रमान् three strides, विष्णोः Visnu's, लोकान् worlds, महासुरविमर्दान् the fricton between gods and demons, अमृतस्य for the nectar , च मन्थनम् and the churning, जानामि I know, अपि indeed.
data.md: I know the realms of Varuna, and Visnu's Trivikrama* worlds, the wars of the gods and Asuras, and the churning for ambrosia. *i.e. the worlds enveloped by his three steps during his Dwarf incarnation.

data.v: रामस्य यदिदं कार्यं कर्तव्यं प्रथमं मया । जरया च हृतं तेजः प्राणाश्च शिथिला मम ।।
data.es: 'Rama's work is my primary duty. (But) my strength is drained by age and I have lost my vitality.
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, यत् if, इदं कार्यम् this task, मया by me, प्रथमम् first, कर्तव्यम् duty, हृतम् should be done, प्राणाश्च vitality, शिथिलाः reduced, मम my, जरया due to old age, तेज: strength.
data.md: And albeit age has deprived me of energy, and albeit my life hangs loosely on me, yet, if this is Rāma's work, it should be done by me first.

data.v: तरुणी रूपसंपन्ना सर्वाभरणभूषिता । ह्रियमाणा मया दृष्टा रावणेन दुरात्मना ।।
data.es: 'I saw a young lady of beautiful appearance, adorned with all kinds of ornaments borne away by the evilminded Ravana. That dainty lady was calling out, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana' and was crying aloud. She was throwing away her ornaments and was wriggling to get out of Ravana's grip.

data.v: सूर्यप्रभेव शैलाग्रे तस्याः कौशेयमुत्तमम् । असिते राक्षसे भाति यथा वा तडिदम्बुदे ।।
data.es: 'Her fine silk garment was shining like the radiance of the Sun on the mountain peak, like lightning against the dark cloud. (That was Ravana).
data.anv: असिते in dark, राक्षसे on the demon, तस्याः her, उत्तमम् fine, कौशेयम् silken cloth, शैलाग्रे on the peak of the mountain, सूर्यप्रभेव like the radiance of Sun, अम्बुदे in the dark cloud, यथा like that, वा तटित् यथा like lightning, भाति shining.
data.md: Her silken cloth seemed like the solar splendour on the summit of a mountain; and herself beside the sable Rākşasa, looked like the lightning in the welkin (beside clouds).

data.v: तां तु सीतामहं मन्ये रामस्य परिकीर्तनात् । श्रूयतां मे कथयतो निलयं तस्य रक्षसः ।।
data.es: 'Since she was uttering Rama's name I think she is Sita. (Now) I will tell you about the demon's abode. Listen
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, परिकीर्तनात् was uttering, ताम् her, सीताम् Sita, अहम् I, मन्ये I think, तस्य his, रक्षसः demon's, निलयम् abode, कथयतः described, मे by me, श्रूयताम् you may listen.
data.md: From your relation of Rāma, I conclude that she must be Sītā. Now listen to me as I tell you about the abode of that Rākşasa.

data.v: पुत्रो विश्रवसः साक्षाद्भ्राता वैश्रवणस्य च । अध्यास्ते नगरीं लङ्कां रावणो नाम राकसः ।।
data.es: 'He is Vishrava's son and halfbrother of Vaishravana. His name is Ravana and he resides in the city of Lanka.
data.anv: विश्रवसः Vishravas's, पुत्रः son, साक्षात् real, वैश्रवणस्य Vyshravana's, भ्राता brother, रावणो नाम  called Ravana, राक्षसः rakshasa, लङ्कां नगरीम् city of Lanka, अध्यास्ते resides.
data.md: Son to Viśravana and brother to Vaiśravaņa, the Rākşasa named Rāvana resides in the city of Lankā.

data.v: इतो द्वीपे समुद्रस्य संपूर्णे शतयोजने । तस्मिँल्लङ्का पुरी रम्या निर्मिता विश्वकर्मणा ।।
data.es: 'The beautiful city of Lanka is an island, a hundred yojanas away from here.It was built by Visvakarma.
data.anv: इतः from here, सम्पूर्णे when completed, शतयोजने a hundred yojanas, द्वीपः island, तस्मिन् in it, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मिता built, रम्या beautiful, लङ्कापुरी capital of Lanka.

data.v: तस्यां वसति वैदेही दीना कौशेयवासिनी । रावणान्तःपुरे रुद्धा राक्षसीभिः सुरक्षिता ।।
data.es: 'You will see in the city of Lanka, the princess from Videha, daughter of Janaka, a picture of dejection, robed in silk, confined in the harem of Ravana, wellprotected by demonesses.
data.anv: दीना dejected, कौशेयवासिनी lady wearing silk garment, वैदेही Vaidehi, तस्याम् in the city, रावणान्तःपुरे in the harem, रुद्धा confined, राक्षसीभिः by demonesses, सुरक्षिता well protected, वसति lives, तस्याम् in that city, राज्ञः the king's, जनकस्य Janaka's, आत्मजाम् daughter, मैथिलीम् Maithili, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

data.v: जनकस्यात्मजां राज्ञस्तस्यां द्रक्ष्यथ मैथिलीम् । लङ्कायामथ गुप्तायां सागरेण समन्ततः ।।
संप्राप्य सागरस्यान्तं संपूर्णं शतयोजनम् । आसाद्य दक्षिणं कूलं ततो द्रक्ष्यथ रावणम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys traverse a hundred yojanas across the sea. On reaching the southern coast you will be able to see Ravana's Lanka defended and surrounded by the sea. Now proceed swiftly and prove your strength.
data.anv: प्लवङ्गमाः O monkeys, सम्पूर्णम् a complete, शतयोजनम् hundred yojanas, सागरस्य of the sea, अन्तम् end, सम्प्राप्य having reached, अथ then, दक्षिणं तीरम् southern coast, आसाद्य on reaching, ततः then, समन्ततः all around, सागरेण by the sea, गुप्तायाम् protected, लङ्कायाम् at Lanka, रावणम् Ravana, द्रक्ष्यथ will see, त्वरिताः swiftly, तत्रैव there, क्षिप्रम् at once, विक्रमध्वम् prove your strength.

data.v: तत्रैव त्वरिताः क्षिप्रं विक्रमध्वं प्लवंगमाः । ज्ञानेन खलु पश्यामि दृष्ट्वा प्रत्यागमिष्यथ ।।
आद्यः पन्थाः कुलिङ्गानां ये चान्ये धान्यजीविनः । द्वितीयो बलिभोजानां ये च वृक्षफलाशिनः ।।
data.es: 'By intuition I know you would see Sita and return. On the first plane you will see sparrows and birds which live on grain. On the second, you will see crows living on the food offered to the dead and birds living on the fruits of trees, and then cocks, cranes and kraunchas moving on the third plane, on the fourth, hawks and falcons and on the fifth, vultures.

data.v: बलवीर्योपपन्नानां रूपयौवनशालिनाम् । षष्ठस्तु पन्था हंसानां वैनतेयगतिः परा । वैनतेयाच्च नो जन्म सर्वेषां वानरर्षभाः ।।
data.es: 'O bulls among monkeys swans blessed with strength, vigour, beauty and youth move in the sixth region. Beyond, on the seventh plane, you will see the descendants of Garuda.
data.anv: वानरर्षभाः O bulls among monkeys बलवीर्योपपन्नानाम् endowed with strength and vigour, रूपयौवनशालिनाम् with beauty and youth, हंसानाम् of swans, षष्ठः the sixth, पन्थाः path, वैनतेयगतिः the path of Garuda, परा is over that, सर्वेषाम् of all, नः of us, जन्म birth, वैनतेयात् from the son of Vinata (Garuda).

data.v: गर्हितं तु कृतं कर्म येन स्म पिशिताशनाः । इहस्थोऽहं प्रपश्यामि रावणं जानकीं तथा ।।
data.anv: येन by whomsoever, गर्हितम् despised, कर्म action, कृतम् done, तस्य पिशिताशिनाः by that flesheater (demon), भ्रातृकृतं due to my brother's, वैरं enmity, च and, प्रतिकार्यम् deserves retaliation, भवेत् it will be.

data.v: अस्माकमपि सौवर्णं दिव्यं चक्षुर्बलं तथा । तस्मादाहारवीर्येण निसर्गेण च वानराः । आयोजनशतात्साग्राद्वयं पश्याम नित्यशः ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys therefore, by the strength of food and by nature we can always see beyond a hundred yojanas from this edge.
data.anv: वानराः O monkeys, तस्मात् therefore, वयम् we, आहारवीर्येण with the strength of our food, निसर्गेण च and by nature, साग्रात् from the edge, आयोजनशतात् up to a hundred yojanas, नित्यशः always, पश्याम we can see.
data.md: For this reason, as well as owing to the energy consequent on our feeding on certain kinds of flesh, we, you monkeys, can see a little further than an hundred Yojanas.

data.v: अस्माकं विहिता वृत्तिर्निसार्गेण च दूरतः । विहिता पादमूले तु वृत्तिश्चरणयोधिनाम् ।।
data.es: 'Our movement and vision naturally extends to distant places. For those fighting on foot, the movement is restricted to the extent of foot movement.
data.anv: अस्माकम् for us, वृत्ति: movement, निसर्गेण by nature, दूरतः at a distance, विहिता is fixed (by destiny), चरणयोधिनाम् for those fighting on foot, पादमूले at their feet, वृत्ति: movement, विहिता is fixed.
data.md: Therefore (the Deity) has ordained such food for us as are fraught with the power of making one see from a great distance. And the abode of cocks and others being underneath trees, their sight is limited to the extent which they require to see.

data.v: उपायो दृश्यतां कश्चिल्लङ्घने लवणाम्भसः । अभिगम्य तु वैदेहीं समृद्धार्था गमिष्यथ ।।
data.es: 'Look out for some means to cross the salty ocean. You will see Vaidehi, and return, your mission accomplished.
data.anv: लवणाम्भसः of the salt ocean, लङ्घने in crossing, कश्चित् some, उपायः means, दृश्यताम् you may look for, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अभिगम्य after approaching her, समृद्धार्थाः as accomplished ones, गमिष्यथ you will return.
data.md: Do you look about for means to cross over the salt waters. Having met with Vaidehi, do you, having achieved success, come back. I wish to be taken by you to the ocean-abode of Varuna. I will offer water to (the manes of) my highsouled brother, who has gone to heaven.

data.v: समुद्रं नेतुमिच्छामि भवद्भिर्वरुणालयम् । प्रदास्याम्युदकं भ्रातुः स्वर्गतस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'Take me to the ocean, the abode of Varuna. I intend to offer oblation to my brother, a great soul who is in heaven.'
data.anv: भवद्भिः by you, वरुणालयम् abode of Varuna, समुद्रम् ocean, नेतुम् to lead, इच्छामि I intend, स्वर्गतस्य for him who is in heaven, महात्मनः of the great soul, भ्रातुः to my brother, उदकम्  oblation, प्रदास्यामि I will offer.
data.md: Do you look about for means to cross over the salt waters. Having met with Vaidehi, do you, having achieved success, come back. I wish to be taken by you to the ocean-abode of Varuna. I will offer water to (the manes of) my highsouled brother, who has gone to heaven.

data.v: ततो नीत्वा तु तं देशं तीरे नदनदीपतेः । निर्दग्धपक्षं संपातिं वानराः सुमहौजसः ।।
data.es: Th mightiest of monkeys carried Sampati, whose wings were totally burnt, to the sea shore and after he had offered oblations took him back to the same place.
