data.v: ततस्तदमृतास्वादं गृध्रराजेन भाषितम् । निशम्य वदतो हृष्टास्ते वचः प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
data.es: The mighty monkeys were delighted to hear the nectarlike words of the king of vultures.
data.anv: ततः then, अमृतास्वादम् tasting nectar, गृध्रराजेन by the king of vultures, भाषितम् spoken, तत् वचः those words, निशम्य on listening, ते they, प्लवगर्षभाः mighty monkeys, मुदिताः delighted, हृष्टाः pleased.
data.md: Then hearing that ambrosial speech of the vulture-king, the monkey-chiefs, being delighted, kept on parleying (on that topic).

data.v: जाम्बवान्वै हरिश्रेष्ठः सह सर्वैः प्लवंगमैः । भूतलात्सहसोत्थाय गृध्रराजानमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Jambavan the king of bears got up at once from the ground along with the monkeys and spoke to the king of vultures:
data.anv: वानरश्रेष्ठः king of bears, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, सर्वैः by all, प्लवङ्गमैः सह with all monkeys, सहसा at once, भूतलात् from the ground, उत्थाय  got up, गृध्रराजानम् to the king of vultures, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then Jāmbavān-foremost of monkeystogether with all the monkeys, arising suddenly from the ground, spoke to the vulture-king, saying,

data.v: क्व सीता केन वा दृष्टा को वा हरति मैथिलीम् । तदाख्यातु भवान्सर्वं गतिर्भव वनौकसाम् ।।
data.es: 'Where is Sita now? By whom else was she seen while being carried? Pray, tell us everything. You are the ultimate saviour of monkeys.
data.anv: सीता Sita, क्व where is she, केन वा by whom, दृष्टा was seen, मैथिलीम् to the princess from Mithila, को वा who did, हरति was carrying, भवान् you, तत् सर्वम् everything about that, आख्यातु tell, वनौकसाम् to the monkeys, गतिः ultimate saviour, भव you are.
data.md: Where is Sītā? By whom has she been seen? And who has carried away Mithila's daughter? Do you tell us all about this, and (thus) prove the path of these rangers of the woods.

data.v: को दाशरथिबाणानां वज्रवेगनिपातिनाम् । स्वयं लक्ष्मणमुक्तानां न चिन्तयति विक्रमम् ।।
data.es: 'Who is not aware of Rama's swift arrows which are like thunderbolt? Who is not able to assess the speed and power of arrows of Lakshmana released directly?'
data.anv: वज्रवेगनिपातिनाम् of those falling as swiftly as thunderbolt, दाशरथिबाणानाम् of Rama's arrows, स्वयम् directly, लक्ष्मणमुक्तानाम् released by Lakshmana, विक्रमम् power, कः who, न चिन्तयति is not taking seriously.
data.md: Who is there that does not take heed of the force of Dasarathi's* and Laksmana's arrows, speeding with the vehemence of thunder? *Lit. Dasaratha's son. The term is applied in especial to Rāma.

data.v: स हरीन्प्रीतिसंयुक्तान्सीता श्रुतिसमाहितान् । पुनराश्वासयन्प्रीत इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।

data.v: श्रूयतामिह वैदेह्या यथा मे हरणं श्रुतम् । येन चापि ममाख्यातं यत्र चायतलोचना ।।
data.es: 'Now hear by whom I was informed about the abduction of the largeeyed princess from Videha and where she is at present.
data.anv: वैदेह्या: of the princess from Videha, हरणम् abduction, मे by me, यथा as, श्रुतम् heard, येन च and by whom, मम  to me, आख्यातम् was informed, आयतलोचना largeeyed lady, यत्र च and where, इह now, श्रूयताम् you hear.
data.md: Listen as to how I came to know of the ravishment of Vaidehī, Sītā, at this place; and who it was that told me where that one of expansive eyes is.

data.v: अहमस्मिन्गिरौ दुर्गे बहुयोजनमायते । चिरान्निपतितो वृद्धः क्षीणप्राणपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: 'With my vitality and prowess depleted, I have been staying for a long time on this mountain, extended by several yojanas and inaccessible.
data.anv: बहुयोजनम् several yojanas, आयते wide, दुर्गे in this inaccessible place, अस्मिन् गिरौ on this mountain, चिरात् for a long time, निपतितः fallen, अहम् I am, वृद्धः old, क्षीणप्राणपराक्रमः with my vitality and prowess depleted.
data.md: For a long time I lay here, old, and of feeble life and energy. that best of birds, my son named Supārswa, coming to me, at the proper hour maintained me with food.

data.v: तं मामेवंगतं पुत्रः सुपार्श्वो नाम नामतः । आहारेण यथाकालं बिभर्ति पततां वरः ।।
data.es: 'Reduced to this state, I have been maintained by food given in time by my son named Suparshva, best among birds.
data.anv: एवं गतम् Reduced to this state, तम् him, माम् me, पतताम् among birds, वरः best among, नामतः named, सुपार्श्वो नाम Suparshva, पुत्रः son, यथाकालम् in time, आहारेण with food, बिभर्ति maintains.
data.md: For a long time I lay here, old, and of feeble life and energy. that best of birds, my son named Supārswa, coming to me, at the proper hour maintained me with food.

data.v: तीक्ष्णकामास्तु गन्धर्वास्तीक्ष्णकोपा भुजंगमाः । मृगाणां तु भयं तीक्ष्णं ततस्तीक्ष्णक्षुधा वयम् ।।
data.es: 'Gandharvas have intense passion. Serpents show violent anger. Deer have great fear. And we vultures have great hunger.
data.anv: गन्धर्वाः gandharvas, तीक्ष्णकामाः with intense passion, भुजङ्गमाः serpents, तीक्ष्णकोपाः with violent anger, मृगाणाम् for the deer, भयम् fear, तीक्ष्णम् is intense, ततः then, वयम् we, तीक्ष्णक्षुधा: have intense hunger.
data.md: Gandharvas exceedingly lascivious; serpents are exceedingly wrathful; fear is excessive in deer; and we have excessive hunger.

data.v: स कदाचित्क्षुधार्तस्य मम चाहारकाङ्क्षिणः । गतसूर्योऽहनि प्राप्तो मम पुत्रो ह्यनामिषः ।।
data.es: 'Once my son came to me without meat after sunset while I was feeling hungry for food.
data.anv: कदाचित् once, मम पुत्रः my son, सः he, आहाराभिकाङ्क्षिणः with intense longing for food, मम myself, क्षुधार्तस्य for me so hungry, अहनि day, गतसूर्ये after sun set, अनामिषः without meat, प्राप्तः came.
data.md: Once on a time my son, going forth about sunrise to procure food for me who was suffering from hunger and (accordingly) eager for it, came back in the evening without any flesh. are

data.v: स मया वृद्धभावाच्च कोपाच्च परिभर्त्सितः । क्षुत्पिपासा परीतेन कुमारः पततां वरः ।।
स ममाहारसंरोधात्पीडितः प्रीतिवर्धनः । अनुमान्य यथातत्त्वमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: 'I was thinking, tormented with hunger, my son who always keeps me happy told me exactly what had happened:
data.anv: आहारसंरोधात् with no food, माम् me, पीडितं I was tormented, सः he, प्रीतिवर्धनः  who makes me happy, अनुमान्य suspected, यथातत्त्वम् what had truly happened, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hurt (by my speech uttered) in consequence of my non-receipt of food, that enhancer of my joy, asking my forgiveness, said these words fraught with fact,

data.v: अहं तात यथाकालमामिषार्थी खमाप्लुतः । महेन्द्रस्य गिरेर्द्वारमावृत्य च समास्थितः ।।
data.es: 'O dear father I went to get food at the right time and stood blocking the entrance of mount Mahendra.
data.anv: तात O father, अहम् I, आमिषार्थी intending to get food, यथाकालम् at the right time, महेन्द्रस्य गिरेः of Mahendra mountain, द्वारम् at the entrance, आवृत्य covering, सुसमास्थितः I was stationed.
data.md: 'Father, taking to my wings at the proper time for procuring flesh, I (went) and stood, obstructing the pass of the Mahendra mountain.

data.v: तत्र सत्त्वसहस्राणां सागरान्तरचारिणाम् । पन्थानमेकोऽध्यवसं संनिरोद्धुमवाङ्मुखः ।।
data.es: 'There I stood alone looking down, obstructing the path of thousands of creatures inhabiting the ocean.
data.anv: तत्र there, सागरान्तचारिणाम्  by the inhabitants of the ocean, सत्त्वसहस्राणाम् of thousands of creatures, पन्थानम् path, सन्निरोद्धुम् obstructing the path, एकः I alone, अवाङ्मुखः looking downwards, अध्यवसम् stood.
data.md: There stood I looking down, obstructing the way of thousands of creatures ranging the sea.

data.v: तत्र कश्चिन्मया दृष्टः सूर्योदयसमप्रभाम् । स्त्रियमादाय गच्छन्वै भिन्नाञ्जनचयोपमः ।।
data.es: 'I saw a person who was dark and huge like a mass of collyrium carrying a lady whose radiance was like the rising Sun.
data.anv: सूर्योदयसमप्रभाम् a lady like the radiance of the rising Sun, स्त्रियम् lady, आदाय carrying, गच्छन् was going, भिन्नाञ्जनचयप्रभः dark and huge like a mass of collyrium, कश्चित् some one, मया by me, तत्र there, दृष्टः was seen.
data.md: There I saw somebody resembling a mass of crushed collyrium, going away, taking a female resembling the rising sun in splendour.

data.v: सोऽहमभ्यवहारार्थी तौ दृष्ट्वा कृतनिश्चयः । तेन साम्ना विनीतेन पन्थानमभियाचितः ।।
data.es: 'Since I was looking for food I resolved to seize both of them. (But) he asked me in a gentle and courteous manner to make way (since I was blocking the aerial path).
data.anv: तौ both, दृष्ट्वा seeing, अभ्यवहारार्थी looking for food, कृतनिश्चयः resolved, विनीतेन politely, तेन by him, साम्ना in a courteous manner, पन्थानम् path, अनुयाचितः requested.
data.md: Seeing them I had made up my mind that they should serve for your fare, when he humbly in a pacific manner begged for way.

data.v: न हि सामोपपन्नानां प्रहर्ता विद्यते क्वचित् । नीचेष्वपि जनः कश्चित्किमङ्ग बत मद्विधः ।।
data.es: 'Who will strike polite people? Even the mean do not do it anywhere. And what to speak of me.
data.anv: सामोपपन्नानाम् for polite people, प्रहर्ता who strikes, जनः people, नीचेष्वपि even among the mean, कश्चित् any one, क्वचित् at any place, न हि not do, मद्विधः one like me, किमङ्ग not to say, बत indeed.
data.md: Even among the mean, there is none on earth that can slay people who assume a mild attitude. What shall I say, alas! of superior ones like myself?

data.v: स यातस्तेजसा व्योम संक्षिपन्निव वेगतः । अथाहं खे चरैर्भूतैरभिगम्य सभाजितः ।।
data.es: 'He flew hurriedly with splendour as though he was enveloping the sky (making it small). All the flying creatures in the sky came and greeted me with respect.
data.anv: सः he, वेगत: hurriedily, तेजसा with splendour, व्योम the sky, सङ्क्षिपन्निव as if he was enveloping, यातः he proceeded, अथ now, अहम् I, खेचरैः by the flying creatures  in the sky, भूतैः by creatures, अभिगम्य approached, सभाजितः respected me
data.md: And summoning celerity, he went on as if pushing off the sky by his energy. Then the rangers of the air and other beings worshipped me.

data.v: दिष्ट्या जीवसि तातेति अब्रुवन्मां महर्षयः । कथंचित्सकलत्रोऽसौ गतस्ते स्वस्त्यसंशयम् ।।
data.es: 'I heard the great sages saying, 'O dear you are lucky to be saved. He has somehow gone from here with that lady (without hurting you). Undoubtedly you are lucky.'
data.anv: तात O dear child, दिष्ट्या lucky, जीवसि you are, असौ he, सकलत्रः with a lady, कथञ्चित्  some how, गतः went, ते to you, असंशयम् no doubt, स्वस्ति be it safe, इति thus, महर्षयः the great sages, माम् me, अब्रुवन् saying.
data.md: And the Maharsis said to me,-By luck it is that Sītā is still living' — he together with a female, having passed by you, certainly augurs good fortune to you. 1. The commentator supplies the elipsis thus,-Coming within your ken by fuck, Sītā is living. 2. The passage is obscure. The commentator has glossed over this sloka, and the meaning is lone the clear for his explanation.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्ततोऽहं तैः सिद्धैः परमशोभनैः । स च मे रावणो राजा रक्षसां प्रतिवेदितः ।।
data.md: Then those eminently handsome Siddhas spoke thus to me.-This is Ravana, the king of the Rākşasas, said they to me.

data.v: हरन्दाशरथेर्भार्यां रामस्य जनकात्मजाम् । भ्रष्टाभरणकौशेयां शोकवेगपराजिताम् ।।
data.anv: ततः then, अहम् I, परमशोभनैः by the glorious, सिद्धैः by siddhas, एवम् that way, दाशरथेः of the son of Dasaratha, रामस्य Rama's, भार्याम् wife, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, भ्रष्टाभरणकौशेयाम् ornaments dropped and silken robe slipping, शोकवेगपराजिताम् overcome with the force of grief, रामलक्ष्मणयोः of Rama and Lakshmana, नाम name, क्रोशन्तीम् while she cried,  मुक्तमूर्धजाम् hair dishevelled, हरन् while abducting, सः he, रक्षासाम् राजा king of demons, रावणः Ravana, प्रतिवेदितः came to be known.

data.v: रामलक्ष्मणयोर्नाम क्रोशन्तीं मुक्तमूर्धजाम् । एष कालात्ययस्तावदिति वाक्यविदां वरः ।।
एतमर्थं समग्रं मे सुपार्श्वः प्रत्यवेदयत् । तच्छ्रुत्वापि हि मे बुद्धिर्नासीत्काचित्पराक्रमे ।।
अपक्षो हि कथं पक्षी कर्म किंचिदुपक्रमेत् । यत्तु शक्यं मया कर्तुं वाग्बुद्धिगुणवर्तिना ।।
data.md: How can a bird bereft of wings, undertake any thing? But listen! I will tell you as to what I am capable of through speech, intellect and merit, and what you can exèrt your manliness in.

data.v: श्रूयतां तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि भवतां पौरुषाश्रयम् । वाङ्मतिभ्यां हि सार्वेषां करिष्यामि प्रियं हि वः । यद्धि दाशरथेः कार्यं मम तन्नात्र संशयः ।।
data.es: 'I will please you with my word and thought and do not doubt that Rama's task is dear to me as well.
data.anv: सर्वेषाम् for all of you, वः to you, वाङ्मतिभ्याम् by word and thought, प्रियम् dear to you, करिष्यामि I will do, यत् हि whatever, दाशरथेः to Dasarathi, कार्यम् is the task, तत् that, मम to me, अत्र there, संशयः doubt, न not.
data.md: I will do what is agreeable to you by my words and my and my intention. That which is Dasarathi's work is also mine. Of this there is no doubt.

data.v: ते भवन्तो मतिश्रेष्ठा बलवन्तो मनस्विनः । सहिताः कपिराजेन देवैरपि दुरासदाः ।।
data.es: 'Indeed, you monkeys are very wise, strong and sensitive. The king of monkeys has sent you on this mission. You cannot be conquered even by gods.
data.anv: ते those of you, मतिश्रेष्ठाः very wise, मनस्विनः sensitive , बलवन्त: strong, देवैरपि even by gods, दुरासदाः unapproachable, भवन्तः you are, कपिराजेन by king of monkeys, प्रेषिताः sent.
data.md: You, foremost in intelligence, strong, intellectual, and incapable of being overcome by the gods themselves, have been despatched by the monarch of monkeys.

data.v: रामलक्ष्मणबाणाश्च निशिताः कङ्कपत्रिणः । त्रयाणामपि लोकानां पर्याप्तास्त्राणनिग्रहे ।।
data.es: 'The heronfeathered arrows of Rama and Lakshmana are sharp and strong enough to protect or subdue all the three worlds.
data.anv: कङ्कपत्रिणः heronfeathered, निशिताः sharp, रामलक्ष्मणबाणाश्च are the arrows of Rama and Lakshmana, त्रयाणाम् all the three, लोकानाम् of worlds, त्राणनिग्रहे to protect or subdue, पर्याप्ताः are enough.
data.md: Rama's and Laksmana's shafts furnished with the feathers of the Kanka, are competent to afflict or save the three worlds.

data.v: कामं खलु दशग्रीवस्तेजोबलसमन्वितः । भवतां तु समर्थानां न किंचिदपि दुष्करम् ।।
data.es: 'The tenheaded Ravana is mighty, powerful and strong, indeed. But you are efficient and it will not be difficult for you to achieve this task.
data.anv: दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, तेजोबलसमन्वितः खलु कामम् is mighty, powerful and strong, तु but, समर्थानाम् for the efficient ones, भवताम् for you, दुष्करम् difficult, किञ्चिदपि even a little, न not.
data.md: And although the Ten-necked one is endowed with strength and energy, yet to you who are competent, nothing is hard to accomplish.

data.v: तदलं कालसंगेन क्रियतां बुद्धिनिश्चयः । न हि कर्मसु सज्जन्ते बुद्धिमन्तो भवद्विधाः ।।
data.es: 'Do not bother about the time limit. Resolve to achieve the objective, for wise people like you should not lag behind in accepting challenges.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तत् then, कालसङ्गेन by complying to the time limit (set by Sugriva), अलम् enough, बुद्धिनिश्चयः resolute, क्रियताम् may be made, भवद्विधाः persons like you, बुद्धिमन्तः wise people, कर्मसु in accepting challenges, न सज्जन्ते हि not lag behind.
data.md: There is no need of delay. Make up 'yo minds. Persons like you do not give way to laziness in enterprise.

data.v: ततः कृतोदकं स्नातं तं गृध्रं हरियूथपाः । उपविष्टा गिरौ दुर्गे परिवार्य समन्ततः ।।
data.es: Sampati bathed and offered libations to Jatayu. Then all the monkeys sat round him on the beautiful mountain.
data.anv: ततः then, हरियूथपाः leaders among the monkeys, कृतोदकम् offered libations, स्नातम् bathed, तं गृध्रम् that vulture Sampati, समन्ततः all of them together, परिवार्य surrounding him, रम्ये delightful, गिरौ on mountain, उपविष्टाः sat down.
data.md: When the vulture had offered oblations of water to the manes of his deceased brother and finished his ablutions, the monkey-chiefs sat down in that charming mountain, surrounding him.

data.v: तमङ्गदमुपासीनं तैः सर्वैर्हरिभिर्वृतम् । जनितप्रत्ययो हर्षात्संपातिः पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Angada sat near Sampati surrounded by all monkeys. Sampati who had gained confidence spoke to Angada once again joyously.
data.anv: तैः by those, सर्वैः by all, हरिभिः by monkeys, वृतम् surrounded, उपासीनम् seated, तम् अङ्गदम् to that Angada, जनितप्रत्ययः gained confidence, सम्पातिः Sampati, हर्षात् out of by, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् addressed.
data.md: And inspired with confidence in the words of the Nisakara), Sampati, from delight, said to Angada, who was seated, surrounded by all the monkeys.'

data.v: कृत्वा निःशब्दमेकाग्राः शृण्वन्तु हरयो मम । तत्त्वं संकीर्तयिष्यामि यथा जानामि मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys I shall tell you in detail how I came to know the princess from Mithila. Listen quietly with rapt attention:
data.anv: हरयः O monkeys, मैथिलीम् princess from Mithila, यथा as, जानामि I know, तत्वम् the truth, सङ्कीर्तयिष्यामि I shall describe, निश्शब्दम् कृत्वा remaining silently, एकाग्राः rapt attention, मम to me, श्रुण्वन्तु listen.
data.md: Remaining silent, do you, you monkeys, heedfully hear what I say. I will tell you truly how I came to know Maithili.

data.v: अस्य विन्ध्यस्य शिखरे पतितोऽस्मि पुरा वने । सूर्यातपपरीताङ्गो निर्दग्धः सूर्यरश्मिभिः ।।
data.es: Scorched by the rays of the Sun, I was burnt totally and fell on the peak of this mount Vindhya years ago.
data.anv: पुरा years ago, सूर्यरश्मिभिः by Sun's rays, निर्दग्धः scorched, सूर्यतापपरीताङ्गः limbs burnt by the heat of Sun, अस्य of this, विन्ध्यस्य  Vindhya's, शिखरे on the peak, पतितः अस्मि I fell.
data.md: My body being affected by solar heat, and my wings burnt by the rays of the sun, O sinless one, I formerly fell to this summit of Vindhya.

data.v: लब्धसंज्ञस्तु षड्रात्राद्विवशो विह्वलन्निव । वीक्षमाणो दिशः सर्वा नाभिजानामि किंचन ।।
data.anv: षड्रात्रात् after six nights, लब्धसंज्ञः with consciousness restored, विवश  pale, विह्वलन्निव perturbed, सर्वाः all, दिशः quarters, वीक्षमाणः while looking at, किञ्चन even a little, नाभिजानामि I could not recognise anything.
data.md: On regaining my senses after six nights, during which I was insensible, I looked around in bewilderment, but could not recognise anything whatever.

data.v: ततस्तु सागराञ्शैलान्नदीः सर्वाः सरांसि च । वनान्यटविदेशांश्च समीक्ष्य मतिरागमत् ।।
data.es: 'Then I looked at the oceans, the mountains, rivers, lakes, forests and all locations and my memory returned gradually.
data.anv: ततः then, सागरान् the seas, शैलान् mountain, सर्वाः नदीः all rivers, सरांसि च and lakes, वनानि च and forests, प्रदेशांश्च and all locations, नीरीक्ष्य after observing, मतिः mind, आगता realised.
data.md: Then closely viewing oceans and mountains, rivers and tanks, and woods and countries, my thoughts came back to me.

data.v: हृष्टपक्षिगणाकीर्णः कन्दरान्तरकूटवान् । दक्षिणस्योदधेस्तीरे विन्ध्योऽयमिति निश्चितः ।।
data.es: 'I came to know then that this place is inhabited by flocks of happy birds and full of many caves and mountain peaks. This is mount Vindhya on the shore of the southern ocean.
data.anv: हृष्टपक्षिगणाकीर्णः inhabited by flocks of  happy birds, कन्दरान्तरकूटवान् filled with caves and mountains, अयम् this, दक्षिणस्य southern side, उदधेः ocean's, तीरे on the shore, विन्ध्य Vindhya, इति this is, निश्चितः for sure.
data.md: Seeing this place abounding in cheerful birds, containing woods and crested with summits, I for certain concluded it to be Vindhya on the shores of the Southern sea.

data.v: आसीच्चात्राश्रमं पुण्यं सुरैरपि सुपूजितम् । ऋषिर्निशाकरो नाम यस्मिन्नुग्रतपाभवत् ।।
data.es: 'There was a hermitage nearby, where a revered sage, who was even worshpped by gods lived. His name was Nishakara. He did rigorous penance here.
data.anv: अत्र there, सुरैरपि even by Gods, सुपूजितम् worshipped with reverence, आश्रमम् hermitage, आसीत् was situated, यस्मिन् in it, निशाकरो नाम called Nisakara, उग्रतपाः performed rigorous penance, ऋषिः sage, अभवत् lived.
data.md: And here lay a sacred asylum, honoured even by the celestials, and here dwelt a saint named Niśākara, of fierce austerities.

data.v: अष्टौ वर्षसहस्राणि तेनास्मिन्नृषिणा विना । वसतो मम धर्मज्ञाः स्वर्गते तु निशाकरे ।।
data.es: 'O righteous monkeys after the death of sage Nishakara eight thousand years have passed. And I have been living here.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञाः O knowers of dharma, निशाकरे when Nishakara, स्वर्गते after he reached the heaven, तेन by him, ऋषिणा विना devoid of sage, अस्मिन् that, वसतः for me while dwelling, मम for me, अष्टौ eight, वर्षसहस्राणि thousand years.
data.md: After Niśākara cognizant of virtue had gone to heaven, I bereft of that saint, passed eight thousand years in this mountain.

data.v: अवतीर्य च विन्ध्याग्रात्कृच्छ्रेण विषमाच्छनैः । तीक्ष्णदर्भां वसुमतीं दुःखेन पुनरागतः ।।
data.es: 'I descended down slowly from the high rugged peak of the Vindhya mountain with great difficulty to the plain land bristling with sharp, harsh darbha grass.
data.anv: विषमात् from the craggy rugged place, विन्ध्याग्रात् from the peak of Vindhya mountain, शनैः slowly, कृच्छ्रेण with great difficulty, अवतीर्य having descended, तीक्ष्णदर्भाम् a place with sharp rough darbha grass, वसुमतीम् to the land, दुःखेन with difficulty, पुनः again, आगतः came.
data.md: Descending with difficulty from the uneven top of Vindhya, I again came* to the earth covered with sharp-pointed grass. *While the saint was staying here.

data.v: तमृषिं द्रष्टु कामोऽस्मि दुःखेनाभ्यागतो भृशम् । जटायुषा मया चैव बहुशोऽभिगतो हि सः ।।
data.es: 'Eager to see the great sage I reached the place with much difficulty. I and my brother Jatayu had approached him many a time earlier.
data.anv: भृशम् intense, दुःखेन with utmost difficulty, अभ्यागतः approached, तम् ऋषिम् that sage, द्रष्टुकामः eager to see, अस्मि I am, सः he, जटायुषा with Jatayu, मयाचैव along with me, बहुशः in many ways, अभिगतो हि both visited him.
data.md: I was eager to see the saint; and (therefore), with much ado I came to him; and Jatāyu and myself saw that saint many a time and oft.

data.v: तस्याश्रमपदाभ्याशे ववुर्वाताः सुगन्धिनः । वृक्षो नापुष्पितः कश्चिदफलो वा न दृश्यते ।।
data.es: 'In the vicinity of that hermitage there was no tree without flowers or fruits and fragrant was the breeze that blew around.
data.anv: तस्य of that, आश्रमपदाभ्याशे in the vicinity of that hermitage, सुगन्धिनः fragrant, वाताः breeze, ववुः blew, अपुष्पितः without flowers, वृक्षः trees, कश्चित् any one, न विद्यते not seen, अफलो वा without fruits, न not.
data.md: A fragrant breeze blew about the hermitage; and no tree was found that did not bear flowers and fruits.

data.v: उपेत्य चाश्रमं पुण्यं वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रितः । द्रष्टुकामः प्रतीक्षे च भगवन्तं निशाकरम् ।।
data.es: 'On reaching the sacred hermitage, I stood and waited under a tree for the audience of the divine sage Nishakara.
data.anv: पुण्यम् sacred, आश्रमम् hermitage, उपेत्य reaching, वृक्षमूलम् under a tree, उपाश्रितः I rested, भगवन्तम् divine sage, निशाकरम् Nishakara, द्रुष्टुकामः desiring to see, प्रतीक्षेऽहम् I awaited.
data.md: Approaching the holy asylum, I, desirous of beholding the worshipful Niśākara, waited at the foot of a tree.

data.v: अथापश्यमदूरस्थमृषिं ज्वलिततेजसं । कृताभिषेकं दुर्धर्षमुपावृत्तमुदङ्मुखम् ।।
data.anv: अथ then, कृताभिषेकम् after having ritual bath, उपावृत्तम् returned towards, दुर्धर्षम् unassailable, उदङ्मुखम् facing towards north, ज्वलिततेजसम् shining with brilliance (of ascetic power), अदूरस्थम् near by, ऋषिम् sage, अपश्यम् I saw.
data.md: Then at a distance I saw the saint, flaming in energy and irrepressible,-returning northwards.

data.v: तमृक्षाः सृमरा व्याघ्राः सिंहा नागाः सरीसृपाः । परिवार्योपगच्छन्ति दातारं प्राणिनो यथा ।।
data.es: 'He was followed by bears, deer, tigers, lions, elephants and snakes just as living beings follow their creator.
data.anv: प्राणिनः living creatures, धातारं यथा like the creator, तम् him, परिवार्य circling around, ऋक्षाः bears, सृमराः deer, व्याघ्राः tigers, सिंहाः lions, नागास्सरीसृपाः elephants and snakes, उपगच्छन्ति were following.
data.md: As creatures gather round a giver, bears and Srimaras, tigers lions, and various reptiles, were going along, surrounding him.

data.v: ततः प्राप्तमृषिं ज्ञात्वा तानि सत्त्वानि वै ययुः । प्रविष्टे राजनि यथा सर्वं सामात्यकं बलम् ।।
data.es: 'Just as the army including feudatories recede, when the king comes, all those creatures repaired to their dens when they knew the arrival of the sage at the hermitage.
data.anv: राजनि when the king, प्रविष्टे enters, सर्वम् all, सामात्यकम् including the feudatories, बलम्  army, यथा like, ऋषिम् that sage, प्राप्तम् when he came, ज्ञात्वा knowing, ततः then, तानि all those, सत्त्वानि creatures, ययुः went.
data.md: And knowing that the saint had arrived (at his home), the animals went away, as go away forces together with counsellors, when the sovereign has entered (his palace).

data.v: ऋषिस्तु दृष्ट्वा मां तुष्टः प्रविष्टश्चाश्रमं पुनः । मुहूर्तमात्रान्निष्क्रम्य ततः कार्यमपृच्छत ।।
data.es: The sage who entered the hermitage came out again within a moment on seeing me and enquired about me affectionately:
data.anv: ऋषिस्तु sage also, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, प्रीतः pleased, आश्रमम् to the hermitage, प्रविष्टः entered, ततः then, मुहूर्तमात्रात् for a moment, पुनः again, निष्क्रम्य after coming out, कार्यम् the task, अपृच्छत enquired.
data.md: The saint was glad on seeing me. Then reentering his asylum for a short space, he came out and enquired for my mission.

data.v: सौम्य वैकल्यतां दृष्ट्वा रोंणां ते नावगम्यते । अग्निदग्धाविमौ पक्षौ त्वक्चैव व्रणिता तव ।।
data.es: 'O gentle one seeing your body devoid of hair I can understood that your wings have been burnt and your body bruised.
data.anv: सौम्य O gentle one, ते your, रोम्णाम् of the hair, वैकल्यताम् being devoid of, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, नावगम्यते it is understood, इमौ these two, पक्षौ two wings, अग्निदग्धौ both burnt by fire, व्रणाश्चापि wounded, शरीरके all over the body.
data.md: O mild one, in consequence of your feathers having undergone alteration, I cannot recognise you. Your two wings have been blasted by fire; and your powers in your frail frame are in the same condition).

data.v: द्वौ गृध्रौ दृष्टपूर्वौ मे मातरिश्वसमौ जवे । गृध्राणां चैव राजानौ भ्रातरौ कामरूपिणौ ।।
data.es: 'You are the king among vultures equal to wind in speed.I had seen both the brothers earlier and both of you could change your form at will.
data.anv: गृध्राणाम् among vultures, राजानौ you both are kings, जवे in speed, मातरिश्वसमौ equal to wind, कामरूपिणौ both can change to any form at will, भ्रातरौ brothers, द्वौ two, गृध्रौ two vultures, मे for me, दृष्टपूर्वौ seen earlier.
data.md: After time I saw two vultures like to wind in speed,-kings of vultures, brothers, wearing shapes at will.

data.v: ज्येष्ठस्त्वं तु च संपातिर्जटायुरनुजस्तव । मानुषं रूपमास्थाय गृह्णीतां चरणौ मम ।।
data.anv: सम्पाते O Sampati, त्वम् you, ज्येष्ठो हि  the elder, जटायु Jatayu, तव your, अनुजः younger brother, मानुषम् human, रूपम् form, आस्थाय assuming, मम my, चरणौ feet, गृह्णीताम् touch my feet.
data.md: You are I know, elder, O Sampati; and Jatayu is younger to you. Assuming human forms, you had taken hold of my feet.

data.v: किं ते व्याधिसमुत्थानं पक्षयोः पतनं कथम् । दण्डो वायं धृतः केन सर्वमाख्याहि पृच्छतः ।।
data.es: 'What disease has affected you? Why are your wings dropped down? Who punished you in this way? Tell me.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ते to you, व्याधिसमुत्थानं किम् what disease affected you, पक्षयोः to both your wings, पतनम् dropping down, कथम् how come, केन by whom, अयम् this, दण्डः punishment, कृतः is given, पृच्छतः for the enquiry, सर्वम् all about, आख्याहि you may tell me.
data.md: Now, what ailment has attacked you? And why have your plumes fallen off? And who has dealt this punishment to you? Do you tell all this to me, who am asking you.

data.v: ततस्तद्दारुणं कर्म दुष्करं साहसात्कृतम् । आचचक्षे मुनेः सर्वं सूर्यानुगमनं तथा ।।
data.es: 'Then I revealed everything to the sage,including the arrogant, impetuous action of rashly following the Sun (for challenging Indra).
data.anv: ततः then, सहसा rashly, कृतम् done, दुष्करम् impetuous, दारुणम् arrogant, तत् कर्म that deed, तदा then, सूर्यानुगमनम् following the Sun, सर्वम् everything, मुनेः to the sage, आचचक्षे I revealed.
data.md: Thereat Sampāti related to the ascetic all about his fearful, arduous, and rash act of following up the sun.

data.v: भगवन्व्रणयुक्तत्वाल्लज्जया चाकुलेन्द्रियः । परिश्रान्तो न शक्नोमि वचनं परिभाषितुम् ।।
data.es: 'O revered sage I am exhausted and my senses are depressed. I am ashamed of myself. My body is wounded. Therefore I am not able to reply.
data.anv: भगवन् O revered sage, व्रणयुक्तत्वात् body being wounded, लज्जया च due to shame, व्याकुलेन्द्रियः with senses disturbed, परिश्रान्तः exhausted, वचनम् these words, परिभाषितुम् to express, न शक्नोमि I am not able to do.
data.md: O reverend sire, in consequence of my body suffering from sores, I, my senses bewildered from shame, and myself fatigued, cannot utter words.

data.v: अहं चैव जटायुश्च संघर्षाद्दर्पमोहितौ । आकाशं पतितौ वीरौ जिघासन्तौ पराक्रमम् ।।
data.es: 'Deluded by pride, I and my brother Jatayu challenging each other to test our relative strength flew far into the sky.
data.anv: अहं चैव I also, जटायुश्च Jatayu also, दर्पमोहितौ deluded by pride, पराक्रमम् valour, वीरौ two heroes, जिज्ञासन्तौ with the intention of knowing, सङ्घर्षात् challenging each other, दूरात् from far, आकाशम् sky, पतितौ we flew.

data.v: कैलासशिखरे बद्ध्वा मुनीनामग्रतः पणम् । रविः स्यादनुयातव्यो यावदस्तं महागिरिम् ।।
data.es: 'Both of us made a bet on the peak of mount Kailasa in the presence of sages to follow the Sungod until he sets on the western mountain.
data.anv: कैलासशिखरे on the peak of Kailasa, मुनीनाम् of sages, अग्रतः in their presence, महागिरिम्  great mountain, अस्तं यावत् till the setting, रविः Sun, अनुयातव्यः follow, स्यात् be, पणम् bet, बद्ध्वा made.
data.md: From pride for power of flight, I and Jatayu, being intoxicated by conceit, began to voyage the sky afar off, with the view of testing each other's prowess, binding ourselves by the vow that we would follow the Sun so long as he did not enter that mighty Setting mountain,-and appear before the ascetics on the summit of Kailāsa.

data.v: अथावां युगपत्प्राप्तावपश्याव महीतले । रथचक्रप्रमाणानि नगराणि पृथक्पृथक् ।।
data.anv: अथ and then, आवाम् both of us, युगपत् simultaneously, प्राप्तौ both reaching, महीतले on the land, रथचक्रप्रमाणानि the size of chariot wheels, नगराणि cities, पृथक् पृथक् one after another, अपश्याव we both saw.

data.v: क्वचिद्वादित्रघोषांश्च ब्रह्मघोषांश्च शुश्रुव । गायन्तीश्चाङ्गना बह्वीः पश्यावो रक्तवाससः ।।
data.es: 'We heard at some places sounds of musical instruments, sounds of Vedic chanting, and many lovely young women dressed in redsinging.
data.anv: क्वचित् at some places, वादित्रघोषांश्च sounds of musical instruments, ब्रह्मघोषांश्च sounds of Vedic chanting, शुश्रुवः we heard, गायन्ती: ladies singing, रक्तवासस: clothed in red  garments, बह्वीः many, अङ्गनाः women, पश्यावः we both saw.

data.v: तूर्णमुत्पत्य चाकाशमादित्यपथमास्थितौ । आवामालोकयावस्तद्वनं शाद्वलसंस्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'We flew quickly into the sky and reached the path of the Sun and looked down at the forest which looked like a green lawn.
data.anv: आकाशम् sky, तूर्णम् quickly, उत्पत्य flying, आदित्यपदम् Sun's path, आश्रितौ we reached, आवाम् we both, तत् वनम् that forest, शाद्वलसन्निभम् like a lawn of grass, आलोकयावः we saw.
data.md: And swiftly darting up into the sky and approaching the path of the Sun, we saw a wood interspersed with swards.

data.v: उपलैरिव संछन्ना दृश्यते भूः शिलोच्चयैः । आपगाभिश्च संवीता सूत्रैरिव वसुंधरा ।।
data.es: 'The earth filled with lofty mountains appeared as if it is covered with pebbles. Surrounded by rivers meandering, it looked as though it was entwined with threads.
data.anv: भूः land, शिलोच्चयैः with tall mountains, उपलैः with pebbles, सञ्छन्ना इव as though it is covered, दृश्यते looked, आपगाभिः by rivers, वसुन्धरा land, सूत्रैः with threads, संवीता इव as if entwined.
data.md: We saw the earth covered with crags and masses of rocks, and intersected by streams resembling threads.

data.v: हिमवांश्चैव विन्ध्यश्च मेरुश्च सुमहान्नगः । भूतले संप्रकाशन्ते नागा इव जलाशये ।।
data.es: 'The mountains of the earth, Himavan and Vindhya and the great Meru looked like huge elephants in a huge pond.
data.anv: हिमवांश्चैव even Himalaya , विन्ध्यश्च Vindhya mountain also, सुमहान्नगः towering mountains, मेरुश्च Mount Meru also, भूतले on the surface of the earth, जलाशये in a pond, नागा इव like elephants, सम्प्रकाशन्ते shining.
data.md: Himavān, and Vindhya, and that mighty mountain, Meru, appeared on the earth like elephants in a tank. Then we began to sweat, and to be filled with regret; and fear seized us both. And we became bewildered; and fainted away frightfully.* *Consequent on Jațāyu having dropped down.

data.v: तीव्रस्वेदश्च खेदश्च भयं चासीत्तदावयोः । समाविशत मोहश्च मोहान्मूर्छा च दारुणा ।।
data.es: 'Much sweat, pain and fear generated in us while we went on and up. This led to terrific confusion and stupor.
data.anv: तदा then, आवयोः for both of us, तीव्रः intense, स्वेदश्च sweat, खेदश्च pain, भयं च and fear, आसीत् made its appearance, मोहः confusion, दारुणा terrific, मूर्छा च and stupor, समाविशति led to.

data.v: न दिग्विज्ञायते याम्या नागेन्या न च वारुणी । युगान्ते नियतो लोको हतो दग्ध इवाग्निना ।।
data.es: 'I did not know which the southern direction was or the southeast or the west. It looked as if the world had been consumed by fire and dissolved, as if it was the end of the yuga.
data.anv: याम्या दिक् southern direction, न च ज्ञायते also was not known, आग्नेयी south east, न or, वारुणी west, न or, लोकः world, युगान्ते at the end of yuga, अग्निना by fire of dissolution, दग्धः burnt, हत इव consumed, नियतः set by an order.
data.md: We knew not the south, or the west, or the quarter presided over by Fire;' and the world that was still burning at the end of a Yuga, appeared (to us) as if it had been consumed quite.? 1. South-east. 2. The passage is obscure. This is however, all the explanation that the commentator has to give.

data.v: यत्नेन महता भूयो रविः समवलोकितः । तुल्यः पृथ्वीप्रमाणेन भास्करः प्रतिभाति नौ ।।
data.es: 'My mind was disturbed and I turned my attention from the object. Once again I focused my attention (on the Sun) and could see the Sungod with great effort. The Sun appeared to us equal in size to earth.
data.anv: मे my, मनः mind, हतम् disturbed, चक्षुषी eyes, संश्रयम् a resort, प्राप्य became, महता with great, यत्नेन with effort, अस्मिन् in this, मनः mind, चक्षुषी both my eyes, सन्धाय by fixing, भूयः again, महता यत्नेन with great effort, भास्करः Sun, प्रतिलोकितः was seen, भास्करः Sun, पृथ्वीप्रमाणेन with the measurement of earth, तुल्यः equal, नौ to us, प्रतिभाति appeared.

data.v: जटायुर्मामनापृच्छ्य निपपात महीं ततः । तं दृष्ट्वा तूर्णमाकाशादात्मानं मुक्तवानहम् ।।
data.es: 'Without taking leave of me Jatayu descended down to the earth. Seeing that, I also followed him down quickly from the sky.
data.anv: जटायुः Jatayu, माम् to me, अनापृच्छ्य without taking leave, महीम् to the earth, निपपात fell down, ततः then, अहम् I, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तूर्णम् quickly, आत्मानम् myself, आकाशात् from the sky, मुक्तवान् came down.

data.v: पक्षिभ्यां च मया गुप्तो जटायुर्न प्रदह्यत । प्रमादात्तत्र निर्दग्धः पतन्वायुपथादहम् ।।
data.es: 'I protected Jatayu with my wings so that he was not burnt. I, however, got burnt miserably and fell down from the aerial region.
data.anv: मया by me, पक्षाभ्याम् with wings, गुप्तः protected, जटायुः Jatayu, न प्रदह्यते was not burnt, तत्र there, प्रमादात् miserably, वायुपथात् from the path of the wind, पतन् while falling down, अहम्  I, निर्दग्धः got burnt.

data.v: आशङ्के तं निपतितं जनस्थाने जटायुषम् । अहं तु पतितो विन्ध्ये दग्धपक्षो जडीकृतः ।।
data.es: 'I thought Jatayu had fallen down somewhere at Janasthana, but I fell on Vindhya, wings burnt, in an unconscious state.
data.anv: तं जटायुषम् that Jatayu, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, निपतितम् fell down, आशङ्के I guess, अहं तु but I, दग्धपक्षः with burnt wings, जडीकृतः devoid of consciousness, विन्ध्ये on Vindhya, पतितः fell.

data.v: राज्येन हीनो भ्रात्रा च पक्षाभ्यां विक्रमेण च । सर्वथा मर्तुमेवेच्छन्पतिष्ये शिखराद्गिरेः ।।
data.es: 'Bereft of my kingdom, my brother and my wings, and having lost my strength I desire to fall down from the mountain top and die.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: राज्येन with kingdom, भ्रत्रा च and brother also, पक्षाभ्याम् my wings, विक्रमेण च and my strength, हीनः devoid, सर्वथा by all means, मर्तुमेव to die, इच्छन् while desiring, गिरेः from the mountain, शिखरात् from the peak, पतिष्ये I shall fall down.
data.md: Deprived of my kingdom, and my brother, and my wings, and my prowess, I wishing to put a period to my existence, will hurl myself headlong from this summit of the mountain.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा मुनिश्रेष्ठमरुदं दुःखितो भृशम् । अथ ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं तु भगवानिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having said this and thinking for a moment, Sugriva again said to the heroic Rama whose eyes had turned red.
data.anv: एवम् thus, उक्ता having spoken, मुनिश्रेष्ठः venerable sage, मरुदं roared, दुःखितो भृशं very sadly, अथ then, ध्यात्वा reflecting, मुर्हूतं for a moment, भगवान् divine sage, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत said.
data.md: Having said this to that foremost of ascetics, I smitten with grief, began to weep. Thereat, after, reflecting for a while, that reverend one said,

data.v: पक्षौ च ते प्रपक्षौ च पुनरन्यौ भविष्यतः । चक्षुषी चैव प्राणाश्च विक्रमश्च बलं च ते ।।
data.es: 'You will get new wings and feathers and also other parts.You will attain vision, life, prowess and strength.
data.anv: पक्षौ तु wings, ते to you, प्रपक्षौ च and feathers, पुन: again, अन्यौ and other, प्राणाश्च life also, चक्षुषी eyes, चैव also, विक्रमश्च prowess, बलं च and strength, ते to you, भविष्यतः you will attain.
data.md: Your wings together with two smaller ones shall grow again; as also your sight, energy, prowess and strength.

data.v: पुराणे सुमहत्कार्यं भविष्यं हि मया श्रुतम् । दृष्टं मे तपसा चैव श्रुत्वा च विदितं मम ।।
data.es: 'I have foreseen with the power of my penance that a great task will be done by you. I have also heard about it in the Puranas and came to know of it.
data.anv: पुराणे in the purana (history), सुमहत् very great, कार्यं task, भविष्यति will happen, मया by you, श्रुतं I heard, दृष्टं seen, मे with my, तपसा by the power of penance, चैव also, श्रुत्वाच I heard, मम me, विदितम् I came to know.
data.md: Having heard of it, and also seen it through ascetic power, I know that a great deed is going to take place.

data.v: राजा दशरथो नाम कश्चिदिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः । तस्य पुत्रो महातेजा रामो नाम भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'Indeed in the Ikshvaku family there will be a king named Dasaratha. He will beget a brilliant son named Rama.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः delight of the Ikshvaku family, दशरथो Dasaratha, नाम named, राजा king, कश्चित indeed, तस्य his, पुत्रो son, महा highly, तेजाः effulgent, रमो Rama, नाम by name, भविष्यति will beget.
data.md: There shall be a king named Daſaratha, increaser of the Ikşwāku race. He shall have a son, named Rāma, endowed with exceeding energy.

data.v: अरण्यं च सह भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणेन गमिष्यति । तस्मिन्नर्थे नियुक्तः सन्पित्रा सत्यपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: 'On account of the command of his father, Rama armed with the strength of truth will proceed to the forest with his brother Lakshmana.
data.anv: अस्मिन्नर्थे on account of, नियुक्तस्सन् assigned by, पित्रा his father, सत्यपराक्रमः strength of truth, सह भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन accompanied by Lakshmana, गमिष्यति will proceed, अरण्यं the forest.
data.md: He (Rāma) shall repair to the forest in company with his brother, Laksmana; that one having truth for prowess, having commissioned to that effect by his sire.

data.v: नैरृतो रावणो नाम तस्या भार्यां हरिष्यति । राक्षसेन्द्रो जनस्थानादवध्यः सुरदानवैः ।।
data.es: 'The king of demons, Ravana who is indestructible even by gods and demons will be abducting his wife from Janastahana.
data.anv: सुरदानवैः by gods and demons, अवध्यः indestructible, राक्षसेन्द्रो king of demons, रावणो by Ravana, नाम named, जनस्थनात् from Janasthana, नैऋतो in the southwest direction, तस्य his, भार्यां wife, हरिष्यति will be abducting.
data.md: A friend named Rāvana, the lord of Rākşasas, incapable of being slain by either the gods or the Dāvanas, shall carry off his Rāma's) spouse in Janasthāna.

data.v: सा च कामैः प्रलोभ्यन्ती भक्ष्यैर्भोज्यैश्च मैथिली । न भोक्ष्यति महाभागा दुःखमग्ना यशस्विनी ।।
data.es: 'Immersed in grief, chaste and famed Sita, will not take any food or enjoy pleasures however much she is tempted.
data.anv: महाभागा noble, यशस्विनी famed, दुःखे in sorrow, मग्ना immersed, न भोक्ष्यति will not eat, सा she, च and, कामैः pleasures, प्रलोभ्यन्ती however, भक्ष्यै: eatables, भोज्यैश्च to be enjoyed, मैथिली princess from Mithila.
data.md: And albeit tempted by viands and objects of enjoyment and desire, the famous and highly virtuous one, plunged in grief, shall not pertake of those things.

data.v: परमान्नं तु वैदेह्या ज्ञात्वा दास्यति वासवः । यदन्नममृतप्रख्यं सुराणामपि दुर्लभम् ।।
data.es: 'Knowing that Vaidehi is not eating food(given by Ravana) Indra,the ruler of gods, will offer nectarlike food rare even for gods.
data.anv: सुराणाम् of gods, वैदेह्या by Sita, दास्यति avoiding to eat, ज्ञात्वा knowing, वा to, स: he, परमान्नंतु divine food, यदन्नम् as food, अमृतप्रख्यम्  like nectar, अपिदुर्लभं that which is difficult to get.
data.md: And knowing that Videha's daughter (has been fasting for many a day), Vāsava shall offer Vaidehī pāyasa like to ambrosia, difficult of being procured even by the gods.

data.v: तदन्नं मैथिली प्राप्य विज्ञायेन्द्रादिदं त्विति । अग्रमुद्धृत्य रामाय भूतले निर्वपिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'Having understood that it has been provided by Indra, Sita will take out a large portion of it and pour it on the ground (as an offering to Rama) and say 'I offer it to Rama wherever he is on earth'.
data.anv: तदन्नं such food, मैथिली princess from Mithila, प्राप्य received, विज्ञाय having understood, अदिदंत्विति this is provided by, इन्द्रात् Indra, अग्रम् large portion, उदृत्य taken out, रामाय for Rama, भूतले on the earth, निर्वपिष्यति offers.
data.md: Receiving that food, Maithili, knowing that it has come from Indra,* took up a little of it from the surface, and dropped it to the earth for Rāma. *From the fact of the food not touching the earth, and other signs. It is humorous to read the explanation of the commentator as to the reason of Indra's supplying Sītā with food. If Sītā remained fasting, Rāvana would forego his attachment for Vaidehi, on seeing her altered appearance; and thus his destruction could not take place. Further, if he saw Sītā retaining her former loveliness, he could conclude that Sītā, as also Rāma, were superhuman character, and that as such they could not be agents for his destruction according to the prophecy Rāvana shall be slain by a human being. This inducing him to persist in his bellicose attitude towards Rāma, would being down ruin upon his head.

data.v: यदि जीवति मे भर्ता लक्ष्मणेन सह प्रभुः । देवत्वं गतयोर्वापि तयोरन्नमिदं त्विति ।।
data.es: 'If my husband and Lakshmana are living or else even if they have attained heaven let this food be enjoyed by them', Sita will say.
data.anv: मे my, भर्ता husband, लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, सह along with, प्रभुः king, यदि like that, जीवति if living, देवत्वं attained heaven, गच्छतः have gone, वापि or so, तयो: their, अन्नमिदंत्विति let this food be enjoyed by them.
data.md: Whether my husband as well as his younger brother live, or they have attained godhead, let this food serve for them.

data.v: एष्यन्त्यन्वेषकास्तस्या रामदूताः प्लवंगमाः । आख्येया राममहिषी त्वया तेभ्यो विहंगम ।।
data.es: 'Rama's messenger and other monkeys will be coming to search for the his queen. O Sampati you should narrate this to them.
data.anv: रामदूताः Rama's messenger, एष्यन्ति and others that way, अन्वेषका to search, तस्याः for her, प्लवांगमाः monkeys, आख़्येया narrate, रामः Rama, महीषी queen, त्वया your, तेभ्यो to them, विहंगम bird (Sampati).
data.md: Rāma's envoys, having been despatched thither.* shall come hither. You should relate to them all the facts connected with the queen of Rāma. *For going to Lankā.

data.v: सर्वथा तु न गन्तव्यमीदृशः क्व गमिष्यसि । देशकालौ प्रतीक्षस्व पक्षौ त्वं प्रतिपत्स्यसे ।।
data.es: 'It is good for you in all respects to remain here. Where can you go (without wings)? Wait for appropriate time and place. You will recover your wings'.
data.anv: सर्वथा in all respects, हि indeed, न गन्तव्यम् should not leave, इदृशः remain here, क्व गमिष्यसि where can you go, देशकालौ time and place, प्रतीक्षस्व waiting for, पक्षौ wings, त्वं yours, प्रतिपत्स्यसे will again grow.
data.md: Do not by any means go hence; and in this case, whither, again, wilt you repair? Do you stay here for season and place. You shall regain your wings.

data.v: उत्सहेयमहं कर्तुमद्यैव त्वां सपक्षकम् । इहस्थस्त्वं तु लोकानां हितं कार्यं करिष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'I am not enthusiastic about giving you the wings now. Remain here and carry on the work for the welfare of the world.
data.anv: नोत्सह not enthusiastic, इयम् for me, अहंकर्तु if I make you get (the wings), मध्यैव remain here, त्वां your, सपक्षकम् your wings, इहस्थ: here itself, त्वं you, तु to you, लोकानां हितां good for the world, कार्यं task, करिष्यसि you will do.
data.md: I could this very day furnish you with wings. But, by staying here in this condition, you wilt be able to compass the welfare of the worlds.

data.v: त्वयापि खलु तत्कार्यं तयोश्च नृपपुत्रयोः । ब्राह्मणानां सुराणां च मुनीनां वासवस्य च ।।
data.es: '(Carry on) the work not only for the princes (Rama and Lakshmana) but also for the brahmins, sages, gods and others who live here.
data.anv: त्वया your, अपि and, खलु for all, तत् that, कार्यं task, तयो: for both of them, च and, नृपपुत्रयोः princes, ब्राह्मणानां for the brahmins, सुराणां च and gods, मुनीनां for sages, वासवस्यच and those who live here.
data.md: Even you shall do that act in behalf of those sons of the king, of the Brāhmanas, of the spiritual preceptors, of the ascetics, and of Vasava.

data.v: इच्छाम्यहमपि द्रष्टुं भ्रातरु रामलक्ष्मणौ । नेच्छे चिरं धारयितुं प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्ये कलेवरम् ।।
data.es: 'I also want to see Rama and Lakshmana. But I do not like to hold on to my life for long. Hence I will give up my body'. The knower of self, the sage (Nishakara) said this to Sampati.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्विषष्टितम स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: इच्छाम desirous, अहं अपि I am also, द्रष्टुं to see, भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ brothers Rama and Lakshmana, न not, इच्छा चिरं desire to live long, धारयुतुं to hold on, प्राणान् life, त्यक्ष्ये will give up, कलेबरं my body, महर्षि: sage, तु your, अब्रवीत् said, एवं this, दृष्टः after seeing, तत्वार्थदर्शनः knower of self.
data.md: I also am desirous of beholding the brothers, Rāma and Laksmana. I do not wish to hold this life long. I would renounce my life.' That Maharși, conversant with the nature of things, told me this.'

data.v: एतैरन्यैश्च बहुभिर्वाक्यैर्वाक्यविशारदः । मां प्रशस्याभ्यनुज्ञाप्य प्रविष्टः स स्वमाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: 'The sage who was skilful in speech, having praised me thus and in many other ways, permitted me to leave and entered his dwelling.
data.anv: वाक्यविशारदः skilful in speech, सः he (sage), एतैः by these, अन्यैश्च and others, बहुभिः by many, वाक्यैः with words, माम् me, प्रशस्य having praised, अभ्यनुज्ञाप्य permitted me to leave, स्वम् his own, आलयम् dwelling, प्रविष्टः entered.
data.md: Having praised me with these and many other words, and bidden me adieu that one skilled in speech, entered his own habitation.

data.v: कन्दरात्तु विसर्पित्वा पर्वतस्य शनैः शनैः । अहं विन्ध्यं समारुह्य भवतः प्रतिपालये ।।
data.es: 'Having crawled slowly and slowly from the cave and climbed the Vindhya, I have been awaiting your arrival.
data.anv: अहम् I, पर्वतस्य of the mountain, कन्दरात् from the cave, शनैः शनैः slowly and slowly, विसर्पित्वा having crawled, विन्ध्यम् Vindhya, समारुह्य after climbing, भवतः you, प्रतिपालये I am waiting for your arrival.
data.md: Issuing out gently from the cave of that mountain, I, ascending Vindhya, was expecting you.

data.v: अद्य त्वेतस्य कालस्य साग्रं वर्षशतं गतम् । देशकालप्रतीक्षोऽस्मि हृदि कृत्वा मुनेर्वचः ।।
data.es: 'More than a hundred years have passed and all this time I have borne the sage's words in my heart and have waited for the right time and place.
data.anv: अद्य now, एतस्य कालस्य of this time, साग्रम् more than, वर्षशतम् one hundred years, गतम् have passed, मुनेः sage's, वचः words, हृदि in heart, कृत्वा by bearing, देशकालप्रतीक्षः waiting for the right time and place, अस्मि I am.
data.md: The space covered by the time intervening between then and to-day is a little over an hundred years;* and laying up in my heart the speech of that ascetic I have been awaiting season and place. *The commentator says the period is one hundred and eight years.

data.v: महाप्रस्थानमासाद्य स्वर्गते तु निशाकरे । मां निर्दहति संतापो वितर्कैर्बहुभिर्वृतम् ।।
data.es: 'Nishakara went on his last journey and attained heaven. Since then many sad thoughts have crisscrossed my mind and I am consumed with those thoughts.
data.anv: निशाकरे when Nishakara, महाप्रस्थानम् the last journey, आसाद्य having launched, स्वर्गते when he reached heaven, बहुभिः by many, वितर्कैः with alternatives, वृतम् filled with, माम् me, सन्तापः sorrow, निर्दहति it is burning.
data.md: Setting out on his great journey, on Niśākara having gone to heaven, I distracted with various thoughts, have been consumed by grief. For the loss of my plumage.-

data.v: उत्थितां मरणे बुद्धिं मुनि वाक्यैर्निवर्तये । बुद्धिर्या तेन मे दत्ता प्राणसंरक्षणाय तु । सा मेऽपनयते दुःखं दीप्तेवाग्निशिखा तमः ।।
data.es: 'Whenever I intended to die, the words of the sage rang in my mind. The inspiration he gave me to preserve my life removed my agony like the glowing flames of fire that take away darkness.
data.anv: मरणे for death, उत्थिम् intending, बुद्धिम् my mind, मुनिवाक्यैः  sage's words, निवर्तये I avert, मे my, प्राणानाम् of life, रक्षणे in protecting, तेन by him, मे my, या such, बुद्धिः thought, दत्ता is given, सा that, दीप्ता glowing, अग्निशिखा like the flames of fire, तमः इव like darkness, मे my, दु:खम् agony, अपनयते take away.
data.md: My rising intention of doing away with myself I have suppressed in consideration of the words of the ascetic. The reason which he had imparted to me for preserving my life, has removed my pains even as a flaming fire (dispels darkness).

data.v: बुध्यता च मया वीर्यं रावणस्य दुरात्मनः । पुत्रः संतर्जितो वाग्भिर्न त्राता मैथिली कथम् ।।
data.es: 'I goaded my son with harsh words saying, 'Knowing the valour of the evilminded Ravana, why did you not protect her (Sita)'
data.anv: दुरात्मनः of the evilminded, रावणस्य Ravana's, वीर्यं बुद्ध्यता knowing his valour, मया by me, मैथिली princess from Mithila, कथम् how, न त्राता not protected, वाग्भिः with (harsh) words, पुत्रः son, संतर्जितः goaded.
data.md: And knowing the prowess of the impious Rāvana, I said in rage to my son, versed in speech,-'Hearing her lamentation, and knowing them bereft of Sītā, why didst you not deliver her?'

data.v: तस्या विलपितं श्रुत्वा तौ च सीता विनाकृतौ । न मे दशरथस्नेहात्पुत्रेणोत्पादितं प्रियम् ।।
data.es: 'Even after hearing the wailing of Sita, knowing that both (Rama and Lakshmana) are separated from her and considering my friendship with Dasaratha, I felt displeased with my son (as he did not make an attempt to rescue her)'.
data.anv: तस्याः her, विलपितम् wailing, श्रुत्वा on hearing also, तौ both (Rama and Lakshmna), सीताविनाकृतौ separated from Sita, मे for me, दशरथस्नेहात् in view of my friendship with Dasaratha, पुत्रेण by my son, प्रियम् pleased, न उत्पादितम् not created.
data.md: My son did not do this good office to Daſaratha, influenced by affection for him.

data.v: तस्य त्वेवं ब्रुवाणस्य संपातेर्वानरैः सह । उत्पेततुस्तदा पक्षौ समक्षं वनचारिणाम् ।।
data.es: Even as he was telling this to the monkeys his wings started appearing in their presence.
data.anv: तदा then, संहतैः together with, वानरैस्सह with the monkeys, तस्य when he, एवम् in that way, ब्रुवाणस्य while he was speaking, वनचारिणाम् of forestdwellers, समक्षम् in the presence, पक्षौ both wings, उत्पेततुः started appearing.
data.md: As he was speaking thus in the midst of the monkeys, his wings sprang up in presence of the rangers of the forest.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा स्वां तनुं पक्षैरुद्गतैररुणच्छदैः । प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे वानरांश्चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: He experienced an unparalleled delight seeing wings with red feathers growing on his body, and said to the monkeys:
