data.md: Thereupon, seeing his person furnished with grown pinions hued like the infant sun, he experienced incomparable raptures, and addressed the monkeys, saying,

data.v: निशाकरस्य महर्षेः प्रभावादमितात्मनः । आदित्यरश्मिनिर्दग्धौ पक्षौ मे पुनरुत्थितौ ।।
data.es: 'By the grace of the most revered soul,sage Nishakara, both my wings that were burnt by the Sun's radiance have grown again.
data.anv: अमितात्मनः of the most revered soul, ऋषेः sage, निशाकरस्य Nishakara's, प्रभावात् due to his grace, आदित्यरश्मिनिर्दग्धौ those that are burnt by Sun's radiant heat, मे my, पक्षौ both wings, पुनः again, उपस्थितौ have grown.
data.md: By the grace of that Rājarși of immeasurable energy, my wings, which had been burnt up by the rays of the sun, have grown again.

data.v: यौवने वर्तमानस्य ममासीद्यः पराक्रमः । तमेवाद्यावगच्छामि बलं पौरुषमेव च ।।
data.es: 'The valour, strength and even courage that I had in my youth,I am experiencing now.
data.anv: यौवने in youth, वर्तमानस्य while I was, मम my, यः that, पराक्रमः valour, आसीत् had been, तमेव the same one, अद्य now, अवगच्छामि I find, बलम् strength, पौरुषमेव even courage, च also.
data.md: To-day I have got back) the strength and prowess which I possessed while my youth was yet present.

data.v: सर्वथा क्रियतां यत्नः सीतामधिगमिष्यथ । पक्षलाभो ममायं वः सिद्धिप्रत्यय कारकः ।।
data.anv: सर्वथा by all means, यत्नः effort, क्रियताम् may be made, सीताम् Sita, अधिगमिष्यथ you will trace, मम me, अयम् this, पक्षलाभः growing of wings, वः to you, सिद्धिप्रत्ययकारकः is a proof of your success in future.
data.md: Do you strive every way. You shall meet with Sītā. And my getting (back) my wings inspires (us) with confidence as to success.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा तान्हरीन्सर्वान्संपातिः पततां वरः । उत्पपात गिरेः शृङ्गाज्जिज्ञासुः खगमो गतिम् ।।
data.es: Sampati, the foremost of the birds thus spoke to the monkeys and flew up from the mountain's peak keen on finding the aerial path.
data.anv: पतगोत्तमः foremost of birds, सम्पातिः Sampathi, सर्वान् all, सः those, हरीन् monkeys, इति in this way, उक्त्वा having said, खगमः the bird, गतिम् direction, जिज्ञासुः eager to find, गिरेः mountain's, शृङ्गात् from the peak, उत्पपात flew up.
data.md: Having said this to all the monkeys, that ranger of the sky and best of birds. Sampāti, anxious to ascertain his power of flight, flew up from the mountain summits.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रीतिसंहृष्टमानसाः । बभूवुर्हरिशार्दूला विक्रमाभ्युदयोन्मुखाः ।।
data.es: The tigers among monkeys felt very happy on hearing the words of Sampati and became sure of their success with their valour.
data.anv: हरिशार्दूलाः tigers among monkeys, तस्य his, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, प्रतिसंहृष्टमानसाः in turn felt very happy, विक्रमाभ्युदयोन्मुखाः hoping success with their valour, बभूवुः  became.
data.md: Hearing his words, those powerful monkeys, with vigour (enhanced, seeing success before them, felt the height of joy.

data.v: अथ पवनसमानविक्रमाः; प्लवगवराः प्रतिलब्ध पौरुषाः । अभिजिदभिमुखां दिशं ययु;र्जनकसुता परिमार्गणोन्मुखाः ।।
data.es: The monkeys as strong as the wind regained courage and went in search of the daughter of Janaka in the direction of Abhijit (constellation known as Abhijit is associated with success).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtythird sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अथ now, पवनसमानविक्रमाः as strong as the wind, प्रतिलब्धपौरुषाः regained courage, प्लवगवराः best of the monkeys, अभिजिदभिमुखाः facing Abhijit, जनकसुतापरिमार्गणोन्मुखाः eager to find the daughter of Janaka, दिशम् direction, ययुः went.
data.md: Then those foremost of monkeys, in vigour resembling the Wind, getting occasion for displaying their prowess, intent upon searching the Janaka's daughter, set forward towards the quarter crested by Abhijit.* * Abhijitabhimukhan (acc.) Abhijit—the name of a star. Abhijit may also mean-he who is to be conquered. Then the sense would be the region in which Rāvana was.

data.v: आख्याता गृध्रराजेन समुत्पत्य प्लवंगमाः । संगताः प्रीतिसंयुक्ता विनेदुः सिंहविक्रमाः ।।
data.es: Hearing the words spoken by the king of vultures, the highly courageous monkeys assembled together and leaped with joyscreaming.
data.anv: गृध्रराजेन by the king of vultures, आख्याताः directed, भीमविक्रमा terribly courageous, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, संगताः assembled, प्रीतिसंयुक्ताः they were pleased, समुत्प्लुत्य leaped, विनेदुः screaming in joy.
data.md: Having heard all this related to them by the vulture-king, the monkeys possessing the strength of lions, filled with delight, bounded and set up a roar.

data.v: संपातेर्वचनं श्रुत्वा हरयो रावणक्षयम् । हृष्टाः सागरमाजग्मुः सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Sampati, the monkeys felt glad and, eager to see Sita, reached the ocean, the passage to the abode of Ravana.
data.anv: हरयः monkeys, सम्पातेः Sampati's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, हृष्टाः glad, सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः desiring to see Sita, रावणक्षयम् the abode of Ravana, सागरम् ocean, आजग्मुः reached.
data.md: Hearing from Sampāti that Rāvana was to be slain, the monkeys growing glad, came to the ocean, with the desire of seeing Sītā.

data.v: अभिक्रम्य तु तं देशं ददृशुर्भीमविक्रमाः । कृत्स्नं लोकस्य महतः प्रतिबिम्बमिव स्थितम् ।।
data.es: Having reached the ocean, the monkeys, endowed with frightening courage, stood looking at the vast ocean which appeared like an image of the whole world.
data.anv: भीमविक्रमाः those with frigtening courage, तम् that, देशम् place, अभिक्रम्य having reached, महतः of a great, लोकस्य of the world, कृत्स्नम् vast, प्रतिबिम्बमिव like an image, स्थितम् placed, ददृशुः saw.
data.md: Coming to that country, these ones processing dreadful prowess, beheld (the sea) reflecting the image of this entire mighty world.

data.v: दक्षिणस्य समुद्रस्य समासाद्योत्तरां दिशम् । संनिवेशं ततश्चक्रुः सहिता वानरोत्तमाः ।।
data.es: Powerful and heroic monkeys assembled at the northern end of the southern ocean.
data.anv: महाबलाः powerful, हरिवीराः heroic monkeys, समुद्रस्य ocean's, उत्तरां दिशम् northernside, समासाद्य having reached, ततः then, सन्निवेशम् collected at that, चक्रुः held.
data.md: Arriving at the northern side of the Southern sea, those exceedingly powerful heroic monkeys took up their quarters there.

data.v: सत्त्वैर्महद्भिर्विकृतैः क्रीडद्भिर्विविधैर्जले । व्यात्तास्यैः सुमहाकायैरूर्मिभिश्च समाकुलम् ।।
प्रसुप्तमिव चान्यत्र क्रीडन्तमिव चान्यतः । क्वचित्पर्वतमात्रैश्च जलराशिभिरावृतम् ।।
data.md: Seeing the sea, here as if asleep, there, as if playful, and at another place with surges measuring mountains; and thronged with the foremost Dānavas inhabiting the nether regions; and capable of causing one's hair to stand on end, those powerful monkeys were seized with sadness.

data.v: संकुलं दानवेन्द्रैश्च पातालतलवासिभिः । रोमहर्षकरं दृष्ट्वा विषेदुः कपिकुञ्जराः ।।
data.md: Seeing the sea, here as if asleep, there, as if playful, and at another place with surges measuring mountains; and thronged with the foremost Dānavas inhabiting the nether regions; and capable of causing one's hair to stand on end, those powerful monkeys were seized with sadness.

data.v: आकाशमिव दुष्पारं सागरं प्रेक्ष्य वानराः । विषेदुः सहसा सर्वे कथं कार्यमिति ब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: All the monkeys were worried when they suddenly saw the ocean which looked impassable like the sky. They wondered if they can at all accomplish the task (of finding Sita)
data.anv: सहसा at once, सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys, आकाशमिव looking like the sky, दुष्पारम् impossible to cross, सागरम् ocean, प्रेक्षय seeing, विषेदुः worried, कथम् how, कार्यम् the task can be performed, इति thus, ब्रुवन् while saying
data.md: Seeing the sea, incapable of being crossed even as the sky, all the monkeys began to lament, saying,-What is to be done?

data.v: विषण्णां वाहिनीं दृष्ट्वा सागरस्य निरीक्षणात् । आश्वासयामास हरीन्भयार्तान्हरिसत्तमः ।।
data.es: Angada, the best among the monkeys saw the worried army despondent gazing at the ocean, and comforted the frightened troops.
data.anv: हरिसत्तमः Angada, the best of the monkeys, सागरस्य ocean's, निरीक्षणात् gazing at, विषण्णाम्   despondent, वाहिनीम् army, दृष्ट्वा seeing, भयार्तान् frightened, हरीन् monkeys, आश्वासयामास comforted.
data.md: That best of monkeys-(Angada), seeing the army cast down because of the sight of the sea, began to comfort the monkeys, afflicted with fear.

data.v: न निषादेन नः कार्यं विषादो दोषवत्तरः । विषादो हन्ति पुरुषं बालं क्रुद्ध इवोरगः ।।
data.es: 'Do not be despondent. It is the biggest flaw. It destroys a person like an angry serpent killing a young child.
data.anv: वषादे in despondency, मनः mind, न कार्यम् does not work, विषादः despair, दोषवत्तमाः biggest flaw, क्रुद्धः angry, उरगः serpent, बालम् इव like a child, पुरुषम् man, विषादः despondency, हन्ति destroys.
data.md: We should not indulge in grief. Grief is injurious.-Grief destroys a person even as a wrathful serpent does a boy.

data.v: विषादोऽयं प्रसहते विक्रमे पर्युपस्थिते । तेजसा तस्य हीनस्य पुरुषार्थो न सिध्यति ।।
data.es: 'If one succumbs to despondency while he has to exhibit his valour, his brilliance gets diminished and he does not succeed in his manly pursuits'.
data.anv: विक्रमे when valiance, समुपस्थिते needs to be exhibited, यः whoever, विषादम् despondency, प्रसहते will succumb, तेजसा with brilliant, हीनस्य of a deprived one, तस्य his, पुरुषार्थः manly pursuit, न सिध्यति will not achieve.
data.md: He that, when the time is come for displaying his prowess, indulges in sorrow, growing weak in energy, fails to attain his objects.

data.v: तस्यां रात्र्यां व्यतीतायामङ्गदो वानरैः सह । हरिवृद्धैः समागम्य पुनर्मन्त्रममन्त्रयत् ।।
data.es: With the night over, Angada joined the older monkeys again and sought their counsel.
data.anv: तस्याम् when that, रात्रौ night, व्यतीतायाम् having ended, अङ्गदः Angada, हरिवृद्धैः with old monkeys, वानरैस्सह along with fellowmonkeys, समागम्य joined together, पुनः again, मन्त्रम् counsel, अमन्त्रयत् sought.
data.md: That night having passed away, Angada in company with the monkeys, joined by the old ones, again took counsel with them.

data.v: सा वानराणां ध्वजिनी परिवार्याङ्गदं बभौ । वासवं परिवार्येव मरुतां वाहिनी स्थिता ।।
data.es: The army of monkeys encircled Angada like the army of Maruts surrounding Indra.
data.anv: वानराणाम् of the monkeys, सा that, ध्वजिनी army, अङ्गदम् Angada, परिवार्य surrounding, स्थिता stood, वासवम् Indra, परिवार्य surrounding, मरुताम् of Maruts, वाहिनी इव like the army, बभौ appeared.
data.md: That monkey-host surrounding Angada, resembled the host of Maruts environing Vasava.

data.v: कोऽन्यस्तां वानरीं सेनां शक्तः स्तम्भयितुं भवेत् । अन्यत्र वालितनयादन्यत्र च हनूमतः ।।
data.es: Who else other than the son of Vali and Hanuman can resist and pacify the monkeyarmy?
data.anv: वालितनयात् अन्यत्र other than Vali's son, हनूमतः Hanumat, अन्यत्र other than, अन्यः another person, कः who, ताम् that, वानरीम् monkey सेनाम् army, स्तम्भयितुम् to suspend, शक्तः can do, भवेत् will be.
data.md: Who save Väli's son (stationed) at one place and at another Hanumān, could be capable of stilling that force?

data.v: ततस्तान्हरिवृद्धांश्च तच्च सैन्यमरिंदमः । अनुमान्याङ्गदः श्रीमान्वाक्यमर्थवदब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then the illustrious Angada, subduer of foes took the counsel of elderly monkeys and the army into confidence and thus addressed them all in meaningful words:
data.anv: ततः then, अरिन्दमः subduer of foes, श्रीमान् illustrious, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् those, हरिवृद्धान् elderly monkeys, तत् that, सैन्यं च and the army also, अनुमान्य taking them into confidence, अर्थवत् meaningful, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् expressed.
data.md: Then saluting the elders as well as army, the-graceful Angada-repressor of foes-~-spoke words fraught with sense,

data.v: क इदानीं महातेजा लङ्घयिष्यति सागरम् । कः करिष्यति सुग्रीवं सत्यसंधमरिंदमम् ।।
data.es: 'Now which mighty monkey will cross the ocean? Who will prove Sugriva, subduer of enemies, true to his promise?
data.anv: इदानीम् now, महातेजाः brilliant, कः who, सागरम् ocean, लङ्घयिष्यति will cross, कः who, अरिंदमम् subduer of foes, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, सत्यसन्धम् true to his promise, करिष्यति will render.
data.md: What person, endued with exceeding energy, shall now leap over the main? Who shall serve that subduer of enemies, Sugrīva, ever intent on truth?

data.v: को वीरो योजनशतं लङ्घयेत प्लवंगमाः । इमांश्च यूथपान्सर्वान्मोचयेत्को महाभयात् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys which one can leap a hundred yojanas and liberate the monkey leaders from the great fear of Sugriva?
data.anv: वीरः hero, कः who, प्लवङ्गमा: O monkeys, योजनशतम् a hundred yojanas, लङ्घयेत can leap, इमान् these, यूथपान् leaders, सर्वान् all, महाभयात् from great fear, मोक्षयेत liberate them.
data.md: What monkey can leap over an hundred Yojanas? Who shall deliver leaders of herds from a mighty fear?

data.v: कस्य प्रसादाद्दारांश्च पुत्रांश्चैव गृहाणि च । इतो निवृत्ताः पश्येम सिद्धार्थाः सुखिनो वयम् ।।
data.es: 'By whose effort can we be successful and return home happily from here to meet wives and sons?
data.anv: वयम् we,कस्य whose, प्रभावात् effort,सिद्धार्थाः emerge successful,सुखिनः happy,इतः from here, निवृत्ताः return,दारांश्च wives,पुत्रांश्चैव and sons, गृहाणि च and homes,पश्येम we will see.
data.md: By whose favour shall we, crowned with success and rendered happy, returning from this place, shall behold our wives and our son, and our homes?

data.v: कस्य प्रसादाद्रामं च लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम् । अभिगच्छेम संहृष्टाः सुग्रीवं च महाबलम् ।।
data.es: 'By whose grace shall we approach Rama and Lakshmana and even the monkey king Sugriva happily?
data.anv: कस्य whose, प्रसादात् grace, संहृष्टा: happily, रामं च Rama and, महाबलम् mighty, लक्ष्मणं च Lakshmana also, वनौकसम् forester, सुग्रीवं च even Sugriva, अभिगच्छेम can we approach.

data.v: यदि कश्चित्समर्थो वः सागरप्लवने हरिः । स ददात्विह नः शीघ्रं पुण्यामभयदक्षिणाम् ।।
data.es: 'If there is any one among you who is capable of leaping across the ocean he will be giving all of us the sacred gift of life quickly?'
data.anv: वः among you, कश्चित् any one, हरिः vanara, सागरप्लवने in leaping the ocean, समर्थः यदि if he is capable, सः he, इह here, नः to us, शीघ्रम् quickly, पुण्याम् sacred, अभयदक्षिणाम् a gift of assurance, ददातु can he give?

data.v: अङ्गदस्य वचः श्रुत्वा न कश्चित्किंचिदब्रवीत् । स्तिमितेवाभवत्सर्वा सा तत्र हरिवाहिनी ।।
data.es: After hearing Angada, no one spoke a word. The entire army of monkeys became still and motionless.
data.anv: अङ्गदस्य Angada's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, कश्चित् any one, किञ्चित् even a little, न अब्रवीत् did not speak, तत्र there, सर्वा the entire, सा that, हरिवाहिनी army of monkeys स्तिमिते motionless, अभवत् became.

data.v: पुनरेवाङ्गदः प्राह तान्हरीन्हरिसत्तमः । सर्वे बलवतां श्रेष्ठा भवन्तो दृढविक्रमाः ।।
data.es: Angada, the best of the monkeys again addressed them saying, 'you are all mighty, eminent and courageous, born in renowned families and have been honoured again and again(for your actions).
data.anv: हरिसत्तमः best of monkeys, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् हरीन् those monkeys, पुनरेव once again, प्राह addressed, भवन्तः you are, सर्वे all, बलवताम् among strong, श्रेष्ठाः eminent, दृढविक्रमाः mighty, व्यपदेशकुले in a renowned family, जाताः born, अभीक्ष्णशः again and again, पूजिताश्च honoured.
data.md: Then that foremost of monkeys addressed those monkeys, saying-All of you are the foremost of strong ones, and of steady prowess. And you have sprung in blameless lines, and are ever honoured (by the king).

data.v: व्यपदेश्य कुले जाताः पूजिताश्चाप्यभीक्ष्णशः । न हि वो गमने संगः कदाचिदपि कस्यचित् ।।
ब्रुवध्वं यस्य या शक्तिर्गमने प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
data.es: 'None of you at any time have faced any obstruction in doing your deeds. You are efficient in leaping. O bulls among monkeys now speak out, who among you can fly and how far?इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वः to you, कस्यचित् any one of you, कदाचित् at any time, गमने fly, सङ्गः no obstruction, क्वचित् हि to carry out, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, प्लवने in leaping, यस्य whose, या such, शक्तिः capacity, ब्रुवध्वम्  speak .

data.v: ततोऽङ्गदवचः श्रुत्वा सर्वे ते वानरोत्तमाः । स्वं स्वं गतौ समुत्साहमाहुस्तत्र यथाक्रमम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, on hearing Angada, all the leaders among the monkeys, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda, Dvivida, Sushena and Jambavan as well expressed one after the other their capability for leaping.
data.anv: अथ and then, अङ्गदवचः Angada's words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, गजः Gaja, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, गवयः Gavaya, शरभः Sarabha, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, मैन्दश्च Mainda, द्विविदश्चैव even Dvivida, सुषेणः Sushena, तथा so also, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, सर्वे all, ते them, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, यथाक्रमम् following an order, तत्र there, गतौ in turn the scope for, स्वं स्वम् on their own, समुत्साहम् capability (to leap), ऊचुः expressed.
data.md: Hearing Angada's speech, those foremost monkeys one after another began to speak, touching their respective competence in coursing.

data.v: गजो गवाक्षो गवयः शरभो गन्धमादनः । मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चैव सुषेणो जाम्बवांस्तथा ।।
data.es: Thereafter, on hearing Angada, all the leaders among the monkeys, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda, Dvivida, Sushena and Jambavan as well expressed one after the other their capability for leaping.
data.anv: अथ and then, अङ्गदवचः Angada's words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, गजः Gaja, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, गवयः Gavaya, शरभः Sarabha, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, मैन्दश्च Mainda, द्विविदश्चैव even Dvivida, सुषेणः Sushena, तथा so also, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, सर्वे all, ते them, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, यथाक्रमम् following an order, तत्र there, गतौ in turn the scope for, स्वं स्वम् on their own, समुत्साहम् capability (to leap), ऊचुः expressed.
data.md: Gaja, and Gavākṣa, and Gavaya, and Sarabha, and Gandhamādana, and Mainda, and Dwivida, and Angada, and Jāmbavān.

data.v: आबभाषे गजस्तत्र प्लवेयं दशयोजनम् । गवाक्षो योजनान्याह गमिष्यामीति विंशतिम् ।।
data.es: Gaja said he can leap ten yojanas and Gavaksha said he can go upto twenty yojanas.
data.anv: तत्र after that, गजः Gaja, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, प्लवेयम् I can leap, आबभाषे said, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, विंशतिम् twenty, योजनानि yojanas, गमिष्यामि I can go, इति thus, आह said.
data.md: Gaja said, “I can leap over ten Yojanas," and Gavaksa said, "I shall go twenty Yojanas."

data.v: गवयो वानरस्तत्र वानरांस्तानुवाच ह । त्रिंशतं तु गमिष्यामि योजनानां प्लवंगमाः ।।
data.md: There monkey Sarabha said to those monkeys, “You monkey, I shall go thirty Yojanas."

data.v: शरभो वानरस्तत्र वानरांस्तानुवाच ह । चत्वारिंशद्गमिष्यामि योजनानां न संशयः ।।
data.md: There monkey Sarabha said to those monkeys, “You monkey, I shall go thirty Yojanas."

data.v: वानरांस्तु महातेजा अब्रवीद्गन्धमादनः । योजनानां गमिष्यामि पञ्चाशत्तु न संशयः ।।
data.md: And the exceedingly energetic monkey, Gandhamädana, said, I shall for certain go fifty Yojanas.

data.v: मैन्दस्तु वानरस्तत्र वानरांस्तानुवाच ह । योजनानां परं षष्टिमहं प्लवितुमुत्सहे ।।
data.md: And the monkey Mainda said to the monkeys there, I shall undertake to leap over sixty Yojanas.

data.v: ततस्तत्र महातेजा द्विविदः प्रत्यभाषत । गमिष्यामि न संदेहः सप्ततिं योजनान्यहम् ।।
data.md: And then the highly energetic Dwivida said,-I Shall, for certain, go seventy Yojanas.

data.v: सुषेणस्तु हरिश्रेष्ठः प्रोक्तवान्कपिसत्तमान् । अशीतिं योजनानां तु प्लवेयं प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
तेषां कथयतां तत्र सर्वांस्ताननुमान्य च । ततो वृद्धतमस्तेषां जाम्बवान्प्रत्यभाषत ।।
data.es: When the monkeys were talking (of their individual capacity) in that manner about their speed, Jambavan the oldest of the monkeys inferred (their capacity) and said:
data.anv: ततः then, तेषाम् among them, वृद्धतमः oldest, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, तेषाम् they, तत्र there, कथयताम् (when they were) saying, तान् सर्वान् all the, अनुमान्य inferred, प्रत्यभाषत replied.
data.md: As they were speaking thus,' the oldest of them all, Jambavān, saluting them answered.

data.v: पूर्वमस्माकमप्यासीत्कश्चिद्गतिपराक्रमः । ते वयं वयसः पारमनुप्राप्ताः स्म साम्प्रतम् ।।
data.es: 'Earlier I was also very courageous, but now I have become old and reached the fag end of life.
data.anv: पूर्वम् earlier, अस्माकमपि even I also, कश्चित् some, गतिपराक्रमः very courageous, आसीत् had , ते वयम् for me, साम्प्रतम् attained, वयसः (old) age, पारम् fag end of life, अनुप्राप्ताः स्म have reached.

data.v: किं तु नैवं गते शक्यमिदं कार्यमुपेक्षितुम् । यदर्थं कपिराजश्च रामश्च कृतनिश्चयौ ।।
data.es: 'However in this situation, it is not possible for us to neglect (our task) as it is the order of the monkeyking and Rama who are determined to achieve the objective.
data.anv: किं तु however, एवं गते in this situation, यदर्थम् order, कपिराजश्च monkey king's, रामश्च and Rama's, कृतनिश्चयौ are determined, इदम् this, कार्यम् task, उपेक्षितुम् to neglect, न शक्यम् not possible.

data.v: साम्प्रतं कालभेदेन या गतिस्तां निबोधत । नवतिं योजनानां तु गमिष्यामि न संशयः ।।
data.anv: साम्प्रतम् at this age, कालभेदेन due to advancement of age, या that, गतिः movement, ताम् that, निबोधत you know, योजनानाम् of yojanas, नवतिम् ninety,गमिष्यामि I can leap, संशयः doubt, न not.

data.v: तांश्च सर्वान्हरिश्रेष्ठाञ्जाम्बवान्पुनरब्रवीत् । न खल्वेतावदेवासीद्गमने मे पराक्रमः ।।
data.es: Jambavan, the distinguished among the monkeys again said, 'My strength to leap into the sky was not only that much (I was stronger in my youth and could cover longer distances)'
data.anv: सर्वान् all, तान् of the monkeys, हरिश्रेष्ठान् distinguished among the monkeys, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said, मे my, गमने in leaping, पराक्रमः valour, एतावदेव only that much, न आसीत् खलु was not.
data.md: Jāmbavān said this to those choice monkeys. But (formerly) my prowess in leaping was forsooth not such.* Of old in the sacrifice of Virocana's son, the external Lord Visnu, when he had covered the entire universe with three steps, was circumambulated by me. *i.e. it was greater.

data.v: मया महाबलैश्चैव यज्ञे विष्णुः सनातनः । प्रदक्षिणीकृतः पूर्वं क्रममाणस्त्रिविक्रमः ।।
data.es: 'In the past, at the time of the wellknown yagna (of king Bali) I was very strong. I circumambulated the eternal Vishnu while he was taking three strides (in his incarnation of Trivikrama Vamana.)
data.anv: मया by myself, पूर्वम् earlier, महाबलेश्चैव of Mahabali, यज्ञे in yagna, क्रममाणः the advancing Lord, विष्णुः Visnu, सनातनः eternal, त्रिविक्रमः Visnu of three strides, प्रदक्षिणीकृतः circumambulated.

data.v: स इदानीमहं वृद्धः प्लवने मन्दविक्रमः । यौवने च तदासीन्मे बलमप्रतिमं परैः ।।
data.es: 'Having grown old I do not have the same courage. In my youth my prowess was incomparable and none could excel me.
data.anv: इदानीम् now, वृद्धः old, सः अहम् that I am, प्लवने to leap, मन्दविक्रमः my strength is denuded, तदा then, यौवने in youth, मे बलम् my prowess, अप्रतिमम् incomparable, परैः by others, आसीत् it was.
data.md: But I who was all this, have waxed old, and my vigour sits feebly upon me. In my youth, ever, my strength was exceeding great and incomparable.

data.v: संप्रत्येतावतीं शक्तिं गमने तर्कयाम्यहम् । नैतावता च संसिद्धिः कार्यस्यास्य भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'I guess that at this time I do not have the capacity to fly to that extent. Achieving the objective is out of question with this much of energy.
data.anv: सम्प्रति at this time, अहम् I have, शक्तिं capacity, गमने to fly, तर्कयामि I guess, एतावतीं that much, शक्यम् possible, एतावता to this extent, अस्य of this, कार्यस्य of the objective, संसिद्धिः success, न भविष्यति will not be.
data.md: Now I can only by my own energy, course thus far. But has a bound shall not bring success on our undertaking.

data.v: अथोत्तरमुदारार्थमब्रवीदङ्गदस्तदा । अनुमान्य महाप्राज्ञो जाम्बवन्तं महाकपिम् ।।
data.es: 'Then the wise Angada said to great Jambavan, in a gentle manner about his own strength.
data.anv: अथ and now, तदा then, प्राज्ञः wise, अङ्गदः Angada, महाकपिम् great monkey, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavan, अनुमान्य doubting, उदारार्थम् in a gentle manner, उत्तरम् reply, तदा then, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: After this, saluting the mighty monkey, Jāmbavān, the wise Angada spoke straight sense, saying,

data.v: अहमेतद्गमिष्यामि योजनानां शतं महत् । निवर्तने तु मे शक्तिः स्यान्न वेति न निश्चितम् ।।
data.es: 'I can certainly go to a distance of a hundred yojanas. However, I cannot say whether I will have enough capacity to return?
data.anv: अहम् I, महत् great, एतत् this, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतम् hundred, गमिष्यामि I can go, निवर्तने to return, मे my, शक्तिः capacity, स्यात् may be, न वा or not, इति thus, निश्चितम् certainly, न not known.
data.md: I can go over this mighty hundred Yojanas; but there is no certainty as to my answer of returning.

data.v: तमुवाच हरिश्रेष्ठो जाम्बवान्वाक्यकोविदः । ज्ञायते गमने शक्तिस्तव हर्यृक्षसत्तम ।।
data.es: Jambavan who was skilful in speech spoke to that great Angada, 'O leader among monkeys and bears your energy to cover this distance is wellknown to us'.
data.anv: वाक्यकोविदः skilful at speech, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, तम् him, हरिश्रेष्ठम् best of monkeys, उवाच said, हर्यृक्षसत्तम best among bears and monkeys, गमने I am going to fly, तव your, शक्तिः energy, ज्ञायते is known.

data.v: कामं शतसहस्रं वा न ह्येष विधिरुच्यते । योजनानां भवाञ्शक्तो गन्तुं प्रतिनिवर्तितुम् ।।
data.es: 'You can go upto even a hundred thousand yojanas and have the required energy to return also. But it is not proper to send you (because you are the heir apparent).
data.anv: भवान् you, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतं सहस्रं वा even a hundred or a thousand, गन्तुम् to go, प्रतिनिवर्तितुम् but to return, शक्तः कामम् you have the required energy, एषः this, विधिः duty, उच्यते हि not proper.
data.md: Thereat, Jāmbavān, cognizant of speech, said to that foremost of monkeys,-0 foremost of leonine as, we know your power of motion, you are capable of ursing a hundred thousand Yojanas, as well as of coming back. But we say that even this is what is fit.

data.v: न हि प्रेषयिता तत स्वामी प्रेष्यः कथंचन । भवतायं जनः सर्वः प्रेष्यः प्लवगसत्तम ।।
data.anv: तात dear , प्रेषयिता who orders, स्वामी lord, कथञ्चन in any way, प्रेष्यः a servant who is sent, न हि indeed, प्लवगसत्तम best of monkeys, सर्वः all, अयं जनः this group, भवता by you, प्रेष्यः to be sent.
data.md: My child, ore master must on no account be commanded by his servants. foremost of monkeys, all these should be commanded your you.

data.v: भवान्कलत्रमस्माकं स्वामिभावे व्यवस्थितः । स्वामी कलत्रं सैन्यस्य गतिरेषा परंतप ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies, you are established as the commander of the army and it is proper for us to protect you as we protect our wives.
data.anv: परन्तप O scorcher of enemies, स्वामिभावे in a state of commander, व्यवस्थितः you are established, भवान् you, अस्माकम् for us, कलत्रम् wife, स्वामी lord, सैन्यस्य army's, कलत्रम् wife, एषा so that, गतिः proper.
data.md: You are our spouse, and (at the same time) occuying the position of our husband. The master is the spouse if the army. This is the way of the world.

data.v: तस्मात्कलत्रवत्तात प्रतिपाल्यः सदा भवान् । अपि चैतस्य कार्यस्य भवान्मूलमरिंदम ।।
मूलमर्थस्य संरक्ष्यमेष कार्यविदां नयः । मूले हि सति सिध्यन्ति गुणाः पुष्पफलादयः ।।
data.es: 'The root of any objective should be protected well. This is the basis of an accomplisher. Only when the roots are intact, the trees have the ability to yield flowers and fruits.
data.anv: अर्थस्य the objective, मूलम् root, संरक्ष्यम् should be protected, एषः this कार्यविदाम् of the accomplishers, नयः policy, मूले when root, सति when it is intact, फलो पुष्पोदयाः bearing flowers and fruits, गुणाः qualities, सिद्ध्यन्ति हि will result.
data.md: The root of any work must be preserved. This is the policy of those versed in business. The root existing, all the virtues, obtaining fruit, certainly meet with success.

data.v: तद्भवानस्या कार्यस्य साधने सत्यविक्रमः । बुद्धिविक्रमसंपन्नो हेतुरत्र परंतपः ।।
data.es: 'O warrior of proven valour O subduer of enemies in achieving this objective you are the source, being endowed with valour and wisdom.
data.anv: सत्यविक्रम truely courageous one, तत् that, भवान् you, अस्य कार्यस्य of this task, साधने in achieving, परन्तप O subduer of enemies, अत्र there, बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पन्नः endowed with wisdom and valour, हेतुः you are the cause.
data.md: You, O you having truth for prowess are the instrument of this undertaking, and, O subduer of enemies, furnished with sense and vigour, you are the occasion herein. And, O foremost of monkeys, you are both our superior, and our superior's son; and resorting to you we are enabled to accomplish our object.

data.v: गुरुश्च गुरुपुत्रश्च त्वं हि नः कपिसत्तम । भवन्तमाश्रित्य वयं समर्था ह्यर्थसाधने ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys you are the son of my guide (Vali) and respectable. We will be capable of accomplishing the goal only under your protection and guidance.
data.anv: कपिसत्तम O best of monkeys, नः for us, गुरुपुत्रः son of our teacher, त्वम् you are, गुरुश्च and also a respectable guide, वयम् we, भवन्तम् you, आश्रित्य under your care, अर्थसाधने in accomplishing our objective, समर्थाः हि are capable also.
data.md: You, O you having truth for prowess are the instrument of this undertaking, and, O subduer of enemies, furnished with sense and vigour, you are the occasion herein. And, O foremost of monkeys, you are both our superior, and our superior's son; and resorting to you we are enabled to accomplish our object.

data.v: उक्तवाक्यं महाप्राज्ञं जाम्बवन्तं महाकपिः । प्रत्युवाचोत्तरं वाक्यं वालिसूनुरथाङ्गदः ।।
data.es: Jambavan, the wise monkey having said that, Angada, the great son of Vali, replied:
data.anv: अथ now, महाकपिः great monkey, वालिसूनुः Vali's son, अङ्गदः Angada, उक्तवाक्यम् having said that, महाप्राज्ञम् very wise, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavan, उत्तरं वाक्यम् in reply, प्रत्युवाच said.
data.md: Threat that mighty monkey, Angada, son to Vali, answered the exceedingly wise Jambavan, when he had spoken,

data.v: यदि नाहं गमिष्यामि नान्यो वानरपुंगवः । पुनः खल्विदमस्माभिः कार्यं प्रायोपवेशनम् ।।
data.es: 'If I do not go and no other monkey leader goes, then we have to resort to fasting unto death once again.
data.anv: अहम् I am, न गमिष्यामि यदि if I will not go, अन्यः other, वानरपुङ्गवः monkey leader, न not, अस्माभिः by us, पुनः again, इदम् this, प्रायोपवेशनम् fasting to death, कार्यं खलु have to do.
data.md: If I go not, nor any other powerful monkey, then we should for certain again sit ourselves down to fast to death.

data.v: न ह्यकृत्वा हरिपतेः संदेशं तस्य धीमतः । तत्रापि गत्वा प्राणानां पश्यामि परिरक्षणम् ।।
data.es: 'If I do not fulfil the objective of the wise king of monkeys I cannot save my life even after returning there (Kishkinda).
data.anv: धीमतः of the wise, तस्य हरिपतेः of the lord of monkeys, सन्देशम् message, अकृत्वा by not fulfilling, तत्र there, गत्वापि even after going, प्राणानाम् of life, परिरक्षणम् protection, न पश्यामि I do not see.
data.md: Without doing the mandate of the intelligent lord of monkeys, we, repairing thither, shall not behold ourselves alive.

data.v: स हि प्रसादे चात्यर्थं कोपे च हरिरीश्वरः । अतीत्य तस्य संदेशं विनाशो गमने भवेत् ।।
data.es: 'The monkey king has the authority to shower grace or give vent to his anger. If we go without fulfilling the task we will face destruction.
data.anv: सः he, हरिः monkey king, प्रसादे च in showering grace, कोपे च and vent anger, अत्यर्थम् highly, ईश्वरः all powerful, तस्य his, सन्देशम् instruction, अतीत्य in not fulfilling the task, गमने in going, विनाशः total destruction, भवेत् will be.
data.md: He is extreme both in showing favour and in anger. Disregarding his order, we shall, going there, meet with destruction. And his ire shall, not take any other course.

data.v: तद्यथा ह्यस्य कार्यस्य न भवत्यन्यथा गतिः । तद्भवानेव दृष्टार्थः संचिन्तयितुमर्हति ।।
data.es: 'Therefore, think over well so that we do not fail ultimately. You have a vision.You should suggest means by which this mission does not misfire.'
data.anv: तत् तथाहि therefore, अस्य of this, कार्यस्य of the task, गतिः advancement, अन्यथा  otherwise, न भवति will not be, तत् that, दृष्टार्थः well aware, भवानेव you alone, सञ्चिन्तयितुम् to think over well, अर्हति you should.
data.md: Therefore it behoves you, cap of seeing issues, to reflect.

data.v: सोऽङ्गदेन तदा वीरः प्रत्युक्तः प्लवगर्षभः । जाम्बवानुत्तरं वाक्यं प्रोवाचेदं ततोऽङ्गदम् ।।
data.es: On listening to Angada's words, Jambavan, the bull among monkeys, replied this way:
data.anv: अङ्गदेन by Angada, तदा then, प्रत्युक्तः having been addressed, वीरः hero, प्लवगर्षभः bull among monkeys, सः जाम्बवान् that Jambavan, ततः then, अङ्गदम् to Angada, उत्तरम् reply, इदं वाक्यम् in these words, प्रोवाच said.
data.md: Thus addressed by Angada that powerful and heroic monkey Jāmbavān answered Angada in excellent words, saying,

data.v: अस्य ते वीर कार्यस्य न किंचित्परिहीयते । एष संचोदयाम्येनं यः कार्यं साधयिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'O hero this work will not be balked. I will now inspire one who can achieve this task.'
data.anv: वीर O hero, ते your, तस्य कार्यस्य of this task, किञ्चित् even a little, न परिहीयते nothing is balked, एषः here I am, कार्यम् task, यः who, साधयिष्यति who can achieve, सञ्चोदयामि एनम् I will inspire him.
data.md: That . business, O hero, say most moult a feather. I shall despatch even him who's bring about success.

data.v: ततः प्रतीतं प्लवतां वरिष्ठ;मेकान्तमाश्रित्य सुखोपविष्टम् । संचोदयामास हरिप्रवीरो; हरिप्रवीरं हनुमन्तमेव ।।
data.md: Then that heroic monkey ordered foremost of monkeys, the highly heroic monkey Hanuman who stood apart, convinced (of the wisdom of Jambavān decision).

data.v: अनेकशतसाहस्रीं विषण्णां हरिवाहिनीम् । जाम्बवान्समुदीक्ष्यैवं हनुमन्तमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then Jambavan observed the worries of several hundred thousands of the monkey army and said to Hanuman:
data.anv: जाम्बवान् Jambavan, विषण्णाम् worried, अनेकशतसाहस्रीम् several hundred thousands, हरिवाहिनीम् army of monkeys, समुदीक्ष्य observed, अथ then, हनूमन्तम् to Hanuman, एवम् this way, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Surveying the monkey-host consisting of many hundred and thousand,-crest-fallen, Jämbavān thus spoke to Hanumān,

data.v: वीर वानरलोकस्य सर्वशास्त्रविदां वर । तूष्णीमेकान्तमाश्रित्य हनुमन्किं न जल्पसि ।।
data.es: 'O Hanuman you are the choicest one among many scholars wellversed in all sastras. Why do you sit alone? Why do you not speak?
data.anv: वानरलोकस्य in the world of monkeys, वीर hero, सर्वशास्त्रविदाम् among the knowledgeable in all sastras, वर choicest one, हनूमान् Hanuman, तूष्णीम् quietly, एकान्तम् solitude, आश्रित्य remaining, किम् why, न जल्पसि you are not speaking.
data.md: O hero among the monkey-multitude, O be of those versed in all branches of learning, staying apart silent, why did you not speak?

data.v: हनुमन्हरिराजस्य सुग्रीवस्य समो ह्यसि । रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि तेजसा च बलेन च ।।
data.es: 'Hanuman you are equal to the king of monkeys and also Rama and Lakshmana in brilliance and strength.
data.anv: हनूमन् Hanuman, तेजसा च with brilliance, बलेन च and in strength, हरिराजस्य monkey king's, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि with Rama and Lakshmana also, समः equal, असि हि you are.
data.md: O Hanuman, you are alil in energy and strength, equal to Sugriva, monarch monkeys, and to Rāma and Lakşmaņa.

data.v: अरिष्टनेमिनः पुत्रौ वैनतेयो महाबलः । गरुत्मानिव विख्यात उत्तमः सर्वपक्षिणाम् ।।
data.es: 'You are the son of Arishtanemi (sage Kasyapa) and Vinata, and your gurulike (elder brother) is Garuda, the greatest among birds. He is powerful and and famous.
data.anv: अरिष्टनेमिनः Arishtanemi's, पुत्रः son, सर्वपक्षिणाम् among all birds, उत्तमः greatest, वैनतेयः Vainateya's, महाबलः very powerful, गरुत्मान् इति Garuthman as such, विख्यातः very famous.
data.md: Aristanemi's son the mighty Vainateya,* famous by the cognomen of Garutmā, is the foremost of birds. *Offspring of Vinatā, Garura's mother.

data.v: बहुशो हि मया दृष्टः सागरे स महाबलः । भुजगानुद्धरन्पक्षी महावेगो महायशाः ।।
data.es: 'Garuda is very powerful, swift, and famous. I have seen him snatching serpents from the ocean many times.
data.anv: महाबलः very powerful, महावेगः very swift, महायशाः very famous, सः that, पक्षी bird, सागरे ocean, भुजङ्गान् serpents, उद्धरन् while snatching, मया by me, बहुशः many times, दृष्टः हि is seen.
data.md: Many a time and oft. I have see that exceedingly powerful, mighty-armed one, endowed with strength of will,-raise up serpents in the ocean.

data.v: पक्षयोर्यद्बलं तस्य तावद्भुजबलं तव । विक्रमश्चापि वेगश्च न ते तेनापहीयते ।।
data.es: 'The strength of your shoulders is equal to that of his (Garuda's) wings. Your speed and valour are no less.
data.anv: तस्य his, पक्षयोः of the wings, यत् such, बलम् strength, तव your, भुजबलम् the strength of your shoulders, तावत् so much, ते your, विक्रमश्चापि also courage, वेगश्च speed, तेन with him, न अपहीयते no less.
data.md: The strength that is in his wings, is equal to the might and virtues your arm.

data.v: बलं बुद्धिश्च तेजश्च सत्त्वं च हरिसत्तम । विशिष्टं सर्वभूतेषु किमात्मानं न बुध्यसे ।।
data.es: 'O leader of the monkeys you are superior in strength, wisdom, brilliance and valour to all beings. Why do you not realise your own strength?
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गव leader of the monkeys, बलम् strength, बुद्धिश्च wisdom, तेजश्च brilliance, सत्त्वम् valour, सर्वभूतेषु of all beings, विशिष्टम् superior, आत्मानम् your self, किम् why, न बुध्यसे do you not know that.
data.md: Your energy and prowess are not surpassed by him And your strength, and your understanding, your energy, and your vigour, O foremost of monkeys, (is known among all creatures). Why did not you prepare yourself furnished with everything that is noble or great, (for this feat)?

data.v: अप्सराप्सरसां श्रेष्ठा विख्याता पुञ्जिकस्थला । अज्ञनेति परिख्याता पत्नी केसरिणो हरेः ।।
data.anv: पुञ्जिकस्थला Punjikasthala, अप्सरसाम् among apsarasas, श्रेष्ठा eminent, विख्याता famous, अञ्जनेति by name Anjana, परिख्याता wellknown as, अप्सरा: apsara, हरेः monkeys, केसरिणः Kesari, पत्नी wife.

data.v: अभिशापादभूत्तात वानरी कामरूपिणी । दुहिता वानरेन्द्रस्य कुञ्जरस्य महात्मनः ।।
कपित्वे चारुसर्वाङ्गी कदाचित्कामरूपिणी । मानुषं विग्रहं कृत्वा यौवनोत्तमशालिनी ।।
अचरत्पर्वतस्याग्रे प्रावृडम्बुदसंनिभे । विचित्रमाल्याभरणा महार्हक्षौमवासिनी ।।
तस्या वस्त्रं विशालाक्ष्याः पीतं रक्तदशं शुभम् । स्थितायाः पर्वतस्याग्रे मारुतोऽपहरच्छनैः ।।
data.es: 'While the largeeyed lady was stationed on the mountain top, the Windgod gently let her auspicious yellow garment with red border fly away.
data.anv: पर्वतस्य mountain's, अग्रे on top, स्थितायाः stationed, विशालाक्ष्याः of largeeyed lady, तस्याः her, पीतं रक्तदशम् yellow with red border, शुभम् auspicious, वस्त्रम् garment, मारुतः Windgod, शनैः gently, अपाहरत् let it fly away.
data.md: It came moss that as that one of expansive eyes was standing on the mit of the mount, the Wind gently stole away her elegant bow cloth with crimson skirts.

data.v: स ददर्श ततस्तस्या वृत्तावूरू सुसंहतौ । स्तनौ च पीनौ सहितौ सुजातं चारु चाननम् ।।
data.es: 'Then he (Windgod) saw her curved, wellset thighs, her beautiful plump breasts and her lovely pleasing face.
data.anv: ततः then, सः he, तस्याः her, वृत्तौ curved, सुसंहतौ both wellset, ऊरू both thighs, पीनौ plump, सहितौ together, स्तनौ च two breasts, सुजातम् very beautiful, चारु pleasing, आननं च face, ददर्श saw.

data.v: तां विशालायतश्रोणीं तनुमध्यां यशस्विनीम् । दृष्ट्वैव शुभसर्वाग्नीं पवनः काममोहितः ।।
data.es: 'On seeing the broad hips, slender waist and beautiful limbs of that famous lady the Windgod was infatuated.
data.anv: विशालायतश्रोणीम् a lady of broad hips, तनुमध्याम् slender waist, यशस्विनीम् famed one, शुभसर्वाङ्गीम् a lady of beautiful limbs, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, पवनः Windgod, काममोहितः was infatuated.

data.v: स तां भुजाभ्यां पीनाभ्यां पर्यष्वजत मारुतः । मन्मथाविष्टसर्वाङ्गो गतात्मा तामनिन्दिताम् ।।
data.es: 'The Windgod lost his control over himself. His whole being was overpowered by love for her beautiful, flawless body. He embraced her with his long arms.
data.anv: अनिन्दिताम् blameless lady, ताम् her, गतात्मा lost his self, सः मारुतः that wind god, मन्मथाविष्टसर्वाङ्गः his whole body overpowered by love, दीर्घाभ्याम् with long ones, भुजाभ्याम् with shoulders, ताम् her, पर्यष्वजत embraced her.

data.v: सा तु तत्रैव संभ्रान्ता सुवृत्ता वाक्यमब्रवीत् । एकपत्नीव्रतमिदं को नाशयितुमिच्छति ।।
data.es: 'She was bewildered by this and being chaste and strict observer of chastiny she said, 'Who is it that has destroyed my monoandry?
data.anv: तत्रैव on that spot itself, सम्भ्रान्ता bewildered lady, सुव्रता a chaste woman, सा तु she was, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, इदम् this, एकपत्नीव्रतम् observing strict monoandry, कः who, नाशयितुम् to destroy, इच्छति is wishing?
data.md: There influenced by fear, that one of excellent vows said,-no is it that desireth to lay violent hands upon my chastity?

data.v: अञ्जनाया वचः श्रुत्वा मारुतः प्रत्यभाषत । न त्वां हिंसामि सुश्रोणि मा भूत्ते सुभगे भयम् ।।
data.es: 'On hearing Anjana's words, the Windgod replied, ' O auspicious lady, I do you no harm, O lady of beautiful hips. I reached (enjoyed) you in mind, not body. You need not fear.'
data.anv: अञ्जनायाः Anjana's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, मारुतः Windgod, प्रत्यभाषत replied, सुश्रोणि O woman of beautiful hips, त्वाम् you, न हिंसामि I do no harm, ते your, मनसः mind's, भयम् fear, मा भूत् do not entertain, सुभगे O auspicious lady
data.md: Hearing Anjana's words, the Wind answered, do not wrong you, O you of shapely hips. Let not her enter your heart.

data.v: मनसास्मि गतो यत्त्वां परिष्वज्य यशस्विनि । वीर्यवान्बुद्धिसंपन्नः पुत्रस्तव भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'O renowned lady I have embraced you and united with you mentally (enjoyed you without physical contact).You will bring forth a son endowed with great wisdom and courage.
data.anv: यशस्विनि O renowned woman, यत् such as, त्वाम् you, परिष्वज्य after embracing, मनसा mentally, गतः अस्मि I united with you, तव your, वीर्यवान् courageous, बुद्धिसम्पन्नः endowed with wisdom, पुत्रः son, भविष्यति will be born.
data.md: As, O famous damsel, by embracing the, I have mentally entered into your womb, you shall her a son, intelligent and endued with prowess.

data.v: अभ्युत्थितं ततः सूर्यं बालो दृष्ट्वा महावने । फलं चेति जिघृक्षुस्त्वमुत्प्लुत्याभ्यपतो दिवम् ।।
data.es: 'On seeing the rising Sun in the deep forest, mistaking him to be a fruit, you wanted to seize it, when you were young.You suddenly flew into the sky and went flying towards the Sun.
data.anv: ततः then, बालः a boy, त्वम् you, महावने in the deep forest, अभ्युत्थितम् rising, सूर्यम् Sun, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, फलं चेति treating it to be, जिघृक्षुः wished to seize, उत्प्लुत्य having jumped, दिवम् to sky, अभ्युद्गतः went flying.
data.md: In that mighty forest, you, a child, desirous of eating, seeing the sun risen, and taking on to be a fruit, sprang up and leaped into the sky.

data.v: शतानि त्रीणि गत्वाथ योजनानां महाकपे । तेजसा तस्य निर्धूतो न विषादं ततो गतः ।।
data.es: 'O great monkey you went three hundred yojanas and were pushed back by the Sun's radiance. Yet it did not leave you depressed.
data.anv: महाकपे O great monkey, अथ then, योजनानाम् of yojanas, त्रीणि three, शतानि गत्वा after covering a distance of three hundred, तस्य his, तेजसा in brilliance, निर्धूतः you were pushed back, ततः then, विषादम् dull, न not, गतः attained.
data.md: O mighty monkey, going three thousand Yojanas, you, struck by as energy, didst not feel poverty of spirit.

data.v: तावदापततस्तूर्णमन्तरिक्षं महाकपे । क्षिप्तमिन्द्रेण ते वज्रं क्रोधाविष्टेन धीमता ।।
data.es: 'O great monkey while falling fast in space, wise Indra hurled his thunderbolt quickly at you, in anger.
data.anv: महाकपे great monkey, तूर्णम् swiftly, अन्तरिक्षम् into space, कोपाविष्टेन in anger, धीमता by the wise, इन्द्रेण by Indra's, वज्रम् thunderbolt, ते at you, क्षिप्तम् hurled, तावत् so much, आपतत: while falling.
data.md: And, seeing you shing through the heavens, O mighty monkey, Indra, owing wrath, hurled his thunder-bolt at you.

data.v: ततः शैलाग्रशिखरे वामो हनुरभज्यत । ततो हि नामधेयं ते हनुमानिति कीर्त्यते ।।
data.es: 'You fell on the edge of the mountain peak and your left chin got broken. Since then you are widely known as Hanuman (one who has a wounded chin).
data.anv: तदा then, शैलाग्रशिखरे on the edge of the mountain peak, वामः left, हनुः chin, अभज्यत was broken, ततः then, ते your, नामधेयम् named, हनुमानिति Hanuman, कीर्त्यते wellknown.
data.md: Thereat, breaking your left jaw, you (didst fall) on the mountain From this circumstance, your name has been known Hanuman.

data.v: ततस्त्वां निहतं दृष्ट्वा वायुर्गन्धवहः स्वयम् । त्रैलोक्ये भृशसंक्रुद्धो न ववौ वै प्रभञ्जनः ।।
data.es: The Windgod who is a carrier of fragrance and breaker of trees became very angry on seeing (the injury on) you and stopped blowing in the three worlds.
data.anv: ततः then, गन्धवहः carrier of fragrance (Windgod), प्रभञ्जनः one who breaks (trees), वायुः wind, त्वाम् you, निहतम् hit दृष्ट्वा seeing, स्वयम् himself, भृशसङ्कृद्धुः became very angry, त्रैलोक्यम् in the three worlds, न ववौवै (windgod) did not blow wind.
data.md: Witnessing you beaten back, that bearer of fumes himself, the Wind, that breaketh everything before in wrath did not blow through the three worlds.

data.v: संभ्रान्ताश्च सुराः सर्वे त्रैलोक्ये क्षुभिते सति । प्रसादयन्ति संक्रुद्धं मारुतं भुवनेश्वराः ।।
data.anv: त्रैलोक्ये in all the three worlds, क्षुभिते सति  disturbed, भुवनेश्वराः all lords of the world, सर्वे all, सुराः Gods, संभ्रान्ताः became uneasy, संक्रुद्धम् angry, मारुतम् Maruta, प्रसादयन्ति propitiated.
data.md: Thereat, all gods-lords of the universeinfluenced by fear in consequence of the triune world waxing agitated, began to path the wrathful Wind.

data.v: प्रसादिते च पवने ब्रह्मा तुभ्यं वरं ददौ । अशस्त्रवध्यतां तात समरे सत्यविक्रम ।।
data.es: 'O dear when the Windgod was pleased, Brahma gave a boon to you, to appease his anger. The boon made you truly valiant so that you cannot be struck by any weapon and killed.
data.anv: समरे in war, सत्यविक्रम O truly valiant, तात o dear, पवने when the Windgod, प्रसादिते propitiated, ब्रह्मा Brahma, तुभ्यम् to you, अशस्त्रवध्यताम् cannot be killed by a weapon, वरम् boon, ददौ he gave.
data.md: And on the Wind being mollified, Bra conferred on him a boon, saying,–O child, O you of prowess, (your son) shall be incapable of being slain in be by means of weapons.'

data.v: वज्रस्य च निपातेन विरुजं त्वां समीक्ष्य च । सहस्रनेत्रः प्रीतात्मा ददौ ते वरमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'O lord observing that you are not hurt even when struck by the thunderbolt, Indra offered, one of the best boons to you, to choose to die only when you wish.
data.anv: प्रभो O lord, सहस्रनेत्रः the thousandeyed, वज्रस्य thunderbolt's, निपातेन by striking, त्वाम् you, विरुजम् not hurt, समीक्ष्य च on observing that, प्रीतात्मा a pleased self, तव your, स्वच्छन्दतः at your wish, मरणम् death, ते you, भूयात् will be, इति thus, उत्तमम् best, वरम् boon, ददौ gave.
data.md: And seeing him sustain (serious) injury consequent on the impact of the thunder. He of a thousand eyes, pleased in his soul, also confer on (you) and excellent boon, O lord, saying, 'Your death: take place according to your will.' *Hanuman.

data.v: स्वच्छन्दतश्च मरणं ते भूयादिति वै प्रभो । स त्वं केसरिणः पुत्रः क्षेत्रजो भीमविक्रमः ।।
मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रस्तेजसा चापि तत्समः । त्वं हि वायुसुतो वत्स प्लवने चापि तत्समः ।।
data.es: 'You are a son of Kesari endowed with terrific strength and a lawful son of Maruta also. You are, therefore, equal to the very Windgod in flying and in brilliance.
data.anv: भीमविक्रमः of terrific strength, सः त्वम् that you are, केसरिणः Kesari's, क्षेत्रजः the offspring (one of twelve sons according to Hindu scriptures), पुत्रः son, मारुतस्य Marutha's, औरसः पुत्रः lawful son, तेजसा with brilliance, तत्समश्च also equal to him, वत्स dear, वायुसुतः son of the Windgod, त्वम् you, प्लवने in flying, च अपि also, तत्समः हि equal to.

data.v: वयमद्य गतप्राणा भवानस्मासु साम्प्रतम् । दाक्ष्यविक्रमसंपन्नः पक्षिराज इवापरः ।।
data.es: 'Now we have almost lost our life.You are our saviour like another monkeyking (like Garuda, king of birds).You are fully endowed with valour and courage.
data.anv: अद्य now, वयम् we, गतप्राणाः almost lost our life, भवान् you, साम्प्रतम् at present, त्रातु you may save us, दाक्ष्यविक्रमसम्पन्नः fully endowed with valour and courage, अपरः another, कपिराजः monkey king, इव like.
data.md: The are the son of the Wind, my child-equal to him in power of leaping. Now we are without our lives. And you, endowed with dexterity and vigour, and like another I of the monkeys,+ are before us. *Sugriva.

data.v: त्रिविक्रमे मया तात सशैलवनकानना । त्रिः सप्तकृत्वः पृथिवी परिक्रान्ता प्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: 'O dear when Visnu (Vamana incarnate) took three strides I circumambulated the whole earth including its mountains and trees twentyone times.
data.anv: तात dear, त्रिविक्रमे when Visnu took three strides, सशैलवनकानना with its mountains, trees and forests, पृथिवी the whole earth, मया by me, त्रिस्सप्तकृत्वः twenty one times, प्रदक्षिणम् परिक्रान्ता circumambulated.
data.md: On the occasion of Vişnu enveloping the earth with three steps, I, O child, had circa ambulated the earth with her mountains, woods and fore one and twenty times.

data.v: तदा चौषधयोऽस्माभिः संचिता देवशासनात् । निष्पन्नममृतं याभिस्तदासीन्नो महद्बलम् ।।
data.es: 'Then on receiving orders from the gods, we collected medicinal herbs and nectar which gave us great strength.
data.anv: तदा then, देवशासनात् by the command of the gods, याभिः by those, अमृतम् nectar, निष्पन्नम् produced, ओषधयः herbs, अस्माभिः by us, सञ्चिताः are collected, तदानीम्  then, नः for us, बलम् strength, महत् great.
data.md: Then, commissioned by the gods, had gathered annuals, which (bcing cast on the deep), cat ambrosia to come out after churning. At that time, god was our strength.

data.v: स इदानीमहं वृद्धः परिहीनपराक्रमः । साम्प्रतं कालमस्माकं भवान्सर्वगुणान्वितः ।।
data.es: 'I have become old and my valour is depleted. At this time you are the sole resort for us. You have all the necessary qualities.
data.anv: इदानीम् as such, वृद्धः old, सः अहम् I being, परिहीनपराक्रमः my valour is depleted, साम्प्रतं कालम् at this time, भवान् you have, अस्माकम् for us, सर्वगुणान्वितः endowed with all qualities.
data.md: But now I have grown old, and prowess has left me. At present we have you, furnish with every virtue.

data.v: तद्विजृम्भस्व विक्रान्तः प्लवतामुत्तमो ह्यसि । त्वद्वीर्यं द्रष्टुकामेयं सर्वा वानरवाहिनी ।।
data.es: 'Cheer up and advance.You are the best among the creatures that can leap.The entire army of monkeys want to see your valour.
data.anv: विक्रान्तः cheer up, तत् that, विजृम्भस्व expand yourself, प्लवताम् among the leaping ones, उत्तमः the best, असि हि you are, सर्वा entire, वानरवाहिनी monkey army, त्वद्वीर्यम् your valour, द्रष्टुकामा हि desiring to see.
data.md: Therefore, possessed of vigour, do I bestir yourself, and bound over (the main). You are the qualified of all. This entire monkey host is eager to bell your prowess.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ हरिशार्दूल लङ्घयस्व महार्णवम् । परा हि सर्वभूतानां हनुमन्या गतिस्तव ।।
data.es: 'O tiger among monkeys get up. Come and sleep on the best of beds. Best of kings, you should not lie on the ground.
data.anv: हरिशार्दूल O tiger among monkeys, हनुमन् O Hanuman, उत्तिष्ठ rise up, महार्णवम् great ocean, लङ्घयस्व cross, तव your, या such, गतिः capacity, सर्वभूतानाम् among all beings, परा हि indeed supreme.
data.md: O redoubtable monkey, do you arise! leap over the mighty ocean. Your motion, Hanumān, asseth that of all beings.

data.v: विषाण्णा हरयः सर्वे हनुमन्किमुपेक्षसे । विक्रमस्व महावेगो विष्णुस्त्रीन्विक्रमानिव ।।
data.es: 'O Hanuman All the monkeys look dejected. Why do you delay? O warrior, act quick with your rapid speed like Trivikrama who took three strides that covered the entire universe'.
data.anv: हनुमन् O Hanuman, सर्वे all, हरयः monkeys, विषण्णाः are dejected, किम् why, उपेक्षसे do you delay, महावेग O warrior of great speed, विष्णुः Visnu, त्रीन् three, विक्रमानिव like Trivikrama, विक्रमस्व you move fast.
data.md: All the monkeys are depressed. O Hanuman, did you overlook this? Put forth your you endowed with mighty vehemence, like Vişnu sing over the three worlds in three steps.

data.v: ततस्तु वै जाम्बवताभिचोदितः; प्रतीतवेगः पवनात्मजः कपिः । प्रहर्षयंस्तां हरिवीर वाहिनीं; चकार रूपं महदात्मनस्तदा ।।
data.md: Exhorted by foremost of monkeys, that one famed for has speech, that key, the offspring of the Wind-god, gladdening the monkey-chiefs, wore (a fit) shape for crossing the ocean.* *Another epithet of Hanumān, Pavanātmaja-son to the Wind?? on the score of Redundency.

data.v: संस्तूयमानो हनुमान्व्यवर्धत महाबलः । समाविध्य च लाङ्गूलं हर्षाच्च बलमेयिवान् ।।
data.es: The monkeys praised the mighty Hanuman as he grew in size whirling his tail around joyfully.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, हनुमान् Hanuman, संस्तूयमानः being praised, हर्षात् joyfully, बलम् strength, उपेयिवान् assumed, लाङ्गूलम् tail, समाविध्य whirling, व्यवर्धत grew.

data.v: तस्य संस्तूयमानस्य सर्वैर्वानरपुंगवैः । तेजसापूर्यमाणस्य रूपमासीदनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: As Hanuman was being praised by the monkey leaders, his body filled with lustre. It looked excellent.
data.anv: सर्वैः by all, वानरपुङ्गवैः by monkey leaders, संस्तूयमानस्य of him being praised, तेजसा with lustre, पूर्यमाणस्य who was filled, तस्य his, रूपम् body, अनुत्तमम् excellent, आसीत् became.
data.md: As, extolled by the principal derly monkeys, he became fraught with effulgence, his beauty as great. .

data.v: यथा विजृम्भते सिंहो विवृद्धो गिरिगह्वरे । मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रस्तथा संप्रति जृम्भते ।।
data.es: Just as a lion grown in a mountain cave stretches its body, the Windgod's son stretched (his limbs) at that time.

data.v: ऋषीणां च प्रसादेन कपिवृद्धमतेन च । गुरूणां च प्रसादेन प्लवस्व त्वं महार्णवम् ।।
data.es: 'By the blessings of the sages and by the grace of the elderly monkeys may you cross over the vast ocean.
data.anv: ऋषीणाम् of sages, प्रसादेन by the grace, कपिवृद्धमतेन च elderly monkeys', गुरूणाम् of elderlies, प्रसादेन by grace, च and, त्वम् you, महार्णवम् vast ocean, प्लवस्य cross.
data.md: By the grace of the saints, and with the permission of the aged monkeys, and by the blessing of the superiors, do you bound over the mighty main.

data.v: स्थास्यामश्चैकपादेन यावदागमनं तव । त्वद्गतानि च सर्वेषां जीवितानि वनौकसाम् ।।
data.anv: तव your, आगमनं यावत् awaiting your arrival, एकपादेन on one foot, स्थास्यामः we will stand, सर्वेषाम् of all of us, वनौकसाम् of forestdwellers, जीवनानि lives, त्वद्गतानि will depend upon you.
data.md: Till you return, we shall stay on one leg. The lives of all these rangers of the forest shall go along with you. *i.e. practise austerities on your behalf.

data.v: ततस्तु हरिशार्दूलस्तानुवाच वनौकसः । नेयं मम मही वेगं प्लवने धारयिष्यति ।।
data.es: Then the tiger among monkeys, Hanuman said to those forestdwellers (monkeys), 'The earth cannot bear the thrust of my leaping.
data.anv: ततः then, हरिशार्दूलः tiger among monkeys, तान् to those, वनौकसः monkeys, उवाच said, इयं this, मही earth, मम my, वेगम् speed, लङ्घने while crossing, न धारयिष्यति it cannot sustain.
data.md: Then that tiger-like monkey said to those rangers of the woods, None in this world would be able to sustain my impetus in the act of bounding.

data.v: एतानि हि नगस्यास्य शिलासंकटशालिनः । शिखराणि महेन्द्रस्य स्थिराणि च महान्ति च ।।
data.es: 'The rocks on the peaks of the ranges of mount Mahendra cannot with stand it, although they are huge and firm.
data.anv: शिलासङ्कटशालिनः the rocks of the mountain ranges, अस्य of this, महेन्द्रस्य नगरस्य Mahendra mountain's, एतानि these, शिखराणि peaks, स्थिराणि stable, सुमहान्ति च are very  huge.
data.md: Here are these summits, firm and spacious, of this mountain, Mahendra, thronged with crags. I shall rush forward from these summits of Mahendra, interspersed with trees and adorned with masses of ore.

data.v: एतानि मम निष्पेषं पादयोः पततां वराः । प्लवतो धारयिष्यन्ति योजनानामितः शतम् ।।
data.es: 'O great monkeys these mountain peaks can withstand the crushing force of my feet as I leap over a hundred yojanas.
data.anv: इतः from here, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतम् one hundred, प्लवतः for me as I leap, मम to me, निष्पेषं crushing force of, पादयोः of both feet, प्लवतां वरा: best among those who leap, धारयिष्यन्ति will withstand.
data.md: As I leap over a hundred Yojanas, these mighty summits shall sustain my impetus.

data.v: ततस्तु मारुतप्रख्यः स हरिर्मारुतात्मजः । आरुरोह नगश्रेष्ठं महेन्द्रमरिमर्दनः ।।
वृतं नानाविधैर्वृक्षैर्मृगसेवितशाद्वलम् । लताकुसुमसंबाधं नित्यपुष्पफलद्रुमम् ।।
सिंहशार्दूलचरितं मत्तमातङ्गसेवितम् । मत्तद्विजगणोद्घुष्टं सलिलोत्पीडसंकुलम् ।।
महद्भिरुच्छ्रितं शृङ्गैर्महेन्द्रं स महाबलः । विचचार हरिश्रेष्ठो महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः ।।
data.es: The mighty, preeminent monkey who was equal to Indra in valour took a leap from the high peaks of the tall mountain, Mahendra৷৷
data.anv: महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः equal to Indra in valour, महाबलः mighty, हरिश्रेष्ठः best of the monkeys, महद्भि: great, शृङ्गैः with peaks, उच्छ्रितम् high, तम् him, महेन्द्रम् Mahendra, विचचार strode.

data.v: पादाभ्यां पीडितस्तेन महाशैलो महात्मना । ररास सिंहाभिहतो महान्मत्त इव द्विपः ।।
data.es: Crushed by the feet of the great self, Hanuman, the huge mountain looked like a proud elephant struck by a lion.
data.anv: महात्मना by great self, तेन by him, बाहुभ्याम् with both his shoulders, पीडितः crushed, महाशैलः mighty mountain, सिंहाभिहतः struck by a lion, मत्तः proud, महान् great, द्विपः इव like an elephant, रराज looked.
data.md: Thereat, hurt by the arms of that high-souled one, the mighty mountain began to cry,* like a mighty mad elephant tormented by a lion. *Through the voices of the animals inhabiting it.

data.v: मुमोच सलिलोत्पीडान्विप्रकीर्णशिलोच्चयः । वित्रस्तमृगमातङ्गः प्रकम्पितमहाद्रुमः ।।
data.es: The rocks of the mountain got scattered by the force. The deer and elephants were terrified. The trees were shaken up violently and streams of water gushed forth.
data.anv: विप्रकीर्णशिलोच्चयः scattered rocks, वित्रस्तमृगमातङ्गः terrified deer and elephants, प्रकम्पितमहाद्रुमः violently shaken up trees, सलिलोत्पीडान् poured out gushing streams of water, मुमोच released.

data.v: नानागन्धर्वमिथुनैः पानसंसर्गकर्कशैः । उत्पतद्भिर्विहंगैश्च विद्याधरगणैरपि ।।
data.es: Shaken by the rude shock, couples of intoxicated gandharvas left in a huff the vast slopes of the great mountain. Flocks of birds and groups of vidyadharas flew away. The serpents went into hiding. Rocks fell off the shaken mountain.
data.anv: तदा then, सः महागिरिः that great mountain, पानसंसर्गकर्कशैः by those whose behaviour was rough in a drunken state, नानागन्धर्वमिथुनैः by different groups of copulating gandharvas, उत्पतद्भि: by those flying, विहगैश्च by birds in the sky, विद्याधरगणैरपि hosts of vidyadharas, त्यज्यमानमहासानुः abandoned by the vast mountain slopes, सन्निलीनमहोरगः with serpents resting, चलशृङ्गशिलोद्घातः the rocks shaken up on mountain tops, अभूत् appeared.

data.v: त्यज्यमानमहासानुः संनिलीनमहोरगः । शैलशृङ्गशिलोद्घातस्तदाभूत्स महागिरिः ।।

data.v: निःश्वसद्भिस्तदा तैस्तु भुजगैरर्धनिःसृतैः । सपताक इवाभाति स तदा धरणीधरः ।।
data.es: The serpents with their bodies half protruded out of the rocks and hissing looked like flags planted on the mountain.
data.anv: तदा then, सः that, धरणीधरः holder of the earth, mountain, निश्वसद्भि: hissing out of the rocks, अर्धनि:सृतैः protruding half of their body, भुजगैः serpents, सपताकः इव like the flags, आभाति appeared.
data.md: With its serpents hissing, with their bodies half issuing (from their holes), the mountain seemed as if it shone with pennons displayed. And the heap of crags forsaken by saints exercised with fear and agitation, looked doleful, like a wayfarer left in a vast forest by his companions.

data.v: ऋषिभिस्त्रास संभ्रान्तैस्त्यज्यमानः शिलोच्चयः । सीदन्महति कान्तारे सार्थहीन इवाध्वगः ।।
data.es: The alarmed and agitated sages abandonned the mountain peaks.The mountain appeared like a lone traveller separated from the caravan in the great forest.
data.anv: त्राससम्भ्रान्तै: by those alarmed and agitated, ऋषिभिः by sages, त्यज्यमानः being abandoned, शिलोच्चयः the mountain, सार्थहीनः berefit of a caravan, महति in a great, कान्तारे in the forest, सीदन् while worrying, अध्वगः इव like the traveller.
data.md: With its serpents hissing, with their bodies half issuing (from their holes), the mountain seemed as if it shone with pennons displayed. And the heap of crags forsaken by saints exercised with fear and agitation, looked doleful, like a wayfarer left in a vast forest by his companions.

data.v: स वेगवान्वेगसमाहितात्मा; हरिप्रवीरः परवीरहन्ता । मनः समाधाय महानुभावो; जगाम लङ्कां मनसा मनस्वी ।।
data.es: Magnanimous, wise and heroic Hanuman, destroyer of enemy warriors, fixed his attention on speed, betook himself mentally to Lanka (ere he reached it physically). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामाणये वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वेगवान् speeds, वेगसमाहितात्मा fixing his attention on speed, परवीरहन्ता destroyer of enemy warriors, मनस्वी sensitive , महानुभावः noble, सः that, हरिप्रवीरः heroic monkey मनः in mind, समाधाय composed, मनसा mentally, लङ्काम् Lanka, जगाम reached.
data.md: That intelligent, magnanimous and heroic monkey-destroyer of hostile heroes, endowed with speed, concentrating his soul on his energy, mentally went to Lankā.

data.v: ततो रावणनीतायाः सीतायाः शत्रुकर्शनः । इयेष पदमन्वेष्टुं चारणाचरिते पथि ।।
data.es: Hanuman, crusher of enemies resolved to find the whereabouts of Sita, carried away by Ravana. He followed the path of the Charanas, celestial bards.
data.anv: ततः then, शत्रुकर्शनः crusher off enemies, रावणनीतायाः carried by Ravana, सीतायाः Sita's, पदम् whereabouts, अन्वेष्टुम् to search, चारणाचरिते where charanas the celestial bards move, पथि way, इयेष resolved .
data.md: Hanumăn then resolved to travel through the air or the path of Cāraņas (heavens), in quest of Jānaki who had taken away by Rävaņa.

data.v: अथ वैदूर्यवर्णेषु शाद्वलेषु महाबलः । धीरः सलिलकल्पेषु विचचार यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: Tawnyhued Hanuman, gifted with extraordinary strength and patience happily strolled on the marshy tracts of grassy land which had the colour of vaidurya.
data.anv: अथ then, महाबलः mighty, धीरः calm, वैडूर्यवर्णेषु of the colour of vaidurya (tawny), सलिलकल्पेषु on the sheet of water (marshy land with green grass that looked like sheet of water), शाद्वलेषु on green grassy lands, यथासुखम् very easily, विचचार strdled.

data.v: द्विजान्वित्रासयन्धीमानुरसा पादपान्हरन् । मृगांश्च सुबहून्निघ्नन्प्रवृद्ध इव केसरी ।।
data.es: Wise Hanuman went about like a lion scaring away birds, uprooting trees with his chest, and trampling many animals.
data.anv: धीमान् wise, द्विजान् birds, वित्रासयन् scaring, उरसा with his chest, पादपान् trees, हरन् uprooting, प्रवृद्धः grown, केसरी इव like a lion, सुबहून् groups, मृगांश्च animals also, निघ्नन् trampling.
data.md: Then he, wise and mighty monkey walked over the earth, green with grass, with irresistible steps. At that time, he brushed aside all animals like a lion and crushed down many trees, and thereby scared away the feathered denizens of the forest.

data.v: स तस्य गिरिवर्यस्य तले नागवरायुते । तिष्ठन्कपिवरस्तत्र ह्रदे नाग इवाबभौ ।।
data.es: As the monkey leader stood at the foot of the great mountain filled with lordly elephants he looked like an elephant standing at the centre of a pond.
data.anv: सः that, कपिवरः leader of monkeys, तत्र there, नागवरायुते with lordly elephants, तस्य गिरिवर्यस्य at the great mountain, तले foot, तिष्ठन् stood, ह्रदे centre, नागः इव like elephant, अबभौ looked.

data.v: स सूर्याय महेन्द्राय पवनाय स्वयम्भुवे । भूतेभ्यश्चाञ्जलिं कृत्वा चकार गमने मतिम् ।।
data.es: Offering salutations with folded palms to the Sungod, to Mahendra, lord of the gods, to the windgod, to the Creator Brahma and to all the attendants of lord Siva, made up his mind to proceed (to Lanka).
data.anv: सः that, सूर्याय to the Sun, महेन्द्राय to Mahendra, lord of the gods, पवनाय to the wind god, स्वयंभुवे to the creator, Brahma, भूतेभ्यः the attendants of lord Siva अञ्जलिम् salutations with folded palms, कृत्वा offered, गमने to go, मतिम् resolution, चकार he made.
data.md: After this, he bowed down to the Sun, Indra, Svayambhu, Wind-god, and all beings with joined palms and then facing the west he saluted his father and then began to increase in dimension like the sea.

data.v: अञ्जलिं प्राङ्मुखः कुर्वन्पवनायात्मयोनये । ततो हि ववृधे गन्तुं दक्षिणो दक्षिणां दिशम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, endowed with great equanimity, facing the east and joining his palms by way of salutaion to the Windgod, his father, he enlarged his size and turned south in order to depart.
data.anv: प्राङ्मुखः facing the east, आत्मयोनये his father, पवनाय windgod, अञ्जलिम् salutations with folded palms, कृत्वा having offered, ततः then, दक्षिण with equanimity, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern direction, गन्तुम् to depart, ववृधे हि grew in size.
data.md: After this, he bowed down to the Sun, Indra, Svayambhu, Wind-god, and all beings with joined palms and then facing the west he saluted his father and then began to increase in dimension like the sea.

data.v: प्लवंगप्रवरैर्दृष्टः प्लवने कृतनिश्चयः । ववृधे रामवृद्ध्यर्थं समुद्र इव पर्वसु ।।
data.es: Having made up his mind to leap for the cause of Rama, Hanuman began to grow in size just as the sea grows during the fullmoon and newmoon days, while the monkey troops were watching.
data.anv: प्लवङ्गप्रवरैः the monkey troops, दृष्टः were gazing, प्लवने  taking leap, कृतनिश्चयः  resolved, पर्वसु during the fullmoon days, समुद्रः इव like the sea, रामवृद्ध्यर्थम् for the welfare of Rama, ववृधे began to grow in size.
data.md: The foremost of the Vānaras at this stared at him, he swelled in size for the purpose of Rāma as the ocean swells on the full-moon days.

data.v: निष्प्रमाण शरीरः सँल्लिलङ्घयिषुरर्णवम् । बाहुभ्यां पीडयामास चरणाभ्यां च पर्वतम् ।।
data.es: Having swollen to an immeasurable figure, he pressed on the mountain with his feet and hands in an attempt to cross the ocean.
data.anv: अर्णवम् ocean, लिलङ्घयिषुः one wishing to cross over, निष्प्रमाणशरीरः having an immeasurable figure, सन् while being, बाहुभ्याम् with both his arms, चरणाभ्यां च and with feet, पर्वतम् mountain, पीडयामास pressed.
data.md: Hanumān got ready for crossing the ocean having grown his body immensely. He caught hold tightly of the mountain with his hands and feet.

data.v: स चचालाचलाश्चारु मुहूर्तं कपिपीडितः । तरूणां पुष्पिताग्राणां सर्वं पुष्पमशातयत् ।।

data.v: प्लवमानं समीक्ष्याथ भुजङ्गाः सागरालयाः । व्योम्नि तं कपिशार्दूलं सुपर्णमिति मेनिरे ।।
data.es: Seeing Hanuman, the tiger among vanaras, coursing through the sky the serpents in their seaabode mistook him for Garuda.
data.anv: अथ and then, व्योम्नि in the sky, प्लवमानम् coursing through, तं कपिशार्दूलम् that tiger among vanaras, समीक्ष्य seeing, सागरालयाः those in the abode of the sea, भुजङ्गाः serpents, सुपर्णः इति to be Garuda, मेनिरे thought.
data.md: And sea-serpents, seeing that tiger-like monkey proceeding in the sky, took him for Suparna himself.

data.v: दशयोजनविस्तीर्णा त्रिंशद्योजनमायता । छाया वानरसिंहस्य जले चारुतराभवत् ।।
data.es: The shadow of Hanuman, the lion among monkeys, thirty yojanas long and ten yojanas in breadth appeared more pleasing৷৷
data.anv: दशयोजनविस्तीर्णा spread over ten yojanas in breadth, त्रिंशद्योजनम् thirty yojanas, आयता long, वानरसिंहस्य of the lion among monkeys, छाया shadow, जले in water, चारुतरा more pleasing, अभवत् looked.
data.md: The shadow the leonine monkey, measuring ten Yojanas in width and thirty in length, seemed the handsome in consequence of his speed.

data.v: श्वेताभ्रघनराजीव वायुपुत्रानुगामिनी । तस्य सा शुशुभे छाया वितता लवणाम्भसि ।।
data.es: The broad shadow of the son of the Windgod in the sea following him shone like a dark row of clouds sailing in the pristine sky.
data.anv: वायुपुत्रानुगामिनी following the Windgod's son, लवणाम्भसि in the salty sea, वितता spread out, तस्य his, सा that, छाया shadow, श्वेताभ्रघनराजीव like dark row of clouds sailing in the pristine sky, शुशुभे shone.
data.md: That shadow resembling masses of white clouds, rallying on the salt waters and following the wind-god's son, seemed exceedingly beautiful. on more

data.v: प्लवमानं तु तं दृष्ट्वा प्लवगं त्वरितं तदा । ववृषुः पुष्पवर्षाणि देवगन्धर्वदानवाः ।।
data.es: Then seeing Hanuman crossing quickly, the gods, gandharvas and demons rained flowers on him.
data.anv: तदा then, त्वरितम् quickly, प्लवमानम् crossing, तं प्लवङ्गम् that monkey, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, देवगन्धर्वदानवाः deva, gandharvas and danavas, पुष्पवर्षाणि rain of flowers, ववर्षुः rained.
data.md: Beholding that monkey engaged in bounding with celerity, gods, Gandharvas and Dānavas began to strew blossoms (on him).

data.v: तताप न हि तं सूर्यः प्लवन्तं वानरेश्वरम् । सिषेवे च तदा वायू रामकार्यार्थसिद्धये ।।
data.es: The Sun spared Hanuman from the heat and even the Windgod served him, blowing cool while he was taking leaps in order to fulfil Rama's mission.
data.anv: तदा then, प्लवन्तम् while he was leaping, तं वानरोत्तमम् that best of vanaras, सूर्यः Sun, रामकार्यार्थसिद्धये for accomplishing Rama's task, न हि तताप  did not discharge heat, वायुः च and even wind, सिषेवे served cool.
data.md: As he was leaping, the Sun did not burn him; and the Wind ministered to him, for the success of Rāma's work.

data.v: ऋषयस्तुष्टुवुश्चैनं प्लवमानं विहायसा । जगुश्च देवगन्धर्वाः प्रशंसन्तो महौजसं ।।
data.es: The sages praised him while he was coursing through the sky, the gods and gandharvas sang in praise of him extolling his majesty and vigour.
data.anv: विहायसा in the sky, प्लवमानम् while he leaped, महौजसम् a highly vigourous one, ऋषयः ascetics, तुष्टुवुश्चैनं extolled him, देवगन्धर्वाः gods and gandharvas, प्रशंसन्तः while prasing him, जगुश्च also sang.
data.md: And the saints hymned his praises, as he was leaping on in the sky. And applauding the ranger of forests, they raised the voice of song.

data.v: नागाश्च तुष्टुवुर्यक्षा रक्षांसि विबुधाः खगाः । प्रेक्ष्याकाशे कपिवरं सहसा विगतक्लमम् ।।
data.es: Observing the unwearied monkey the nagas, yakshas, the demons (protecting the southwest), the learned sages and birds praised him.
data.anv: विगतक्लमम् unwearied, कपिवरम् the great monkey, प्रेक्ष्य observing, सहसा at once, नागाश्च nagas, यक्षाः yakshas, रक्षांसि rakshasas (who were protecting the southwest), विबुधाः learned sages, खगाः birds, सर्वे all, तुष्टुवुः praised .
data.md: Nagas and Yaksas, and various (races of) Raksasas, eulogized (him), on beholding that tiger-like monkey, Hanumān, in the act of bounding.

data.v: तस्मिन्प्लवगशार्दूले प्लवमाने हनूमति । इक्ष्वाकुकुलमानार्थी चिन्तयामास सागरः ।।
data.es: While the monkeychief was leaping (across the sea) the Seagod wished the wellbeing of the Ikshvaku family and honoured him. (The Seagod belonged to the same race) :
data.anv: प्लवगशार्दूले when the tiger among vanaras, तस्मिन् हनूमति when that monkeychief, प्लवमाने while leaping, सागरः the Seagod, इक्ष्वाकुकुलमानार्थी wishing the wellbeing and honour of the Ikshvaku family, चिन्तयामास started thinking.
data.md: Hanumān, that lord of monkeys, being engaged in the act of bounding, the Ocean, who sought to do honour to the race of Ikşvāku within himself.

data.v: साहाय्यं वानरेन्द्रस्य यदि नाहं हनूमतः । करिष्यामि भविष्यामि सर्ववाच्यो विवक्षताम् ।।
data.es: 'If I fail to help the monkeychief, the wise will blame me'.
data.anv: अहम् I, वानरेन्द्रस्य of the chief of monkeys, हनूमतः Hanuman's, साहाय्यम् help, न करिष्यामि यदि if I do not render, विवक्षताम् by all the wise speakers, सर्ववाच्यः will be  blamed, भविष्यामि I will be.
data.md: He said himself, ‘Truly shall I be blamed of all persons if I do not assist this lord of monkeys-Hanumān.'

data.v: अहमिक्ष्वाकुनाथेन सगरेण विवर्धितः । इक्ष्वाकुसचिवश्चायं नावसीदितुमर्हति ।।
data.es: 'I expanded on account of a scion of the Ikshvaku race (Sagara) and I should not do anything to make him (Hanuman) suffer since he is the minister helping the Ikshvaku race'.
data.anv: अहम् I, इक्ष्वाकुनाथेन by the scion of the Ikshvakus, सगरेण by Sagara, विवर्धितः made to extend , इक्ष्वाकुसचिवः च and the minister of Ikshvaku race, अयम् this person, अवसीदितुम् to perish, नार्हति he shouldl not.
data.md: Reared I have been by Sagara, the foremost of the race of the Ikşvākus and this monkey is their counsellor. It therefore dose not behove me to tire him out.

data.v: तथा मया विधातव्यं विश्रमेत यथा कपिः । शेषं च मयि विश्रान्तः सुखेनातिपतिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'I will have to make arrangements for his rest. Later he can resume his journey comfortably'.
data.anv: कपिः monkey, यथा likewise, विश्रमेत he may take rest, तथा in that way, मया by myself, विधातव्यम् arrangement has to be made, मयि on me, विश्रान्तः the rest, शेषम् remaining, सुखेन comfortably, अतिपतिष्यति will leap over.
data.md: It become me to do that by which the monkey may take rest in me and, relieved, may happily traverse the remaining way.

data.v: इति कृत्वा मतिं साध्वीं समुद्रश्छन्नमम्भसि । हिरण्यनाभं मैनाकमुवाच गिरिसत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Having resolved in his mind, the Seagod addressed the noble, golden mount Mainaka, hidden in the sea:
data.anv: समुद्रः the Seagod, इति thus, साध्वीं well, मतिम् in his mind, कृत्वा after resolving, अम्भसि in waters, छन्नम् hidden, हिरण्यनाभम् golden, गिरिसत्तमम् noble mountain, मैनाकम् to Mainaka, उवाच said.
data.md: Having arrived at this wholesome resolution, the Ocean spake upto that best of mountains, Maināka, hued in gold and situate in the waters, saying.

data.v: त्वमिहासुरसंघानां पातालतलवासिनाम् । देवराज्ञा गिरिश्रेष्ठ परिघः संनिवेशितः ।।
data.es: 'O foremost mountain you are kept here by Indra, lord of the gods as a barrier against the intrusion of demons residing in the netherworld.
data.anv: गिरिश्रेष्ठ O foremost mountain, त्वम् you, इह here, पातालतलवासिनाम् for those residing in the nether world, असुरसङ्घानाम् of hordes of demons, परिघः beam used as a barrier against the gateway, देवराज्ञा by the lord of the gods, सन्निवेशितः arranged.
data.md: O lord, you had been placed here by the king of celestials as an outer gate against the Asuras inhabiting the region under the earth.

data.v: त्वमेषां ज्ञातवीर्याणां पुनरेवोत्पतिष्यताम् । पातालस्याप्रमेयस्य द्वारमावृत्य तिष्ठसि ।।
data.es: "You are staying at the entrance preventing the violent demons of the immeasurable nether world from jumping onto the surface.
data.anv: जातवीर्याणाम् of the violent, एषाम् for these, पुनरेव again, उत्पतिष्यताम् prone to come up, त्वम् you, अप्रमेयस्य of the immeasurable, पातालस्य nether world's, द्वारम् entrance, आवृत्य  blocking, तिष्ठसि are staying.
data.md: You too, from then, had been waiting at this gate, unapproachable by the Asuras, rising up again and again and whose prowess is wellknown (to the Lord of celestials)

data.v: तिर्यगूर्ध्वमधश्चैव शक्तिस्ते शैलवर्धितुम् । तस्मात्संचोदयामि त्वामुत्तिष्ठ नगसत्तम ।।
data.es: "O noble mountain you have the capacity to grow across, upward and downward by your free will. I therefore prompt you to grow.
data.anv: शैल O mountain, तिर्यक् across, ऊर्ध्वम् upward, अधश्चैव and at the bottom, वर्धितुम् to grow, ते to you, शक्तिः energy, गिरिसत्तम O noble mountain, तस्मात् therefore, त्वाम् you, सञ्चोदयामि I am prompting, उत्तिष्ठ you mary rise.
data.md: O mountain, you are capable of expanding yourself upwards, downwards and on they sides. I do command you therefore, O best of mountains, to rise up.

data.v: स एष कपिशार्दूलस्त्वामुपर्येति वीर्यवान् । हनूमान्रामकार्यार्थं भीमकर्मा खमाप्लुतः ।।
data.es: "Valiant Hanuman, a tiger among monkeys and a performer of dreadful deeds, is flying over you to fulfil Rama's mission
data.anv: कपिशार्दूलः a tiger among monkeys, वीर्यवान् valiant one, भीमकर्मा a performer of dreadful deeds, सः एषः that great personality, हनूमान् Hanuman, रामकार्यार्थम् on account of Rama's work, खम् in the sky, आप्लुतः flew, त्वाम् you उपरि over, एति you
data.md: That best of monkeys, the energetic Hanumān, the performer of mighty deeds, engaged in Rāma's service, worn out with fatigue, wait above you. Beholding the exhaustion of that leader of monkeys, it behove you to rise up.

data.v: तस्य साह्यं मया कार्यमिक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्तिनः । मम इक्ष्वाकवः पूज्याः परं पूज्यतमास्तव ।।
data.es: "I should help him for he is working for the welfare of the Ikshavaku family. The Ikshvaku kings are worthy of adoration to me and for you as well.
data.anv: अस्य to him, इक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्तिनः for him who serves the Ikshvaku race, मया by me, साह्यम् help, कार्यम् should be given, मम to myself, इक्ष्वाकवः the kings of the Ikshvaku race, पूज्याः worthy of adoration, तव  to you, पूज्यतमाः most adorable .

data.v: कुरु साचिव्यमस्माकं न नः कार्यमतिक्रमेत् । कर्तव्यमकृतं कार्यं सतां मन्युमुदीरयेत् ।।
data.es: "You may act as our minister and let us not miss this chance. Pious men lose their cool if a worthy act is left unfulfilled.
data.anv: अस्माकम् for us, साचिव्यम् counselling (the duty of a minister), कुरु you may do, नः for us, कार्यम् task, न अतिक्रमेत् may not be lost, कर्तव्यम् our duty, कार्यम्  task, अकृतम् not carried out, सताम् for pious men, मन्युम् anger, उदीरयेत् will cause.

data.v: सलिलादूर्ध्वमुत्तिष्ठ तिष्ठत्वेष कपिस्त्वयि । अस्माकमतिथिश्चैव पूज्यश्च प्लवतां वरः ।।
data.es: "Rise up from the waters. Let him rest on you since this noble monkey is our guest and worthy of worship.
data.anv: सलिलात् from the waters, ऊर्ध्वम् above, उत्तिष्ठ rise, अस्माकम् for us, अतिथिश्चैव guest also, पूज्यश्च worthy of worship also, प्लवताम् among the jumping ones, वरः noble, एषः कपिः this monkey, त्वयि on you, तिष्ठतु let him rest.

data.v: चामीकरमहानाभ देवगन्धर्वसेवित । हनूमांस्त्वयि विश्रान्तस्ततः शेषं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: "O goldenpeaked mountainyou are the refuge of the gods and gandharvas. Let him also rest on you for a while before he negotiates the remaining part of the journey.
data.anv: चामीकरमहानाभ O goldenpeaked one, देवगन्धर्व सेवित resorted to by gods,  gandharvas, हनुमान् Hanuman, त्वयि by you, विश्रान्तः resting, ततः then, शेषम् remaing part, गमिष्यति will cover.

data.v: काकुत्स्थस्यानृशंस्यं च मैथिल्याश्च विवासनम् । श्रमं च प्लवगेन्द्रस्य समीक्ष्योत्थातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "You ought to rise up if you consider the nobility of the scion of the Kakusthas, the deportation of Mythili, and the exertion put forth by Hanuman, the lord of monkeys".
data.anv: काकुत्स्थस्य Rama's, अनृशंस्यं च good nature, मैथिल्याः Sita's, विवासनं च deportation, प्लवगेन्द्रस्य Hanuman's, श्रमं च strain also, समीक्ष्य considering, उत्थातुम् to rise up, अर्हसि you ought to.

data.v: हिरण्यनाभो मैनाको निशम्य लवणाम्भसः । उत्पपात जलात्तूर्णं महाद्रुमलतायुतः ।।
data.es: Hearing the command of the god of the ocean, mount Mainaka, rich in gold and covered with trees and creepers rose up at once from the water.
data.anv: हिरण्यनाभः mountain with gold at its bosom, मैनाकः Mainaka, लवणाम्भसः of the salty ocean, निशम्य after listening, महाद्रुमलतायुतः with great trees and creepers, तूर्णम् at once, जलात् from the water, उत्पपात  rose up.
data.md: Hearing the speech of the Ocean, the golden mountain Maināka, covered with tall trees and creepers, rose up instantly from his watery bed.

data.v: स सागरजलं भित्त्वा बभूवात्युत्थितस्तदा । यथा जलधरं भित्त्वा दीप्तरश्मिर्दिवाकरः ।।
data.es: Just as the rising Sun comes out with glowing rays tearing the veil of dark clouds, the mountain rose up from the water of the ocean.
data.anv: तदा then, सः that mountain, सागरजलम् waters of the ocean, भित्त्वा projecting, दीप्तरमशिः the lord of glowing rays, दिवाकरः Sun, जलधरम् a cloud, भित्त्वा breaking, यथा as, अभ्युत्थितः rose up, बभूव appeared.
data.md: Like to the Sun of bright rays rising out of the watery expanse, he uplifted himself from the Ocean.

data.v: शातकुम्भमयैः शृङ्गैः सकिंनरमहोरगैः । आदित्योदयसंकाशैरालिखद्भिरिवाम्बरम् ।।
data.md: The sky was as if cleft by these golden summits like to the rising of the Sun, inhabited by Kinnaras and large Serpents.
