data.v: तस्य जाम्बूनदैः शृङ्गैः पर्वतस्य समुत्थितैः । आकाशं शस्त्रसंकाशमभवत्काञ्चनप्रभम् ।।
data.es: The sky shone like barnished weapons smeared with the golden colour of the mountain peaks that rose up above the water.
data.anv: समुत्थितैः by those risen ones, तप्तजाम्बूनदैः by barnished gold, पर्वतस्य mountain's, शृङ्गैः with peaks, शस्त्रसंकाशम् the colour of weapons, आकाशम् sky, काञ्चनप्रभम्, golden, अभवत् appeared.
data.md: To golden summits of that mountain being thus lifted up, the dark-blue sky assumed the golden hue. And by those highly resplendent golden peaks that best of mountains assumed the brilliance of a thousand suns.

data.v: जातरूपमयैः शृङ्गैर्भ्राजमानैः स्वयं प्रभैः । आदित्यशतसंकाशः सोऽभवद्गिरिसत्तमः ।।
data.es: The noble mountain, Mainaka was glittering like a thousand Suns with selfeffulgent golden peaks shining.
data.anv: स्वयंप्रभैः the selfeffulgent ones, भ्राजमानैः glittering , जातरूपमयैः  golden, शृङ्गैः by the peak, सः that, गिरिसत्तमः noble mountain, आदित्यशतसङ्काशः like a thousand Suns, अभवत् appeared.

data.v: तमुत्थितमसंगेन हनूमानग्रतः स्थितम् । मध्ये लवणतोयस्य विघ्नोऽयमिति निश्चितः ।।
data.es: Hanuman considered the mountain rising up in the midst of the ocean and standing in front an impediment.
data.anv: लवणतोयस्य of the seawater, मध्ये in the midst, असङ्गेन impediment across, उत्थितम् rising up, अग्रतः in front, स्थितम् stood, तम् him, हनुमान् Hanuman, अयम् this, विघ्नः obstruction, इति thus, निश्चितः surely.
data.md: Beholding before him that up-heaved mountain in the midst of the salt Ocean Hanumān regarded it, as a barrier for aye.

data.v: स तमुच्छ्रितमत्यर्थं महावेगो महाकपिः । उरसा पातयामास जीमूतमिव मारुतः ।।
data.es: The great vanara,who was swift in action felled down the mountain that had risen high instantly with his chest just as the wind would strike a cloud.
data.anv: महावेगः swift in action, सः महाकपिः that great vanara, अत्यर्थम् instantly, उच्छ्रितम् risen, तम् him, मारुतः the wind, जीमूतमिव like a cloud, उरसा with the chest, पातयामास pushed it down.
data.md: Like to Wind dispersing clouds, that mighty monkey with great velocity crushed down those up-lifted peaks with his breast.

data.v: स तदा पातितस्तेन कपिना पर्वतोत्तमः । बुद्ध्वा तस्य कपेर्वेगं जहर्ष च ननन्द च ।।
data.es: Felled by the vanara's speed, the tall mountain overwhelmed with joy roared in high pitch.
data.anv: तेन कपिना by that vanara, तथा in that way, पातितः felled down, स पर्वतोत्तमः that high mountain, तस्य कपेः by the vanara's, वेगम् speed, बुद्ध्वा after realising, जहर्ष च felt happy, ननन्द च and roared in high pitch.
data.md: Being thus crushed down by that monkey, the best of mountains, being apprized of his prowess, began to shout with joy.

data.v: तमाकाशगतं वीरमाकाशे समवस्थितम् । प्रीतो हृष्टमना वाक्यमब्रवीत्पर्वतः कपिम् । मानुषं धरयन्रूपमात्मनः शिखरे स्थितः ।।
data.es: Now the mountain assumed a human form and standing on its own summit, which stood very high, and glad at heart, addressed the heroic vanara gone to the aerial region.
data.anv: पर्वतः mountain, प्रीतः feeling happy, हृष्टमानाः gladly, मानुषम् human, रूपम् form, धारयन् assuming, आत्मनः his, शिखरे on the summit, स्थितः standing, आकाशगतम् gone to the aerial region, तं वीरं कपिम् that heroic vanara, आकाशे in the sky, समुपस्थितः  stood, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereupon, with a glad heart assuming the semblance of a man ånd stationing himself upon his own summit, that mountain-chief addressed Hanumān, saying.

data.v: दुष्करं कृतवान्कर्म त्वमिदं वानरोत्तम । निपत्य मम शृङ्गेषु विश्रमस्व यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: "O best of vanaras you have achieved a formidable deed. Alighting on my peak and comfortably resting awhile, you may resume your journey.
data.anv: वानरोत्तम O best of the vanaras, त्वम् you, दुष्करम् formidable, इदम् this, कर्म deed, कृतवान्  accomplished, मम my, शृङ्गेषु on this peak, निपत्य alighting, यथासुखम् comfortably, विश्रमस्व you may rest.
data.md: O best of monkeys, forsooth had you been engaged in this arduous task. Coming down on my peak do you take rest.

data.v: राघावस्य कुले जातैरुदधिः परिवर्धितः । स त्वां रामहिते युक्तं प्रत्यर्चयति सागरः ।।
data.es: "The son of Rama's family, Sagara, has extended the ocean in the past.It is most appropriate that he (the god of the sea) honours you in return as you have set out in the service of Rama.
data.anv: उदधिः the ocean, राघवस्य of Raghava's, कुले in the family, जातैः by those born, परिवर्धितः is extended, सः सागरः that Sagara, रामहिते for the service of Rama, युक्तम् endowed with, त्वाम् you, प्रत्यर्चयति honour in return.
data.md: This ocean was reared by one born in the family of Raghus. And beholding you engaged on Rāma's behoof he is worshipping you.

data.v: कृते च प्रतिकर्तव्यमेष धर्मः सनातनः । सोऽयं तत्प्रतिकारार्थी त्वत्तः संमानमर्हति ।।
data.anv: कृते when help is rendered, प्रतिकर्तव्यम्  it should be repaid, एषः this, सनातनः eternal, धर्मः dharma, तत्प्रतिकारार्थी for doing service in return, सः अयम् this, त्वत्तः from you, सम्मानम् honour, अर्हति he deserves.
data.md: The best and everlasting virtue consists in returning benefits to one who has benefited us. Bent on returning benefits to Raghu's race, he deserve respect from you.

data.v: त्वन्निमित्तमनेनाहं बहुमानात्प्रचोदितः । योजनानां शतं चापि कपिरेष समाप्लुतः । तव सानुषु विश्रान्तः शेषं प्रक्रमतामिति ।।
data.es: "I was prompted by the ocean for your sake since he has great regard for you. O great monkey you may rest here for a while and continue your journey. The lord of the ocean feels that this tiger among monkeys can cover the distance of a hundred yojanas. He tells me, 'let him rest on your peak and then cover the rest of the distance'.
data.anv: योजनानां शतम् a hundred yojanas, समाप्लुतः is leaping, एषः this, कपिः vanara, तव your, सानुषु on the peaks, विश्रान्तः resting, शेषम् remaining, प्रक्रमताम proceed thereafter, इति thus, अनेन by this ocean, त्वन्निमित्तम for your sake, अहम् I, बहुमानात् with honour, प्रचोदितः prompted, कपिशार्दूल: a tiger among monkeys, त्वम् you, तिष्ठ stay, मयि at my, विश्रम्य after resting, गम्यताम् you can go.
data.md: And to welcome you properly I have been despatched by him with the message-traversing over a hundred yojans this monkey has been worn out with fatigue; let him voyage to the remaining way after resting for a while on your summit.

data.v: तिष्ठ त्वं हरिशार्दूल मयि विश्रम्य गम्यताम् । तदिदं गन्धवत्स्वादु कन्दमूलफलं बहु । तदास्वाद्य हरिश्रेष्ठ विश्रान्तोऽनुगमिष्यसि ।।
data.es: "O foremost of the monkeys after eating plenty of sweet and tasty roots and fruits and resting a while you may go.
data.anv: हरिश्रेष्ठ O foremost of the monkeys, तत् इदम् such as this, गन्धवत् sweet smelling, स्वादु tasty, बहु plenty, कन्दमूलफलम् roots and fruits, इदम् this, तत् that, आस्वद्य after tasting, विश्रान्तः taking rest, अनु later, गमिष्यसि you may go.
data.md: Do you therefore, O best of monkeys, remain here and take rest. And feasting on these many fragrant and sweet fruits and roots, O foremost of monkeys, do you relieve yourself of the toil and proceed.

data.v: अस्माकमपि संबन्धः कपिमुख्यस्त्वयास्ति वै । प्रख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु महागुणपरिग्रहः ।।
data.es: "O chief of monkeys, indeed we too have a relationship with you based on merit which is wellknown to all the three worlds.
data.anv: कपिमुख्य O chief of monkeys, त्रिषु in the three, लोकेषु in the worlds, प्रख्यातः wellknown, महागुणपरिग्रहः possesing great merits, सम्बन्धः kinship, त्वया with you, अस्माकमपि for us also, अस्ति वै  is there.
data.md: O leader of monkeys, my relation with you is replete with many virtues and known all over the three worlds.

data.v: वेगवन्तः प्लवन्तो ये प्लवगा मारुतात्मज । तेषां मुख्यतमं मन्ये त्वामहं कपिकुञ्जर ।।
data.es: "O son of the Windgod you are an elephant among monkeys, the foremost among them who move at a high speed.
data.anv: मारुतात्मज O son of the Windgod, कपिकुञ्जर O elephant among monkeys, वेगवन्तः  swift, प्लवन्तः jumping, ये those, प्लवगाः vanaras, तेषाम् of them, मुख्यतमम् the foremost, त्वाम् you, अहम् I, मन्ये believe.
data.md: O Son of Maruta, O best of monkeys, I know you to be the foremost of all monkeys.

data.v: अतिथिः किल पूजार्हः प्राकृतोऽपि विजानता । धर्मं जिज्ञासमानेन किं पुनर्यादृशो भवान् ।।
data.es: "Even a newcomer, however ordinary, deserves worship by a wise man who wishes to educate himself in the path of righteousness. Needless to say that distinguished guest like you deserves all reverence.
data.anv: धर्मम् righteousness, जिज्ञासमानेन  who desires to know, विजानता by a wise man, प्राकृतोऽपि even an ordinary person, अतिथिः a guest, पूजार्हः worthy of worship, त्वादृशः a person like you, महान् great, किं पुनः what again, किल it is  said.
data.md: Even an ordinary guest should be adored by him who abide by virtue, what of you great as you are?

data.v: त्वं हि देववरिष्ठस्य मारुतस्य महात्मनः । पुत्रस्तस्यैव वेगेन सदृशः कपिकुञ्जर ।।
data.es: "O foremost among the vanaras you are the son of the highsouled Windgod's, preeminent among the gods, you are also equal to him in speed.
data.anv: कपिकुञ्जर foremost among vanaras, त्वम् you, देववरिष्ठस्य of the pre eminent one among the divine beings, महात्मनः of the highsouled, मारुतस्य wind god's, पुत्रः हि son indeed, वेगेन in speed, तस्यैव with his own self, सदृशः comparable.
data.md: O you lion among monkeys, you are the son of Māruta, the foremost of celestials and are his equal in speed.

data.v: पूजिते त्वयि धर्मज्ञ पूजां प्राप्नोति मारुतः । तस्मात्त्वं पूजनीयो मे शृणु चाप्यत्र कारणम् ।।
data.es: "O knower of righteousness to worship you is to honour the Windgod. Therefore you are worthy of worship for me. I will tell you the reason. Listen.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञ O knower of righteousness, त्वयि when you, पूजिते if you are worshipped, मारुतः Windgod, पूजाम् veneration, प्राप्नोति will recieve, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, अपि also, मे to me, पूजनीयः worshipworthy, अत्र here, कारणं च also the cause, शृणु listen.
data.md: You that are conversant with virtue, being worshipped, Maruta himself receive offerings. You are therefore worth of my adoration. Hearken, there is another reason for it.

data.v: पूर्वं कृतयुगे तात पर्वताः पक्षिणोऽभवन् । तेऽपि जग्मुर्दिशः सर्वा गरुडानिलवेगिनः ।।
data.es: "Formerly in Kritayuga, O dear, mountains were endowed with wings. They used to move speedily in all directions like Garuda and the Windgod.
data.anv: तात O dear son, पूर्वम् formerly, कृतयुगे in Krita yuga, पर्वताः mountains,पक्षिणः had wings, अभवन् endowed, ते  they, गरुडानिलवेगिनः swift like Garuda and wind, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, जग्मुः went about.
data.md: O worshipful one, in olden times, the mountains, gifted with wings, began to range all quarters with velocity like to Garuda.

data.v: ततस्तेषु प्रयातेषु देवसंघाः सहर्षिभिः । भूतानि च भयं जग्मुस्तेषां पतनशङ्कया ।।
data.es: "When they moved about, even hosts of sages, gods and creatures panicked for fear of falling down (and destroying all worlds).
data.anv: ततः then, तेषु when they, प्रयातेषु went about, सहर्षिभिः and sages, देवसङ्घा: hosts of gods, भूतानि च and all creatures, तेषाम् their, पतनशङ्कया out of fear of their falling down, भयम् fear, जग्मुः felt.
data.md: They moving thus, the celestials, the ascetics, and all creatures became almost faint with fear of their falling down.

data.v: ततः क्रुद्धः सहस्राक्षः पर्वतानां शतक्रतुः । पक्षांश्चिच्छेद वज्रेण तत्र तत्र सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: "Provoked at this, the thousandeyed Indra who had performed a hundred sacrifices cut off the wings of mountains into a thousands pieces with his thunderbolt.
data.anv: ततः then, शतक्रतुः one who has performed a hundred yajnas, सहस्राक्षः Indra, क्रुद्धः in anger, तत्र तत्र here and there, सहस्रशः in thousand, पर्वतानाम् of the mountains, पक्षान् wings, वज्रेण with the thunderbolt, चिच्छेद cut into pieces.
data.md: Highly enraged therefore, the thousand-eyed Deity, the performer of hundred sacrifices, hundred with his thunderbolt, the wings of hundreds and thousands of them.

data.v: स मामुपगतः क्रुद्धो वज्रमुद्यम्य देवराट् । ततोऽहं सहसा क्षिप्तः श्वसनेन महात्मना ।।
data.anv: सः he, देवराट् Indra, क्रुद्धः in wrath, वज्रम् thunderbolt, उद्यम्य held, माम् to me, उपागतः came, ततः then, अहम् I, महात्मना by the great self, श्वसनेन by the Windgod, सहसा at once, क्षिप्तः dropped down.
data.md: When with his thunderbolt, the Lord of celestials, wroth, approached me, I was all on a sudden thrown down by the high-souled Wind.

data.v: अस्मिँल्लवणतोये च प्रक्षिप्तः प्लवगोत्तम । गुप्तपक्षः समग्रश्च तव पित्राभिरक्षितः ।।
data.es: "O distinguished vanara your father, the Windgod threw me down into this saltwater sea. Thus my wings were protected.
data.anv: प्लवगोत्तम O distinguished among the vanaras, गुप्तपक्षसमग्रश्च kept my wings intact, अस्मिन् in this, लवणतोये in the salt waters of the sea, प्रक्षिप्तः thrown down, तव पित्रा by your father, अभिरक्षितः protected.
data.md: O best of monkeys I was these cast done in this salt ocean and preserved unhurt by your ancestors having my wings hid.

data.v: ततोऽहं मानयामि त्वां मान्यो हि मम मारुतः । त्वया मे ह्येष संबन्धः कपिमुख्य महागुणः ।।
data.es: "O esteemed vanara the Windgod is revered by me and so I honour you. O chief of monkeys, my bondage with you is therefore of high value to me, indeed.
data.anv: कपिमुख्य O esteemed vanara, मारुतः Windgod, मम my, मान्यः हि revered one, ततः therefore, अहम् I, त्वाम् you, मानयामि I will honour you, त्वया by you, मे to me, एषः this, सम्बन्धः relationship, महागुणः is great.
data.md: I shall therefore adore you and you are object of my worship O Maruta! And this my relation with you, O foremost of monkeys, is pregnant with many virtues.

data.v: अस्मिन्नेवंगते कार्ये सागरस्य ममैव च । प्रीतिं प्रीतमना कर्तुं त्वमर्हसि महाकपे ।।
data.es: "O great monkey when I hold you so high, you ought to oblige me and the (god of the) ocean wholeheartedly (and accept our hospitalty).
data.anv: महाकपे O great monkey, अस्मिन् in this, कार्ये  work, एवंगते reached such a position, त्वम् you, प्रीतमनाः wholeheartedly, सागरस्य च and the ocean's, ममैव च and mine also, प्रीतिम् pleasure, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि you ought to.
data.md: The time for returning benefits having arrived, O high-souled one, it behove you to afford me and the ocean, satisfaction with a blessed heart.

data.v: श्रमं मोक्षय पूजां च गृहाण कपिसत्तम । प्रीतिं च बहुमन्यस्व प्रीतोऽस्मि तव दर्शनात् ।।
data.es: "O noble monkey oblige us by accepting our offering given with love and be relieved of your fatigue. Your presence itself is welcome to me".
data.anv: कपिसत्तम O noble monkey, श्रमम् fatigue, मोक्ष्य after being relieved, पूजां  च and offerings, गृहाण accept, प्रीतिम् love, बहुमन्यस्व oblige us, तव your, दर्शनात् by your presence, प्रीतः अस्मि I am pleased.
data.md: best of monkeys, relieve yourself of the fatigue and accept my affectionate offering, who am worthy of your respect. For his relationship with Wind whose son was Pitupanthānam-the text means "his father's path”-Wind being Hanumān's father the passage means-"aerial way."-Happy am I to see you. *Wrath in consequence of his inability to accept his offerings.

data.v: एवमुक्तः कपिश्रेष्ठस्तं नगोत्तममब्रवीत् । प्रीतोऽस्मि कृतमातिथ्यं मन्युरेषोऽपनीयताम् ।।
data.es: The great Hanuman, pleased with the words of Mainaka, said "I am pleased at your hospitality. Remove your unhappiness.
data.anv: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having addressed, कपिश्रेष्ठः the great monkey, तं नगोत्तमम् to the lord of mountains, अब्रवीत् said, प्रीतः pleased, अस्मि I am, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, कृतम् is offered, एषः this, मन्युः unhappiness, अपनीयताम् remove.
data.md: Being thus accosted by Maināka, the best of mountains, Hanumān, the foremost of monkeys said, saying: Pleased am I and you had shown me enough of hospitality. Do you give up your wrath.

data.v: त्वरते कार्यकालो मे अहश्चाप्यतिवर्तते । प्रतिज्ञा च मया दत्ता न स्थातव्यमिहान्तरा ।।
data.es: "My commitment is hastening me. The day set (for the accomplishment of the task) is also drawing to a close. A vow is made and I will not halt in the middle of my work."
data.anv: मे to me, कार्यकालः schedule, त्वरते hastens, अहः च the day also, अतिवर्तते exceeds, मया by me, प्रतिज्ञा vow, दत्ता च is made, अन्तरे in between, इह here, न स्थातव्यम् I will not halt.
data.md: Business wants me to go soon and the time is well-nigh spent. Besides I have promised that I shall not halt at any intermediate place.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा पाणिना शैलमालभ्य हरिपुंगवः । जगामाकाशमाविश्य वीर्यवान्प्रहसन्निव ।।
data.es: Having said this, the mighty monkey gently touched the mountain with his hands before ascending to the sky with a smile on his face.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् heroic, हरिपुङ्गवः chief of monkeys, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, शैलम् the mountain, पाणिना with his hand, आलभ्य gently touching, आकाशम् to the sky, आविश्य ascended, प्रहसन्निव with a smile on his face, जगाम departed.
data.md: Thereupon touching the hill with his hand that highly energetic monkey wended, smiling his aerial way. Ocean

data.v: स पर्वतसमुद्राभ्यां बहुमानादवेक्षितः । पूजितश्चोपपन्नाभिराशीर्भिरनिलात्मजः ।।
data.es: The mountain and the sea honoured and adored the son of the Windgod and gave him appropriate blessings.
data.anv: सः he, अनिलात्मजः son of the Windgod, पर्वतसमुद्राभ्याम् by both the mountain and ocean, बहुमानात् with great respect, आवेक्षितः was adored, उपपन्नाभिः with proper ones, आशीर्भिः with blessings, पूजितः च also honoured.
data.md: Thereat the and the mountain respectfully looked towards him and adored and welcomed him with blessings worthy of the occasion.

data.v: अथोर्ध्वं दूरमुत्पत्य हित्वा शैलमहार्णवौ । पितुः पन्थानमास्थाय जगाम विमलेऽम्बरे ।।
data.es: And thereafter leaping a long distance into the clear sky, he (Hanuman) took the path of the Windgod, his father, leaving behind the mountain and the sea.
data.anv: अथ then, शैलमहार्णवौ the mountain and the ocean, हित्वा after leaving, ऊर्ध्वम् high, दूरम् long distance, उत्प्लुत्य leaping into, विमले in the clear, अम्बरे in sky, पितुः father's, पन्थानम् the path, आस्थाय after taking, जगाम went.
data.md: Leaving the mountain and the ocean and rising his up, he proceeded in the clear welkin traversing the aerial way.

data.v: भूयश्चोर्ध्वगतिं प्राप्य गिरिं तमवलोकयन् । वायुसूनुर्निरालम्बे जगाम विमलेऽम्बरे ।।
data.es: Rising higher and further up and looking at the mountain (which was going down into the ocean), the son of the Windgod coursed through the cloudless sky unsupported.
data.anv: वायुसूनुः son of the Windgod, भूयः च further, ऊर्ध्वम् high up, गतिम् path, प्राप्य taking, तं गिरिम् the mountain, अवलोकयन् while looking at, निरालम्बे in a place without any support, विमले pure, cloudless, अम्बरे in the sky, जगाम went.
data.md: Rising high up and casting his look down on the hill, that foremost of monkeys proceeded by the unsupported aerial track.

data.v: तद्द्वितीयं हनुमतो दृष्ट्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् । प्रशशंसुः सुराः सर्वे सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः ।।
data.es: Gods, siddhas as well as the great sages praised him for the second great achievment of Hanuman, which is impossible for others to accomplish.
data.anv: हनुमतः of Hanuman, तत् that, सुदुष्करम् most difficult, द्वितीयम् a second, कर्म task, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, सर्वे all, सुराः gods, सिद्धाश्च siddhas, परमर्षयः great sages, प्रशंशसुः praised him.
data.md: Beholding this singularly arduous work of Hanumān the celestials, the Siddhas and the ascetics all praised him.

data.v: देवताश्चाभवन्हृष्टास्तत्रस्थास्तस्य कर्मणा । काञ्चनस्य सुनाभस्य सहस्राक्षश्च वासवः ।।
data.es: The gods who happened to be present at that time (on the mountain) and the thousandeyed Indra were delighted by the gesture of golden Sunabha (Mainaka) mountain.
data.anv: तत्रस्थाः those who were there, देवताश्च gods, सहस्राक्षः the thousandeyed, वासवश्च Indra, काञ्चनस्य of the golden Mainaka, तस्य his, सुनाभस्य of Sunabha, कर्मणा by the task, हृष्टाः delighted, अभवन् became.
data.md: All the celestials and others living on its summit, were highly pleased with the mountain arrayed in gold and having beautiful sides.

data.v: उवाच वचनं धीमान्परितोषात्सगद्गदम् । सुनाभं पर्वतश्रेष्ठं स्वयमेव शचीपतिः ।।
data.es: Indra, the lord of Sachi, was personally satisfied and spoke to Mainaka, the best of mountains, in faltering tone, his throat choked out of joy.
data.anv: धीमान् wise, शचीपतिः husband of Sachi, Indra, पर्वतश्रेष्ठम् best mountain, सुनाभम् Sunabha, परितोषात् satisfied, सगद्गदम् with throat choked, स्वयमेव himself, वचनम् these words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: And the thousand-eyed Vásava was also pleased. And greatly pleased that highly intelligent Saci's lord, himself, addressed that best of mountains having picturesque sides, saying.

data.v: हिरण्यनाभशैलेन्द्रपरितुष्टोऽस्मि ते भृशम् । अभयं ते प्रयच्छामि तिष्ठ सौम्य यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: "O Hiranyanabha, the foremost among the mountains I am highly pleased with you. I give you security (free from fear of losing wings). O pious one you may stay on happily as you please.
data.anv: हिरण्यनाभ O Hiranyanabha, शैलेन्द्र O lord of mountains, ते with you, भृशम् a lot, परितुष्टः अस्मि I am pleased, सौम्य O pious one, ते to you, अभयम् security, प्रयच्छामि I give, यथासुखम् happily as you please, तिष्ठ you may stay on.
data.md: Greatly delighted am I, O lord of mountains, O you having golden peaks. 'No fear' I do declare to you. Proceedest you therefore, at your ease, O gently one!

data.v: साह्यं कृतं ते सुमहद्विक्रान्तस्य हनूमतः । क्रमतो योजनशतं निर्भयस्य भये सति ।।
data.es: "You have rendered very valuable help to Hanuman who was attempting to leap a distance of a hundred yojanas. He is fearless even when there is reason to fear (of falling down).
data.anv: विक्रान्तस्य of one attempting to leap, योजनशतम् a hundred yojanas, क्रमतः while  leaping, भये सति when there is reason to fear, निर्भयस्य of a fearless one, हनूमतः Hanuman, ते by you, सुमहत् very valuable, साह्यम् help, कृतम् rendered.
data.md: Greatly had you hoped Hanumān, crossin fearlessly an unceasingly, over hundred yojanas so that he might not fall in danger.

data.v: रामस्यैष हि दौत्येन याति दाशरथेर्हरिः । सत्क्रियां कुर्वता शक्या तोषितोऽस्मि दृढं त्वया ।।
data.es: "The vanara has gone on a mission to help the son of Dasaratha. I am highly pleased with the service rendered to him.
data.anv: एषः हरिः this vanara, दाशरथेः of the son of Dasaratha, रामस्य Rama's, पितायैव for his wellbeing only, याति  going, तस्य his, सत्क्रियाम् honour, कुर्वता for doing, त्वया by you, दृढम् surely, तोषितः अस्मि I am pleased.
data.md: This monkey, is going in the interests of Rāma, Dasaratha's son—and you had welcomed him to the best of your mighty. Therefore I am greatly pleased with you.

data.v: ततः प्रहर्षमलभद्विपुलं पर्वतोत्तमः । देवतानां पतिं दृष्ट्वा परितुष्टं शतक्रतुम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Mainaka, the great mountain was delighted to see Indra, lord of the gods, performer of a hundred yajnas satisfied.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, पर्वतोत्तमः the best of mountains, देवतानाम् of gods,पतिम् lord, शतक्रतुम् who had performed a hundred yajnas, Indra, परितुष्टम् extremely happy,दृष्ट्वा after seeing, विपुलम् very much, प्रहर्षम् delight, आगमत् experienced.
data.md: Beholding that lord of celestials the performer of an hundred sacrifices, highly gratified, that best of mountains attained to an excess of joy.

data.v: स वै दत्तवरः शैलो बभूवावस्थितस्तदा । हनूमांश्च मुहूर्तेन व्यतिचक्राम सागरम् ।।
data.es: Then mount Mainaka, assured by Indra became secure. And Hanuman also crossed over the ocean in a short while.
data.anv: तदा then, दत्तवरः who received a boon, सः he, शैलः Mainaka, अवस्थितः he became stable, बभूव became, हनुमांश्च Hanuma also, मुहूर्तेन in a short while, सागरम् ocean, व्यतिचक्राम crossed over.
data.md: Having received boons (from Indra) the Mountain occupied again its pristine place. And Hanumān in a short time crossed over the main.

data.v: ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः । अब्रुवन्सूर्यसंकाशां सुरसां नागमातरम् ।।
data.es: Then the gods, gandharvas, siddhas and great sages approached Surasa, the mother of nagas, who was glowing like the Sungod and said:.
data.anv: ततः then, सगन्धर्वाः including gandharvas, देवाः gods, सिद्धाश्च and siddhas, परमर्षयः great sages, सूर्यसङ्काशाम् shining like the Sun, नागमातरम् mother of nagas, सुरसाम् Surasa, अब्रुवन् said.
data.md: Thereupon the celestial along with Gandharvas, Siddhas and the ascetics, spake to Surasā the mother of serpents, resembling the Sun, saying.

data.v: अयं वातात्मजः श्रीमान्प्लवते सागरोपरि । हनूमान्नाम तस्य त्वं मुहूर्तं विघ्नमाचर ।।
data.es: "The glorious son of the Windgod, called Hanuman, is crossing the ocean. Obstruct him for sometime by assuming the hideous form of a demon, gigantic as a mountain, fearful with yellowishbrown eyes, with big teeth and a wide mouth like the sky.
data.anv: हनुमन्नाम named Hanuman, श्रीमान् glorious, अयं this person, वातात्मजः son of the Windgod, सागरोपरि over the sea, प्लवते is flying, त्वम् you, सुघोरम् hideous, पर्वतोपमम् gigantic like a mountain, राक्षसम् demoniac, रूपम् form, आस्थाय assuming, दंष्ट्राकरालम् with big teeth, पिङ्गाक्षम्  yellowbrown eyes, नभः समम् like the sky, वक्त्रम् mouth, कृत्वा doing, मुहूर्तम् for a short while, तस्य him, विघ्नम् obstruction, आचर make.
data.md: The highly effulgent son of Wind named Hanumān is crossing over the main. You are required to throw obstacles in his way for a while.

data.v: राक्षसं रूपमास्थाय सुघोरं पर्वतोपमम् । दंष्ट्राकरालं पिङ्गाक्षं वक्त्रं कृत्वा नभःस्पृशम् ।।
data.es: "The glorious son of the Windgod, called Hanuman, is crossing the ocean. Obstruct him for sometime by assuming the hideous form of a demon, gigantic as a mountain, fearful with yellowishbrown eyes, with big teeth and a wide mouth like the sky.
data.anv: हनुमन्नाम named Hanuman, श्रीमान् glorious, अयं this person, वातात्मजः son of the Windgod, सागरोपरि over the sea, प्लवते is flying, त्वम् you, सुघोरम् hideous, पर्वतोपमम् gigantic like a mountain, राक्षसम् demoniac, रूपम् form, आस्थाय assuming, दंष्ट्राकरालम् with big teeth, पिङ्गाक्षम्  yellowbrown eyes, नभः समम् like the sky, वक्त्रम् mouth, कृत्वा doing, मुहूर्तम् for a short while, तस्य him, विघ्नम् obstruction, आचर make.
data.md: Assuming therefore the semblance of a terrible, grim-visaged Rāksasa, resembling a huge mountain and having terrible teeth and a face with coppery eyes, do you touch the welkin.

data.v: बलमिच्छामहे ज्ञातुं भूयश्चास्य पराक्रमम् । त्वां विजेष्यत्युपायेन विषदं वा गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: "We want to assess his strength, valour and intelligence once again. We wish to know whether he will win or give way to despondency".
data.anv: अस्य his, बलम् strength, भूयः once again, पराक्रमं च and valour, उपायेन intelligence त्वाम्  you, विजेष्यति he will win, वा or else, विषादम् dejected, गमिष्यति will give way, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामहे we wish.
data.md: We are anxious to learn if he defeat you by some means or comes by grief."

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु सा देवी दैवतैरभिसत्कृता । समुद्रमध्ये सुरसा बिभ्रती राक्षसं वपुः ।।
data.es: Thus honoured by the gods, Surasa assumed a terrific ugly form frightening to all and stood in the midst of the ocean. Putting up a distorted appearance and encompassing Hanuman who was crossing the ocean, she spoke to him:
data.anv: देवी the divine being, सा सुरसा Surasa, दैवतैः by gods, एवम् that way, उक्ता having been addressed, अभिसत्कृता received their honour, समुद्र मध्ये in the midst of the ocean, विकृतम् terrific, विरूपं च ugly form, सर्वस्य for all, भयावहम् frightening, राक्षसं वपुः demoniac form, बिभ्रती  put up, प्लवमानम् leaping, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, आवृत्य after encirding him, इदम् these words, उवाच ह said.
data.md: Thus addressed the worshipful Surasā, having been honoured by the celestials, deformed and horrible and capable of exciting the fear of all beings, and obstructing Hanumān as he was coursing on, said.

data.v: विकृतं च विरूपं च सर्वस्य च भयावहम् । प्लवमानं हनूमन्तमावृत्येदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Thus honoured by the gods, Surasa assumed a terrific ugly form frightening to all and stood in the midst of the ocean. Putting up a distorted appearance and encompassing Hanuman who was crossing the ocean, she spoke to him:
data.anv: देवी the divine being, सा सुरसा Surasa, दैवतैः by gods, एवम् that way, उक्ता having been addressed, अभिसत्कृता received their honour, समुद्र मध्ये in the midst of the ocean, विकृतम् terrific, विरूपं च ugly form, सर्वस्य for all, भयावहम् frightening, राक्षसं वपुः demoniac form, बिभ्रती  put up, प्लवमानम् leaping, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, आवृत्य after encirding him, इदम् these words, उवाच ह said.
data.md: Thus addressed the worshipful Surasā, having been honoured by the celestials, deformed and horrible and capable of exciting the fear of all beings, and obstructing Hanumān as he was coursing on, said.

data.v: मम भक्षः प्रदिष्टस्त्वमीश्वरैर्वानरर्षभ । अहं त्वां भक्षयिष्यामि प्रविशेदं ममाननम् ।।
data.es: "O bull among vanaras the lords of the universe have provided you as food for me. I will eat you. Enter my mouth".
data.anv: वानरर्षभ O bull among, त्वम् you, ईश्वरैः by lords of the universe, मम to me, भक्षः food, प्रदिष्टः are provided, अहम् I, त्वाम् you, भक्षयिष्यामि I will eat you, इदम् this, मम my, आननम् mouth, प्रविश enter.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys, you had been ordained as my fare by the gods themselves. I will eat you up, do you enter my mouth.

data.v: एवमुक्तः सुरसया प्राञ्जलिर्वानरर्षभः । प्रहृष्टवदनः श्रीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Surasa, the glorious Hanuman said this with a blooming face and folded hands:
data.anv: सुरसया by Surasa,एवम् In that way, उक्तः spoken, श्रीमान् glorious, वानरर्षभः वहतत bull among vanaras, प्रहृष्टवदनः with a blooming face, प्राञ्जलिः with folded hands, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: रामो दाशरथिर्नाम प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम् । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या चापि भार्यया ।।
data.es: "Dasaratha's son called Rama accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and his wife Vaidehi entered Dandaka forest.
data.anv: दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, रामो नाम called Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह accompanied by Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, वैदेह्या चापि with Vaidehi also, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered.
data.md: Thus accosted by Surasā, (Hanumān) with a glad countenance, said, Rama, son to Dasaratha, had entered the Dandaka forest in company with his brother, Lakşmaņa, and his wife, Vaidehi.

data.v: अस्य कार्यविषक्तस्य बद्धवैरस्य राक्षसैः । तस्य सीता हृता भार्या रावणेन यशस्विनी ।।
data.es: "While Rama was engaged otherwise, his glorious wife Sita was abducted by Ravana actuated by deeprooted enmity of demons with him.
data.anv: राक्षसैः with rakshasas, बद्धवैरस्य  deeprooted enmity, तस्य his, अन्यकार्यविषक्तस्य while he was engaged in some other work, यशस्विनी a glorious lady, भार्या wife, सीता Sita, रावणेन by Ravana, हृता was abducted.
data.md: He having created hostility with the Rākṣasas, his illustrious wife, Sītā, while he was engrossed in some work, was carried away by Ravana.

data.v: तस्याः सकाशं दूतोऽहं गमिष्ये रामशासनात् । कर्तुमर्हसि रामस्य साह्यं विषयवासिनि ।।
data.es: "I am going as Rama's emissary to search for his wife. It is proper for you to render help since you are a resident of his kingdom.
data.anv: अहम् I, रामशासनात् by Rama's command, दूतः emissary, तस्याः her, सकाशम् for, गमिष्ये I shall go, विषयवासिनि O resident of his kingdom, रामस्य of Rama, साह्यम् help, कर्तुम् to render, अर्हसि it proper for you.
data.md: At Rāma's command, I go to her as his envoy. It behove you, living in (Rāma's) dominions, to lend him your help.

data.v: अथ वा मैथिलीं दृष्ट्वा रामं चाक्लिष्टकारिणम् । आगमिष्यामि ते वक्त्रं सत्यं प्रतिशृणोमि ते ।।
data.es: "I told her that it is proper for her (living in the domain of Rama) to help his queen and wife. Or else, I promised after I disclose to Rama, Sita's whereabouts, I will come and enter her mouth.
data.anv: अथवा alternatively, मैथिलीम् Mythili, अक्लिष्टकारिणम् one who may makes work easy (without any trouble), रामं च and Rama, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, ते to your, वक्त्रम् mouth, आगमिष्यामि I will reach, सत्यम् truly, ते you, प्रतिशृणोमि I promise.
data.md: Or having seen Mithila's daughter, as well as Rāma of untiring deeds, I will enter your mouth. This I promise you truly."

data.v: एवमुक्ता हनुमता सुरसा कामरूपिणी । अब्रवीन्नातिवर्तेन्मां कश्चिदेष वरो मम ।।
data.es: Having heard Hanuman, Surasa capable of taking any form at her free will told him that no one can cross (her region) as she had been given such a boon(by the Creator)৷৷
data.anv: हनुमता by Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having been spoken, कामरूपिणी one who can assume any form at free will, सुरसा Surasa, अब्रवीत् said, कश्चित् no one, नातिवर्तेत cannot cross, एषः such, मम to me, वरः boon.
data.md: Thus addressed by Hanumān, Surasā, capable of wearing forms at will, said, “None shall pass me without being devoured by me, even this is the boon that I have received."

data.v: एवमुक्तः सुरसया क्रुद्धो वानरपुंगवः । अब्रवीत्कुरु वै वक्त्रं येन मां विषहिष्यसे ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Surasa, Hanuman the supreme vanara said, "Open your mouth wide enough to hold me."
data.anv: सुरसया by Surasa, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been spoken to, वानरपुङ्गवः supreme vanara, क्रुद्धः got angry, अब्रवीत् he said, वक्त्रम् mouth, कुरु वै open, येन in such a way, माम् me, विषहिष्यसे you can bear me.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा सुरसां क्रुद्धो दशयोजनमायतः । दशयोजनविस्तारो बभूव हनुमांस्तदा ।।
data.es: Provoked by the words of Surasa, Hanuman stretched himself to ten yojanas.
data.anv: तदा then, हनुमान् Hanuman, सुरसां Surasa, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, क्रुद्धः angry, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, आयतां wide, दशयोजनविस्तारः ten yojanas in breadth, बभूव became.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा मेघसंकाशं दशयोजनमायतम् । चकार सुरसाप्यास्यं विंशद्योजनमायतम् ।।
data.es: Seeing his body stretched to ten yojanas like a cloud, Surasa also widened her mouth to twenty yojanas.
data.anv: दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, आयतम् wide, मेघसङ्काशम् like a cloud, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, सुरसा च Surasa too, आस्यम् her mouth, विंशद्योजनम् twenty yojanas, आयतम् wide, चकार stretched.

data.v: हनुमांस्तु ततः क्रुद्धस्त्रिंशद्योजनमायतः । चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं चत्वारिंशत्तथोच्छ्रितम् ।।
data.es: Provoked, Hanuman further stretched his body to thirty yojanas and Surasa on her own enlarged her mouth to forty yojanas. Then the great hero Hanuman stretched his body to fifty yojanas.
data.anv: ततः then, हनुमांस्तु Hanuman also, क्रुद्धः in anger, त्रिंशद्योजनम् thirty yojanas, आयतः wide, सुरसा Surasa, तथा like that, वक्त्रम् mouth, चत्वारिंशम् forty yojanas, उच्छ्रितम् high, चकार did, वीरः hero, हनुमान् Hanuman, पञ्चाशद्योजनोच्छ्रितः fifty yojanas high, बभूव became.

data.v: बभूव हनुमान्वीरः पञ्चाशद्योजनोच्छ्रितः । चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं षष्टियोजनमायतम् ।।
तथैव हनुमान्वीरः सप्ततिं योजनोच्छ्रितः । चकार सुरसा वक्त्रमशीतिं योजनायतम् ।।
हनूमानचल प्रख्यो नवतिं योजनोच्छ्रितः । चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं शतयोजनमायतम् ।।
तद्दृष्ट्वा व्यादितं त्वास्यं वायुपुत्रः स बुद्धिमान् । दीर्घजिह्वं सुरसया सुघोरं नरकोपमम् ।।
data.es: Intelligent Hanuman observing Surasa's enlarged mouth open and dreadful like hell with a long tongue, suddenly shrunk his body to the size of a thumb.
data.anv: सुबुद्धिमान् very intelligent, वायुपुत्रः Hanuman, सुरसया by Surasa, व्यादितम् opened, दीर्घजिह्वम् long tongued, सुघोरम् dreadful, नरकोपमम् like hell, तत् आस्यम् that mouth, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, आत्मनः his, कायम् body, सुसंक्षिप्य shrunk, अङ्गुष्ठमात्रकः of the size of a thumb, बभूव became.

data.v: स संक्षिप्यात्मनः कायं जीमूत इव मारुतिः । तस्मिन्मुहूर्ते हनुमान्बभूवाङ्गुष्ठमात्रकः ।।
सोऽभिपत्याशु तद्वक्त्रं निष्पत्य च महाजवः । अन्तरिक्षे स्थितः श्रीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Glorious and mighty Hanuman quickly went into her mouth and got out and stood in the sky and said:.
data.anv: श्रीमान् glorious one, महाबलः mighty, सः he, आशु immediatly, तद्वक्त्रम् her mouth, अभिपत्य got in, निष्पत्य च and got out, अन्तरिक्षे in the sky, स्थितः stood, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: प्रविष्टोऽस्मि हि ते वक्त्रं दाक्षायणि नमोऽस्तु ते । गमिष्ये यत्र वैदेही सत्यं चास्तु वचस्तव ।।
data.es: "O Dakshayani I have indeed entered your mouth and your boon has come true (as nobody can go against the boon of the Creator). Allow me to proceed in quest of Vaidhehi. My salutations to you."
data.anv: दाक्षायणि O dughter of Daksha, ते your, वक्त्रम् mouth, प्रविष्टः I have entered, अस्मि हि I am indeed, ते to you, नमः salutations, अस्तु may be, वैदेही Vaidhehi, यत्र wherever, गमिष्ये I will go, तव your, वरः च boon also, सत्यम् true, आसीत् was.
data.md: O descendant of Dakşa, I have entered into your mouth. I bow down to you. I will repair to where Vaidehi is Your boon has proved trve.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा वदनान्मुक्तं चन्द्रं राहुमुखादिव । अब्रवीत्सुरसा देवी स्वेन रूपेण वानरम् ।।
data.es: Seeing Hanuman released out of her mouth like the Moon released from the mouth of Rahu, Surasa assumed her true form and said:
data.anv: राहुमुखात् from the mouth of Rahu, चन्द्रमिव like the Moon, वदनात् from the mouth, मुक्तम् released, तं him, वानरम् that vanara, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सुरसा देवी the divine Surasa, स्वेन in her true, रूपेण form, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Seeing him out of her mouth like the Moon out of the mouth of Rāhu, the venerable Surasā spoke to the monkey in her native form, saying.

data.v: अर्थसिद्ध्यै हरिश्रेष्ठ गच्छ सौम्य यथासुखम् । समानय च वैदेहीं राघवेण महात्मना ।।
data.es: "O noble vanara proceed happily to achieve your purpose. Go and unite Vaidehi with the noble self, Raghava.
data.anv: सौम्य O noble one, हरिश्रेष्ठ O best of vanaras, अर्थसिद्ध्यै for achieving your purpose, यथासुखम् with pleasure, गच्छ proceed, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, महात्मना with the great self, राघवेण with Raghava, समानयस्व unite.
data.md: For compassing your end, go, O foremost of monkeys, O mild one, at yours ease. And bringing to Vaidehī tidings touching the highsouled Rāghava do you meet her.

data.v: तत्तृतीयं हनुमतो दृष्ट्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् । साधु साध्विति भूतानि प्रशशंसुस्तदा हरिम् ।।
data.es: Gods, siddhas as well as the great sages praised him for the second great achievment of Hanuman, which is impossible for others to accomplish.
data.anv: सुदुष्करम् very difficult, हनुमतः of Hanuman, तत् that, तृतीयं कर्म a third feat, दृष्ट्वा after witnessing, तदा then, भूतानि  living beings, साधु साधु इति welldone, welldone this, हरिम् vanara, प्रशशंसुः applauded.
data.md: Beholding this singularly arduous work of Hanumān the celestials, the Siddhas and the ascetics all praised him.

data.v: स सागरमनाधृष्यमभ्येत्य वरुणालयम् । जगामाकाशमाविश्य वेगेन गरुणोपमः ।।
data.es: Rising above the invincible ocean, the abode of lord Varuna, Hanuman coursed through the sky speedily like Garuda.
data.anv: वेगेन speedily, गरुडोपमः like Garuda, सः he, अनाधृष्यम् invincible, वरुणालयम् abode of varuna, सागरम् ocean, अभ्येत्य piercing through, आकाशम् sky, आविश्य coursing, जगाम went.

data.v: सेविते वारिधारिभिः पतगैश्च निषेविते । चरिते कैशिकाचार्यैरैरावतनिषेविते ।।
सिंहकुञ्जरशार्दूलपतगोरगवाहनैः । विमानैः संपतद्भिश्च विमलैः समलंकृते ।।
वज्राशनिसमाघातैः पावकैरुपशोभिते । कृतपुण्यैर्महाभागैः स्वर्गजिद्भिरलंकृते ।।
बहता हव्यमत्यन्तं सेविते चित्रभानुना । ग्रहनक्षत्रचन्द्रार्कतारागणविभूषिते ।।
महर्षिगणगन्धर्वनागयक्षसमाकुले । विविक्ते विमले विश्वे विश्वावसुनिषेविते ।।
देवराजगजाक्रान्ते चन्द्रसूर्यपथे शिवे । विताने जीवलोकस्य विततो ब्रह्मनिर्मिते ।।
बहुशः सेविते वीरैर्विद्याधरगणैर्वरैः । कपिना कृष्यमाणानि महाभ्राणि चकाशिरे ।।
data.es: While Hanuman was drawing big clouds which were either white or red or blue or yellow, he looked charming.
data.anv: कपिना by the vanara, आकृष्यमाणानि drawing, पाण्डुरारुणवर्णानि white and red colour, नीलमाञ्जिष्ठकानि च blue and yellow clouds, महाभ्राणि big clouds, चकाशिरे shining.

data.v: प्रविशन्नभ्रजालानि निष्पतंश्च पुनः पुनः । प्रावृषीन्दुरिवाभाति निष्पतन्प्रविशंस्तदा ।।
data.es: Entering into and emerging from the clouds, he looked like the Moon that appears and disappears (behind a bank of clouds).
data.anv: अभ्रजालानि into the mass of clouds, प्रविशन् entering, पुनः पुनः again and again, निष्पतंश्च disappearing, प्रच्छन्नश्च covered by, प्रकाशश्च shining again, चन्द्रमाः like the Moon, लक्ष्यते was appearing.
data.md: And now entering into the clouds, and now emerging from them, he looked like the moon, sometimes hid and sometimes visible.

data.v: प्लवमानं तु तं दृष्ट्वा सिंहिका नाम राक्षसी । मनसा चिन्तयामास प्रवृद्धा कामरूपिणी ।।
data.es: Seeing Hanuman speeding in the sky a demoness called Simhika who can assume any form at her will had grown out of proportion and thought on her part:
data.anv: कामरूपिणी who can take any form at will, सिंहिका नाम called Simhika, राक्षसी demoness, प्लवमानम् him who was speeding in the sky, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, प्रवृद्धा expanded in size, चिन्तयामास started thinking.
data.md: And it came to pass that beholding him in the act of bounding, a Rākşasi named Sinhikā, of great age, and capable of wearing forms at will, thought herself.

data.v: अद्य दीर्घस्य कालस्य भविष्याम्यहमाशिता । इदं हि मे महत्सत्त्वं चिरस्य वशमागतम् ।।
data.anv: चिरस्य after a long time, इदम् this, महत् great, सत्त्वम् being, मे my, वशम् fold, आगतम् has come, दीर्घस्य after a long, कालस्य time, अद्य today, अहम् I, आशिता satiated, भविष्यामि I will be.
data.md: Today after a long lapse of time I shall have my fare. This mighty creature has after a long time come within my power.

data.v: इति संचिन्त्य मनसा छायामस्य समक्षिपत् । छायायां संगृहीतायां चिन्तयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: Thinking thus, she dragged him by his shadow before she took hold of him, Hanuman started deliberating within.
data.anv: इति thus, मनसा in her mind, सञ्चिन्त्य after thinking, अस्य his, छायाम् shadow, समाक्षिपत् pulled, छायायाम् when his shadow, गृह्यमाणायाम् was held, वानरः vanara, चिन्तयामास deliberated.

data.v: समाक्षिप्तोऽस्मि सहसा पङ्गूकृतपराक्रमः । प्रतिलोमेन वातेन महानौरिव सागरे ।।
data.es: "I am caught suddenly. I am handicapped.I am like a huge ship in an ocean retarded by the wind blowing from the opposite direction.
data.anv: सागरे in the ocean, प्रतिलोमेन from the opposite side, वातेन by the wind, महानौरिव like a huge ship, पङ्गूकृतपराक्रमः  powerless, सहसा  suddenly, समाक्षिप्तः caught, अस्मि I am.

data.v: तिर्यगूर्ध्वमधश्चैव वीक्षमाणस्ततः कपिः । ददर्श स महासत्त्वमुत्थितं लवणाम्भसि ।।
data.es: Looking around, right and left, up and down, the monkey saw a huge being rise from the salty sea.
data.anv: ततः then, कपिः monkey, तिर्यक् horizontally, ऊर्द्वम् upward, अथश्चैव at the bottom level, वीक्षमाणः while looking at, लवणाम्भसि in the salt sea, उत्थितम् risen up, महत् huge, सत्त्वम् being, ददर्श saw.

data.v: कपिराज्ञा यदाख्यातं सत्त्वमद्भुतदर्शनम् । छायाग्राहि महावीर्यं तदिदं नात्र संशयः ।।
data.es: Seeing the form with a hideous countenance, Hanuman reflected about the creature of ugly appearance endowed with power which can catch a creature though his shadow, about which king Sugriva had once told him. 'It is the same creature, no doubt', said Hanuman.
data.anv: मारुतिः Maruti, विकृताननम् hideous countenance, तत् that creature, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, चिन्तयामास reflected, कपिराजेन by the king of monkeys, कथितम् described, अद्भुतदर्शनम् of wonderful appearance, छायाग्राहि  which can hold the shadow, महावीर्यम् very powerful, तत् that, सत्त्वम् creature, इदम् this, अत्र here it is, संशयः doubt, न no.
data.md: Seeing that one of a distorted countenance, the wind-god's son thought, This one is, without doubt, the creature of wonderful form, possessed of exceeding prowess, given to securing its prey by means of its shadow, which had been described by the monkey-king.

data.v: स तां बुद्ध्वार्थतत्त्वेन सिंहिकां मतिमान्कपिः । व्यवर्धत महाकायः प्रावृषीव बलाहकः ।।
data.es: Recognising the true nature of Simhika the clutcher of shadows, the wise Hanuman grew to a huge size like a cloud in rainy season.
data.anv: मतिमान् wise one, सः कपिः Hanuman, ताम् her, अर्थतत्त्वेन by her true nature, सिंहिकाम् Simhika, बुद्ध्वा recognising, महाकायः huge bodied one, प्रावृषि in rainy season, वलाहकः इव like a cloud, व्यवर्धत grew.
data.md: And concluding her to be Sinhikā from her act, the intelligent monkey attaining a gigantic body, increased himself, like a mass of clouds during the rains.

data.v: तस्य सा कायमुद्वीक्ष्य वर्धमानं महाकपेः । वक्त्रं प्रसारयामास पातालाम्बरसंनिभम् ।।
data.es: Observing the body of Hanuman growing in size, Simhika started distending her mouth wide like the depth of the underworld.
data.anv: सा she, तस्य महाकपेः Hanuman's, कायम् body, वर्धमानम् growing, उद्वीक्ष्य after observing, पातालान्तरसन्निभम् like the depth of the underworld, वक्त्रम् mouth, प्रसारयामास distended.
data.md: Seeing the enlarged body of the mighty monkey, she extended her mouth measuring the sky and the nether regions. And roaring like to a mass of clouds, she rushed against the monkey.

data.v: स ददर्श ततस्तस्या विकृतं सुमहन्मुखम् । कायमात्रं च मेधावी मर्माणि च महाकपिः ।।
data.es: Roaring like a heavy mass of clouds, Simhika chased Hanuman. Intelligent Hanuman observed her enormous mouth and noticed her vital parts.
data.anv: घनराजीव like a mass of heavy clouds, गर्जन्ती  roaring, वानरम् that vanara, समभिद्रवत् ran towards him, ततः then, मेधावी intelligent, महाकपिः Hanuman, तस्याः her, विवृतम् opened, कायमात्रम् body alone, सुमहत् enormous, मुखम् mouth, मर्माणि च vatal parts, सः he, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Thereat, that intelligent and mighty monkey marked her deformed and huge mouth, her body and its asticulated members.

data.v: स तस्या विवृते वक्त्रे वज्रसंहननः कपिः । संक्षिप्य मुहुरात्मानं निष्पपात महाबलः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the vanara whose physique was as hard as thunderbolt suddenly contracted once again and entered her opened mouth.
data.anv: महाबलः strong one, वज्रसंहननः of thunderboltlike physique, सः कपिः that vanara, आत्मानम् himself, मुहुः once again, संक्षिप्य contracted, तस्याः her, विवृते open, वक्त्रे in the mouth, निष्पपात entered.
data.md: And the redoubtable monkey hard as the thunderbolt, contracting himself in a moment, threw himself into her mouth.

data.v: आस्ये तस्या निमज्जन्तं ददृशुः सिद्धचारणाः । ग्रस्यमानं यथा चन्द्रं पूर्णं पर्वणि राहुणा ।।
data.es: The siddhas and charanas who were watching his performance of drowning in her mouth were amazed as though the moon is seized by Rahu on a fullmoon night.
data.anv: सिद्धचारणाः siddhas and charanas, तस्याः her, आस्ये in the mouth, निमज्जन्तम् drowning in, पर्वणि on fullmoon day, राहुणा by Rahu, ग्रस्यमानम् being seized, पूर्णम् full, चन्द्रं यथा like the Moon, ददृशुः saw.
data.md: And the Siddhas and Chāraņas saw him sink in her mouth, as the full Moon is taken by Rāhu during a Parva.

data.v: ततस्तस्य नखैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मर्माण्युत्कृत्य वानरः । उत्पपाताथ वेगेन मनःसंपातविक्रमः ।।
data.es: The vanara who had the speed of mind tore her vital parts with his sharp nails and rushed out quickly before she closed her mouth.
data.anv: ततः thay, वानरः vanara, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, नखैः with nails, तस्याः her, मर्माणि private vital parts, उत्कृत्य after tearing, अथ then, मनः सम्पातविक्रमः  with the speed of mind in action, वेगेन quickly, उत्पपात rushed out.
data.md: Then tearing her limits by means of his sharp claws, the monkey, endowed with the celerity of thought, vehemently sprang forward.

data.v: तां हतां वानरेणाशु पतितां वीक्ष्य सिंहिकाम् । भूतान्याकाशचारीणि तमूचुः प्लवगर्षभम् ।।
data.es: Heart torn asunder and killed by Hanuman, miserable Simhika instantly fell into the sea water. Observing it, the beings who ranged the sky said to the foremost of vanaras:
data.anv: सा that, हनुमता by Hanuman, हृतहृत्  heart torn, विधुरा  miserable, अम्भसि into water, पपात fell down, वानरेण by vanara, आशु instantly, हताम् killed, पतिताम् dropped, वीक्ष्य  seeing, आकाशाचारीणि  moving in the sky, भूतानि beings, तम् him, प्लवगोत्तमम् best of vanaras, ऊचुः addressed.
data.md: And seeing Sinhikā speedily slain by the monkey, and fallen, creatures ranging the sky addressed that foremost of monkeys, saying,

data.v: भीममद्य कृतं कर्म महत्सत्त्वं त्वया हतम् । साधयार्थमभिप्रेतमरिष्टं प्लवतां वर ।।
data.es: "O great jumper a great deed has been done by you today in killing that fierce creature. O great monkey fulfil your mission without any obstruction.
data.anv: प्लवतां वर O great jumper, अद्य  to day, त्वया by you, महत्  great, सत्त्वम् creature, हतम् is destroyed, भीमम् fierce, कर्म action, कृतम् done, अभिप्रेतम् intention, अर्थम् aim, अरिष्टम् unobstructed, साधय you fulfill
data.md: Terrible is the deed that you had performed to day. Mighty was the creature that has been slaughtered by you. Compass you yours wishedfor end without let, О foremost of monkeys.

data.v: यस्य त्वेतानि चत्वारि वानरेन्द्र यथा तव । धृतिर्दृष्टिर्मतिर्दाक्ष्यं स कर्मसु न सीदति ।।
data.es: "O lord of vanaras he in whom these four qualities, fortitude, vision, intelligence and dexterity exist as in you will achieve his mission and not get lost".
data.anv: वानरेन्द्र O lord of vanara, यस्य in whom, धृतिः fortitude, दृष्टिः vision, मतिः intelligence, दाक्ष्यम् dexterity, एतानि these, चत्वारि four, तव यथा as in you, स: he, कर्मसु in missions, न सीदति will not get lost.
data.md: He, O chief of monkeys, that, like you, is endowed with endurance, sharp sightedness, sense, and ability, dose not feel depressed in action.

data.v: स तैः संभावितः पूज्यः प्रतिपन्नप्रयोजनः । जगामाकाशमाविश्य पन्नगाशनवत्कपिः ।।
data.es: Honoured by them the venerable monkey went ascending into the sky like Garuda to achieve the objective.
data.anv: पूज्यः a venerable one, सः कपिः that monkey, तैः by them, सम्भावितः honoured, प्रतिपन्नप्रयोजनः achieved the objective, आकाशम् sky, आविश्य having ascended,      पन्नगाशानवत् like Garuda, जगाम went.
data.md: Honoured by these and wished well as to his purpose, that monkey, worthy of being honoured, set out, enveloping the sky, like him that subsist on serpents.* *Garuda.

data.v: प्राप्तभूयिष्ठ पारस्तु सर्वतः प्रतिलोकयन् । योजनानां शतस्यान्ते वनराजिं ददर्श सः ।।
data.es: On reaching the other side of the shore crossing a hundred yojanas, he saw rows of forest trees.
data.anv: प्राप्तभूयिष्ठपारः on reaching the other side of the shore, सर्वतः all over, प्रतिलोकयन्  looked around, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतस्य of a hundred, अन्ते at the end of, वनराजिम् rows of forest trees, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And it came to pass that as he had almost arrived at the other shore (of the ocean), he looking about on all sides at the end of an hundred yojanas saw a range of woods.

data.v: ददर्श च पतन्नेव विविधद्रुमभूषितम् । द्वीपं शाखामृगश्रेष्ठो मलयोपवनानि च ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the best among jumpers, even while in air he saw an island adorned with many trees, also gardens adjacent to Malaya mountain.
data.anv: शाखामृगश्रेष्ठः best among the animals that jump on branches, monkeys, पतन्नेन onwhile yet on air, विविधद्रुमभूषितम् adorned with several kinds of beautiful trees, द्वीपम् island, मलयोपवनानि gardens bordering Malaya mountain, ददर्श च also saw.
data.md: As he went on, that best of monkeys saw an island decked with diverse trees, and groves pertaining Malaya.

data.v: सागरं सागरानूपान्सागरानूपजान्द्रुमान् । सागरस्य च पत्नीनां मुखान्यपि विलोकयन् ।।
data.md: He surveyed the sea, and lands bordering thereon, and trees growing on the sea shore, and the countenance of the spouses of the Sea.

data.v: स महामेघसंकाशं समीक्ष्यात्मानमात्मना । निरुन्धन्तमिवाकाशं चकार मतिमान्मतिम् ।।
data.md: Surveying his own person resembling a mighty mass of clouds, and as if closing up the sky, that self-possessed one ascertained his course of action.

data.v: कायवृद्धिं प्रवेगं च मम दृष्ट्वैव राक्षसाः । मयि कौतूहलं कुर्युरिति मेने महाकपिः ।।
data.md: Soon as the Rākṣasas shall behold my enlarged body and the vehemence of my motion, they shall be seized with curiosity concerning me.

data.v: ततः शरीरं संक्षिप्य तन्महीधरसंनिभम् । पुनः प्रकृतिमापेदे वीतमोह इवात्मवान् ।।
data.md: Thus thought that magnanimous one. Thereat diminishing that person of his resembling a mountain, that self-possessed one, purged on ignorance, resumed his natural shape.

data.v: स चारुनानाविधरूपधारी; परं समासाद्य समुद्रतीरम् । परैरशक्यप्रतिपन्नरूपः; समीक्षितात्मा समवेक्षितार्थः ।।
data.md: Thus wearing various graceful forms, that one, acting after reflection, having come to the other shore of the ocean incapable of being reached by others, on looking over his (immensely magnified person), reduced his body (to its former size).

data.v: ततः स लम्बस्य गिरेः समृद्धे; विचित्रकूटे निपपात कूटे । सकेतकोद्दालकनालिकेरे; महाद्रिकूटप्रतिमो महात्मा ।।
data.md: That high-souled one resembling a cloudy pavilion, alighted on the (foremost) summit of the splendid mountain, Samva; crested with picturesque peaks; and abounding in ketakas, uddalakas and cocoanuts.

data.v: स सागरं दानवपन्नगायुतं; बलेन विक्रम्य महोर्मिमालिनम् । निपत्य तीरे च महोदधेस्तदा; ददर्श लङ्काममरावतीमिव ।।
data.md: Having by main force bounded over the ocean heaving with surges, and rife with Dānavas and Pannagas, he alighting on the shore of the mighty main, beheld Lankā like to Amarāvati.

data.v: स सागरमनाधृष्यमतिक्रम्य महाबलः । त्रिकूटशिखरे लङ्कां स्थितां स्वस्थो ददर्श ह ।।
data.es: The mighty Hanuman crossed the inviolable sea, stood comfortably on the peak of Trikuta mountain and looked at Lanka.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, सः Hanuman, अनाधृष्यम् inviolable, सागरम् sea, अतिक्रम्य having crossed, स्वस्थः comfortable, त्रिकूटशिखरे on Trikuta mountain peak, स्थिताम् standing, लङ्काम् Lanka, ददर्श ह saw.
data.md: Having crossed over the ocean incapable of being repressed, that one endowed with great strength, staying at the plateau of Chitrakūta, and having refreshed himself, cast his eyes on Laukā.

data.v: ततः पादपमुक्तेन पुष्पवर्षेण वीर्यवान् । अभिवृष्टः स्थितस्तत्र बभौ पुष्पमयो यथा ।।
data.es: With heaps of flowers full of fragrance fallen down from the trees all over the mountain, it looked as though it was a mountain of flowers.
data.anv: शैलः the mountain, पादपमुक्तेन by those dropped down from the trees, सुगन्धिना full of fragrance, पुष्पौघेण heap of flowers, सर्वतः all over, संवृतः covered, यथा like, बभौ appeared, पुष्पमय: made of flowers.
data.md: And covered with showers of blossoms poured down by the trees, that monkey possessed of prowess then appeared there like Puspamaya.* *A monkey so named.

data.v: योजनानां शतं श्रीमांस्तीर्त्वाप्युत्तमविक्रमः । अनिश्वसन्कपिस्तत्र न ग्लानिमधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: The glorious, powerful vanara (Hanuman) even after crossing a hundred yojanas, felt neither suffocated nor exasperated.
data.anv: उत्तमविक्रमः endowed with great prowess, श्रीमान् glorious one, कपिः monkey, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतम् a hundred, तीर्त्वापि even after crossing also, अनिःश्वसन् without gasping, तत्र there, ग्लानिम् exhaustion, न अधिगच्छति did not experience.
data.md: Having cleared an hundred Yoyanas, that monkey gifted with first-rate prowess, did not heave sighs or feel any fatigue.

data.v: शतान्यहं योजनानां क्रमेयं सुबहून्यपि । किं पुनः सागरस्यान्तं संख्यातं शतयोजनम् ।।
data.es: (He said to himself), "I can cross a distance of even hundreds of yojanas. What to say of a hundred yojanas which is a calculated distance."
data.anv: अहम् I, योजनानाम् of yojanas, सुबहूनि very many, शतान्यपि even hundreds of them, क्रमेयम् I can cross, शतयोजनम् a hundred yojanas, संख्यातम् a measured, सागरस्य ocean's, अन्तम् end, किं पुनः what more.
data.md: I am competent to bound over many hundreds of Yojanas. What then is this end of the ocean measuring an hundred Yojanas only?

data.v: स तु वीर्यवतां श्रेष्ठः प्लवतामपि चोत्तमः । जगाम वेगवाँल्लङ्कां लङ्घयित्वा महोदधिम् ।।
data.es: Courageous and exalted Hanuman, the best among vanaras, noted for his speed reached Lanka crossing over the great ocean on his own.
data.anv: वीर्यवताम् courageous, श्रेष्ठः exalted, प्लवतामपि among vanaras, उत्तमः best, सः तु he on his part, वेगवान् noted for speed, महोदधिम् ocean, लङ्घयित्वा after crossing over, लङ्काम् Lanka, जगाम reached.
data.md: That foremost of those endowed with energy and the prime of monkeys, gifted with speed, went to Laikā,* having crossed over the mighty main. *Descending, remarks the commentator, from the mountain-summit.

data.v: शाद्वलानि च नीलानि गन्धवन्ति वनानि च । गण्डवन्ति च मध्येन जगाम नगवन्ति च ।।
data.es: Hanuman passed through forests laden with fragrant flowers, bluish grassy land, big rocks and mountains covered with trees.
data.anv: नीलानि darkcoloured, शाद्वलानि having grassland, गन्धवन्ति fragrant, गण्डवन्ति with big rocks, मध्येन on the way, नगवन्ति च mountains also, वनानि च even trees, जगाम went .
data.md: Seeing blue lawns, and perfumed woods, replete with honey and filled with mountains, he held his way by the central thoroughfare.

data.v: शैलांश्च तरुसंछन्नान्वनराजीश्च पुष्पिताः । अभिचक्राम तेजस्वी हनुमान्प्लवगर्षभः ।।
data.es: Brilliant Hanuman, a bull among monkeys, crossed the mountains covered with blossoming trees and forest ranges.
data.anv: प्लवगर्षभः bull among vanaras, तेजस्वी brilliant one, हनुमान् Hanuman, तरुसंछन्नान् dense with trees, शैलांश्च and mountains, पुष्पिताः blossomed, वनराजीश्च forest ranges, अभिचक्राम crossed.
data.md: That foremost of monkeys, the energetic Hanumān, went by hills filled with trees, and ranges of blossoming woods.

data.v: स तस्मिन्नचले तिष्ठन्वनान्युपवनानि च । स नगाग्रे च तां लङ्कां ददर्श पवनात्मजः ।।
data.es: That son of the Windgod stood on the mountain and saw the forests and groves round Lanka situated on the mountain peak.
data.anv: सः पवनात्मजः that son of the Windgod, तस्मिन् on that, अचले on the mountain, तिष्ठन् while standing, वनानि forests, उपवनानि च and groves, नगाग्रे on the mountain peaks, ताम् that, लङ्काम् Lanka, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And stationing himself in that mountain, the offspring of the Wind-god beheld woods and groves and Lankā established at the brow of the mountain.

data.v: सरलान्कर्णिकारांश्च खर्जूरांश्च सुपुष्पितान् । प्रियालान्मुचुलिन्दांश्च कुटजान्केतकानपि ।।
प्रियङ्गून्गन्धपूर्णांश्च नीपान्सप्तच्छदांस्तथा । असनान्कोविदारांश्च करवीरांश्च पुष्पितान् ।।
पुष्पभारनिबद्धांश्च तथा मुकुलितानपि । पादपान्विहगाकीर्णान्पवनाधूतमस्तकान् ।।
हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा वापीः पद्मोत्पलायुताः । आक्रीडान्विविधान्रम्यान्विविधांश्च जलाशयान् ।।
संततान्विविधैर्वृक्षैः सर्वर्तुफलपुष्पितैः । उद्यानानि च रम्याणि ददर्श कपिकुञ्जरः ।।
समासाद्य च लक्ष्मीवाँल्लङ्कां रावणपालिताम् । परिखाभिः सपद्माभिः सोत्पलाभिरलंकृताम् ।।
सीतापहरणार्थेन रावणेन सुरक्षिताम् । समन्ताद्विचरद्भिश्च राक्षसैरुग्रधन्विभिः ।।
काञ्चनेनावृतां रम्यां प्राकारेण महापुरीम् । अट्टालकशताकीर्णां पताकाध्वजमालिनीम् ।।
तोरणैः काञ्चनैर्दिव्यैर्लतापङ्क्तिविचित्रितैः । ददर्श हनुमाँल्लङ्कां दिवि देवपुरीमिव ।।
गिरिमूर्ध्नि स्थितां लङ्कां पाण्डुरैर्भवनैः शुभैः । ददर्श स कपिः श्रीमान्पुरमाकाशगं यथा ।।
data.es: The foremost among the vanaras, perched on top of the mountain saw the city of Lanka on the mountain with auspicious mansions as though touching the sky.
data.anv: सः that, कपिश्रेष्ठः foremost of the vanaras, पाण्डुरैः with white , शुभैः with auspicious, भवनैः with mansions, गिरिमूर्ध्नि  on the mountain, स्थिताम् stood, आकाशगम् यथा as if touching the sky, पुरं a city, लङ्काम् Lanka, ददर्श saw.

data.v: पालितां राक्षसेन्द्रेण निर्मितां विश्वकर्मणा । प्लवमानामिवाकाशे ददर्श हनुमान्पुरीम् ।।
data.es: The city of Lanka, ruled by the lord of demons and built by Visvakarma looked as if it was a city floating in the sky.
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the lord of demons, पालिताम् ruled, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मिताम् constructed, आकाशे in the sky, प्लवमानामिव as if moving  पुरीम् city, ददर्श saw.

data.v: संपूर्णां राक्षसैर्घोरैर्नागैर्भोगवतीमिव । अचिन्त्यां सुकृतां स्पष्टां कुबेराध्युषितां पुरा ।।
दंष्ट्रिभिर्बहुभिः शूरैः शूलपट्टिशपाणिभिः । रक्षितां राक्षसैर्घोरैर्गुहामाशीविषैरपि ।।
वप्रप्राकारजघनां विपुलाम्बुनवाम्बराम् । शतघ्नीशूलकेशान्तामट्टालकवतंसकाम् ।।
data.es: Having reached the northern entrance of the city he started thinking that Visvakarma must have conceived Lanka as a lady with its ramparts as her hips and loins, moats filled with water as her robes, the spiked iron tridents as her locks of hair, and the tall towers as her her ear rings
data.anv: वानरः vanara, वप्रप्राकारजघनाम् ramparts of the fortress for hips and loins, विपुलाम्बुनवाम्बराम् moats full of water for robes, शतघ्नीशूलकेशान्ताम् spiked iron tridents for locks of hair, अट्टालकवतंसकाम् tall towers for earrings, मनसा  in the mind, एव only, कृतां conceived, निर्मिताम् built, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, लङ्काम् Lanka, उत्तरं द्वारम् northern entrance, आसाद्य having reached, चिन्तयामास started thinking.

data.v: द्वारमुत्तरमासाद्य चिन्तयामास वानरः । कैलासशिखरप्रख्यमालिखन्तमिवाम्बरम् । ध्रियमाणमिवाकाशमुच्छ्रितैर्भवनोत्तमैः ।।
तस्याश्च महतीं गुप्तिं सागरं च निरीक्ष्य सः । रावणं च रिपुं घोरं चिन्तयामास वानरः ।।
आगत्यापीह हरयो भविष्यन्ति निरर्थकाः । न हि युद्धेन वै लङ्का शक्या जेतुं सुरैरपि ।।
data.es: 'It is not possible for monkeys to come here and even if they do, it is no use. Lanka is invincible even to the gods in war.
data.anv: हरयः monkeys, इह here, आगत्यापि even after coming here, निरर्थकाः will not serve any purpose, भविष्यन्ति will be, लङ्का Lanka, युद्धेन by war, सुरैरपि even by gods, जेतुम् to win, न शक्या हि not possible.

data.v: इमां तु विषमां दुर्गां लङ्कां रावणपालिताम् । प्राप्यापि स महाबाहुः किं करिष्यति राघवः ।।
data.es: 'What will Rama the mighty armed hero do even after reaching this formidable city of Lanka ruled by Ravana?
data.anv: विषमाम् most difficult, दुर्गाम् formidable, रावणपालिताम् ruled by Ravana, इमाम् this, लङ्काम् Lanka, प्राप्यापि even if he comes, महाबाहुः greatarmed, सः राघवः that Rama, किं करिष्यति what can he do?
data.md: Even if the mighty-armed Rāghava should reach this terrible-looking and impregnable Lankā reared by Rāvana, what could he do?

data.v: अवकाशो न सान्त्वस्य राक्षसेष्वभिगम्यते । न दानस्य न भेदस्य नैव युद्धस्य दृश्यते ।।
data.es: 'There is no scope for reconciliation with the demons. It is not possible to win over them with gifts. They cannot be divided by dissension. There is no scope for war.
data.anv: राक्षसेषु with demons, सान्त्वस्य for reconciliation, अवकाशः scope, न अभिगम्यते not expected, दानस्य by making offers, न not, भेदस्य  by dissension, न not, युद्धस्य of war, नैव दृश्यते not feasible.
data.md: Opportunity find I none either for conciliation with the Raksasas, or for (winning them over) by gifts, or for sowing dissensions among them, or for conquering them in fight.

data.v: चतुर्णामेव हि गतिर्वानराणां महात्मनाम् । वालिपुत्रस्य नीलस्य मम राज्ञश्च धीमतः ।।
data.es: 'Only four great monkeys can have access to this place. They are Angada the son of Vali, Nila, Sugriva, the wise king of monkeys and myself.
data.anv: वालिपुत्रस्य Vali's son's, नीलस्य of Nila, मम mine, धीमतः of the wise one, राज्ञश्च king's, महात्मनाम् of the great souls, चतुर्णाम् of these four, वानराणाम् these four among vanaras only, गतिः हि can come here.
data.md: Of all the monkeys, four only endowed with (exceptional) celerity, viz., Vāli's son, Nīla, the intelligent king, and myself, heave the power to come over here.

data.v: यावज्जानामि वैदेहीं यदि जीवति वा न वा । तत्रैव चिन्तयिष्यामि दृष्ट्वा तां जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: 'Whether Janaka's daughter, Vaidehi is alive or not is not known. After seeing her I shall think over'.
data.anv: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, यदि जीवति वा if she is alive or, न वा not alive, यावत् जानामि until I know, ताम् her, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तत्रैव there on the spot, चिन्तयिष्यामि I shall think over.
data.md: When I have ascertained whether Vaidehī is alive or not, I shall, after interviewing Janaka's daughter, think about this.

data.v: ततः स चिन्तयामास मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः । गिरिशृङ्गे स्थितस्तस्मिन्रामस्याभ्युदये रतः ।।
data.es: Standing on the mountain, the elephant among monkeys pondered for a while on the means of finding Sita, in which lay the welfare of Rama.
data.anv: ततः then, रामस्य Rama's, अभ्युदये in his welfare, रतः lay, सः that, कपिकुञ्जरः elephant among vanaras, तस्मिन् on that, गिरिशृङ्गे on the mountain peak, स्थितः stood, मुहूर्तम् for a short while, चिन्तयामास  pondered.
data.md: Then that elephantine monkey, stationed on the summit of that mountain, for a while bethought himself as the success of Rāma.* *About rescuing his wife.

data.v: अनेन रूपेण मया न शक्या रक्षसां पुरी । प्रवेष्टुं राक्षसैर्गुप्ता क्रूरैर्बलसमन्वितैः ।।
data.es: 'I shall not be able in my present form to enter the city guarded by fierce and powerful demons.
data.anv: क्रूरैः by the fierce, बलसमन्वितैः by the powerful ones, राक्षसैः by demons, गुप्ता guarded, रक्षसाम् of demons, पुरी city, मया by me, अनेन by this present, रूपेण form, प्रवेष्टुम् to enter, न शक्या not possible.
data.md: I cannot in this form succeed in entering the city of the Rākşasas, guarded by wily and powerful Rākṣasas.

data.v: उग्रौजसो महावीर्यो बलवन्तश्च राक्षसाः । वञ्चनीया मया सर्वे जानकीं परिमार्गिता ।।
data.anv: जानकीम् Sita, परिमार्गता while searching, मया by me, उग्रौजसः energetic, महावीर्याः very valiant, बलवन्तश्च powerful, राक्षसाः demons, सर्वे all, वञ्चनीयाः should be deceived.
data.md: I should, while engaged in searching for Jānaki, deceive all the strong and highly energetic Rākşasas gifted with prowess.

data.v: लक्ष्यालक्ष्येण रूपेण रात्रौ लङ्का पुरी मया । प्रवेष्टुं प्राप्तकालं मे कृत्यं साधयितुं महत् ।।
data.es: 'To accomplish this great task I will have to assume an inconspicious form and enter the city of Lanka in the night as that is the appropriate time.
data.anv: मे for me, महत् great, कृत्यम् task, साधयितुम् to accomplish, मया by me, लक्ष्यालक्ष्येण in a non conspicious, रूपेण form, रात्रौ during night, लङ्कापुरी city of Lanka, प्रवेष्टुम् to enter, प्राप्तकालम् is the appropriate time.
data.md: For attaining this mighty object, it behove me to enter Lankā at night in a shape invisible yet well suited to the end in view.

data.v: तां पुरीं तादृशीं दृष्ट्वा दुराधर्षां सुरासुरैः । हनूमांश्चिन्तयामास विनिःश्वस्य मुहुर्मुहुः ।।
data.es: 'Looking at the city, unassailable even to gods and demons, Hanuman sighed again and again thinking:
data.anv: अहम् I, विक्रान्तः heroic, सीतायाः Sita, तादृशीम् seeing her deplorable state, ताम् her, दारुणाम् dreadful, दशाम् state, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, चिन्तयामास started worrying, मे myself, मनः in mind, न निर्वृतम् not had peace.
data.md: Beholding the city in that state, difficult of being subdued by the celestials and Asuras (combined), Hanumān, sighing moment arily, thought within himself,

data.v: केनोपायेन पश्येयं मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम् । अदृष्टो राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन दुरात्मना ।।
data.es: 'By what means can I find Mythili, daughter of Janaka, without being noticed by the evilminded Ravana, the lord of demons?
data.anv: दुरात्मना evilminded, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by lord of demons, रावणेन by Ravana, अदृष्टः without being seen, केन for that, उपायेन means, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, मैथिलीम् Mythili, पश्येयम् will be possible to find.
data.md: How can I, without being discovered by the impious lord of Rākşasas, Rāvana, succeed in seeing Janaka's daughter, Maithili?

data.v: न विनश्येत्कथं कार्यं रामस्य विदितात्मनः । एकामेकश्च पश्येयं रहिते जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: 'How can the purpose of Rama, a noble soul be not spoilt? I may have a private audience with the daughter of Janaka.
data.anv: विदितात्मनः one who is endowed with selfknowledge, रामस्य Rama's, कार्यम् task, कथम् how, न विनश्येत् will not be spoilt, एकश्च single person, रहिते in a private audience, एकाम् her, जनकात्मजाम् Sita, पश्येयम् possible to see.
data.md: How can the work of Rāma cognizant of self (be so managed that it) may not be brought to naught? How can I see Janaka's daughter singly in secret?

data.v: भूताश्चार्थो विपद्यन्ते देशकालविरोधिताः । विक्लवं दूतमासाद्य तमः सूर्योदये यथा ।।
data.es: 'Just as darkness disappears at Sunrise, wellplanned strategies also fail at the hands of a thoughtless messenger when they are set in opposition to proper time and place.
data.anv: विक्लबम् one who has no sense, दूतम् messenger, आसाद्य is after getting, देशकालविरोधिताः set in opposition to proper time and place, भूताः it plan, अर्था: the planned strategies, सूर्योदये at the time of Sunrise, तमः यथा like darkness, विपद्यन्ते will be destroyed.
data.md: Action on the very eve of success, on being obstructed by adverse season and place, and through the agency of unreflecting envoys come to nought, even as darkness is dispelled on sunrise.

data.v: अर्थानर्थान्तरे बुद्धिर्निश्चितापि न शोभते । घातयन्ति हि कार्याणि दूताः पण्डितमानिनः ।।
data.es: 'Even though messengers are not intelligent, they think themselves clever and capable. They act foolishly, swerve from proper course of action and fail in their effort.
data.anv: निश्चिता अपि even though decided, बुद्धि: intelligent, अर्थानर्थान्तरे  between a proper course of action and inaction, न शोभते not look nice, पण्डितमानिनः clever and capable, दूताः messengers, कार्याणि efforts, घातयन्ति हि will spoil.
data.md: In respect of what should he undertaken and what not, even the certain decision (of a master assisted by his counsellors), because of a heedless messenger, dose not appear in all its beauty: messengers (foolish) yet proud of their knowledge, bring every business to nought.

data.v: न विनश्येत्कथं कार्यं वैक्लव्यं न कथं भवेत् । लङ्घनं च समुद्रस्य कथं नु न वृथा भवेत् ।।
data.es: 'How should the task be performed? How to avoid impetuousness? How can my purpose of crossing the ocean be not wasted?
data.anv: कार्यम्  effort, कथम् how, विनश्येत्  not be destroyed, वैक्लब्यम् thoughtlessness, कथम् how, न भवेत् will not be, समुद्रस्य ocean's, लङ्घनं च croosing, कथं नु how indeed, वृथा waste, न भवेत् not become?
data.md: How can I so manage that my business may not suffer? How can I avoid recklessness? How can my bounding over the deep bear fruit?

data.v: मयि दृष्टे तु रक्षोभी रामस्य विदितात्मनः । भवेद्व्यर्थमिदं कार्यं रावणानर्थमिच्छतः ।।
data.es: 'If I am seen by the demons, the plan of Rama, possessor of selfknowledge, to kill Ravana, will be wasted.
data.anv: मयि I am, रक्षोभिः by the demons, दृष्टे तु seen, रावणानर्थम् destruction of  Ravana, इच्छतः desiring, विदितात्मनः divine knowledge, रामस्य Rama's, इदम् this, कार्यम् plan, व्यर्थम् wasted, भवेत् will be.
data.md: On my being seen by the Rākşasas, the work of Rāma cognizant of self, desirous of the destruction of Ravana, shall be marred.

data.v: न हि शक्यं क्वचित्स्थातुमविज्ञातेन राक्षसैः । अपि राक्षसरूपेण किमुतान्येन केनचित् ।।
data.es: 'It is difficult to stay with the demon anywhere here even in the disguise of a demon without being identified. It will not be possible to remain unidentified even by assuming any other form.
data.anv: राक्षसैः by demons, अविज्ञातेन without being identified, राक्षसरूपेणापि even by assuming the form of a demon, क्वचित् anywhere, स्थातुम् to stay with them, न शक्यं हि  not be possible, अन्येन in other form, केनचित् by any form, किमुत what to say.
data.md: Even if I wear a Rākşasa form, I cannot anywhere remain undiscovered by the Rākṣasas.

data.v: वायुरप्यत्र नाज्ञातश्चरेदिति मतिर्मम । न ह्यस्त्यविदितं किंचिद्राक्षसानां बलीयसाम् ।।
data.es: 'I think even the wind who has no form cannot move here without being detected. Nothing escapes the notice of powerful demons. There is nothing unknown to them.
data.anv: अत्र here, वायुरपि even wind, अज्ञातः without being detected, न चरेत् may not move, इति thus, मम my, मतिः thought, बलीयसाम् the powerful, राक्षसानाम् of demons, अविदितं unknown, किञ्चित् even a little indeed, नास्ति हि not.
data.md: What shall I say of any other form? Even the wind, I conceive dose not stray here, unperceived. Nothing whatever is here that is unknown to the Räkşasas of redoubtable deeds.
